description: A 1965 news report on the Epsom Derby, one of Britains best-known horse races. (britishpathe.com).

title: Nevada, in Blow to Jeb Bush, Opts to Stick With Caucuses
description: The Nevada Legislature adjourned Monday without voting on a measure to change the states presidential nominating process from caucuses to a primary, a blow to Jeb Bush, who was hoping for the switch.

title: Assads Forces May Be Aiding New ISIS Surge
description: ISTANBUL  Building on recent gains in Iraq and Syria, Islamic State militants are marching across northern Syria toward Aleppo, Syrias largest city, helped along, their opponents say, by the forces of President Bashar al-Assad.

title: Altuzarra Resort 2016
description: Looks from the collection.

title: A.C.L.U. Asks Judge to Force Improvements at Baltimore Jail
description: Despite longstanding assurances that conditions would be improved in the Baltimore jail, the State of Maryland still keeps inmates in fetid buildings where heat and unsanitary conditions spread disease, and delays in care for mental and physical ailments have led to unnecessary suffering, according to a court filing on Tuesday by the American Civil Liberties Union.

title: What Caitlyn Jenner Can Teach Our Daughters
description: Magazine covers can often start conversations with children what with their lurid headlines and provocative imagery. I frequently find them hard to explain: There is no really comprehensible answer, for an 8-year-old, to the question of why the girl on the cover of Sports Illustrated is taking off her swimsuit bottom. (And theres really no comprehensible answer for me about why our general store stacked those up next to the brownie mix).

title: Jean Ritchie, Lyrical Voice of Appalachia, Dies at 92
description: Jean Ritchie, who brought hundreds of traditional songs from her native Appalachia to a wide audience  singing of faith and unfaithfulness, murder and revenge, love unrequited and love lost  and in the process helped ignite the folk song revival of the mid-20th century, died on Monday at her home in Berea, Ky. She was 92.

title: 3 Teenagers Are Arrested in Rape in Chinatown
description: At 5:10 a.m. Monday, a woman, beaten and bleeding, stumbled into a corner deli in Chinatown. Minutes earlier, the police said, three 16-year-olds the woman had just met at an Internet cafe a block and a half away attacked her, and two raped and robbed her.

title: Speeding Up Hardware Through an Accelerator and Marketplace
description: The cool things now in hacker space are physical products, like personalized drone racing, centrifugal force-brewed coffee, and hyper-efficient air purifiers that use ultraviolet light.

title: Instagram to Open Its Photo Feed to Ads
description: Instagram is cranking up its money machine, and that means a lot more ads in your photo feed.

title: Morels and Peas Are Pastas Springtime Companions
description: When it comes to so-called luxury ingredients, wild mushrooms are among the most accessible, for a couple of reasons. One, if you have the energy and a guide and the right location, you can forage for them. O.K., very few of us are going to do that. Alternatively, you buy them, and in those places where the foraging is local the price isnt at all outrageous, especially because a little can go a long way.

title: Disney Unveils Playmation, Toys That Play Back
description: GLENDALE, Calif.  For more than two years, inside a Walt Disney laboratory built to resemble a childs bedroom, grade schoolers have been secretly testing an at-home version of Iron Mans high-tech armor.

title: Tsonga Scratches Out a Win, and a Roland Garros Love Note
description: PARIS  In a match dented by collapses of all sorts, Jo-Wilfried Tsonga managed to fall to the ground in joy in the end.

title: Lawmakers Press Takata on Propellant in Airbags
description: WASHINGTON  Even as Takata, the Japanese auto supplier, has acknowledged that its airbags are prone to rupture and has vastly expanded their recall, it has maintained that the underlying explosive that powers the airbags can be used safely.

title: Debate Over Government Surveillance
description: A sampling of the recent arguments in Washington over restarting the governments spying program.

title: Hamas Forces Kill Leader of Islamic Splinter Group in Gaza
description: GAZA  The local leader of an extremist Islamic splinter group was fatally shot Tuesday in a clash with Hamas forces who had come to arrest him. The death raised tensions in Gaza at a time when Hamas, which controls the territory, has been cracking down on radical jihadists.

title: Scott Walker Vows to Compete in Florida
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin wants to make sure everyone knows he loves Florida.

title: Diane von Furstenberg Resort 2016
description: Looks from the collection.

title: Automakers Report May Sales Beat Forecasts
description: DETROIT  Automakers on Tuesday reported that sales of new vehicles in May exceeded forecasts and reached the highest seasonally adjusted rate in nearly a decade.

title: An Easy Broth That Stands In for Fish Stock
description: Its amazing what you can do with a couple of anchovies. I wanted to make a one-pot meal with fresh Alaskan halibut that did not require the extra time and ingredients for a fish stock. But I did want broth that tasted of the sea, so I did what many cooks in Southern France and Italy do, and pounded anchovies in a mortar and pestle with garlic. I also pounded almonds for body and texture.

title: City Point Project in Brooklyn Gets Unlikely Partner in Extell
description: City Point, a major development in Downtown Brooklyn, is offering touches that seem to cater to Brooklyns homespun, forward-thinking spirit: a movie theater that serves beer. A reinvented shopping mall. A food hall for start-up restaurateurs.

title: Understanding the Rate Increases for Health Care Plans
description: Insurance companies have begun announcing rate increases for the health care plans they will sell next year on the Obamacare marketplaces, and a handy new website from the federal government makes searching for rate change requests easier than ever.

title: Investigating Why the Oriental Star Capsized on the Yangtze River
description: At about 9:20 p.m. that evening, the Oriental Star had passed a cargo ship that had anchored to wait out the storm.

title: Verbatim: Two Retired Democrats Are Winners With Republicans
description: Former Representative John Dingell, remarking on the spectacle of two Democrats (himself and former Senator Carl Levin, both from Michigan) receiving the Gerald R. Ford Medal for Distinguished Public Service at a dinner Monday at the National Republican Club of Capitol Hill.

title: Breaking Up Companies Creates Extensive Costs, Too
description: Acquisitive corporate chieftains love to talk about synergies from the deals theyre planning while they de-emphasize costs. On the flip side, managers who are trying to resist pressure to split their companies may overstate the dis-synergies such moves would create, but such costs are still real.

title: Do Millennials Need Fun Banking?
description: We believe that banking should make your life better, reads the frequently-asked-questions page on the website of the startup Qapital.

title: Knickerbockers St. Cloud Comes With a Serving of History
description: Headliner

title: New Trial Ordered for Man Convicted in 1988 Brooklyn Double Homicide
description: In a decision released on Tuesday, a judge ordered a new trial for Shabaka Shakur, a man serving two consecutive terms of 20 years to life for a 1988 double homicide in Brooklyn.

title: Anti-ISIS Coalition Makes Little Progress at Paris Meeting
description: PARIS  With Islamist militant fighters on the ground in Syria and Iraq moving faster than the international coalition arrayed against them, a meeting in Paris by coalition members on Tuesday seemed unlikely to reverse the momentum anytime soon.

title: Pinterest Brings E-Commerce to Social Scrapbooking With Buy It Button
description: Pinterest, the online social scrapbooking service, has long claimed to help people discover new things in the real world. Soon users will be able to buy those things, too.

title: toughest loss
description: the most miserable sports cities

title: Where FIFA Stands After Blatters Resignation
description: Questions and answers about the resignation of FIFA president Sepp Blatter, and the indictments of 14 soccer officials and marketing executives on corruption charges.

title: Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen Accepted Their CFDA Award in Style
description: The Stars: Ashley and Mary-Kate Olsen

title: Bruised, Herbalife Swings Back at an Accuser
description: This Wall Street brawl began with a billion-dollar bet.

title: Boko Haram Steps Up Attacks in Northeast Nigeria, Killing Scores
description: DAKAR, Senegal  Less than a week after Muhammadu Buhari, a former army general, took over as Nigerias president and vowed to crush Boko Haram, the group has intensified its attacks in the countrys northeast, killing scores in a series of assaults and suicide bombings.

title: A Celebration After the CFDA Awards
description: Gigi Hadid, Alexander Wang, Kelly Osbourne, Jhene Aiko and others attend the CFDA after-party at the Top of the Standard.

title: Rand Paul Begins to Make Believers Out of His Fathers Supporters
description: WASHINGTON  There is usually no quicker way to make Rand Pauls face pucker than to ask him how he is different from his father. That is because for the better part of four years, the Kentucky Republican has tried to create a political identity distinct from the man whose legacy provided the foundation for his success.

title: High Line Founder to Lead World Monuments Fund
description: Its hard to imagine Joshua David moving on from Friends of the High Line, which he founded in 1999 with Robert Hammond. But now he is starting a new chapter as president of the World Monuments Fund, making him the third leader in that organizations 50-year history.

title: Why Americans Hate Cable Companies
description: Not that there should have ever been any doubt, but consumers like competition.

title: Dueling Claims From Herbalife and Hedge Fund
description: William A. Ackman made a billion-dollar bet that Herbalife was a pyramid scheme. Now both sides are spending millions of dollars shaping the public narrative and federal investigations.

title: Philip Glass to Perform Inside a Richard Serra Installation
description: The composer Philip Glass once worked as an assistant for the sculptor Richard Serra, after the two befriended each other in Paris in the early 1960s and swapped cultural touchstones. Phil took me to see Buster Keaton films, Mr. Serra told The New Yorker, and I took him to Brancusis studio.

title: Monks, Wine and Caffeine: Reporters Notebook
description: In Europe, monks and alcohol share a long history; after all, one of the pioneers of winemaking techniques used in champagne was Dom Prignon, a Benedictine monk.

title: White House Meeting Elicits Pledges to Reduce Antibiotic Use
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration convened representatives of hospitals, food producers, professional medical societies and restaurant chains on Tuesday and extracted pledges to reduce the use of lifesaving antibiotics, whose effectiveness is waning because of overuse.

title: Paris Police Clear Out Migrant Camp and Destroy Tents
description: PARIS  The French police evacuated hundreds of migrants from a camp in Paris early Tuesday in the latest attempt to control a growing population of migrants arriving on European shores after crossing the Mediterranean Sea.

title: Macedoniato Hold Early Elections Amid Political Turmoil
description: SKOPJE, Macedonia  Macedonia will hold early elections next April under a tentative deal to defuse a political crisis that has been rocking the country for months, a mediator said.

title: Head Scarves Before the Supreme Court
description: This is really easy, Justice Antonin Scalia said on Monday morning as he announced the Supreme Courts 8-to-1 decision in favor of a Muslim woman who was denied a job at the clothing-store chain Abercrombie & Fitch because her head scarf violated the companys Look Policy.

title: Dames at Sea Will Sail to Broadway This Fall
description: Dames at Sea, the musical that gave Bernadette Peters her big break more than 40 years ago, will finally arrive on Broadway at the Helen Hayes Theater this fall.

title: Restaurants Add Reservation Cancellation Fees to the Menu
description: Booking a table used to feel pretty good. Sure, it wasnt always easy to get the time and date we wanted, but once we did, there was a sense of accomplishment. And most of the time, the call ended with the first sweet embrace of hospitality, as the nice person on the phone promised your table would be waiting and the whole staff would be looking forward to your arrival.

title: Chief Says I.R.S. Struggles to Stay Ahead of Online Attackers
description: WASHINGTON  John Koskinen, the head of the Internal Revenue Service, on Tuesday attributed a recent online attack that exposed the information of more than 100,000 taxpayers to the agencys inability to keep up with increasingly sophisticated threats.

title: MRI Report
description: The patients MRI report.

title: At Ruschmeyers Summer Surf-Art Installation, Hotel Guests Are Invited to Pitch In
description: I believe some of the best of art is born from a juxtaposition that makes you smile, says the artist Jason Dussault, who this summer will spend four weeks creating a surf-inspired art installation in an on-site residency at Ruschmeyers hotel  a commune for the cool, as Dussault puts it. Dussault will be setting up his temporary workspace and makeshift showroom in the communal lawn, the Magic Garden, at the center of the boutique hotels 19 guest rooms; among the picnic and Ping-Pong tables, hell be creating and displaying mosaic sculptures on vintage surfboards. Using canvases sourced from eBay and local surf shops, the work Dussault is creating for the series, Off Duty, portrays Lego-like superheroes on vacation  a Lego Wolverine, for example, wearing a Kiss the Cook BBQ apron and using his talons as shish kebabs.

title: Klimts Portrait of Gertrud Loew to Be Auctioned
description: London  A painting by Gustav Klimt that has been in private hands for over a century will be auctioned at Sothebys Impressionist and Modern Art Evening Sale here on June 24. The work, Portrait of Gertrud Loew, painted in 1902, has an estimated sale price of 12 million to 18 million pounds (about $18 million to $28 million), and is for sale as a result of a settlement between the Felsovanyi family, the heirs of the paintings subject, and the Klimt Foundation.

title: U.S. Envoy Held Talks With Houthi Rebels of Yemen
description: WASHINGTON  A senior State Department official held talks last week with the Houthi rebels of Yemen, opening a new round of diplomacy aimed at persuading the warring factions in that country to participate in a peace conference in Geneva, American officials said Tuesday.

title: First Note
description: Notes from the patients first doctors visit.

title: LP Prep
description: The patients LP preparation notes.

title: First Visit with Dr. Schepp
description: Note from the patients first visit with Dr. Schepp.

title: Multiple Sclerosis Notes
description: Notes from the patients meeting with the M.S. doctor.

title: A Chateau With Winemaking Equipment Near Bordeaux
description: The six-bedroom house, set on about 35 acres and dating to 1784, is on the market for $2.5 million.

title: A Roller-Coaster Week for Sepp Blatter
description: In the wake of a corruption inquiry at FIFA, Mr. Blatter first said, I would like to stay with you, while promising to reform the organization. But on Tuesday he said he would step down.

title: Fatherhood Has Its Rewards, Like That $1,700 Stroller
description: Guys, it turns out, like to be behind the wheel, whether it is a motorcycle or car. Or pram.

title: Republicans Resist F.C.C. Proposal for Lifeline Broadband Subsidies
description: Republicans pushed back on Tuesday against a plan from the chairman of the Federal Communications Commission  to subsidize broadband Internet for poor Americans.

title: Texas Lawmakers Pass a Bill Allowing Guns at Colleges
description: HOUSTON  Students and faculty members at public and private universities in Texas could be allowed to carry concealed handguns into classrooms, dormitories and other buildings under a bill passed over the weekend by the Republican-dominated Legislature. The measure is being hailed as a victory by gun rights advocates and criticized by many students and professors as irresponsible and unnecessary.

title: Support for the European Union Is Rising, Survey Suggests
description: LONDON  Faith in the European Union is reviving in Europe, even as parties that are skeptical of the bloc threaten to divide and polarize the Continent, according to a new survey by the Pew Research Center.

title: Cause of Amtrak Trains Speeding Still Unknown, Panel Is Told
description: WASHINGTON  Federal regulators told Congress on Tuesday that they were still working to understand why an Amtrak train was traveling at double the designated speed when it derailed in Philadelphia last month, killing eight people and injuring about 200.

title: Congress Holds Hearing on Amtrak Crash
description: Officials testified at a congressional hearing on Tuesday about why a technology that slows trains wasnt in place before last months derailment in Philadelphia that killed 8 people.

title: Devils Hire John Hynes as Coach
description: NEWARK  Given his first opportunity to make a hire as the Devils general manager, Ray Shero picked a familiar face.

title: Mitch McConnells N.S.A. Debacle
description: Its been a bad few days for Republican defenders of the late-2001, be-very-afraid, security-trumps-liberty mindset, the one that gave us the Patriot Act, the Iraq War, Gitmo, Abu Ghraib, warrantless wiretapping, the vast collection of Americans phone-call metadata and the overwhelming sense that this government  specifically the eavesdropping trolls at the National Security Agency  is not to be trusted.

title: Review: Mark Vanhoenackers Skyfaring: A Journey With a Pilot on Joy of Flight
description: For more than a decade when I was in my 20s and 30s, I was terrified to fly. Like John Updikes character Henry Bech, I had an especially morbid fear of being dropped from the tail-end lavatory. Sometimes I made it as far as the boarding gate with my ticket before turning back in shame, also in relief, to head to the bus or train station.

title: What You Get For $1,350,000
description: A cabin in Alabama, a modern house in Pennsylvania and a 1928 stone and stucco house in Ohio

title: First Draft Focus: Never Too Late to Say Thank You
Reading The Times with Steve Coll
description: Steve Coll is the Dean of the Graduate School of Journalism at Columbia University and a staff writer at The New Yorker.

title: Egypt Says It Has Arrested 2 Senior Muslim Brotherhood Leaders
description: LONDON  Two senior leaders of the Muslim Brotherhood, Mahmoud Ghozlan and Abdul Rahman al-Barr, were arrested this week in a suburb of Cairo after evading the police for nearly two years, security officials said Tuesday.

title: Pictures of the Day: China and Elsewhere
description: Photos from China, Greece, Spain and Britain.

title: A Closer Look at Ron Darlings Apartment
description: The Mets game analyst likes living high up on the 37th floor, where its beautifully quiet.

title: Sepp Blatter to Resign as FIFA President
description: Mr. Blatter said he would step down as president of FIFA, four days after his re-election to the post.

description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: June 2, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from China, Greece, Spain and Britain.

title: Ron Darlings Piece of the Sky
description: Age 54

title: Partying After the CDFA Awards
description: The speeches at the CFDAs 2015 annual awards ceremony ran long. Very long. Afterward, guests including June Ambrose, shown here, headed to the Top of the Standard, where Refinery29 hosted the shows after-party. Here are the photos.

title: Greeces Alliances Fade in European Debate About Its Debt Crisis
description: ROME  If Europe is finally coming to a moment of reckoning in the Greek debt crisis  a standoff now rattling financial markets and threatening European unity  then the critical meeting apparently occurred late Monday night, when Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany summoned critical players to an emergency summit meeting in Berlin. Everyone was invited, except Greece.

title: Detective Charged in Biker Attack Says He Fled Because He Was Scared
description: An undercover New York City police detective accused of being one of 11 motorcyclists who assaulted a driver in Upper Manhattan testified on Tuesday that he became frightened for his own safety when he saw the man being pummeled and fled instead of intervening to help him.

title: Review: A Pigeon Sat on a Branch, Roy Anderssons Rumination on Life
description: A Pigeon Sat on a Branch Reflecting on Existence begins with three vignettes on death. In one of them, a man has expired in a cafeteria on board some kind of ferry or cruise ship. Officers and passengers stand around him with expressions of concern, but the server has a more practical worry: what to do with the beer and the shrimp sandwich the dead customer had already paid for. A stout older gentleman shuffles forward. I guess Ill take the beer, he says with a shrug.

title: Blatters FallLeads to Rejoicing Online From His Critics
description: Sepp Blatters sudden announcement that he would resign as president of FIFA, world soccers governing body, after 17 years, triggered a global wave of reaction on social networks on Tuesday.

title: Research Pays When New Grads Buy a Car
description: After graduating from college, many young adults rush to buy a car. But there is a lot to consider before you take on the expense of your own set of wheels.

title: Off-the-Leash Summer Looks
description: In this exclusive photo shoot for Mens Style, we share the Menswear Dogs looks for making a statement at destination weddings.

title: Review: Every Last Child, a Front-Line View of the Polio Crisis in Pakistan
description: Every Last Child, a compelling documentary by Tom Roberts, gives a street-level view of the polio crisis in Pakistan, where that crippling virus remains endemic. While a program by the World Health Organization goes door to door administering oral vaccinations to infants, Pakistani Taliban militants have killed dozens of health workers since 2012.

title: Rikers Inquiry Expands to Include Union Chiefs Financial Dealings
description: Federal prosecutors have opened a new front in their investigation of Rikers Island, embarking on a far-reaching examination of the financial dealings of Norman Seabrook, the powerful president of New York Citys correction officers union.

title: Review: Interpreting Gertrude Stein in Composition ... Master-Pieces ... Identity
description: Genius or crackpot? Your opinion of Gertrude Stein, in case you hadnt already formed a firm one, may zigzag between those poles, ultimately landing somewhere in between, as you listen to David Greenspans fascinating new exploration of this singular writers work. Composition ... Master-Pieces ... Identity, presented by Target Margin Theater at the Connelly Theater, consists of three pieces of Steins writings  two lectures and a poem  read or performed by Mr. Greenspan, who also conceived the show.

title: Jeb Bush on His Good Friend Marco. Rubio, That Is.
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Senator Marco Rubio railed against outdated leaders in a recorded video shown at the Economic Growth Summit on Tuesday morning. But Jeb Bush said he did not think the remarks were directed at him.

title: Chevron and North Sea Rivals Race to Keep an Oil Region Relevant
description: ABERDEEN, Scotland  Even before Craig May, a longtime Chevron executive, moved to this North Sea port city two summers ago, he knew that the oil wealth in Britains waters was on the steepening slope of a decades-long decline.

title: Sale of Old Masters Sets Off an Outcry in Ireland
description: Over the past four decades, the art collection at Russborough House has drawn both the attention of I.R.A. thieves and the interest of more than a million visitors to this 18th-century Georgian mansion near Dublin.

title: Decline of North Sea Oil Fields Forces Political Shifts in Britain
description: ABERDEEN, Scotland  For the oil industry, the decline of the North Sea fields is part of a global challenge.

title: Who Will Succeed Sepp Blatter?
description: A look at the possible candidates to succeed FIFA president Sepp Blatter.

title: Review: American Ballet Theater Revives La Bayadre Using Familiar Choreography
description: One of the sovereign images of ballet classicism is  or can be  the processional entrance of the female corps de ballet of spectral Shades in Marius Petipas 1877 ballet La Bayadre. Slowly, one after another, the women descend a ramp onto the stage until their zigzag formation fills the floor. Tick-tock, tick-tock: tick (they lean forward, raising a stretched leg behind them in arabesque), tock (they arch back with arms framing their heads in halo shapes); tick-tock, forward and back. Its an accumulation, and its mesmerizing.

title: Prosecutor Says Police, Not Boston Bombers, Probably Shot Transit Officer
description: BOSTON  The transit officer who nearly bled to death during a chaotic shootout with the Boston Marathon bombers in 2013 was most likely wounded by police gunfire, the Middlesex County district attorney said Tuesday.

title: Mississippi Cuts Work Program for Prisoners
description: POPLARVILLE, Miss.  With the lunch hour near and the temperature in the 80s, the only souls in sight outside the courthouse here were two men taking turns aiming a pressure washers nozzle at the steps of the building.

title: Mark Rylance and Streetcar Are Part of St. Anns New Season
description: St. Anns Warehouse, the nonprofit Off Broadway theater that after a long battle is preparing to move into a new home in Brooklyn, announced on Tuesday that its next season will feature a play starring Mark Rylance, an opera by Enda Walsh, and contemporary stagings of classics by Shakespeare and Tennessee Williams.

title: Chris Hughes, Publisher of The New Republic, to Hold a Fund-Raiser for Hillary Clinton
description: Chris Hughes, the publisher of The New Republic, and his husband, Sean Eldridge, will hold a fund-raiser for Hillary Rodham Clintons presidential campaign, two people briefed on the invitation said.

title: Girls Rule in an Indian Village
description: In the remote village Mawlynnong, a matrilineal society inspired a photographer to make portraits of self-assured young women.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Nubank Raises $30 Million to Challenge Banking in Brazil
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Nubank, the financial technology start-up founded by a former partner at Sequoia Capital, said on Tuesday that it had raised $30 million in a new funding round led by Tiger Global Management.

title: Living In NoHo
description: New buildings are popping up, some of them sleek high-rises, while 19th-century industrial buildings are being transformed into luxury residences.

title: A Chef Shares Stories and Recipes From His Family Farm in Marthas Vineyard
description: In The Beetlebung Farm Cookbook ($35, Little, Brown), the chef and farmer Chris Fischer pairs each recipe with a story. Together, these paint a picture of Marthas Vineyard, where his family has lived for 12 generations, and his familys farm there, which his grandfather built on a 5-acre corner plot near Menemsha Harbor in Chilmark.

title: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: Were trying something new: a quick rundown of the days top stories.

title: The Woman Behind Caitlyn Jenners Vanity Fair Cover
description: As dramatic entrances go, it didnt lag far behind that of Venus emerging from the foam.

title: Ackman Takes Stake in Nomad Foods, an Acquisition Vehicle
description: The billionaire investor William A. Ackman has taken a large stake in Nomad Foods Limited, a company that acquires food businesses.

title: The Downloaders
description: In the digital bamako markets of Mali, vendors fill old phones with new songs  and jump-start a homegrown musical community.

title: From New York (Cool) to Palookaville (Melancholy)
description: An occasional series on vintage comics.

title: Recent Commercial Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: A Conversation With Amale Andraos
description: Ms. Andraos, 42, is the newly appointed dean of Columbia Universitys Graduate School of Architecture, Planning and Preservation. She is also a founding principal, with her husband, Dan Wood, of WORKac, an architecture firm based in New York whose local projects include edible schoolyards in public schools and a new condominium conversion in TriBeCa.

title: Bequest Issue Arises in New York City Opera Bankruptcy Case
description: The long-running court battle over the remains of the bankrupt New York City Opera took a new turn on Tuesday. Lawyers in the case said in court that they were exploring whether the company could be reorganized so it could emerge from bankruptcy and accept a multimillion dollar bequest from a benefactor who died during the troupes last days.

title: Chimpanzees Would Cook if Given the Chance, Research Says
description: Chimpanzees have the cognitive ability to cook, according to new research, if only someone would give them ovens.

title: ScienceTake | Could Chimps Cook?
description: Almost. Scientists found that chimpanzees have the patience and foresight to hold off on eating raw food and put it in a device that seems to cook it.

title: On Gray Day, American Pharoah Takes Up Residence at Belmont
description: The more the rain pelted the grounds outside the refurbished Barn 1 at Belmont Park on Tuesday, the more the crowd grew. Fans came in raincoats and boots, umbrellas in one hand and cameras in the other. There were grooms, security guards, racing officials and members of the news media. Satellite trucks from CNN, CBS, Fox News, NY1 and more lined the narrow streets. They assembled for one reason: the arrival in New York of American Pharoah, the Kentucky Derby and Preakness Stakes winner.

title: Pierre Audi Is Named Next Artistic Director of Park Avenue Armory
description: Pierre Audi is a serious multitasker.

title: Californians Are Encouraged by Sharp Drop in Water Use
description: SACRAMENTO  Californians cut their water use in April by 13.5 percent over the same month two years ago, a big improvement from March and the first indication of how the state is reacting to mandatory water cutbacks imposed by Gov. Jerry Brown to deal with the regions ongoing drought.

title: Climate Deal Badly Needs a Big Stick
description: Few economists are as versed in the global diplomatic effort to combat climate change as Nicholas Stern of Britain.

title: Rochelle Shoretz, Founder of Cancer Support Group, Dies at 42
description: As a 28-year-old who had just learned she had breast cancer in 2001, Rochelle Shoretz founded a support group for cancer patients while sitting in her oncologists office awaiting chemotherapy. She called it Sharsheret, Hebrew for chain. In 2009, the cancer returned.

title: South Sudan: U.N. Dismayed by Decline
description: United Nations officials expressed alarm Tuesday over a further deterioration in South Sudan, where they said recent heavy fighting had displaced more than 100,000 people and blocked aid deliveries to 650,000. Adrian Edwards, a spokesman for the United Nations refugee agency in Geneva, told reporters that at least 60,000 South Sudanese had fled since January, mostly to Sudan, Ethiopia and Uganda, bringing the total number of refugees to 555,000 since December 2013, when the conflict erupted. Mr. Edwards said that 1.5 million people had been displaced within the country and that a third of the population lacked sufficient food. The news came a day after United Nations officials said South Sudans government had decided to expel the organizations aid coordinator there, Toby Lanzer, who has criticized the South Sudanese armed forces for their role in the fighting. He was nearing the end of his tenure anyway, but Secretary General Ban Ki-moon condemned the expulsion.

title: Antitrust Scrutiny for 3 Big U.S. Theater Chains
description: LOS ANGELES  A simmering federal investigation into whether the big movie theater chains are misusing their market clout to keep new films away from independent competitors gained steam on Tuesday.

title: Video Shows James Holmes Recalling Colorado Theater Shooting
description: DENVER  The gunmans voice was flat, unshaded by emotion, as he told a psychiatrist how he had slipped through the emergency exit door of a packed movie theater and opened fire on the crowd. He was on autopilot, he said. He turned up the electronic music in his headphones to drown out the screams. He knew he would probably end up arrested or dead, but he was carrying out what he called the mission.

title: Tribe Opening New Casino Says a Competitors Site Is Too Close for Comfort
description: CHITTENANGO, N.Y.  The states newest casino opened here on Tuesday, brimming with hundreds of slot machines, scores of smiling employees and four flying-monkey sculptures adorning a Wizard of Oz-   themed gambling floor.

title: De Blasio Calls New York the Safest Big City Despite Some Crime Statistics
description: One day after police officials outlined a pronounced increase in shootings and homicides in the city so far this year, Mayor Bill de Blasio on Tuesday moved to reassure residents that New York remains the safest big city in America, dismissing any suggestion that his policies are responsible for the rise.

title: Huffington Post in Limbo at Verizon
description: Over the last couple of years, an array of media companies, venture capitalists and wealthy individuals have quietly explored buying a stake in The Huffington Post. The most recent valuation, according to half a dozen people briefed on the matter: about $1 billion.

title: Officers Kill Suspect Who Wielded Knife in Boston
description: BOSTON  A man under surveillance by antiterrorism investigators was shot and killed Tuesday by an F.B.I. agent and a Boston police officer after he waved a long black knife at them and refused to back down, officials said.

title: Families Tell Lawmakers of Americans Held Hostage in Iran
description: Relatives of three Americans imprisoned in Iran and of a fourth who vanished there eight years ago gave emotional testimony Tuesday to lawmakers in Washington, pressing the Obama administration to do more to free the captives before the June 30 deadline for reaching an international agreement to limit Irans nuclear program.

title: A Plan to Combat Mistaken Identifications and False Confessions
description: For generations, physical evidence at crime scenes has been collected using techniques to reduce contamination. Technicians wear gloves on their hands, masks on their faces, bootees over their shoes. With sterile tools, they tweeze, swab and dust for hairs, bloodstains and fingerprints, and place them in individual packets for lab analysis.

title: 13% Left Health Care Rolls, U.S. Finds
description: WASHINGTON  About 13 percent of people who signed up for health insurance coverage in 2015 under the Affordable Care Act have fallen off the rolls, many because they failed to pay their share of premiums, the Obama administration said Tuesday.

title: Jim Bailey, Character Actor in Drag, Dies at 77
description: Jim Bailey, an actor and singer who specialized in performing in drag, especially in the guise of pop divas like Judy Garland and Barbra Streisand, died on Saturday in Los Angeles. He was 77.

title: E.P.A. to Set New Limits on Airplane Emissions
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration is set to announce that it will require new rules to cut emissions from airplanes, expanding a quest to tackle climate change that has included a string of significant regulations on cars, trucks and power plants.

title: Sponsors React Meekly to Sepp Blatters Resignation
description: In the hours after Sepp Blatter announced Tuesday that he would resign as president of FIFA, World Cup sponsors issued statements that read as if one very careful public relations executive had written several versions of the same message that was now so safe to deliver with Blatter on the way out. Only two of the five statements I received even cited Blatter, who, after all, was the star of the day.

title: New York City Creates Replacement for Student Data Website
description: Starting next week, parents of students in New York City public schools will be able view their childrens attendance, grades and, ultimately, scores on Regents exams and state reading and math tests on a new website, NYC Schools.

title: Steven Stamkos and Jonathan Toews Welcome Leading Roles
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Large banners of Stanley Cup-winning captains were unfurled around the room, creating a hockey shrine of sorts and reminding Steven Stamkos why he has often awaked in anxiety and expectation amid the rising pressure of these playoffs.

title: Sepp Blatter: From Defiant to Defeated in Four Fateful Days
description: It must have been some sort of rotten long weekend for Sepp Blatter for him to decide, just days after his re-election Friday as FIFAs president, that he didnt want to run world soccer anymore, after all.

title: Review: The Spoils Stars Jesse Eisenberg as Narcissist
description: As both actor and playwright, Jesse Eisenberg loves rolling in the sties of self-contempt, places where privileged human pigs sniffle and suffer and smear themselves with muck. Even if these are areas you usually choose to avoid, it must be said that Mr. Eisenberg gives good wallow.

title: Pickup Line
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Well, this one by Herre Schouwerwou made me laugh out loud. It took a while to trickle through my brain, but when it finally did, the payoff was fabulous. But I had to stare at it for a while.

title: Airstrikes in Yemen Kill Allies of Saudi-Led Coalition, Witnesses Say
description: SANA, Yemen  Warplanes from a military coalition led by Saudi Arabia carried out airstrikes Tuesday in Yemen that killed at least 16 fighters allied with the Saudi-led group, witnesses said.

title: Irwin A. Rose, Nobel-Winning Biochemist, Dies at 88
description: Irwin A. Rose, who shared the 2004 Nobel Prize in Chemistry with two collaborators for unraveling the mystery of how cells identify old and damaged proteins and transform them into pieces for new proteins  discoveries that led to the development of a new class of drugs to fight cancer  died on Tuesday in Deerfield, Mass. He was 88.

title: NBC Expected to Extend Belmont Stakes Rights Through 2020
description: The NBC Sports Group is expected to announce Wednesday at the Belmont Stakes draw in Manhattan that it will carry the third leg of thoroughbred racings Triple Crown through at least 2020.

title: Maryland: Vote Is a Setback for Scientology-Linked Rehab Center
description: The Frederick County Council on Tuesday voted 6 to 1 against placing a fishing retreat on a local register of historic places, making it very unlikely that a drug rehabilitation program with ties to the Church of Scientology will be opened. The retreat, near Camp David, has been visited by several presidents. The vote against adding the property, known as Trout Run, to the historic list will deny the retreat the zoning it would need for a Narconon facility. The Council was urged by its lawyer to consider only Trout Runs historic character and not the practices of Narconon. Narconon is likely to appeal.

title: NYRA Chairman, Anthony Bonomo, Is Taking a Leave of Absence
description: Anthony Bonomo, the chairman of the New York Racing Association, is taking a leave of absence in the wake of allegations that he provided a no-show job to the son of Dean G. Skelos, the former New York State Senate majority leader.

title: New York Police Officer Charged With Using Dead Mans Credit Card
description: A New York City police officer was arrested on Tuesday and charged with stealing a dead mans credit card and using it to buy a diamond ring. She pleaded not guilty on Tuesday afternoon.

title: All-In on Tanaka, Yankees Can Only Hope His Elbow Holds Up
description: SEATTLE  After taking a month off to rest and recover from tightness in his right wrist, Masahiro Tanaka pronounced himself fit and ready, so the Yankees will saddle him up Wednesday against the Seattle Mariners and see how far they can ride him.

title: Uncertainty Clouds David Wrights Potential Return to Mets
description: SAN DIEGO  David Wright walked through the visitors clubhouse at Petco Park on Tuesday afternoon, greeting teammates he had not seen in several weeks. He moved gingerly, his posture straight as a board in an effort to protect his back as much as possible. When he stands, it often feels achy and tight and uncomfortable.

title: Roger Goodell to Hear Tom Bradys Appeal
description: Over the objections of the players union, N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell said that he would be the one hearing an appeal of the four-game suspension he gave to New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady. In a letter sent to the N.F.L. Players Association on Tuesday, Goodell said that under the collective bargaining agreement, he had the right to hear appeals involving conduct detrimental to the integrity of the game.

title: Onwards and Upwards
description: Whether a messy bun or an elegant chignon, nothing signals efficiency like an updo.

title: A Sneak Peek at a Futuristic Multimedia Performance
description: In a lot of a visual art, you complete the project, and by the time you present it, its done, says Tyondai Braxton, whose multimedia project Hive will be the centerpiece of an upcoming three-night residency at the New York venue the Kitchen. After a pause, he admits: But maybe youd want to have it completely completed when you play the Guggenheim. Braxton is the former frontman of the experimental indie-rock band Battles, as well as a performer with two decades of experience in the New York music world. Hive did indeed have its first show in at the Guggenheim in 2013, for which it was originally commissioned, before making stops at locations including the Sydney Opera House, the MONA FOMA festival in Tasmania and the Barbican Centre in London. Now, Braxton is ready to unveil the finished product. I feel like Ive arrived at the first incarnation of what I want this to be, he says. Everyone understands the music, understands the vibe of it, and were really interfacing in a way thats exciting.

title: Chelsea Boots 2.0
description: This season, the often black and understated shoes have graduated to showstopper status.

title: Female Directors Fare Better in Festivals Than in Hollywood, Study Finds
description: Women may direct only a fraction of the top-grossing films  about 7 percent, a number that helped lead the American Civil Liberties Union to call for investigations into Hollywood hiring practices  but they continue to enjoy better representation in film festival fare.

title: Word of the Day | dapper
description: dapper  \da-pr\  adjective

title: Whats On TV Wednesday
description: 5:15 P.M. (IFC) AMERICAN HISTORY X (1998) In an Oscar-nominated role, Edward Norton plays Derek Vinyard, a white supremacist who goes to prison for a gruesome killing. He renounces racism there, but his younger brother, Danny (Edward Furlong), a high school student, remains steadfast in the attitudes he learned from Derek. After Danny writes a book report on Mein Kampf, his principal, Dr. Robert Sweeney (Avery Brooks, above left, with Mr. Norton), creates a remedial course for him called American History X. Dr. Sweeney visits Derek in prison and they agree to try to persuade Danny to give up his bigotry. American History X has enough fiery acting and provocative bombast to make its impact felt, Janet Maslin wrote in The New York Times about this film directed by Tony Kaye. For one thing, its willingness to take on ugly political realities gives it a substantial raison dtre. For another, it has been directed with a mixture of handsome photo-realism and visceral punch.

title: Corrections: June 3, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Although the members of FIFA have given me the new mandate, this mandate does not seem to be supported by everybody in the world of football.

title: Robert Rauschenbergs Endless Combinations
description: WHEN YOURE LOOKING for the Robert Rauschenberg archive, everything starts to resemble a Rauschenberg. The chance juxtaposition of a vibrant yellow school bus next to a red Staples sign seems somehow intended, part of the artists grand design. So too might the pale lavender blossoms of wisteria that frame the gray painted door tucked away in a hardscrabble industrial zone of lots and chain-link fencing.

title: Syndergaards Flying Start Crashes to Earth
description: SAN DIEGO  Noah Syndergaard had just thrown the worst inning of his young major league career, and as he came off the mound, he held his glove to his face. He shouted into it so loud and so forcefully that his head thrust forward, his neck veins popped, and he had to use his right hand, his off hand, to hold the glove in place.

title: Girls Rule in an Indian Village
description: Though small and remote, the village of Mawlynnong, bordering Bangladesh in Indias northeastern state of Meghalaya, attracts tourists from all over the globe.

title: Diversity of Catholic Views
description: To the Editor:

title: The Airport Security Sieve
description: The performance of airport security screeners on a recent investigation by undercover agents was appalling. The screeners failed to detect weapons, mock explosives and other prohibited items 95 percent of the time at airports across the country, which may be a shock to travelers who assumed the hassle of screening was worth it if it kept them safe.

title: Women on a Peace Mission to North Korea
description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: My Road to the White House
description: I know a hot trend when I see one and I hate to hop aboard too late. So here goes:

title: Where the Housing Crisis Continues
description: BOSTON

title: Requiring Ultrasounds Before an Abortion
description: To the Editor:

title: When a School Board Victimizes Kids
description: NEW YORK STATE has a proud tradition of local decision making in public education. However, students in the public schools in East Ramapo, about 30 miles north of Manhattan, in Rockland County, are being denied their state constitutional right to a sound basic education by a board that has grossly mismanaged the districts finances and educational programs.

title: Lost Opportunity on Nuclear Disarmament
description: The United States and other nuclear powers failed to use a recent United Nations conference to advance the cause of nuclear disarmament. The meeting in May was supposed to strengthen international efforts to contain nuclear weapons. Instead, it was a reminder of the deep divisions over the future of nuclear weapons and what efforts should be made to eliminate them.

title: Planting Seeds in Baltimore
description: On a warm Saturday in late May 2008, my wife, Ann, talked me into going to an auditorium in Baltimore to watch a lottery. It was no ordinary lottery. Numbered balls were cranked out of a bingo machine, and the winners got a ticket to a better life. It was the lottery to choose the first 80 students to attend a new public college-prep boarding school: the SEED School of Maryland based in Baltimore. (My wife chairs the foundation behind the SEED schools.) SEED Maryland  SEED already had a branch in the District of Columbia  was admitting boys and girls from some of the toughest streets and dysfunctional schools in Maryland, and particularly Baltimore, beginning in sixth grade. Five days a week, they would live at the school in a dormitory with counselors  insulated from the turmoil of their neighborhoods  and take buses home on weekends. Last Saturday, I attended the graduation of that first class.

title: Drews Two Hits Help the Yankees Snatch a Victory
description: SEATTLE  Perhaps it was the two days Stephen Drew spent reviewing years-old video and tinkering with his swing in the batting cage. Maybe it was a reversal of his miserable fortunes. Or possibly it was the haircut he got a couple of hours before the first pitch.

title: Rival Pro-Democracy Rallies Planned for June 4 in Hong Kong
description: Every June 4 for a quarter-century, people in Hong Kong who want to commemorate the 1989 Tiananmen Square crackdown have known where to go: Victoria Park, site of the worlds largest public gathering mourning the hundreds, possibly thousands, of civilians killed when troops were deployed to suppress pro-democracy demonstrations in Beijing.

title: O.E.C.D. Sees Slow Recovery Worldwide
description: PARIS  The world economy continues to heal at a disappointingly slow pace, the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development said on Wednesday, but it predicted that growth should return to a healthier rate close to its long-term goal by the end of 2016.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Paris Bridges Love Locks Are Taken Down
description: In Paris Bridges Love Locks Are Taken Down, Alissa J. Rubin and Aurelien Breeden write about a new look for a Paris landmark.

title: Test Yourself | Protein Powder Powers Coders
description: Below, the opening paragraphs of a May 24 article headlined In Busy Silicon Valley, Protein Powder Is in Demand.

title: NoHos Cinderella Moment
description: For many years, NoHo was the forgotten stepsister to SoHo, although they both have similar cast-iron architecture, zoning, loft tenants and a great backdrop of artists and bohemian culture, said Jeanne Wilcke, a leader of the NoHo Neighborhood Association and a 24-year resident.

title: Remembering Last Nights Music Festival in the Morning
description: When Grace McClellan attends two music festivals  Governors Ball in New York and Bonnaroo in Tennessee  this month, she will be among friends who feel more like family. Their shared bond, along with a love of live music: Theyre all sober.

title: Ubers French Resistance
description: Around midnight on a windswept Saturday in April, three unmarked cars slowed to a halt on the Rue de Rivoli, near the ornate 19th-century facade of the Htel de Ville. The doors swung open, and six police officers, part of a special Paris law-enforcement brigade known as the Boers, hopped out in civilian clothing, with pistols strapped to their waists. They formed a silent huddle as their leader, Capt. Thierry Pujol, issued their marching orders for the evening.

title: Out of the Ashes, a Rebuilt Synagogue With a Basketball Court on Top
description: Anyone else might be able to enter the rebuilt synagogue of Congregation Kehilath Jeshurun at 125 East 85th Street later this summer, take a quick look around and think: Its just like it used to be, only spruced up a bit.

title: Can the Swiss Watchmaker Survive the Digital Age?
description: Pim Koeslag designs and fabricates some of the worlds most complicated mechanical timepieces. Especially ambitious is his Grand Tourbillon Minute Repeater, created for Ateliers deMonaco, a watch company he helped start. When I visited his bright, sunlit factory in Geneva in May, he opened a refrigerator-size safe to show me one of them.

title: Jeb Bush, Taking His Time, Tests the Legal Definition of Candidate
description: WASHINGTON  Jeb Bush is under growing pressure to acknowledge what seems obvious to some voters and election lawyers: He is running for president.

title: Jurassic World Puts Colin Trevorrow in the Drivers Seat
description: LOS ANGELES  In Jurassic World, scientists create a living theme park attraction called Indominus rex by splicing the DNA of two very different dinosaurs. They are ecstatic. Behold! The glorious future, a ticket-selling machine.

title: Should Womens Basketball Lower the Rims?
description: Female basketball players are about seven inches shorter than their male counterparts in both the pros and the college ranks, yet 10-foot rims are still the standard for both men and women. Does keeping rims at the same height promote equality in athletics? Or does it just slow down the game for women?

title: Spotify Wants Listeners to Break Down Music Barriers
description: In the last few weeks, my two children, ages 4 and 2, have suddenly become obsessed with Simon and Garfunkel.

title: Fears of MERS Virus Prompt Broadening of Cautions in South Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Fears of the deadly virus that causes Middle East respiratory syndrome enveloped South Korea on Wednesday as the authorities nearly doubled the number of quarantined people they say may have been exposed, temporarily closed more than 700 kindergartens and schools and refused to identify the six hospitals where infections had been confirmed.

title: The New World, by Chris Adrian and Eli Horowitz
description: Whither the digital novel? Werent we all excited, back in the 90s, about what technology would actually do to storytelling? Werent we talking about hyperlinks and cybertext and interactivity? I gather theres still a vogue in English departments for digital humanities, whatever that is. But for most of us the whole concept has been domesticated. It turns out we dont want tech-aided experiments in form so much as little Kindles lighting our faces on subways and planes and in darkened bedrooms. We want more room in the suitcase.

title: The Wonder Garden, by Lauren Acampora
description: Edith Whartons first published book was a nonfiction work called The Decoration of Houses. In it, she wrote that the essence of a style lies not in its use of ornament, but in its handling of proportion. Structure conditions ornament, not ornament structure. She was arguing that home dcor and architecture had to be linked, that content must be connected to form: an aesthetic theory that could just as easily apply to writing.

title: Forgetting the Pain of Exercise
description: Completing a marathon can be exhilarating but also agonizing. Thighs cramp. Backs ache. Toes bleed. Stomachs churn. Afterward, leg muscles can become so sore and tight that finishers must ease themselves backward down stairs and request assistance to rise from the toilet.

title: Why Kathy McCabe Loves Italy
description: For the past 12 years, Kathy McCabe has written and published Dream of Italy, a subscription newsletter devoted to travel in Italy. Her infatuation with the country began with her first trip there in 1995 to visit Castelvetere sul Calore, home of her maternal ancestors near Naples. The town was full of families bearing her mothers maiden name (Nargi). It was like Brigadoon, she said. The town had come to life for one day. That led to annual visits with trips farther afield. In starting the newsletter, I realized there were a lot of people like me who went to Italy over and over.

title: Todays Travel News and Tips
description: Our weekday morning digest that includes consumer news, deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.

title: The Ultra-Bad-Dude God & The Electric Permanent
description: Muse is an occasional visual presentation of a discovery, adventure or escape. Here are a few things the artist Henrik Drescher learned in China.

title: Eurozone Unemployment Fell to 11.1% in April
description: FRANKFURT  Unemployment in the eurozone fell to 11.1 percent in April, the lowest rate in three years, according to official figures published on Wednesday.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Focus Media Reaches $7.4 Billion Deal to List in Shenzhen
description: HONG KONG  Years after delisting in the United States after a short-selling attack, one of Chinas biggest advertising companies is hoping to cash in on a market rally on its home turf.

title: Interpol Issues Alerts for 6 After Sepp Blatter Says Hell Quit
description: LONDON  Interpol issued wanted person alerts on Wednesday for two former senior FIFA officials and four corporate executives, one day after Sepp Blatters surprising announcement that he would resign as the head of soccers governing body.

title: New York Today: Troubled Bridges
description: Good morning on this brightening Wednesday.

title: Backward Induction and Brad DeLong (Wonkish)
description: Brad DeLong is, unusually, unhappy with my analysis in a discussion of the inflationista puzzle  the mystery of why so many economists failed to grasp the implications of a liquidity trap, and still fail to grasp those implications despite 6 years of being wrong. Brad sorta-kinda defends the inflationistas on the basis of backward induction; I find myself somewhat baffled by that defense.

title: Majority of New York Voters Dissatisfied With State Government, Poll Finds
description: ALBANY  They are dissatisfied with the way things are going in the state. They are losing confidence in Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo.

title: Nomad in Talks to AcquireContinental Europe Business of Findus
description: LONDON  Nomad Holdings Limited said on Wednesday that it was in early stage talks to acquire the Continental Europe business of Findus Group, the British frozen food and seafood supplier.

title: How Deng Xiaoping Helped Create a Corrupt China
description: BEIJING  For the past month, I have been banned from giving interviews, and so I am offering this essay to mark the 26th anniversary of the crackdown of June 4, 1989, when the authorities suppressed dissent in cities across China.

title: Off-the-Leash Summer Looks
description: In this exclusive photo shoot for Mens Style, we share the Menswear Dogs looks for making a statement at destination weddings.

title: Greeces Runaway Train
description: ATHENS  For months, Greeks have felt like passengers on a runaway train, with no idea who is driving it or whether it will be brought under control.

title: Fear of Almonds
description: I cant tell you how many times in the last month someone has come up to me and said something like, Do you think I should stop eating almonds? or I really miss almond butter, but I just cant bring myself to buy it anymore.

description: The Obama administration has invested heavily in a data-based drive to improve the math, reading and science skills of the nations school children.

title: Medicares Next Half-Century
description: The 50th anniversary of Medicare next month is an opportunity to consider what the goals of medicine should be in our aging society and how we want to live in relation to medicines evolving tools.

title: Gaffes on the Campaign Trail
Facing Elite Bloat, Airlines Move the Goal Posts
description: When everyones an elite flier, no one is, Delta Air Lines explained in an email to frequent fliers last fall.

title: Stephen Curry Gave Davidson Good Publicity, and a Bad Rap
description: The confidence and charisma Stephen Curry has shown during the Golden State Warriors march to the N.B.A. finals was on display in 2009 when he sent an email to the entire Davidson College student body. It was an invitation to the premiere of his first rap video.

title: Today in Politics: Welcome to the Party, Lincoln Chafee
description: Good Wednesday morning from Washington, where the Senate finally reached an agreement on the National Security Agency surveillance bill. Hillary Rodham Clinton has a new advocacy group, and a previously reluctant segment is warming up to Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky. And the presidential race is set to add another name to its roster.

title: China Keeps Lid on Information, as Hopes Dim in Yangtze Ship Disaster
description: JIANLI, China  China sought to maintain a tight grip on information about a capsized cruise ship on Wednesday, even as hopes dimmed for the hundreds of people aboard who remained missing and questions emerged about the vessel and the captains decision to sail into a storm.

title: Morning Agenda: Greece Challenges Its Lenders
description: GREECE CHALLENGES ITS LENDERS | As the top representatives of Greeces creditors moved toward completing a proposal to give the country the bailout aid it badly needs, Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras of Greece said on Tuesday that his government sent its own proposal to creditors, on its own terms,  Liz Alderman writes in The New York Times. On Wednesday, the prime minister will discuss the Greek proposal with Jean-Claude Juncker, the president of the European Commission, in Brussels, according to a Greek government official.

title: Sepp Blatters Resignation Removes an Obstacle to FIFA Overhaul
description: Now that Sepp Blatter has resigned, widespread international glee is tempered by a daunting question for FIFA: What next?

title: Korean Official on MERS School Closings
description: The South Korean education minister, Hwang Yoo-Wea, announced class cancellations and precautionary measures after the virus killed two.

title: European Central Bankto Stick With Bond-Buying Plan, Citing Results
description: FRANKFURT  The European Central Bank left its main borrowing rate unchanged on Wednesday, but intends to continue with its bond-buying program, meant to stimulate the eurozone economy, as long as necessary to raise the inflation rate from its dangerously low level.

title: The Times Should Push Back Hard on Background Sourcing
description: The all-too-common Washington practice of background briefings and background press releases brings to mind a quip often attributed to Mark Twain: Everybody complains about the weather but nobody does anything about it.

description: Good morning, classical fans. Does the start of June have you wanting to range free a little? Not too far from the New York border, some choice performances await.

title: South Korea Says It Tested Missile That Can Strike Anywhere in North
description: SEOUL, South Korea  South Korea successfully test-fired its first ballistic missile on Wednesday with a range far enough to hit any part of North Korea, Defense Ministry officials said.

title: Whitman Paints a Vague Picture of Hewlett Packard Enterprise
description: LAS VEGAS  Meg Whitman, chairwoman and chief executive of Hewlett-Packard, explained her dream Tuesday for Hewlett Packard Enterprise, the new company shes creating after HP is split in half. She also indicated her dilemma.

title: Even in Safety of Malaysia, Rohingya Migrants Face Bleak Prospects
description: AMPANG, Malaysia  For refugees from Myanmar who have reached Malaysia, life may well be better than the grim marginalization and persecution they fled. But even here, poverty and exclusion threaten to rob them of a voice in determining their own future.

title: Moroccan Film About Prostitution Creates Uproar
description: PARIS  A prostitution-themed film from Morocco that had its premiere at the Cannes Film Festival in May has set off a furor there: After six minutes of excerpts appeared online, the government last week banned the movie from theaters, the female stars received death threats and a male actor was attacked with a knife.

description: TUSCALOOSA, ALA.

title: Will the John Galliano Repackaging Work?
description: John Galliano  the brand, not the man  has a new visual identity (translation: logo and packaging) and a new business strategy (contemporary!) to signal what Dominique de Longevialle, its chief executive, is calling a resurgence.

title: Florida House That Brought Marco Rubio Grief Is Finally Sold
description: At long last, Senator Marco Rubio has sold a home in Tallahassee, Fla., that has brought him grief over the years  selling for $18,000 less than the sale price and $8,000 less than its most recent listing price.

title: Cuddles, From Joseph Wilde, Turns the Tables on a Fear of Horror
description: Mirrors frightened him when he was a child. Windows, too. Even now, at 29, the London writer Joseph Wilde can get a little freaked out by turning his back on a darkened room.

title: Daily Report: Spotify and the End of Musical Genres
description: Farhad Manjoo writes that theres a reason his two children, ages 4 and 2, have suddenly become obsessed with Simon and Garfunkel, not long after fixations on Maroon 5 and Michael Jackson.

title: Tired of Waiting for U.S. to Act, States Pass Crowdfunding Laws and Rules
description: In 2012, President Obama signed a law that he called a potential game changer for entrepreneurs seeking financing to start or expand a business: Small companies looking for financial backers could advertise their offerings online, and average people  not just wealthy accredited investors  would be allowed to buy stakes in businesses they found promising.

title: Real Estate in France

title: Caitlyn Jenner Documentary Series Reveals Title and First Promo
description: Earlier this week, Caitlyn Jenner revealed her name to the world in a cover story for Vanity Fair. That article and the Annie Leibovitz images accompanying it were a sensation. Now, the E! network, which airs Keeping Up With the Kardashians, the reality show on which Ms. Jenner has long appeared, has released its first look at the documentary series that will document the 65-year-olds transition from Bruce to Caitlyn.

title: 1940: 17 Nazi Bombers Shot Down
description: Newsreel footage of Paris in ruin after the German bombings. (britishpathe.com)

title: South Korea Test-Fires Missile
description: Footage from the launch site and from an infrared camera shows South Korea launching a new ballistic missile from its west coast.

title: Review: Mark Morris and Haydn Join to Brighten Houston Ballet Program
description: HOUSTON  Why hasnt Mark Morris set more dances to works by Joseph Haydn? An important part of this famously musical choreographers talent has been applied to pieces by composers from the late 17th century to the late 18th  notably Purcell, Bach, Handel, Gluck and Mozart. Haydn (1732-1809) isnt just a central composer of that period; he also often exemplifies the same qualities as Mr. Morris: high spirits, terrific humor, a strong inclination to the pastoral and a keen instinct for structural experimentation. Last week, the Houston Ballet gave the premiere of Mr. Morriss The Letter V  choreographed to Haydns Symphony No. 88 in G (1787). (Some Haydn symphonies were once known by letters of the alphabet; V was assigned to this one  hence this ballets title.)

title: Farewell, My Lovely Cigarettes
description: Like every other Gen Xer, I learned to smoke because a neighborhood girl named Tammy had a grandmother who was dying of cancer and therefore didnt have time to notice that Tammy was stealing her Benson & Hedges 100s.

title: Tumblr 521  524
description: Tumblr 521  524

title: Rangers Joey Gallo Makes Debut With 3 Hits and a Home Run
description: Texas Rangers fans have been waiting for the debut of Joey Gallo, and they were not disappointed when it came.

title: Primates of Park Avenue: Reporters Notebook
description: When Wednesday Martin, a writer I had never heard of, published an Op-Ed essay in The Times a few weeks ago about Upper East Side mothers, readers responded with great interest across the digital universe. Most hadnt read the book on which the essay was based  its publication date was June 2  but everyone seemed to have an opinion.

title: In Hindi Films, Strong Women Are a Formula That Works
description: In the hit Hindi film of the season, an architect cares for her cantankerous father, enduring his careful analysis of his own constipation, his contempt for marriage, which he claims is for low I.Q. people, and his appreciation for the fact, which he shares with others, that his unmarried daughters sex life is purely need based. In another Hindi film, a woman who is estranged from her husband flirts with available men, bringing much misery to their lives.

title: John Paulson Gives $400 Million to Harvard for Engineering School
description: Harvard announced Wednesday that the billionaire hedge fund manager John A. Paulson had given a $400 million endowment to support the School of Engineering and Applied Sciences  the largest gift in the universitys history.

title: Welcome to Summer! But First, Just a Few Forms
description: Hello! Congratulations on reaching the end of yet another school year. Just one or two things to check off the list before the summer can officially begin.

title: Court Rules Against Lloyds Banking Group on Bond Redemption
description: LONDON  A British court ruled on Wednesday that the Lloyds Banking Group would not be allowed to redeem a series of high-interest bonds, a move the lender hoped would save it more than $300 million a year.

title: In Warriors-Cavaliers N.B.A. Finals, Four Factors Loom Large
description: The Cleveland Cavaliers and the Golden State Warriors have steamrollered their way through the N.B.A. playoffs with little opposition. Cleveland is 12-2 and Golden State 12-3. There would not seem to be a lot there to help predict the way the N.B.A. finals will go.

title: Pink Slips at Disney. But First, Training Foreign Replacements.
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  The employees who kept the data systems humming in the vast Walt Disney fantasy fief did not suspect trouble when they were suddenly summoned to meetings with their boss.

title: Pentagon Seeks Easing of Ban on Russian Rockets for U.S. Space Missions
description: WASHINGTON  After Russia annexed Crimea last year, Congress passed legislation that forced the Pentagon to stop buying Russian rocket engines that have been used since 2000 to help launch American military and intelligence satellites into space.

title: Yahoo Wins Rights to Live Stream Bills-Jaguars N.F.L. Game
description: Yahoo may be well past its glory days, but its quarterback, Marissa Mayer, can still score a touchdown now and then.

title: Democrats Wage a National Fight Over Voter Rules
description: Democrats allied with Hillary Rodham Clinton are mounting a nationwide legal battle 17 months before the 2016 presidential election, seeking to roll back Republican-enacted restrictions on voter access that Democrats say could, if unchallenged, prove decisive in a close campaign.

title: Boston Terror SuspectsShooting Highlights Concerns Over Reach of ISIS
description: BOSTON  Investigators had been watching Usaamah Abdullah Rahim long enough to know about his avid interest in Islamic State militants, but when they overheard him talking on a cellphone about beheading Massachusetts police officers, they moved in, leading to a confrontation Tuesday morning outside a pharmacy here that left Mr. Rahim dead and once again raised alarms about the influence of foreign extremists on homegrown radicals.

title: Greece and Eurozone Send Positive Debt-Deal Signals
description: ATHENS  As Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras of Greece visited Brussels on Wednesday to discuss a bailout deal, signs emerged that the two sides might be edging closer to a compromise.

title: Help for the Signing-Impaired
description: While talking to a hearing person at a noisy party, I inevitably reach the point when I want to stop, switch off my cumbersome voice, and let my hands fly.

title: Timea Bacsinszky, Who Once Put Aside Hotel Studies, Reaches the Semifinals
description: PARIS  Two years ago, Timea Bacsinszky had to tell her boss at the hotel where she worked that she would be taking some time off to play the French Open. On Wednesday, she booked a spot against Serena Williams in the semifinals at Roland Garros.

title: Greek Prime Minister on Debt Talks
description: Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras of Greece said on Wednesday that international creditors must do their part to help end speculation of the country leaving the euro zone.

title: 1965: U.S. Astronaut Cavorts in Space
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla.  Astronaut Edward H. White pushed himself free today [June 3] from a spaceship traveling at more than 17,500 miles an hour and became the worlds first self-propelled man in space. It took only a little push to give Maj. White a 20-minute joyride, with only a slender golden tether tying him to his Gemini-4 ship. And what a ride. He danced, he jiggled, he laughed, he teased, he used his space gun to whip himself through the void, and he snapped pictures with two cameras. Four and a half hours earlier, earths gravity tied him to the ground. But now he was free.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, June 4, 1965

title: Europes Next Generation of Venture Capital Funds
description: LONDON  European venture capital is going through a shake-up.

title: A Talking Teddy Bear Practicing in the Pediatric Hospital
description: This is the fourth episode in a Bits video series, called Robotica, examining how robots are poised to change the way we do business and conduct our daily lives.

title: The Bear
description: Beatrice Lipp, a patient at Boston Childrens Hospital, meets Huggable, a robotic teddy bear. The robots creators are studying whether it can have therapeutic value for hospitalized children.

title: Education in Kenya Suffers at Hands of Shabab Extremists
description: MANDERA, Kenya  In a small classroom at Mandera Academy, a private school, posters with numbers, the Swahili and English alphabets, and geometric shapes hung on the walls as dozens of students crammed together on small wooden desks.

title: Jeb Bushs Decision Process
description: How long is Jeb Bush going to sustain the fiction that hes not a candidate for president? The obvious answer: until he gets enough dark, unaccountable money into his pockets through his Super PAC that he can finally bless the people with his official announcement. (That sum is said to be $100 million and rising. How much is enough?)

title: Clip: The Nightmare
description: A scene from Rodney Aschers documentary about sufferers of sleep paralysis.

title: Lincoln Chafee Takes Winding Road Into Democratic Race
description: ARLINGTON, Va.  He has served as a mayor, a senator and a governor. He has been a Republican, an independent and a Democrat. On Wednesday, Lincoln Chafee of Rhode Island added presidential candidate to the list.

title: Emma Stone as Asian-American? Cameron Crowe Apologizes
description: Prospects for Bradley Cooper and Emma Stones new film Aloha, brought to you by the fading Hollywood darling Cameron Crowe (Almost Famous, Jerry Maguire), have long looked dim.

title: Multipliers and Reality
description: The fiscal multiplier  the increase in real GDP per dollar of government stimulus spending, or the fall per dollar of austerity cuts  has assumed a lot of significance in recent years. When Bernstein and Romer assumed that it was 1.5, Robert Lucas accused them of shlock economics, and smeared Romers professional ethics. Since then there has been quite a lot of empirical work, which generally indicates a multiplier of about  1.5.

title: Summer Looks From Bodhi, the Menswear Dog
description: An Internet sensation shows men how to dress for summer destination weddings in an exclusive photo shoot.

title: SoftBank Invests $1 Billion in Coupang, a Korean E-Commerce Start-Up
description: SoftBank, the massive multinational media and telecom conglomerate, announced on Wednesday that it had invested $1 billion in the Korean e-commerce start-up Coupang, in one of the largest private tech investments of 2015.

title: Janet Jackson to Release First Album in Seven Years
description: Janet Jackson is plotting a full-scale comeback.

title: Netflix Announces Lineup of Animated Childrens Shows
description: Netflix announced on Wednesday that it was adding four new animated childrens series to its lineup of original programming, including a preschool show from Cirque du Soleil Media about a whimsical character named Luna Petunia who plays in a dreamland.

title: In Pushing for Revised Surveillance Program, Obama Strikes His Own Balance
description: WASHINGTON  For more than six years, President Obama has directed his national security team to chase terrorists around the globe by scooping up vast amounts of telephone records with a program that was conceived and put in place by his predecessor after the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks.

title: In Belmont Draw, American Pharoah Gets Post 5 in Field of Eight
description: Seven horses, a mile-and-a-half route and 36 seasons of failure are all that stand in the way of American Pharoahs becoming thoroughbred racings 12th Triple Crown champion, and the first since Affirmed in 1978.

title: Apollo Deal for OM Group Hints at Bloating Valuations
description: Apollo Global Management is struggling to stick to its mission.

title: Trial in Iran of Washington Post Reporter Jason Rezaian to Resume Monday
description: The adjourned espionage trial of Jason Rezaian, the Washington Post correspondent incarcerated in Tehran since last July, will resume on Monday, Mr. Rezaians brother said Wednesday.

title: Changing the Look of Excel
The Long Chase Is Over as Novak Djokovic Clobbers Rafael Nadal
description: PARIS  It has been a chase like no other for Novak Djokovic. For nearly a decade, he has had to deal with Rafael Nadals red dust at Roland Garros; had to absorb lopsided defeats and agonizingly close losses; had to push his limits far from Paris in order to have a chance to solve the Nadal conundrum.

title: Mike Huckabee and Rand Paul Have Most Airtime on Fox News, Data Show
description: The first Republican presidential debate is less than 60 days away, and not all the Republican candidates seeking the presidency will make the stage. One of the co-hosts of the debate, Fox News, has said only candidates who reach the top 10 in polling will be invited to attend.

title: Womens World Cup 2015: China, an Early Power, Seeks a Way Back
description: EDMONTON, Alberta  China hosted the inaugural Womens World Cup in 1991 and put on the Cup again in 2007. It finished second to the United States at the 1996 Atlanta Olympics and in the 1999 World Cup. And its star forward at the time, Sun Wen, joined with the American Michelle Akers in being named the greatest female soccer players of the 20th century.

title: Apple Recalls Beats Pill XL Speakers
description: Apple is recalling about 233,000 of its Beats Pill XL speakers in the United States and Canada after receiving complaints that the products can overheat.

title: Bill Gates, College Dropout: Dont Be Like Me
description: Bill Gates is something of a model for education skeptics. Mr. Gates  like Steve Jobs, Mark Zuckerberg and Oprah Winfrey  dropped out of college. If they didnt need a college degree, the skeptics suggest, maybe you dont need one, either.

title: The Fascinating Politics of Polygamy
description: There have been a number ofinteresting commentsrelated tothe new Gallup data showing Americas socially-liberal shift continuing apace, but before I get to them I want to offer one more wordon the data point I plucked out for my Sunday column: The appreciable increase in public acceptance of polygamy.

title: Astronomers Describe the Chaotic Dance of Plutos Moons
description: The five moons of Pluto form a sort of miniature planetary system  one that is unique in the solar system.
