title: Delhi Bans Popular Noodles Produced by Nestles India Unit
description: NEW DELHI  The state government of Delhi on Wednesday banned Maggi, a brand of instant noodles made by Nestls Indian unit, citing high levels of lead found in preliminary testing.

title: U.S. Defense Secretary Visits India to Build Military Ties
description: NEW DELHI  With a dash of the requisite South Asian pomp and a heap of expectations for the future, Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter met on Wednesday with senior Indian officials to inch forward with military ties to a country that the United States sees as a crucial future partner in Asia.

title: Lin Shaye Faces Down Horrors in Insidious: Chapter 3
description: If her movie roles are a clue, the actress Lin Shaye stares at fear and laughs. She has battled serpents (Snakes on a Plane), flesh-eaters from outer space (Critters) and, most famously, evil spirits in the wildly popular Insidious movies.

title: Review: In Alan Cumming Sings Sappy Songs at Caf Carlyle, No Emotion Is Left Hidden
description: I have admired Alan Cumming since first seeing him in the 1998 Broadway revival of Cabaret. Who was this exotic, androgynous provocateur and pansexual pied piper brazenly flirting with audience members without losing his composure? He was scary and irresistible.

title: 36 Hours in Savannah
description: Explore street view, find things to do in Savannah.

title: 36 Hours in Savannah
description: Yes, there are lots of live oaks and lovely squares, but Savannah also has a lively bar scene, innovative restaurants and a rich, storied past.

title: 36 Hours in Savannah, Ga.
description: Some of Savannahs best-known attractions  mossy cemeteries, old mansions, ghost tours  give the misleading impression that the city is a macabre vestige of its storied past. In truth, Savannah is alive and kicking: How could it not be when a large swath of the historic downtown enjoys liberal open-container alcohol policies that make go-cup a popular term in the local lexicon? More recently, a cultural revival has been converting abandoned properties into everything from craft breweries to a contemporary art museum. So now Savannahs antebellum beauty of live oaks and elegant squares coexists with cool shops and innovative restaurants. Welcome to the new South.

title: Showtime to Introduce Net Streaming Service in July
description: Following in the footsteps of its rival HBO, the premium cable network Showtime announced on Wednesday that its new Internet streaming service will make its debut in early July on Apple devices for a monthly fee of $11.

title: Carolina Herrera Resort 2016
description: Looks from the collection.

title: Love Spectacle? In Primates of Park Avenue, Wife Bonuses Are the Least of It
description: Are you thinking about adding Primates of Park Avenue to your reading list?

title: Marshall Islands, the Flag for Many Ships, Seeks to Rein In Emissions
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Far out in the Pacific Ocean, the tiny Republic of the Marshall Islands has taken on a vital role in international shipping, with its flag flying over the third-largest number of ships in the world.

title: Bronx Rabbi Case Prompts Prosecutors to Ask People to Come Forward
description: Prosecutors in the Bronx are asking people to come forward in the case of a prominent Modern Orthodox rabbi who took boys as young as 12 into the sauna naked.

title: Ex-Workers Accuse CVS of Racial Discrimination Against Shoppers
description: Four former store detectives employed by CVS in New York filed a class-action lawsuit against the drugstore chain on Wednesday, accusing their bosses of ordering them to target black and Hispanic shoppers.

title: Group Home Where 3 Teenage Rape Suspects Lived Is Closed
description: New York Citys child welfare agency has closed a group home for boys in Brooklyn after three 16-year-olds were accused of leaving the home without permission early on Monday and, officials said, then raping, robbing and beating a woman they met at an Internet cafe in Manhattan.

title: The Last Ship Musical to Dock in Scandinavia
description: The Last Ship is sailing to Scandinavia.

title: No, a Debate Stage Isnt a Magical Springboard for Minor Parties
description: What is keeping third-party and independent candidates from mounting credible campaigns for the presidency?

title: U.S. Prosecutors Did Not Question Goldman on Financial Crisis in 2010 Meeting
description: In early 2010, with the financial crisis still reverberating through the economy, a top Justice Department official arranged a meeting with executives from Goldman Sachs and some of his prosecutors, a document shows.

title: Decisions by Captain in Yangtze Ship Disaster Come Under Scrutiny
description: HONG KONG  Up ahead, a violent lightning storm lit up the dark sky and rain pounded ships on the Yangtze River. At 5 p.m. on Monday, the local maritime bureau sent a notice intended for all vessels, warning them to expect heavy rain and thunderstorms for the next six hours.

title: Justice Dept. Memo on Goldman Meeting
description: With the financial crisis still reverberating, this 2010 gathering appears to be the only recorded meeting between Lanny Breuer, a top Justice Department official, and representatives from big Wall Street banks.

title: Abuses by Nigerias Military Found to Be Rampant in War Against Boko Haram
description: DAKAR, Senegal  In the course of Nigerias war against the Boko Haram terrorist group, at least 7,000 people have died in government detention because of brutal conditions, an additional 1,200 have been extrajudicially executed by Nigerian security forces, and at least 20,000 have been arbitrarily arrested by the authorities, Amnesty International said in a report released Wednesday.

title: In London, Conrad Shawcrosss Colossal Moment
description: Its a monumental moment in the career of Conrad Shawcross. The 38-year-old British artist, who is the youngest member of Londons prestigious Royal Academy of Arts, has just unveiled The Dappled Light of the Sun, a colossal steel sculpture that scales the institutions classical courtyard like an alien landing. Even for Shawcross  an artist celebrated for his feats of engineering, spanning rope machines, reconfigured robots and even a pair of rotating wooden arms for Raf Simonss runway  this is ambitious. Each of the 8,000 pieces has been handmade in five diminishing scales; when laid flat, the piece comprises about 7  miles of welded steel and weighs in at around 30 tons. It exploits the geometry of the tetrahedron, Shawcross explains of the mass of pyramid shapes. Seen on their own, theyre very rational and ordered, but together, they become totally unruly. So the finished work is full of energy and movement. It looks anarchic against the order and stillness of the courtyard space.

title: European Central BankPresident Hints at Concession for Greece
description: FRANKFURT  The message to Greece from European Central Bank headquarters in Frankfurt on Wednesday was, on the surface, much the same as it has always been: Stick to the program.

title: Jeremy Shamos, a Nice Guy Who Likes Playing the Jerk
description: Offstage, the actor Jeremy Shamos is charming and socially adept. He is reasonably relaxed and seemingly sane, not especially prone to fits of rage or self-recrimination.

title: Upload the Pictures, and Let Google Photos Do the Rest
description: I DONT take a lot of photographs. I have a pretty decent camera with me at all times  my iPhone 5s  but organizing hundreds or thousands of photos has never seemed worth the effort.

title: Classical Playlist: Brahms, Arvo Prt and Gorczycki
description: BRAHMS: Symphony No. 4 Claudio Abbado, conductor; Berlin Philharmonic(Deutsche Grammophon)Carlos Kleibers Brahms Fourth with the Vienna Philharmonic is supposed to be in a league of its own. Truthfully, though, I turn more often to Claudio Abbados recording with the Berlin Philharmonic, as I did again last week to prepare for Manfred Honecks superb appearance with the New York Philharmonic. Not everything Abbado recorded remains worthwhile listening, but his marriage of the cavernous Karajan sound with Italianate lyricism worked wonders in the Brahms he released in the early 1990s. (David Allen)

title: Boston Police Describe Shooting
description: Bostons police commissioner, William Evans, discussed on Wednesday a video that captured officers shooting a terrorism suspect carrying a knife.

title: Stephen Colbert Debuts Late Show Video, Podcast and More
description: As he prepares to take over CBSs Late Show on Sept. 8, Stephen Colbert now has a beefed-up online and social media presence  but he no longer has a beard.

title: What Lincoln Chafee Would Need to Do to Win
description: Lincoln Chafee, a former Rhode Island governor and senator, has entered the race for the Democratic nomination for president. Here is what he will need to do if he hopes to win.

title: Lincoln Chafee on the Issues
description: Lincoln Chafee, 62, a former governor and senator from Rhode Island, on Wednesday entered the race for the Democratic presidential nomination. He was appointed to the Senate in 1999 as a Republican to replace his father, John H. Chafee, who had died. He was elected the next year and was the only senator in his party to vote against going to war in Iraq. After being defeated by Sheldon Whitehouse in 2006, Mr. Chafee was elected governor in 2010 as an independent but later became a Democrat. He did not seek re-election. Here are his stands on important issues.

title: On the Campaign Trail in Des Moines: Reporters Notebook
description: Raygun, a retailer in the hip East Village of Des Moines, recently set out a new line of merchandise and a sign: Shirts for out of town media.

title: Rick Perry Hones His Image as Texas Miracle Fades
description: HOUSTON  Not long ago, what former Gov. Rick Perry and other conservatives like to call the Texas Miracle  the booming Texas economy  looked like a potential steppingstone to national office. But as Mr. Perry jumps into the ever-widening race for the Republican presidential nomination, his states economic performance appears considerably less miraculous.

title: ASAP Rocky Is No. 1
description: This week on the album chart: another surprise rap album release, another No. 1.

title: Bernie Sanders Calls for More and Earlier Debates
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont is employing a new strategy that he hopes will help him stand out in the growing field of Democrats who are running for president: Hes calling for more debates.

title: In Chechnya, Human Rights Groups Offices Are Vandalized
description: MOSCOW  Cheered on by a small crowd, masked men vandalized the offices of a human rights advocacy group in Grozny, the capital of the Russian region of Chechnya, on Wednesday.

title: Bitcoin Rules Completed by New York Regulator
description: With just weeks to go before he steps down, Benjamin M. Lawsky, New Yorks top financial regulator, on Wednesday released rules for running a Bitcoin business in the state.

title: Two Egyptian Policemen Shot Dead Near Pyramids of Giza
description: CAIRO  In an unusual daytime attack near Egypts most visible tourist attraction, gunmen shot and killed two police officers on Wednesday, a few hundred yards from the pyramids of Giza, security officials said.

title: Driven | 2015 Mercedes-Benz GLA250
description: Even at its most affordable, loyalty to the Mercedes star comes at a price.

title: Apple to Unveil Tool Kit for Watch App Developers
description: SAN FRANCISCO  When Apple began selling the Apple Watch in April, Phillip Ryu did not rush to create an app for it. Because apps on the device have limited animation and the software takes several seconds to load, Mr. Ryu, a founder of Impending, which makes mobile games, said he was constrained in terms of what programs he could create for the watch.

title: Video Review: Mercedes Tries to Hook First-Timers With the GLA250
Ex-FIFA Official Chuck Blazer Admitted Accepting Bribes for World Cup Votes
description: It was three days before Thanksgiving in 2013. In Zurich, FIFA issued a news release announcing that it was fighting match-fixing, and Sepp Blatter, FIFAs president, celebrated after a Swiss initiative to cap soccer managers pay had failed.

title: Sepp Blatters Resignation and Soccer Reform
description: Its not entirely clear yet what led Sepp Blatter to decide to step down as president of FIFA, world soccers governing body, only four days after he was defiantly re-elected to a fifth term. It may be that his lawyers advised him this was the best way to combat corruption charges that would soon entangle him, or that major sponsors urged him to move along. In any case, his departure clears the way to start reforming the culture of corruption and impunity that have long tarnished the worlds most popular sport.

title: Turkeys Elections Will Test Power of the President
description: ISTANBUL  Fighter jets raced across the Istanbul sky, painting the Turkish flag with ribbons of colored smoke, as a military band with nearly 600 musicians marched below. Hundreds of thousands of people looked on, in an event that quickly took on the fervor of a religiously infused political rally.

title: Review: American Contemporary Music Ensemble Beckons, Playfully, at Miller Theater
description: Timo Andress music has tutelary deities, and hes not shy about acknowledging them. Thrive on Routine for string quartet (2010) takes its inspiration, as Mr. Andres writes on his witty and informative website, from accounts of Charles Ivess morning regimen.

title: Review: Sense8, the Wachowskis Netflix Series, Connects Young and Cute
description: In the now classic 1999 movie The Matrix machines enslave humans for use as battery-like sources of energy. On the new Netflix series Sense8, its almost as if Tinder has taken control of the planet.

title: Why Spotifys Move Past Genre Might Be Good for Music
description: What kind of music do you listen to? If Spotify has its way, your answer to that age-old ice-breaker might be different pretty soon.

title: The Price of Caitlyn Jenners Heroism
description: A NEW goddess has emerged like Botticellis Venus rising from the sea. Caitlyn Jenner gazes out from Annie Leibovitzs July Vanity Fair cover, bare save for a satin bodysuit. Her auburn curls tumble over alabaster shoulders. Can she really be the avatar of personal freedom and self-expression the media claims her to be?

title: Calvin Klein Resort 2016
description: Looks from the collection.

title: Michael Kors Collection Resort 2016
description: Looks from the collection.

title: Apple Takes On a Market Full of Streaming Services
description: When it comes to streaming music, is Apple arriving too late or right on time?

title: Hillary Clinton to Attack Republican Rivals on Voting Rights
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton, in a speech on Thursday, will accuse some of her Republican presidential rivals of supporting a spate of new state voting laws that she says threatened the democratic process, her campaign said on Wednesday.

title: Lower-Cost LEDs Offer Some Competition to Compact Fluorescent Lights
description: For years, lighting manufacturers have labored to make LED lights mimic the warm feel of incandescent bulbs. But what they offered in features and quality, they could not match in price.

title: Crystal Bridges Museum to Announce Major Purchases
description: The Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art will soon announce major purchases that fill gaps in its collection and fulfill its mission to include more women in the canon of American art: Jasper Johnss renowned Flag painting from 1983, which the museum bought at Sothebys in November for $36 million (outlasting three other ardent bidders), and four works by Louise Bourgeois, including her monumental bronze, steel and marble spider sculpture Maman. The Bourgeois purchases, concluded in December 2014, together are worth an estimated $35 million to $40 million.

title: Victoria Beckham Resort 2016
description: Looks from the collection.

title: Bookshelf: About a Girl
description: The heroines in these new picture books take charge of their own life stories.

title: Review: New York City Ballet, With Heartfelt Pas de Deux, in A Midsummer Nights Dream
description: At the center of Act II of George Balanchines A Midsummer Nights Dream is an intricate, hushed, slow, gentle, spellbinding pas de deux that has nothing to do with either the ballets story or the Shakespeare play on which it is based. Danced by an anonymous woman and man during the divertissement given by Duke Theseus for the triple wedding, it is an image of perfect chivalrous love and cooperation. On Tuesday night, when Midsummer made its annual return to City Ballet repertory at the David H. Koch Theater, it was danced by Tiler Peck and Tyler Angle as beautifully as I have ever known it, the legato of their phrasing spinning threads like gossamer.

title: Review: Brian Brooks Moving Company Keeps Things Off-Center at the Joyce Theater
description: Brian Brooks has been a regular at the Joyce Theater lately, performing last week with Wendy Whelan in Restless Creature, for which he was one of four choreographers, and this week with his Brian Brooks Moving Company. Watching his fine dancers in a program of five short works, which opened on Tuesday, you can see why Ms. Whelan, looking to break out of ballets verticality, would gravitate toward Mr. Brooks. He treats the body as an axis thats never upright, or only upright on its way from one incline to another. The bodys momentum, whipped up by a brisk calligraphy of the limbs, keeps the axis swaying off-center.

title: Morocco Defends Ban of Much Loved; Attack on Actor Is Called Unrelated
description: Moroccos communications minister on Wednesday defended the governments decision to ban the film Much Loved, which shows scenes of prostitutes in Marrakesh partying and servicing wealthy Saudi clients. Meanwhile, the state-run news agency said there was no link between the film and a knife attack on a cast member.

title: Chuck Blazer Court Papers Made Public
description: The sealed papers from the soccer official Chuck Blazer's criminal case were released on Wednesday. Blazer pleaded guilty in 2013 to charges that included racketeering, wire fraud, money laundering and income tax evasion.

title: Review: Primates of Park Avenue, Making Fun of the Rich
description: No book in recent memory has been as splashily misrepresented as Wednesday Martins Primates of Park Avenue. It is supposed to have blown the lid off the darkest secrets of the wealthy, glamorous Upper East Side wife-and-mommy set. Ms. Martin unearthed these secrets  including that of the buzzed-about wife bonus, which her book barely mentions  by living among and masquerading as one of those rich RoboMoms while also doing fieldwork in anthropology and primatology, like an urban Jane Goodall with an interest in social-climbing and fashion.

title: At Least 19 Killed in Fighting in Eastern Ukraine
description: MARIUPOL, Ukraine  Fighting broke out Wednesday between separatist forces and Ukrainian soldiers on the outskirts of Donetsk, in eastern Ukraine, killing at least 19 people, officials from both sides said, and threatening an already fragile cease-fire.

title: Seeking Feedback About Attorney Generals Office
description: Lawyers for Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo sent a five-page questionnaire to state agencies asking about their dealings with the office of Eric T. Schneiderman.

title: Report Accuses Track Coach Alberto Salazar of Promoting Doping by His Runners
description: The track coach Alberto Salazar was accused by a former assistant and a former runner who trained under him of breaking doping rules, according to a report by ProPublica and the BBC.

title: What I Love | James Gager and Richard Ferretti
description: A creative couple didnt just renovate a country place in Pennsylvania. They art-directed it.

title: A Sardinian Chef Dishes on His Parisian Pleasures
description: Nutella is my drug, says the chef Simone Tondo, while lighting a cigarette and sipping a caf on the terrace of Le Square Trousseau in Paris. The Sardinian-born chef of the restaurant Roseval may know a thing or two about mackerel and heirloom tomatoes, but its hazelnut spread that really gets him going  that and the on-demand car service Uber. Its my new friend, he says.

title: Pictures of the Day  Burundi and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Burundi, Indonesia, Syria and Singapore.

title: U.N. Creating Panel to Review Handling of African Children Sex Abuse Inquiry
description: Jolted by allegations of a mishandled inquiry into sexual abuse of African children by French peacekeepers, the United Nations announced Wednesday that it was creating an independent panel to review what had happened.

title: June 3, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Burundi, Indonesia, Syria and Singapore.

title: At the CFDA Awards, Self-Absorption on Full Display
description: At the CFDA Fashion Awards on Monday, speeches ran long (very long); the dress code said black-tie, though many wore jeans; waiters served pasta that few people ate; and Kanye West presented a fashion-icon award to Pharrell Williams but talked mostly of himself.

title: Clip: We Are Still Here
description: A scene from Ted Geoghegans horror film.

title: For NGOs in China, a Sense of Party Creep
description: In 1995, hundreds of members of nongovernmental organizationsdescended on Beijing, including Kazakhs calling for an end to nuclear testing, New Yorkers seeking equal pay for women and Europeans advocating sex workers rights, during the United Nations Fourth World Conference on Women. They dazzled Chinese hungry for change, and the concept of civil society took off. Within months, it seemed as if everyone was setting up an NGO.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Review: Pretty Raw Recounts Helen Frankenthalers Influence on the Art World
description: WALTHAM, Mass.  A groundbreaking show at the Rose Art Museum at Brandeis University here clears a more prominent place for Helen Frankenthaler in the history of postwar New York painting. Pretty Raw: After and Around Helen Frankenthaler re-examines her 1952 invention of stain-painting and traces some of its repercussions up to the present.

title: Prosecutor ReceivesFindings in Fatal Shooting of Tamir Rice by Cleveland Police
description: Sheriffs investigators on Wednesday turned over their findings on the death of Tamir Rice, the 12-year-old boy fatally shot by a Cleveland police officer, to the county prosecutor, who is expected to review the case and present it to a grand jury.

title: Jeppe Hein | Please Touch the Art
description: The sculptor Jeppe Hein explores his installation, entitled Please Touch the Art, at Brooklyn Bridge Park in New York City.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: Were trying something new: a quick rundown of the days top stories.

title: Americans Views on Income Inequality and Workers Rights
description: Americans overwhelmingly favor a variety of proposals aimed at strengthening workers rights, including paid sick leave and paid family leave, the latest New York Times/CBS News poll finds. A majority, moreover, continues to support raising the federal minimum wage to $10.10.

title: App Smart | Stream Music For Free
description: There are plenty of great streaming music services that you can already try, often for free, and while the big players are jockeying to dominate the market, now is a great time to experiment.

title: Video Feature: Streaming Music Apps for a Variety of Tastes
description: Apple, which helped popularize digital music, has watched from the sidelines in recent years as consumers have moved toward streaming music services and away from music downloads through its iTunes service. Next week, Apple is expected to begin a streaming effort of its own, based on Beats Music, which it acquired last year.

title: Donna Karan Resort 2016
description: Looks from the collection.

title: Inequality Troubles Americans Across Party Lines, Times/CBS Poll Finds
description: Americans are broadly concerned about inequality of wealth and income despite an economy that has improved by most measures, a sentiment that is already driving the 2016 presidential contest, according to a New York Times/CBS News poll.

title: How the Poll Was Conducted
description: The latest New York Times/CBS News Poll is based on telephone interviews conducted May 28 to 31 with 1,022 adults throughout the United States.

title: HP Destroys a Dream Computer to Save It
description: Hewlett-Packard has lowered expectations for one of its biggest bets, called the Machine. The new version may actually be more promising.

title: Masahiro Tanakas Sterling Return Lifts Yankees Over Mariners
description: SEATTLE  The Yankees have acted cautiously with Masahiro Tanaka, treating him as if he were made of Venetian glass rather than flesh, blood and sinew. On Wednesday, he reminded everyone why he is such a treasure.

title: Shopping Events and Sales Happening This Week in New York
description: With resort season in full swing, Robert Clergerie is teaming up with Joe Coffee to offer free iced coffee outside its Chelsea showroom each morning from 9 to 10:30 through June 16. Even if you are not part of the fashion tribe, you can still grab a cup of joe; each comes in a sleeve printed with the Robert Clergerie logo and the tag line Living is Sharing. At 545 West 25th Street.

title: Where to Party This Summer in New York
description: New York is awash in new places to socialize and mingle, and the party circuit continues in the Hamptons and on Fire Island.

title: First Draft Focus: Martin OMalley on the Stump
Vineyard Vines Takes Leisurewear to a Colorful Dimension
description: Memorial Day passes, and a young mans thoughts turn to bucolic trips away from the city sturm and the urban drang. Out to the cape, or on the Island, to sands that stretch for miles and are trammeled by the feet of bumbling weekenders, to boats bobbing amiably on the Sound with coolers cradling 24-packs of Corona Light in ice made slightly grimy by unwashed hands.

title: Rohingya Refugees: Stateless in Southeast Asia
description: A Bangladeshi photographer has dedicated himself to covering the plight of Rohingya refugees who fled Myanmar only to find themselves stateless.

title: Trucks and Buses to Get Electronic Stability Control
description: Citing a desire to make large trucks and buses safer, federal regulators said on Wednesday that they would require new vehicles to have electronic stability controls to help drivers maintain control during a skid.

title: High-Waist Jeans Make a Comeback
description: Plus: a capsule collection of African styles for women from Kisua and 8 and understated shoes with a touch of rock n roll from the Turkish designer.

title: Gay Parties on Fire Island and on Rooftops in Manhattan
description: The gay resorts on Fire Island have been living up to its name too literally. In 2010, a fire destroyed the Pavilion club and other properties in the Pines. The dockside spots were rebuilt and sold this year to a partnership that includes Ian Reisner, an owner of the Out NYC hotel in Hells Kitchen, and P. J. McAteer, who owns Sip-n-Twirl and other Pines establishments.

title: Ali Adler, Supergirl Writer, Rescues the Sexually Befuddled Man
description: The day before her first book was released, Ali Adler was sitting in the lobby of the Chateau Marmont in West Hollywood, Calif. She was enjoying a latte and telling an anecdote about someone who had gotten an early peek but wouldnt get to read her book for many years. That is, if he ever chooses to read it at all.

title: Turning the Watch Strap Into a Statement
description: Lets get one thing straight: That rubbery, straplike thing that holds the new Rolex Oyster Perpetual Yacht-Master Everose gold to your wrist is not, according to Rolex, rubber. Nor is it a strap.

title: St. Vincent, an Experimenter in Music and in Makeup
description: St. Vincent (nee Annie Clark), 32, has been performing under that name since 2006. In February, she won her first Grammy, for Best Alternative Album, for her self-titled album. When shes not on tour, the singer, who grew up in Dallas, lives in the East Village in Manhattan, which will be her home base when she performs at the Governors Ball Music Festival on Friday and at Barclays Center for the Contemporary Color concert June 27 and 28. Here, she discusses her beauty regimen. BEE SHAPIRO

title: An Early Twitter Investor Calls for Change
description: Chris Sacca isnt just one of the earliest investors in Twitter. He has been one of the companys most vocal cheerleaders, too.

title: Brazilian Companies Are Finding Willing Investors Again
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  Six months ago, stocks and bonds in Brazilian companies were practically left for dead.

title: Ryan Fitzpatrick Is Ready to Impress Jets, Even as a Backup
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Ryan Fitzpatrick raced out of the pocket, down the middle of the field and toward the left sideline as Darrelle Revis and Antonio Allen gave chase. As Fitzpatrick neared the boundary, Revis started laughing. So did Allen, who told Fitzpatrick, Youve got some wheels, man.

title: More Labs Are Likely to Have Mistakenly Received Anthrax Samples, Military Says
description: WASHINGTON  The Defense Department said Wednesday that it had mistakenly sent suspected live samples of anthrax to at least 51 laboratories in 17 states and three foreign countries, a higher number than officials had disclosed last week.

title: Dudley Williams, Eloquent Dancer Who Defied Age, Dies at 76
description: Dudley Williams, an East Harlem prodigy who dazzled Alvin Ailey company audiences as a leading dancer for more than four decades, performing into his 60s, died over the weekend at his home in Manhattan. He was 76.

title: Computer Scientists Are Astir After Baidu Team Is Barred From A.I. Competition
description: SAN FRANCISCO  A group of researchers at the Chinese web services company Baidu have been barred from participating in an international competition for artificial intelligence technology after organizers discovered that the Baidu scientists broke the contests rules.

title: Cuomos Team Surveys New York State Agencies for Opinions on Attorney General
description: ALBANY  Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York has made no secret of his dislike for Attorney General Eric T. Schneiderman. Now, Mr. Cuomos office has begun to solicit the opinions of others.

title: Jacques Parizeau, Who Led Second Quebec Separatist Movement, Dies at 84
description: Jacques Parizeau, the former Quebec premier who came close to severing that province from the rest of Canada, died on Monday in Montreal. He was 84.

title: Dalton School Ordered to Rehire Teacher Who Criticized Bosses in Email
description: The email, sent last year by David Brune to his colleagues in the theater department at the Dalton School, one of Manhattans top private schools, had the markings of a routine workplace complaint, but with an operatic flair not unknown among stage types.

title: Using Violence and Persuasion, ISIS Makes Political Gains
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Days after seizing the Syrian desert city of Palmyra, Islamic State militants blew up the notorious Tadmur Prison there, long used by the Syrian government to detain and torture political prisoners.

title: Long Path to the Top of Racing for Larry Collmus, the Voice of the Triple Crown
description: Larry Collmus was practicing his equine scales in the race announcers booth at Belmont Park. Regia Marina, Clearly Cheating  thats a nice name  Tiger Moth, he said, speaking to himself, memorizing the six new names before doing it again. Clearly Cheating. Regia Marina, Fast Retailing. His pace picked up. Il Mulino, Majestic Empire, Tiger Moth.

title: Co-Owner of Four Seasons Restaurant Is Charged With Sexual Abuse
description: Julian Niccolini, a longtime co-owner of the Four Seasons, was arrested on Wednesday on a charge that he sexually abused a 28-year-old woman during a party at the celebrated Manhattan restaurant, the police said.

title: Authorities File Charges Over Loud Cheering at Mississippi High School Graduation
description: SENATOBIA, Miss.  The commencement ceremony last month for Senatobia High School, its graduating seniors dressed smartly in blue gowns, scarcely seemed like an event that would provoke multiple allegations of criminal conduct.

title: Walmart Adjusts the Thermostat to Warm Worker Relations
description: BENTONVILLE, Ark.  When the weather gets sultry here at company headquarters, Walmart workers everywhere brace for an icy blast.

title: Argentina: Rallies to Protect Women
description: Thousands of people rallied in cities across Argentina on Wednesday to demand more robust action to prevent violence against women after a spate of murders. On Twitter, President Cristina Fernndez de Kirchner denounced a culture that devastates women. More than 1,800 women died between 2008 and 2014 in episodes of domestic violence, according to La Casa del Encuentro, a local womens rights group. Organizers of the rallies urged officials to enforce the provisions of a 2009 law devised to crack down on violence against women. Speaking in Buenos Aires, Juan Minujn, an actor, said: This is a unanimous cry for coordinated action that tackles the problem. We dont want more tears of mourning.

title: To Find the Next Nicklaus, Dont Look to a Nicklaus
description: DUBLIN, Ohio  At 21, Jordan Spieth is younger than a few of the golfers on the Louisiana State and University of Southern California teams that squared off Wednesday in the N.C.A.A. Division I match-play final. Spieth, one of the marquee players in this weeks Memorial Tournament, is the closest pursuer to the world No. 1, Rory McIlroy, who last month turned 26, leading Jack Nicklaus, the Memorial host and 18-time major champion, to observe, The game of golf is in pretty good hands.

title: Gaza: Militants Fire Rockets Into Israel
description: Palestinian militants launched two rockets from Gaza toward southern Israel late Wednesday, the Israeli military said. The rockets landed in open ground and caused no injuries but were a blow to the informal cease-fire that ended last summers 50-day Gaza war. It was the second rocket attack in eight days after a period of relative calm. Although Hamas, the Islamic militant group that controls Gaza, has worked to enforce the cease-fire with Israel, smaller, more radical groups are thought to have been responsible for the recent rocket fire, a sign of internal Palestinian tensions. One such group claimed responsibility for firing the rockets on Wednesday, but Israel says it holds Hamas responsible for all fire emanating from Gaza. In retaliation, Israel on Thursday bombed three militant training camps, but there were no casualties, Reuters reported.

title: A New York Times/CBS News Poll on Income Inequality and Workers Rights
description: Nearly six in 10 Americans said government should do more to reduce the gap between the rich and the poor, but they split sharply along partisan lines, according to a New York Times/CBS News poll.

title: Chafee Announces Presidential Bid
description: Lincoln Chafee, a former Rhode Island governor, said he would seek the Democratic nomination in 2016.

title: Nico Castel, Tenor and Diction Coach at the Met, Dies at 83
description: Nico Castel, the Henry Higgins of the Metropolitan Opera, who guided generations of the worlds foremost singers through the oohs and aahs of their craft, died on May 31 at his home in Manhattan. He was 83.

title: High Praise for Service
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio looked on as relatives of Michael Demeo, a medal recipient, shared a moment of joy on Wednesday at the 146th annual Medal Day ceremony for New York firefighters at City Hall Plaza in Manhattan.

title: A Golden State Warriors Fan Tries to Look at the Series Objectively
description: One of the hardest things to come by in sports is objectivity without emotion. You can find desire on the fields, devotion in the stands and anger on the radio.

title: Prosecutor Wont Retry Man Granted New Trial in Brooklyn Double Homicide
description: The Brooklyn district attorney will not retry or appeal the case of a man who was granted a new trial this week in a double murder for which he has served 27 years. That means the man, Shabaka Shakur, could leave prison within days.

title: Mario Cooper, Nexus Between AIDS Activists and Black Leaders, Dies at 61
description: Mario Cooper, a former Democratic political operative who gained prominence in the 1990s by pressing leaders in Washington and the black community to address the disproportionate effect of AIDS on minorities, died on May 29 in Washington. He was 61.

title: Frick Museum Abandons Contested Renovation Plan
description: The Frick Collection has yielded.

title: Massachusetts: President Quits Boston Library as Art Goes Missing
description: The president of the Boston Public Library resigned Wednesday amid a federal investigation into the disappearance of two artworks from the librarys collection. Amy Ryan, who became the president of the library system in 2008, stepped down hours after announcing new security measures for the systems holdings. The two works, a 1634 Rembrandt etching valued at $20,000 to $30,000 and a 1504 Albrecht Durer engraving valued at $600,000, were discovered missing in April. Officials said the Rembrandt was believed to have been gone for more than a year. It was unclear whether the pieces were stolen or misfiled.

title: A Team With More Twists Than the Cuyahoga, and Just as Much Grit
description: There is considerable drama  some might even say poetic justice  in the Cleveland Cavaliers run to the N.B.A. finals. The story began as a tight, neat narrative, constructed out of max contracts and free agency, at a time when professional basketball teams were not so much built as they were cast, like boy bands.

title: Gnther Schneider-Siemssen Dies at 88; Envisioned Elaborate Opera Stage Sets
description: Gnther Schneider-Siemssen, the opera stage designer who created the Romantic, naturalistic sets that allowed a generation of Wagnerites at the Metropolitan Opera to watch Rhinemaidens frolic in the Rhine and hear Meistersingers sing in a fairy-tale Nuremberg, died on Tuesday in Vienna. He was 88.

title: Martin OMalley Says Immigration Reform Would Be a Priority in His White House
description: Martin OMalley, a Democratic presidential candidate, sought to seize on the immigration reform debate on Wednesday, pledging to take on the issue within the first 100 days of his administration.

title: Review: At Ensemble Studio Theater, Men and Women Chatting Privately
description: Handsome and toned, John is naked in the shower, debating a point with Jess.

title: Review: Heisenberg, With Mary-Louise Parker, Mines the Extraordinary in the Commonplace
description: For a woman of mystery, Georgie Burns sure seems like an out-in-the-open kind of gal. Make that way out.

title: Spelunk With Me
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Its not often that I invite you all to wander through a dark CAVERN with me, but today we are going to go on an adventure. Please put your helmets on and make sure that your flashlights are in good working order. Also, please make sure you know the difference between up and down.

title: U.S. Military Deaths in Afghanistan
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,344 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations and five service members who have died supporting the operation to eliminate the Islamic State militant group. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans recently:

title: Recognizing Art in the Other Side of the Beautiful Game
description: What makes soccer, the so-called beautiful game, so beautiful? Saturdays Champions League final is the perfect occasion to ask this question.

title: An Activist Investor Takes Aim at Bid for Samsung
description: HONG KONG  One of Americas biggest activist hedge funds is making a rare foray into Asia, betting that it can alter the restructuring plans of the heavyweight Samsung.

title: New York City Is Sued Over Rule Change to Rent-Freeze Program
description: When Mayor Bill de Blasio signed legislation a year ago that increased the number of older New Yorkers eligible to have their rents frozen, he called it a godsend and an extraordinary lifeline for people whose incomes could not keep pace with the cost of living.

title: Gary Bettman Denies Brain Disease Link
description: N.H.L. Commissioner Gary Bettman on Wednesday stood by his recent comment that there was no definitive evidence linking hockey and chronic traumatic encephalopathy, a degenerative brain disease that scientists have found in many athletes who played contact sports. Bettman said his views echoed those of the federal court judge who approved a settlement between the N.F.L. and thousands of retired players. The N.H.L. is being sued by former players who say the league did not warn them of the dangers of concussions.

title: At Home With Ana Kras, New York Design Star of the Moment
description: Its an improvisation of an apartment, says Ana Kras, the Serbian-born furniture maker, illustrator, photographer and model, of the whitewashed one-bedroom she recently moved into on New Yorks Lower East Side. With its double-size windows and high ceilings, the space feels substantially larger than its 500 square feet. The spontaneous, uncluttered aesthetic is due in part to circumstance: Kras has only been living in this apartment a week or so, and most of her things are still with her parents in Belgrade, where she grew up and studied at the University of Applied Arts, and in Los Angeles, her home base until she relocated to New York two years ago. In addition, she has just returned from a 5-day trip to Marfa, Tex., where she shot the fall/holiday look book for Lou & Grey as the new face of the brand (she has also contributed to the Ampersand, its new online magazine).

title: Equestrian Chic
description: From the cut of jodhpur pants to the brim of a traditional Spanish riding hat, equestrian style is winning the fashion race once again.

title: An Outsider Photographer, and Surprise Aesthete
description: In this weekly series, Ts photo editors share the most compelling visual projects theyve discovered.

title: Word of the Day | objective
description: objective  \b-jek-tiv, b-\  noun and adjective

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, June 4, 2015
description: We have advised teachers not to go back. They are subject to attacks.

title: Lightnings Attackers Are Quick, but Blackhawks Comeback Is Quicker
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The Tampa Bay Lightning, young upstarts playing against the Chicago Blackhawks, a team in the midst of building a dynasty, wanted to dispel any notion that they were due for a letdown after their somewhat surprising run to the Stanley Cup finals.

title: New Research Says Robots Are Unlikely to Eat Our Jobs
description: There is no shortage of angst about the relentless advance of digital technology and what it means for the work force, if not humanity. Dire warnings have come from no less than Elon Musk, Stephen Hawking and Bill Gates. Summoning the demon was Mr. Musks evocative phrase to describe the potential danger posed by artificial intelligence.

title: Josh Duggar Molested Four of His Sisters, His Parents Tell Fox News
description: In their first interview since allegations emerged that their son had molested several underage girls, Jim Bob and Michelle Duggar defended their handling of his behavior and their later decision to start a reality show about their family.

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 7 P.M. (AMC) JAWS (1975) Steven Spielberg directed this summer blockbuster classic. Amity Island, a beach town, is on alert after a shark attack, but local officials want to avert economic disaster at the height of the tourist season. Martin Brody (Roy Scheider) is the police chief, new to Amity Island, who teams up with the oceanographer Matt Hooper (Richard Dreyfuss) and the grizzled fisherman Quint (Robert Shaw, above right, with Mr. Scheider, center, and Mr. Dreyfuss) to hunt the shark. It may not look like much but it puts good actors to the test, Vincent Canby wrote in The New York Times. They have to work very hard just to appear alive, and Mr. Scheider, Mr. Shaw and Mr. Dreyfuss come across with wit and easy self-assurance.

title: Dillon Gee Falters, as Does the Mets Fielding
description: SAN DIEGO  Dillon Gee stood on the mound  tossing the ball in the air with one hand, the way someone might when he is bored  as the Mets infield converged on him and his manager, Terry Collins, emerged from the dugout to take him out of the game.

title: Corrections: June 4, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Rohingya Refugees: Stateless in Southeast Asia
description: The Bangladeshi photographer Saiful Huq Omi has spent six years photographing Rohingya Muslims who fled persecution in Myanmar only to find themselves stateless. When he visited refugees in Bangladesh, where more than 200,000 Rohingya now live, he heard stories of torture, rape and murder as well as those about a lack of basic freedoms. While few other people in the world were interested in the plight of these stateless refugees at the time, he felt compelled to focus on them. For Mr. Huq it was personal.

title: A Journalists Worries About Indias Pollution
description: To the Editor:

title: Defending Plans for a Guggenheim Museum in Abu Dhabi
description: To the Editor:

title: Whats in a City Name?
description: To the Editor:

title: Protecting Children From Sex Abuse
description: To the Editor:

title: The Pressure to Primp
description: To the Editor:

title: Old Age Versus Geese
description: Clint Eastwood is going to make a film about Sully Sullenberger, the pilot who landed that US Airways flight on the Hudson after a flock of geese knocked out both the planes engines.

title: Mark Zuckerberg, Let Me Pay for Facebook
description: FACEBOOK. Instagram. Google. Twitter. All services we rely on  and all services we believe we dont have to pay for. Not with cash, anyway. But ad-financed Internet platforms arent free, and the price they extract in terms of privacy and control is getting only costlier.

title: Chemicals in Your Popcorn?
description: What do a pizza box, a polar bear and you have in common?

title: Voting Case Has Potential to Put House Further Out of Reach for Democrats
description: In 2012, Republicans won a majority of seats in the House even though more people voted for Democratic candidates over all. This is because of structural biases, factors that allow a party to outperform its share of the popular vote. The Republicans are expected to again have a big advantage in 2016 because of such factors, which include gerrymandering and the tendency of Democratic voters to be concentrated in cities.

title: Transgender, at War and in Love
description: This Op-Doc video profiles a transgender airman named Logan Ireland, who recently completed a deployment serving as male, the gender he knows himself to be. Remarkably, after telling his leaders and some peers that his sex was assigned female at birth, he received their supportdespite military policy that prevents transgender people from serving openly. Meanwhile, his fiance, Laila Villanueva, who was assigned male at birth, has a similar scenario, but works without the support of her command.

title: Transgender, at War and in Love
description: This short documentary shares the challenges of a transgender military couple, who are banned from serving openly.

title: Let Transgender Troops Serve Openly
description: Staff Sgt. Loeri Harrison could receive the paperwork any day now, forms certifying that after an exemplary eight-year Army career, she is no longer fit for duty and must leave Fort Bragg because she is transgender.

title: 6 Qs About the News | The Woman Behind Caitlyn Jenners Vanity Fair Cover
description: In The Woman Behind Caitlyn Jenners Vanity Fair Cover, Matthew Schneier writes about designing the cover.

title: Test Yourself | Best in Show at the World Taxidermy Championships
description: Below, several paragraphs from a June 1 article, Masters of Taxidermy Seek to Replicate More Than an Animals Appearance.

title: In Downtown Brooklyn, a Rental With No Stairs
description: When Chuck and Cindy Nemser bought their Park Slope townhouse in 1966, an aunt of Ms. Nemsers observed that there was no bathroom on the main floor.

title: Welcome to the Age of Digital Imperialism
description: In March, the Culture Ministry of Thailand sent out an unusual communiqu. Women, it seems, both locals and tourists, were snapping pictures of their breasts from beneath, in an act known colloquially as the underboob selfie. The ministry reminded women that sharing such images was banned under the Computer Crime Act of 2007 and that offenders could face five years in prison. Since the shots were cropped below the face, a ministry spokesman acknowledged to Reuters, prosecuting the scofflaws would be difficult. But this flaunting of flesh, the spokesman feared, might tempt others toward the same indelicacy. We can only warn people to not take it up, he said. They are inappropriate actions.

title: Is Translation an Art or a Math Problem?
description: One Enlightenment aspiration that the science-fiction industry has long taken for granted, as a necessary intergalactic conceit, is the universal translator. In a 1967 episode of Star Trek, Mr. Spock assembles such a device from spare parts lying around the ship. An elongated chrome cylinder with blinking red-and-green indicator lights, it resembles a retracted light saber; Captain Kirk explains how it works with an off-the-cuff disquisition on the principles of Chomskys universal grammar, and they walk outside to the desert-island planet of Gamma Canaris N, where theyre being held hostage by an alien. The alien, whom they call The Companion, materializes as a fraction of sparkling cloud. It looks like an orange Christmas tree made of vaporized mortadella. Kirk grips the translator and addresses their kidnapper in a slow, patronizing, put-down-the-gun tone. The all-powerful Companion is astonished.

title: New Convertibles Invite Drivers to Come Out and Play
description: CONVERTIBLE makers and fans might be forgiven for humming a few bars of Here Comes the Sun.

title: A Music-Sharing Network for the Unconnected
description: Over the last two decades, cellphones have ushered in a communications revolution in Africa. The entire country of Mali, for example, has just 120,000 landlines to serve a population of 15 million. But as of 2012 there were enough cellphones in service in Mali for every man, woman and child. The spread of cellphones in this way has driven innovation across the continent. M-Pesa, a text-message-based money-transfer system, has made financial services available for the first time to millions. Another enterprise tells rural farmers by text what their crops might sell for in distant markets; mass-texting campaigns have helped promote major public health initiatives.

title: In Philippe Parrenos H{N)Y P N(Y}OSIS, Art Is the Big Idea
description: When he was young, the French artist Philippe Parreno had a fantasy in which he would open his mouth and a beam of projector light would shoot out, casting his thoughts onto whatever was in front of him, medium and message in one human head. My imagination would just be easy and available, he once told the computer scientist Jaron Lanier.

title: Art-Directing a Garden in Bucks County
description: Memorial Day weekend was a working holiday this year for Richard Ferretti and James Gager. Coltsfoot Farm, their place in Bucks County, Pa., was opening to the public on June 6, for a garden tour to benefit the New Hope Historical Society, and they were busy grooming it.

title: What Has YouTube Taught You?
description: Online how-to videos are available on seemingly any subject. Want to learn how to apply mascara? Caulk a bathtub? Slay Minecrafts Ender Dragon?

title: Moldova, Hunting for Missing Millions, Finds Only Ash
description: IALOVENI, Moldova  A thick carpet of white ash in the back of a burned-out Volkswagen van is all that remains of the final, desperate act in a banking swindle so enormous that it cost this impoverished Eastern European nation the equivalent of an eighth of its annual economic output.

title: A Stamp, Tiny and Rare, Fulfills a Boyhood Dream
description: As a boy in Queens with a couple of stamp albums, Stuart Weitzman stared at the blank spaces for two of the worlds most famous stamps  spaces that he figured he would never fill. One was for an 1856 One-Cent Magenta from British Guiana, and there is only one One-Cent Magenta in all the world.

title: Review: In Spy, Melissa McCarthy Is a C.I.A. Drudge Who Goes Rogue
description: In Spy, a wild, profane, surprisingly bloody caper-comedy, Melissa McCarthy appears on screen with various sidekicks, nemeses, foils, straight men (and women) and human punching bags. Among them are Jason Statham, Jude Law, Allison Janney, Bobby Cannavale and Rose Byrne, who are accomplished and by now fairly well-established banterers and counterpunchers in their own right. Even better  and less familiar  are Peter Serafinowicz and the marvelous Miranda Hart (Chummy to all you Call the Midwife fans out there) as two of the unlikelier C.I.A. employees in recent cinema.

title: Steve Kerr and David Blatt Reached N.B.A. Finals on Unconventional Paths
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  It was appropriate that the first substantial meeting between two worldly, soon to be first-year N.B.A. head coaches would take place in an international airport.

title: Correction Commissioner Calls Overhauling Rikers a Long, Heavy Lift
description: This is what counts for success nowadays at Rikers Island.

title: High-Speed Rail Aids Disaster Deployments by Chinese Military
description: Loudspeakers screeched no-smoking warnings as scores of men in blue camouflage uniforms massed on platforms No. 6 and 7 at the Hongqiao Railway Station in Shanghai early Tuesday afternoon, 16 hours after the capsizing of the Oriental Star cruise ship with 456 people on board.

title: Mislaid, by Nell Zink
description: Toward the middle of Nell Zinks Mislaid, a screwball comic novel of identity, Karen, a Southern white girl whose lesbian mother has raised her as black for complicated reasons, innocently asks a new friend, as though she were inquiring about her major: What minority are you?

title: Stephen King: By the Book
description: The author, most recently, of Finders Keepers has never read Jane Austen. I do not say this with either pride or shame (or prejudice, for that matter). Its just a fact.

title: Kevin Amato and the Brave New Mens Runway
description: The fashion scout Kevin Amato is challenging the notions of male beauty that have long held sway in the mens wear business.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Hotel Review: Portrait Firenze in Florence
description: Rooms from 360 euros (about $393 at $1.09 to the euro); 580 euros in high season.

title: Biking Through History in Philadelphia
description: With the April launch of Indego, Philadelphias 24-hour bike share program, the city now has a network similar to New Yorks Citi Bike; Washington, D.C.s Capital Bikeshare; and bike programs in other cities. (Philadelphia is also on our list of 52 Places to Go for 2015.) A bike can be rented with a credit or debit card at any Indego docking station for $4 per half-hour, an ideal option for neighborhood trips. There is also an option to find open bikes at individual stations online.

title: Todays Travel News and Tips
description: Our weekday morning digest that includes consumer news, deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.

title: Behind Picassos Curtain, the Ballet That Got Away
description: Why has the ballet Le Tricorne  often performed in English-speaking countries as The Three-Cornered Hat  become a rarity? This was one of the artistic triumphs of the first half of the 20th century. A study in Spanish folk vitality presented by Serge Diaghilevs Ballets Russes (which spent 1916 to 1918 in Spain), it had music by Manuel de Falla, designs by Pablo Picasso and choreography by Lonide Massine (who danced the lead role, the Miller).Youd think that the sheer celebrity value of its designs would make companies want to stage it, and the colorful energies of its score are intoxicating.

title: New York Today: Where Falcons Nest
description: Good morning on this mild Thursday.

title: Ex-FIFA OfficialJack Warner Threatens to Spill Avalanche of Secrets
description: LONDON  Jack Warner, the former FIFA vice president who was among 14 people indicted by a United States grand jury as part of an inquiry into corruption in world soccer, says he knows why the organizations president, Sepp Blatter, announced plans to step down.

title: Jeb Bush Plans June 15 Announcement
description: Jeb Bush will end the suspense on June 15.

title: Romanticizing Broken Windows Policing
description: There has been a recent spike in violent crimes, particularly shooting, in major cities in the United States. What precisely is fueling it is hard to know. There are more theories and conjecture than there is data. There may in the end be many contributing factors.

title: Rick Perry to Run for President in 2016, Shrugging Off 2012 Missteps
description: ADDISON, Tex.  Rick Perry, the former Texas governor whose 2012 campaign for the White House turned into a political disaster that left him humbled and weakened, announced Thursday that he would run for president again in 2016, exuding confidence in front of a crowd of veterans while making no specific reference to his first unsuccessful bid.

title: In Vermont, Frustrations Mount Over Affordable Care Act
description: BURLINGTON, Vt.  Just a few years ago, lawmakers in this left-leaning state viewed President Obamas Affordable Care Act as little more than a pit stop on the road to a far more ambitious goal: single-payer, universal health care for all residents.

title: Today in Politics: All Eyes on Texas
description: Good Thursday morning from Washington, where just across the Potomac in Arlington, Va., Lincoln Chafee, the former Rhode Island senator and governor, announced his candidacy for president with some words on measurements. But the campaign spotlight swings to Texas, where former Gov. Rick Perry will make his own announcement outside Dallas, and Hillary Rodham Clinton will discuss voting rights in Houston. And another politician with Texas ties, Jeb Bush, has a big announcement planned for June 15.

title: Why a Presidential Campaign Is the Ultimate Start-Up
description: A new start-up in Brooklyn Heights has 80,000 square feet of freshly leased office space, computer boxes used as improvised furniture and enormous ambitions.

title: Scenes from the Tiananmen Memorial Events in Hong Kong
description: June 4 marks the 26th anniversary of the deadly crackdown on protesters in Beijing, which left hundreds, possibly thousands, of people dead. In Hong Kong, residents have long gathered to remember those killed. This year, different groups in the semiautonomous Chinese city held separate vigils, a sign of the increasing complex sense of local identity and concerns among some that commemorating the 1989 protests at Tiananmen Square detracts from efforts to cultivate democracy in Hong Kong, as Crystal Tse and Alan Wong report.

title: Hong Kongs Young People Feel Less Invested in Fight for Democracy on Mainland
description: HONG KONG  For the first time in years, Hui King-to chose not to take part in the candlelight vigil in Victoria Park here commemorating those who died during the Chinese governments suppression of protests in Tiananmen Square in Beijing on June 4, 1989.

title: Hillary Clinton, in Texas, Tries to Win Over Forlorn Democrats
description: HOUSTON  Its lonely to be a Democrat in Texas these days.

title: Morning Agenda: Dish and T-Mobile Said to Be Discussing Merger
description: DISH AND T-MOBILE SAID TO BE DISCUSSING MERGER | The American media and communications sector could see yet another big merger soon,  The Wall Street Journal reports, this time involving Dish Network and T-Mobile. Citing people familiar with the matter, the newspaper reports that the talks are in the formative stage but that the two sides are in close agreement about the structure of the enlarged company, with Charlie Ergen, Dishs chief executive, as the new entitys chairman and John Legere, T-Mobiles chief executive, as the new chief executive.

title: Global Stock Markets React to Uncertainty in Asia and Europe
description: PARIS  Volatility weighed on global stock markets on Thursday as a roller coaster trading day in China added to the grinding uncertainty about the debt crisis in Greece. A rout in European bonds continued.

title: Joan of Arc at the Stake, Distilled to Her Essence at the New York Philharmonic
description: In the Metropolitan Museum of Art hangs a large, mesmerizing painting of Joan of Arc by the 19th-century French painter Jules Bastien-Lepage. Joans gaze is both innocent and determined, her blue eyes focused on something that seems to hold her in thrall.

title: A Short Blast of Optimism About Democracy and The Press
description: There arent many days when I feel optimistic about American democracy and how the press is functioning in its role of watchdog and keeping citizens informed. But Wednesday was one of them.

title: Speaking Out Against Autism Speaks, Even if It Means No Ice Cream
description: Last month, my 5-year-old daughter told me that her after-school program was raising money for Autism Speaks. She was excited because (as explained via emails and fliers from the school), the fund-raiser would take place at a local ice cream store and all her friends would be there. The money would go to support a particularly beloved teacher running the New York marathon on behalf of the charity. My daughter, very excited, asked if we could go.

title: First Draft Focus: Saying Goodbye to Beau Biden
Throwback Thursday | On Summer Hiatus
description: We began this feature last July, with a post about Disneyland, and followed it with entries on topics from the Scopes trial to the space race, shark attacks, Star Wars, teenage slang and the Simpsons. Along the way, we hope we showed students how easy and fun it can be to use the New York Times archives to investigate American history and culture.

title: Cheered Up by a Blue Crab
description: Dear Diary:

title: Lloyds Bank Is Said to Face Potential Fine Over Handling of Insurance Complaints
description: LONDON  British regulators are preparing to impose a substantial fine on the Lloyds Banking Group for its handling of customer complaints related to a contentious insurance product that has cost the industry billions of dollars, a person familiar with the settlement discussions said on Thursday.

title: Are New Fashion Capitals on the Rise?
description: One of the thorniest questions in fashion today is brand nationality.

title: Turkey's Election Sends Message to Erdogan
description: Several features of the government of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, who was once seen as a role model for the Middle East, show him to have spent more than a decade silencing political dissent and amassing power.

title: SoundCloud Reaches Royalty Deal With 20,000 Record Labels
description: With its sleek design and easy integration with social media, SoundCloud has become one of the most popular sites for streaming music. But it has long had a tense relationship with the music industry because it lacked formal licensing deals, and so paid no royalties.

title: Daily Report: Apple to Announce Developer Tools for Watch, Plus Music Streaming Plan
description: On Monday, Apple will begin its annual developer conference, where the company is set to release new tools for software developers to create smarter apps that will gain deep access to the watchs heart-rate and motion sensors, among other components, Brian X. Chen reports.

title: Gas Station Explosion in Ghanas Capital Kills Around 100
description: DAKAR, Senegal  Roughly 100 people have died after an explosion sent flames coursing through a gas station in the center of Accra, the Ghanaian capital, officials said on Thursday.

title: Jack Warner Says He Knows FIFAs Secrets
description: Mr. Warner, a former vice president of soccers governing body and a central figure in its scandal, vowed on Wednesday to reveal all he knows about Sepp Blatter and corruption within the organization.

title: 3 People Are Fatally Shot in a Car on Long Island
description: WYANDANCH, N.Y.  Three people sitting in a parked car were shot and killed late Wednesday night and a fourth was wounded in the gunfire on a residential street in this Long Island community, the authorities said.

title: What Rick Perry Would Need to Do to Win
description: Former Gov. Rick Perry of Texas is announcing his candidacy for the Republican presidential nomination on Thursday. Here is a look at what he will need to do if he hopes to win.

title: Rick Perry on the Issues
description: Rick Perry, the longest-serving governor of Texas, on Thursday entered the race for the Republican presidential nomination. He left office in January after running the state for 14 years, during which he promoted business-friendly policies like keeping taxes low and easing government regulation of the private sector. Here are his stands on important issues.

title: South Korea Confirms 2 More Deaths in MERS Outbreak
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The number of people who have died of Middle East respiratory syndrome in South Korea increased to four on Friday after officials confirmed two more deaths in what has become the largest outbreak of the virus outside the Middle East.

title: In Spotlight, Chinese Officials Are Reluctant to Embrace Transparency After Yangtze Disaster
description: JIANLI, China  On the main Chinese state television network Thursday night, a news anchor read out pronouncements that President Xi Jinping and the Communist Partys other six leaders had made at a meeting that day.

title: Tsipras and Greece Buy Time From I.M.F.
description: ATHENS  As it tries to negotiate a new bailout deal with creditors, Greece got some breathing room on Thursday by deferring a series of debt payments until the end of the month.

title: Yvonne Rainer Prepares Her Newest Dance for New York
description: Either Im not warmed up, or Im too old for this, Yvonne Rainer said on a recent afternoon, as she demonstrated a brain-teasing section of her 1966 solo Trio A. About 20 students, from highly trained dancers to adventurous novices, had gathered atDanspace Project in the East Village to learn a work that, perhaps more than any other piece of choreography, has become synonymous with the term postmodern dance.

title: Think Like a Doctor: Strange Vision
description: The Challenge: Can you solve a medical mystery involving a healthy 31-year-old woman who, while working in Africa, starts seeing wavy patterns before her eyes, followed by terrible headaches, odd tingling sensations and tiny strokes that just wont stop?

title: Rick Perry Announces 2016 Bid in Video
description: In a video released online Thursday, Rick Perry, the former Texas governor, announced that he was joining the Republican field for the 2016 presidential race.

title: 1940: U.S. Urged to End Neutrality
description: NEW YORK  The New York Herald Tribune, in an editorial entitled An End of Neutrality, today [June 4] said: In the judgment of this newspaper the time has come for the United States to stand up before the nations of the world and declare that while reasserting its non-belligerence, its neutrality in respect to the European war has come to an end.

title: New E.T.F.s Appeal to Those With Bigger Appetites for Risk
description: Imagine a fund that offers exposure to the strategies of the worlds sharpest hedge fund investors. Or one that tracks the steady dividends paid by companies like Apple, instead of their more volatile shares.

title: The Most Cursed Sports Cities in America
description: The N.B.A. finals feature two fan bases that have endured years of suffering: Clevelands and Oaklands. Here, we rank the top 13 cities by sports agony.

title: Ahead of Election, Erdogan Cracks Down on Critics
description: Its three days before Turkeys hotly-contested parliamentary election on Sunday and President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, the strongman of Turkish politics, is feeling desperate. How else to explain his incessant and outlandish attacks against the media and other critics?

title: In Sardinia, an Affordable Family-Run Farm Stay
description: The lone albino donkey, Michael Malloru explained as he petted the good-natured fellow, was named for the captain that sunk the Costa Concordia cruise ship in 2012 and was later convicted of manslaughter. The asno is named Capitano Schettino, and Capitano Schettino is an asino, he said in Italian, using an alternative word for donkey. Get it?

title: Boston and Pittsburgh, Americas Most Successful Sports Cities
description: If youre a Boston sports fan over the age of 30, it may be emotionally difficult for you to think of your teams as successful. (Disclosure: I am, and it is.) But the facts are pretty clear: Boston is Americas most successful modern sports town.

title: Poll Finds Big Support for Pathway to Citizenship
description: With presidential contenders on all sides struggling to refine their positions on the prickly issue of immigration, nearly three-quarters of Americans say they support a pathway to legal status for undocumented immigrants, according to a poll published Thursday by the Pew Research Center.

title: Swiss Prosecutors End HSBC Inquiry Without Filing Charges
description: LONDON  Prosecutors in Switzerland said on Thursday that they had ended an investigation into possible money laundering at HSBCs Swiss private bank without filing any criminal charges.

title: I.M.F. Urges Fed to Delay Raising Interest Rates
description: WASHINGTON  The International Monetary Fund said Thursday that the Federal Reserve should wait until next year before raising its benchmark interest rate, citing the stubborn persistence of sluggish inflation.

title: Fracking and the Texas Non-Miracle
description: Grr. Ive been meaning to write about the Texas economic stumble, but have to some extent been scooped by the business desk. Still, theres more to say, particularly about the role of the energy sector in the previous boom.

title: Review: Robert Irwin Shows a Calming Installation at Dia:Beacon
description: A lot of contemporary art is agitating. Gratuitous sexual provocation and moral bullying; sensory irritation and intellectual grandiosity; gaudy spectacle and cults of personality. Roiled by such strident forms of sociopathology, todays art and its attendant New York society can sometimes seem like a boiling caldron of bile and tears heated by a bonfire of money. In many ways, its not so different from the mainstream cultures of music, movies, television and politics, and its usually not as entertaining.

title: Official Describes Ghana Gas Explosion
description: Prince Billy Anaglate, a spokesman for the local fire service, said on Thursday that a blast at a gas station in Ghana was caused by a nearby fire that spread to other buildings.

title: Dog Days at Mens Style
description: A while back I noticed an exciting development in mens fashion  the appearance of Menswear Dog on Tumblr.

title: A Collection of Dutch Artifacts 50 Years in the Making
description: The antiques collector George Way navigates his one-bedroom apartment on Staten Island via narrow passageways amid a profusion of dark oak armchairs and daybeds. Given the density, the untrained eye would never suspect that his home is actually a little less crowded these days. Thats because about 130 of his antiques now fill three galleries at the Orangetown Historical Museum & Archives in Orangeburg, N.Y., for the exhibition From Holland to Here: Featuring the George Way Collection of Dutch Artifacts, running through Nov. 15.

title: Celebrating 100 Years of Pyrex
description: The Corning Museum of Glass in Corning, N.Y., is exploring the strategies of mid-20th-century cookware marketers with its new exhibition, Americas Favorite Dish: Celebrating a Century of Pyrex, opening on Saturday. Glass vessels in patriotic, psychedelic and Op Art motifs will be displayed along with the advertisements that suggested the products would make for happy marriages, easy meals and spotless kitchens.

title: A Johannes Spitler Chest Goes to Auction
description: Two dozen colorfully painted chests have been attributed to Johannes Spitler, a furniture maker briefly active in Virginia around 1800. Descendants of an original owner of a Spitler chest, painted with tulips and birds, have consigned it to a June 20 sale at the Jeffrey S. Evans & Associates auction house in Mount Crawford, Va. It is expected to sell for $200,000 to $300,000.

title: What to Do This Weekend
description: Need something fun to do?

title: Hunting for Hackers, N.S.A. Secretly Expands Internet Spying at U.S. Border
description: WASHINGTON  Without public notice or debate, the Obama administration has expanded the National Security Agencys warrantless surveillance of Americans international Internet traffic to search for evidence of malicious computer hacking, according to classified N.S.A. documents.

title: Azorean Diaspora Cant Resist the Powerful Pull of Home
description: PONTA DELGADA, Portugal  Before a recent religious procession here, a wooden statue of the Holy Christ of Miracles was draped in a new cape, but with a distinctly non-Portuguese twist: Images of Canadian maple leaves were woven into its silk and velvet embroidery.

title: Ronald Perelman Puts Financial Clout Behind Lindsey Graham
description: When Hillary Rodham Clinton left the State Department in 2013, one of the earliest meetings she held was with an old friend, Ronald O. Perelman, the cosmetics billionaire and a major political donor.

title: Barnard College, After Much Discussion, Decides to Accept Transgender Women
description: Barnard College announced on Thursday that it will begin accepting transgender women, joining a slate of womens colleges that have created formal policies on whether to admit students who do not identify with their birth sex.

title: Leaked Snowden Documents Show Expansion of Cybersurveillance by U.S. Agencies
description: As the threat of malicious hacking has grown, the National Security Agency and the Federal Bureau of Investigation have secretly expanded their surveillance of Internet communications flowing to and from the United States, documents provided by the former intelligence contractor Edward J. Snowden show.

title: New York Court Rules for Immigrant in Fight to Become Lawyer
description: His legal fight to become a lawyer lasted three years. This week, Cesar Vargas, a Mexican-born 31-year-old New Yorker, became the first immigrant in the state without legal status to be approved to work as a lawyer.

title: Free TVs in Mexico Are Seen as Having Political Strings Attached
description: ECATEPEC DE MORELOS, Mexico  Isabel Valdez Rodrguez is expecting to pick up two free 24-inch digital televisions  one for herself; the other for her mother  courtesy of President Enrique Pea Nietos government.

title: How to Enjoy Brooklyn Bridge Parks New Public Art, According to the Artist
description: In Brooklyn Bridge Park, Jeppe Heins 18 new installations include a labyrinth of mirrors (reflective planks that recall the Manhattan skyline across the water), timed-cycle fountain (walls of water shoot up from the ground, rotating every so often to create distinct rooms where guests can stand without getting wet) and 16 bright red, playfully shaped benches. The artist aptly titled the lot Please Touch the Art  and shows us, in the above video, how to do just that.

title: Sheryl Sandbergs Post on Late Husband Sets  Off Meditations on Grief
description: Sheryl Sandberg helped women think about their careers. Now she may also help people manage their grief.

title: 20 Indian Soldiers Killed in Ambush in Manipur
description: NEW DELHI  At least 20 Indian soldiers were killed during an ambush Thursday by militants in the remote northeast of the country, in one of the deadliest confrontations in recent years.

title: Rick Perry Super PAC Ads Going Up in Iowa
description: The super PAC supporting former Gov. Rick Perry of Texas has made a large reservation for television ad time in two Iowa markets, just as the former Texas governor has announced his second campaign for the White House.

title: Edinburgh Fringe Will Be Biggest Ever
description: The bulky printed program for the 2015 Edinburgh Festival Fringe is being distributed to libraries, stores and other sites around Scotland on Thursday, marking the official start of the annual arts festival that will run Aug. 7-31. This year, 3,314 shows spread across 313 venues will make up the largest Fringe to date (last years program included 3,193 shows), organizers announced in Edinburgh on Thursday morning.

title: Tim Robbins Plays Secretary of State in The Brink
description: In 1992, in the thick of the presidential campaign between George H. W. Bush and Bill Clinton, Tim Robbins wrote, directed and starred in the barbed political satire Bob Roberts, about a conservative Senate candidate and folk singer who co-opts Dylanesque imagery in hopes of winning the election.

title: Letters: Blooms Day
description: To the Editor:

title: Burt Reynolds and Johnny Cash Highlight CMT Documentary Lineup
description: LOS ANGELES  A documentary billed as a charming and fascinating look at champion chicken breeders. A film produced by Morgan Spurlock about Americans exercising their God-given freedoms, no matter the cost. An examination of how Burt Reynolds redefined Southern pride in 1977 with Smokey and the Bandit.

title: Vahram Mateosian, Owner and Operator of Mr. Ned
description: On the fourth floor of a building on lower Fifth Avenue, Vahram Mateosian and his team of veteran tailors and cutters make custom suits, many of which cost $950. The shop, Mr. Ned, has been open since 1965  long before it became the go-to suit maker for Wes Anderson and a bevy of bankers and lawyers.

title: Our Father, Who Art on Broadway
description: God has assumed many forms on New York stages.

title: British Government to Sell Remaining Stake in Royal Mail
description: LONDON  The British government said on Thursday that it would sell its remaining stake in the Royal Mail as part of an effort to reduce the countrys debt.

title: 1965: Russia: At Least We Had TV
description: Newsreel footage, with no sound, of a Russian cosmonaut outside his spacecraft in 1965. (britishpathe.com)

title: Critics Notebook: Frick Collection Spares a Prized Garden
description: City Hall did the right thing this week, nudging the Frick Collection back to the drawing board, where it should have returned a year ago. Until recently, that museum had clung to its plan to demolish a prized garden on East 70th Street in Manhattan and replace it with an ungainly six-story addition.
