title: The Mobilization Error
description: Every serious presidential candidate has to answer a fundamental strategic question: Do I think I can win by expanding my partys reach, or do I think I can win by mobilizing my partys base?

title: The Duty to Be Outraged
description: To the Editor:

title: What Doctors Say About Transgender Troops
description: The American Medical Association on Monday challenged the militarys policy barring transgender troops, stating  in a resolution that there is no medically valid reason to disqualify them from serving. The association urged the Defense Department to offer medical care to transgender troops consistent with the type of treatment that is readily available to civilians.

title: How Flannery OConnor Is Depicted on a New Stamp
description: To the Editor:

title: Creating a Market for Refugees in Europe
description: THIS year we have seen a record number of refugees trying  and too often dying  to get across Europes Mediterranean frontier, propelled by brutal wars, the collapse of Libya and other states, environmental disasters and grinding poverty that both cause and feed on this human misery.

title: Disputed Painting Is Declared an Authentic Rembrandt After Decades
description: THE HAGUE  The painting was sliced down the middle and straight through its center in the 19th century, probably to be sold as two Rembrandt portraits. At some point in the next 40 years, it was sutured back together with pieces of an entirely different canvas, and layered with paint to cover up its scars.

title: In Womens Rights Battle, a Call to Underarms
description: As the summer warms up, bringing with it sleeveless tops, Xiao Meili, a womens rights advocate, is collecting photos of womens armpits. Her goal: to challenge a growing belief in China that a woman must have hair-free armpits to be attractive.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Jarring Image of Polices Use of Force at Texas Pool Party
description: Please be advised that the video above includes images of violence and explicit language.

title: Test Yourself | CatCon
description: Below, several paragraphs from a June 7 article, At CatCon, Breaking a Stereotype in Ears and Whiskers.

title: Rick Perry and the Hazards of One-Party Rule
description: Former Texas governor Rick Perry entered the presidential sweepstakes last week suggesting that financially downtrodden Americans are looking for a second chance. Theyre not the only ones. Perrys announcement on Wednesday  the first weve heard from him on the national stage since the oops-heard-round-the-world throttled his previous candidacy in 2011  was notable for both its muscular foreign policy rhetoric and its emphasis on his sun-scarred beginnings as a cotton farmer in Paint Creek, Tex. Then as now, however, Perrys strong suit remains his self-professed status as Texas Job Creator in Chief. As he put it in his speech, During my 14 years as governor, Texas companies created almost one-third of all new American jobs. That distinction sets Perry apart from other current or former G.O.P. governors now favored over him in the polls: Jeb Bush, Scott Walker and Chris Christie.

title: Mercedes Cup Organizers Plant Grass to Grow Events Profile
description: PARIS  While the new king of clay, Stan Wawrinka, posed for the cameras Monday alongside the Seine with the French Open trophy, the longtime king of clay, Rafael Nadal, was already on grass in Stuttgart, Germany.

title: Would You Want to Be a Child Prodigy?
description: Publish a novel at age 12, perform surgery at age 7, be a jazz piano sensation at age 10.

title: Dennis Hastert Pleads Not Guilty in Federal Case Targeting Bank Withdrawals
description: CHICAGO  After days of silence, J. Dennis Hastert, a former speaker of the House of Representatives, on Tuesday pleaded not guilty to federal charges that he illegally structured bank withdrawals and lied to the authorities about millions of dollars he had promised to pay someone for misconduct that occurred decades ago.

title: Marco Rubios Career Bedeviled by Financial Struggles
description: WEST MIAMI, Fla.  For years, Senator Marco Rubio struggled under the weight of student debt, mortgages and an extra loan against the value of his home totaling hundreds of thousands of dollars. But in 2012, financial salvation seemed to have arrived: A publisher paid him $800,000 to write a book about growing up as the son of Cuban immigrants.

title: The Love Object, by Edna OBrien
description: Edna OBriens 2012 memoir, Country Girl, was a roller-coaster ride. One downward plummet: The priest in OBriens Irish hometown has her first book burned in public. But then theres the rise to stardom and parties at which the chat is as barbed as the gossip of village life, though with more literary allusions.

title: Saint Mazie, by Jami Attenberg
description: The story of a Jazz Age party girl who winds up in a cage as a ticket-taker in a Depression-era Lower East Side movie theater, Jami Attenbergs Saint Mazie is full of love and drink and dirty sex and nobility and beef stew.

title: Tuesdays Travel News and Tips
description: Our weekday morning digest that includes consumer news, deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.

title: How to Find a Truly Quiet Hotel Room
description: Is there such a thing as a quiet hotel room anymore?

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Before Supreme Court Weighs in, Obama Makes His Case for Health Law
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Tuesday condemned opponents of his signature health care law as cynical partisans seeking to deprive Americans of a benefit that has become an integral part of the countrys social safety net, building a tough political case against Republicans as the Supreme Court weighs whether to strike down a key element of the Affordable Care Act.

title: New York Today: Gaming the Housing System
description: Good morning on this sprinkling Tuesday.

title: Police in Eastern India Say They Killed 12 Maoist Rebels
description: NEW DELHI  Twelve Maoist rebels were killed in a firefight with the police in eastern India early Tuesday, a senior police official said.

title: Orchestra in Turin, Italy, Names James Conlon as Principal Conductor
description: James Conlon, the versatile New York-born maestro, is returning to Europe for his next podium: he will become the principal conductor of the RAI National Symphony Orchestra in Turin, Italy, in 2016, the orchestra said on Tuesday.

title: W.H.O. to Look Into MERS in South Korea
description: Keiji Fukuda, the World Health Organizations assistant director general for health security, spoke on Tuesday with experts in the country to investigate the recent outbreak of MERS.

title: Macedonia at the Crossroads
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria  Have you ever been stuck in an elevator? a Macedonian politician asked me recently. We were in Skopje, his countrys capital, where huge public protests have raged over the last year, including demonstrators occupying the government square and, in the Parliament, a nearly yearlong boycott by the political opposition. Can you imagine being stuck like this for 20 years? This is what happened to us.

title: Norway Divests From Coal
description: The Norwegian Parliament voted on Friday to order the countrys huge oil fund  at $890 billion, the worlds largest sovereign wealth fund  to pull billions of dollars of investments out of companies that derive 30 percent or more of their business from mining or burning coal. The move is a major boost to the three-year-old campaign to persuade large investors to divest their fossil fuel stocks. And it could add to the momentum toward concrete action at the climate-change summit conference to be held in Paris in December.

title: Want to Bet That Jeb Bush Is Running?
description: The potential candidate Jeb Bush  who everyone knows is running  has not faced the fund-raising restrictions that election law imposes on those of his rivals who are officially declared candidates. He has accomplished this by seemingly pretending that he is not actually running for president.

title: When You Literally Cant Even Understand Your Teenager
description: A little paradox of Internet celebrity is that a YouTube personality can amass millions upon millions of young fans by making it seem as if hes chatting with each of them one to one. Tyler Oakley, a 26-year-old man who identifies as a professional fangirl, is a master of the genre. He has nerd glasses, pinchable cheeks, a quiff he dyes in shades of blue and green and more YouTube subscribers than Shakira. Some of his teenage admirers have told him that he is the very first gay person that they have ever seen. He models slumber party outfits and gushes over boy bands, giving the kids who watch him from their bedrooms a peek into a wider world.

title: Letter of Recommendation: Fear of a Black Hat
description: An hour or so into Fear of a Black Hat, a 1994 mockumentary about a gangsta-rap group called N.W.H. (the H is for hats), a peculiar negotiation takes place: Ice Cold, the crews politically awakened frontman, wants 15 dead cops on the cover of its forthcoming album. Citing the moral watchdogs, the white record executive politely requests that there be no dead cops. N.W.H.s manager, played by a ponytailed Richard Lewis clone, has a compromise in mind.

title: Today in Politics: Jeb Bush Heads to Europe to the Sound of Musical Chairs
description: Good Tuesday morning from Washington, where, a day after returning from Group of 7 meetings in Germany, President Obama will move his attention to defending his health care law, and where a senator clears time for blueberry muffins. And Jeb Bush begins his own Europe trip as he switches some job titles on his team.

title: Using Dance to Connect With Locals
description: On a trip to Austria in 2013, I took a drop-in waltz class at the Rueff Dance School in downtown Vienna.

title: The Architecture of Psychotherapy
description: If you listen to psychotherapists when they talk to one another, you will often hear them speak of something called the therapeutic frame. This term, coined by the psychoanalyst Marion Milner, refers to the set of conventions and ground rules that structure the therapeutic experience. Just as the frame of a painting defines the borders of a work of art, the therapeutic frame is the container in which the therapy takes place.

title: The Art of Dissent
description: Ai Weiwei and Jacob Appelbaum are artists, journalists, dissidents, polymaths  and targets. Their respective governments, China and the United States, monitor their every move. They have been detained and interrogated. Ai cannot leave China, and Appelbaum is advised not to return to the United States. They are separated from their families. Ai has been imprisoned and beaten by the police. Yet each continues his work and speaks out against government wrongdoing.

title: The Art of Dissent
description: Laura Poitras documents the dissidents Ai Weiwei and Jacob Appelbaum as they collaborate on an art project.

title: Morning Agenda: HSBC Plans 50,000 Job Cuts in Global Overhaul
description: HSBC PLANS 50,000 JOB CUTS IN GLOBAL RESTRUCTURING | HSBC said Tuesday that it would cut as many as 50,000 jobs around the world and try to reduce costs by as much as $5 billion a year by 2017 as it laid out its plans to restructure its global businesses,  Chad Bray reports in DealBook. About 25,000 jobs will be lost through the sale of the banks businesses in Turkey and Brazil, and an additional 20,000 to 25,000 jobs will be eliminated as part of the restructuring. However, the bank is increasingly focusing on Asia, saying that it would expand its asset management and insurance operations in hopes of capturing expected opportunities from emerging wealth in the region. The bank also plans to increase its business in the Pearl River Delta in the southern Chinese province of Guangdong and in parts of Southeast Asia.

title: Digital Media Solidarity!
G.E. to Sell Buyout Financing Business for $12 Billion
description: General Electric said on Tuesday that it had agreed to sell the bulk of a division that finances leveraged buyouts to the Canada Pension Plan Investment Board in a $12 billion deal.

title: Weekly News Quiz | June 2-8, 2015
description: Have you been following the news?

title: Early and Often
description: With a mere 17 months to go before Election Day, its not too early to start issuing clich alerts. Weve warned in the past about such perennial favorites as war chest, battleground, pivot and narrative, and no doubt well see our share of those in coming months.

title: How Would Ulysses Be Received Today?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. When James Joyces Ulysses was first published in 1922, it was banned for obscenity and the U.S. Postal Service burned copies. This week, in honor of Bloomsday on June 16, Charles McGrath and Rivka Galchen discuss how the book would be received if it were published for the first time today.

title: Perfectly Reasonable Question: The Ethics of Using Opposition Research
description: The Times reported last week that Senator Marco Rubio, a prominent member of the throng vying for the Republican presidential nomination, had a number of traffic tickets. His wife had even more.

title: Deutsche Bank Headquarters in Frankfurt Are Searched by Prosecutors
description: FRANKFURT  German authorities searched offices at Deutsche Bank headquarters in Frankfurt on Tuesday and seized documents, the bank said.

title: The Chutzpah Caucus
description: Sen. John Thune is coming in for quite a lot of ridicule for this:

title: Remembering Marie-Louise Carven, a Creator of Contemporary Fashion
description: Marie-Louise Carven, the woman who founded the house of Carven and shaped French fashion in the postwar years, died in Paris on Monday at age 105.

title: A Fathers Letter to Argentina

title: The Party of Fiscal Responsibility in Action
description: One of the greatest confidence tricks ever pulled in American politics was the way Republicans managed, for a while anyway, to convince centrists that they were apostles of fiscal responsibility. Paul Ryan presented budgets that combined huge tax cuts for the rich with not quite as huge benefit cuts for the poor, added some magic asterisks  basically deficit-increasing redistribution from the have-nots to the haves, with added fraudulence  and received awards for fiscal responsibility.

title: Growing Body of Law Allows Prosecution of Foreign Citizens on U.S. Soil
description: Arrested in Djibouti while he was en route to Yemen from Somalia, far from his home in Britain, Madhi Hashi was baffled to find himself jailed in Manhattan.

description: The odd, unconventional beauty of todays most successful models is largely the result of the vision of one woman. Meet the industrys in-demand casting director.

title: The Presidential Candidate List Gets Longer: 366 and Growing
description: If it seems as if new candidates are announcing their presidential runs every day, well, thats because they are.

title: Readers Turn: The Elite Bloat of Frequent Fliers
description: Each Tuesday, The Upshots newsletter will feature a selection of comments from an article that resonated with our readers in the past week.

title: Al Qaeda Tries a New Tactic to Keep Power: Sharing It
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  After they routed the army in southern Yemen, fighters from Al Qaeda stormed into the city of Al Mukalla, seizing government buildings, releasing jihadists from prison and stealing millions of dollars from the central bank.

title: With Affordable Space, New Jersey Lures Food Businesses
description: BURLINGTON, N.J.  Juniors might make the quintessential New York cheesecake, but its owner, Alan Rosen, has quickly learned that baking it in suburban New Jersey is much easier.

title: Hope Solo Is a Hero on the Field. Repeat, on the Field.
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba

title: British Investigator Hired by Glaxo Is Freed From China Prison
description: SHANGHAI  Peter Humphrey, a British private investigator who was detained two years ago while working for the pharmaceutical giant GlaxoSmithKline, was released from prison on Tuesday with seven months to go in a two-and-a-half-year sentence, according to friends and family members.

title: Apple Announces Streaming Music Service
description: Apples chief executive, Timothy D. Cook, and its head of software and internet services, Eddy Cue, announced the companys new music streaming service on Monday in San Francisco.

title: On Set | Edie Campbell
description: The 24-year old British model believes inner beauty absolutely shines through  and plans to join the 27 club.

title: South Korean Leader Postpones U.S. Trip Amid MERS Outbreak
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Park Geun-hye, the embattled South Korean president, has decided to postpone a summit meeting with President Obama in Washington that had been planned for next week, her office said on Wednesday.

title: 1915: No U.S. Goods Sent to Germany
description: LONDON  A Government analysis just published in Washington of Americas foreign trade in April, cables the New York correspondent of the Daily Telegraph, shows that the exports to the United Kingdom in that month were valued $94,000,000. Not a cents worth went to Germany. In April last year, however, the exports to that country were valued at $18,000,000. This is the first time that the Government has reported that for the whole month no goods, no copper, no resin, no cotton  nothing whatever  went to Germany from the United States.  The New York Herald, European Edition, June 10, 1915

title: A Glimpse Inside North Korea
description: A collection of objects photographed by David Guttenfelder

title: Kindergartens Ringing the Bell for Play Inside the Classroom
description: PASADENA, Md.  Mucking around with sand and water. Playing Candy Land or Chutes and Ladders. Cooking pretend meals in a child-size kitchen. Dancing on the rug, building with blocks and painting on easels.

title: 1965: Astronaut Reflects on Mission
description: ABOARD THE U.S.S. WASP  Astronaut Edward White said today [June 9] that he had no sensation of fear when he began his walk in space. One of three sailors invited to lunch with Maj. White told reporters that Maj. White also said the gun he used to maneuver himself in space was quite effective.

title: Fashionable Specs
description: How glasses fashion has changed.

title: G.M. Chief Flatly Dismisses a Merger Overture From Fiat Chrysler
description: DETROIT  Mary T. Barra, the chief executive of General Motors, on Tuesday firmly rejected the idea that the company could benefit from a combination with a rival automaker like Fiat Chrysler Automobiles, which tried in March to start merger talks with G.M.

title: New Jerseys Top Court Rules Christie Can Skip Pension Payments
description: New Jerseys highest court ruled on Tuesday that Gov. Chris Christie could skip the pension payments he promised to make in the signature law of his tenure, averting a huge fiscal crisis just weeks before the state closes its books for the year.

title: The Star and the Creator of Witnesses on Their New French TV Thriller
description: In what world does a police officer run after a suspect, weapon drawn, in kitten heels? Why, in France, of course  at least in the France of Herv Hadmar, the director and creator, with Marc Herpoux, of the Gallic thriller Witnesses. The six-part crime drama is available for streaming on iTunes, Amazon and Netflix. Its eerie with a hint of the supernatural, wrote Neil Genzlinger of The New York Times. And paced just right.

title: 2 Motorcyclists Found Guilty in 2013 Attack on Driver but Acquitted of Top Charge
description: An undercover New York police detective and another man were found guilty on Tuesday of assault for being part of a group of motorcyclists who dragged a driver from his car in Upper Manhattan and beat him in front of his wife and baby daughter.

title: La Jeune Rue Project, and Its Founder, Slide Toward Failure in Paris
description: PARIS  It was supposed to become the hot new destination in Paris: an epicurean village in one of the citys trendiest districts, run by a team of international designers and chefs offering upscale, ethical cuisine in an ultrachic setting.

title: Belgium Commemorates Waterloo With a Coin, and France Is Not Pleased
description: LONDON  Perhaps befitting a battle that ended French hegemony in Europe, Paris, it seems, has been outflanked once again.

title: Daily Report: Apple Unveils Music Service and Software Upgrades
description: Apple showed on Monday that it knows how to grab attention even while playing catch-up, Brian X. Chen writes.

title: Obamas Corporate Tax Blunder
description: YOU probably havent heard of the BEPS project  but you soon will. Short for Base Erosion and Profit Shifting, the BEPS Project is the focus of a rapidly moving effort by the Group of 20 countries to create a new set of international tax principles designed to better capture tax revenue from multinational companies like Apple, Google and Starbucks.

title: Vincent T. Bugliosi, Manson Prosecutor and True-Crime Author, Dies at 80
description: Vincent T. Bugliosi, who successfully prosecuted the cult leader Charles Manson and several acolytes for the savage murders of the actress Sharon Tate and six other people in August 1969, then became a best-selling writer of true-crime books, died on Saturday in Los Angeles. He was 80.

title: Considering a Second Foster Child
description: I recognize the number that lights up the screen of my phone. Someone from my foster care agency is calling.

title: Pia Sundhage of Sweden Is a Coach at Home on the Move
description: LINKOPING, Sweden  When Pia Sundhage left the United States womens soccer team in 2012 to become the coach of Swedens national team, U.S. Soccers news release said she was returning home to pursue opportunities. Most news media reports highlighted how she could not turn down the opportunity to lead her homelands team. Even Sundhage mentioned this notion of a homecoming to the American players when she told them the news, before serenading them with Leaving on a Jet Plane.

title: Mission Chinese Food
description: Danny Bowiens new menu on the Lower East Side features more varied and less fiery dishes.

title: Restaurant Review: Mission Chinese Food on the Lower East Side
description: When it appeared on Orchard Street in 2012, Mission Chinese Food was slightly unreal. It didnt seem to follow the rules, or even know that there were rules. The health department and other city agencies knew, though, and after just 18 months, they pulled the plug on Danny Bowiens hallucinatory all-ages chile-pepper party.

title: Work on a West Bank Site Gives Rise to Suspicions
description: NEAR EL AROUB REFUGEE CAMP, West Bank  The old stone compound set amid Palestinian farmland between the cities of Bethlehem and Hebron has a relatively new fence.

title: For Jeb Bush, a Tepid Media Reception to European Trip
description: Jeb Bushs Europe trip is intended to help bolster his foreign policy credentials for American voters, but in the countries he is visiting  Germany, Poland and Estonia  the visit appears to be making few headlines.

title: Arcadia Britannica: A Modern British Folklore Portrait
description: Images from the photographer Henry Bournes new book.

title: Sweet Briar Colleges Closing Temporarily Blocked by Virginia Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON  A plan to close Sweet Briar College, a 114-year-old womens college in Virginia, ran into an obstacle Tuesday at the State Supreme Court, which raised questions about whether administrators have the authority to shut the college and declared the legal fight far from over.

title: 1964 | Homosexuals Proud of Deviancy
description: David W. Dunlap is a Metro reporter and writes the Building Blocks column. He has worked at The Times for 40 years.

title: Train Safety Changes Ordered After Amtrak and Metro-North Accidents
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Railroad Administration on Tuesday issued a safety advisory for passenger railroads in the wake of two major accidents that killed more than a dozen people and injured hundreds more.

description: HSBC keeps going back in time.

title: Federal Panel Backs Approval of New Drug to Fight Heart Attacks
description: An expert group recommended on Tuesday that the Food and Drug Administration approve a powerful new drug to protect against heart attacks. If approved, it would be the first in a major new class of medicines in a generation that significantly lower levels of cholesterol, the leading cause of heart disease.

title: Some of the Sharpest Knives in the Drawer
description: Bernard Capulong, the editor in chief of the mens goods site Everydaycarry.com, selects a few of his favorite pocketknives.

description: Like everything else with the LightSail spacecraft, the picture did not come easily.

description: In recent years, office-bound urban men have adopted the accouterments of their free-range rural brethren: the beard, the flannel shirt, the work boot.

description: With ten Republicans already officially in the race, and five more likely to enter, are we looking at the biggest primary slate in recent memory? The answer turns out to be complicated.

description: WASHINGTON  A federal court on Tuesday dismissed a lawsuit by the nations largest coal companies and 14 coal-producing states that sought to block one of President Obamas signature climate change policies.

description: WILLSBORO, N.Y.  A dayslong manhunt for two escaped killers prompted a burst of police activity on Tuesday as investigators combed acres of remote, swampy terrain about 35 miles from the prison where the men had been incarcerated.

title: The Face
description: Eleven women who define whats beautiful now.

title: ISIS Stages Attacks in Iraq and Libya, Despite U.S. Airstrikes
description: CAIRO  Islamic State militants staged attacks near Baghdad and the Libyan city of Surt on Tuesday, underscoring the groups persistent strength on both fronts despite a monthslong American-led air campaign against it in Syria and Iraq.

title: Robert Gibbs Opts for a Burger and Fries With New McDonalds Job
description: Robert Gibbs, the former press secretary for President Obama, has traded the White House mess hallfor the McDonalds lunchroom.

title: The Mouths of Babes
description: Alani Santos, age 11, has been preaching since she was 3.

title: Science Fails to See Benefits of Eating Placenta
description: Some believe eating human placenta  raw, cooked, or dried out, pulverized and encapsulated  has health benefits. But a review of the handful of studies on the subject has found no evidence that eating placenta is good for you.

title: A Return to Play
description: School districts are again embracing play as a bedrock of kindergarten, Motoko Rich writes in The New York Times. Read more.

title: Top U.S. Military Official Seeks to Assure Israel on Security
description: TEL AVIV  The Obama administration on Tuesday increased its efforts to ease Israels opposition to a possible nuclear deal with Iran, as the top American military leader assured Israeli officials that the United States would further strengthen Israels arsenal of arms, warplanes and cybertechnology.

title: If Youre a Betting Man, Its Time to Start Believing Donald Trump
description: Politicians lie, but bettors have a habit of ferreting out the truth. And this is why my article this morning noted that it would be harder for politicians to evade the fund-raising limits that apply to candidates if we relied on prediction markets rather than lawyers to assess whether a politician was running for office.

title: Tony Ourslers Paranormal Possessions
description: For the past 20 years, the pioneering video artist has amassed a trove of occult ephemera in his Manhattan home and studio: a deck of extrasensory perception cards, spirit photos (among them, a portrait of the former first lady Mary Todd Lincoln and her late husbands alleged ghost), a gun-shaped film projector from a 40s magic act and tons of ectoplasmic goop. Next month, the artist will release a 600-page book that brings his entire collection together in one place, and he will debut an immersive 3D film with actors playing Arthur Conan Doyle, Harry Houdini and the mystic Margery Crandon. He cryptically calls the video project, which will screen throughout the international photography festival Les Rencontres dArles, his return to narrative.

title: The Least Worst Crisis
description: I was, I think, one of the first commentators to notice that a funny thing was happening in Iceland: the nation that was supposed to be Ground Zero for financial disaster was actually having a milder crisis than many others, thanks to heterodox policies  debt repudiation, capital controls, and massive devaluation. Now, as Matthew Yglesias points out, Iceland is getting ready to lift the controls, and its experience still looks remarkably good considering the circumstances.

title: The Least Worst Crisis
description: I was, I think, one of the first commentators to notice that a funny thing was happening in Iceland: the nation that was supposed to be Ground Zero for financial disaster was actually having a milder crisis than many others, thanks to heterodox policies  debt repudiation, capital controls, and massive devaluation. Now, as Matthew Yglesias points out, Iceland is getting ready to lift the controls, and its experience still looks remarkably good considering the circumstances.

title: Obama on Healthcare Reform
description: The president spoke about health insurance changes during the Catholic Hospital Association Conference in Washington.

description: The 23-year old transgender model recalls coming to terms with her distinct (and undeniable) beauty.

title: Vincent Musetto, 74, Dies; Wrote Headless Headline of Ageless Fame
description: Vincent Musetto, a retired editor at The New York Post who wrote the most anatomically evocative headline in the history of American journalism  HEADLESS BODY IN TOPLESS BAR  died on Tuesday in the Bronx. He was 74.

description: WASHINGTON  The White House briefing room was evacuated Tuesday afternoon during the televised daily session with reporters after the Washington police received a bomb threat by telephone, Secret Service officials said.

title: American Billionaire Makes Risky Bet on Greece Debt Deal
description: FRANKFURT  The contrarian American billionaire Wilbur L. Ross Jr. made a bundle betting on the Irish banking system when it was down and out, and a similar wager on Cyprus now looks promising. But Greece may prove to be the toughest test yet of his knack for cashing in on eurozone crisis spots.

title: Jeb Bush, on European Tour, Opens by Rebuking Putin
description: BERLIN  Jeb Bush on Tuesday delivered a forceful rebuke of President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia in a city once sundered by Soviet aggression, calling him a ruthless pragmatist, demanding the isolation of the countrys corrupt leadership and vowing to reassert American primacy in the fight to contain Russias territorial ambitions.

title: Rikers Island and the Death of Kalief Browder
description: The Justice Department and the City of New York are expected to reach an agreement this month on a reform plan that is intended to end the barbaric abuses that have long dominated the Rikers Island jail complex.

title: Details About the Indictment of Dennis Hastert
description: CHICAGO  On Tuesday, J. Dennis Hastert, a former Illinois congressman, appeared in federal court in Chicago to plead not guilty to charges that he structured cash withdrawals from banks to avoid detection and then lied to federal investigators about it. Mr. Hastert used the money to pay a former student  known only as Individual A  to not disclose that Mr. Hastert had sexually abused him decades ago, people briefed on the federal investigation have said.

title: On Set | Amber Valletta
description: The 41-year old model discusses her definition of beauty  and wants women to rule the world.

title: Group Asks Court to Order Arrest of Cleveland Officers in Tamir Rice Case
description: More than six months after a Cleveland police officer fatally shot a 12-year-old boy, community leaders and activists on Tuesday made an unusual bid to bypass the usual legal process by directly petitioning a court to file criminal charges and order the arrest of the officer and his partner.

title: Con Edison and New York City Are Faulted in East Harlem Explosion
description: WASHINGTON  An explosion in East Harlem that killed eight people last year would not have happened if two of Consolidated Edisons gas pipes had been welded together properly, federal regulators said on Tuesday.

title: First Draft Focus:  Secret Service Evacuates White House
Steven A. Cohen Was Buyer of Giacomettis Pointing Man, for $141 Million
description: The bidder who won Alberto Giacomettis Lhomme au doigt (Pointing Man) for $141.3 million (including fees) from an auction at Christies last month was the hedge fund billionaire Steven A. Cohen, according to two people with knowledge of the sale.

title: What Excites and Inspires Santiago Calatrava
description: Santiago Calatrava is suddenly everywhere in New York. After much delay and even more expense, the World Trade Center transit hub (and shopping concourse) is slowly being revealed to the public, as are new PATH train platforms designed by the Spanish architect. Using one of his favorite words, the new spaces are indeed monumental  open and airy, a radical transformation of space in an area of the city that can often feel closed-in and tightly confined.

title: What Excites and Inspires Santiago Calatrava
description: Santiago Calatrava is suddenly everywhere in New York. After much delay and even more expense, the World Trade Center transit hub (and shopping concourse) is slowly being revealed to the public, as are new PATH train platforms designed by the Spanish architect. Using one of his favorite words, the new spaces are indeed monumental  open and airy, a radical transformation of space in an area of the city that can often feel closed-in and tightly confined.

title: Einkorn Risotto Is a Long Time Coming
description: There are a lot of reasons to love einkorn, one of the latest ancient grains to hit the shelves in markets. Its a wheat berry like farro and spelt, but its softer and cooks in less time, especially if you soak it. The flavor is sweet and nutty, the texture chewy but yielding.

title: Voldemort Is More Popular Than Jeb Bush
description: The Terminator, Darth Vader and the shark from Jaws all have higher favorability ratings than any of 13 candidates and likely candidates for president. And Voldemort has a higher rating than six Republicans, including Jeb Bush. Thats what Christopher Ingraham of Wonkblog found when he compared polling data on the presidential hopefuls with Google Consumer Survey results on the fictional characters.

title: Corporations Open Up About Political Spending
description: In November 1999, Time Warner swore off soft money contributions to political campaigns. At the time, it might have seemed like a mistake. The company was about to join with America Online in a deal that would require approval from federal regulators. Yet Gerald M. Levin, Time Warners chairman, argued that soft money not only distorted American politics, it sullied the company as well.

title: Belgium Unveils New 2.50 Euro Coin
description: Johan Van Overtveldt, the Belgian finance minister, spoke on Monday about the minting  even after Frances opposition  of a new 2.50 coin that commemorates the Battle of Waterloo.

title: Canadian Senators Expenses Under Investigation After Auditors Report
description: OTTAWA  By global corruption standards, the amounts are relatively tiny: only about 840,000 Canadian dollars in questionable claims, spread over two years and 30 senators.

title: Etsy Shares Rise on Back of Tiger Global Stake
description: Shares of Etsy on Tuesday received a healthy boost from a newly disclosed investment by Tiger Global Management  but it was barely enough to bring the stock back to its initial public offering levels.

title: U.S. General Affirms Support for Israel
description: Gen. Martin E. Dempsey, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, accepted an award from his Israeli counterpart and emphasized the American militarys strong relationship with Israel.

title: The Modern Face of British Folklore is Sure to Make You Smile (Maybe Giggle)
description: The British love of dressing up takes a weird and wondrous turn in the latest book from the photographer and T contributor Henry Bourne. Arcadia Britannica: A Modern British Folklore Portrait ($30, out June 16 from Thames & Hudson) was shot in the style of Irving Penns Small Trades, capturing a sample of some of the 700 folklore traditions played out across the country every year. The origin of these strange and spectacular events, with characters that include Straw Bears and Horn Dancers and Pearly Queens, is often blurry. Yet when capturedby Bournes lens, one thing is abundantly clear: Much like fancy dress at Halloween, modern folk is fun. Why else would a Scottish graphic designer choose to cover himself in over 10,000 thistles in the bizarre tradition of the Burry Man?

title: School of Rock Plans Fall Opening on Broadway
description: May we have the attention of the class, please: School of Rock will indeed be in session on Broadway this fall. The Andrew Lloyd Webber musical adaptation of the 2003 Jack Black comedy has now solidified its Broadway plans, and is to begin previews at the Winter Garden Theater on Nov. 9 with its opening night scheduled for Dec. 6, its press representatives said Tuesday.

title: TED Reconsiders Policy Barring Kids From Conferences
description: Speakers at TED conferences are known for instigating change. But attendees can, too.

description: David Venable, QVCs top food pitchman, sold more than $250 million worth of books and kitchen equipment last year alone.

title: QVCs David Venable: The Man Who Helps America Cook
description: WEST CHESTER, Pa.  Consider the power of David Venable, a towering Southerner with a helmet of brown hair who moons over cookware on television.

title: Community Leaders Demand Arrests
description: Local leaders asked a judge to issue arrest warrants for two Cleveland policemen involved in the 2014 fatal shooting of 12-year-old Tamir Rice.

title: Jeb Bushs Team Files Paperwork for Entering Race
description: Jeb Bushs team has taken another step leading to his all-but-certain presidential campaign, filing legal papers Tuesday preparing the groundwork for his expected entrance into the race next week.

title: Court Upholds Texas Limits on Abortions
description: WACO, Tex.  A federal appellate court upheld some of the toughest provisions of a Texas abortion law on Tuesday, putting about half of the states remaining abortion clinics at risk of permanently shutting their doors and leaving the nations second-most populous state with fewer than a dozen clinics across its more than 267,000 square miles. There were 41 when the law was passed.

title: On Set | Amilna Estevao
description: The 16-year old Angolan model, featured on the cover of Ts Summer 2015 Beauty Issue, reflects on her first runway show season  and favorite school subjects. (Hint: not mathematics.)

description: For the last four years, the asset-management giant BlackRock has dominated exchange-traded funds, the fastest-growing segment of the mutual fund industry.

title: Natalia Osipova, Injured, Withdraws From  Romeo and Don Quixote
description: One of the worlds most celebrated ballerinas, Natalia Osipova, has withdrawn from several performances in the United States as she recovers after an injury that she sustained last month while dancing the title role in Giselle with American Ballet Theater at the Metropolitan Opera House.

title: A Green Future for Blue Hawaii, Maybe
description: Gov. David Ige of Hawaii on Monday signed a bill to put his state on a path to total energy independence within 30 years. If this is for real, the state would go from being overwhelmingly dependent on imported oil to being a fossil-fuel-free paradise, powered by wind, sun, waves, tides, magma and whatever other energy sources the engineers come up with. Algae, maybe, or sunscreen.

title: The Last of the Angola 3 Gets Released  Almost [Updated]
description: After spending more than four decades alone in a 6-by-9-foot prison cell  possibly the longest anyone has endured that punishment in American history  Albert Woodfox could be forgiven for being skeptical at the prospect of his release, which a federal judge ordered on Monday.

title: Amid MERS Outbreak, Readers Reflect on South Korean Hospitals
description: As South Korea struggles to contain an outbreak of Middle East respiratory syndrome that has infected close to 100 people, the countrys health care system has come under scrutiny. Experts have said that the MERS outbreak may have been fueled by  a hospital system that encourages family members to take on nursing duties, reported Choe Sang-Hun, a New York Times correspondent based in Seoul.

title: Dance This Week: A Classic Beauty, Non-Virtuoso Dance and Ailey Returns
description: My greetings to dancegoers.

title: Tunnels, Disguises and Sewers: Clinton Prisons Inmates Have Found Many Ways to Flee
description: In summer 1903, a former bank burglar serving a life sentence removed the last bit of earth from a tunnel that had taken him four years to complete and escaped with three other inmates under the walls of Clinton prison in far northern New York State. Almost three decades later, it was a diminutive prisoner that some newspapers called the midget bandit who fled the prison in a similar way.

title: Review: In Be More Chill, a Nerd Finds Popularity in a Sci-Fi Pill
description: RED BANK, N.J.  Teenage angst: the grief that just keeps on giving, to popular culture, at least. The woes of the misfit and the wallflower, the snooty brutishness of the jocks and the mean girls have been a bottomless well of material for television, movies and books for decades, and the well shows no signs of running dry.

title: In Odd Mom Out, Mining the Upper East Side for Comedy Gold
description: Most people refer to the neighborhood where Jill Kargman lives with her husband and three children as the Upper East Side.

title: Review: Award-Winning Short Films From Sundance
description: Anthologies offer short films an escape from the festival circuit and a chance to show regular moviegoers the rewards of discipline and constraint  even when their titles, like 2015 Sundance Film Festival Award-Winning Shorts,  reveal neither attribute.

title: De Blasio Administration Wants High-Sodium Warnings on Menus
description: New York City has banned trans fats at restaurants, posted calorie counts on menus and tried, unsuccessfully, to limit the size of sodas.

title: A Conversation With John C. Santora
description: Mr. Santora, 58, is the chief executive for North America at Cushman & Wakefield, the commercial real estate companys largest operating region. A 37-year veteran of C&W, Mr. Santora served in numerous positions, including as president and chief executive of the companys Corporate Occupier and Investor Services group.

title: What You Get for  $2,400,000
description: This weeks homes include a contemporary in Seattle, a Victorian in New Orleans and a midcentury modern in Colorado.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Sometimes, Even Women Need a Smoothly Shaved Face
description: Kate Somerville, a celebrity facialist whose long list of Hollywood clients includes Jessica Alba and Debra Messing, has a beauty secret that many women would prefer to keep secret.

title: A Shave and a Facial: Five Steps
description: Susanne Schmaling, the director of education for Associated Skin Care Professionals, a trade group, recommends that women wax facial hair because it pulls up roots to keep skin smooth longer  but not when using anti-aging products with retinols.

title: Filth Found in Airline Food Operations at Los Angeles Airport
description: WASHINGTON  A federal inspector on a routine visit to food service facilities at Los Angeles International Airport in January found conditions that, she wrote, could compromise the safety of food meant for airline passengers.

description: The controversy surrounding Brian Williams has provided an opening for Mr. Lack to return to the place where he enjoyed the peak of his career, NBCs news division.

description: By all appearances, Andrew Lacks return to the top job at NBC News has gone smoothly.

title: A Minimalist Film Score From an Indie-Rock Heavyweight
description: It was very low-conflict, says Daniel Rossen, the musician responsible for the band Grizzly Bears lush guitar arrangements and occasional vocals, who also records as Department of Eagles and under his own name. Hes talking about his first time scoring a film, Valedictorian, which was directed by his old NYU friend Matthew Yeager. Back in the day, the pair worked together at a store in the West Village that specialized in cinema classics and foreign film, in the city thats long gone, as Rossen puts it. Rossen and Yeager bonded over understated films and music, an aesthetic that would later inform their own art. In film and music, I think we prefer a much subtler approach, Rossen explains. Thats evident in both Valedictorian itself, a poetic film about a young man detaching from his social and work landscape in New York City, and its sparkling, guitar-driven soundtrack, which streams exclusively here.

description: Some of President Obamas statements about the American strategy to confront ISIS and its effectiveness.

title: Global Index May Add Chinese Stocks, Fueling Investment
description: HONG KONG  Chinese stocks do not really need an extra boost. They have tripled in value over the last year to nearly $10 trillion  overtaking Japan, Hong Kong and Britain and coming in second only to the United States.

description: WASHINGTON  Washington is thinking hard about thesharing economythese days.

description: The strongest proof that Svetlana Alliluyeva was Joseph Stalins daughter is that this small, demure-looking redhead scared people  and not just because her face and coloring so resembled her fathers.

description: The incorporated village of about six square miles, 30 miles from Manhattan, has well-regarded schools and expansive homes.

description: VERDEN, Germany  Felix Kolb wears socks and sandals, and the occasional hoodie, around the office. It is the uniform of someone working in the countercultural tradition of German political activism but employing the digital tools of contemporary grass-roots movements.

description: LONDON  James Kinsella is an unlikely champion for European technology.

title: Carla Krbes Grandly Bows Out of Pacific Northwest Ballet
description: SEATTLE  All ballet companies become like families in their internal dynamics; in my experience, however, none gather dancers and audience together with the intimacy of Pacific Northwest Ballet. Almost every performance has a preshow educational talk and a postshow conversation with one or more individual dancers (most questions are from the audience), and each season ends with a gala-like occasion honoring each departing performer. I was here on Sunday night to watch the farewell performance of Carla Krbes, one of the most marvelous ballerinas of our day. But that occasion proved to be about more than one dancer.

title: Apple Music and Labels Investigated in 2 States
description: While Apple was preparing a splashy introduction for a new service that would stream music over the Internet for a fee, the attorneys general of New York and Connecticut were quietly investigating the Silicon Valley giants negotiations with music companies in search of potential antitrust violations.

description: Confusing and inaccurate advertising about reverse mortgages persists despite recent efforts to curtail it, a new report finds, so potential borrowers should be wary.

description: As White House press secretary, Robert Gibbs was the public face of a powerful operation with a global reach. Now he is becoming the chief spokesman for another kind of global enterprise: McDonalds.

title: Los Angeles Police Officers Acted Improperly in Ezell Ford Shooting, Civilian Board Says
description: LOS ANGELES  One of the two police officers involved in the shooting death in August of Ezell Ford, an unarmed, mentally ill black man, behaved improperly throughout the confrontation, and the other was unjustified in drawing his weapon in one instance, a civilian oversight committee for the Los Angeles Police Department ruled Tuesday.

title: U.S. Embracing a New Approach on Battling ISIS in Iraq
description: WASHINGTON  In a major shift of focus in the battle against the Islamic State, the Obama administration is planning to establish a new military base in Anbar Province and send 400 American military trainers to help Iraqi forces retake the city of Ramadi.

title: SOCO Oil Company Paid Large Sums to Officer in Congo, Activists Say
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  When a British oil company began prospecting for oil in  Africas oldest national park, drawing worldwide concern and inspiring an Oscar-nominated documentary last year, the company was adamant in denying any wrongdoing.

title: Sales to Mahan Air Blacklisted by U.S. Hang Over Iran Talks
description: In the shadow of the final weeks of nuclear talks, Iran and the United States appeared headed on Tuesday toward a possible confrontation over the recent purchase of nine used Airbus jetliners by Mahan Air, an Iranian airline blacklisted under American sanctions more than three years ago.

title: Matthew Dellavedova Isnt First Aussie to Charm Cleveland
description: CLEVELAND  The surprising emergence of Matthew Dellavedova, the Cavaliers unsung point guard from Maryborough, Australia, has charmed this city during the N.B.A. playoffs. As unlikely as it may seem, Cleveland has embraced an Aussie underdog athlete before  just look back 116 years to find him.

title: Rebels Seize Syrian Army Base in a Blow to Assad
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Insurgents seized a major army base in the southern Syrian province of Daraa on Tuesday, the latest in a series of blows to government forces. But the victory was claimed this time by one of the few remaining rebel groups not dominated by hard-line Islamists.

title: $663 Million in Penalties for Maker of Guardrail
description: A Texas federal judge handed down a $663 million judgment Tuesday against Trinity Industries, the guardrail maker accused of producing a faulty product that can jam and spear through vehicles.

title: Wall St. Courts Start-Ups It Once May Have Ignored
description: On the first day of a hackathon at the Manhattan headquarters of Goldman Sachs, participants from the Wall Street bank showed up in suits. The programmers from Kensho, a start-up that had recently gotten money from Goldman, were there in jeans and ripped shirts.

title: Burden Unites the Cleveland Stars Jim Brown and LeBron James
description: On Dec. 27, 1964, Jim Brown asked the Cleveland Browns coaches to leave the teams locker room. Brown had something he wanted to say to his teammates before they all took the field against the favored Baltimore Colts in the N.F.L. championship game.

title: Trauma Suit to Include Deposition From Gary Bettman
description: N.H.L. Commissioner Gary Bettman will be deposed next month by lawyers representing the former players who have accused the league of hiding the dangers of repeated head trauma and promoting violence on the ice.

title: Hermann Zapf, 96, Dies; Designer Whose Letters Are Found Everywhere
description: Hermann Zapf, whose calling in life  to create beautiful letters, as one of his students put it  found expression in lush, steady-handed calligraphy and in subtly inventive typefaces that have brought words to readers on paper, on signposts, on monuments and on computer screens for more than half a century, died on Thursday at his home in Darmstadt, Germany. He was 96.

title: Giants Chris Heston Pitches No-Hitter Against Mets
description: There was euphoria in the visitors clubhouse, of a kind not experienced in Queens since 1969. The evidence sat in the garbage: boxes and boxes of empty packages of Budweiser beer.

title: High Bridge Reopens After More Than 40 Years
description: It was not built to give New Yorkers expansive views of the Harlem River or a pedestrian shortcut between the Bronx and Manhattan. Rather, the monumental structure that is known as the High Bridge and echoes a Roman aqueduct opened in 1848 to bring fresh water from Westchester County to a booming young city.

title: Scorers Have Been Silent, but Blackhawks Remain Confident
description: CHICAGO  During Jonathan Toewss first N.H.L. postseason in 2009, the Blackhawks lost the opening game of their Western Conference semifinal against Vancouver.

title: Greece: U.N. Warns That Migrants May Overwhelm Tourist Island of Lesbos
description: United Nations officials expressed deepening concern on Tuesday about record numbers of desperate refugees from Syria, Iraq and Afghanistan arriving on the Greek island of Lesbos, a short boat ride from the Turkish coast. Adrian Edwards, a spokesman for the United Nations refugee agency in Geneva, said that roughly 600 refugees a day were arriving in the Greek islands, and that half of them were coming ashore in Lesbos, a picturesque tourist destination ill equipped to handle the flow. The Lesbos arrivals have grown steadily by the month, from 737 in January to more than 7,200 in May. Mr. Edwards said the arrivals, crammed into rubber dinghies and wooden boats, were straining the islands capacity, services and resources. They are part of a broader exodus of people from the Middle East and Africa fleeing war and deprivations in their home countries for risky and sometimes deadly Mediterranean trips to Europe, which has created a crisis for the European Union. The refugee agency said there had been 103,000 refugee and migrant arrivals in Europe via the Mediterranean so far in 2015.

title: Muhammad Wilkerson Shows Up, Without New Deal From Jets
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Muhammad Wilkerson, a prized defensive end who missed voluntary off-season workouts to protest the lack of progress toward a new contract, returned to the Jets on Tuesday for the start of a mandatory three-day minicamp. He emphasized that the issue was not behind him.

title: Questions of Cost in Plan to Aid Defrauded Students
description: The Department of Educations announcement Monday of new debt-relief measures for defrauded former students of Corinthian Colleges, a large for-profit education company that is now in bankruptcy, raised a host of questions about how broadly those provisions would apply, what students would have to do to have their loans forgiven, and how large the ultimate cost to taxpayers might be.

title: Try For a Brass Ring
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Are you dizzy yet? Tracy Grays crossword turns and spins, and you may have needed to pin it down in order to solve it successfully.

title: Review: Cuddles, Not Your Typical Vampire Drama, Opens at 59E59
description: Cuddles is an absurdly cute title for the sensational little shocker that opened at 59E59 Theaters on Tuesday night as part of their annual Brits Off Broadway series. This, er, bloodcurdling vampire drama, written by the young playwright Joseph Wilde, makes most movies, books or plays about the famously undead, however gory, seem like sweet little bedtime stories.

title: Italy: Doctor Abducted in Libya Is Freed
description: Italian officials say an Italian doctor kidnapped in Libya in January has been freed. An official at the Foreign Ministry said Tuesday that the doctor, Ignazio Scaravilli, was in good condition in Tripoli, awaiting his return to Italy. The official, speaking on the condition of anonymity because he was not authorized to provide details, said the Libyan authorities in Tripoli had helped with the release. Dr. Scaravilli was kidnapped Jan. 6.

title: Review: Pontus Lidberg Dance, a Swirl of Choreography and Even Puppets at the Joyce Theater
description: Pontus Lidberg choreographs in loops and swirls. On Saturday at the Joyce Theater, this Swedish choreographer and filmmaker offered two impressions of his intimate, emotional vision in companion pieces. Bodies ripple up and down from the floor, partnerships dissolve with a meaningful pause and swooping turns in one direction are usually followed by the same thing in another.

title: Have Turkish Voters Made Themselves Heard?
De Blasio Puts Allies on Panel Hearing Circumcision Plan
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio has installed numerous allies on the New York City Board of Health as his administration prepares to present a controversial plan that would ease the rules on a circumcision ritual linked to herpes infections in infants.

title: Therapy Dog Helps Woman Testify at Assailants Sentencing Hearing
description: Wrenching as it was, the scene was not an uncommon one at a sentencing hearing inside a Brooklyn courtroom on Tuesday. A 30-year-old woman was describing the horrific ordeal she and her 5-year-old daughter endured for five months in 2012, bound by duct tape, assaulted and hidden away from the outside world.

title: Pentagon Anti-Bias Policy Extended to Gays
description: The Pentagon has extended its equal opportunity policy to gay and lesbian troops, granting them an added layer of protection from discrimination and harassment, Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter said Tuesday at a gay and lesbian pride event at the Pentagon. But he, along with the rest of the Pentagons leadership, remained silent on the fate of transgender troops, who can still be forced out of the military because of their gender identity. The announcement was another step toward the acceptance of gay and lesbian troops, who could have been expelled from the military because of their sexual orientation until the repeal of the dont ask, dont tell policy in 2011. Extending equal opportunity protections to gay and lesbian troops ensures the military treats sexual-orientation-based discrimination the same way it treats discrimination based on race, religion, color, sex, age and national origin, Mr. Carter said.

title: Colorado: 3 Are Removed From Theater Murder Jury
description: Three jury members were dismissed Tuesday from the murder trial of the gunman who opened fire inside an Aurora, Colo., movie theater because of concerns they had been tainted by hearing or discussing news reports about the case during breaks from the trial. One dismissed juror said in court that her husband had called her to ask about reports of an errant Twitter message the district attorney in the case sent last week. Judge Carlos A. Samour Jr. had reprimanded the district attorney, George Brauchler, for his message outside the presence of the jury. The judge has warned jurors dozens of times not to discuss the death-penalty case or read about it, and to tell him if they accidentally hear any of its details outside the courtroom. Twelve jurors and nine alternates remain on the panel.

title: Eliciting Memories, Nationals Draft Mariano Riveras Son
description: In Game 5 of the 2001 World Series, Matt Williams was asked to bunt against Mariano Rivera, one of baseballs indomitable closers. In a few years, Williams could be managing Riveras son.

description: The Hamiltons seemed to make for an enviable family.

title: Hope Fades That Albany Will Take Up M.T.A.s Capital Budget This Session
description: As New York State lawmakers enter the final days of the legislative session in Albany with several pressing issues to resolve, one topic appears to be off the agenda: the Metropolitan Transportation Authority.

title: Michelle Obama Urges Chicago Graduates to Transcend a Tragedy
description: CHICAGO  They left an empty chair for Hadiya Pendleton draped in purple, her favorite color, with flowers sitting on top. They presented her family with a cap and gown and a class ring. And even as they mourned her absence, they celebrated her spirit and their own resilience in overcoming her loss.

title: New York City Council to Vote on Bill to Protect Carwash Workers
description: For years, labor leaders and advocates for employees toiling at New York Citys 200 carwashes have been in a battle with the owners of the businesses over wages and working conditions, including the right to join a union.

title: Questionable Expenses by Lawmakers in Other Countries
description: The financial irregularities of the Canadian Senate, revealed on Tuesday in an audit of the expense reports of 116 current and former senators, are prosaic in comparison to the lowlights of other such scandals worldwide.

description: The Chelsea-style gallery depends on a certain blueprint. White walls. Hushed contemplation. Chic austerity.

title: Masahiro Tanaka Flashes Form and Substance in Yankees Win
description: Give or take an inch, a few pounds and two or three miles per hour on their fastballs, Masahiro Tanaka and Max Scherzer are aesthetic equals.

description: Do I Have to Keep a Secret About a Family Members Health?

title: Czech Republic Coach Resigns
description: Vladimir Ruzicka, the Czech Republic ice hockey coach, has resigned after allegations by parents that he demanded money to give their sons a chance of playing when he was in charge of the Slavia Prague club. Ruzicka has denied any wrongdoing. (AP)

title: San Franciscos New All-Natural Boutique Isnt for Hippies
description: In certain hip neighborhoods of certain hip cities, an eco-beauty boutique is nearly as likely a sight as a single-origin coffee bar. But although green has gone mainstream, until now, many sustainability-oriented apothecaries have been more focused on niche items than necessities. That, however, is set to change with the arrival of Credo, a new natural and organic emporium whose first location has just opened on San Franciscos Fillmore Street. The brainchild of Shashi Batra, a member of the executive team that first brought Sephora to the U.S., Credo offers an experience similar to that of the LVMH-owned superstore, minus the synthetic ingredients. You may want your tomatoes farm-to-table, but I dont think you should get your eye shadow or mascara farm-to-table, Batra explains. It should be in a place where you can test it and feel good about it. It shouldnt be in bottles that look like dog shampoo. It shouldnt smell like tree sap. It has to deliver on all those levels.

title: At the New York Botanical Garden, Jenny Holzer Channels Frida Kahlo
description: Im getting a free drink for using other peoples writing! marveled the artist Jenny Holzer earlier this week, ahead of a dinner last night at the New York Botanical Garden. The occasion served a double purpose for the artist, who was honored by the Poetry Society of America and also premiered a new program of text projections, which will continue to scroll over the glass walls of the gardens exhibition hall starting at dusk each day through Saturday.

title: Black Swimsuits
description: Because every woman should own a simple maillot.

description: apostate  \-ps-tat, -tt\  adjective and noun

title: Whats On TV Wednesday
description: 11 A.M. (IFC) INTOLERABLE CRUELTY (2003) George Clooney plays Miles Massey, the crme de la crme of divorce lawyers, in this Joel and Ethan Coen film. Catherine Zeta-Jones, above with Mr. Clooney, is Marylin, a silken beauty and Miless latest client, who becomes mired in a vicious divorce after she catches her husband (Edward Herrmann) cheating yet again. Billy Bob Thornton is her millionaire beau and Miless rival for her money-hungry affections. The Coens, bless their hearts, are too smart to apologize for avarice  its what gave screwball comedies a kick, and sends this movie straight to your head, Elvis Mitchell wrote in The New York Times. Keep in mind that its only a minor rush, but a rush nonetheless. It has a Jell-O-shot smoothness that makes you a little dizzy afterward in recollecting how assured and unremittingly smart Intolerable Cruelty is. In Fantastic Mr. Fox (2009), at 1:15 p.m., Mr. Clooney, Meryl Streep, Jason Schwartzman and Bill Murray lend their voices to this animated tale from Wes Anderson, adapted with Noah Baumbach from the Roald Dahl anti-fable about a fox who rallies his animal friends against three evil farmers. It is precisely the movie that a child smitten with Roald Dahls fiction and fascinated by the enigmas of the adult world would dream of making: something to amaze and terrify the grown-ups and win the envy and adulation of his peers, A. O. Scott wrote in The Times.

title: Survey Points to Challenges NATO Faces Over Russia
description: WASHINGTON  As NATO faces a resurgent Russian military, a substantial number of Europeans do not believe that their own countries should rush to defend an ally against attack, according to a comprehensive survey to be made public on Wednesday.

title: How to Beat the Bots
description: So heres an interesting statistic from a 2014 labor survey by burning-glass.com: 65 percent of new job postings for executive secretaries and executive assistants now call for a bachelors degree, but only 19 percent of those currently employed in these roles have a B.A. So four-fifths of secretaries today would not be considered for two-thirds of the job postings in their own field because they do not have a four-year degree to do the job they are already doing! The study noted that an increasing number of job seekers face being shut out of middle-skill, middle-class occupations by employers rising demand for a bachelors degree as a job-qualifying badge  even though it may be irrelevant, or in no way capture someones true capabilities, or where perhaps two quick online courses would be sufficient.

title: Lets Help Create More Farmers
description: Just about everyone agrees that we need more farmers. Currently, nearly 30 percent are 65 or older, and fewer than 10 percent are under 35. The number of farmers is likely to fall further with continuing consolidation and technological innovation.

title: Who Gets to Go to the Pool?
description: IN a 1948 speech to fellow Dixiecrats, Strom Thurmond famously declared that the entire United States Army couldnt force white Southerners to allow black people into our theaters, into our swimming pools, into our homes, and into our churches.

title: Help for Victims of College Fraud
description: Education Secretary Arne Duncans decision to forgive the federal loans of tens of thousands of students who attended Corinthian Colleges will provide relief for those who were seduced into taking on debt in exchange for degrees and certificates that turned out to be useless.

title: Saving Affordable Health Insurance
description: The Affordable Care Act, which has helped millions of people get health care, is now fully woven into the nations social fabric. As President Obama said Tuesday, there is something deeply cynical about the ceaseless, endless, partisan attempts to roll back the progress already made.

description: The California Senates passage of the End of Life Option Act last week, which would allow terminally ill people to choose to end their lives, filled me with both joy and sadness.
