description: We dont yet have a complete strategy, President Obama told a news conference on Monday at the conclusion of a G-7 meeting in Germany.

title: What Apples Tim Cook Overlooked in His Defense of Privacy
description: Timothy D. Cook, Apples chief executive, delivered a speech last week that raised some eyebrows in the technology industry.

title: Aftermath of Bombing in Egypts Luxor
description: Security officials on Wednesday surveyed the scene of a suicide bombing near Egypts ancient Karnak temple in the city of Luxor.

title: Jrme Valcke, a Top FIFA Official, Says He Authorized $10 Million Transfer
description: SAMARA, Russia  The secretary general of FIFA on Wednesday said that he had authorized a $10 million transfer at the heart of a bribery scandal involving soccers governing body, but he maintained that he had done nothing wrong.

title: Pope Creates Tribunal for Bishop Negligence in Child Sexual Abuse Cases
description: ROME  Pope Francis has approved the creation of a Vatican tribunal for judging bishops accused of covering up or failing to act in cases of child sexual abuse by priests, an unprecedented step long demanded by victims in the more than three decades that the Roman Catholic Church has publicly dealt with the abuse scandal.

title: Fading Slide Show
description: Fading slide show for homepage art spot.

title: A Guide to Reading Rituals
description: Agreed: We need to do more than just help children learn to read we need to help them learn to love reading and make reading a habit, even a craving. But in many schools  unintentionally, tragically  a kind of creeping police state emerges around reading. Its not enough for some teachers to tell children to read for, say, 20 minutes or half an hour each night. Many children must report back with a reading log in which they record not just the titles and authors of the books theyve read, but also the number of minutes spent reading and pages read. Never mind that this exercise turns something private and immeasurable into a piece of data. Isnt it teaching, above all, the art of the fudge?

title: Pakistani Mans Brother on Execution
description: Shehzad Bahadur spoke after the execution of his brother, Aftab Bahadur, a Pakistani man who was sentenced to death for murder in 1992 at the age of 15.

title: Rikers Island Officers Are Charged in 2012 Death of Inmate
description: Federal prosecutors in Manhattan announced on Wednesday that one current and two former correction officers at Rikers Island have been charged in connection with the 2012 beating death of a 52-year-old inmate and a conspiracy to make it appear that the use of force was warranted.

title: LeBron Jamess Dominance in N.B.A. Finals Is Historic
description: How dominant has LeBron James been for the Cleveland Cavaliers? You can make a good case that he is the most crucial player to a team in N.B.A. finals history.

title: Embattled Burundi President Sets New Dates for Elections
description: BUJUMBURA, Burundi  President Pierre Nkurunziza declared new dates for disputed elections in Burundi, state radio announced on Tuesday, continuing a battle with opposition parties that has upended the nation for weeks.

title: Graffiti Art Replaces Paris Padlocks
description: A work by eL Seed, a French-Tunisian artist, has been chosen to adorn a Paris bridge that had its love locks removed by city authorities because of safety concerns.

title: A Graceful Midcentury Armchair by Gio Ponti
description: While he may be best known for the harmonica-like Pirelli Tower and the perfectly simple Superleggera chair, the midcentury design giant Gio Ponti was also a master of more organic and sensuous forms. His favorite commission was Villa Planchart, situated above Caracas, a building made for the life of its inhabitants, which he filled with silks, jades and orchids. The building, he wrote, must have the grace and lightness of a resting butterfly. The same could be said of the armchair he made for the villa in 1954, which hovers on slender legs, its arms swooping like wings. (An all-white version floated in the entrance; one with a plush green cushion perched in the living room.) Now in production by the Italian design house Molteni & C, the D.154.2 chair is an immediate and understated classic  a manifestation of Pontis twin ideals of harmony and joy.

title: New York City to End Contract With Rikers Health Care Provider
description: New York City officials have known for years about serious problems with Corizon Health Inc., the for-profit company that oversees medical care at the Rikers Island jail complex.

title: Lincoln Tunnel Bus Collision Injures at Least 31, Snarling Traffic
description: In the end, the crash turned out to be not too serious  a bus ran into the back of another bus. No one was seriously injured. But it was the timing and, more significantly, the location of the accident that quickly elevated it into a much bigger deal.

title: Neck-Deep in Ways to Knot a Mans Tie
description: Neckties dont have to be a ball and chain. Try one of the 177,000 knots you may not know about.

title: Increasingly Frequent Call on Baltic Sea: The Russian Navy Is Back
description: KLAIPEDA, Lithuania  The Emanuel, a 90-foot trawler, has what is supposed to be a humdrum job, plying a 30-mile stretch of the Baltic Sea to make sure vessels do not snag their anchors on a pair of electricity cables recently installed on the seabed.

title: In Jordan, an Ancient Roman City Awaits Visitors
description: Gerasa remains empty as many of the foreigners who do come to Jordan are aid workers, journalists and refugees, drawn by the very turmoil that keeps tourists away.

title: Department of Investigations Report on Rikers Island Health Provider
description: A report released Wednesday by the citys Department of Investigation concludes that Corizon Health Inc., the contractor that runs health care at Rikers Island, repeatedly failed to screen and supervise its employees. The report also concluded that the two city agencies that were charged with overseeing Corizon failed their most basic responsibilities.

title: Spotify Sells 1.4% Stake for $115 Million
description: Spotify has added $115 million to its war chest as it prepares to compete with Apple for dominance of the music streaming market.

title: Conflicts in Syria and Region Take Toll on Jordans Tourism
description: JERASH, Jordan  The tour guides sat in a dusty white trailer a few steps from the main gate, drinking thick black coffee and smoking. There were 42 of them, ready to show a visitor around a world-renowned archaeological site in any of nine languages. But even though it was a sunny spring day, there was no work for 38 of them.

title: Cubas Web Entrepreneurs Search for U.S. Clients, and Reliable Wi-Fi
description: MEXICO CITY  At his parents cramped house in Havana, Yondainer Gutirrez builds apps and websites on a makeshift computer that runs on pirated software. He has no Internet access there, so he rents time on other peoples connections to send his work to clients in France, Britain, Canada and the rest of Latin America.

title: 183 Questions for Writing or Discussion
description: For six years, we have posted a fresh Student Opinion question nearly every weekday. Every June, just as we do with that years lesson plans, we round them all up and post them in one place.

title: Officers Responding to Bronx Dispute Fatally Shoot Armed Man
description: Behind the bedroom door, the police said, a woman screamed for help.

title: Manuel Camacho Sols, Once on Path to Mexican Presidency, Dies at 69
description: MEXICO CITY  Manuel Camacho Sols, who was once the heir apparent to the Mexican presidency and a central player in a politically turbulent time in Mexico  as it dealt with an Indian uprising, an assassination and economic collapse, all in 1994  died on Friday at his home here. He was 69.

title: 1965: U.S. Suffers Wars Worst Loss
description: SAIGON  A Viet Cong force of 1,500 today [June 10] overran a district capital and Special Forces camp 60 miles north of Saigon, inflicting the heaviest toll of U.S. combat casualties of the war. At least 27 Americans as well as hundreds of South Vietnamese were killed, wounded or missing, after a day-long battle at Dong Xoai in which the guerrillas routed the government defenders and then mowed down their reinforcements with a curtain of machine-gun fire. There were conflicting reports on the U.S. casualty breakdown. The number of dead ranged from a State Department report in Washington of seven dead and 13 wounded to an official Saigon report of eight dead, ten missing and 13 wounded.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, June 11, 1965

title: Shop Locally, Download Globally
New Hampshire Republicans Urge Networks to Alter Debate Criteria
description: Republicans in New Hampshire are urging Fox News and party leaders to reconsider its plans to limit participation in presidential debates based on performance in polls.

title: Pope Urges Putin to Make a Great Effort to Resolve the Crisis in Ukraine
description: ROME  Barely two days after Europes most powerful leaders presented a common front on Russian sanctions, President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia swept into Italy on Wednesday, a pointed reminder that European unity against him is fragile and that efforts to isolate him have brought only mixed success.

title: Jeb Bush Calls Putin a Bully
description: Jeb Bush, a former governor of Florida, said that the United States and its allies need to be more resolute in responding to President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.

title: Eclectic and Personal, A Dtacher Outfits a Niche Audience
description: Monika Kowalska was born in Poland and moved to Baltimore at age 9, when she imagined herself becoming an airline pilot. Instead, she grew up to be a designer and professional magpie, founding a company that combined her clothing line with objects collected on her travels.

title: Library of Congress Chief Retires Under Fire
description: WASHINGTON  James H. Billington, a leading Russia scholar in 1987 when President Ronald Reagan nominated him to be the 13th librarian of Congress, will step down from his post on Jan. 1 after nearly three decades leading the worlds largest library, officials announced Wednesday.

title: States and Congress Urged to Act if Justices Rule Against Health Law
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administrations top health care official said Wednesday that if the Supreme Court stopped the payment of health insurance subsidies to millions of Americans, it would be up to Congress and state officials to devise a solution.

title: I Left My Noodle on Ramen Street
description: The musician Devendra Banharts new book combines his art with musings and conversations.

title: Eyeing 2016, G.O.P Embraces Digital Strategies, but Doubts Persist
description: WASHINGTON  The criticism after the 2012 presidential election was swift and harsh: Democrats were light years ahead of Republicans when it came to digital strategy and tactics, and Republicans had serious work to do on the technology front if they ever hoped to win back the White House.

title: Bikers Jailed After Waco Shootout Deride High Bonds and Slow Justice
description: WACO, Tex.  Matthew A. Clendennen, one of the nearly 180 bikers who were jailed after the deadly shootout here last month among rival biker gangs and the police, said he had one weapon on him during the melee  a pocketknife with a two-inch blade that was a Christmas gift from his parents that he uses as a screwdriver and box cutter at work.

title: Disunion: The Final Q & A
description: In April 2011, the editors of Disunion, The New York Timess series on the Civil War, convened a panel of historians to mark the 150th anniversary of the Confederate assault on Fort Sumter and the onset of the four-year conflict. Before a sold-out audience at the Times Center in New York City, the panelists  David Blight, Ken Burns, Adam Goodheart and Jamie Malanowski  discussed the origins of the conflict, the role of slavery and the immense challenges facing a still-new president.

title: Johnny Isakson, Georgia Senator, Says He Has Parkinsons
description: Senator Johnny Isakson, a Republican from Georgia, said on Wednesday that he has been receiving treatment for Parkinsons disease, but added that the illness will not prevent him from seeking re-election next year.

title: N.B.A. Finals: Cavaliers Supporting Cast Has Been Overlooked
description: This series was supposed to be over. The second it was announced that Kyrie Irving would miss the remainder of the N.B.A. finals with a broken kneecap, the sporting world appeared to agree that the already favored Golden State Warriors had been handed the teams first championship since 1975.

title: Raven-Symon to Join ABCs The View as Newest Co-Host
description: ABCs morning show The View has found a new co-host in the former child star Raven-Symon. Shell join the show immediately, the network announced Wednesday.

title: Nashville Council Rejects $100 Million Flood-Protection Plan
description: ATLANTA  The Metro Council in Nashville rejected a contentious $100 million flood-protection proposal Tuesday night that had been criticized for focusing on the downtown area at the expense of other, lower-profile neighborhoods in the Tennessee capital. The proposal had been heavily promoted by Mayor Karl Dean.

title: Caitlyn Jenner and the American Religion
description: Ive seen a few people quoting this Will Wilkinson essaylet on Caitlyn/Bruce and American Christianity, and it deserves to be quoted:

title: E.P.A. Takes Step to Cut Emissions From Planes
description: The Obama administration said on Wednesday that it would take the first step toward regulating greenhouse gas emissions from airplanes, but it acknowledged it would most likely take years before stringent standards are enacted.

title: Speakers That Make You the Life of the Pool Party
description: APPLES original iPod redefined how we carry and listen to our music. But its utility really took off with the introduction of amplified speaker devices that turned an iPod into a portable stereo.

title: Wisconsin Labor Protests
description: Demonstrators fight a right-to-work bill at the State Capitol.

title: At Ohio Festival, a Tale of the Duct Tape
description: It calls itself the Duct Tape Capital of the World, and for good reason: Avon, Ohio, about a half-hour west of Cleveland, draws more than 60,000 duct tape enthusiasts annually from across the globe. The city, home to Duck brand duct tape, celebrates the shiny, sticky utility material each Fathers Day weekend with the Avon Heritage Duck Tape Festival, scheduled this year for June 19 to 21.

title: A New Video Starring the Sultry Chanteuse Sophie Auster  Four Times
description: [Watch the video on Vimeo.]

title: FIFAs Valcke on $10 Million Transfer
description: Jrme Valcke, the secretary general of FIFA, on Wednesday dismissed allegations of wrongdoing over $10 million in bank transactions at a news conference in Samara, Russia.

title: British Government Begins Sale of Remaining Royal Mail Stake
description: LONDON  The British government said on Wednesday that it had begun the process of selling its remaining stake in the Royal Mail, which went public less than two years ago.

title: DNA Deciphers Roots of Modern Europeans
description: For centuries, archaeologists have reconstructed the early history of Europe by digging up ancient settlements and examining the items that their inhabitants left behind. More recently, researchers have been scrutinizing something even more revealing than pots, chariots and swords: DNA.

title: Dope Revisits the Hood, With Joy and Wit
description: When Shameik Moore got the part of Malcolm, the soft guy in a tough world at the heart of the film Dope, he had a problem.

title: Airlines Want Your Carry-On Bags to Be Smaller
description: The future of your favorite carry-on bag may be precarious. At its annual summit in Miami Tuesday, the International Air Transport Association suggested a new standard for carry-on luggage to be stowed in overhead bins, and its not getting larger.

title: Hotels Offer Luxury Shopping Inside Your Rooms
description: Luxury hotels are increasingly partnering with high-end retailers to give guests insider shopping experiences and perks. Many of these collaborations are at properties in New York.

title: Review: Jonathan Strange & Mr Norrell, a Battlefield Where Magic Is the Weapon of Choice
description: When the Duke of Wellington meets Jonathan Strange, the magician sent to the Continent from England to help him defeat Napoleon, he is not impressed. What I chiefly require, sir, is more artillery and more men, he barks at Strange. Can you make them appear? Unable to fill the generals request, Strange offers instead to make it rain.

title: Michelle Obama Talks About Race and Success, and Makes It Personal
description: CHICAGO  She looked around and saw herself three decades ago, young and uncertain, from a part of town where success is a struggle, not a birthright. She knew what they had been through, what it was like to take the long way home to avoid gangs, what it was like when the family strained to make ends meet.

title: Kurds Have Bigger Prize in Mind After Political Gains in Turkey
description: ISTANBUL  Late into the night on Sunday on the shattered streets of Kobani, the Syrian Kurdish city devastated last year by battles with militants affiliated with the Islamic State, residents celebrated the outcome of the recent Turkish parliamentary election, honking horns, cheering and firing their guns.

title: Visa Signature: Experience Miami
description: Miamis secret wonders sizzle during a couples retreat to the Delano South Beach. A room upgrade, thanks to Visa Signature, begins a trip mixing Cuban mystique with modern flair.

title: Tokio Marine Learns Lessons in Value Destruction
description: Tokio Marine may at last be learning some valuable lessons about value destruction.

title: Bernie Sanders Denies Internet Claim on Dual Israeli Citizenship
description: Senator Bernie Sanders declared in a radio interview on Wednesday that I do not have dual citizenship with Israel, batting away an incorrect assertion that has cropped up on the Internet.

title: Tony Awards Telecast Draws Fire From Dramatists Guild
description: The Dramatists Guild of America, unhappy that honors for writers and composers were given off-air during the Tony Awards ceremony on Sunday, is urging its broadcast network CBS to reconsider next year.

title: 36 Hours in Zagreb
description: On this interactive Google map, explore street view and find things to do in Zagreb.

title: 36 Hours in Zagreb
description: Jazzy lounges, bistros and chic ateliers abound in newly popular Zagreb, but this Slavic metropolis still retains plenty of cobbled-street charm.

title: Trailers for 'Dope' and Other Movies in the Hood
description: Dope is an answer to, a repudiation of, a reconciliation with the streetwise black cinema of the early 1990s, films like Juice, Boyz N the Hood, Menace II Society and more.

title: 36 Hours in Zagreb, Croatia
description: For years, Zagreb, Croatias chief city, was a layover on the way to the countrys island-studded coast. No more. Tourism had shot up more than 20 percent from 2011 to 2013, when Croatia joined the European Union. Accompanying that rise is a raft of modernized and recently built lodgings, including some three dozen hostels  important additions to the towns once-inadequate accommodation scene. For those who fell in love with Zagreb, population 790,000, before its surge in popularity, fear not. Though the town has rejiggered its offerings with jazzy lounges, bistros and chic clothes-designer ateliers, this Slavic metropolis along the Sava River still retains plenty of cobbled-street charm.

title: Billingtons Letter to President Obama
description: James Hadley Billington will step down from his post on Jan. 1 after nearly three decades leading the worlds largest library.

title: Michelle Obama on Overcoming Hardship
description: A selection of clips from the first ladys recent speeches to young people around the country.

title: In Washington Speech, Chris Christie Sounds as if Hes Ready to Run
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey told reporters on Tuesday that his family was completely supportive of a potential presidential run; his decision hinged on his will to do it.

title: More Play or More Academics for Kindergarten?
description: If youve watched a succession of siblings go through kindergarten, you may have noticed that things have changed, and are still changing. As Motoko Rich writes in Kindergartens Ringing the Bell for Play Inside the Classroom, after a national movement toward more academics in that first year of school, many kindergartens are bringing back play: sand tables, blocks, easels, toy kitchens.

title: Review: Aaron Diehls Space Time Continuum Is a Jubilant New Album
description: AARON DIEHL

title: Moog Music Gives Employees More Control
description: At the Moog synthesizer factory in Asheville, N.C., on Tuesday, Michael Adams, the companys owner and chief executive, wanted to share some life-changing news with the entire staff.

title: Review: In ROBOT, Machines Perform With Humans at BAM
description: Theres an old vaudeville adage cautioning adult performers against sharing a stage with children or animals. The warning needs an update: Never do a show with adorable toddler-size robots.

title: 1963: Timothy Learys Long, Strange Trip
description: This feature looks at some of the earliest mentions of famous names or terms in The Times. Have an idea for someone or something you would like to read about? Leave a suggestion in the comments section.

title: Jenny Diskis End Notes
description: Last July, when the English writer Jenny Diski was told she had inoperable lung cancer and, at best, another three years to live, she responded to the news characteristically  that is, in wry poor taste. So, she said, turning to her husband, the poet and academic Ian Patterson, wed better get cooking the meth. The Poet  as Diski always refers to Patterson, with tender-ironic reserve, in her personal essays  was just about able to keep up his end of the morbid repartee that is the currency of their marriage: This time we quit while the goings good. The oncologist and the nurse, apparently not watchers of Breaking Bad, looked on blankly.

title: Fountains of Youth
description: There are all sorts of magical creams and serums that promise tighter skin and fewer lines, but a new fad in cosmetics suggests that turning back the clock can be as simple as sipping a drink. The Beauty Chefs Collagen Inner Beauty Boost mixes the wrinkle smoother with superfoods such as goji berries and acai berries. Beauty & Gos grape-flavored Radiance drink is meant to improve elasticity with hyaluronic acid. For the follically challenged, theres Fountains Hair Molecule, a silicon and biotin liquid that can be taken alone or mixed with a morning smoothie to produce extra strength and shine. The most too-good-to-be-true of the bunch comes in a six-pack: Precious, a collagen-infused beer from the Japanese brewery Suntory, is aimed at women who desire a healthy  and perhaps tipsy  glow.

title: Elizabeth Warren Calls Out Education Department Over Student Loans
description: Senator Elizabeth Warren took the Department of Education to task on Wednesday for what she called a lack of transparency and failure to protect students from dangerous student loan servicers and for-profit colleges.

title: Britain Expects Initial Losses as It Prepares to Sell Its R.B.S. Stake
description: LONDON  The British government is ready to exit the banking business, even if it means that it will record a loss on some of its holdings.

title: Pathologist Didnt Break Law in Missing-Brain Autopsy Case, Court Finds
description: The facts of the case were, at the very least, disturbing.

title: On Tortuous Road to Freedom, Angola Three Inmate Bides His Time
description: NEW ORLEANS  Albert Woodfox has been close to the outside before, but rarely this close.

title: Simple Life Among the Hutterites
description: Tim Smith was looking for a day picture when a quick glimpse of Hutterite women led him to pursue a project about their simple, communal life.

title: Law Firm a Casualty of a Takeover Battle
description: Mylans defensive fight against its unwanted suitor, Teva Pharmaceutical Industries, has claimed an unusual casualty: a big corporate law firm that has advised both drug makers.

title: Texas Officer Was Under Stress When He Arrived at Pool Party, Lawyer Says
description: HOUSTON  The police officer in McKinney, Tex., who resigned after a cellphone video was circulated showing him shoving a black teenager in a bikini to the ground outside a pool party offered an apology Wednesday through his lawyer, who tried to explain the officers actions by saying that he was under stress after responding to two earlier calls involving a suicide and a suicide attempt.

title: Vatican City Welcomes Putin
description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia arrived at the Vatican for a meeting with Pope Francis.

title: Pictures of the Day: Syria, Chile and Elsewhere
description: West Bank, Turkey and Elsewhere  Pictures of the Day

title: Review: Nabokov in America and Reaping Inspiration From Amber Waves
description: His private tragedy, Vladimir Nabokov once declared, was that I had to abandon my natural idiom, my untrammeled, rich, and infinitely docile Russian tongue for a second-rate brand of English, devoid of any of those apparatuses  the baffling mirror, the black velvet backdrop, the implied associations and traditions  which the native illusionist, frac-tails flying, can magically use to transcend the heritage his own way.

title: Jenny Holzer at the New York Botanical Garden
description: The artist created new work to coincide with the gardens exhibition Frida Kahlo: Art, Garden, Life.

title: Copa Amrica Set to Begin Under a Cloud of Corruption Allegations
description: SANTIAGO, Chile  Just outside the gates to the field where Chiles national mens soccer team prepared for Thursdays opening game of the Copa Amrica, Cecilia Amaya, a second-grade teacher here, handed out small slips of paper bearing a list of demands.

title: An Art Book from Devendra Banhart thats as Eclectic as the Man Himself
description: Devendra Banhart is exactly the sort of person for whom the term multihyphenate was coined. Though hes attained a measure of mainstream notoriety as a musician, his undergraduate degree is in the visual arts, and for the last 15 or so years he has been steadily building, and occasionally exhibiting, a parallel body of work around drawings, paintings and, more recently, photography. When you dedicate enough time to anything, Banhart explains, if the motives arent 100 percent egoic, then some things start to come to fruition.

title: Judge Rejects Claim for a Pissarro by Heirs in Nazi Art Case
description: A federal judge in Los Angeles has declined to order the return of an Impressionist painting to the relatives of a Jewish woman who was forced to sell the work for $360 to a Nazi art appraiser in 1939.

title: Video Feature: Frame Shops for Phone Photos
description: Smartphones have turned us all into photographers. Now with the help of some apps, we can also be photo artists, framing our snaps and making collages.

title: Review: Pantis High Heels in Low Places Delivers Identity Politics in Stilettos
description: Strolling in stiletto heels amid the audience members, Panti gauged the crowd packed into the little auditorium at the Irish Arts Center. Then she gave a warning: Anyone seeking inspiring words of wisdom from her show would leave disappointed.

title: Hillary Clintons Hard Choice: Her First Instagram Post
description: Hillary Rodham Clintons first post on Instagram isnt a picture of her on the campaign trail or of supporters gathered at a house party. Its a play on her memoir, Hard Choices.

title: Derek Lam Resort 2016
description: Looks from the collection.

title: June 10, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Turkey, the West Bank, Chile and Mongolia.

title: June 10, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Turkey, the West Bank, Chile and Mongolia.

title: Florence and the Machine Have First No. 1 Album
description: When Florence and the Machine, the British rock group led by the flame-haired, siren-voiced Florence Welch, released its latest album, How Big, How Blue, How Beautiful, the bands record company made its ambition clear: it would settle for nothing less than No. 1.

title: Profiting From New Markets
description: Small companies have to be especially nimble in spotting and taking advantage of market shifts, and this week, Sarah Max delves into how one online jeweler introduced a new service that became an instant hit. Its a great example of how scrappy start-ups are changing the way business is done in large, traditional industries.

title: Tempest in Central Park
description: Public Theater hosts annual gala at Delacorte Theater.

title: Video Review: With the Sorento, Kia Moves to the Top Shelf
description: REMEMBER when Kia was all about cheap generic economy cars? Today, its design team is led by former Audi and Cadillac rock stars (Peter Schreyer and Tom Kearns ), and among its most popular vehicles are the family-size Optima and Sorento.

title: Driven | 2016 Kia Sorento SX Limited
description: Kia ditches bargain basement pricing for something better: a crossover with broad appeal.

title: Review: Afghanistan, Zimbabwe, America, Kuwait, as Grim as It Is Cryptic
description: A pair of American soldiers manning a remote desert outpost find themselves unraveling under the pressure of heat, hunger, boredom and anxiety in Afghanistan, Zimbabwe, America, Kuwait, a new play written and directed by Daniel Talbott at the Gym at Judson. As grim as it is cryptic  it is never clear where exactly we are, or even if one of the titular countries is involved  the play gains some force from the intense performances of its cast, led by a particularly captivating Seth Numrich as the jumpier of the soldiers.

title: Supporting Structure for Arthur Ashe Roof Is Completed
description: Officials from the United States Tennis Association talked about 5,000 tons of steel, 1,700 structural beams, 115,000 three-pound bolts and three massive cranes Wednesday.

title: J. Crew Flounders in Fashions Shifting Tides
description: Wendy Sherman peered into the J. Crew store at the Mall at Short Hills, and frowned.

title: Andrew Miller Headed to D.L.; Yankees Lose to Nationals
description: Andrew Miller, standing in front of his locker, took a swig of red Gatorade and braced for the impending swarm of reporters.

title: Brain Tumors Genetic Makeup Critical in Treatment, Research Finds
description: Doctors can more effectively treat many brain tumors by first ascertaining their genetic characteristics, rather than studying tissue samples under a microscope, the standard practice, two teams of researchers reported on Wednesday.

title: More U.S. Troops to Be Deployed to Iraq
description: The White House press secretary, Josh Earnest, discussed the reasons for sending up to 450 more advisers to Iraq to aid in the fight against ISIS.

title: J. Crew Struggles With Its Great Man Dilemma
description: J. Crew, Michelle Obamas sometime clothing retailer, is yet another struggling private equity buyout. J. Crews owners, TPG Capital and Leonard Green & Partners, are stuck, tied to the bargain they struck with the companys chief executive, Millard S. Drexler. Call it the great man problem.

title: Behind the Burden of Bail: Reporters Notebook
description: Most news stories begin long before they capture the reporters attention, and they go on for long afterward. But sometimes the reporter is paying attention before a story comes to fruition.

title: Review: The Concept of Dust Features Yvonne Rainers Eclecticism
description: The dancer-choreographer Yvonne Rainer became a historic figure in the 1960s. Then she was a pioneering figure of that nebulous genre that was later labeled postmodern dance. Today you cant get far in understanding that area of dance experimentalism without considering either the 1965 manifesto in which she announced No to spectacle. No to virtuosity. No to transformations and magic and make-believe (and more) or the 1966 solo dance Trio A, in which her matter-of-fact delivery and elaborately pedestrian vocabulary became a radical classic.

title: Elie Saab Resort 2016
description: Looks from the collection.

title: The Human Rights Watch Film Festival Explores Social Justice
description: The compelling documentaries that open and close this years Human Rights Watch Film Festival, which begins on Thursday, are valuable, coolheaded explorations of Americas racially charged climate. In an atmosphere poisoned by fear, mistrust and inflammatory rhetoric, the films provide calm, reasoned assessments of roiling tensions that are not about to subside. These and other serious documentaries are all the more welcome because they arrive at the start of Hollywoods silly season, when the pickings are slim for thoughtful films about thorny issues. Many of these selections have been shown in previous festivals, but the agglomeration of so many hard-hitting films speaks for itself.

title: Chris Black, a Digital Tastemaker for Young Men
description: Age 32

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Review: On Sites The Barber of Seville Unfolds in a Surprising Setting
description: A charming episode in The Barber of Seville seemed so familiar, and yet not. Count Almaviva, having fallen for Rosina, the ward of the jealous Dr. Bartolo, sings a melting serenade to this pretty young woman from the courtyard outside her balcony.

title: To Shop and Surf in Rockaway Beach
description: Plus: Off-the-shoulder tops that are a more romantic way to show skin than cutouts; white poplin shirts inspired by an origami artist and playful jewelry to layer on for a burst of color.

title: Apology and Rationale for Officers Acts
description: Jane Bishkin, the lawyer for former Cpl. Eric Casebolt, said he regretted his conduct in the pool party incident in McKinney, Tex., and outlined the stress he was under from previous cases.

title: Senate Shows Support for Export-Import Bank
description: The Senate made it loud and clear on Wednesday that a bipartisan majority wants the Export-Import Bank to survive past June 30, when the federal agencys authorization expires.

title: Jeb Bushs Learning Curve on Russia
description: Few world leaders are easier to criticize these days than President Vladimir Putin of Russia. There can be no defense of his decision to annex Crimea, worsen Ukraines civil war by sending troops and weapons to the eastern region and threaten nuclear responses if NATO tries to deter his aggression.

title: College Rape Prevention Program Proves a Rare Success
description: A program that trained first-year female college students to avoid rape substantially lowered their risk of being sexually assaulted, a rare success against a problem that has been resistant to many prevention efforts, researchers reported Wednesday.

title: A Sampling of Work by a Wave of New Illustrators
description: Coloring clothes in delightful ways.

title: Hackers Go After Little Fish, Too, While Trawling for Credit Cards
description: Hackers are going local in their efforts to steal credit card information from United States customers, hitting small businesses with as much frequency as retail giants.

title: Bill Clinton Says He Will Stop Giving Paid Speeches if Hillary Wins
description: Former President Bill Clinton has made millions of dollars giving paid speeches since he left office, but he said on Wednesday that if his wife, Hillary Rodham Clinton, won the White House, he would no longer take money for talking.

title: Seeing Fashion With a Sketchpad and Markers
description: Last month, Saks Fifth Avenue held a press breakfast at its flagship store to unveil its glam gardens spring window installations, designed by beauty and fragrance brands. The guests were the usual blas mix of magazine editors, bloggers and fashion writers. And then there was Blair Breitenstein, who had an art-school tote around her shoulder and the nervous, wide-eyed, am-I-really-in-Oz? look of a fashion obsessive newly arrived in New York.

title: New Ride Services Forge Own Specialized Paths
description: When Trae Vassallos children hop in the car to head to their after-school sports practice in the San Francisco Bay Area several times a week, it is not Ms. Vassallo, a full-time working mother of three, who drives them. Nor is it her husband, a nanny or any other caregiver.

title: Tempest in Central Park
description: On Sunday, the Public Theater cleaned up at the Tony Awards, where its show Fun Home, won five of the big prizes, including best musical. On Tuesday, the the Public Theater held its annual benefit celebrating Shakespeare in the Park, with a star-studded crowd that included Jon Bon Jovi, who arrived around 6:30 p.m. See the photos, above.

title: Hows My Driving? The Insurer Knows
description: Stop? Or gun it? Those are often the competing voices running through drivers heads when they approach a yellow light.

title: A Futurist Looks at Where Cars Are Going
description: Eric Larsen heads research in society and technology at Mercedes-Benz Research and Development in Sunnyvale, Calif. Mr. Larsen, 53, who joined the carmaker in 1995, wrote his thesis for a Ph.D. in sociology at the University of Washington on the failure of innovation in the Communist world. Now he thinks about how Mercedes can sustain innovation as technology transforms luxury cars.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: Good evening! Heres the latest.

title: Start-Ups Clamor to Be the Airbnb of Boats
description: Americans own about 22 million recreational boats, and on average they use them just 11 days a year, according to the latest data from the Coast Guard.

title: Parking Apps Face Obstacles at Every Turn
description: As soon as Uber and Lyft reinvented driving, entrepreneurs cast about for the next unloved slice of the economy to upend. They found it in parking.

title: Traffic Hacking: Caution Light Is On
description: A year ago, Cesar Cerrudo flew to Washington, strolled over to Capitol Hill and pulled out his laptop. Then he began to hack the citys traffic system.

title: A Dialogue of Car and Highway
description: One peek at all the electronics under the hood is proof that todays car is as much computer as engine. Examine the larger picture, and youll see how much the stuff around cars is becoming smarter, too.

title: Britain Offers Itself as a Proving Ground
description: A nondescript industrial park in Coventry, England, two hours north of London, seems an unlikely place to find a state-of-the-art driverless car.

title: Options for Simplifying the Commute
description: In November 1974, the newly born Silicon Valley began an ill-fated dial-a-ride experiment. A phone call to a team of operators would send a bus to pick up and drop off a rider along a computer-customized route. After the 1973 oil crisis, however, the service quickly became a success disaster. The dial-a-ride, created by the Santa Clara County public transit system, groaned under a crush of 80,000 calls a day for weeks and led to busy signals, missed rides and low efficiency. Less than six months later, the service was essentially canceled.

title: Options for Simplifying the Commute
description: In November 1974, the newly born Silicon Valley began an ill-fated dial-a-ride experiment. A phone call to a team of operators would send a bus to pick up and drop off a rider along a computer-customized route. After the 1973 oil crisis, however, the service quickly became a success disaster. The dial-a-ride, created by the Santa Clara County public transit system, groaned under a crush of 80,000 calls a day for weeks and led to busy signals, missed rides and low efficiency. Less than six months later, the service was essentially canceled.

title: Tipping Point in Transit
description: One sunny morning a few weeks ago, I slipped into the inviting cockpit of a Mercedes-Benz S550 sedan, a ride equipped with massaging front seats, reclining back seats, a heads-up display worthy of a fighter jet and more speakers than a political convention. At $136,000, this was a car fit for a rap star or a European Union functionary, of which I am neither (yet).

title: Texas Ruling on Abortion Leads to Call for Clarity
description: For more than two decades, courts have struggled with a fuzzy legal standard set by the Supreme Court for judging abortion laws: When does a rule governing doctors or clinics or medical procedures become an unconstitutional undue burden on a womans right to an abortion?

title: Republicans Tie Their Favorite Causes to the Trade Agreement
description: WASHINGTON  With a final House showdown coming on Friday on President Obamas push for accelerated power to pursue a sweeping trade agreement, the vote brokering has begun  and it is all tilting to the right.

title: Shopping Events and Sales This Week in and Around New York
description: Headed east this first steamy weekend in the city? There are many new places to shop, like the Orlebar Brown beach-shack-inspired pop-up, where you will find great summer pieces like trunks printed all over with a panoramic photo of surfers riding a wave ($345). At 23 Newtown Lane, East Hampton.

title: App Smart | Instant Photo Collages
description: Several new apps make it easy and quick to create collages with your photographs.

title: New York Escapees Could Be in Vermont
description: State officials from New York and Vermont said at a news conference that the two escapees from a New York prison could be in Vermont.

title: Warning: Soda May Be Bad for Your Health, San Francisco Says
description: San Francisco could soon be the first city in the country to place health warnings on advertisements for sugary drinks.

title: Hackers May Have Obtained Names of Chinese With Ties to U.S. Government
description: WASHINGTON  Investigators say that the Chinese hackers who attacked the databases of the Office of Personnel Management may have obtained the names of Chinese relatives, friends and frequent associates of American diplomats and other government officials, information that Beijing could use for blackmail or retaliation.

title: Sidewalk Labs, a Start-Up Created by Google, Has Bold Aims to Improve City Living
description: Googles ambitions and investments have increasingly broadened beyond its digital origins in Internet search and online advertising into the arena of physical objects: self-driving cars, Internet-connected eyeglasses, smart thermostats and a biotech venture to develop life-extending treatments.

title: Player Ratings: Germany (1) vs. United States (2)
Touch of Faith
description: Alani Santos, 11, is among the thousands of child preachers in Brazil who minister to poor and working-class people through healing and prayer.

title: City Council in Arizona Votes to End Coyotes Arena Lease
description: The Arizona Coyotes stormy relationship with the city of Glendale took a downward turn Wednesday when the City Council voted to terminate its lease agreement with the team at Gila River Arena.

title: How Boko Haram Courted and Joined the Islamic State
description: Boko Haram became the largest affiliate of the Islamic State after months of strengthening its propaganda.

title: Ludvik Vaculik, Influential Czech Writer and Dissident, Dies at 88
description: Ludvik Vaculik, a leading Czech writer, dissident and intellectual, whose calls for human rights and trenchant critique of Communism helped foster a short-lived period of freedom that culminated in the Soviet invasion of Czechoslovakia in 1968, has died. He was 88.

title: Cuomo Shuts Door on Part of Mayor de Blasios Affordable Housing Plan
description: ALBANY  Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo dealt a serious blow to Mayor Bill de Blasios affordable housing plan on Wednesday, saying time had run out to amend a state program giving developers generous tax breaks in exchange for creating low-cost housing.

title: South Korean Hamlet, Under MERS Quarantine, Symbolizes Weaknesses in System
description: JANGDEOK, South Korea  No one in this tiny village of 73 households can leave. Teams of sentries, in round-the-clock shifts, block all access roads, lest any resident think about escape.

title: Libya Groups Vow to Crush Unit of ISIS
description: CAIRO  A coalition of Islamist militias in the Libyan city of Darnah has vowed to eliminate a local unit of the Islamic State, testing its strength and emphasizing the deep divisions among the countrys Islamist forces.

title: Attacks at Tourism Sites in Egypt
description: Tourism in Egypt was just beginning to recover from the slump after the Arab Spring revolution of 2011 when militants began targeting tourist sites again. Here are some notable attacks of recent years.

title: Vote Aids Deep Sea Corals in Much of Mid-Atlantic
description: The Mid-Atlantic Fishery Management Council voted Wednesday to protect deep sea corals from most bottom fishing over about 38,000 square miles of ocean, running from New York to Virginia.

title: Evan Solomon, CBC Host, Fired Over Role in Art Deals
description: OTTAWA  The Canadian Broadcasting Corporation abruptly fired the host of two prominent political programs on its television and radio networks, the latest in a series of embarrassments that have raised questions about how the government-owned broadcaster is managed.

title: EBay and PayPal Revise Their User Agreements, and Hit a Nerve
description: SAN FRANCISCO  EBay wants to celebrate its forthcoming spinoff of PayPal by calling people up and trying to sell them something.

title: N.B.A Finals: Cleveland Cavaliers Tired? They Should See the Other Guys
description: CLEVELAND  James Jones, the other player on the Cavaliers who has made five straight trips to the N.B.A. finals, contemplated the value of experience.

title: Letters to eBay and PayPal on Robocalls
description: Letters from the New York attorney general warning of changes to the terms of service that would allow so-called robocalls could be illegal.

title: Trainers Intended as Lift, but Quick Iraq Turnaround Is Unlikely
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas decision to open a new base for an additional 450 American military trainers and other personnel in Anbar Province in Iraq is designed to give a badly needed lift to the Sunni tribes and Iraqi troops who have been struggling to hold their own against the Islamic State.

title: Without Showing Games, ESPN Leaves a Mark on the N.B.A. Finals
description: The peculiar credit appears at the end of N.B.A. finals broadcasts on ABC. There is no reason for this single line to be shown publicly. The information it conveys is irrelevant to viewers and is an example of a major entertainment company speaking publicly to itself. But it tells you why N.B.A. games are carried by ABC, whose once-dominant sports division was buried long ago.

title: Horst Brandsttter, Who Introduced Playmobil, Dies at 81
description: BERLIN  Horst Brandsttter, owner of the company whose finger-high Playmobil figures can be found in playrooms around the world and who brought the Hula-Hoop to Europe in the 1950s, died on June 3. He was 81.

title: Panel Tells F.D.A. to Back Second Drug to Help Heart
description: An expert committee that advises the Food and Drug Administration recommended on Wednesday that the agency approve the second in a new class of drugs that can drive cholesterol levels down to unheard-of levels.

title: The Bold Designs of Paul Bacon
description: Paul Bacon, who designed striking book jackets for major books, is dead at 91. A sampling of his work.

title: Paul Bacon, 91, Whose Book Jackets Drew Readers and Admirers, Is Dead
description: Paul Bacon, the influential designer known for creating radical, eye-catching book jackets for major literary works like Joseph Hellers Catch-22 and Philip Roths Portnoys Complaint, died on Monday in Fishkill, N.Y. He was 91.

title: No-Hitter Is as Familiar to the San Francisco Giants as a Ring
description: Chris Heston twirled a no-hitter against the Mets on Tuesday, Matt Cain has thrown a perfect game against the Houston Astros, and Tim Lincecum has twice kept the San Diego Padres hitless.

title: Family Disputes Police Account of Bronx Mans Stun Gun Death
description: A Bronx man who died after being shocked with a Taser stun gun by a New York officer was not holding scissors or acting violently, a lawyer for the mans family said on Wednesday. The account contrasted with one provided by the police.

title: Lebanon: U.S. Puts 3 Lebanese on Blacklist Over Hezbollah Links
description: Three Lebanese men and their businesses were blacklisted by American sanctions officials on Wednesday for what they described as extensive ties with Hezbollah, the Shiite political organization in Lebanon that the United States and Israel regard as a terrorist group. The Treasury Department said the actions against the Lebanese froze any assets they might have under United States jurisdiction and prohibited Americans from doing business with them. Its statement said the actions underscore the direct ties between Hezbollahs commercial and terrorist activities, as well as the groups continued exploitation of the legitimate commercial sector for financial, organizational and material support. The targets of the actions were identified as Adham Tabaja and his company, Al-Inmaa Group for Tourism Works, and its subsidiaries; Kassem Hejeij, a businessman who arranged financial services access for Hezbollah; and Husayn Ali Faour and his company, Care Care Center, which was accused of arranging transportation for Hezbollah, which is politically aligned with the governments of Syria and Iran. Mr. Faour was identified as a member of Islamic Jihad, a Hezbollah branch.

title: Everyone Has a Family Member Who Works Up There
description: DANNEMORA, N.Y.  The most striking thing  the only striking thing, really  about the village of Dannemora, nestled in the Adirondacks, is a monolithic wall that both defines and divides it.

title: Eugene Kennedy, a Voice for Change in the Catholic Church, Dies at 86
description: Eugene Kennedy, a psychologist, former priest and public intellectual who, inspired by the ideas of Vatican II, emerged in the 1970s as a powerful voice for reform and modernization of the Roman Catholic Church, died on June 3 in St. Joseph, Mich. He was 86.

title: Review: In 10 out of 12 at Soho Rep, the Audience Tunes In to the Crew
description: Ever been bored into rhapsody? Every so often, a strange and ecstatic vision rises from the carefully tended tedium of 10 out of 12, Anne Washburns evocation of that special state of theater purgatory known as the tech rehearsal, which opened on Wednesday night at Soho Rep in a production directed by Les Waters.

title: Well-Kept Secret
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Will Shortz has said that he looks for lively and sparkling fill in the puzzles that get submitted to him, so its easy to see why this one was accepted.

title: Marguerite Patten, 99, Dies; Tutored Food-Rationed Britons in Home Cooking
description: Marguerite Patten, a home economist who told ration-pinched British families how to make a satisfying meal out of nothing during World War II, and later became one of the countrys first television chefs and the author of more than 170 cookbooks aimed at average Britons, died on June 4 in Richmond, Surrey. She was 99.

title: Papal Responses to Sexual Abuse in the Church
description: In setting up a Vatican tribunal to discipline negligent Roman Catholic bishops, Pope Francis has taken the most concrete step of any pope in holding accountable church leaders who failed to prevent the sexual abuse of minors by priests. Although Francis and his most recent predecessors, Pope Benedict XVI and Pope John Paul II, made efforts to punish abusive priests, the tribunal is the Vaticans first mechanism to punish their superiors.

title: Jurors Rancorous Split Over Etan Patz Mistrial Remains on Display Outside Hearing
description: Several jurors who failed to reach a decision in the trial of a man accused of killing Etan Patz in 1979 showed up on Wednesday at the defendants court appearance, giving dueling news conferences outside court and airing the bitter divisions that led to a hung jury.

title: For Its Championship Event, the L.P.G.A. Decides to Go Big
description: At last years United States Womens Open, Stacy Lewis looked around at the amenities and began to wonder, Why dont we have this for all of our majors?

title: New York City Seeks Compromise With Orthodox Leaders on Circumcision Rules
description: Rabbi David Niederman, an influential Orthodox leader in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, sat outside a meeting of the New York City Board of Health on Wednesday, staring at a brochure and frowning.

title: New York City Council Suddenly Passes New Police and Firefighter Disability Pension Benefits
description: The New York City Council approved a new package of disability pension benefits on Wednesday for police officers and firefighters in what union representatives and some council members described as a surreptitious process.

title: Giants Pound Matt Harvey, and Mets Make Missteps on Basepaths
description: A day after San Francisco Giants starter Chris Heston pitched a no-hitter against his team, Mets Manager Terry Collins said that even such a disheartening loss was fleeting and that his players had already shifted their focus to Wednesdays opposing starter, Tim Hudson.

title: Nike Will Replace Adidas as N.B.A.s Official On-Court Apparel Provider
description: Nike will replace Adidas, the N.B.A.s official provider of on-court apparel, in the 2017-18 season with an eight-year deal that will allow it to manufacture authentic and replica jerseys for retail markets.

title: Stars on Their Teams, and Maybe in the Cup
description: Hope Solo, Abby Wambach, Alex Morgan and Megan Rapinoe have been impressing followers of American soccer for years. Christine Sinclair has received lots of attention as the star of host Canada, and the heroics of Marta of Brazil and Homare Sawa of Japan from past World Cups are well remembered.

title: Wednesday at the Womens World Cup
description: WEDNESDAYS RESULTS

title: Floral Still-Lifes That Recall Old Masters Paintings
description: In this weekly series, Ts photo editors share the most compelling visual projects theyve discovered.

title: A Dual Review of Whats New Starring Natasha Lyonne and John Baldessari
description: Natasha Lyonne and John Baldessari snack on chocolate while assessing a ghastly gnome and gnarly soap.

title: Word of the Day | impudence
description: impudence  \im-py-dn(t)s\  noun

title: Chicago Blackhawks Show Their Mettle in Tying Stanley Cup Finals
description: CHICAGO  The shots kept ringing off the post and the crossbar for the Blackhawks  one, two, three, as the groans from the crowd at United Center grew ever louder, ever more insistent. Those clangs echoed in the second period and the third period until the puck sneaked into the net.

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 11:35 A.M. (Starz Cinema) HIGHER GROUND (2011) Corinne Walker, a freewheeling teenage mother turned fundamentalist Christian (played by Vera Farmiga, who also directed, as an adult; her sister Taissa Farmiga as a teenager; and McKenzie Turner as a child) comes to question her faith  and her marriage  when faced with a crisis in this adaptation of This Dark World, a 2002 memoir by Carolyn S. Briggs. Joshua Leonard and Boyd Holbrook share the role of Corinnes husband, a rock guitarist who saves their daughter from death after a bus crash, leading the couple onto the path of salvation. Norbert Leo Butz plays the pastor of their cultlike church. And Dagmara Dominczyk is Corinnes best friend, who speaks in tongues to God and makes her feel loved. There is something remarkable  you might even say miraculous  about the way Higher Ground makes its gentle, thoughtful way across the burned-over terrain of the American culture wars, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times. Focused with sympathetic intensity on the ordeal of a single soul, it illuminates, as though from within, a complex spiritual struggle. But, he added, what faith and doubt have in common is that both are hard work, and the hard-won wisdom of Higher Ground is that human nature does not necessarily distinguish between saints and sinners.

title: Corrections: June 11, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: It sets up a system where first theres the punishment, and then theres the opportunity to go to court for trial.

title: Simple Life Among the Hutterites
description: When it comes to feature photos, the more you drive the luckier youll get. Tim Smith learned that lesson one crisp spring day in 2009, when he was searching for something  anything  worth photographing. He needed to find a day picture to fill space on the pages of the Brandon Sun newspaper in Manitoba, Canada. Unfortunately, nothing much was happening in his corner of western Manitoba.

Tim Smith learned that lesson one crisp spring day in 2009, when he was searching for something  anything  worth photographing. He needed to find a day picture to fill space on the pages of the Brandon Sun newspaper in Manitoba, Canada. Unfortunately, nothing much was happening in his corner of western Manitoba.

title: The Myth of a White Minority
description: IN 2012, the Census Bureau announced that nonwhite births exceeded white births for the first time. In 2013, it noted that more whites were dying than were being born. In March, it projected that non-Hispanic whites would be a minority by 2044.

title: Battle of the Abortion Decisions
description: Its been a dismal stretch for a womans right to choose. Not everywhere  I swear that if you stay with me theres going to be a bright spot. But, first, Im afraid were going to have to talk about Texas.

title: From Caitlyn Jenner to a Brooklyn High School
description: People all over the world have been following the emergence of Caitlyn Jenner, but few as enthusiastically as Spencer and Joshua, two students at a New York City high school who see her as an inspiring role model.

title: A Universal Story Told in a Bengali Village
description: When I recently saw the newly restored versions of Satyajit Rays Apu Trilogy, a wave of emotion swept up over me as I watched Apu grow up, become a writer and lose his family.

title: Closing Off Abortion Rights
description: For the last several years, opponents of abortion rights have cloaked their obstructionist efforts under all manner of legitimate-sounding rationales, like protecting womens health. This has never been more than an insulting ruse. Their goal, of course, is to end all abortions, and lately theyre hardly trying to pretend otherwise.

title: Dont Weaken the F.D.A.s Drug Approval Process
description: DURING the early days of the AIDS epidemic in the 1980s, there were no effective treatments against H.I.V., the virus that causes the disease. Because of this, many thousands of people died lingering deaths. The desperation of those times led to the rise of an activist movement that took to the streets and pressed government officials to expedite research on drugs to treat AIDS.

description: To the Editor:

title: The North-South Divide on Two-Parent Families
description: When it comes to family arrangements, the United States has a North-South divide. Children growing up across much of the northern part of the country are much more likely to grow up with two parents than children across the South.

title: Test Yourself | Before Summer Starts, a Flurry of Celebrations, Ceremonies and Field Days
description: Below, several paragraphs from a June 5 article, Mom and Dad Have Their Own Set of Finals.

title: Britain Raises $1.16 Billion in Sale of Royal Mail Shares
description: LONDON  The British government said on Thursday that it had raised 750 million pounds, or about $1.16 billion, in a sale of half of its remaining stake in Royal Mail, the operator of Britains postal service.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Life on the Run Still Offers Long-Term Fugitives Abundant Ways to Blunder
description: In Life on the Run Still Offers Long-Term Fugitives Abundant Ways to Blunder, Noah Remnick writes about what life might be like for someone after escaping prison.

title: Financial District Roommates
description: Matthew DeSimone and Matthew Murawski, good friends, roomed together during their last two years at the College of the Holy Cross in Worcester, Mass.

title: Lost Brother in Yosemite
description: YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK, Calif.  Afternoon gave way to evening, and the parade of restless clouds and the occasional bursts of rain had moved on from Yosemite Valley. In their wake was the empty quiet of Taft Point, 3,000 feet above a famous green valley going gray in late-day shadow.

title: Winning Belmont Bettors Hope to Cash In Online
description: As soon as American Pharoah galloped across the finish line at the Belmont Stakes on Saturday, another race began, as throngs of lucky gamblers swarmed the grandstand to trade in their ticket stubs for stacks of dollar bills.

title: Russian Groups Crowdfund the War in Ukraine
description: WASHINGTON  The Novorossiya Humanitarian Battalion boasts on its website that it provided funds to buy a pair of binoculars used by rebels in eastern Ukraine to spot and destroy an armored vehicle. Another group, Save the Donbass, solicits donations using a photograph of a mortar shell inscribed with its web address and the names of donors. Yet another, Veche, states that its mission is to create modern, combat-ready military units fighting Ukraines central government.

title: What Are You Doing This Summer?
description: Will you be working? Taking classes? Practicing for the SAT? Attending a sports or music camp? Interning?

title: Nepal Landslides Kill at Least 21, With Others Trapped or Missing
description: KATHMANDU, Nepal  Landslides caused by heavy rains struck several remote villages in eastern Nepal overnight on Thursday, killing at least 21 people, a local official said.

title: Surveillance States
description: For a while, every time I borrowed a book from my local library in Washington, D.C., I was greeted by an Orwellian poster: Big Brother Is Watching You! I often wondered if others paused to reflect on the implication of these words, if they understood how profoundly living under surveillance distorts a society. It transforms your perspective, your manners, your relationships with friends, colleagues, students, with every waiter and cabdriver you meet. It changes your relationship with yourself.

title: Review: In Jurassic World, the Franchise Feeds the Beast
description: Clomp, clomp, clomp  here it comes, another new blockbuster ready for its shock-and-awe ch-ching close-up. With its global brand recognition, Jurassic World comes with more muscle than the average big-ticket behemoth, one thats been built on best-selling novels, three earlier flicks, theme-park attractions and the usual marketing tie-ins. Once again, dinosaurs are on the roam, an unpeaceable kingdom that is an index of the folly of man trying to play God. In reality, theres more flab than muscle packed on this galumphing franchise reboot, which, as it lumbers from scene to scene, reminds you of what a great action god Steven Spielberg is. Too bad he didnt take the reins on this.

title: Thursdays Travel News and Tips
description: Our weekday morning digest that includes consumer news, deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Statins May Not Affect Memory, Study Suggests
description: Statins, the widely used cholesterol-lowering drugs, have been blamed for memory loss, but a new study suggests that the association is an illusion.

title: New York Today: The Men at Large
description: Good morning on this tropical Thursday.

title: New York Today: The Men at Large
description: Good morning on this tropical Thursday.

title: Zhou Yongkang, Ex-Security Chief in China, Gets Life Sentence for Graft
description: HONG KONG  President Xi Jinping of China vowed to hunt tigers as well as flies in his drive to rid the ruling Communist Party of corruption, and on Thursday he defanged the most dangerous tiger yet  Zhou Yongkang, the nations former chief of domestic security.

title: Michael Wolff Thinks We Could All Learn From Fox News
description: You wrote in December 2013, in a media-criticism column for The Guardian, that no one reads The Times Magazine anymore. So thanks for joining us in this private setting. You know, the first article I ever published was in The Times Magazine, in 1974.

title: The Supreme Court Down the Stretch
description: American Pharoahs stretch run in the Belmont Stakes was a beauty to behold. The Supreme Courts stretch run in the closing weeks of its term? Not so much.

title: Hillary Clinton and Wishful-Thinking Politics
description: Hillary Rodham Clintons campaign took a beating from some pundits this week for telling the truth: Shes going to employ a strategy focused on a narrow set of the most competitive states.

title: Exploring Franche-Comt, Frances Well-Kept Secret
description: The Citadel of Besanon is an imposing 27-acre fortress on a bluff high above the citys Renaissance-era center, which spills out from a teardrop-shaped oxbow on the Doubs River. This is now eastern France, about an hour from the Swiss border, but the unusual topography has drawn military attention at least since it was Celtic Gaul: Julius Caesar noted its potential as a defensive stronghold on his way through the region. Sbastien Le Prestre de Vauban, Louis XIVs celebrated engineer, designed the current structure, one of his 12 fortifications that collectively made the Unesco World Heritage list in 2008.

title: Today in Politics: Mitt Romney Conference Promises Donors and Early Morning Hikes
description: Good Thursday morning from Washington, where the Supreme Courts coming decision on health care is not the only court ruling on the law watchers have their eyes on. But most of Thursdays action and focus will be on Utah, where Republicans will meet Mitt Romneys list of donors and spend time in the sun.

title: My Perennial Dilemma
description: Thank goodness for farmers. As a mere gardener, I dont know how they do it. The heartbreak. My phlox had powdery mildew last summer and it about killed me. The worry. Was I applying the right mildew spray? The doubt. Had I read the Department of Agricultures official Plant Hardiness Zone Map correctly? Was Provincetown in Zone 7A? I had to remind myself that my life and livelihood did not depend on my phlox crop.

title: After a Mishap, a Favorite Returns to the Fleet
description: Team Vestas Wind returned to complete the Volvo Ocean Race after a crash on a reef left the team stranded in the second leg.

title: The Child Preachers of Brazil
description: It was fall in Brazil, and rain drizzled under a gray moon. The faithful were beginning to arrive at the International Mission of Miracles, a Pentecostal church in the poor and working-class city of So Gonalo, 10 miles from Rio de Janeiro. In front of the church, which was located between a supermarket and an abandoned lot, a banner staked in the muddy ground advertised a young girl named Alani Santos, whose touch could heal.

title: After Crash in Volvo Ocean Race, a Team Shifts Its Focus and an Event Changes Its Rules
description: Even though Chris Nicholson entered the Volvo Ocean Race only two months before the start last October, his four races worth of experience made him a favorite in the around-the-world event. He believed he could win.

title: Soju for the Soul
description: I took the news badly when my friend Jiwon said she was leaving New York and moving to Seoul. She was a beloved drinking and dining companion, a doting cat sitter and the person most likely to make me laugh until I cried. But she wanted to get to know the country where she was born, and she assured me it wouldnt be forever.

title: The Virtues of Political Disagreement
description: This interview, the fifth in a series on political topics, discusses philosophical issues concerning political disagreement. My interviewee is Jerry Gaus, professor of philosophy at the University of Arizona. He is the author of The Order of Public Reason: A Theory of Freedom and Morality in a Diverse and Bounded World.  Gary Gutting

title: Women Respond to Nobel Laureates Trouble With Girls
description: LONDON  A Nobel laureate has resigned as honorary professor at University College London after saying that female scientists should be segregated from male colleagues because women cry when criticized and are a romantic distraction in the laboratory.

title: Amazons E-Books Business Investigated by European Antitrust Regulators
description: In the digital world, things change in an instant. One minute you are the peoples champion. In the next, perhaps a villain.

title: Aung San Suu Kyi of Myanmar Meets With Xi Jinping in Beijing
description: HONG KONG  Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, the Nobel Peace laureate who leads Myanmars opposition, met with President Xi Jinping of China on Thursday, the second day of a trip that appears likely to underscore her transformation from a global icon of democracy to a politician with ambitions to form her countrys next government.

title: Michelle Obama Guest-Edits Issue of More Magazine
description: Michelle Obama has been on the cover of many magazines, including Vogue and Time. To go along with her latest appearance, she has also had a bigger role behind the scenes.

title: Morning Agenda: J. Crews Great Man Problem
description: J. CREWS GREAT MAN PROBLEM | As losses mount at J. Crew, the clothing retailer owned by TPG Capital and Leonard Green & Partners, it finds itself floundering after missteps in pricing and design, Julie Creswell writes in The New York Times. What compounds J. Crews troubles is the $1.5 billion in debt incurred through a leveraged buyout orchestrated by the chief executive, Millard S. Drexler, and the two private equity firms in 2011, Ms. Creswell writes. J. Crew executives blamed the most recent quarterly losses on some fashion mistakes, like the cropped Tilly sweater, and on Wednesday the company said it had replaced the head of womens design and will cut 175 jobs. However,  in the Deal Professor column, Steven Davidoff Solomon contends that J. Crew doesnt just have a fashion problem  it has a great man problem.

title: Top Executive at Kleiner Perkins to Make Rare Silicon Valley Shift, to Menlo Ventures
description: SAN FRANCISCO  A veteran investor is making the rare leap from one top Silicon Valley firm to another.

title: China Says It Killed North Korean Suspected of Illegally Crossing Border
description: Chinese troops on the border with North Korea shot and killed a person early Thursday who was suspected of illegally entering the country, according to a government statement.

title: Idle Home Builders Hold Chinas Economy Back
description: HONG KONG  Renhe Commercial appears to have a well-fortified business model: It builds air raid shelters across China for the government, outfitting them as underground shopping malls for use during peacetime.

title: Review: Flaming June Arrives in New York, Preceded by Its Reputation
description: Flaming June by Frederic Leighton (1830-1896), a famous Victorian painting, has come to New York for the first time in more than 35 years, for a solo turn at the Frick Collection.

title: Has the Affordable Care Act Proved Its Worth?
Fox News Adds G.O.P. Candidate Forum Amid Criticism of Debate Plans
description: Fox News has decided to add a candidate forum before the first Republican presidential debate on Aug. 6, after the network came under criticism for its criteria to winnow down the number of people onstage.

title: Obama Looks at Adding Bases and Troops in Iraq, to Fight ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama is open to expanding the American military footprint in Iraq with a network of bases and possibly hundreds of additional troops to support Iraqi security forces in their fight against the Islamic State, White House officials said on Thursday.

title: 1940:  Parisians Flee the City as German Troops Advance
description: Newsreel footage reporting the German invasion of France and the exodus from Paris. INA.

title: Can a New Designer (Not Jenna Lyons) Fix J. Crew?
description: J. Crew just isnt selling. With sales down for another consecutive quarter, doomsayers are circling. Interestingly, however, while normally the first solution when product has not been resonating is, Fire the creative director! (see Gucci, which also fired its chief executive), that has not been this brands solution. Instead, it has replaced the design second-in-command.

title: Jihads New Frontier: Tajikistan
description: A new front line against Islamist militancy involving the Islamic State is forming along the Tajikistan-Afghanistan border, where multiple groups of Central Asian militants, as well as the Pakistani and Afghan Taliban, have been joining forces with the Islamic State to challenge secular regimes in former Soviet republics.

title: Syrian Druse Reconsider Alliances After Deadly Attack
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A deadly attack by Al Qaedas Syrian branch in the north and an advance by other insurgents into a previously quiet southern province are squeezing Syrias Druse minority sect across the country, setting off urgent debates among Druse leaders about how best to protect their interests: Stick close to the government, reach out to Sunni insurgents or stand alone and defend themselves.

title: No Justice for Canadas First Peoples
description: Guelph, Ontario

title: Authorities Hunting for 2 Escapees Focus on 5-Square-Mile Area Near Prison
description: CADYVILLE, N.Y.  In a six-day manhunt that has touched on locations as varied as the streets of Philadelphia to an island in Lake Champlain, law enforcement officers searching for two convicted murderers on Thursday largely narrowed their efforts to a five-square-mile area just east of the prison from which they escaped.

title: Hillary Clinton Will Evoke Roosevelt and Try to Ease Fears on Trust in New York Speech
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton, at a major outdoor rally planned for Saturday, will directly address concerns that have emerged in the early weeks of her candidacy, telling voters they can trust her to fight for the middle class and stressing that she cares about their problems, several people briefed on her plans say.

title: Kevin Rose Moves On From Silicon Valley to Watches
description: For some start-up founders, once you get the bug to create your own companies, it is hard to stop. Just ask Kevin Rose.

title: Botany of Desire
description: Handfuls of delightfully whimsical floral jewels as exquisitely alluring as a summer bouquet.

title: No Justice in Pakistan
description: In Pakistan, the innocent are executed and the guilty go free. On Wednesday, Aftab Bahadur, who was 15 years old when he was convicted of murder after a forced confession under torture, was executed. Mr. Bahadur had spent 22 years on death row. Two witnesses against him later recanted and declared him innocent. Meanwhile, it came to light last Friday that eight of 10 men who were reported to have been given life sentences by a secret military court in April for their role in the 2012 attack on the Nobel Prize winner and education activist Malala Yousafzai had quietly been released.

title: Ornette Coleman, Saxophonist Who Rewrote the Language of Jazz, Dies at 85
description: Ornette Coleman, the alto saxophonist and composer who was one of the most powerful and contentious innovators in the history of jazz, died on Thursday in Manhattan. He was 85.

title: Holocaust Film That Won at Cannes Will be Hungarys Oscar Submission
description: PARIS  Son of Saul, the debut feature by the Hungarian director Laszlo Nemes that had its premiere at the Cannes Film Festival last month, will be Hungarys submission for the Oscar for best foreign-language film, the countrys film fund announced Thursday.

title: Daily Report: Google Sets Its Sights on Improving City Life
description: Googles ambitions and investments have increasingly broadened beyond its digital origins in Internet search and online advertising into the arena of physical objects: self-driving cars, Internet-connected eyeglasses, smart thermostats and a biotech venture to develop life-extending treatments.

title: Germanwings Victims Remains Return Home
description: The mayor of Haltern am See, Germany, said townspeople lined the streets to welcome home the remains of 16 schoolchildren killed in the crash of a Germanwings plane in March.

title: Trevor Noah Twitter Account Not Vetted Before Daily Show Decision
description: A top Viacom executive said that the Twitter account of the comedian Trevor Noah was not vetted before his selection as the new host of The Daily Show and that he underestimated how viewers would respond to anyone who was named to succeed Jon Stewart.

title: With Significant Other, Joshua Harmon Happily Writes About the Unhappy
description: When the playwright Joshua Harmon was 10, his grandmother handed him a copy of a play and told him that if he read it, she would take him to see it on Broadway. After several weeks, he finished the script, and then they went to the show. I was very excited, he said recently over drinks. The play was Euripides Medea, which is not exactly childrens theater, unless you like your children violently murdered. I loved it, he said.

title: Christopher Lee Dies at 93; Actor Breathed Life Into Nightmarish Villains
description: Christopher Lee, the physically towering British movie actor who lent his distinguished good looks, Shakespearean voice and aristocratic presence to a gallery of villains, from a seductive Count Dracula to a dreaded wizard in The Lord of the Rings, died on Sunday in London. He was 93.

title: Campaign Kickoffs: Who Has Stumbled, Who Has Sparkled
description: For months now, the candidates have seemed like jittery aspiring actors strutting their stuff for choosy directors and producers. Here are some lessons learned so far.

title: Student Loans and Defaults: The Facts
description: Lee Siegel, an author, sparked a heated discussion about student debt after writing about his decision to default deliberately on his loans. He did so, he wrote in a New York Times Op-Ed article, so that he could pursue his career as a writer without the financial burden of paying his loans, and he called on other borrowers to join him in order to press politicians to address rising college costs.

title: After Financial Crisis, Fates of Lender and Borrower Diverge
description: Timothy L. Blixseth, a 65-year-old former billionaire, now sits in his eighth week of solitary confinement in a county jail in Great Falls, Mont., one of the few people being held accountable in connection with Wall Streets profligate behavior in the years leading up to the 2008 financial crisis.

title: Chinas Ex-Security Chief Sentenced
