description: Zhou Yongkang, Chinas former domestic security chief, spoke after he was sentenced to life in prison on Thursday for accepting bribes, abusing power and revealing state secrets.

title: Fred Anton Maier, 76, Speedskating Champion and Record Setter, Dies
description: Fred Anton Maier, one of Norways finest athletes in one of its signature sports, who set several world records in speedskating and won Olympic gold at 5,000 meters in Grenoble, France, in 1968, died on Tuesday at his home in southern Norway. He was 76.

title: Dating With Schizophrenia
description: Dating is hard. Dating when you are overweight is harder. Dating when you are a big dude with a serious mental illness is nearly impossible.

title: Mary Schapiro to Join London Stock Exchange Board
description: LONDON  The London Stock Exchange Group said on Thursday that Mary L. Schapiro, the former chairwoman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, would join its board as it continued to expand its business in the United States.

title: Rupert Murdoch to Put Media Empire in Sons Hands
description: Rupert Murdochs long-held plan to hand over his media empire to his sons is now being realized.

title: Affairs of the Wrist: The Apple Watch Comes Between Them
description: Is the Apple Watch just for gadget geeks? Farhad Manjoo, our technology columnist, fell hard for the watch back in April. But our fashion director, Vanessa Friedman, didnt feel the sparks; she went public this week with her Apple Watch breakup. The two talked  over email, of course  about their wearable-tech turn-ons and turnoffs. Farhad composed his letters on his 5K iMac, watch on wrist. Vanessa replied from her MacBook Air, her wrist newly bare.

title: Government Report Urges Changes in British Surveillance Law
description: LONDON  Amid growing debate in Europe over electronic spying, an independent report on Thursday called for changes to Britains surveillance laws, arguing that they are undemocratic and opaque, and that they risk eroding confidence in the oversight of intelligence agencies.

title: Hire the Next First Lady
description: If Lindsey Graham is elected president, he joked recently, well have a rotating first lady. Since hes single, his female friends and possibly his sister could take turns in the role.

title: Pipeline of Young Talent Infuses the Blackhawks
description: CHICAGO  Andrew Shaw walked into the locker room after the Chicago Blackhawks morning skate, looked around and muttered an expletive. Between him and his locker were several dozen members of a news media horde. Shaw had to dodge a boom microphone before he could get his equipment off.

title: Lululemons Founder May Sell His Stake in Company
description: Lululemon Athletica disclosed in a filing on Thursday that its founder, Dennis J. Wilson, may sell his entire stake in the yoga wear maker, paving the way for Mr. Wilson to end an association that had become contentious.

title: Unshaven and Proud: Winners of the Chinese Womens Armpit Contest
description: Six Chinese women who proudly posted photographs of their unshaven armpits online have been named the winners of a contest held to challenge the notion that women must have hair-free armpits to be attractive.

title: 1915: Appeal for American Peace
description: LONDON  On the heels of the publication of the second American Note to Germany, Mr. Bryan has issued an appeal to the American people. He declares that the real issue is not between President Wilson and himself, but between systems of government.

title: Paris and Lovers Look to Move On After Breakup With Bridges Locks
description: PARIS  After Paris removed hundreds of thousands of locks affixed to the iron grillwork on the Pont des Arts last week, the romantics online were in mourning.

title: British Revival of A View From the Bridge Heads to Broadway This Fall
description: A much-lauded British revival of Arthur Millers A View From the Bridge will transfer to Broadway this fall.

title: Leaders From Myanmar and China Meet
description: Video from Chinas state-run television shows a meeting on Thursday between President Xi Jinping and Myanmars opposition leader, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, in Beijing.

title: World Cup Organizers Have a Reason to Root for the Home Team
description: OTTAWA  The organizers of the Womens World Cup in Canada are hoping that the home team and the United States enjoy good tournaments, but not necessarily for reasons of patriotism or cordial relations with neighbors.

title: Soon, Cars May Take Away the Keys of a Drunken Driver
description: WASHINGTON  IN the near future, cars will communicate with one another on the road, partly or entirely drive themselves and be packed with more entertainment options than most computers.

title: Watching the Womens World Cup  With Our Sons
description: It was my 13-year-old son who insisted that we rush back from a birthday shopping expedition for his sister so that we wouldnt miss the start of the Womens World Cup Soccer game between the United States and Australia earlier this week. The women are going to do really well, he told me. Theyre really good.

title: Bernie Sanders Demands Hillary Clinton Take Trade Stance Right Now
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont delivered a sharp critique of Hillary Rodham Clinton on Thursday for her reluctance to talk about issues as a presidential candidate and vowed that he is running against her to win.

title: Manuel Valls, French Premier, Vows to Repay Cost of Taking Sons to Soccer Match
description: LONDON  Prime Minister Manuel Valls of France said on Thursday that he would pay 2,500 euros to the state after he provoked an uproar by taking a government Falcon jet to watch the Champions League soccer final in Berlin with his two young sons over the weekend.

title: Showtime Chief Matthew Blank to Step Aside Next Year
description: Showtimes longtime chief executive, Matthew C. Blank, will step aside early next year and be succeeded by his second in command, David Nevins, the network announced on Thursday. Mr. Blank will retain the title of chairman.

title: Spain Approves Citizenship Path for Sephardic Jews
description: MADRID  Seeking to redress one of the darkest chapters of Spains history, the Spanish Parliament on Thursday approved a long-awaited law devised to open the way for citizenship for thousands of Sephardic Jews whose ancestors were expelled in 1492.

title: Ron Moody, Actor Best Known as Fagin in Oliver!, Dies at 91
description: Ron Moody, a British character actor who rose to prominence in the role of Fagin, Dickenss guru of thievery, in Oliver!, the stage and movie versions of Oliver Twist, died on Thursday. He was 91.

title: Jerry Seinfeld Will Direct Colin Quinn in New Stage Show
description: With an accent thats as emblematically Brooklyn as the Coney Island Cyclone or an artisanal pickle store, the comedian Colin Quinn is preparing for a return to the New York stage in a new show that takes a satirical look at his hometown and its history.

title: On Health Care Reform, Nothing to Fear but the Scaremongers
description: A linchpin of the Affordable Care Act is that mid-sized and large employers must either provide health coverage for employees who work at least 30 hours a week, or pay a penalty.

title: The Children of Gay Marriage
description: When the court considers same-sex unions, it often asks what about the children? Here are some answers.

title: I.M.F. Recalls Negotiators as Deadline Looms for Greek Deal
description: PARIS  The plotline is familiar by now in Greeces long-running debt crisis, as bailout talks once again hit a major snag. But at this stage just weeks before the bailout expires, the latest twist could have more serious repercussions.

title: Restaurant Report: Bastardo in Lisbon
description: Eating at a hotel restaurant in Lisbon is often a formal, expensive affair, the exact opposite of what Alexandre Martins, the chief executive of the Internacional Design Hotel in the Baixa neighborhood, was aiming for when he opened Bastardo in September. The brightly lit, 50-seat space has a colorful Pop Art aesthetic: mismatched tables and chairs, Lego block bread baskets and paper settings in bold font declaring on this magic place mat calories dont count, and prices to match.

title: France Opens Germanwings Crash Criminal Inquiry
description: PARIS  A French prosecutor on Thursday formally opened a criminal inquiry into the crash of a Germanwings jetliner, appointing a panel of judges to investigate whether the airline or any individuals should bear responsibility for failing to adequately monitor the psychological health of the planes co-pilot, who is believed to have deliberately crashed the plane.

title: When Doctors Withdraw Cancer Treatment
description: I first met my patient, a former truck driver, in 2009, when he was in his mid-50s and had just been diagnosed with acute lymphocytic leukemia, or A.L.L. Often when my patients first learn that they have acute leukemia, they ask me: Do I have the good one?

title: Mens Summer Skincare Essentials
description: These days, with the ever-expanding offering of skincare products designed specifically for men, a grooming regime like Patrick Batemans in American Psycho  the fictional investment banker used daily various cleansers, lotions and even an ice-pack  is quickly becoming commonplace for the modern man. And whos to say theres anything wrong with that? A good epidermis, especially in the harsh summer months, can be just what a guy needs to remain looking fresh and feeling good. Here, some of the seasons best products to cleanse, exfoliate, moisturize and protect the skin.

title: Uber Releases Mobile Video Game to Recruit Drivers
description: For years, Uber has used rallies, ad campaigns and word of mouth to recruit tens of thousands of drivers to work for the company.

title: Jeb Bush Defends Book That Called for Shaming Single Parents
description: WARSAW  Jeb Bush on Thursday defended a passage in a 1995 book he co-authored calling for the restoration of shame as a way to curb out-of-wedlock births in the United States.

title: Our Summer Calendar and a Question or Two for You
description: Happy summer!

title: Music Streaming Service Aims at Japan, Where CD Is Still King
description: As listeners around the world turn to streaming music, there has been one important holdout: Japan. More than 80 percent of the sales in the country are still on physical formats like CDs, and the industry in Japan has been resistant to allowing streaming services to take root.

title: Elliott Management Pushes Citrix Systems for Change
description: Elliott Management, the activist investor that has made a lucrative practice out of shaking up technology companies, has found a new target.

title: First for Pina Bauschs Tanztheater Wuppertal: New Commissions
description: The 2009 death of the choreographer Pina Bausch plunged the future of her company, the Tanztheater Wuppertal, into doubt. But the troupe, which has only performed Bauschs epic tragicomic productions, has defied expectation, reviving old pieces, hiring new dancers and touring worldwide to the same rapturous responses that were received during the choreographers lifetime.

title: Sex Dolls That Talk Back
description: This is the fifth episode in a Bits video series, called Robotica, examining how robots are poised to change the way we do business and conduct our daily lives.

title: The Uncanny Lover
description: Matt McMullen is developing a sex robot that uses technology to create the illusion of sentience. But is it enough to generate real emotions in its user?

title: Chris Hemsworth Gets the Call for Female Ghostbusters
description: Chris Hemsworth, the steely-eyed muscular blond best known as Thor, will be playing the receptionist in the forthcoming female revamp of Ghostbusters.

title: For $7.99, You Too Can Be a Marvel Colorist
description: Colorists are often the unsung heroes of the creative team that produces a comic book. That may change when Marvel Comics releases its first coloring book for adults in October.

title: Son-in-Laws Stroke Causes George Pataki to Cancel Events
description: Former Gov. George Pataki of New York has canceled campaign events in New Hampshire to deal with a family health emergency.

title: Serena Williams Is a Star Who Matches LeBron James, From a Different Court
description: This week, Steve Kerr was asked if he thought LeBron James was the best active athlete he could think of. After kiddingly throwing out the name of the Triple Crown winner American Pharoah, Kerr, the Golden State Warriors coach, added: No, I think I said when I was a broadcaster with TNT, I think I might have made the comment that hes arguably the best athlete that any of us have ever seen in terms of size and speed and strength. I mean, hes a force.

title: F.T.C. Reaches Settlement in a Kickstarter Scheme
description: The Federal Trade Commission on Thursday announced a settlement in its first Internet crowdfunding case, which involved a board-game maker who investigators say took in more than $120,000 on Kickstarter to fund a project but spent the money on personal expenses, including rent.

title: Notable Names React to the Death of Christopher Lee
description: From a seductive Count Dracula to a dreaded wizard in The Lord of the Rings, Mr. Lee breathed life into nightmarish villains. On Thursday, actors, politicians and writers took to social media to remember his work. Mr. Lee died on Sunday in London. He was 93. For more on his life, read the New York Times obituary.

title: Minimal Undies With Maximum Coverage and Comfort for the Win
description: The movement away from tight, constricting undergarments continues as budding lingerie brands create pieces meant to move with, not restrict, womens bodies. Produced for the VPL (visible panty line) uninhibited, the designs cede to comfort, using super-soft, breathable fabrics and high-waisted, full-bottomed, generally wire-free (and all around, very minimal) elements. Created for the sport of womanhood, Land of Womens functional and classic cuts  think supple, everyday sports bras and ample bottomed briefs  support any feminine endeavor. Negative combines subtle seduction (perforated lace) and playfulness (albatross feather prints) for their uncomplicated and considered pieces. And Base Range uses unexpected details, like a small triangular opening at the sternum, and organic fabrics for sustainable support.

title: 1965: Beatles in Queens Honors List
description: Beatles received their medals at the Buckingham Palace in October 1965. (britishpathe.com)

title: Ornette Colemans Greatest Hits
description: Ornette Colemans varied and provocative recordings reflect many bands and changes of sound, from post-bebop to symphonic music to an original version of funk. Here is a brief selection of high points, a dozen tracks from his late-1950s beginnings to 2007, including some of the most durable and influential jazz of the 20th century.

title: I Love Paraguay
description: Rich Paraguayan food in Sunnyside, Queens.

title: I Love Paraguay, an Ode to a Homeland
description: The bread is coarse, flat and round, a moon at its peak, looking ready to crumble. A mix of cassava starch, milk, eggs and Muenster, given the barest amount of cohesion on a griddle, it suggests a further step in the evolution of a quesadilla, with the cheese not pent up but pervading every cranny, crazing the surface so that each bite is crispy and chewy at once.

title: The Mutability of Wages
description: Arindrajit Dube enlarges on my post about efficiency wages, pointing out that the same logic applies to firms that have monopsony power. Thats a very good point  and I think were circling in on an important part of the logic behind the new view on inequality policy, which says that policies to enhance worker bargaining power can have major effects on the distribution of market income.

title: The Mutability of Wages
description: Arindrajit Dube enlarges on my post about efficiency wages, pointing out that the same logic applies to firms that have monopsony power. Thats a very good point  and I think were circling in on an important part of the logic behind the new view on inequality policy, which says that policies to enhance worker bargaining power can have major effects on the distribution of market income.

title: The Babe Ruth of Congress
description: Cedric Richmond, a House Democrat who represents New Orleans, is the Babe Ruth of the Congressional Baseball Game.

title: Clips of Jazz Legend Ornette Coleman
description: Challenges to the traditions of jazz were the hallmarks of Ornette Colemans long career.

title: Letters: Galileos Middle Finger
description: To the Editor:

title: Top Chris Christie Aide Goes to His Political Action Committee
description: Maria Comella, the long-serving communications director to Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, will move over to the governors political action committee in a senior role, the latest move that indicates he will run for president.

title: Heroes or Killers? A Secret History of SEAL Team 6 Draws a Range of Reader Reaction
description: Nancy Wartik is a news assistant and comment moderator.

title: FIFA Spokesmans Favorite FIFA Joke
description: Walter De Gregorio, FIFAs former communications director, resigned on Thursday days after he told a joke about the associations corruption scandal on Swiss television.

title: Hand Foot Fizzle Face Digs Into an Odd Collaboration Between Beckett and Jasper Johns
description: In the mid-1970s, Samuel Beckett and Jasper Johns collaborated on a book, although collaborated is perhaps too strong a word, and book may not cut it, either.

title: A Diamond Ring with Dual Personalities
description: The night the Belgian jewelry designer Kim Mee Hye created her signature Swing Swing Ring, she says, felt almost Shakespearean: Nearly a meter of rain fell in 48 hours. There was hail, there was thunder, and there was lightning. The result? A piece that combines the impact of a blinged-out diamond ring with the understated energy of a simple, discreet one  depending on how its worn. Its a ring, the designer says, created for women who think of fine jewelry beyond the simple act of wearing a status symbol.

title: What to Do This Weekend
description: Looking for something to do this weekend?

title: David Byrnes Changing of the Color Guard
description: DAYTON, OHIO  You may find yourself in a mall in this medium-size Midwestern city. And you may sit in a food court with a few dozen high school students. And you may discuss a song you have written for them. And they may explain how they will throw flags and rifles and sabers. And you may ask yourself: Well, how did I get here?

title: Tapping Into the Potential of Falanghina
description: Ah, falanghina, I thought I knew you.

title: Answering Questions About Your Relationship
description: Admittedly, my husband and I resemble each other slightly. We both have beards and thick-frame glasses (as well as two ears, a nose and mouth). But we are often asked by strangers if we are brothers (once even, if we are twins). This makes me uncomfortable. I doubt straight couples are asked if they are siblings. Why should we be treated differently? While remaining polite, I would like a reply that makes them uncomfortable, too, so they understand their question is inappropriate.

title: Letter From Azerbaijan Jail: Khadija Ismayilova Speaks Out
description: To the Editor:

title: The Magic Word
description: A short film by Tracy Antonopoulos.

title: Review: In Me and Earl and the Dying Girl, a Comfort Zone That Cannot Last
description: The me in Me and Earl and the Dying Girl is a Pittsburgh teenager named Greg, a gangly, sarcastic young man  not quite a misfit, but also not a member of any recognizable high school social grouping  with a special fondness for movies. Greg (Thomas Mann) and Earl (RJ Cyler), his best friend since childhood, spend their spare time remaking classic films on video, using stop-motion animation and silly costumes and giving the results groan-inducing punny titles. (Samples from their extensive catalog include The 400 Bros, Monorash and Eyes Wide Butt.)

title: In Draft, Yankees Try to Minimize Risk and Maximize Pitching
description: With two first-round picks, including the highest one the team has had in 22 years, the Yankees scouting director, Damon Oppenheimer, said Thursday in evaluating the teams draft that he felt pressure to get this one right.

title: Rupert Murdochs Step Back Will Propel Dynasty Forward
description: Rupert Murdoch is propelling his family dynasty forward by taking a step back.

title: Bronx Rabbi Who Had Sauna Chats Is in Negotiations for Buyout
description: The prominent rabbi of a Bronx synagogue who has been the focus of attention for having taken boys and young men to the sauna naked is negotiating a buyout and expects to reach an agreement to step down in the near future, his lawyer said on Thursday.

title: On City Parks, Mayor de Blasio Is Seen as Friend, Foe and Something in Between
description: In Mayor Bill de Blasios proposed budget for the fiscal year that begins July 1, he allocates $1.27 billion to parks, including $150 million over four years to expand his program devoted to long-neglected parks and playgrounds in low-income neighborhoods.

title: FIFA Spokesman Steps Down After Joking About Blatter Being Arrested
description: Suggesting once again that the FIFA saga might be beyond parody, the chief spokesman for world soccers governing body stepped down on Thursday, amid speculation that he was forced out for joking on Swiss television about the possible arrest of President Sepp Blatter.

title: Chris Christie Lays Out Education Plan
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey leaned on the podium with his right elbow, his standard let-me-give-it-to-you-straight stance, and gave one of his classic blunt warnings, this time setting up a nearly hourlong speech laying out his educational platform.

title: Lindsey Graham, a Bachelor, Called a Bro With No Ho
description: Senator Lindsey Grahams bachelorhood became a hot topic in Congress on Thursday when Senator Mark S. Kirk was caught on an open microphone musing about Mr. Grahams marital prospects.

title: North Carolina Allows Officials to Refuse to Perform Gay Marriages
description: DURHAM, N.C.  Defying the governor, lawmakers on Thursday enacted a law that allows state court officials to refuse to perform a marriage if they have a sincerely held religious objection, a measure aimed at curtailing same-sex unions.

title: Report Says Census Undercounts Mixed Race
description: The number of American adults with mixed-race backgrounds is three times what official census figures indicate, and the figure is rising fast, according to a survey released Thursday. But most do not call themselves multiracial.

title: A Late-Bloomer Artist Finds Instagram  and Fashion
description: Six years ago, Helen Downie  the 50-year-old, London-based artist better known as Unskilled Worker (who hopes to retain a certain amount of anonymity)  had been clean of drugs for 10 months when she was diagnosed with breast cancer, and first felt the urge to paint. Today, she basks in her quick two-year rise from amateur painter to an Instagram sensation recently hired by Gucci to create portraits.

title: As Supplies Dwindle, World Food Program Cutting Rations to Refugees in Kenya
description: The World Food Program, the anti-hunger agency of the United Nations, said Thursday that it was temporarily cutting rations to a half-million refugees in Kenya by nearly a third, an emergency move to conserve dwindling supplies and funds.

title: JPMorgan Shakes Up a Banking Team
description: JPMorgan Chase has shaken up its technology, media and telecommunications team, elevating several top bankers while giving the current head of the team a new senior deal maker role.

title: Senate Rejects Measure to Strengthen Cybersecurity
description: WASHINGTON  On the heels of a vast breach of the personal information of federal employees, the Senate failed Thursday to advance a cybersecurity measure, the third time in three years that a bipartisan effort to tackle the problem has fallen victim to procedural actions.

title: Whimsy Just Doesnt Show Up on a Spreadsheet
description: I have a soft spot for economists. I fell for a number of them and was fascinated by their thought processes, which struck me as so efficient, how they sized things up and appraised value with one glance. Their minds seemed to operate in ways mine never did.

title: Review: Kota Yamazakis OQ, a Work of Contrasting Themes
description: The palace in Kota Yamazakis imagination is neither made of pink plastic nor is it where princesses sneak off to dance the night away. It is stark, sealed off and vaguely forbidding. Mr. Yamazaki, a Butoh-trained choreographer, titles OQ, performed Friday at Japan Society, after the phonetic sound of the Japanese word for palace and draws inspiration from utakai, or poetry readings by Japanese aristocrats, and renga, collaboratively composed linked poems.

title: Carmelo Anthony Becomes a Soccer Team Owner in Puerto Rico
description: While fans are wondering about his comeback from knee surgery and who will surround him on the Knicks next season, Carmelo Anthony has turned his focus to another sport.

title: A Congressional Baseball All-Star Team
description: Tonight, members of Congress will head to Nationals Park, not to take in a game, but to take the field for the Congressional Baseball Game for Charity.

title: Sophie Theallet Resort 2016
description: Looks from the collection.

title: Banded Mongooses and Careful Sex
description: Most mammals that live in social groups avoid inbreeding in a simple way: They dont mate with others in their group.

title: Shreveport Battles the Ravages of the Mighty Red
description: SHREVEPORT, La.  Sheriff Steve Prator of Caddo Parish can barely recognize his house near Twelve Mile Bayou and the Red River in northern Shreveport.

title: Tracy Antonopoulos and Gia Coppola Team Up to Salute (and Wink at) Italian Cinema
description: It wasnt hard to conceptualize, says the director Tracy Antonopoulos of her new short film The Magic Word, created in partnership with Peroni Nastro Azzuro for its summer Grazie Cinema Series, which debuted this week and is curated by Antonopouloss good friend and collaborator Gia Coppola. The five-minute film premieres online here, and begins in black and white as a girl (played by Courtney Falsey) wanders into a cafe dotted with patrons crying and looking down at their tables sullenly. After finally making eye contact with the inattentive bartender, the girl says a simple grazie, and the entire scene changes to a fanciful, colorful place of joy. Its really just about moody girls who get frustrated with the world, Antonopoulos says bluntly. And Fellini films, Italian cinema in general. I wanted the message to ultimately be that life can be a little bit more fun. The Italians kind of do that best. Coppola concurs: The film shows the lead character interacting with the world in a fun and kind manner, which is what I feel the word grazie means, she says. Thanking, celebrating and saying cheers.

title: Womens Pro League Offering Pay Signs Its First Player
description: Janine Weber became the first player to join the newly formed National Womens Hockey League on Thursday, signing a free-agent contract with the New York Riveters.

title: Review: Albert Oehlen, a Master of Disciplined Excess
description: The German artist Albert Oehlen has been painting up a storm for more than 30 years, producing canvases that promulgate one kind of cross-fertilized chaos or another. The usual components include angst-free Abstract Expressionist brushwork, bits of popular advertising imagery, Surrealist automatist scribbles, spray-can vapor trails reminiscent of graffiti art and, at times, composite images built on the computer.

title: Mylans Dutch Takeover Defense Is in Nasdaqs Hands
description: These days, the pharmaceutical company Mylan is both the hunter and the hunted. The question is whether Mylans defense against a takeover attempt will run afoul of United States market rules and whether those rules will be enforced.

title: Saying Goodbye After 84 Million Miles
description: The crew that launched from the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan on Nov. 24 hands over command to a new crew led by Gennady Padalka of the Russian Federal Space Agency

title: Six Personal Letters by Harper Lee to Be Auctioned at Christies
description: On Dec. 12, 1960, Harper Lee sat down at her typewriter and wrote an exuberant letter to her close friend, the New York architect Harold Caufield, expressing her shock and delight at a glowing review of her debut novel.

title: Following Smugglers in Kurdistan
description: Smuggling is an integral way of life in Kurdish villages where, for many, there is no other way to earn a living. It is a business that some families have practiced for generations.

title: Baidu Fires Researcher Tied to Contest Disqualification
description: A week after researchers at Baidu were barred from competing in an international computer vision contest after contest organizers discovered that scientists at the company broke the rules for the competition, the Chinese web service said that it had fired the team leader.

title: Erdogan Urges Cooperation in Forming New Turkish Government
description: ISTANBUL  For Turkeys ubiquitous president, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, it was a long time between television appearances: 3 days 22 hours 1 minute 45 seconds.

title: Twitters C.E.O., Dick Costolo, Is Set to Exit, Feeling Heat of Criticism
description: SAN FRANCISCO  After replacing much of Twitters top management team last year, Dick Costolo told members of the companys board that he wanted them to replace him as chief executive, too.

title: The Man Who Stole Nazi-Era History From the Streets
description: During World War II, Zosa Szajkowski, a Polish-born historian living in Manhattan, joined the United States Army. He was later sent to Europe, where he learned how many of his Jewish relatives had been killed by the Nazis. He also scoured bombed-out streets for paperwork to send home to Jewish institutions  a kind of revenge for wartime atrocities.

title: Pictures of the Day: Chile, Gaza and Elsewhere
description: Ukraine, Chile and Elsewhere  Pictures of the Day

title: A Night in Havana
description: While on assignment in Cuba, Ts design editor Tom Delavan explores local nightlife with one of his subjects.

title: Saturns Ring of Dust and Soccer Balls
description: Saturns outermost ring is made up of an unusual combination of fine dust particles occasionally interspersed with rocks the size of soccer balls, scientists reported in the journal Nature. The faint ring, discovered in 2009, is probably made of material ejected from one of Saturns moons, Phoebe. With images from NASAs WISE spacecraft, researchers at the University of Maryland discovered that the ring was dominated by small particles, a rarity in our solar system, while the ring itself is enormous, 10 times as big as the E ring, the next largest.

title: Virginia Is Latest Front in Democrats Voting Rights Battle
description: Democrats allied with Hillary Rodham Clinton have filed a voting rights lawsuit in Virginia, the third time they have done so in a crucial presidential battleground state in the last two months.

title: Review: In The Yes Men Are Revolting, Prankster Activists Take On Climate Change
description: Its one thing for political pranksters to play dirty tricks on corporations whose agendas they oppose, but its quite another for their shenanigans to be carried out with the ingenuity and humor of comic performance art. Take the Yes Men, Mike Bonanno and Andy Bichlbaum (not their real names), subversive political satirists who dream up elaborate stunts to embarrass climate-change deniers.

title: June 11, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Chile, Ukraine, Gaza and South Korea.

title: June 11, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Chile, Ukraine, Gaza and South Korea.

title: Pamela Paul, Book Review Editor, Talks Shop
description: It feels terrible when its happening to you, Pamela Paul, editor of The Book Review said when asked about the purpose of negative reviews in a conversation with C-Spans Book TV. But, you know what I remind myself when we have negative reviews is that were not a service arm for the publishing industry, she said. Were here for the readers. And readers are trying to make a decision about what they should spend their time reading and their money buying if theyre buying a book.

title: Finding Escapees Is Top Priority
description: The authorities are following every significant lead in their search for the two inmates who escaped from a New York prison, Gov. Peter Shumlin of Vermont said.

title: In Brazil, Investors Pay a Premium for Tradition
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  Investors in mutual funds in New York and London may complain about the fees they pay, but they are getting no sympathy in Brazil.

title: Cleveland Judge Finds Probable Cause to Charge Officers in Tamir Rice Death
description: A judge in Cleveland ruled Thursday that probable cause existed to charge two Cleveland police officers in the death of a 12-year-old boy, Tamir Rice, but the judge also said he did not have the power to order arrests without a complaint being filed by a prosecutor.

title: Review: Robert Kursons Pirate Hunters, a Real-Life Treasure Hunt
description: For all of Robert Kursons efforts to fill his latest book, Pirate Hunters, with hyperbolic thrills, its best pages are those that summarize his Shadow Divers (2004), one of the most fascinating, pulse-quickening true stories to hit best-seller lists in recent years.

title: Rupert Murdoch: The Man Behind the News
description: From his roots in an Australian newspaper family, Rupert Murdoch has built a powerful international media empire that has considerably altered the journalistic landscape in many countries, including the United States.

title: Elmer Crowells Barn Is Rebuilt in Cape Cod
description: The Cape Cod barn where the woodcarver Elmer Crowell produced decoy birds, which have sold for more than $1 million each, opens to the public on June 21. Mr. Crowell (rhymes with roll) worked a few miles from the Harwich Historical Society in Massachusetts, where his outbuilding has been reconstructed.

title: Big Apple Barbecue Block Party Offers a Taste of Country
description: To take a last-minute trip to the South this weekend, you neednt look farther than Madison Square Park.

title: Egyptian Police Officer Convicted in Killing of Activist
description: CAIRO  An Egyptian police officer was convicted Thursday of a form of manslaughter for killing a poet and activist by shooting her at close range with birdshot. The court sentenced the officer to 15 years in prison.

title: Fighting Brutality at Rikers Island
description: The house-of-horrors stories that federal prosecutors keep uncovering at New York Citys Rikers Island jail bear a striking resemblance to the torture that transpired at the Abu Ghraib prison in Iraq during the early days of the war  when prisoners were threatened, beaten, shocked, stripped and starved of food and sleep as a matter of course.

title: Weekend Entertainments From the Archives of The New York Times
description: Saturday is the 150th anniversary of the birth of William Butler Yeats. A year of events (including an Irish Repertory Theater fund-raiser held on Monday at Town Hall in New York, at which the poets granddaughter read The Lake Isle of Innisfree) culminates with a festival in Sligo, Ireland, this weekend.

title: Review: Torbjorn Rodland Mixes the Religious With the Evocative
description: A Norwegian artist who lives in Los Angeles, Torbjorn Rodland creates photographs that are formally acute, conceptually playful and psychologically evocative. The most intriguing of the large color prints in his show have eccentric religious overtones.

title: Camp After a Transplant: Harder on Mother Than Daughter
description: Yet again, I debriefed Paula, the head nurse who stood before me with a ream of medical records.

title: Court Denies Requests to Keep New Net Neutrality Rules From Taking Effect on Friday
description: In themonths since the Federal Communications Commission voted to regulate the Internet like a public utility, opponents of the new rules have clamoredto keep themfrom takingeffect this Friday.

title: Discipline for Airlines, Pain for Fliers
description: At this weeks meeting in Miami of the International Air Transport Association, the annual meeting of the worlds top airline executives, the buzzword was discipline.

title: Bottega Veneta Resort 2016
description: Looks from the collection.

title: Anatomy | Me and Earl and the Dying Girl
description: In this Anatomy of a Scene, Alfonso Gomez-Rejon narrates a sequence from his film featuring Thomas Mann, Connie Britton and Nick Offerman.

title: I.R.S. Adds New Safeguards to Thwart Identity Theft and Fraud
description: Reeling from an online attack that allowed criminals to steal personal information and divert tax refunds from tens of thousands of taxpayers, the Internal Revenue Service announced on Thursday a sweeping effort to step up protections against identity theft and fraud. The actions are expected to be completed by early next year, well before the April 15 filing deadline.

title: Review: Rasheed Araeen Has First New York Solo Show at Aicon Gallery
description: Born in Pakistan in 1935 and a London resident since 1964, Rasheed Araeen has been an art-world legend since the 1980s, when he founded and edited Third Text, a journal that not only gave a voice to contemporary non-Western and nonwhite artists but also helped initiate an entire rethinking of 20th-century art history. Mr. Araeen also produced some of the most influential writing of the time (I still have his clips from 30 years ago) and organized shows like The Other Story in London, which laid the foundation for the concept that modernism, far from being a Western phenomenon, had happened all over the world, on different schedules.

title: Shares of Axovant, Alzheimers Drug Developer, Surge on Trading Debut
description: A 29-year-old former hedge fund manager has pulled off what is perhaps the largest initial public stock offering ever in the biotechnology industry, creating a company with a market value approaching $3 billion on the basis of an unproved drug for Alzheimers disease that it acquired for $5 million.

title: Review: In Joan of Arc at the Stake, Beasts With Burden of Judging
description: During a transfixing moment of the New York Philharmonics starkly dramatic staged performance of Honeggers great French oratorio Joan of Arc at the Stake on Wednesday night, the superb actress Marion Cotillard, as Joan, a spoken role, stepped haltingly across a walkway extending past the orchestra into the auditorium. At first she looked dazed and distracted. Was Joan absorbed with spiritual reverie? Hearing heavenly voices again? Or out of her mind? It seemed eerily unclear.

title: Review: From Joan Snyder, a Profusion of Flowers at Franklin Parrasch
description: Joan Snyder, who had her first solo show in New York in 1970, has always been extremely present in her paintings and, like them or not, this intensity is in itself an achievement. The best of her latest efforts, produced over the last two years, confront us with heavy textures, strong colors, bursting roseate motifs and sometimes fraught bits of language, which all coalesce into a visceral self-expression that uses nearly every means at a painters disposal, and then some. For Ms. Snyder, painting functions as a kind of scrapbook, diary, garden journal and bulletin board.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Review: Figuratively Considered Looks at Early American Modernists
description: Never underestimate the gems by unsung artists to be found along the less-traveled byways of the New York gallery world. Case in point is a selection of paintings, drawings and prints by American artists at the Kraushaar Galleries, which was founded in 1885 and is still going.

title: A Few of Christopher Lees 250 Faces
description: Christopher Lees many characters often turned from good to evil in franchises like Lord of the Rings and Star Wars. His turn as Dracula made him famous, but he also had quite the singing voice.

title: Jazz Listings for June 12-18
description: Full reviews of recent jazz performances: nytimes.com/jazz. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Dance Listings for June 12-18
description: Full reviews of recent dance performances: nytimes.com/dance. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
description: Good evening! Heres the latest.

title: Judge Ronald B. Adrines Ruling on the Cleveland Officers Involved in the Tamir Rice Shooting
description: After a public petition asking a judge to order the arrest of the two Cleveland police officers involved in the killing of Tamir Rice, a Cleveland judge ruled Thursday that probable cause existed to charge Officers Timothy Loehmann and Frank Garmback in the death of the 12-year-old boy.

title: Rescue From a Sinking Ship
description: Four men stranded on a sinking fishing vessel in Alaska were rescued by the Coast Guard just moments before their craft disappeared under the waves.

title: Classical & Opera Listings for June 12-18
description: Full reviews of recent classical performances: nytimes.com/classical. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Review: Van Gogh and Nature, Exploring the Outside World in High Relief
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass.  Someday, museums will run out of themes for packaging van Gogh exhibitions, and thats fine. Hes one of those artists you just want to spend time with, no pretext needed, because hes some kind of instant soul mate, startling, difficult, vulnerable, always willing to make so much of himself available to you.

title: Things to Do in Connecticut, June 14 to 20, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com.

title: Pop, Rock & Cabaret Listings for June 12-18
description: For full reviews of recent concerts: nytimes.com/music. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: A House Finds a New Home
description: FEW people in the New York art world  or anywhere in the world, for that matter  make an entrance with quite the flair of La Monte Young, the minimalist composer.

title: Things to Do in New Jersey, June 14 to 20, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: Comedy Listings for June 12-18
description: For news about comedy, including critical commentary: nytimes.com/arts. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Museum & Gallery Listings for June 12-18
description: Museums and galleries are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of recent art shows: nytimes.com/art. A searchable guide to these and many other art shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: New York Citys Week in Pictures: June 12
description: Photographs from the past week in New York City and the region include images from the town of Dannemora, N.Y., scene of a prison escape, and Mayor Bill de Blasios first radio call-in show.

title: Things to Do on Long Island, June 14 to 20, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: Pie Attack on Rupert Murdoch
description: Mr. Murdoch, the chairman and chief executive of News Corporation, was attacked with a shaving cream pie by a protester while testifying before a British Parliament committee in 2011.

title: Theater Listings for June 12-18
description: Approximate running times are in parentheses. Theaters are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of current productions, additional listings, showtimes and ticket information are at nytimes.com/theater. A searchable, critical guide to theater is at nytimes.com/events.

title: James Holmess Ex-Girlfriend Recalls Awkwardness and Ghoulish Remarks
description: DENVER  They got to know each other during a study group and had their first date at a horror film festival. She was his first girlfriend, and though he said he loved her, she never felt close to him. He was awkward and introverted, and mused unsettlingly about evil and justice. She once told him he should see a therapist.

title: Me and Earl and the Dying Girl (With Movie Trailer): Alfonso Gomez-Rejon Narrates a Scene
description: In the comedic drama Me and Earl and the Dying Girl, a movie-obsessed teenager named Greg (Thomas Mann) befriends his classmate Rachel (Olivia Cooke), who has been diagnosed with leukemia. The friendship begins reluctantly when Gregs mother (Connie Britton) forces him to call Rachel in this early scene from the film. The sequence plays out in one continuous take as the camera roams through Gregs home and we listen in on his conversation with Rachel.

title: Movie Listings for June 12-18
description: Ratings and running times are in parentheses; foreign films have English subtitles. For movies released on or after June 12 and full reviews of all current releases: nytimes.com/movies.

title: Brooklyn Botanics New Discovery Garden, Not Just for Kids
description: Childrens gardens often have that unfortunate dumbing-down-of-nature quality  giant neon caterpillars, cutesy mushroom houses  but there is no such condescension at the Brooklyn Botanic Gardens new Discovery Garden, which opened last Saturday.

title: Things to Do in Westchester, June 14 to 20, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com.

title: Rental Spire on 42nd Street
description: Sky, developed by Moinian Group, will be among the largest rentals in the city when it opens in a few months.

title: How Rupert Murdochs Move Will Change the Leadership at Fox
description: Rupert Murdoch plans to name his son James chief executive of 21st Century Fox.

title: New Gallery to Inject a Bit of New York Into Downtown Art World of Los Angeles
description: It isnt an expansion on the level of a Zwirner or Gagosian, but Michele Maccarone is adding a second gallery to her stable  this time in Downtown Los Angeles. Ms. Maccarone, known for her rough and funky spaces  originally on the Lower East Side and now in the West Village  is to open her new gallery on Sept. 19, one day before the scheduled debut of the Broad Museum nearby.

title: Spare Times for June 12-18
description: Young Artists at the Chelsea

title: Spare Times for Children for June 12-18
description: Pug Fun Day

title: Legislature May Make Lunar New Year a School Holiday in New York City
description: The State Senate voted unanimously this week to make the first day of the Asian lunar calendar a school holiday in New York City, and the State Assembly plans to consider a similar bill next week, suggesting that the Legislature does not want to wait for the de Blasio administration to reach its own decision on the issue.

title: Costolo Exit at Twitter Kick-Starts Deal Speculation
description: For deal makers, the departure of a chief executive always raises an interesting question: Is that company for sale?

title: The Comings and Goings of Twitter Executives
description: In the last three years, most of the top executives at Twitter have come and gone, including most recently its chief.

title: Review: The Wolfpack Shares the Story of Brothers and a Cinematic Lifeline
description: Movies can change your life, but can they save it? For most people that probably sounds foolish, but the six brothers featured in the astonishing documentary The Wolfpack arent most people. For much of their lives, these six ingenious young men used the movies to imaginatively if not physically break out of their Lower Manhattan apartment in a building run by the New York City Housing Authority. Even as their father all but imprisoned them (one year they never left the apartment), they made great metaphoric escapes by immersing themselves in the fictional realms created by directors like Francis Ford Coppola and Quentin Tarantino.

title: This Weeks Movies | June 11, 2015
description: The New York Times film critics review Jurassic World, Me and Earl and the Dying Girl and The Wolfpack.

title: Movie Review: The Wolfpack
description: The Times critic Manohla Dargis reviews The Wolfpack.

title: Movie Review: Jurassic World
description: The Times critic Manohla Dargis reviews Jurassic World.

title: Civic Group Sues to Halt Hudson River Park Backed by Barry Diller
description: Critics of the billionaire Barry Dillers plans for 2.4-acre park on a platform over the Hudson River asked a court on Thursday to halt construction of the $130 million project until it undergoes a new environmental review and is approved by the State Legislature.

title: Israeli Report Backs Tactics by Military in Gaza War
description: JERUSALEM  With a United Nations commission expected to soon release its report on last summers war between Israel and Palestinian militants in the Gaza Strip, the Israeli military late Thursday issued an update on its internal inquiries, saying neither Israeli nor international laws were broken in several attacks that led to civilian deaths.

title: Facebook Offers a Glimpse of Oculus Rift Goggles
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Facebook showed the world its first commercial version of virtual reality on Thursday  and offered tantalizing hints of how it hopes to turn three-dimensional goggles into a new kind of computing and communications device.

title: Dog-Related Bills Flood Albany as Major Legislation Stalls
description: ALBANY  They bark at their lobbyists, never talk to lawmakers, and periodically lose control of themselves in the halls of the State Capitol. And yet, for all of that, there is one constituency whose interests are exceptionally well represented in Albany this year.

title: Review: Madame Bovary Features Mia Wasikowska as a Notorious Adulteress
description: Madame Bovary, cest moi, Gustave Flaubert said of his most famous fictional creation. Impulsive, vain and sometimes cruel, she is hardly the most sympathetic character in 19th-century literature, but she is among the most vivid and complicated. Flaubert illuminated her inner life and outward circumstances with a clarity that set a new standard for the novel, one that continues to beguile, and often to frustrate, his followers.

title: De Blasio Calls Trans-Pacific Partnership a Huge Mistake
description: Reviving a public split with the White House, Mayor Bill de Blasio declared on the eve of a key vote in Washington that it would be a huge mistake for Congress to approve President Obamas chief legislative priority, a sweeping trade deal known as the Trans-Pacific Partnership.

title: Review: In Chagall-Malevich, Two Painters Clash in Revolutionary Russia
description: Set primarily in revolutionary-era Russia, Alexander Mittas Chagall-Malevich centers on the painter Marc Chagall and fictionalizes his real-life efforts to establish an artistic bulwark amid war and ideological ferment. Its a literally colorful and playful attempt to portray battlefields of artistic ambition and political struggle. But its dialogue and characters are also written as subtly as a radical manifesto.

title: Defying Obama, Many in Congress Press to Arm Ukraine
description: WASHINGTON  With the peace process stalled and violence escalating in Ukraine, a bipartisan coalition in Congress is defying President Obama and European allies by pressing the administration to provide weapons to the embattled nation.

title: Review: In The 11th Hour, Fertility Anxiety Gets Thriller Treatment
description: An unborn baby and a ticking biological clock make the scariest sounds in The 11th Hour, a troubling example of what can only be called a fertility thriller.

title: A Chinese Ebola Drug Raises Hopes, and Rancor
description: After a nurse who contracted Ebola in Sierra Leone was discharged Wednesday from a Rome hospital, a doctor there described the experimental treatments the patient had received as absolutely miraculous.

title: Save the Children Group Is Shut Down in Pakistan
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  The Pakistani authorities on Thursday shut down the aid group Save the Childrens office in Islamabad and ordered its foreign staff members to leave the country within 15 days.

title: Review: Eli Roth Presents the Stranger, a Tale Steeped in Blood
description: Though the full title of Guillermo Amoedos The Stranger bears the name of one of the films producers, the horror specialist Eli Roth (Hostel), it has its own singular, and gruesome, distinctions.

title: 2015 Womens World Cup: Norway Holds Top-Ranked Germany to a Tie
description: THURSDAYS RESULTS

title: Database May Help Identify Veterans on the Edge
description: Researchers at the Department of Veterans Affairs and the National Institutes of Health have developed a database they say can identify veterans with a high likelihood of suicide, in much the same way consumer data is used to predict shopping habits.

title: Review: An Open Secret Spotlights Child Sexual Abuse in Hollywood
description: You may miss a few moments of An Open Secret, either while looking away during its unsettling stories or closing your eyes in frustration. This potent documentary elicits those kinds of reactions.

title: A Court Keeps People Out of Rikers While Remaining Tough
description: Maybe we dont need to have 12,000 people kept on Rikers Island.

title: Louisiana Lawmakers Hold Their Noses as They Balance the Budget
description: BATON ROUGE, La.  With less than two hours left in the 2015 session, Louisiana legislators agreed Thursday on a solution to the worst budget shortfall in decades, approving a funding arrangement that drew bipartisan criticism but was seen as the only way to gain the support of Gov. Bobby Jindal and avert fiscal disaster.

title: Christen Press Went Abroad and Found a Place on the U.S. Team
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba  When Christen Press scored a goal on Monday in the United States game against Australia, there was a lightness to her celebration.

title: Saudi Arabia: Bloggers Allies Rebuffed
description: Saudi Arabia on Thursday rejected foreign criticism of the conviction and flogging punishment of Raif Badawi, a blogger who has come to symbolize what human rights advocates call the kingdoms oppressive restraints on free speech and its cruel justice system. The Foreign Ministry, in a brief statement carried by the official Saudi Press Agency, described the criticism as interference in the kingdoms internal affairs. The United States government commission on religious freedom, the European Union and human rights groups have asked King Salman to pardon Mr. Badawi, 31, whose sentence of 1,000 lashes, to be administered in weekly rounds of 50 each, was suspended in January after the first round nearly killed him. But this month the kingdoms highest court affirmed the validity of the conviction and the punishment, which also includes a 10-year prison term and a $267,000 fine. The courts decision appeared to allow for the resumption of the floggings, which could happen as early as Friday.

title: Once Down, James Murdoch Is Guided Back to the Top
description: It would be hard to overstate how bad James Murdochs reputation was in London when he left town some three and a half years ago.

title: Obama Makes Surprise Trip to Nationals Park to Lobby Pelosi
description: Facing the prospect of a devastating defeat in Congress, President Obama abruptly summoned his motorcade on Thursday night and raced to a charity baseball game to track down and lobby his top Democratic ally in the House to stand with him on trade.

title: An Unfamiliar and Tricky Course Adds to the Challenge in an L.P.G.A. Major
description: HARRISON, N.Y.  On any given week on the L.P.G.A. Tour, Christina Kims routine has few wrinkles. Play some practice-round holes before the tournament starts, keep putting preparation to about 20 minutes, then go out and play. But that has changed this week.

title: Review: Set Fire to the Stars Unleashes Dylan Thomas on America
description: Time was when the lilting incantations of the Welsh poet Dylan Thomas were viewed as visionary outpourings of a holy bohemian by audiences entranced by his mellifluous voice. Thomas was one of the first modern poets who understood that poetry readings were as much show business as they were art. Those were the days  the late 1940s and early 1950s  when the romantic notion that drunkenness was a shortcut to enlightenment held sway, and a buttoned-up society allowed bad boys like Thomas, who died in 1953 at 39, relatively free rein to misbehave.

title: Guns at Hand, a Prison Town Tracks a Manhunt for Escaped Convicts
description: DANNEMORA, N.Y.  In a town where residents are either corrections officers or live next door to one, few admit to being fearful about the two convicted murderers who escaped the walls of the prison here last weekend. But their actions reveal a heightened watchfulness.

title: Sharks 1,400-Mile Truck Trip to Brooklyn Ends Too Soon
description: Four sandbar sharks left their home in Marathon, Fla., on Wednesday morning, bound for their new home at the New York Aquarium in Coney Island.

title: Orange Is the New Black Season 3 Premiere Recap: Mothers Day Visit
description: Season 3, Episode 1: Mothers Day

title: For Twitter, Future Means Here and Now
description: Here, in 140 characters or fewer, is some free advice for Twitters next chief executive: Focus on live events. People never tire of gabbing about whats going on right now. Twitter could be the best place for that. Do it fast.

title: Review: Live From New York! Celebrates 40 Years of Saturday Night Live
description: Live From New York!, Bao Nguyens unfocused, skimpy history of Saturday Night Live, resembles a smiley-faced Sunday morning infomercial for a vintage pop music collection. Stumbling upon such an ad, chances are you might linger long enough to feel a nostalgic tug upon hearing a fragment of a favorite oldie but goodie before changing channels. You are also reminded of how much time has passed and how quickly the years have flown. The shows 40-year existence, after all, is roughly half a lifetime.

title: Outsourcing Companies Under Scrutiny Over Visas for Technology Workers
description: The Department of Labor has opened an investigation into two India-based outsourcing companies for possible violations of rules for visas for foreign technology workers under contracts they held with an electric utility, Southern California Edison. The power company recently laid off more than 500 technology workers. Many said they were made to train replacements who were immigrants on temporary visas, known as H-1B, brought in by the Indian firms, Tata Consultancy Services and Infosys. Senators Richard Durbin of Illinois, a Democrat, and Jeff Sessions of Alabama, a Republican, announced the investigation after they were notified by the department.

title: David Guttenfelder, a Photojournalist, Answers Readers Questions on North Korea
description: David Guttenfelder, a photojournalist and National Geographic Fellow, recently spent six days in North Korea on assignment for The New York Times. He answered readers questions during a Q. and A. on Facebook on Thursday on everyday life in North Korea and his working conditions there. Mr. Guttenfelder, who has been to North Korea about 40 times, received questions on a wide range of topics, including malnutrition, censorship and the availability of American TV shows like Keeping Up With the Kardashians.

title: Former Worker Arrested in Brooklyn Group Home Investigation
description: A worker at a group home for boys in Brooklyn has been arrested after three boys he claimed he was monitoring slipped out of the home, city investigators said on Thursday. The boys are accused of raping, robbing and beating a woman while they were out.

title: Review: Guards at the Taj, Two Ordinary Guys Ordered to Do the Unthinkable
description: The Taj Mahal is among the worlds most ravishingly beautiful creations, but should you have a chance to see it in person after watching Guards at the Taj, a new play by Rajiv Joseph, you may find yourself viewing it through a bloodstained haze. In this mostly absorbing two-hander, which opened on Thursday in an Atlantic Theater Company production directed by the noted actor Amy Morton, Mr. Joseph dramatizes a dark myth about its building that stands as a grim allegory of the supreme divide between the powerful and the powerless in 17th-century India and, perhaps by extension, many places today.

title: Emulate an Esne
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  Are you READY to roll with the crunchy fun of a themeless Friday puzzle? Or are you letting the white space and ramped-up clues frighten you away?

title: 12 Held as Police Break Up Staten Island Heroin Ring
description: The New York police this week broke up a sprawling family-run network of drug dealers, according to the acting district attorney for Staten Island, who said the ring was run by two stepbrothers whose operation helped fuel an explosion of heroin use in the borough.

title: Federal Money for Education Surpasses States Contributions
description: Reversing a pattern, federal funding for higher education has in recent years outstripped state funding. According to a new report from the Pew Charitable Trusts, the federal government supplied $75.6 billion in 2013, the latest year for which data is available, and state governments supplied $72.7 billion. From 2000 to 2012, federal per-student spending increased by 32 percent, while state spending dropped by 37 percent. Generally, the federal government provides financial help to individual students and specific research projects, while state funds go toward public institutions general operations. Much of the growth of federal higher-education spending has been increases in veterans education benefits and Pell grants.

title: David Wilson Makes Jump (Actually Three) to Life After N.F.L.
description: Ten months after saying a tearful goodbye to football, the former Giants running back David Wilson is running again.

title: Knee Injury Also Hurts Finances of New Jet
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  When Stevan Ridley excelled as a running back at Louisiana State, he dreamed of earning a lucrative N.F.L. contract one day and the material pleasures it would bring. When he signed a relatively modest deal as a third-round draft choice of the New England Patriots in 2011, he drew motivation from knowing that free agency could yield the big money he desired once he proved himself.

title: Cuomo Seeks to Link Bills on Rent Regulation and Private School Tax Credits
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said on Thursday that he was trying to get two contentious legislative issues  rent regulations and a tax credit meant to expand access to private schools  approved by the Assembly and the Senate by linking the fates of both.

title: Man Found Dead in Queens Park Was Killed
description: The death of a 23-year-old man found in a Queens park this week has been ruled a homicide, the police said on Thursday.

title: Sexism in the Lab
For the Rohingya of Myanmar, a Hardscrabble Existence
description: Their harrowing exodus has slowed, if only temporarily. And many members of this persecuted ethnic group remain desperate to make their getaway.

title: Mervin Field Dies at 94; Took Pulse of California as Pollster
description: LOS ANGELES  Mervin Field was a college dropout. He had no formal training in polling or statistics. He bagged groceries while growing up in Princeton, N.J. He went to San Francisco after World War II with the unlikely goal of starting a one-man marketing research firm. Business was so slow that he worked nights pumping gas.

title: Indian Journalist Who Linked Official to Graft Dies
description: NEW DELHI  They came in the heat of the late afternoon, two cars jammed with enforcers and police officers allied with a local dairy minister. They charged into the reporters house and reminded him that he had been warned many times that he should not write anything against the minister.

title: Good Fortune Comes and Goes, but Mets Grind Out a Win
description: When Mets Manager Terry Collins ran into the Hall 0f Fame pitcher John Smoltz on Thursday afternoon, he had to reply with a mix of humor and curtness when asked how he was doing.

title: At the Whitneys Untitled Restaurant, Downtown Plates Mirror the Change in Scenery
description: When the Whitney Museum of American Art moved from the Upper East Side to the Meatpacking District this spring, it traded its proximity to the large green rectangle of Central Park for sweeping views of the High Line, where Piet Oudolfs unruly garden landscape spills onto the former railroad trestle in the most organic of ways. In the above video, the chefs at the Whitneys new restaurant, Untitled, discuss how the museums change in scenery inspires the dishes they serve and the atmosphere they have created within the new Renzo Piano-designed building. And below, they share a recipe off the Untitled menu for lobster toast.

title: A Grand Havana Home
description: For one couple, realizing their dream house as a cultural salon in Cuba has been more than a labor of love. Its been a lesson in patience, perseverance and wild invention.

title: Word of the Day | fleece
description: fleece  \fles\  noun and verb

title: N.B.A. Finals: Golden State Warriors Get Mad and Pull Even With Cleveland Cavaliers
description: CLEVELAND  Before they arrived at Quicken Loans Arena on Thursday night, the Golden State Warriors spent roughly 45 hours stewing over their predicament in the N.B.A. finals. Choose an adjective, any adjective: upset, frustrated, angry or perhaps several others not suitable for print.

title: Your Turn: A Weekend Thread, Open for Comments
description: Welcome to Motherlodes weekly open thread. Do you have thoughts about the news this week, and how it affects families? A question to ask? A rant to share? This is your place. Go.

title: Whats on TV Friday
description: 8:45 A.M. (Sundance) DOMINO (2005) Keira Knightley stars as Domino Harvey, the daughter of a jet-setting mother and the movie actor Laurence Harvey, who, despite her privileged upbringing, became a bounty hunter in South Central Los Angeles. Writing in The New York Times, Manohla Dargis called this biopic, whose ensemble cast features Mickey Rourke, Christopher Walken, Delroy Lindo, Jacqueline Bisset, Dabney Coleman and MoNique, a lollapalooza of delectable cheap thrills. What makes it the ultimate Tony Scott movie  or as a friend put it, Its all the Tony Scott you could possibly want in a Tony Scott movie!  is its uncharacteristically sharp screenplay, she said of its script by Richard Kelly. Mr. Scott has worked with talented writers before, but this is the first time he has shot a film written by a screenwriter who both cops to the great enjoyment that can be had from the modern action movie  perhaps best illustrated here by the sight of Ms. Knightley unloading two machine guns at once  and blows the action-movie tropes to smithereens.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: There are dead fish in my living room.

title: Corrections: June 12, 2015
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Following Smugglers in Kurdistan
description: Born in the Sulaimaniyah Governorate of Iraqi Kurdistan, Aram Karim had long been aware of the smugglers whose covert businesses, ferrying all manner of goods, operated along the borders that fragmented his native land. Granted, he had a personal insight from years ago: He had tried  and failed  to be smuggled into Turkey three times. Yet while the struggles of these impoverished villagers living on the margins were widely known, they were rarely documented.

title: Following Smugglers in Kurdistan
description: Born in the Sulaimaniyah Governorate of Iraqi Kurdistan, Aram Karim had long been aware of the smugglers whose covert businesses, ferrying all manner of goods, operated along the borders that fragmented his native land. Granted, he had a personal insight from years ago: He had tried  and failed  to be smuggled into Turkey three times. Yet while the struggles of these impoverished villagers living on the margins were widely known, they were rarely documented.

title: How Adulthood Happens
description: Every society has its rites of passage, marking the transition from youth to adulthood. Most of these rites of passage are ritualized and structured, with adult supervision and celebration. But the major rite of passage in our society is unritualized, unstructured and unnamed. Most of the people in the middle of it dont even know it is going on. It happens between ages 22 and 30.

title: Seriously Bad Ideas
description: Oxford, Britain  One thing weve learned in the years since the financial crisis is that seriously bad ideas  by which I mean bad ideas that appeal to the prejudices of Very Serious People  have remarkable staying power. No matter how much contrary evidence comes in, no matter how often and how badly predictions based on those ideas are proved wrong, the bad ideas just keep coming back. And they retain the power to warp policy.

title: The Effects of Texas Abortion Laws
description: To the Editor:

title: On Not Sharing My Data
description: To the Editor:

title: A Pill to Boost Female Libido
description: A federal advisory panel has recommended that the Food and Drug Administration approve the first drug to treat a lack of sexual desire in otherwise healthy women. Some womens groups are hailing this as a breakthrough in gender equality, a start to closing the gap between men, who have numerous drugs to treat sexual dysfunction, and women, who have none. But the panels recommendation was laced with so many caveats that it seems clear that this particular drug  flibanserin  is only marginally effective and carries some risk of serious adverse effects.

title: Let Rich and Poor Learn Together
description: THE mayor of New York City, Bill de Blasio, campaigned on a promise to provide free universal pre-K classes to more than 70,000 4-year-olds. The city is now poised to meet this ambitious goal.

title: New Yorks Housing Emergency
description: New York States lawmakers are scheduled to shut down their legislative work for the year next Wednesday. That is a meaningless, self-declared deadline, which means Gov. Andrew Cuomo and the Legislature have no excuse for failing to deal with some of the most urgent matters on their agenda, like housing in New York City.

title: All Work Is Noble: The Meaning of a Summer Job
Greece, a Financial Zombie State
description: Greece and the other countries in the eurozone are once again at an impasse days ahead of a crucial deadline. If the two sides do not reach an agreement on how to extend a 240 billion euro ($270 billion) loan program beyond June 30, Greece will most likely default on its debts and would probably be forced to abandon the euro.

title: Test Yourself | The Story of Six Brothers Who Didnt Leave Their Apartment for Years
description: Below, several paragraphs from a June 10 article, The Wolfpack Brothers Step Out of Their World.

title: The Tribe, Set at a Grim School for the Deaf, Forgoes Subtitles for Its Fierce Sign Language
description: Its not every day that a film from Ukraine is released in the United States without subtitles. But The Tribe is in so many ways a special case: a crime drama about a teenage deaf mafia in which the only words used are sign language. As conceived, written and directed by Myroslav Slaboshpytskiy, the movie tells its story of violence and love through visuals alone, withholding translations of the nonprofessional actors passionate signing.

title: Goodfellas, 25 Years On: Cast Members Reminisce
description: Its been 25 years since Martin Scorseses seminal gangster film Goodfellas opened to the adulation of critics, among them Vincent Canby of The New York Times, who hailed it as breathless and brilliant. Though its now considered a classic, counted by the American Film Institute as one of the countrys 100 greatest films, its foul-mouthed tale of the rise and fall of the murderous Henry Hill; his wife, Karen; and his patron, Paulie, left early audiences cold. In a nod to the anniversary, Film Forum is screening a newly restored version of the movie starting next Friday.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Transgender Childrens Books Fill a Void and Break a Taboo
description: In Transgender Childrens Books Fill a Void and Break a Taboo, Alexandra Alter reports on authors who are writing about transgender issues in childrens literature.

title: Myanmars Missing Rohingya
description: At a makeshift government encampment in Sittwe, Myanmar, holding 140,000 Rohingya, a persecuted Muslim ethnic group, I asked camp residents if they had relatives who had traveled to Malaysia.

title: Myanmar to Bar Rohingya From Fleeing, but Wont Address Their Plight
description: SITTWE, Myanmar  The government of Myanmar says it is determined to stop the departures of migrants fleeing religious persecution in places like this bitterly divided port city, but it will not budge in its refusal to address the conditions driving the exodus across the sea.

title: The Memory-Keeper of SoHo
description: In the four-story loft building where she grew up, Yukie Ohta, a 46-year-old archivist, picked up a Mason jar filled with small leather rags and took a long nostalgic whiff. Then she handed the jar to a visitor and exclaimed, This is a SoHo smell.

title: House Rejects Trade Measure, Rebuffing Obamas Dramatic Appeal
description: WASHINGTON  Hours after President Obama made a dramatic, personal appeal for support, House Democrats on Friday thwarted his push to expand trade negotiating power  and quite likely his chance to secure a legacy-defining accord spanning the Pacific Ocean.

title: Rising Costs a Concern for Land-Lease Building Owners
description: Marc Cooper knew exactly what he was getting into in 2011 when he purchased three apartments at Trump Plaza.

title: Scott Walker and the Fate of the Union
description: On his first day of work in three months, Randy Bryce asked his foreman for the next day off. He wanted to go to the Capitol in Madison, Wis., and testify against a proposed law. Bryce, a member of Milwaukee Ironworkers Local 8, was unloading truckloads of steel beams to build a warehouse near Kenosha, and he needed the job. He has an 8-year-old son, his debts were piling up and a 10-hour shift paid more than $300. But the legislation, which Republicans were rushing through the State Senate, angered him enough to sacrifice the hours. Supporters called it a right to work bill, because it prohibited unions from requiring employees to pay dues. But to Bryce, that appealing name hid the true purpose of the bill, which was to destroy unions.

title: For Rohingya, Days of Waiting
description: Thousands of Rohingya Muslims have been fleeing persecution in Myanmar. Recently the departures have abated, though the situation may be temporary. And many remain eager to leave.

title: Hillary Clinton Embraces Her Mothers Emotional Tale
description: Dorothy Howell was 8 years old when her parents sent her away. It was 1927. Her mother and father, who fought violently in the Chicago boardinghouse where the family lived, divorced. Neither was willing to take care of Dorothy or her little sister.

title: Summer Reading Contest, Week 1 | What Interested You Most in The Times This Week?
description: Our Sixth Annual Summer Reading Contest begins!

title: Rules of Engagement
description: American instructors offer some timely tips to warring Iraqis.

title: The Obamacare Disinformation Loop
description: Over the past few weeks Ive been watching a real-time demonstration of how American voters come to be misinformed about key policy issues. Yes, its Obamacare again.

title: The Obamacare Disinformation Loop
description: Over the past few weeks Ive been watching a real-time demonstration of how American voters come to be misinformed about key policy issues. Yes, its Obamacare again.

title: Ask Well: Exercise and Heart Damage
description: Question:

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Organic Farmers Object to Whole Foods Rating System
description: Like a whale and the myriad barnacles clinging to its sides, Whole Foods Market and organic farmers have long had a symbiotic relationship.

title: Germany Drops Inquiry Into Claims U.S. Tapped Angela Merkels Phone
description: BERLIN  Germanys federal prosecutor said on Friday that he had dropped a formal investigation into allegations of eavesdropping on one of Chancellor Angela Merkels cellphones by an American intelligence agency because of a lack of concrete evidence.

title: New York Today: Cleaning Up
description: Good morning on this hot Friday.

title: New York Today: Cleaning Up
description: Good morning on this hot Friday.

title: Mow the Lawn
description: LONDON  My youngest child, Adele, graduated from the American School in London this week. Shes off to college in California, whence I suspect she will never return. As places to stay go, California is up there. Whenever Im there I wonder why I leave. Unencumbered by too much past, it offers the sunlit tug of the future.

title: When a High Salary Is a Hurdle
description: Send your workplace conundrums to workologist@nytimes.com, including your name and contact information (even if you want it withheld for publication). The Workologist is a guy with well-intentioned opinions, not a professional career adviser. Letters may be edited.

title: France Wants Google to Apply Right to Be Forgotten Ruling Worldwide or Face Penalties
description: LONDON  Frances privacy watchdog on Friday called on Google to apply a European data protection ruling to its global domains or face financial penalties.

title: Advancing TB Test Technology, Where It Matters Most
description: On a recent morning in a Ho Chi Minh City intensive-care unit, Cao Thi My Hanh sat crying and clutching her 5-month-old granddaughter, Nguyen Dang Thanh Phuong. More than a month earlier she had noticed the baby coughing and struggling to breathe. Hanh took her granddaughter to see several doctors in her rural province, but they all failed to give her a proper diagnosis. When she finally reached this large urban hospital, she found out that Phuong had tuberculosis, and realized the weeks of inadequate care had given the life-threatening illness time to take hold.

title: French Court AcquitsDominique Strauss-Kahn in Case That Put His Sex Life on View
