title: In Europe, Leaders Take Note: Jeb Bush Isnt His Brother
description: BERLIN  After emerging from a 45-minute meeting here with Jeb Bush, the foreign minister of Germany, Frank-Walter Steinmeier, told colleagues that what struck him most about the American was not the strength of his opinions but something simpler: the depth of his curiosity.

title: Guns in Your Face
description: Life in America requires a lot of advance preparation. For instance, when youre getting ready for a plane trip you imagine what youll do if a problem arises  flight delay, long lines at security. But I bet you havent considered the best way to react if the man in front of you on the airport escalator has a gun dangling from his shoulder.

title: A Flushing Meadows Chronicler of Soccer and Immigration
description: It was a recent Sunday morning and Luis Muoz was in his usual place, the crowded soccer fields at Flushing Meadows-Corona Park in Queens. He was not wearing cleats but white orthopedic-style tennis shoes. And he wove among the jerseys not with a ball but with a camera.

title: Donors Speed-Date the G.O.P. Hopefuls
description: PARK CITY, Utah  When Republican donors and operatives descended on Mitt Romneys annual retreat at a five-star European-style lodge here last year, they came to pay homage to Mr. Romney and try to regroup after losing the 2012 presidential race.

title: Plea Deal in Case Tied to Derek Boogaards Death
description: Oscar Johnson, a former medical assistant for hockeys minor league Utah Grizzlies, may have never met Derek Boogaard, the deceased N.H.L. left wing. But Johnson has agreed to plead guilty in a case involving painkillers he prescribed that may have ended up in the hands of Boogaard shortly before his death.

title: Asian Migrants Say Australia Paid Smugglers to Turn Back
description: GENEVA  Asian migrants on a boat that was intercepted by the Australian authorities three weeks ago have told refugee workers that the Australians paid the smugglers to take them back to Indonesia, a United Nations official said on Friday.

title: Jim Ed Brown, Smooth Voice on The Three Bells and Other Hits, Dies at 81
description: Jim Ed Brown, a Grand Ole Opry star whose smooth, sweet baritone made him a chart-topper as a solo act, in duets with Helen Cornelius and as one third of the close-harmony group the Browns, whose 1959 hit The Three Bells sold more than a million records, died on Thursday in Franklin, Tenn. He was 81.

title: U.S. Soccer Defends Actions in Hope Solo Case
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba  The United States Soccer Federation, under intensifying scrutiny for its handling of a case involving domestic violence accusations against goalkeeper Hope Solo, on Friday mounted a detailed defense of its actions and of its decision not to suspend Solo from the national team for the current Womens World Cup.

title: Jane Hart, Activist and Nearly an Astronaut, Dies at 93
description: Jane Briggs Hart, a flying enthusiast, would-be astronaut and competitive equestrian and sailor whose outspoken views on womens rights, the Roman Catholic Church and the Vietnam War sometimes made political life a challenge for her husband, Philip A. Hart, a Democratic senator from Michigan in the 1960s and 70s, died on June 5 in Bloomfield, Conn. She was 93.

title: Police Review Board Seeks Grand Jury Records in Eric Garner Case
description: The debate over grand jury records connected to the chokehold death of Eric Garner at the hands of the police took a new turn on Friday as lawyers argued over whether the Staten Island district attorneys office should provide that material to the Civilian Complaint Review Board.

title: Robert Chartoff, Producer of Raging Bull and Rocky, Dies at 81
description: Robert Chartoff, half of the powerful Hollywood producing team behind Rocky and Raging Bull as well as other high-profile dramas, died on Wednesday at his home in Santa Monica, Calif. He was 81.

title: Bartolo Colon Earns Ninth Victory as Mets Defeat the Braves
description: Bartolo Colon strolled into the clubhouse at Citi Field three and a half hours before his start Friday. He was wearing sunglasses, jeans and a red T-shirt. He looked at ease.

title: Womens World Cup: U.S. Earns a Draw the Hard Way
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba  At 5 feet 2 inches, left back Meghan Klingenberg is the smallest player on the American womens national team, but she made probably the biggest play on Friday night to preserve a 0-0 tie with Sweden in the World Cup.

title: Michael Pinedas Time Off Leads to a Forgettable Start
description: BALTIMORE  Over the course of a six-month grind of a baseball season, a night like Friday, when the Yankees were drubbed by the Baltimore Orioles, 11-3, is one that might normally be easily forgotten.

title: 6 Guantnamo Detainees From Yemen Are Transferred to Oman
description: WASHINGTON  The United States has transferred six lower-level detainees from the prison at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, where each had been held for more than 13 years, the military announced early Saturday. The departures, to Oman, were the first from the prison in six months and reduced the inmate population there to 116 prisoners.

title: Whats on TV Saturday
description: 7:30 P.M. (HBO) GET ON UP (2014) Chadwick Boseman shuffles, spins and splits as James Brown, the hardest-working man in show business  as well as a monumental egotist, perfectionist and harsh taskmaster with a streak of paranoia  in this biopic directed by Tate Taylor (The Help). Nelsan Ellis is Bobby Byrd, Browns longtime best friend, who sticks around as the wives and girlfriends come and go. Browns music and show business ascendance are the heart and soul of a movie that takes his art very seriously, Stephen Holden wrote in The New York Times. None other than Mick Jagger, who has made no secret of his indebtedness to Browns stage moves, is the music producer of this film, which puts music front and center, where it belongs. Browns real voice, which never sounds dubbed, is used in remixes of his original recordings. And while the film largely skirts the issue of race along with Browns alienation of black audiences because of his support of Richard M. Nixon, in the end, he stood above it all, Mr. Holden added. Having won the game, he dwelt in his own realm, where he ruled once and for always as the Godfather of Soul.

title: Experts Fault South Korean Response to MERS Outbreak
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The South Korean governments failure to share information quickly with the public and establish an efficient disease-control system contributed to worsening the outbreak of Middle East respiratory syndrome in the country, a joint panel of experts from the World Health Organization and South Korea said Saturday.

Billed as a High Line for the Forest, the Wild Walk is an elevated nature trail and interactive museum that weaves into the treetops of Tupper Lake in northern New York.

title: Dallas Gunman Killed After Attack on Police Headquarters
description: DALLAS  A gunman attacked Police Headquarters at the edge of downtown here from inside an armored van early Saturday, shooting at officers and leaving bags filled with pipe bombs around the building in a brazen assault that led to an hourslong standoff. Hours after negotiators who had tried to persuade him to surrender lost contact, the suspect was found dead in the van after being shot by a police sniper, the police said.

It is easy to get disoriented, local residents say, and between the bugs and the wet weather, it might be the second worst time of year for anyone to try seek refuge there. title: Long Island Restaurants Serve Up Tacos for Summer
description: A Long Island Railroad train periodically roared past Chichimecas Music and TAM Bar Restaurant in Farmingdale on a recent evening, but diners paid no mind. They were listening instead to Alejandro Gonzalez as he played a rousing guitar duet of Guantanamera with a fellow musician. The dining room, festooned with colorful Mexican flags, woven serape tablecloths, maracas and murals, captured the mood of a neighborhood social club buoyed by food, music and margaritas.

title: Director Reflects on His Tenure at Long Island Arts Camp
description: Oh, I wish Usdan had existed for me, Dale Lewis said, with both a sigh and a smile, in his office at the Long Island arts day camp, which is unusual in both its name and its offerings.

title: What Could Gay Marriage Mean for the Kids?
description: When courts consider same-sex unions, they often ask about what life is like for children with gay parents. Here are some answers.

title: Fossil Fuel Divestment Movement Harnesses the Power of Shame
description: Norway this month became an unlikely leader in a growing social movement: persuading investors to sell their stock in fossil fuel companies.

title: Restaurant Review: Rye House in Port Chester
description: At first blush, Rye House looks a little like a mead hall, but once your eyes adjust to the dim light, it looks more like a loft apartment with bachelor accouterments: leather upholstery, rough-hewed posts and beams, tilted mirrors, dual flat screens and a well-stocked bar. Was it a surprise that on a Saturday night the Port Chester restaurant was packed with middle-aged guys in untucked Hawaiian shirts gripping frosty glasses of craft beer and goblets of red wine? Were they also holding tickets to hear the likes of Deep Purple at the nearby Capitol Theater? Showtime came and went, and few budged.

title: Hillary Clinton, in Roosevelt Island Speech, Pledges to Close Income Gap
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton, in a speech that was at times sweeping and at times policy laden, delivered on Saturday a pointed repudiation of Republican economic policies and a populist promise to reverse the gaping gulf between the rich and poor at her biggest campaign event to date.

title: The Chat: Hillary Clintons Rally Speech, Instantly Analyzed
description: Two months after announcing her presidential candidacy by video, Hillary Rodham Clinton held her first campaign rally shortly before noon Saturday on Roosevelt Island in New York City. Over instant messages, two New York Times political correspondents analyzed Mrs. Clintons remarks in real time  as they did with Mrs. Clintons announcement video and with the campaign announcements of several other 2016 candidates. Here is an edited version of their chat.

title: N.F.L.s Unsteady Stance on a Tricky Gambling Landscape
description: As the quarterback of the Dallas Cowboys, Tony Romo is a lightning rod for many things, starting with his teams inability to make it to the Super Bowl, and the pop stars he has dated.

title: Support for Holocaust Survivors
description: Temmi Merlis, 27, is a social worker at the Blue Card, a New York-based nonprofit organization that helps Holocaust survivors.

title: Hillary Clintons Campaign Kickoff Speech
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton gave her first big speech of her 2016 presidential campaign on Roosevelt Island in New York City.

title: Hillary Outlines Campaign Focus
description: Hillary Clinton speaks at her campaign launch rally on Roosevelt Island in New York City.

title: 3 Pieces to Debut at Caramoor Summer Festival
description: Over the years, the Caramoor Center for Music and the Arts in Katonah has opened its summer stage early, and often, to notable premieres, from the American debut of Benjamin Brittens trilogy of operatic church parables in the 1960s to the inaugural performance of David Ludwigs String Quartet No. 1: Pale Blue Dot last year.

title: Copa Amrica Tickets, Finally, Are Hard to Come By
description: VIA DEL MAR, Chile  Eduardo Santa Cruz has been attending Copa Amrica games in Chile since 1955, when he was 5 years old and his parents took him to games in Santiago.

title: Primates of Times Square: A Case Study
description: WHEN did The Timess coverage of Wednesday Martins book, Primates of Park Avenue, reach critical mass? Or perhaps the question should be: When did it catapult into excess?

title: The Dannemora Dilemma
description: NOT many small American towns stick in your memory 10 years after you last drove through them. But New Yorks Dannemora, site of last weekends remarkable prison break, is a vivid exception.

title: Obamas Flickering Greatness
description: WASHINGTON

title: Its Not Just About Bad Choices
description: BALTIMORE

title: Jayson Lusk
description: Jayson Lusk is a food and agricultural economist at Oklahoma State University who studies what we eat and why we eat it.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: Casely-Hayford: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: London

title: Caitlyn Jenner and Gender Stereotypes
description: To the Editor:

title: Lost Voices of the Worlds Refugees
description: The global crisis of people forcibly displaced by conflict or persecution is expressed in many ways  in faceless numbers, always millions more than in the previous year; in the images of desperate people crowded onto rickety boats; in the pictures of endless tents on a barren, dusty field. Around the world, at least 50 million people either have been displaced inside their countries or have fled to foreign lands. Some, like Palestinians, have lived as refugees for generations; some, like Syrians and Ukrainians, are fleeing more recent conflicts; some, like the Rohingya of Myanmar, run from systematic persecution.

title: For a Catcher Who Had a Pitchers Surgery, Recovery From a Different Angle
description: BALTIMORE  Matt Wieters does not pitch for a living, but from every other angle, he is an expert on the pitching arm. As the catcher for the Baltimore Orioles, Wieters works with pitchers and hits against them hundreds of times a year. He also had Tommy John surgery last June.

title: Lane Opens for Driver Who Hit Wall
description: Although the 16-car field for the 2015 Nascar Sprint Cup playoff will not be set until September, it isnt hard to identify the drivers to beat this year. The six-time Cup champion Jimmie Johnson and last years winner, Kevin Harvick, have been the class of the series to date.

title: Will Nebraskas Death Penalty Come Back?
description: In a sensible, humane move last month, Nebraska lawmakers abolished the states death penalty by a 30-to-19 vote that crossed party lines and overrode a veto by Gov. Pete Ricketts. These lawmakers arent renegades; an April poll by the American Civil Liberties Union of Nebraska found that 58 percent of Nebraskans supported alternatives to the death penalty, like life without parole.

title: Putting an End to Abusive Car Loans
description: Auto loans have long been a bastion of predatory lending and racial discrimination. Until the federal Consumer Financial Protection Bureau was established, auto lending by banks was only lightly regulated, and lending by nonbank finance companies escaped federal regulation altogether. Greater scrutiny of banks by the bureau since 2013 has resulted in fines totaling $18 million and in payments totaling $136 million to 425,000 black, Hispanic and Asian borrowers who were charged higher auto-loan interest rates than comparable white borrowers.

title: U.S. Is Poised to Put Heavy Weaponry in Eastern Europe
description: RIGA, Latvia  In a significant move to deter possible Russian aggression in Europe, the Pentagon is poised to store battle tanks, infantry fighting vehicles and other heavy weapons for as many as 5,000 American troops in several Baltic and Eastern European countries, American and allied officials say.

title: Restaurant Review: Jammin Crpes in Princeton
description: Cookbook author and French food aficionado Richard Olney wrote of crepes that their greatest pitfalls derive, no doubt, from their versatility  not in itself a fault, but a quality that teases many a cook into overstepping the boundaries of sense and taste. One should never lose sight of the fragile and delicate, thin, tender thing that is the crepe itself. Olney, writing in the 1970s, proposed that home cooks roll savory crepes around calfs brains or, for dessert, sauce them with chartreuse.

title: Cavaliers Lucky Charm Teeters on Six Chairs
description: CLEVELAND  On Sunday afternoon, Gary Borstelmann will load six wooden chairs into the back of his Chrysler minivan and set out for Cleveland from his home in New Smyrna Beach, Fla. He expects that the 1,200-mile drive will take two days, but at least he will have the company of his personal assistant, Patricia Murphy, and his pet turtle, Frick.

title: How to Make Online Dating Work
description: WE turn to screens for nearly every decision. Where to eat. Where to vacation. Where to eat on vacation. Where to get treatment for the food poisoning you got at that restaurant where you ate on vacation. Where to write a negative review calling out the restaurant that gave you food poisoning and ruined your vacation. So its no surprise our screens are becoming the first place we turn to when looking for romance  because you need someone to take care of you when you get food poisoning on your vacation, right?

title: At Audible, Work Speaks Volumes
description: On a gray April morning in Newark, Jonathan Davis, an actor, sat in a conference room and paused to consider the value of his work.

title: The Toxic Legacy of Lead Paint
description: New Orleans

title: Review: Moxie in Madison
description: Coolness, in a restaurant or any other endeavor, is an elusive quality to pin down. A place thats cool has to be stylish, but without seeming like its trying too hard. It may be unusual, even offbeat, but it cant be off-putting. And it must somehow convey both exclusivity and affability. A cool hangout might make you feel a little self-conscious the first time you walk in, but you relax quickly. Because being welcomed there means you must be cool, too.

title: Flawed Humans, Flawed Justice
description: WHAT would it take to achieve true criminal justice in America?

title: Review: Good People, in Hartford, Deals With Characters in, and From, Southie
description: When Margie Walsh, the tough-talking heroine of David Lindsay-Abaires Good People, tells her one-time boyfriend Mike that hes become like someone on a television show, its far from a compliment. She means that as a well-off doctor living in a moneyed suburb of Boston, with a bespoke wife and a pampered child, hes a traitor to their class and to their shared roots in hardscrabble Southie, the blue-collar South Boston neighborhood once famous for being poor, Irish and bigoted.

title: Bearing My Fathers Byline
description: Until he wandered into The Baltimore Sun in the fall of 1959 and found his calling in life, it would be fair to say that my father suffered from an acute identity crisis. Though his given name was George Melvin, no one called him that, if only to avoid confusion with my grandfather. Around the rowhouse in East Baltimore where Dad grew up, everyone always called him Sonny. As a high school athlete who lettered in three sports, he was known as Otts, the origins of which are unclear. In his incarnation in later years as a fledging bush-league baseball player, he adopted the sobriquet Randy because he felt it created the illusion that he could run faster. Im not kidding. He actually thought that.

title: Regulation and Arbitrage (Implicitly Wonkish)
description: According to the FT, the financial fear du jour is no longer Greece, or inflation, or any of the other things that have obsessed markets in recent years; its liquidity. We are pointed to a recent column by Stephen Schwarzman, who warns that lack of liquidity is just like when Hitler invaded Poland (sorry, he said that about ending the tax loophole for equity managers) may cause a financial crisis; Nouriel Roubini agrees.

title: Regulation and Arbitrage (Implicitly Wonkish)
description: According to the FT, the financial fear du jour is no longer Greece, or inflation, or any of the other things that have obsessed markets in recent years; its liquidity. We are pointed to a recent column by Stephen Schwarzman, who warns that lack of liquidity is just like when Hitler invaded Poland (sorry, he said that about ending the tax loophole for equity managers) may cause a financial crisis; Nouriel Roubini agrees.

title: Organ and Organist Lend the Lightning a Thunderous Grandeur
description: TAMPA, Fla.  At the south end of Amalie Arena, perched atop a stage, sits the largest organ in the N.H.L. It features five rows of keys, four rows of switches, a host of buttons and, underneath, several pedals. At times, Krystof Srebrakowski, the organist, seems to use every one of its features, bobbing his head, his eyes closed, his feet dancing between pedals, his fingers gliding along.

title: Birds of New York: A Soundscape
Aid to Women, or Bottom Line? Advocates Split on Libido Pill
description: WASHINGTON  At a small luncheon last July in an elegant downtown restaurant, two well-known Washington feminists came to celebrate Cindy Whitehead, a senior executive at a pharmaceutical firm that is developing a pill to revive womens sex drive.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Article Overlooks Women and W.N.B.A.

title: Iranian President Expects Sanctions to Lift Within Months of Deal
description: TEHRAN  With a little more than two weeks before the deadline for a nuclear deal, Irans president, Hassan Rouhani, said Saturday that he expected relief from economic sanctions within a couple of months after an agreement with six world powers was signed.

title: Play Set in Israeli Prison Imperils Arab Theater
description: HAIFA, Israel  The play had been staged many times for Arabic-speaking audiences in Israel without controversy. But a performance with Hebrew subtitles for a wider audience was all it took to touch off a major furor.

title: On Randalls Island, the Rhythm and Physics of Throwing a Javelin
description: Tim Glover, the top javelin thrower in the United States, shrugged off one indignity after another performing one of the less appreciated sports at the Adidas Grand Prix on Randalls Island on Saturday. Forget finishing in seventh place (it happens): it was not yet 10 a.m., and the stadiums mostly containing the parents of 11-year-olds running relay races. But the music was too much.

title: Three Simple Rules for Eating Seafood
description: NEARLY a decade ago, the writer Michael Pollan advised: Eat food. Not too much. Mostly plants. Ever since, a certain kind of progressive supermarket aisle has emerged: Real foods, calorie-limited portions and vegetarianism (or at least Meatless Mondays) have become culinary aspirations for millennials and boomers alike.

title: Business Dynasties Try to Pass the Torch Without Dropping It
description: Rupert Murdoch should be as lucky as Avedis Zildjian.

title: The Scene
description: Casely-Hayford at London Collections Men.

title: Photo Diary: Casely-Hayford Spring/Summer 2016
description: Scenes from London Collections Men, captured by Alexandra Waespi.

title: Bernie Sanders Can Take Heart From a Broadway Champ
description: IF you want to support Senator Bernie Sanders for president but worry that he doesnt have a shot against Hillary Rodham Clinton for the Democratic nomination, take heart from the Broadway show Fun Home, which won the Tony Award for best musical last week.

title: Seattle Team Wins a Sailing Challenge to Alaska
description: SEATTLE  It turned into a race for the steak knives.

title: The In Crowd
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Sometimes you get the puns, sometimes the puns get you.

title: Pope Francis May Find Wariness Among U.S. Bishops on Climate Change
description: ST. LOUIS  The church bulletin inserts are nearly ready to go. So are the emails to every Roman Catholic parish in the United States with preaching suggestions for the first Sunday after Pope Francis releases his encyclical on the environment.

title: Pope Francis to Explore Climates Effect on Worlds Poor
description: VATICAN CITY  Ban Ki-moon arrived at the Vatican with his own college of cardinals. Mr. Ban, the United Nations secretary general, had brought the leaders of all his major agencies to see Pope Francis, a show of organizational muscle and respect for a meeting between two global institutions that had sometimes shared a bumpy past but now had a mutual interest.

title: Ronald A. Wilford, Manager to a Host of Legendary Maestros, Dies at 87
description: Ronald A. Wilford, a spotlight-shunning manager who became one of the most powerful figures in classical music in the second half of the 20th century not by conducting orchestras but by orchestrating the careers of conductors, died on Saturday in Manhattan. He was 87.

title: Frank Zachary, Editor and Art Director, Dies at 101
description: Frank Zachary, a celebrated magazine editor and art director who pioneered graphic innovations and creative photography while chronicling postwar Americas fascination with travel and leisure and the affluent society, died on Friday at his home in East Hampton, N.Y. He was 101.

title: City Schoolchildren Take to a British Sport
description: More than 70 teams in and around New York City played this month in the eighth annual Rugby Cup, and a frequent contender is a Brooklyn middle school.

title: Jeb Bush Works to Recover From a Shaky Start
description: WASHINGTON  Jeb Bush had a plan for the last six months he spent as an unannounced candidate for president. He would raise tens of millions of dollars, distinguish himself from his brothers controversial presidency, start winning over conservatives and establish himself as the Republican to beat for his partys nomination.

title: Sheriffs Report Provides New Details on Tamir Rices Death, but Leaves Questions
description: A lengthy report published Saturday revealed new details about the fatal shooting of 12-year-old Tamir Rice by a Cleveland police officer, but made no recommendation on whether the officer or his partner should face criminal charges.

title: N.B.A. Finals: David Lee, a Former All-Star, Has Become a Stellar Substitute for the Warriors
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  David Lee strained his left hamstring in the preseason, lost his starting job for the Golden State Warriors and never got it back. He played sparingly as the Warriors rolled to 67 victories in the regular season. His past as a two-time All-Star seemed like more of a stigma as his D.N.P.s  box-score code for did not play  accumulated like dust bunnies.

title: Jacob deGrom Starts Strong, but Bullpen Stumbles as Mets Fall to Braves
description: As it inched across the batters box at Citi Field on Saturday afternoon, the shadow from the light tower above the western grandstands provided cover for two starting pitchers who hardly needed the assistance.

title: Man Discharges Gun at Waldorf Wedding Reception, Injuring 5
description: An unidentified man attending a wedding reception at the Waldorf Astoria Hotel in Manhattan on Saturday accidentally discharged a firearm and injured five people, including one woman who was struck in the head, the police said.

title: Usain Bolt and Mary Cain Are Not at Their Fastest in Adidas Grand Prix
description: The Adidas Grand Prix had breakout performances on Saturday, but some top stars had uninspiring results.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: We clearly need a fundamental change of course, to protect the earth and its people  which in turn will allow us to dignify humanity.

title: Inbee Park, With Benefit of Early Homework, Takes Two-Stroke Lead in Womens P.G.A. Championship
description: HARRISON, N.Y.  Brad Beecher thought it would be a good idea to get an early sneak peek. He had heard how demanding Westchester County Clubs West Course could be, so rather than fly from Canada on Monday for a first look, he and the player he caddies for, Inbee Park, played a handful of practice rounds last month. Beecher watched as Park got a grasp on how big and bold the course is.

title: More Defensive Gaffes Bedevil the Yankees in Their Second Straight Loss
description: BALTIMORE  For the second night in a row, the Yankees were troubled by an embarrassing failure to communicate. On Friday, two outfielders looked at each other as a fly ball landed between them, and it was catcher Brian McCann and Mark Teixeira who politely bumbled on Saturday.

title: Hillary Clinton Recruits Supporters With House Parties
description: DES MOINES  Fresh off her first major campaign rally in New York City, Hillary Rodham Clinton flew to Iowa on Saturday evening to urge Democrats to sign on to her presidential team rather than remain open to overtures from the growing political operations of Bernie Sanders and Martin OMalley, two rivals also working intently here.

title: 30,000 Fans Greet American Pharoah in Festive Return to Churchill Downs
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  On a hot and humid day, American Pharoah, the 12th Triple Crown winner, returned to a kings homecoming at Churchill Downs. The euphoric coronation began Friday, when he returned to the dirt at 6:45 a.m. for a jog. It ended Saturday evening before an estimated crowd of 30,000 who came from near and far to see the bay colt for themselves and fawn over the horse that has revitalized a proud sport.

title: Simpler, Uncomplicated Timepieces Are Back
description: Remember the days of basic, good-looking watches with nylon straps and uncomplicated mechanics? Those days are now.

title: In the East Village and SoHo, Orleys Family Values
description: Established in 2011 by Matthew Orley, his now-wife Samantha and Matthews younger brother, Alex, the jacquard-heavy, knitwear-centric brand Orley is 100 percent a family affair, from motivation to execution. With its mens, and newly minted womens, ready-to-wear lines, our collections tend to be autobiographical, Alex says. The tenets of the brand take things a little nostalgic or familiar and recontextualize those retro feelings into something modern in their boldness. A lot of what we do comes from our grandparents strong sense of self. We grew up around them. They were very esoteric dressers.

title: Chicago Blackhawks Close In on Stanley Cup With Another One-Goal Victory
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Ben Bishop stood in the crease looking as brave as he could in the third period Saturday as the Chicago Blackhawks mounted another charge toward him. The Blackhawks knew that Bishop, the Tampa Bay Lightning goalie, was dealing with an undisclosed injury, and they had challenged him every chance they could, testing the limits of his will and his tolerance for pain.

title: In the Running
description: The Adidas Grand Prix at Randalls Island attracted a wide range of athletes, from the very young to Olympians.

Dunn and Alistair Dunn of Chappaqua, N.Y. The Rev. David L. Clark, a minister ordained by Westside Christian Church in Tennessee, officiated at Deerpark Restaurant in Asheville, N.C.

description: Veronica Grace Mears and Christopher Albert Meagher were married Saturday at St. Stephens Episcopal Church in Ridgefield, Conn. The Rev. Whitney Altopp, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony.

description: Amanda Marie Raus and Todd Patrick Piro were married Friday at St. Stephen Church in Trumbull, Conn. The Rev. Christopher J. Samele, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

description: Katheryn Elizabeth Sillo, the daughter of Johanna Sillo and Rocco Sillo of New Canaan, Conn., was married there Saturday to Joseph Gene Vittoria, a son of Toni-Ann Vittoria and Joseph Vittoria, also of New Canaan. Msgr. William J. Scheyd performed the ceremony at St. Aloysius Roman Catholic Church.

title: Lisa Vertucci Barbara Leshinsky
description: Lisa Ann Vertucci and Barbara Iris Leshinsky were married Saturday at their weekend house in Canaan, N.Y. Diana H. Leo, who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: Kate Baar-Bittman, Nicholas Traverse
description: Kate Sara Baar-Bittman and Nicholas Paul Traverse were married on Saturday at the Chequessett Yacht & Country Club in Wellfleet, Mass. P. Wayne Osborne, who received a one-day solemnization certificate from Massachusetts, officiated.

description: Leon Gerald Violante and Edward Woodruff Snowdon Jr. were married Saturday at the Mohonk Mountain House, a resort in New Paltz, N.Y. Evan Wolfson, a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Allison Campbell,  Adam Kramer
description: Allison Lindsay Campbell and Adam Charles Kramer were married Saturday evening at Windows on the Water, an events space at the Surfrider Beach Club in Sea Bright, N.J. Rabbi Douglas Krantz officiated with the assistance of the Rev. Carroll J. Mrowicki, who is affiliated with Citi Ministries.

title: Bailey Champlin and Benjamin Sessa
description: Bailey Elizabeth Champlin, the daughter of Patricia Pearson Champlin and Rolland S. Champlin of Glastonbury, Conn., is to be married Sunday to Benjamin Jacob Sessa, a son of Harriet Sachs Sessa and Dr. Vito R. Sessa of Rye, N.Y. Brian T. Sandstrom, who received temporary permission from Massachusetts to solemnize the marriage, is to officiate at the Chatham Bars Inn in Chatham, Mass.

title: Brooke Jacobsen, Cassel Lessinger
description: Brooke Eren Jacobsen, the daughter of Allison E. Jacobsen and John C. Jacobsen of Morristown, N.J., was married Saturday evening to Cassel Taylor Lessinger, a son of Audrey L. Lessinger and Murray R. Lessinger of Kenilworth, Ill. Rabbi Victor Appell officiated at Green Brook Country Club in North Caldwell, N.J.

title: Sarah Woo,  Michael Kai
description: Sarah Jung Woo and Michael Curtis Joe Kai were married Saturday at the Adamson House, a museum and national historic site in Malibu, Calif. Albert Buchman, a friend of the couple who was ordained by American Marriage Ministries for the occasion, officiated.

title: Gabrielle Salinger,  Kian Amiri
description: Gabrielle Shoshana Salinger, a daughter of Sharon S. Salinger and Seth H. Salinger of Boston, is to be married on Sunday to Kian Amiri, a son of Gitty Ruehman of Los Angeles and Sia Amiri of Las Vegas. Rabbi John Rosove is to officiate at Hartley Botanica, a botanical garden in Somis, Calif.

title: Alyssa Yamamoto, Killian Nolan
description: Alyssa T. Yamamoto, a daughter of Kaoru Yamamoto of Briarcliff Manor, N.Y., and the late Tateki Yamamoto, is to be married Sunday to Killian Benjamin Nolan, the son of Janet E. Dunwoody and Dermot P. Nolan of San Jose, Calif. The grooms father, who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, is to officiate at 620 Loft and Garden, an events space in New York.

title: Jamie Mullally, Issa Hanna
description: Dr. Jamie Ann Mullally and Issa Jesse Hanna were married Saturday in Interlaken, N.Y. The Rev. Bernard M. Maloney performed the ceremony at the St. Francis Solanus Roman Catholic Church.

title: Christina Minardi and Annette Cuellar
description: Christina Minardi and Annette Cuellar were married Saturday at their home in Wayne, N.J., by Toni Belford Damiano, a municipal court judge in Woodland Park, N.J. Later in the day, Ms. Damiano led the couple in another ceremony that included an exchange of wedding rings and vows at Blooming Hill Farm in Monroe, N.Y.

title: Jessica McBride, Sean Whitsitt
description: Jessica Anne McBride, a daughter of Virginia Carey McBride and Dr. Mark J. McBride of Madison, N.J., was married Saturday to Sean James Whitsitt, the son of Jan Sundberg Whitsitt and Bob Whitsitt of Medina, Wash. The Very Rev. Elias R. Lorenzo, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at Immaculate Conception Church in Westhampton Beach, N.Y., with the Rev. Peter M. Colapietro, also a Roman Catholic priest, taking part.

title: Daisy Wheeler,  Steven Berbeco
description: Daisy Wheeler and Steven Micah Berbeco were married Saturday in Shelburne, Vt. George R. Berbeco, the grooms father, officiated at the Shelburne Museum, having been granted permission to solemnize the marriage by Vermonts secretary of state.

description: Jane Eungee Lee and Dr. Edmund Ying-Peng Wun were married Saturday. The Rev. Danny Kim, a pastor of the Christian and Missionary Alliance, officiated at the Village Club at Lake Success in Great Neck, N.Y.

Hoppenstedt of Hamden, Conn. Rabbi Jonathan D. Malamy officiated at the home of the grooms family in Hamden.

Rick Clayton, a United Methodist minister, officiated at the Sutherland, an event space in Wake Forest, N.C.

description: Lily Paulette Shapiro and Cantor Benjamyn Samuel Ellerin are to be married Sunday. Cantor Rebecca Garfein is to perform the ceremony at Temple Shaaray Tefila in Bedford, N.Y., with Rabbi Benjamin H. Spratt taking part.

title: Pinky Weitzman, George Chan
description: Rebecca Elizabeth Weitzman and George Michael Chun-Bong Chan were married Saturday at the Ashokan Center, an outdoor education center and retreat in Olive, N.Y. The officiant was David Malloy, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion.

title: Emily Carton and Eric Lundblade
description: Emily Glynis Carton, a daughter of Wendy A. Rowden and John D. Carton of Bedford Corners, N.Y., was married Saturday evening at her parents country home in Sandwich, Mass., to Eric James Lundblade, the son of Denise A. Lundblade and James W. Lundblade of Portland, Ore. Rabbi Daniel S. Wolk officiated.

title: Eliza Gordon-Lipkin, Erick Sager
description: Dr. Eliza Meryl Gordon-Lipkin and Erick Ryan Sager were married Saturday at the Baltimore Museum of Industry. The brides brother, Seth Gordon-Lipkin, officiated after becoming a Universal Life minister.

title: Laura Swanson, Ryan Ingle
description: Laura Lavey Swanson, a daughter of Julie A. Swanson and Neil J. Swanson of Rochester Hills, Mich., was married Saturday evening to Ryan Robert Ingle, the son of Pamela S. Ingle and Robert A. Ingle of Shawnee, Kan. Jacobus Schutte, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated at 501 Union, an event space in Brooklyn.

title: At Art Basel, a Powerful Jury Controls the Market
description: The hundreds of gallery owners who apply each year to secure a coveted booth at Art Basel, the Swiss art fair, spend weeks on their admission applications. They describe the evolution of their galleries, track the history of their exhibitions and list the biographies of their artists. Then there is the matter of the mock booths, intricate sketches, miniature models, even virtual tours, of their planned exhibition spaces, complete with tiny reproductions of the exact works they hope to exhibit.

title: Zoo Animals on the Loose in Tbilisi After Flooding
description: MOSCOW  Residents of Tbilisi, Georgia, were warned to stay off the streets on Sunday lest they encounter one of the lions, tigers, bears or other beasts set free from the city zoo after floodwaters devastated the center of the capital.

title: A Hard Road to Health Insurance
description: The Affordable Care Act was designed to help people like David Elson. He had a box full of unpaid medical bills, a result of uncontrolled diabetes and all the health complications that came with it. He badly needed health insurance, but as a self-employed alarm installer, he could not afford it  especially since insurers could charge chronically ill people much more before the new law took effect.

title: Bid by Omar al-Bashir of Sudan to Avoid Arrest Is Tested in South Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG  As the only head of state wanted by the International Criminal Court on genocide charges, President Omar Hassan al-Bashir of Sudan had spent years looking over his shoulder. He avoided countries where the risk of arrest seemed high. He visited friendly African nations hostile to the court, though he sometimes quickly left for home when the ground seemed to shift.

title: Protesters Return to Hong Kongs Streets
description: HONG KONG  Thousands of people returned on Sunday to streets near Hong Kong government headquarters  the site last year of months of student-led protests for freer elections  hoping to press lawmakers to block Beijings plan for selecting the citys top official in 2017.

title: 1890: Palais Royal Tower
description: PARIS  The disconsolate shopkeepers of the Palais Royal have hit upon a new scheme to attract the public to the comparatively deserted arcades. When the proposal to cut a new street through the gardens was abandoned, M. Martin-Ginouvier proposed to build in the centre of the enclosure a tower, 55 mtres high, of iron and crystal. A modification of this scheme has now been supplied by another architect M. Bourdais, and approved of at a meeting of the principal trade men of the Palais. M. Bourdais proposes to build, near the Galerie dOrlans, a tower 100 mtres high, not of iron and glass, but of stone. His plans show four platforms, accessible by lifts and a staircase, with, at the summit, a lighthouse powerful enough to light the four central arrondissements.  The New York Herald, European Edition, June 15, 1890

title: Concern for the Men Still Behind Bars as Lockdown Continues
description: For nine days, Geneva Perez has been trying to reach her husband in prison. And for nine days, she has been told she cannot talk to him.

title: John Carroll, Editor Who Reinvigorated The Los Angeles Times, Is Dead at 73
description: John S. Carroll, a widely admired newspaper editor who restored the reputation and credibility of The Los Angeles Times in the early 2000s even as he fought bitterly with the papers cost-conscious corporate parent, died on Sunday at his home in Lexington, Ky. He was 73.

title: Spanish Official Apologizes Over Twitter Joke About Holocaust
description: MADRID  The new, left-wing government of Madrid faced its first test over the weekend when the politician charged with running culture was forced to apologize for joking about the Holocaust on Twitter.

title: Dave Grohl Injures Leg During Fall, Cancels Tour Dates

title: Whats On TV Sunday
description: 8 P.M. (Ovation) SOUTHERN UNCOVERED WITH THE LEE BROS. Matt and Ted Lee, above from left, the James Beard Award-winning food and travel writers, explore the art, culture and cuisine of their native South, with stops in Atlanta, Dallas, New Orleans, Louisville and Ashville, N.C. They begin their tour in Charleston, S.C., their hometown, where they partake of a Lowcountry oyster roast, an undersea winery and dinner that comes with a side of dance lessons.

title: At Gawker Media, New Economy Workers Strive to Form a New Kind of Union
description: The Facebook notification popped onto her screen in April: an invitation to the editorial staff at Gawker Media to a union meeting about you. Anna Merlan, a 28-year-old reporter with six months on the job, stared at her laptop, startled.

title: 1940: Rout and Debacle of the French Army
description: BERLIN  As the gray-uniformed battalions of Fhrer Adolf Hitler marched into Paris and raised the swastika banner over the capital in sign of conquest, the Nazi high command asserted that the whole northern front from the coast to the Maginot line east of Sedan had collapsed and that in all the sectors the enemy was in full retreat.

title: For One Mens Wear Designers Collection, the Parts Belie the Sum
description: The words pink, crinkled, cotton, bonded tailoring dont sound very wearable  but in Matthew Millers deft hands, they made for one of the weeks freshest ideas.

title: Adaptation of The Rothschilds to Come to New York
description: Before Fiddler on the Roof is revived for the fifth time on Broadway, another production by Sheldon Harnick and Jerry Bock will arrive in New York. Rothschild & Sons, a one-act rewrite of the 1970 musical The Rothschilds, will make its world debut Off Broadway as a production of the York Theater Company in October.

title: At Margaret Howell, Wearing Black and White Is All About Restraint
description: Much is said about the finale look of a show, but designers like Margaret Howell understand the importance of a first impression. In the openinglooks she sent down the runway, it became apparent that black and white, an emerging trend this season, would be integral to the designers spring/summer 2016 mens collection. But unlike her contemporaries, Howell used the scheme in a subtle, relaxed way  the perfect white shirt, a simple striped T-shirt, perfectly proportioned black trousers  that proved exercising restraint can, in fact, be bold.

title: Americas Seniors Find Middle-Class Sweet Spot
description: WAXAHACHIE, Tex.  Most Americans suffered serious losses during and after the recession, knocked off balance by layoffs, stagnant pay and the collapse of home values. But apart from the superrich, one groups fortunes appear to have held remarkably steady: seniors.

description: DES MOINES  Hillary Rodham Clinton on Sunday urged President Obama to listen to congressional Democrats  particular the House minority leader, Nancy Pelosi  and make changes to the Trans-Pacific Partnership trade deal that reflect their concerns about protecting American jobs and wages.

title: Israels Foreign Ministry Issues Report Defending Conduct in Gaza War
description: JERUSALEM  In a pre-emptive strike against a forthcoming United Nations report on the war last year between Israel and Palestinian militants in the Gaza Strip, Israels Foreign Ministry on Sunday issued a lengthy paper arguing that its troops adhered to international law and blaming the militants for most of the civilian casualties in Gaza.

title: Same-Sex Parents Rights May Be Unresolved After Justices Ruling
description: When Jessica and Melissa Tincher take the four-hour road trip from their home in Lexington, Ohio, to visit relatives in Indiana, it is a two-vehicle affair: They need car seats for each of their four children  a 4-year-old, a 3-year-old and 2-year-old twins  along with Pack n Plays, high chairs, diapers and enough toys to keep everyone entertained. And then there are the two dogs, who together weigh 165 pounds.

title: Review: Milan Kunderas The Festival of Insignificance Is Full of Pranks, Lies and Vanity
description: In his groundbreaking novels The Book of Laughter and Forgetting (1980) and The Unbearable Lightness of Being (1984), the Czech-born Milan Kundera wrote about his country under the shadow of the Soviet Union, reinventing the form of the novel while examining the osmosis between the personal and the political there, and the subversive roles that humor and irreverence can play in a totalitarian state.

description: London

title: Review: Ayelen Parolins 25.06.76 Evolves as She Does
description: A person changes over time, so why should her autobiographical dance solo stay the same? The Argentine-born choreographer Ayelen Parolin, who lives and works in Brussels, first presented 25.06.76 in 2004. Named for her date of birth and performed more than 20 times over the past decade, the slapdash solo evolves as she does. On Friday, she showed its current iteration at the Invisible Dog Art Center in Cobble Hill, Brooklyn.

title: Review: San Francisco Operas Two Women Depicts Wars Horror at High Pitch
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Near the end of Marco Tutinos relentlessly impassioned new opera, Two Women, a character cries out Basta, basta!

description: Judd Apatow hadnt performed stand-up comedy for more than 20 years when he approached the Comedy Cellar stage in New York in April of last year. I was terrified, he said.

description: We do love a good, tragic back story to go with our artists. Theyre so much easier to market that way.

title: Saxophonist David Murray Part of Vision Festival Lineup
description: The Vision Festival, an annual New York festival built around the continuum of experimental jazz and free improvisation, is celebrating its 20th birthday, and has announced its schedule for this years edition, from July 5-12. This festival began in 1996; has been staged in various churches, theaters and community centers; and incorporates music, dance, visual art, poetry, and film. It runs without corporate financing under the auspices of the nonprofit, artist-run organization Arts for Art.

title: U.S. Airstrike in Libya Targets Planner of 2013 Algeria Attack
description: WASHINGTON  The United States carried out an airstrike in Libya early Sunday against the mastermind of the 2013 terrorist seizure of an Algerian gas plant that left 38 foreign hostages dead, American and Libyan officials said on Sunday.

title: The Third Surprise
description: This has been a weekend for political surprises. First, of course, was the shocking rejection of TPP by House Democrats. Second was Hillary Clintons unexpectedly liberal/populist campaign-launching speech on Roosevelt Island.

description: This has been a weekend for political surprises. First, of course, was the shocking rejection of TPP by House Democrats. Second was Hillary Clintons unexpectedly liberal/populist campaign-launching speech on Roosevelt Island.

title: Sometimes Sold With Magnifying Glasses
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Readers have asked me how, after four years of writing daily about crosswords, I still have something to say about them. These readers have obviously never met me in person, because I am really not one to lack an opinion about anything. Just ask Will Shortz.

title: With Victory Over Orioles, Yankees Keep Slim Lead in East
description: BALTIMORE  The Yankees 5-3 victory over the Baltimore Orioles on Sunday was a much-needed one. It kept the Yankees in first place in the American League East  barely  and ended a three-game losing streak, with the help of a rally that required precious little exertion, even in sapping heat and humidity.

title: Women Languish in Texas Immigration Detention Centers
description: Lawmakers, advocates and religious leaders say confinement only compounds the suffering of women fleeing from predatory gangs or domestic abuse at home.

title: Hope and Despair as Families Languish in Texas Immigration Centers
description: DILLEY, Tex.  Workers are putting the finishing touches on rows of barracks in a 50-acre camp here, the largest immigration detention center in the country. It houses thousands of women and their children who were caught crossing the border illegally and are seeking asylum in the United States.

title: Stop Revering Magna Carta
description: MAGNA CARTA, on which King John placed his seal 800 years ago today, is synonymous in the English-speaking world with fundamental rights and the rule of law. Its been celebrated, and appropriated, by everyone from Tea Party members to Jay Z, who called his latest album Magna Carta Holy Grail.

title: If a Car Rusts in the Forest ...
description: The Old Car City USA junkyard in White, Ga., no longer deals in spare parts. Its old vehicles have been abandoned in the woods and have become a tourist destination.

title: Nature Helps Squeeze Out a Little More Mileage
description: WHITE, Ga.  Not too long ago, Old Car City USA and its thousands of deceased autos was a junkyard like so many others that dotted  or blighted, depending on ones point of view  the American landscape. Nestled in the ridges and valleys here about an hour north of Atlanta, the salvage yard was a veritable heaven for do-it-yourselfers looking to save money by opting for used over new.

title: Fears of Greek Default Rise as Weekend Talks on Debt Payment Break Down
description: BRUSSELS  Just weeks before a crucial debt payment comes due, weekend talks between Greece and its European creditors broke down as both sides refused to soften their long-held bargaining positions.

title: A Federal Reserve Meeting, the Joust for Jet Orders and Fitbits Stock Market Debut
description: The titans of the global aerospace industry will gather on Monday at Le Bourget Airport for the biennial International Paris Air Show. The traditional joust for jet orders between Airbus and Boeing, the worlds biggest commercial plane makers, will dominate the weeklong event as millions of dollars worth of hardware soars above the chalets and convention halls.

title: Nek Chand, Creator of a Sculpture Kingdom in India, Dies at 90
description: NEW DELHI  Nek Chand, an Indian artist who rose to prominence by quietly building a sprawling kingdom of folk sculptures in northern India that became one of the countrys most popular tourist destinations, died on Friday in Chandigarh. He was 90.

title: As Magna Carta Turns 800, How Firm Is Your Grasp on Medieval Law?
description: The seminal document was written on June 15, 1215. Since then, its principles have been enshrined in laws and constitutions around the world. How did it come about 800 years ago, and what is its modern legacy? Test your medieval legal knowledge.

title: Magna Carta, Still Posing a Challenge at 800
description: It is relatively unsplashy, as these things go  not very long, not very elegantly written, just 3,500 or so words of Medieval Latin crammed illegibly onto a single page of parchment.

title: Goose Exterminator of the Netherlands Enrages Animal Rights Activists
description: WIJK BIJ DUURSTEDE, Netherlands  The hiss of gas, released by a red lever turned by Arie den Hertog in the back of his white van, signaled the start of the massacre. The victims, crammed into a sealed, coffin-like wooden case, squawked as they struggled to breathe. Then, after barely two minutes, they fell silent.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of June 15
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Virtual Reality Headsets, Gaining Scrutiny at E3 This Week, Raise Very Real Concerns
description: Every Friday, a dozen or so people strap on virtual reality headsets, log on to the Internet and do something that would normally require driving to a local multiplex: watch a movie with a bunch of strangers.

title: Houthi Rebels in Yemen Seize a Capital
description: AL MUKALLA, Yemen  Houthi rebel fighters seized the capital of a northwestern Yemeni province bordering Saudi Arabia early Sunday, tightening their control of the country despite a monthslong, Saudi-led bombing campaign intended to force a retreat.

title: Slicing Away a Bodys Tortured Past
description: Paul Mason, once informally known as the worlds fattest man, had already shed most of his 980 pounds, but his most difficult operation was to remove the giant folds of excess skin that had remained.

title: Down From 980 Pounds, With New Battles to Wage
description: For a man who once weighed 980 pounds and had already lost 650 of them, the loss of 50 more  the amount that vanished after Paul Masons nine-and-a-half-hour operation last month  might not seem like a big deal.

title: With Game-Winning Goals, Antoine Vermette Is Giving the Blackhawks a Lift
description: Antoine Vermette watched Game 3 of the N.H.L.s Western Conference finals on a television in the Blackhawks locker room while he exercised, riding a stationary bike and lifting weights. It was the third time this postseason he had been designated as a healthy scratch, a personal low point, and he wanted to use the time productively.

title: Californias Water Czar, Part Empathetic Confessor and Part Friendly Scold
description: SACRAMENTO  Felicia Marcus peered over her desk the other day as the State Water Resources Control Board came to order in a hearing room here, bracing for another day of bad drought news. There would be warnings about die-offs of birds and fish. An anguished farmer describing how he is being forced to fallow fields of crops. An economic report projecting $2.7 billion in drought-related losses in 2015.

title: Losing Custody of Son Appeared to Set Off Troubled Dallas Gunman, Family Says
description: DALLAS  In April, a judge here rendered a decision that seemed to finally upend James L. Boulwares troubled life. Ending a fight that had played out for years in court, Mr. Boulware lost a custody battle with his mother over his 11-year-old son. At issue was his history of violence against his mother, who told the judge in court documents that he had mental problems, and whose allegation that he had tried to choke her led the police to arrest him in 2013.

title: Under Armour Is Swinging for the Stars
description: Before he watched the final round of the Masters tournament at Augusta National Golf Club in April, Ryan Kuehl, an executive for the sportswear company Under Armour, left his cellphone in a rented sport utility vehicle. Hours later  after the 21-year-old Jordan Spieth had won in record fashion  Mr. Kuehl checked his phone.

title: Rent Regulations on New York City Apartments Expire on Monday
description: ALBANY  Rent regulations that limit how much landlords can charge for many apartments in New York City and a number of surrounding communities were set to expire on Monday and lawmakers here did not appear close to a deal to extend or modify them.

title: Blackhawks Fans Show That Chicago Can Love a Winner, Too
description: CHICAGO  The national anthem had barely begun, but the red mass of pounding, stomping, cheering people inside the United Center was in full frenzy. If there is a Midwestern version of Los Angeless star-speckled courtside scene, it was in this crowd: John Cusack, the actor; Danica Patrick, the auto racer; Billy Corgan, the musician.

title: Philae Spacecraft Reawakens on a Speeding Comet With Data for Scientists
description: After a seven-month slumber, a European spacecraft that landed on a speeding comet last fall has awakened from hibernation and phoned home, the European Space Agency said on Sunday.

title: Once a First-Round Pick as a Shortstop, Sergio Santos Is Now a Reliever for the Yankees
description: BALTIMORE  When Sergio Santos, the latest reliever to audition for the Yankees, made his way to the mound Saturday night, not everybody knew him solely as a hard-throwing right-handed pitcher with a wipeout slider.

title: Engaging Movie Fans, From Teaser to Premiere
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif.  Next month, 130,000 sweaty fans will swarm the San Diego Convention Center for the annual pop culture scavenger hunt known as Comic-Con International.

title: A Plan to Fortify the U.S. Women, From a Pioneer
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia  As a young girl in Colorado, April Heinrichs stuffed copies of Readers Digest into her socks as shin guards and slept in her cleats.

title: Playground Legend Revisits the Streets, His Fall and His Rise
description: Carlton Greene made his way up two steep flights of stairs, slowly, with great effort. Forty-five years ago, he took these steps two at a time, sometimes three. But that was then. Now he is 60, and his knees, hips and thighs have seen better days.

title: The Trans-Pacific Partnership and a Presidents Legacy
description: WASHINGTON  For more than six years, the short walk from the Oval Office downstairs to the Situation Room has all too often meant bad news or grim choices. Whether it was war in the Middle East, Russian aggression in Ukraine or the hunt for terrorists around the globe, President Obamas foreign policy has felt consumed by guns and drones.

title: Alex Rodriguez Remains a Superstar Hard to Forget, and to Embrace
description: BALTIMORE  Rick Dempseys name stretches for three stories  vertically, in neon  on the warehouse beyond right field at Camden Yards. Dempsey, who has a restaurant here, batted .233 in the majors but was the most valuable player in the World Series the last time the Baltimore Orioles won it. Fans beg for his autograph every day, and he happily obliges.

title: These Golden State Warriors Won Before. In April.
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  James Michael McAdoo and Ognjen Kuzmic of the Golden State Warriors have not had starring roles in the N.B.A. finals. Through five games, including a 104-91 Golden State victory on Sunday at Oracle Arena, McAdoo has played a total of one minute in the series. Kuzmic, a 7-foot center, has yet to appear in uniform.

title: Review: In This Is Mary Brown, Mom Has Troubles but Is Quite a Character
description: The title character of This Is Mary Brown didnt lead an exciting life, but she inspired a lovely little play. This one-woman show, written and performed by her daughter, Winsome Brown, never sugarcoats a somewhat sad story, and that honesty makes it all the more admirable.

title: Review: In The Qualms, a Sex Party Winds Up Being All Talk
description: A bouquet of colored condoms is tossed in the air, like naughty confetti, in The Qualms, the latest play from the Pulitzer Prize-winning provocateur Bruce Norris. But while sex is theoretically on the menu in Mr. Norriss comedy, about a quartet of erotically adventurous couples, the main course (which is to say intercourse) never quite arrives. Those condoms, Im afraid, are made airborne more out of frustration than excitement.

title: Fainting at the Finish
description: Sam Peterman, a sophomore at Sweet Home High School near Buffalo, has a condition that causes her to collapse at the finish line of nearly every race.

title: Race After Race, Teenager Crosses Finish Line, Then Collapses
description: Dale Peterman watched and waited. It was all he could do.

description: Thousands fled Syria as Kurd fighters neared the Islamic State in Yal Abyad, Syria.

title: Brazil Absorbs an Early and Familiar Shock, Then Rewrites the Script
description: TEMUCO, Chile  Brazil has worked very hard over the last 12 months to bury all traces of last years World Cup disaster. Under its new coach, Dunga, the team played 10 friendly games without a loss and at times looked a bit like its old self.

title: Inbee Park Reigns at Major, No Matter What Its Called
description: HARRISON, N.Y.  The celebration continued after the television cameras had turned off, with all sorts of people stepping to the microphone at the 18th green of Westchester Country Clubs West Course to heap praise on Inbee Park.

description: The National Puerto Rican Day Parade on Sunday made its way through Manhattan along Fifth Avenue from 44th Street to 79th Street.

title: Judge Clears Way for Pierhouse Complex to Cast Shadow on Brooklyn Bridge

description: An armed man who demanded that a group of five riders hand over the keys to their motorcycles died on Saturday after being shot in the head by one in the group, an off-duty state corrections officer, according to the police.

description: Spoilers follow for the Season 5 finale of Game of Thrones.

title: N.B.A. Finals: Stephen Curry and Warriors Arent Short on Big Shots
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Stephen Curry did what he does, prying for open space beyond the 3-point arc, shimmying with the dribble, bouncing the ball behind his back, stepping back and letting go with a shot as quick as a blink and as high as the 15th row.

title: Beyond Caitlyn Jenner Lies a Long Struggle by Transgender People
description: By now, most Americans are probably familiar with the rights movement known by the initials L.G.B.T., but they may have a better sense of the L.G.B. part  lesbian, gay, bisexual. The T, for transgender, has eluded many people. That, however, may be quickly changing with a string of developments in recent years, not the least being the emergence this month of Caitlyn Jenner, a transgender woman who was a public figure for four decades as Bruce Jenner, Olympic decathlon champion and reality-show personality.

title: Transforming History
description: Transgender issues today are rooted in a decades-long struggle for acceptance.

title: Finding the Next Mia Hamm and Alex Morgan
description: A study by U.S. Soccer found that 74 percent of the players on its womens youth national teams  from ages 13 to 23  have at least one older sibling

title: Cuomo to Announce Investigation of Prison Escape
description: With frustrations rising and questions multiplying, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo will announce on Monday a formal investigation by the state inspector general into all factors involved in the escape of two convicted murderers from a maximum-security prison in northern New York.

title: IBM Invests to Help Open-Source Big Data Software  and Itself
description: The IBM endorsement effect has often shaped the computer industry over the years. In 1981, when IBM entered the personal computer business, the company decisively pushed an upstart technology into the mainstream.

title: Quotation of the Day for Monday, June 15, 2015
description: The myth of Magna Carta lies at the whole origin of our perception of who we are as an English-speaking people, freedom-loving people whove lived with a degree of liberty and under a rule of law for 800 years. Its a load of tripe, of course. But its a very useful myth.

title: North Korean Soldier Braves DMZ to Defect to South
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A North Korean soldier defected to South Korea on Monday, walking across the countries shared border, which is so heavily guarded that only a few refugees from the North have managed to cross it in recent years, South Korean officials said.

title: Whats On TV Monday
description: 10 P.M. (AMC) THE MAKING OF THE MOB: NEW YORK Ray Liotta narrates this eight-part series, which uses re-enactments, archival footage, visual effects and interviews to chronicle the rise of the Mafiosi Lucky Luciano, Meyer Lansky, Bugsy Siegel, Frank Costello and Vito Genovese. Among those weighing in are former Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani of New York; Meyer Lansky II, Lanskys grandson; the actors Chazz Palminteri and Joe Mantegna; the singer Frankie Valli; former Mayor Oscar B. Goodman of Las Vegas; and the historian David Pietrusza. A 25th-anniversary presentation of Martin Scorseses Goodfellas (1990), which stars Mr. Liotta as Henry Hill, the gangster turned mob informant whose testimony resulted in 50 convictions, leads in at 7. This programming block is the first in AMCs Mob Mondays, which will partner each episode of the series with a classic mobster film.

title: Corrections: June 15, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Bashir Wont Be Detained, Official Says
description: Foreign Minister Ibrahim Ghandour of Sudan says his countrys president, Omar Hassan al-Bashir, will leave South Africa as planned despite a judge barring his departure.

title: Burk Uzzles American Puzzle
description: If you ask Burk Uzzle what he has been up to lately, hell most likely tell you he has just been poking around. That means hitting the road with a couple of Leicas, a small shoulder bag and a few rolls of film. Hes done this for some 50 years, taking the time between assignments to drive somewhere along side streets and back roads, to get out and follow his whimsical vision.

title: Yes, Wall Street Needs Help
description: RECENTLY JPMorgan Chase and HSBC announced reductions in the size of their work force. This comes on top of downsizing since the financial crisis by many of the citys largest private sector employers, including Bank of America, Citigroup, BNY Mellon, American Express, American International Group and MetLife.

title: Democrats Being Democrats
description: On Friday, House Democrats shocked almost everyone by rejecting key provisions needed to complete the Trans-Pacific Partnership, an agreement the White House wants but much of the party doesnt. On Saturday Hillary Clinton formally began her campaign for president, and surprised most observers with an unapologetically liberal and populist speech.

description: To the Editor:

title: New Jersey Needs to Raise the Gas Tax to Repair Bridges and Roads
description: Drivers in New Jersey enjoy boasting about cheap gas in their state, where prices at the pump rank among the lowest in the country  so low, in fact, that thrifty motorists passing through often pull off the New Jersey Turnpike to fill up. The reason for the low prices is New Jerseys relatively modest gas tax.

title: Workers Betrayed by Visa Loopholes
description: It hardly needs saying that immigration policy should not undermine Americans jobs, wages or working conditions. The problem is that what some companies want  cheap, exploitable, disposable labor  is exactly what the system can be twisted into giving them.

title: Chinas Unsettling Stock Market Boom
description: Something strange is going on in the Chinese stock market. Even as the countrys economy has slowed, stocks have surged about 147 percent in the last 12 months as individual investors have poured their savings and have borrowed money to put into the market.

title: Pluses and Minuses of a Carbon Tax
description: To the Editor:

title: Jeb Bush and Single Mothers
description: Last week, Jeb Bush was asked to answer for a passage from his book from two decades ago, Profiles in Character, in a chapter titled The Restoration of Shame, in which he blamed the irresponsible conduct of births to unmarried women on a flagging sense of community ridicule and shaming.

title: Hong Kong Police Arrest 9 Ahead of Contentious Vote
description: HONG KONG  The Hong Kong police said on Monday that they had taken nine people into custody, including at least one member of a local radical organization, after finding components of explosives in an abandoned television studio.

title: Test Yourself | After-Prom Parties
description: Below, several paragraphs from a June 12 article, Prom Accessories: Corsages, Limousines and Liability Waivers.

title: Hudsons Bay to Buy Galeria Kaufhof Stores in $3.2 Billion Deal
description: Richard A. Baker has been a master at skillfully using real estate to revive retail brands. He did just that with the Hudsons Bay Company, a department store whose long history traces back to the New World era of fur trading. It was that panache that allowed him to snag the venerable brands of Saks Fifth Avenue and Lord & Taylor when they were up for grabs.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Automotive Art and the Passage of Time
description: In In the Woods of Georgia, an Old Junkyard Has Rusted Into Automotive Art, Mike Tierney reports on a curiosity called Old Car City and the people who created it.

title: Europcar Plans to Sell $963 Million in Shares in Paris I.P.O.
description: LONDON  Europcar, a French rental car company, said on Monday that it planned to sell 854.5 million euros, or about $963 million, in shares in an initial public offering in Paris this month.

title: Jeb Bushs Surprising Struggle With Moderates
description: It was easy to see Jeb Bushs path to the Republican nomination when he announced the formation of his super PAC in December. He wasnt guaranteed to pull it off  not by any stretch  but he seemed well positioned to appeal to the coalition of party elites and blue-state voters that has allowed center-right establishment candidates to win the partys last two contests.

title: EasyJet Chief Leads Airline Through Turnaround
description: LONDON  Early in a May conference call with journalists to discuss easyJets first-half results, Carolyn McCall, the low-cost airlines chief executive, seemed puzzled to find herself being grilled about toilets.

title: Jeb Bush Announces White House Bid, Saying America Deserves Better
description: MIAMI  Jeb Bush, a son and brother of presidents, formally declared a White House candidacy of his own on Monday, portraying himself as the most accomplished leader in the 2016 field, vowing to wage war on Washingtons political culture and insisting that his family name gave him no unique claim to the Oval Office.

title: Justices Words Are Combed for Clues as Major Decisions Loom at Court
description: WASHINGTON  Three years ago this week, Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg chided the news media for publishing a steady stream of rumors and fifth-hand accounts predicting how the court would rule on a constitutional challenge to President Obamas health care law.

title: An Architect Works With a Source of Inspiration: His Father
description: When he was growing up in San Juan, P.R., Jonathan Marvel would often visit his fathers architecture studio, awe-struck by the work around him. Schools, churches, hotels, apartment buildings, plazas and boulevards  seemingly all the things of daily life had come from the pen of his father, Thomas Marvel, one of the most prolific designers of his generation on the island.

title: Quebec? Italy? No Shortage of Theories on Escaped Convicts Whereabouts
description: DANNEMORA, N.Y.  There is no evidence that the two murderers who escaped a maximum-security prison here earlier this month are in Mexico, chuckling at investigators. There is no evidence that they are in Italy, Pennsylvania or a hunting camp in northern Quebec. And there is absolutely no evidence that the whole thing  the escape, the hunt, the days of combing the woods  was faked.

title: Omers to Buy Stake in Consulting Firm in $1.7 Billion Deal
description: LONDON  The private equity firm Charterhouse Capital Partners said on Monday that it had agreed to sell its majority stake in the consulting firm Environmental Resources Management to Omers, a Canadian pension fund, in a deal that valued the company at $1.7 billion.

title: At Alexander McQueen, Tom Ford, J.W. Anderson, Craig Green and Sibling: Men, Drinks, Drama and Dishabille
description: LONDON  Fashion week, like all the seasonal holidays, brings people together. Otherwise, its hard to explain how you might find yourself cheek by jowl with male models and male models emeriti and the Formula One champion Lewis Hamilton, bouncing from one corner of London to another, navigating gridlock traffic between a temporary show encampment on the Thames and the Phillips auction house on Berkeley Square.

title: Living Largely Off the Grid in China
description: In a modest-looking dwelling shrouded by greenery halfway up one of the highest mountains in eastern China, a young couple have been conducting an experiment in self-sufficiency for about five years.

title: The Y.M.C.A.s Work Outside the Gym
description: As a Y.M.C.A. member since 1984, I know it as a great place to become and remain fit, make friends and receive encouragement and support.
