description: The Greek debt crisis taxes the best minds of Europe.

title: U.N. Leader Calls Yemen a Ticking Bomb, Amid Delay in Cease-Fire Talks
description: GENEVA  The United Nations secretary general, Ban Ki-moon, warned that Yemen was a ticking bomb, as efforts to start talks aimed at achieving at least a cease-fire in the country were further delayed on Monday.

title: Mondays Travel News and Tips
description: Our weekday morning digest that includes consumer news, deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: ScienceTake | How Hawkmoths See at Dusk
description: Hawkmoths see at dusk by slowing down visual processing in the brain.

title: Hawkmoths Slow Brain to Dine in the Night
description: Getting food can be tough for all sorts of animals, but the hawkmoth has a particular challenge. It feeds at dusk by inserting a long proboscis into a flower to drink nectar.

title: Yankees Alex Rodriguez Keeps Security Guard Busy Chasing Down History
description: When Stephen Drew hit a home run into the right-field stands last Tuesday night at Yankee Stadium, Nick Paccione watched it sail over his head. The next thing he knew, the ball ricocheted off a seat behind him and right into his hands.

title: Naomi Oreskes, a Lightning Rod in a Changing Climate
description: The job interviewer scrutinized the young American geology student sitting across from him. She was about to graduate from the Royal School of Mines in London, and was trying to break into a field long unwelcoming to women.

title: New York Today: Morning Downpour
description: Good very wet Monday morning.

title: New York Today: Morning Downpour
description: Good very wet Monday morning.

title: Jeb Bush on the Issues
description: Jeb Bush, who was governor of Florida from 1999 to 2007, on Monday announced his candidacy for the Republican presidential nomination. A son of George Bush, the 41st president, and a younger brother of George W. Bush, the 43rd, he is known for sometimes bucking Republican orthodoxy. Here is a look at his stand on important issues.

title: Suspected Explosives Found in Hong Kong
description: Nine people have been taken into custody after what were believed to be explosives were found in an abandoned studio, the police said. The former colony is set to vote on political overhaul this week.

title: 5 Things You May Not Know About Jeb Bush
description: He is the son and the younger brother of presidents and was a two-term governor of Florida, now the nations third most populous state. But there is much voters can still learn about Jeb Bush, who announced his campaign for the Republican presidential nomination on Monday. Here are some things you may not know about him.

title: Argentine Women Call Out Machismo
description: BUENOS AIRES  It started with a single tweet. Theyre killing us. A cry of deep despair from a female journalist that needed no explanation for women in Argentina: Within weeks, hundreds of thousands marched in cities across the nation with a single purpose  to demand an end to the killing.

title: 2 BishopsResign in Minnesota Over Sexual Abuse Scandal
description: CHICAGO  Two bishops in the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of St. Paul and Minneapolis resigned their posts Monday, the second time this spring that American church leaders have stepped aside after complaints over their handling of sexual abuse claims involving priests.

title: Egypts Vanishing Youth
description: CAIRO  Esraa el-Taweel, 23, went out to dinner with friends on June 1 and has not been seen since. Ms. Taweel, a student and photojournalist who was shot in the spine last year while covering protests on the anniversary of Egypts 2011 revolution, is said to have difficulty walking. Her family believes she was forcibly disappeared along with two young friends, Sohaib Mohamed and Amr Mohamed.

title: Do Corporations Have Minds?
description: Back in 2007, Viacom filed a copyright infringement lawsuit. It alleged that the defendants had created a website that was hosting copyrighted Viacom videos, including everything from the The Colbert Report to SpongeBob SquarePants. But that was not all. Viacom made a series of allegations about the defendants mental states. It alleged that they specifically intended to host these illegal videos, that they were doing so knowingly and with brazen disregard for the law.

title: To Lose Weight, Eating Less Is Far More Important Than Exercising More
description: One of my familys favorite shows is The Biggest Loser. Although some viewers dont appreciate how it pushes people so hard to lose weight, the show probably inspires some overweight people to regain control of their lives.

title: Concert by the Sea, a Jazz Classic by Erroll Garner, Is to Be Reissued
description: Few jazz albums have reached as wide an audience as the pianist Erroll Garners Concert by the Sea. Recorded in Carmel-by-the-Sea, Calif., in 1955, it was released on Columbia and quickly achieved a rare sort of success  becoming not only a standout moment in Mr. Garners career but also an essential touchstone for pianists, and one of the best-selling jazz albums ever.

title: Today in Politics: Jeb Bush Is Set to Make Official What Was Widely Known
description: Good Monday morning from Washington, where, yet again, there is work to be done and drama to watch over the trade bill. But after this week, nearly every hopeful will be formally accounted for on the campaign trail, as Hillary Rodham Clinton held her official kickoff rally on Saturday and Jeb Bush tells us he is, indeed, running for president.

title: Britons, Some Raising a Pint, Celebrate Magna Cartas 800th Anniversary
description: LONDON  The 800th anniversary on Monday of Magna Carta, a medieval political truce that inspired protections for some of the worlds most cherished liberties, prompted a range of celebrations in Britain that included a ceremony involving Queen Elizabeth II and a national beer day.

title: E. Tautz: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: London

title: Europe Is Urged to Prepare for Greek Default as Stances Harden on Debt Deal
description: BRUSSELS  A chorus of voices on Monday called on European Union authorities to plan for Greece to default on its huge pile of debt after bailout talks between Athens and its creditors deteriorated over the weekend.

title: Morning Agenda: Greek Debt Talks Break Down Again
description: GREEK DEBT TALKS BREAK DOWN AGAIN | Another attempt at a bailout agreement for Greece fell apart on Sunday night after Greek officials angrily contended that their European counterparts in the weekend talks did not have the authority to negotiate any kind of deal,  James Kanter and Landon Thomas Jr. write in The New York Times. The Greek officials who traveled to Brussels for the talks were Nikos Pappas, a close confidant of Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras, and Yannis Dragasakis, the deputy prime minister. They met with senior-level European officials, none of whom had the same rank in their respective government posts. They wanted us to hit our targets by slashing pensions and increasing taxes, said one senior member of the Greek negotiating team, Mr. Kanter and Mr. Thomas write. But they had no mandate to negotiate.

title: Shouting Grexit in a Crowded Theater
description: Some readers have noted that I havent said much about the Greek crisis in the past few days. Indeed. Its crunch time, and right now everyone involved needs to engage in quiet, cool deliberation. Theres really nothing more outsiders can say, at least in public, that we havent already said. So it seems to me that for now I should hold back a bit.

title: Q. and A.: Holden Chow on China, Elections and Hong Kongs Attitude
description: Hong Kongs legislature is set to vote this week on a proposal to allow all eligible voters in the former British colony the chance to vote in the 2017 election for the citys top leader, the chief executive. Supporters and opponents say the measure, which will require the support of two-thirds of the 70 delegates, is likely to be voted down.

title: United Technologies Plans to Sell or Spin Off Sikorsky Unit
description: LONDON  The United Technologies Corporation said on Monday that it planned to either sell or spin off Sikorsky Aircraft, the maker of the Black Hawk helicopters favored by the United States military.

title: Omar al-Bashir, Leaving South Africa, Eludes Arrest Again
description: JOHANNESBURG  Shielded by the authorities, President Omar Hassan al-Bashir of Sudan flew out of South Africa on Monday morning aboard his presidential jet, just hours before a South African court ruled that the government was legally required to arrest him.

title: Absence of Jebmentum
description: Nate Cohn notes Jeb Bushs failure to nail down the GOP nomination, or even to establish himself as the candidate of the Republican moderates (I think we always need scare quotes in this context). Jeb is nowhere close to even having the kind of position Mitt Romney had at this stage.

title: Why It Matters That Hillary Clinton Wore Ralph Lauren
description: At her campaign opening rally on Roosevelt Island on Saturday (to be distinguished from her campaign announcement, in April), Hillary Rodham Clinton donned her now-signature look: a bright blue pantsuit with a matching bright blue shirt underneath. She stuck out a mile, matched her H campaign logo  which was also the design of her stage  and looked appropriately patriotic, especially when standing next to Bill Clinton in his red polo.

title: China Ends Recovery Efforts on Ship That Capsized on Yangtze
description: BEIJING  China has concluded rescue and recovery efforts surrounding a cruise ship that capsized this month on the Yangtze River and has revised its count of the number of people who were on board and the number of survivors, according to official news media.

title: Vatican Sets Trial for Ex-Ambassador Accused of Sexual Abuse
description: The Vatican announced on Monday that in July it will open a trial of its former ambassador to the Dominican Republic on charges of sexually abusing boys while serving in the Caribbean and of possessing child pornography.

title: Homebuilders Standard Pacific, Ryland to Merge
description: Two big California homebuilders, the Standard Pacific Corporation and the Ryland Group, have agreed to combine in a so-called merger of equals.

title: CVS to Buy 1,600 Drugstores From Target for $1.9 Billion
description: The voracious CVS Health is already a dominant player in nearly every corner of the health care world  it is the nations largest dispenser of prescription drugs, the biggest operator of health care clinics and the second-largest pharmacy-benefits manager.

title: Owner of Kelley Blue Book and Autotrader to Buy Dealertrack for $4 Billion
description: Cox Automotive, a provider of digital marketing and e-commerce services for the automotive industry, said on Monday that it would buy Dealertrack Technologies for $4 billion in cash.

description: Martin Schulz, the president of the European Parliament, said a withdrawal from the eurozone would have drastic consequences for Greece as well as for the European Union.

title: Daily Report: Virtual Reality Tries to Establish Its Own Mores
description: The ability of virtual reality to transport people to locales both exotic and ordinary, is well known. Yet how the medium will fit into peoples online and offline lives is a new frontier, writes Nick Wingfield.

description: LeBron James has been carrying the injury-riddled Cavaliers in the N.B.A. finals with one heroic performance after another. Now, down by three games to two, undermanned Cleveland may finally have run out of gas.

title: 1965: Jewish Cemetery Vandalized
description: BAMBERG, GERMANY  The ancient cemetery was found grossly vandalized today [June 15] in what is one of the worst anti-Semitic outbreaks recorded in Germany since the war. Police reported that vandals had desecrated 23 tombstones in the cemetery with yard-high swastikas and anti-Semitic smearings such as six million Jews were too few. The desecration was discovered by two American families who had returned here to visit the graves of relatives.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, June 16, 1965

title: Supreme Court Refuses to Hear Case on Pre-Abortion Ultrasounds
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday refused to hear an appeal from North Carolina officials seeking to revive a state law that had required doctors to perform ultrasounds, display the resulting sonograms and describe the fetuses to women seeking abortions.

description: The Brooklyn-based artist, whose book Babe is out now, tells T about the movies, artists, activities and more that inspire her.

description: Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain spoke on Monday at Runnymede on the banks of the River Thames to commemorate the signing of Magna Carta there eight centuries ago.

title: Boston Muslims Struggle to Wrest Image of Islam From Terrorists
description: BOSTON  Yusufi Vali was hunched over his computer at this citys biggest mosque, where he is executive director, when the first phone call came. The police had killed a man a few miles away. Soon there were reports that the man was a Muslim who had been under investigation for terrorism.

description: Hidden City Tours, which specializes in walking tours led by the homeless and formerly homeless, has a new Street Life tour of Barcelona, Spain, focused on a side of the city tourists  and residents  dont often see.

description: PHOENIX  Judge G. Murray Snow pressed Sheriff Joe Arpaio to answer a bit of an odd question: Was the sheriff investigating the judge and his wife?

description: NEW DELHI  On a sticky morning last week, Deputy Commissioner Chandra Shekhar Sahukar of Indias Agriculture Ministry (animal husbandry department, small ruminant section) found himself in a yoga class for the first time in his 57 years, miserably grasping his ankle.

description: PLATTSBURGH, N.Y.  A prison employee made a brief appearance in court here on Monday morning after her arrest on charges that she helped two convicted killers make their dramatic escape from the state prison in nearby Dannemora.

description: Ban Ki-moon, the secretary general of the United Nations, and Riyadh Yaseen, the foreign minister of Yemen, spoke on Monday as efforts to start peace talks in the country were delayed.

description: Amid attacks on Islam in Boston, the Islamic Society of Boston Cultural Center, seeks to build a home for a distinctly American Islam, one that models community service, tolerance and compassion.

title: What Mountain Climbing Can Teach You About Business
description: When we think of mountain climbing, we tend to think of Mount Everest and big groups of people climbing in long lines. Armies of Sherpas create base camps and ferry supplies and gear up and down the mountain. Miles of rope anchored to the mountainside helps climbers reach the top. For a very long time, many people considered this the best way to climb a mountain.

title: Defining Hillary Clinton as a Fighter

description: Craig Kanaricks kitchen is a study in modern culinary desire, every corner equipped with things I cant live without, he said.

title: In Game of Thrones Finale, a Breakdown in Storytelling
description: You wouldnt have thought that a show based on a beloved series of books, with hundreds of pages of existing story to work from  a mythology that is an actual mythology  would become the Lost of its television generation. But thats where Game of Thrones finds itself after Sunday nights Season 5 finale: a wildly popular show that seems to have lost its way, and to be losing faith with a growing number of its viewers.

title: 1940: Roosevelt Scorns Hitler
description: WASHINGTON  President Roosevelt indicating his belief that Adolf Hitlers word is worthless referred today [June 14] to Germanys record of broken pledges to other nations as discounting the value of a reported statement by Chancellor Hitler that he had no intention of attacking the United States or any other part of the Western Hemisphere.

title: Matt Enlows Rectangle Division Puzzle
Jeb Bush Is Still the Favorite, the Markets Say
description: Jeb Bush has had a rough few months. He fumbled a question about the war in Iraq. He has not consolidated the support of Republican elites, as Nate Cohn notes. And he has not scared off other candidates who could hurt him in the primaries, like John Kasich. There is no clever case to be made that Mr. Bushs campaign has actually performed well this spring.

title: Rachel Dolezal Leaves N.A.A.C.P. Post as Past Discrimination Suit Is Revealed
description: A few years before she began claiming to be black, an N.A.A.C.P. official who now stands accused of deceiving people about her race apparently sued a historically black university, charging that it had discriminated against her  in part for being white.

title: Plan for Theme Park at Centuries-Old Chinese Caves Rattles Preservationists
description: DUNHUANG, China  In the cool shadows of Cave 98, Li Lingzhi watched as workers in blue suits inspected the Buddhist frescoes commissioned in this Gobi Desert cliff grotto more than a millennium ago by a local ruling family.

title: Ruling in A.I.G. Bailout Lawsuit
description: A judge ruled the government does not owe Maurice Greenberg and other shareholders any damages over the companys 2008 bailout.

title: High Seas Style at Alexander McQueen
description: In one of our favorite looks so far, Alexander McQueen featured a modern riff on the perennial nautical theme, pairing a patchwork knit with trim, cropped sailor pants. The beauty was in the details: two different widths of stripes spliced together at the top, and buttons anchoring the sides of the hems at the bottom.

title: Building a Better Tortilla
description: The Bread Lab at Washington State University is working to improve the quality of Chipotles tortillas.

title: Chipotles Quest to Develop a Better Tortilla
description: MOUNT VERNON, Wash.  The latest piece of equipment at the Bread Lab, a heavenly smelling corner of the Washington State University campus here, is a tortilla press, a gift from Chipotle Mexican Grill.

title: Companies Move On From Big Data Technology Hadoop
description: There is increasing evidence that Hadoop  one of the most important technologies of the past several years for big data analysis is not keeping up with the world that created it.

title: Feminine Fabrics Foray Into Mens Wear
description: More so than ever, fabrics traditionally perceived as feminine are being cut into convincing mens wear silhouettes. At the spring/summer 2016 shows in London, tiers of ruffles cascaded down Alexander McQueen knits and Wales Bonners jewel-encrusted, velvet suits felt tough  not ladylike. This afternoon, Burberry Prorsum showed an entire collection of lace, both subtle  with shirts and ties peeping out of suits  and dramatic, as in this finale look. (And the actors Chiwetel Ejiofor and Samuel L. Jackson had front-row seats to the show.)

title: Ex-A.I.G. Chief Wins Bailout Suit, but Gets No Damages
description: WASHINGTON  When Maurice R. Greenberg, the former chief executive of the American International Group, brought a class-action lawsuit against the government in 2011, contending that the Federal Reserve overstepped its bounds when it bailed out his company at the height of the financial crisis, the reaction was mainly befuddlement and outright ridicule.

title: Letters to the Editor
Workers Can Be Fired for Marijuana Use, Colorado Court Rules
description: DENVER  Even in one of the countrys most marijuana-friendly states, smoking pot off the job and away from work can still get an employee fired.

title: Grace Wales Bonners High-Low, Gender-Defying Clothes You Might Actually Wear
description: Following her quiet breakthrough at last seasons Fashion East presentation, Grace Wales Bonner delivered on high expectations today, the last day of London Collections Mens spring/summer 2016 shows. In a thoughtful, wide-sweeping collection withmulticultural, high-low, gender-defying implications, Wales Bonner achieved the impossible: clothes you might actually wear. The former T cover star Nader Chaudhry modeled one of the strongest looks, a faded, checked linen shirt worn with wide topstitched denim.

title: What Happens to Surplus Super PAC Money?
description: This is only the second presidential election in which super PACs, which can raise unlimited money as long as they dont coordinate directly with candidates, will play a role. Jeb Bushs super PAC, for instance, was expected to raise $100 million, though it now appears it wont reach that number this month.

title: Peter Walters Voyage Into a Microscopic World
description: Peter Walter, a professor of biochemistry at the University of California, San Francisco, studies how proteins within cells communicate with one another. His contributions have been instrumental in shaping scientific understanding of how cells are organized and how they function.

title: In London, Hands-On Graffiti
description: The East End of London is famous for the vibrant graffiti art splashed throughout the streets, and now a new experience from the London-based experiential travel company NoteWorthy gives travelers a chance to get up close with its culture. The half-day excursion begins with a local graffiti artist giving guests an overview of the history behind the art form and a walking tour of murals, including works by the renowned Banksy.

title: Complicities
description: A selection of Brigitte Lacombe photographs, which go on sale tonight through Phillips in Manhattan.

title: John Cleese and Eric Idle to Hit the Road Together
description: Theyve been comedic collaborators for roughly half a century, and after all that time youd understand if John Cleese and Eric Idle would prefer to spend the next 50 years as far apart as possible. But can it be that these two founding members of Monty Python might actually be  getting along?

title: G.E. Said to Struggle to Find Buyers of Australian Units
description: SYDNEY, Australia  GE Capital, the financial arm of General Electric, is struggling to drum up interest in its Australian commercial lending and leasing businesses, according to people briefed on the matter.

title: Warriors Prove Even LeBron James Cant Do It Alone
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  It was up to LeBron James again to try to salvage what he could against a superior team, to push the Golden State Warriors to the brink as he chased another improbable victory for the Cleveland Cavaliers. So he lined up a shot 34 feet from the basket, and nobody at Oracle Arena on Sunday night seemed terribly surprised when it went in.

title: Kurds and Syrian Rebels Storm ISIS-Held Border Town
description: ISTANBUL  A coalition of Kurdish militias and Arab rebels stormed into a strategic Syrian town on the Turkey border on Monday, seizing most of it from Islamic State fighters who had long used the area to smuggle supplies and fighters into their self-declared caliphate, according to Kurdish militia leaders and activists.

title: Suicide Bombers Strike Chads Capital
description: DAKAR, Senegal  Suicide bombers struck for the first time in the capital of Chad on Monday morning, apparently in retaliation for the leading role the country has played in a regional war against the Nigerian terrorist group Boko Haram, officials said.

title: Review: Deutschland 83 Focuses on a Reluctant Cold War Spy
description: Television has featured a fair amount of spying lately, and a fair amount of 1980s nostalgia, too. But Deutschland 83, an espionage series from Germany set in that wretched decade, is fresh and enjoyable nonetheless, distinguishing itself with a young protagonist and a losers-history perspective.

title: Jurassic World Sets Box Office Record
description: LOS ANGELES  A monster hit, indeed: Jurassic World, as it turns out, took in $208.8 million at the North American box office over the weekend, 2 percent more than estimated on Sunday and enough to enter Hollywoods record books as the biggest opening ever, Universal Pictures said on Monday.

title: Prison Employee Faces Charges
description: Joyce E. Mitchell, a woman charged with helping two convicted murderers escape from a maximum-security prison in New York, appeared in court on Monday as the manhunt continued.

title: Goldman Sachs Plans to Offer Consumer Loans Online, Adopting Start-Ups Tactics
description: Goldman Sachs has spent 146 years largely as the bank of the powerful and privileged.

title: Jeb Bush Shows Loyalty to a Logo Derided by Some
description: Jeb Bushs new campaign logo  Jeb!  was unveiled to guffaws that it was unoriginal and lacking in design elements, but for the former Florida governor, a throwback look appears to have been part of the plan.

title: Live and Kicking: Soccer Games to Watch This Week
description: Club soccer is so last month. Its all internationals this week. The soccer editor Andrew Das tells you what to watch.

title: Justices Uphold Denial of Visa to Afghan Husband of American Woman
description: WASHINGTON  In a fractured 5-to-4 decision with no majority opinion, the Supreme Court on Monday refused to second-guess the denial of a visa on national security grounds to the Afghan husband of an American woman.

title: Too Much at Risk for Sepp Blatter to Renege on Vow to Resign
description: If social media is any indication, it is highly possible that many soccer fans have been so busy celebrating Sepp Blatters announcement that he will step down as FIFA president that they missed a number of key developments in the story.

title: Science, Now Under Scrutiny Itself
description: The crimes and misdemeanors of science used to be handled mostly in-house, with a private word at the faculty club, barbed questions at a conference, maybe a quiet dismissal. On the rare occasion when a journal publicly retracted a study, it typically did so in a cryptic footnote. Few were the wiser; many retracted studies have been cited as legitimate evidence by others years after the fact.

title: Womens Bodies Safe from North Carolina Lawmakers, For Now
description: There is no shortage of absurdly creative (or creatively absurd?) attempts by lawmakers around the country to prevent women from controlling what happens inside their own bodies.

title: Brigitte Lacombe Shares Her Secret
description: Though their subjects include many of the most iconic celebrities of the last half-century, Brigitte Lacombes photographs have become classics of the genre because of their distinct lack of cinematic artifice. Its nothing to do with photography, the French-born, New York-based lenswoman says of her approach. Its about what you can establish with a person within a very short period of time.

title: Womens World Cup: How Each Team Advanced
description: What must the U.S., Canada and other teams do to move on, and whats next for them if they do?

title: Tobys Estate Offers Cold-Brew Coffee in a Bottle
description: To Sip: Cold-Brew Coffee With a Twist-Off Cap

title: Pope Francis Calls for Climate Action in Draft of Encyclical
description: ROME  Pope Francis offers a broad vision of an endangered planet, partly blaming human activity and fossil fuels for climate change while calling for people of all religions to take swift action, according to a leaked draft of his much-awaited environmental encyclical that was posted online Monday by an Italian magazine.

title: No. 2 Qaeda Leader May Have Died in U.S. Airstrike in Yemen
description: WASHINGTON  Yemeni officials and extremists reported on Monday that the leader of Al Qaedas Yemen affiliate and recently the second-ranking official of the global terror network, Nasser al-Wuhayshi, had been killed in an American drone strike. American officials said they could not confirm the reports but were investigating.

title: A Jellyfish That Quickly Puts Itself Back Together
description: When a juvenile moon jellyfish loses tentacles, it rapidly reorganizes its remaining limbs to maintain symmetry, a new study says.

title: Manhunt: Reporters Notebook
description: Batteries and chargers and GPS. Snacks and water and sensible shoes. And an awful lot of patience.

title: Sand Fly Saliva Proves a Good Monkey Vaccine for Leishmaniasis
description: A vaccine against leishmaniasis based on the saliva of sand flies has worked well in monkeys and may have potential to work in humans, according to a new study.

title: N.B.A. Finals Have a Shot at Ratings Not Seen in Years
description: Twenty million people once routinely watched games in the N.B.A. finals  when Ronald Reagan, George H. W. Bush and Bill Clinton were in the White House.

title: Review: In How Music Got Free, Stephen Witt Details an Industry Sea Change
description: In Terry Zwigoffs 2001 film,  Ghost World,  a teenager, Enid, walks into the room where Seymour keeps his vast collection of old 78 r.p.m. records and says: You are, like, the luckiest guy in the world. I would kill to have stuff like this.

title: Hudsons Bay Deal Looks to Have Benign Financial Consequences
description: Hudsons Bay was originally set up in 1670 by British royal charter and headed by a German cousin of the reigning Charles II. Lately, it has existed as a Canadian company with a North American presence.

title: The Illusionists Will Reappear on Broadway
description: Almost a year after it disappeared The Illusionists, a magic-based variety show, is returning, this time to the Neil Simon Theater.

title: First Draft Focus: Story Time With Hillary
House Republicans and White House Try to Revive Trade Bill Stalled by Democrats
description: WASHINGTON  Congressional Republican leaders and White House officials on Monday explored ways to resurrect trade legislation that stalled last week when House Democrats objected and dealt President Obama an embarrassing defeat at the hands of his own party.

title: Is He Really Dead? And Where Does Game of Thrones Stand for Season 6?
description: Spoilers follow for the season 5 finale of Game of Thrones. Like immediately.

title: Nepal Reopens Heritage Sites Despite U.N. Concerns
description: KATHMANDU, Nepal  The Nepal government declared several damaged heritage sites open to the public on Monday, in a bid to recover tourism revenues in the region hit by an earthquake, but United Nations officials worried that the buildings were not entirely ready.

title: A Thirsty Colorado Is Battling Over Who Owns Raindrops
description: DENVER  When Jason Story bought an old soy sauce barrel to collect the rain dripping from his downspout, he figured he had found an environmentally friendly way to water his gardens beets and spinach. But under the quirks of Western water rules, where raindrops are claimed even as they tumble from the sky, he became a water outlaw.

title: State Museum in Albany Plans Overhaul of Its Galleries
description: Though its profile in New York City may be low, the New York State Museum is one of the largest museum attractions in the state, with 635,000 visitors a year  more than the annual attendance of the Frick Collection, for example, or the Brooklyn Museum.

title: S.E.C. Finds Itself in a Constitutional Conundrum
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission may soon be confronting the adage be careful what you wish for.

title: Gap Is Closing 175 Stores, Hoping for a Turnaround
description: Gap announced on Monday that it planned to close one-fourth of its stores in North America over the next few years, potentially affecting thousands of jobs, as the brand struggles to turn around a business mired in a long sales slump.

title: Expired Rent Regulation Rules Would Cause More Anxiety Than Chaos, Officials Say
description: New York renters faced uncertainty about potential large rent increases as state lawmakers let rent regulations expire on Monday without renewing them. But the city has been there before, with no dire consequences.

title: Abby Wambach Says U.S. Would Be Scoring More on Grass
description: Abby Wambach caused a stir at the Womens World Cup over the weekend when she told reporters that the United States would have scored more goals in its first two games if the tournament was not being played on artificial turf.

title: Royal Sibling Rivalry
description: Prince William and Prince Harry faced off against each other at a charity polo match in Gloucestershire, Britain.

title: Fashions Ex-Enfant Terrible Launches an Auction House
description: In his former life as a clothing designer and member of the downtown New York fashion collective Asfour, Kai Khne was a notorious enfant terrible whose party-boy antics made him something of a tabloid habitu. In recent years, however, he has more or less forsaken the city in favor of a woodsy idyll in the western Catskills, embracing what he calls the new luxury of local and sustainable living and cultivating a life around upstates growing food, design and art scenes. After opening a pop-up farm-to-table restaurant and antiques gallery in the town of Andes in the summer of 2013, Khne and his boyfriend, John Mollett, are launching a new project this week back in New York: an auction house under the name of Hasbeens & Willbees that will bring a bit of the Catskills ethos down to the city. They kick things off Wednesday with the sale of a trove of objets belonging to their late friend, the upstate-based interior designer Kenyan Lewis, who died suddenly of diabetes complications last December.

title: St. Paul Bishop Assesses Resignations
description: The Rev. Andrew Cozzens, an auxiliary bishop for the archdiocese, called the resignation of Archbishop John Nienstedt and his aide an opportunity for greater healing.

title: The Prime of Life, by Steven Mintz
description: The notion that adulthood, despite its perks, is little more than a booby prize for surviving the scrapes and trials of youth has more or less become a cultural given in the modern age. From the 1950s narrative of soul-crushed men in gray flannel suits to the existential torment of hippies-turned-yuppies in the 1980s to the tyrannical scheduling demands of todays Lean In movement, grown-up life in America is generally framed as a sort of bland entree following the assortment of colorful appetizers that make up childhood and young adulthood. Moreover, as any armchair social anthropologist will tell you, maturity seems to kick in later and later with each passing generation.

title: How to Raise an Adult, by Julie Lythcott-Haims
description: When did the central aim of parenting become preparing children for success? This reigning paradigm, which dictates that every act of nurturing be judged on the basis of whether it will usher a child toward a life of accomplishment or failure, embodies the fundamental insecurity of global capitalist culture, with its unbending fixation on prosperity and the future. Its no surprise that parenting incites such heated debates, considering how paradoxical these principles can be when theyre applied to children. When each nurturing act is administered with the distant future in mind, what becomes of the present? A child who soaks in the ambient anxiety that surrounds each trivial choice or activity is an anxious child, formed in the hand-wringing, future-focused image of her anxious parents.

title: Petra Collins Shares Her Favorite Things
description: Describing Petra Collins as a photographer is reductive, though its her photographs for which shes best known. That said, shes also well recognized from the many photographs that have been taken of her, notably by her mentors Richard Kern and Ryan McGinley. And she is probably most infamous for her drawings, particularly her Period Power illustration for an American Apparel T-shirt that generated significant media notoriety. (To further complicate things, that illustration was originally based on a neon light sculpture that Collins had previously created.)

title: Review: Rachel Podger Plays Bach for Flute With Her Violin
description: As a rule, violinists rarely pilfer foreign repertory. They dont need to. With so much first-rate music written for the violin, the motivation to adapt and transcribe works written for other instruments is low. So why did Rachel Podger, one of the leading performers on the Baroque violin, open her masterly recital at the Baryshnikov Arts Center on Sunday with Bachs Partita in A minor for solo flute, transposed into the key of G minor? Because when it comes to Bach, Ms. Podger told the audience, You cant get enough.

title: Why Grow Up? by Susan Neiman
description: A great deal of modern popular culture  including just about everything pertaining to what French savants like to call le nouvel ge dor de la comdie amricaine  runs on the disavowal of maturity. The ideal consumer is a mirror image of a familiar comic archetype: a man-child sitting in his parents basement with his video games and his Star Wars figurines; a postgraduate girl and her pals treating the world as their playground. Baby boomers pursue perpetual youth into retirement. Gen-Xers hold fast to their skateboards, their Pixies T-shirts and their Beastie Boys CDs. Nobody wants to be an adult anymore, and every so often someone writes an article blaming Hollywood, attachment parenting, global capitalism or the welfare state for this catastrophe. Ive written one or two of those myself. Its not a bad racket, and since Im intimately acquainted, on a professional basis, with the cinematic oeuvre of Adam Sandler, I qualify as something of an expert.

title: Themes of the Popes Encyclical on Climate, Equity and the Environment Emerge in Italian Leak
description: Also see the new post: Beware Casting Pope Francis as a Caped Climate Crusader.

title: Jeb Bush Openly Runs for President, Finally
description: Jeb Bush, the former governor of Florida who has been pretending not to be a presidential candidate for months, stopped that charade today with an announcement speech in Miami in which he pretended some other things: that he is not part of a political dynasty, that he has shown how to cut government costs while protecting ordinary people, and that he will be a candidate to all people all the time.

title: Review: Adam Lambert Tones Down Excess on The Original High
description: ADAM LAMBERT

title: Discontent in Eastern Ukraine Leads to Rare Public Protest
description: MOSCOW  Residents of two frequently shelled neighborhoods in Donetsk in eastern Ukraine staged a public antiwar protest on Monday, an exceedingly rare event in rebel-held territory.

title: Review: Brian Landrus Trios The Deep Below Is All About the Bass End
description: BRIAN LANDRUS TRIO

title: Review: Ran Blakes Ghost Tones Connects With George Russell
description: RAN BLAKE

title: California Has to Repay $331 Million to Homeowners Fund, Court Rules
description: A court ruled late Friday that California is obligated to return $331 million that it took from a fund designated to help troubled borrowers but instead used to plug holes in the states budget.

title: Review: Rebecca Stenns Riparius (Belonging to the River) in Brooklyn Debut
description: In Brooklyn, near the Ninth Street Bridge over the notoriously polluted Gowanus Canal, a postindustrial wasteland seems to be in the early stages of gentrification. Amid warehouses with For Rent placards, one telling sign of change is the 19th-century factory building that has been converted into the Gowanus Industrial Arts Complex. On the top floor is a clean, white, airy space known as the Gowanus Loft. And it is here that the Rebecca Stenn Company is debuting its new work, Riparius (Belonging to the River).

title: First Draft Focus: Jeb Bush Makes It Official
description: Jeb Bush Announces White House Bid, Saying America Deserves Better

title: Review: Ryn Weavers The Fool Experiments While Echoing Stevie Nicks
description: RYN WEAVER

title: Broadway Reaps Box-Office Benefits of Tonys Broadcast
description: Broadway enjoyed a post-Tonys bounce last week, with 10 shows grossing more than $1 million each after the annual awards broadcast prompted a bump in ticket sales.

title: Pictures of the Day: Kenya and Elsewhere
description: Kenya and More  Photos of the Day

title: Omar al-Bashir Case Shows International Criminal Courts Limitations
description: The International Criminal Court was created in 2002 with an audacious promise: to go after the biggest perpetrators of crimes against humanity and those who commit genocide.

title: June 15, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Kenya, Gaza City, Syria and Greece.

title: June 15, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Kenya, Gaza City, Syria and Greece.

title: Xbox One to Get Backward Compatibility, Microsoft Says at E3
description: LOS ANGELES  Microsoft talked about plenty of new things on Monday at the video game industrys big annual E3 conference, but it was something old that got the biggest rise out of the crowd.

title: Xbox One to Get Backward Compatibility, Microsoft Says at E3
description: LOS ANGELES  Microsoft talked about plenty of new things on Monday at the video game industrys big annual E3 conference, but it was something old that got the biggest rise out of the crowd.

title: Parents Denial Fuels Childhood Obesity Epidemic
description: Not only was the 16-year-old boy 60 pounds overweight, but a blood test showed he might have fatty liver disease. At last, his mother took him to a pediatric weight management clinic in New Haven. But she did not at all like the dietitians advice.

title: From Plastic Tablecloths, Three-Dimensional Art Grows
description: The interdisciplinary artist Crystal Wagner isnt interested in people looking at art as an object on the wall, or a print over there, she says. Instead, Wagner hopes to elicit a sense of wonder through her three-dimensional murals made from birthday party tablecloths stuffed into a chicken-wire armature, with paper embellishments. The ingredients are deliberate: A lot of our aesthetic experience is defined by the places that we visit on a daily basis  you dont even realize that theyre burning themselves into your retina, she notes. Its the way that the cereals are lined up on shelves, or how Coke cans sit next to the Mountain Dew. So, I wanted to create organic bioforms that seem to grow, but using materials that people are exposed to.

title: Astrid Andersen and A$AP Ferg Team Up for a Kung-Fu Ode to the 90s
description: [Watch the video on YouTube.]

title: Walkabout: Iceland Tourism Surges; Business Travel
description: Longer Lines Tourism to Iceland has been on an upswing, with a 24 percent increase in visitors, with a total of 970,000 in 2014. The trend shows no signs of stopping; last month, the number of visitors from the United States increased 76 percent compared with last year. (Skift)

title: Review: The Last Beach and The Narrow Edge Share Tales of Harm and Hope Along Our Coasts
description: In her song Big Yellow Taxi, Joni Mitchell gave voice to a lament we hear more and more these days: you dont know what youve got till its gone. Her theme is the landscape  paradise, she calls it in the song, paved over for a parking lot.

title: Jeb Bush Wants 4 Percent Growth. That Will Be Hard to Reach.
description: Jeb Bush wants to make the United States an economic superpower like no other, as he said in announcing his candidacy for president Monday. There is a good case, of course, that the nation already is an economic superpower like no other: It has the highest gross domestic product in the world by a margin of about $7 trillion.

title: The Chat: Jeb Bushs Announcement Speech, Instantly Analyzed
description: Jeb Bush formally entered the race for the 2016 Republican presidential nomination on Monday with a speech at the Kendall campus of Miami Dade College. Over instant messages, two New York Times political correspondents  Patrick Healy and Maggie Haberman  analyzed Mr. Bushs remarks in real time, as they did with the campaign announcements of several other 2016 candidates. Here is an edited version of their chat.

title: Hillary Clinton Pushes to Expand Access to Pre-Kindergarten
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton on Monday pushed to broaden President Obamas efforts to expand access to pre-kindergarten, proposing more federal money for states to provide preschool to children from moderate and low-income families.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Jeb Bushs Formal Announcement
description: Mr. Bush, the former governor of Florida, announced that he was officially beginning his presidential bid.

title: In Performance | Sierra Boggess
description: Ms. Boggess sings the number A Little Bit Less Than from the musical comedy It Shoulda Been You, on Broadway at the Brooks Atkinson Theater.

title: Rachel Dolezals Passing Isnt So Unusual
description: Why do we care so much about Rachel Dolezal, the head of the Spokane, Wash., chapter of the N.A.A.C.P. who apparently misrepresented herself as African-American when, according to her parents, she is Czech, Swedish and German, with some remote Native American ancestry?

title: Reactions to Bashirs Defiance
description: President Omar Hassan al-Bashir of Sudan defied a court order to remain in South Africa until it ruled on an application for his arrest on genocide charges from the International Criminal Court.

title: Facing Consumer Pressure, Companies Start to Seek Safe Alternatives to BPA
description: For consumers, figuring out which canned foods and plastics contain the controversial chemical known as BPA can be nearly impossible. But determining whether newer alternatives are any safer may be even more difficult.

title: Buried in Jeb Bush Website, a Die Hard Surprise
description: For an hour or so this afternoon, buried in the source code of Jeb Bushs website were several paragraphs summarizing the plot of the Die Hard movie franchise.

title: Kayakers Protest in Seattle Waters
description: Protesters in kayaks set up a blockade in Elliott Bay as Royal Dutch Shells drill rig left Seattle on its way to explore for oil in the Arctic Ocean off Alaska.

title: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: Good evening! Heres the latest.

title: Times Critics Picks: What to Do This Week
description: Looking to break out of your cultural rut?

title: After Blackout in California, a Squirrel Seems Too Convenient a Scapegoat
description: BERKELEY, Calif.  Was it really all the squirrels fault?

title: Karzai, Vowing That Hes Done, Discusses His Afghanistan Legacy
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Hamid Karzai, the former president of Afghanistan, wants to set a few things straight.

title: Russia Urges U.S. Not to Deploy Weapons to Border Areas
description: MOSCOW  Moscow issued muted warnings on Monday in response to the Pentagons possible stationing of battle tanks and other heavy weapons to speed the deployment of American troops if needed in NATO states bordering Russia.

title: Conlon Nancarrows Player-Piano Works at the Whitney: No Live Performer Needed
description: In a cramped alcove just off the airy 204-seat theater at the Whitney Museum of American Arts new home downtown, Jay Sanders was seeing his player piano in action for the first time. Two technicians had been tinkering with the instrument, a 1921 Marshall and Wendell Ampico upright, and now they were letting it run.

title: LastPass Password Manager Acknowledges Breach
description: LastPass, the online password manager, announcedMonday in a blog post that its network was breached and that hackers made off with user email addresses, password reminders and encrypted masterpasswords.

title: LastPass Password Manager Acknowledges Breach
description: LastPass, the online password manager, announcedMonday in a blog post that its network was breached and that hackers made off with user email addresses, password reminders and encrypted masterpasswords.

title: Review: What Counts, a Lydia Johnson Dance Work, Attends to the Music
description: Among the tasteful, finely wrought works that Lydia Johnson Dance presented at Ailey Citigroup Theater over the weekend was the premiere What Counts. What seems to count most for Ms. Johnson is music. The four pieces on the program all showed uncommon skill at matching ballet movement to music, both at the large scale of structure and in small, felicitous details.

title: Review: The Sleeping Beauty Spurs American Ballet Theater to Work on the Details
description: As American Ballet Theater gave a series of performances of its new production of The Sleeping Beauty last week, it was easy to spot ways in which things could sound and look better. Tchaikovskys score should have been better played (especially by the brass and wind sections) and been more sensitively conducted, and Richard Hudsons sets (inspired by Bakst) deserved to be lighted considerably better than they have been by James B. Ingalls.

title: Bubble!
description: Its tempting! to ridicule! Jeb Bush! over his ludicrous campaign logo! But it would be wrong.

title: Bubble!
description: Its tempting! to ridicule! Jeb Bush! over his ludicrous campaign logo! But it would be wrong.

title: Jeb Bush Declares His Presidential Candidacy
description: Aiming to be the third member of his family to occupy the Oval Office, the former governor of Florida announced his plans in Miami.

title: Spitzer Charges Into His Familys Real Estate Business
description: Much has changed for Eliot Spitzer since he resigned as governor of New York in 2008, only 15 months after taking office, amid revelations that he was a client of a prostitution ring.

title: Sidney Blumenthal, Hillary Clintons Confidant, Turns Over Memos on Libya
description: WASHINGTON  Emails that a longtime confidant to Hillary Rodham Clinton recently handed over to the House committee investigating the 2012 attacks in Benghazi, Libya, raise new questions about whether the State Department and Mrs. Clinton have complied with a series of requests from the panel.

title: Posing Questions of Photographic Ethics
description: In the aftermath of this years debates over manipulated photos, a new show sets out to explore the history of altered images in photojournalism.

title: Israeli Helped Inspire U.S.-Russia Weapons Deal With Assad, Memoir Says
description: JERUSALEM  The American-Russian deal that pressured President Bashar al-Assad of Syria to abandon his stockpile of chemical weapons two years ago was encouraged by an Israeli minister, according to a new memoir by a former Israeli ambassador to Washington.

title: Walmart Accused of Using Charity to Sway Cities Where It Wants to Expand
description: A group of community and labor organizations is accusing Walmart of inappropriately using the nonprofit Walmart Foundation to help reduce local opposition to its expansion efforts in some urban areas like Washington, Boston, Los Angeles and New York.

title: New York Comptroller, Taking Aim at Three-Quarter Homes, Urges City Agencies to End Referrals
description: The office of the New York City comptroller plans to send letters on Tuesday to City Hall and various agencies demanding that they take steps to ensure that people in need of housing are not sent to illegal boarding homes, known as three-quarter houses, and to provide information that will help the office compile a list of such homes.

title: Siena Tries to Regain Its Financial Footing, and Its Identity
description: SIENA, Italy  Operators of kindergartens and ambulance services had to find new sources of funds. A biotech company filed for bankruptcy. The local professional soccer team slipped into the minor leagues after it could no longer afford the salaries of its top players.

title: After SAT Misprint, Two Sections Wont Be Scored
description: After a misprint in test booklets about the time allotted for taking part of the SAT earlier this month, the College Board said on Monday that it would not score two sections of the exam, and would waive its fees for students who wanted to take the test again.

title: Monica Lewis, 93, Dies; Her Apple-Pie Appeal Sold Chiquita Bananas
description: Monica Lewis, the dimpled, diminutive chanteuse who made her Broadway debut as a teenager, taught Americans how to ripen their newly imported bananas as the ubiquitous voice of Miss Chiquita, appeared on the inaugural episode of Ed Sullivans television variety show in 1948 and durably continued to perform jazz and pop hits for decades, died on Friday at her home in the Woodland Hills area of Los Angeles. She was 93.

title: Kennedy Airport Hopes Work on Runway Wont Add to Summer Delays
description: In mid-March, travelers trying to fly out of Kennedy International Airport got a bitter taste of the misery that can prevail when a major hub finds itself with only one working runway. The start of a yearlong rebuilding effort on one of the airports four main runways left passengers stewing aboard planes that waited up to two hours to take off.

title: Medical Use of Marijuana Doesnt Increase Youths Use, Study Finds
description: Marijuana use did not increase among teenagers in the states in which medical marijuana has become legal, researchers reported Monday.

title: Classical Live Offers Orchestras Another Internet Stage
description: With the pace of change in the recording industry making it challenging for some performers and their audiences to find one another, five leading orchestras joined together on Monday and began offering some of their recent live recordings online on Google Play Music.

title: Bloomberg Philanthropies Gives $100 Million to Cornell Tech
description: Cornell Tech, the applied sciences graduate school of Cornell University, is expected to announce a $100 million gift from Bloomberg Philanthropies on Tuesday to construct the first academic building on the schools Roosevelt Island campus.

title: Review: Loudon Wainwright IIIs Surviving Twin Is a Father-Son Collaboration
description: The first song Loudon Wainwright III ever wrote for his son, Rufus, is more than 40 years old by now, an address to his child in utero.

title: In A.I.G. Case, Surprise Ruling That Could End All Bailouts
description: For years, critics of the bailouts during the financial crisis argued that the rescue efforts werent harsh enough. The chief executives of failing institutions should have lost their jobs. Shareholders should have suffered more pain. Taxpayers should have received substantial compensation for the risk they took.

title: Plea Deal for Chuck Blazer Is Unsealed
description: The former American soccer official Chuck Blazer was providing information to federal prosecutors looking into corruption in world soccers governing body for nearly a year and a half while still a member ofFIFAs ruling executive committee, according to a plea agreement unsealed by a federal judge Monday.

title: Invitations to a White House Party: Signed, Sealed, Delivered, but Private
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration has thrown an invisibility cloak over many issues during its nearly seven years in office: drone strikes in Yemen, the raid to kill Osama bin Laden in Pakistan, even provisions of a Pacific trade pact involving 12 nations.

title: Best U.S. Open Courses Give Players a Lift, and Vice Versa
description: For more than a century, the United States Golf Association has staged its main Open championship on treacherously traditional courses across America, but this week it is in uncharted territory: links-like Chambers Bay on a sandy shore of Puget Sound near Tacoma, Wash.

title: Alex Rodriguez, Back Home, Pops Out in His Chance to Shine
description: MIAMI  As Alex Rodriguez trotted out of the dugout in the ninth inning to pinch-hit Monday, he was met by a loud cheer from the opposing fans. After the game, as Rodriguez left the clubhouse, someone suggested to him that it was the loudest a Marlins crowd had been in years.

title: A Summary Judgment for the Rachel Moore vs. Howard University Lawsuit
description: In 2005, courts documents show that Ms Moore, which was Rachel Dolezals married name at the time, failed to bring sufficient evidence to back her claims of discrimination against the historically black university.

title: Rachel Moore vs. Howard University in 2002
description: A lawsuit filed in 2002 by Rachel Moore, which was Ms. Dolezals married name at that time, claimed that the historically black university discriminated against her, that she was not hired for certain jobs and that a scholarship she was awarded was terminated because she was white.

title: Mets Win, and Look Ahead to Facing R.A. Dickey
description: R. A. Dickey crouched next to a video room outside the Mets clubhouse on Monday and waited. Suddenly, the door swung open.

title: Orange Is the New Black Season 3, Episode 6 Recap: Chang
description: Season 3, Episode 6

title: 6 First-Rounders Among Draft Picks at College World Series
description: OMAHA  Vanderbilt shortstop Dansby Swanson still has not gotten over the double jolt of jubilation.

title: Review: In Preludes, a Hypnotist Tries to Get Rachmaninoff to Make Music Again
description: Writers block turns out to be a lot more inspiring than you could ever have imagined  and sad and stirring and gloriously fun. In Preludes, which opened on Monday night at the Claire Tow Theater at Lincoln Center, Dave Malloy makes beautiful music out of a composers three years of creative silence.

title: Who Says?
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  There are two kinds of solvers, in my opinion: those who curse the pop culture in crossword puzzles, and those who are grateful for it.

title: Board Hears Support for Raising Food Workers Minimum Wage
description: The mayor who faced a multitude of excited New York City workers in Manhattan on Monday morning was not Bill de Blasio.

title: South Africas Disgraceful Help for President Bashir of Sudan
description: On Monday, President Omar Hassan al-Bashir of Sudan fled arrest in South Africa and is now safely back in Khartoum, the Sudanese capital. His escape is another blow to the International Criminal Court, which has been struggling to bring him to trial for six years on charges of crimes against humanity and genocide.

title: Israeli Government Cartoon Mocks Foreign Coverage of Gaza
description: As part of Israels intensifying effort to undermine potential criticism from the United Nations of its military assault on Gaza last summer, the countrys Foreign Ministry released an animated YouTube video on Monday mocking coverage of the conflict by Western reporters as absurdly inaccurate.

title: Prime Minister Modis Yoga Consultant, H.R. Nagendra
description: H.R. Nagendra, a yoga therapist in Bangalore, has been consulting with Narendra Modi, now Indias prime minister, since the 1980s, and has been called in to provide training to officials serving under Mr. Modi, first in Gujarat and later in New Delhi.

title: Bushs Announcement, in Two Languages
description: Jeb Bush announced his candidacy in Miami with an emphasis on his bona fides in the Latino and Hispanic communities.

title: With Blackhawks 3 Stanley Cups in 6 Years, Chicago Runneth Over
description: CHICAGO  The Chicago Blackhawks can rub shoulders with some of the greatest dynasties in hockey history after they won their third Stanley Cup in six years by beating the Tampa Bay Lightning, 2-0, on Monday to end a tightly fought six-game series.

title: Womens World Cup 2015: Norway Reaches Knockout Stage
description: MONDAYS RESULTS

title: A Playlist From Nowadays, the New Outdoor Bar From the Guys Behind Mister Saturday Night
description: About 18 months ago, Justin Carter and Eamon Harkin found an abandoned postindustrial space hugging the border of Bushwick, Brooklyn, and Ridgewood, Queens. The D.J. duo behind the wildly popular disco dance parties and record label known as Mister Saturday Night (and the offshoot Mister Sunday, which finds a spirited summer crowd gathering at Industry City, Brooklyn) knew it was home for their new all-outdoor urban oasis bar, Nowadays.

title: Nick Cave Revisits Detroit, Soundsuits in Tow
description: When the Cranbrook Art Museum asked to host his inaugural solo outing in Michigan, the artist and dancer  and Cranbrook Academy of Art alum  Nick Cave agreed, on one condition: I said, I will only do it if I can do work in Detroit. For the uninitiated, the schools campus sits about 20 miles away from the downtown area, Caves first lesson upon his arrival in the late 80s. Girl, thank God for the city, he says. I got here and I was the sole black person, so Detroit saved my life. I became connected to this circle of creative people. He recalls a fearlessness to the way they came together and fed off of one another. I dont know if I could have done Cranbrook without Detroit, he avers. Thats why this is so important; Im reconnecting with the city that really allowed me to create a balance in my higher education.

title: Inside Nikes Supersecret Showroom and Fitness Studio
description: In the fashion world, showrooms are essentially a safe place for editors, buyers and stylists of very important clients to experience a collection  to ask questions, inspect details, feel fabrics and understand a garments nuances. At certain showroom appointments, models are even on hand to help visitors visualize pieces on the wearer  how they move with the body or drape across it, which features they accentuate and what proportions they require. And at Nikes newest showroom, 45 Grand (so named for its address), the goal is, similarly, to educate and provide an experience. But the interiors are nothing like what the industry has come to expect.

title: In the West Village, Modern Boutique Owners Who Live Where They Work
description: Were both innately solvers, Michael Ventura, the founder and CEO of the strategy and design practice Sub Rosa, says of himself and his wife Caroline, the jewelry designer of Brvtvs. Hes speaking of their traits, both at work  Sub Rosa specializes in elegant and efficient business solutions while Brvtvs counters the jeweled cacophony with restrained pieces  and at home  which shares an address with their new store, and abuts their individual businesses.

title: Wearable Devices to Prevent Sunburn
description: Could new technology succeed where years of public health messages, doctor warnings and nagging moms have failed  to keep us safe from too much sun?

title: Charitable Giving Rises Past Prerecession Mark
description: Charitable giving rose for the fifth year in a row in 2014, rebounding past a prerecession peak to an estimated $358 billion, according to an annual report from the Giving USA Foundation.

title: Word of the Day | adventitious
description: adventitious  \ad-()ven-ti-shs, -vn-\  adjective

title: Consumer Groups Back Out of Federal Talks on Face Recognition
description: A central component of President Obamas effort to give consumers more control over how companies collect and share their most sensitive personal details has run aground.

title: Consumer Groups Back Out of Federal Talks on Face Recognition
description: A central component of President Obamas effort to give consumers more control over how companies collect and share their most sensitive personal details has run aground.

title: New York Rent Regulation Laws Expire Amid Last-Minute Talks
description: ALBANY  Rent regulations limiting how much landlords can charge for about one million apartments in New York City and its suburbs expired on Monday night after lawmakers failed to reach an agreement on how to extend them.

title: Blaze Starr, Burlesque Queen Who Was Linked to a Governor, Dies at 83
description: Blaze Starr, the voluptuous stripper who was billed as the Queen of Burlesque and whose affair with a Louisiana governor was the basis of a 1989 movie, died on Monday in Wilsondale, W.Va., the coal country town in which she was born. She was 83.

title: Review: Harrison Birtwistles The Cure and The Corridor, Myths With a Twist
description: SNAPE, England  Harrison Birtwistle was once a radical presence at the Aldeburgh Festival. At the 1968 premiere of his violent production of seaside puppetry, Punch and Judy, the festivals appalled founders, Benjamin Britten and Peter Pears, not so quietly excused themselves from the sonic carnage.

title: Whats on TV Tuesday
description: 10 P.M. (TNT) PROOF Parachuting off Mount Everest doesnt faze Ivan Turing, a tech wizard with a referential surname and a fondness for Steve Jobsian turtlenecks. But terminal cancer has given him pause. Ive always hated unknowns, he tells Dr. Carolyn Tyler, a cardiothoracic surgeon with little patience for speculation and a wellspring of grief all her own. And now that Im facing the biggest one there is, I want to know what to expect. His offer: Hell give her control of his $10 billion estate if shell help him prove what, if anything, exists after the body flat lines. Beautiful minds (and some intriguingly nutty concepts) collide in this new series, which stars Jennifer Beals and Matthew Modine, and counts Kyra Sedgwick among its executive producers. As Dr. Tyler investigates the murky realm that believers call the afterlife, the doctor in her chafes at the notion that the nearly dead share experiences that science cant explain. But as the mother of a teenage son killed a year earlier, she cant help but want to believe herself.

title: Sony Previews Game Lineup at E3
description: LOS ANGELES  Sony, as is customary, got the last word of the first day of E3, the video game industrys annual conference here.

title: Sony Previews Game Lineup at E3
description: LOS ANGELES  Sony, as is customary, got the last word of the first day of E3, the video game industrys annual conference here.

title: Vivian Gornicks The Odd Woman and the City
description: Vivian Gornicks new memoir, The Odd Woman and the City, has an unusually large cast of characters. There is her mother, the subject of her memoir Fierce Attachments, and her friend, Leonard, a gay man, whom she meets once a week. There are the people she sees at parties and the two men she was married to, briefly, in her youth. There are her lovers  one of whom we might recognize for his habit of telling women what they want (in Fierce Attachments, a glass of wine; in this memoir, anal sex)  and the couples whose relationships she likes to analyze with friends: Who would have written this story, Wharton or James?

title: Corrections: June 16, 2015
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Where does it stop? Does that mean you own the cloud, too?

title: Posing Questions of Photographic Ethics
description: Most curators hope to get glowing reviews and popular acclaim when they mount an exhibit. Michael Kamber, on the other hand, is expecting some blowback for his latest show, Altered Images: 150 Years of Posed and Manipulated Documentary Photography, which opens this weekend at the Bronx Documentary Center.

title: The Growing Right-Wing Terror Threat
description: THIS month, the headlines were about a Muslim man in Boston who was accused of threatening police officers with a knife. Last month, two Muslims attacked an anti-Islamic conference in Garland, Tex. The month before, a Muslim man was charged with plotting to drive a truck bomb onto a military installation in Kansas. If you keep up with the news, you know that a small but steady stream of American Muslims, radicalized by overseas extremists, are engaging in violence here in the United States.

title: Our Future Musicians
description: To the Editor:

title: The Democratic Tea Party
description: Last week, the Congressional Democrats defeated the underpinnings of the Trans-Pacific Partnership trade agreement. Lets count up the things these Democrats will have done if this policy stands.

title: How to Grade a Teacher
description: This is the second column Ive written about Deborah Loewenberg Ball, the dean of the University of Michigan School of Education. Ball believes the training that teachers get while they are in school needs to be drastically improved. Last year, I wrote about her effort to develop a professional training curriculum that would allow beginning teachers to be far better grounded in their craft than they are now.

title: Central Americas Unresolved Migrant Crisis
description: This time last year, migrants from Central America, including thousands of unaccompanied minors, were streaming into the United States, creating a problem for border communities and Obama administration officials. With far fewer people reaching American soil this year, it is tempting to conclude that the crisis is ebbing.

title: Californias Pension System Clamps Down on High Investment Fees
description: The California Public Employees Retirement Systems decision to reduce the number of alternative investment firms, like private equity funds, it uses to manage its money is a prudent step that should help it save billions of dollars.

title: Bail in America: A Push for Reform
description: To the Editor:

title: Meet the New Common Core
description: MADISON, Wis.  HATE the Common Core? Youre not alone. The national reading and math standards, set up by a bipartisan consortium of state governors, have turned into a political lightning rod for a coalition of angry parents and education activists. The math component has generated special peevishness. The comedian Louis C.K. was widely cheered in April when he tweeted: My kids used to love math. Now it makes them cry. Thanks standardized testing and Common Core!

title: Sticker Shock in For-Profit Hospitals
description: Two reports published this month provide fresh evidence of the hard-to-justify high prices that many hospitals charge for common procedures. The prices drive up premiums for many privately insured patients and can be ruinously expensive for those who are uninsured or inadequately insured or who go to a hospital or doctor outside their insurance network.

title: Your Giant Carry-On Bag Is Safe for Now
description: Dont worry, nobody is coming for your enormous rollaboard suitcase just yet.

title: Europes Highest Appeals Court Backs Bond-Buying Program
description: PARIS  The European Central Bank on Tuesday got a vote of confidence from Europes highest appeals court, which ruled that the bank has the authority to buy quantities of bonds from eurozone countries.

title: Test Yourself | Gap to Close 175 Stores in North America
description: Below, several paragraphs from a June 15 article, Gap to Close 175 Stores in North America.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Down From 980 Pounds, With New Battles to Wage
description: In Down From 980 Pounds, With New Battles to Wage, Sarah Lyall reports on a man who at his heaviest was known informally as the worlds fattest man.

title: Burberry, in a Class of Its Own
description: LONDON  As London mens wear shows go, there is everybody, and then there is Burberry. Its dedication to scale makes classing its catwalk presentations with its competitors ludicrous. In scope and in price, for avidity and sheer concertedness  not only for the usual hundreds of elements, but also for a 24-piece orchestra  it is unmatched among the fashion week spectacles here.

title: Why Jeb Bushs Online Campaign Was Quiet
description: If you searched for Jeb Bush using Google last week, you would have found thousands of results but no advertisement at the top directing readers to his organization. That kind of ad is what you saw when you did a web search for Rand Paul, the Kentucky senator, or Hillary Rodham Clinton, the Democratic front-runner. Because there was no Jeb Bush campaign website, the top non-news result in Google for Jeb Bush was a Wikipedia page about him.

title: Where Racewalking Is King, the Antidoping Officials Are Busy
description: SARANSK, Russia  The palatial glass-and-steel Olympic Training Center of the Republic of Mordovia rises from the flattened landscape of this small industrial city in Russias rust belt. Saransk does not have much of a profile, even in Russia. Grard Depardieu bought a house here to escape French taxes. It was once a popular spot for gulags. But it is basically the Russian equivalent of flyover country  unless you happen to be a fan of racewalking.

title: For U.S., Killing Terrorists Is a Means to an Elusive End
description: WASHINGTON  Twice in the last week, the United States has focused its vast manhunting machinery on tracking down and striking terrorist leaders in anarchic countries that for the White House once embodied the promise of the Arab revolutions across the Middle East.

title: Offering Services, ISIS Digs In Deeper in Seized Territories
description: ERBIL, Iraq  In northern Syria, the jihadists of the Islamic State have fixed power lines, dug sewage systems and painted sidewalks. In Raqqa, they search markets and slaughterhouses for expired food and sick animals. Farther south, in Deir al-Zour, they have imposed taxes on farmers and shopkeepers and fined men for wearing short beards.

title: Philippine Rebels Give Up Dozens of Weapons in Step Toward Peace Deal
description: MANILA  Islamic militants in the southern Philippines turned over dozens of weapons on Tuesday as part of a tentative peace deal, an agreement that is facing stiff resistance from lawmakers since a firefight with rebels in January that killed dozens of police officers.

title: Jonathan Galassis Muse
description: Ida Perkins! There is surely no poet to equal her. Her stunning debut, Virgin Again, marked the beginning of a trail blazed through American letters. Published by T.S. Eliot, praised by Marianne Moore, she earned respect within the academy that didnt hinder her rise to global celebrity. She was the only person ever to appear simultaneously on the covers of Rolling Stone, Interview and the recherch Tel Quel. Carly Simon and Carole Kings duet version of Idas song Broken Man went platinum in 1970. Will we ever see her like again?

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: How to Pick a Cellphone Plan for Traveling Abroad
description: As a general rule, Im against an alien takeover of our planet  unless they bring along one thing: a global wireless system that would simplify the endlessly complex world of options for using cellphones abroad.

title: Tuesdays Travel News and Tips
description: Our weekday morning digest that includes consumer news, deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.

title: Whats Trending on Trending
description: Priya Ollapally, product manager for special editorial projects, helped design The Timess new tool (in Beta), Trending,  which shows what Times stories are most popular with readers online and in social media. She explains the thinking behind the new product.

title: The Corrupt Rhetoric of the FIFA Scandal
description: LONDON  We have fought colonialism and defeated it and we still fight imperialism and we will fight it whenever it manifests itself. So claimed South Africas sports minister, Fikile Mbalula, recently. He was talking not of war or invasion but about the F.B.I.s investigation into corruption involving FIFA, world soccers governing body. Other officials from Africa, Asia and the Caribbean have expressed similar sentiments.

title: Why Germany Cant Lead Europe
description: HAMBURG, Germany  Imagine a building in Berlin tall enough to provide a look across the entire continent  and beyond. What do you see?

description: Good morning on this soggy Tuesday.

description: The devastating earthquake in Nepal in April killed thousands of people and displaced hundreds of thousands more. And it reduced hundreds ofhistoric monumentsto rubble.

description: Whats at stake?

title: Silent History
description: Knowing yourself and accepting yourself are two different things. I knew that I fancied boys from the time I was in kindergarten. Although you dont know how to name it, especially in a very heterosexual society like Turkeys, this is something that you feel. I didnt accept who I was, on the other hand, until years later, during university, when I found myself coming out to 30 or 40 people at once onstage in a drama class. All my friends in the class came one by one to kiss and congratulate me. But even then I hadnt opened the curtain all the way, because I hadnt come out to my mother.

title: George Takei Is Out for Justice
description: Youre very busy for someone your age. Youve written three books; you have a web series; and your musical, Allegiance, based on your familys time in an internment camp during World War II, will debut on Broadway in November. As a matter of fact, I just came back from the posting of the marquee at the Longacre Theater. I just wish my father could have been there. Takei is his surname, and the play is about an event that affected him so profoundly. He came back to Los Angeles from the camp with nothing  literally penniless  and was living on Skid Row.

title: Can Thulisile Madonsela Save South Africa From Itself?
description: On a cloudy morning in March last year, dozens of reporters, photographers and camera crews gathered in the vast building that houses the offices of Thulisile Madonsela, South Africas public protector. The journalists assembled that day were searched by security, stripped of their phones, pens, notebooks and recording equipment and told to take a seat in a conference room. Madonselas staff gave each of them a thick document numbering almost 450 pages. Her assistants were posted by the windows, making sure no one was secretly leaking information. Outside, riot officers in armored vehicles stood watch. Theres about 100 people in the room, recalled Ranjeni Munusamy, a well-known editor at The Daily Maverick, a South African newspaper. Everyones quiet and flipping through pages, and now and then you look up to see who is on what page. I went right to the end to look at the findings. When I saw them, I wanted to scream.

title: Janine Gibson, a Former Guardian Editor, Will Head BuzzFeeds British Operation
description: Janine Gibson, a former senior editor at The Guardian who left the newspaper recently after being passed over for its top editors post, will join BuzzFeed as the editor in chief of its British operation.

title: Today in Politics: Ladies and Gentlemen, Mr. Donald Trump
description: Good Tuesday morning from Washington, where a confidant of Hillary Rodham Clinton is set to testify to a House committee about the attacks in Benghazi, Libya. As for the presidential candidates, the crowded Republican field finally found room for Jeb Bush, and now, it might have to again move over for a hopeful who needs only one name: Trump.

title: Pete Seegers New York Roots
description: The poet Carl Sandburg called him Americas tuning fork, and for good reason.

title: Deaths of Irish Students in Berkeley Balcony Collapse Cast Pall on Program
description: BERKELEY, Calif.  They come by the thousands  Irish students on work visas, many flocking to the West Coast to work in summer jobs by day and to enjoy the often raucous life in a college town at night. It was, for many, a rite of passage, one last summer to enjoy travel abroad before beginning a career.

title: Hong Kong Election Plan Appears Unlikely to Win Lawmakers Approval
description: HONG KONG  The issue of how to choose Hong Kongs chief executive is once again threatening to convulse the citys politics.
