Morning Agenda: Split Decision for Greenberg in A.I.G. Lawsuit
description: SPLIT DECISION FOR GREENBERG IN A.I.G. LAWSUIT | On Monday, Judge Thomas C. Wheeler of the United States Court of Federal Claims sided with Maurice R. Greenberg, the former chief executive of the American International Group, ruling that the Federal Reserve illegally took over A.I.G. as part of its $185 billion bailout of the troubled company in 2008,  Aaron M. Kessler writes in DealBook. It wasnt a complete victory for Mr. Greenberg, who is also one of the largest shareholders of A.I.G.  he wasnt awarded any portion of the $40 billion in damages he was seeking because the judge also sided with the government in its argument that the bailout had saved A.I.G. from the bankruptcy.

title: Fitbit Raises Price Range for I.P.O.
description: Fitbit, the maker of wearable health-tracking devices, raised the range for the expected pricing of its initial public offering to $17 to $19 a share, according to a filing on Tuesday with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Jeb Bush Makes a Major Fashion Statement
description: Jeb Bush is his own man. How do we know this? Well, he says it a lot. But more important, he showed it on Monday in Miami  becoming the first candidate in his family, and possibly the first candidate ever, to announce his bid for the United States highest office in  shirtsleeves.

title: Weekly News Quiz | June 9-15, 2015

title: Is Self-Loathing a Requirement for Writers?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. Self-loathing is the engine; fame is the fuel, Karl Ove Knausgaard has said. This week, Thomas Mallon and Anna Holmes discuss the role of self-hatred in creativity.

title: Dance This Week: Merce Cunningham, Twyla Tharp and Romeo and Juliet
description: Hail, dancegoers. Here is another installment of our weekly dance column, in which we draw attention to highlights in the field. This weekend, New York dance fans have important events uptown and downtown. If you time things right, you can see choreography by Merce Cunningham, Trisha Brown and Twyla Tharp in three (or even two) consecutive days, and catch American Ballet Theaters Romeo and Juliet, which involves both debuts and departures. Please use the comments section to let us know what you think.

description: BEIJING  By declaring Tuesday that it would soon complete its contentious program of building artificial islands in the South China Sea, Beijing hopes to diminish tensions with the United States while reassuring its home audience that it has delivered on its pledge to resist American military pressure, experts said.

description: Thomas de Maizire, the German interior minister, said economic migrants trying to come to Europe should stay in hot spots like Greece and Italy and then be sent back to their home countries.

title: The Rise of Student Debt for Those Who Get Degrees
description: My recent article on student debt prompted many questions from readers who were hungry for more detail. I had provided statistics on all undergraduates, but many readers wanted to see debt for those who graduated with a bachelors degree.

description: In a video statement made by a man identified as Khaled Batarfi, a senior operative, Al Qaeda in Yemen confirmed that its leader Nasser al-Wuhayshi was killed in a U.S. airstrike.

title: Napoleon Rides Again
description: The Battle of Ligny, Napoleon Bonapartes final victory, was re-enacted Sunday in Belgium to start a weeklong series of events commemorating the 200th anniversary of his ultimate defeat at Waterloo.

title: 200 Years After Waterloo, Napoleon Still Wins by Losing
description: LIGNY, Belgium  Napoleon Bonaparte, also known as Frank Samson, a pudgy Paris lawyer who likes wearing gold braided uniforms and a black bicorne hat, won his last battle on Sunday in southern Belgium.

title: 1890: Anarchists On The Warpath
description: The invasion of a Paris newspaper office by a score of Anarchists, and a savage assault upon the rdacteurs who happened to be at their desks  this is the astonishing sequel to the disorderly meeting reported in yesterdays Herald. Mouchards was the epithet by which the newspaper in question, the Egalit, described the men who had begun the fight at the Faubourg du Temple meeting. The cap apparently fitted the compagnons and compagnes of Anarchism, for about a score of them, men and women, betook themselves to the offices of the offending journal to wreak vengeance.  The New York Herald, European Edition, June 17, 1890

title: Tracing a 17-Year-Olds Path From Britain to an ISIS Suicide Attack
description: LONDON  He was barely old enough to drive in Britain. But last Saturday, Talha Asmal, a 17-year-old high school student from West Yorkshire, is said to have detonated a Toyota Land Cruiser full of explosives at an Iraqi security facility. If true, he would be the youngest known suicide bomber from Britain.

title: Hillary the Divider
description: The weekends this-time-I-mean-it Hillary Clinton presidential announcement was precededby an interesting pundit debate over whether her apparent presidential strategy trying to recreatethe Obama coalition, running a little more to the left than people anticipated, not even making an attempt to retrace her husbands electoral path and ditchingcertain beyond-red-and-blue ideas once embraced by the current president is a good idea, either for her or for America. The critics include my colleague David Brooks and National Journals Ron Fournier; Hillarys defenders include Jonathan Chait and my Upshot colleague Brendan Nyhan. My own thoughtsare  complicated, and fall into two parts.

title: Feeling For
description: Vans partners with Japanese contemporary artist Takashi Murakami to create a lively capsule collection, available on June 27.

title: F.D.A. Sets 2018 Deadline to Rid Foods of Trans Fats
description: WASHINGTON  The Food and Drug Administration on Tuesday gave the food industry three years to eliminate artery-clogging artificial trans fats from the food supply, a long-awaited step that capped years of effort by consumer groups and is expected to save thousands of lives a year.

title: Rebirth of a Transgender Teenager
description: As Katherine Boone, 18, recovered from gender reassignment surgery, she and her family talked about what they went through.

title: The New Girl in School: Transgender Surgery at 18
description: In a cozy cottage decorated with butterflies to symbolize transformation, Katherine Boone was recovering in April from the operation that had changed her, in the most intimate part of her body, from a biological male into a female.

title: Napoleon Rides Again
description: The Battle of Ligny, Napoleon Bonapartes final victory, was re-enacted Sunday in Belgium to start a weeklong series of events commemorating the 200th anniversary of his ultimate defeat at Waterloo.

title: Orange Is the New Black Season 3, Episode 7 Recap: Norma Romanos Magic
description: Season 3, Episode 7: Tongue-Tied

title: Americans Are Again Getting More Worried About the Climate
description: The financial crisis made Americans less worried about climate change. The Democrats attempt to pass sweeping climate legislation in 2009 and 2010 probably reduced Americans anxiety level as well, as paradoxical as that may sound. But now Americans are getting more worried again.

title: Cardinals Investigated for Hacking Into Astros Database
description: WASHINGTON  Front-office personnel for the St. Louis Cardinals, one of the most successful teams in baseball over the past two decades, are under investigation by the F.B.I. and Justice Department prosecutors, accused of hacking into an internal network of the Houston Astros to steal closely guarded information about players.

title: Failure of Obamas Trans-Pacific Trade Deal Could Hurt U.S. Influence in Asia
description: TOKYO  With President Obamas trade agenda in jeopardy in Congress, the nations of Asia are weighing the potential impact of a failed deal on local jobs and exports, but also something else: American influence in the region.

title: From Style: Casual Jeb Bush
description: Jeb Bush Makes a Major Fashion Statement

title: Donald Trump,Pushing Someone Rich, Offers Himself
description: Donald J. Trump, the garrulous real estate developer whose name has adorned apartment buildings, hotels, Trump-brand neckties and Trump-brand steaks, announced on Tuesday his entry into the 2016 presidential race, brandishing his wealth and fame as chief qualifications in an improbable quest for the Republican nomination.

title: How Rachel Dolezal Identifies Herself
description: Rachel A. Dolezal, who resigned as president of the N.A.A.C.P. chapter in Spokane, Wash., has been accused of misrepresenting her racial background. A look at how shes identified herself.

title: Antibiotics Are Effective in Appendicitis, Study Says
description: For more than 100 years, the standard treatment for appendicitis has been surgery. Now a large Finnish study provides the best evidence to date that most patients can be treated with antibiotics alone.

title: Turtle Island Quartet Finds New Cellist in Carolina Chocolate Drops
description: A cello change is coming to the Turtle Island Quartet, a 30-year-old ensemble that has become known for crossover classical performances that reimagine works by artists as varied as John Coltrane and Jimi Hendrix for string quartet.

title: Cole Hammer, 15, Enjoys Pro Treatment Ahead of U.S. Open
description: UNIVERSITY PLACE, Wash.  Cole Hammer was being interviewed Monday evening at Chambers Bay Golf Course when Cody Gribble, a fellow Texan with whom Hammer had just finished a nine-hole practice round, sneaked up from behind, lifted the 125-pound Hammer off his feet in a bear hug, set him down and started to walk away.

title: 1940: French abandon the Maginot Line
description: The German army was making a terrific drive today [June 14] to encircle the French troops defending the Maginot Line. The spokesman of the French War Ministry admitted tonight that the military situation is incontestably very grave. The Associated Press quoted reports from Basel, Switzerland, that the French were abandoning the Maginot Line entirely and had withdrawn their half million fortress troops to a new line extending from Belfort to the Langres plateau and thence to Troyes on the Seine river.  New York Herald Tribune, June 17, 1940

title: Of All Teams to Hack, Why the Astros?
description: It might seem a bit like a crooked politician breaking into the office of a rival who is at 2 percent in the polls, or a master spy choosing to snoop around the Embassy of Tonga.

title: The Broad Museum Picks Up Its Art-Buying Pace
description: The Broadcollection is perpetually growing  the philanthropists Eli and EdytheBroadare known to average one acquisition a week. But now, as the collection prepares to open its new contemporary art museum downtown in Los Angeles on Sept. 20, the Broads have picked up the pace.

title: The Broad Museum Picks Up Its Art-Buying Pace
description: The Broadcollection is perpetually growing  the philanthropists Eli and EdytheBroadare known to average one acquisition a week. But now, as the collection prepares to open its new contemporary art museum downtown in Los Angeles on Sept. 20, the Broads have picked up the pace.

title: Morsi Death Sentence Confirmed by Judge
description: A judge in Egypt announced the confirmation of last months sentence of Mohamed Morsi, Egypts first democratically elected president and a member of the Muslim Brotherhood.

title: Bernie Sanders on the Rise in New Hampshire Polling
description: BOSTON  Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont appears to be making headway against Hillary Rodham Clinton among Democratic primary voters in New Hampshire, according to a new poll. His strength is built on support from liberal voters and from men.

title: Bernie Sanders on the Rise in New Hampshire Polling
description: BOSTON  Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont appears to be making headway against Hillary Rodham Clinton among Democratic primary voters in New Hampshire, according to a new poll. His strength is built on support from liberal voters and from men.

title: Beware Casting Pope Francis as a Caped Climate Crusader
description: All eyes are on the Vatican after an Italian news magazine leaked what is very likely the final text (the Italian translation) of Pope Franciss forthcoming encyclical letter on humanitys obligations to protect the environment, avoid dangerous climate change and overcome poverty and inequity. The official release of the letter, Laudato Si  On the Care of Our Common Home, comes Thursday, but interpretations abound already as translations spread. While there areallegations that traditionalistsin and around the Catholic Church leaked the text to the magazine to deflate the impact of the release, I dont see that happening.

title: Donald Trump on the Issues
description: Donald J. Trumps entry into the race for the Republican presidential nomination amounts to his first actual foray into elective politics after several threats. A real estate developer and host of The Celebrity Apprentice, he opines about many issues in colorful terms, and is fast on the trigger with denunciations, but does not always make his own policy recommendations clear.

title: Takashi Murakami Has Been Wearing Vans for 10 Years
description: Vans and the contemporary artist Takashi Murakami partnered up to create a lively capsule collection of summer sneakers. The limited-edition designs will be released under the premium Vault by Vans line, with Murakamis signature cheeky, anime-inspired motifs of flowers and skulls printed on unisex sneakers and tees for adults and toddlers. For the past 10-plus years, without exaggeration, I have been wearing Vans slip-ons almost every single day, he says. For me, there are no other shoes that are so comfortably wearable that let me focus on producing my artwork. Murakami also created skate decks (though they werent his first  and probably wont be his last).

title: Low Interest Rates Could Limit Growth of Federal Debt, Budget Office Says
description: WASHINGTON  As large as the nations postrecession debt is, American taxpayers could catch a break for years to come from continued abnormally low interest rates, which hold down the cost of financing that debt and in turn limit the debts growth, congressional analysts said on Tuesday.

title: Verbatim: The D.N.C.s Tongue-in-Cheek Welcome to Donald Trump
description: A statement sent out to reporters from the Democratic National Committee, welcoming Donald Trump to the 2016 presidential race, with just the slightest hint of sarcasm.

title: Egyptian Court Confirms Death Sentence for Mohamed Morsi
description: CAIRO  An Egyptian judge on Tuesday confirmed a death sentence against the deposed president Mohamed Morsi, condemning his rule as a black night and his Islamist movement as satanic and diabolical.

title: What Donald Trump Would Need to Do to Win
description: Mr. Trump, a real estate developer and reality television star, has declared himself a candidate for the Republican nomination for president. Here is a look at what he will need to do if he hopes to win.

title: Colorados Unjust Marijuana Ruling
description: It took the Colorado Supreme Court a year to come up with the ruling, issued on Monday, that upheld the firing of a man who used medical marijuana legally under state law to help ease the pain he has suffered since a car accident left him paralyzed. A lot of that time had to be devoted to twisting the logic behind the decision.

title: Game of Thrones Finale Sets a Record
description: Game of Thrones set a series record for total viewers with its season finale Sunday night with 8.1 million viewers, according to Nielsen. The HBO shows previous record was the season premiere in April, which attracted eight million viewers. Last years season finale brought in 7.1 million viewers.

title: Blanca
description: Adventurous food with an Italian underpinning from Carlo Mirarchi in Bushwick, Brooklyn.

title: Restaurant Review: Blanca in Bushwick, Brooklyn
description: When Blanca opened in 2012, a 27-course tasting menu served at a counter behind a pizzeria in Bushwick sounded like the setup to a joke. (Second prize is 30 courses.) The restaurant does have its sense of humor, but it quickly proved that about cooking for maximum pleasure, it was unswervingly serious.

title: Military Deaths in ISIS Operations
description: The Department of Defense has identified six American service members who have died supporting the operation to eliminate the Islamic State militant group. It confirmed the death of the following American recently:

title: Haitian Workers Facing Deportation by Dominican Neighbors
description: MEXICO CITY  Hundreds of thousands of migrant workers are facing deportation from the Dominican Republic, the latest in a series of actions by the government that have cast a light on the countrys long-troubled relationship with its Haitian neighbors.

title: Tsipras Attacks Greeces Creditors as Pressure Grows on Debts
description: BRUSSELS  Greeces prime minister, Alexis Tsipras, on Tuesday blasted his countrys creditors for austerity measures that he said were humiliating and strangling his people as pressure mounted on Athens to present reforms in exchange for bailout funding.

title: In Overheard Interview, Jeb Bush Mocks Hillary Clinton and Opposes Gay Marriage
description: DERRY, N.H.  Jeb Bush said Tuesday that the enhanced interrogation techniques deployed by his brother after Sept. 11 attacks were no longer appropriate, that he hoped the Supreme Court would rule against same-sex marriage, and mocked Hillary Rodham Clinton for passing few laws during her eight years in the Senate.

title: Boston Revises Bid in Effort to Host 2024 Olympics
description: BOSTON  When Boston 2024, the private group organizing the citys bid to host the 2024 Summer Olympics, unveiled its plans in January, it boasted that it would put on the most walkable Games in modern times.

title: Official Discusses Balcony Collapse
description: Jennifer Coats, the Berkeley, Calif., Police Department spokeswoman, discussed a deadly apartment balcony collapse early Tuesday morning.

title: Donald Trump Is Running for President
description: Donald J. Trump announced that he was a candidate for the Republican nomination in the 2016 United States presidential election.

title: Police Search for Assailant in 4 Attacks on Asian Women
description: Four Asian women have been attacked in Manhattan in the past week, and similarities surrounding their attacks have led the police to believe that they are the victims of bias crimes.

title: ISIS Loses Control of Crucial Syrian Border Town
description: ISTANBUL  Kurdish militias and rebel fighters on Tuesday took full control of the strategic Syrian town of Tal Abyad on Turkeys border, striking a blow against the Islamic State and expanding their realm of control.

description: Highlights from the fairs sector emphasizing large-scale work.

description: At the Beacon Theater on Monday night, Amy Schumer said it was a weird time for her, explaining matter-of-factly, Everything I do becomes a thing.

title: On View
description: A look at Nick Cave: Here Hear.

title: Kirk Kerkorian, Billionaire Investor in Film Studios and Casinos, Dies at 98
description: Kirk Kerkorian, the media-shy investor who became one of the richest Americans by betting his money on ventures like casinos and film studios, died Monday night at his home in Beverly Hills, Calif. He was 98.

title: As Stress Drives Off Drone Operators, Air Force Must Cut Flights
description: CREECH AIR FORCE BASE, Nev.  After a decade of waging long-distance war through their video screens, Americas drone operators are burning out, and the Air Force is being forced to cut back on the flights even as military and intelligence officials are demanding more of them over intensifying combat zones in Iraq, Syria and Yemen.

title: United to Leave J.F.K. and Shift West Coast Flights to Newark
description: United Airlines said on Tuesday that it would move out of Kennedy International Airport in October, after failing to make a profit there for seven years, and will shift all of its flights to Los Angeles and San Francisco to its hub in Newark.

title: Doing More, Not Less, to Save Retirees From Financial Ruin
description: Just over 10 years ago, researchers at the University of Michigan added three questions to their Health and Retirement Study, a biennial survey of Americans over 50:

title: Sydney Leroux Returns to Vancouver but Says She Isnt Looking Back
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia  Nothing better than being back in Vancouver! Sydney Leroux wrote on her Twitter account Monday night.

title: Choice Words From Donald Trump, Presidential Candidate
description: During his nearly hourlong ceremony announcing his presidential candidacy on Tuesday, Donald J. Trump was typically bombastic, opinionated and full of praise for himself. The following are some of his most noteworthy quotations.

title: House Moves to Delay Action on Trade Bill for 6 Weeks
description: WASHINGTON  In an extraordinary twist that perhaps only a lame duck president can relish, President Obama has largely jettisoned his plan to lure House Democrats to get his trade agenda through Congress, and instead is now working closely with Republican leaders.

title: Coaches on Blackhawks Stanley Cup Win
description: The winning and losing coaches discuss the Chicago Blackhawks defeat of the Tampa Bay Lightning in the Stanley Cup finals.

title: During Ramadan, Dates Are a Unifying Staple
description: When the chef Sameh Wadi was growing up  first in Kuwait, then in Jordan, and finally in Minneapolis and St. Paul  one of the few constants in his life was his mothers cooking, especially the date-filled ring cookies called kaak that she made by hand and stockpiled during Ramadan.

title: Belichick, Snowden and Hack Wilson: Twitter Reacts to Cardinals Scandal
description: News that the F.B.I. and the Justice Department are investigating whether front-office officials for the St. Louis Cardinals hacked into the internal networks of the Houston Astros drew immediate reaction on social media on Tuesday. The Cardinals  one of the most successful teams in baseball  have a huge national fan base. But the Twitter-verse loves to see the mighty fall, and commenters rushed to jump on the pile:

title: As Vladimir Putin Talks More Missiles and Might, Cost Tells Another Story
description: KUBINKA, Russia  They call it Russias military Disneyland, and the underlying idea that Russia will soon field a high-tech, modernized army was indeed part fantasy. But the bristling array of armaments underlined how military competition had overtaken diplomacy in East-West relations.

title: Age 16, and Not Too Young to Join the Community Board
description: Being a teenager in New York has always conferred unrivaled access to adult privileges. No cars are needed to get around town. Over-21 beverages are easily found.

title: Gabriel Kreuther Opening His Own Place; Dante Gets a Spruce-Up
description: Headliner

title: Judge in A.I.G. Case Rebukes Davis Polk Law Firm
description: Maurice R. Greenberg, the former chief executive of the American International Group, did not name the big New York law firm Davis Polk & Wardwell as a defendant in his lawsuit challenging the terms of the federal governments bailout of his company during the financial crisis.

title: Goldmans Consumer Loan Plan Poses Risks
description: Goldman Sachs may get lost on Main Street.

title: Orange Is the New Black Season 3, Episode 8 Recap: The Alex Problem
description: Season 3, Episode 8: Fear, And Other Smells

title: Black Like Who? Rachel Dolezals Harmful Masquerade
description: Rachel A. Dolezal, who stepped down Monday as president of the Spokane, Wash., chapter of the N.A.A.C.P., could have been a powerful ally to African-Americans. The participation of white allies has always been important to anti-racism work. By most accounts, she is educated about black cultures and an advocate for black causes. But empathy evolved into impersonation. And Ms. Dolezals subterfuge, made easier by the legacy of racism in America, undermines the very people she claims to support.

title: Google Is Its Own Secret Weapon in the Cloud
description: Google is wielding a new weapon against Amazon and Microsoft for cloud computing customers: itself.

title: Google Is Its Own Secret Weapon in the Cloud
description: Google is wielding a new weapon against Amazon and Microsoft for cloud computing customers: itself.

title: Israels Ludicrous Spoof of Western Journalists
description: If you dont have a good story to tell, a tried and tested tactic is to lampoon the press.

title: Can DNA Testing Personalize Skin Care?
description: LONDON  Whats being billed as the future of skin care starts suspiciously like a visit to the dentist: with a mouthwash gargle. Thats to eliminate debris that may interfere with a good saliva sample, from which DNA will be extracted and serums tailored to ones genetic blueprint.

title: Reading About Racial Boundaries
description: I identify as black, Rachel A. Dolezal told NBCs Today show on Tuesday. Ms. Dolezals resignation of her post as an N.A.A.C.P. official in Washington State after accusations that she misrepresented her racial background is the water-cooler story of the week.

title: A Chicken Tagine That Gives Rhubarb the Last Say
description: When I was in Paris last month, I was inspired by the generous stacks of rhubarb in markets all over the city. It was the same last year when I visited my brother Dan and his dedicated rhubarb garden in Minneapolis. The plant has been in season since late April in temperate zones, and it will last through the summer.

title: Review: Eddo Sterns Vietnam Romance Is Art You Can Watch or Play
description: Video games surpassed Hollywood movies in popularity over a half-decade ago, but few artists have dealt seriously with the aesthetics or technology of the form. Eddo Stern is an exception, and his current project, Vietnam Romance (2015), is a seasoned meditation on the relationship between war and gaming.

title: The Trans-Pacific Partnership: Questions and Answers
description: WASHINGTON  After a decade of negotiations among a dozen nations, the trade deal known as the Trans-Pacific Partnership, or T.P.P., is almost complete and ready for final consideration by Congress. But before President Obama can present the final document for approval, Congress must vote to give him the right to limit consideration of the T.P.P. to a single up-or-down vote, with no filibusters or amendments allowed. That is called trade promotion authority, or T.P.A., and, so far, Mr. Obama has failed to get it.

title: MGM Buys Rights to Primates of Park Avenue
description: First it was gloated over for its schadenfreude, then it was denounced for supposedly being full of lies. Now, Wednesday Martins best-selling Primates of Park Avenue  an anthropological memoir of the authors time among the super rich of the Upper East Side  is bound for the silver screen.

title: Leak of Popes Encyclical on Climate Change Hints at Tensions in Vatican
description: ROME  The unexpected leak of Pope Francis much-anticipated environmental encyclical has meant the return of something that not long ago was fairly common around the Vatican but had become often dormant during the two-plus years of Francis mostly charmed papacy: intrigue.

title: The Larger-Than-Life Highlights of Art Basels Unlimited Sector
description: Opening a day before the main fair at Art Basel, the Unlimited sector is devoted to displaying gigantic, bright-hued, deeply ambitious, booth-bursting works that are so epic in scale as to inspire  a whole lot of double-taps on Instagram. And Basel undoubtedly will offer thousands of photo-worthy opportunities as the week goes on, both in and outside the main fair. Design/Miami is opening up across the street from Unlimited, with Standard Hotels head honcho Andre Balazs acting as curator of design at large. The hippest young kids show at Liste just across town, including the New York shops Essex Street and Bushwicks Clearing. And of course there are the high-octane art dinners and parties: the trek out to the Foundation Beyeler, the salon between Tina Brown and Tino Sehgal followed by a feast at the Museum fr Gegenwartskunst, Tolga Albayraks globetrotting art bash Tolgas Fair Club and countless lavish nights at the citys crown jewel, the Grand Hotel Trois Rois.

title: A Star Wars Inspired Runway Show With Galactic Support
description: LONDON  The force is with Bobby Abley, a London-based mens wear designer who had his first solo runway show here on Monday. Much of Mr. Ableys collection for the spring and summer of 2016 referenced characters from the Star Wars franchise.

title: Are You Financially Literate? 5 Questions on Savings and Investing
description: How well you do understand basic savings and investment decisions?

title: Readers Respond: On Workers Betrayed by Visa Loopholes
description: American workers, entrepreneurs, immigrants and a few readers supporting big employers illustrated the complexity of the immigration reform debate with their responses to an editorial about abuses in a high-tech visa program.

description: Have you taken a selfie with a presidential candidate? New York Times journalists covering the 2016 presidential campaign would like to see your picture.

title: Beautiful Tour to Star Jessie Muellers Sister, Abby
description: Abby Mueller is set to play the title role in Beautiful: The Carole King Musical, the role for which her sister, Jessie, won a Tony Award last year.

title: Migrants Funeral in Berlin Highlights Europes Refugee Crisis
description: BERLIN  A 34-year-old woman was buried in a Berlin cemetery on Tuesday, thousands of miles from her home in Syria and hundreds from the shores of Italy that eluded her while she was alive.

description: Photos from Italy, Greece, Indonesia and the United States.

title: June 16, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Italy, Greece, Indonesia and the United States.

title: June 16, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Italy, Greece, Indonesia and the United States.

title: In Savannah, Where Change Is Slow, an Art District Is Catching On
description: SAVANNAH, Ga.  The idea of a vanguard arts district may seem counterintuitive in this slow-paced city of courtly manners and stately architecture, but after almost two decades, an emerging area called the Starland District may finally be hitting its stride.

title: More Florida Fun
description: Others are picking up on the sheer amazingness  make that amazingness!  of Jeb! citing the record of bubble-era Florida as proof of his skill in economic management. Jim Tankersley adds some data to the picture. But I think there are a couple of additional important points to make here.

title: More Florida Fun

Jim Tankersley adds some data to the picture. But I think there are a couple of additional important points to make here.

title: What You Get for  $1,200,000
description: Contemporaries in Tucson and Nashville and views of a lake in Michigan

title: Far-Right Parties Form Coalition in European Parliament
description: PARIS  More than a year after populist, far-right parties surged in elections for the European Parliament, several of them announced on Tuesday that they had finally banded together with the goal of raising their political profile.

title: 21st Century Fox Announces New Murdoch Roles
description: The media conglomerate 21st Century Fox announced on Tuesday that Rupert Murdochs two sons would assume new leadership roles in the company, continuing the elder Mr. Murdochs plans to keep control of the company in his family.

title: Eager to Go, Giants Defense Waits on Jason Pierre-Paul
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Steve Spagnuolos eagerness to restore the Giants to the heights they enjoyed in his first tenure as defensive coordinator in 2007 and 2008 was readily apparent when he met with reporters Tuesday at the start of a mandatory three-day minicamp. So were his limitations.

title: Military Spouses, Facing Deployment, but Not Alone
description: Drowning is silent. During my high school life-guarding days, our manager used to repeat the phrase in earnest. Lately, the verbiage has played in a loop in my mind, as I struggle physically and emotionally with my husbands coming deployment.

title: Phoebe English Aces Mens Wear With Her Debut Capsule Collection
description: Womens weardesigners dont often succeed in translating their points of view to mens wear  orvice versa. But in her debut effort today, Phoebe English made a seamless transition with a capsule collection of easy, oversize mens clothes, appropriating just the right signatures frayed edges, natural fabrics, deconstruction  to make it work.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Generic A.D.H.D. Drug, Not Equivalent to the Brand, Is in Use Anyway
description: When Dr. Louis Kraus, a chief of child psychiatry at a hospital in Chicago, writes prescriptions for patients who have attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder, he often chooses Concerta, an extended-release form of the drug Ritalin that gives patients relief from their symptoms for as long as 12 hours.

title: London Mens Fashion Week Street Style
description: Fashion fans and models take to the streets during the spring 2016 mens collection shows in London.

title: Review: The Tribe Communicates Without Words
description: The Tribe, set at a Ukrainian boarding school for the deaf, unfolds without spoken dialogue or subtitles. The members of the nonprofessional, mostly deaf cast communicate in sign language, and while much of the audience will remain ignorant of the nuances, and even the basic sense, of their interactions  we learn the characters names only in the final credits  the film isnt obscure or especially confusing. Written and directed by Myroslav Slaboshpytskiy, its something of a formal tour de force, a triumphant overcoming of self-imposed cinematic challenges.

title: Trailer: BAMCinemaFest
description: A preview for the festival.

title: At Margaret Howell, J.W. Anderson, Burberry, Alexander McQueen and Craig Green,Bigger Is Not Necessarily Better
description: LONDON  In this city, mens fashion week wends inevitably, ineluctably to the pub. That British institution (unlike the suit, the coat, the tie, the shoe and almost any other institution that intersects with the twice-yearly mens wear shows here) is all but impervious to change.

title: Supreme Court Rejects 2 Antitrust Cases
description: The Supreme Court this week declined to review a pair of antitrust cases involving an international price-fixing cartel, despite the urging of some legal experts, economists and the National Association of Manufacturers.

title: Stained Glass at Riverside Church Removed for Repairs
description: Chiseling at sooty, buckling and leaky portraits of medieval saints in radiant red and blue, workmen are hoisting about 30 stained-glass windows out of Riverside Church in Manhattan. For the next few weeks, crews from Clagnan Stained Glass Studio in Wall Township, N.J., advised by the Massachusetts consultant Julie L. Sloan, will be digging out chunks of caulk to release the panes. Designed in the 1920s by the prominent Boston glass workshops of Wilbur H. Burnham and Wright Goodhue, the the stained-glass panels will undergo a year of repair at Clagnan.

title: Reading The Times With Santiago Calatrava
description: Santiago Calatrava is a Spanish architect, structural engineer, sculptor and painter. His projects include the World Trade Center Transportation Hub, which opens this month; the Park Avenue Sculptures, installed last week along the central median on Park Avenue between 52nd and 55th Streets in New York City, are on view through November.

title: BAMcinemaFest Opts to Be Unlikable and Thought-Provoking
description: At six years old, BAMcinemaFest is less encumbered by hype and expectation than other, more established festivals. It shares independent-film DNA (and a few high-profile films) with Sundance, but it doesnt inspire the same level of hand-wringing about the State of Indie. Nor does it mimic the busyness and buzz  or the corporate slickness  of Tribeca. Even though its native turf in Brooklyn is highly contested, newly glamorous cultural space, the festival is defined by an aesthetic of intellectual curiosity, understated ambition and easygoing eclecticism. You go to the Brooklyn Academy of Music, see some movies, and wander into Fort Greene afterward, looking for a pint of craft beer and a place to sit and talk about what you saw.

title: Review: The Pavilion, a Class Reunion Drama, at Barrow Group Theater
description: To have survived adolescence is to wish for a do-over, the chance to take another crack at some fundamental, inescapable decision made so badly the first time around.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Living in Crown Heights, Brooklyn
description: Alluring architecture, along with new residential development, is attracting newcomers and spurring rapid change.

title: Focus and Strategy Shift in Hunt for 2 Escaped Killers
description: DANNEMORA, N.Y.  On Friday, Maj. Charles E. Guess of the New York State Police sounded full of confidence, saying law enforcement officials were making progress tracking the two killers who had escaped from the maximum-security prison here.

title: Moving Wikipedia From Computer to Many, Many Bookshelves
description: The Wikipedia entry for quixoticism runs only about 255 words. But if anyone could argue for a personal mention, it might be Michael Mandiberg.

title: Lost, At Home in Colombia
description: A family story about a grandfather who was lost and raised by another family led Jorge Panchoaga to La Casa Grande  The Big House  in which he explores notions of home and identity.

title: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: Good evening! Heres the latest.

title: In Return to Twitter, Jack Dorsey Aims to Follow Path of Steve Jobs
description: Perhaps we should blame Steve Jobs for Jack Dorseys reappointment as Twitters interim chief executive.

title: A Flamingos New Prosthetic Leg
description: At the Sorocaba Zoo in Brazil, a flamingo is walking again with a prosthetic leg.

title: Warner Music Executive Is Leaving to Lead Helicopter Start-Up Blade
description: Robert Wiesenthal, the chief operating officer of the Warner Music Group and a longtime entertainment industry executive, is planning to resign to lead a start-up company that promises to be the Uber of helicopters.

title: Anne Gaylor, 88, Dies; Guarded Wall Between Church and State
description: Anne Nicol Gaylor, who transformed a local campaign for abortion rights into a national crusade to maintain the separation of church and state, died on June 14 at a hospice in Fitchburg, Wis., near Madison. She was 88.

title: Review: The Astronaut Wives Club Examines the Paper Dolls Behind the Men of Steel
description: In The Right Stuff, Tom Wolfe writes that the first astronauts wives were presented as seven flawless cameo-faced dolls sitting in the family room with their pageboy bobs in place, ready to offer any and all aid to the brave lads.

title: John Kasich, Ohios Republican Rebel, Nears Run for President
description: LANSING, Mich.  The last time John R. Kasich contemplated running for president, as an ambitious congressman in 1999, he tried courting Republicans in Iowa only to discover that even the reporter trailing him from his home state, Ohio, was more enthralled with the Texas governor, George W. Bush.

title: San Francisco Festival of Ethnic Dance
description: An annual dance festival celebrates the choreography native to the many cultures that have become American.

title: Review: Ethnic Festival Dancers Follow the Footsteps of a Heritage
description: I know of no regular event that more effectively, more movingly, recommends this countrys diverse inclusiveness than the annual San Francisco Festival of Ethnic Dance. The companies appearing arent visitors from other countries; theyre American. But they perform the dances of other lands  in most cases, dances they are preserving as their racial or national heritage  and with exuberant pride. Each year, the festival presents a different program on each of four consecutive weekends. If I lived in or near California, I would attend all four, every year. (The auditions alone are celebrated.) Each years presentations contain surprises.

title: Other Viewpoints on the Link Between Race and Identity
description: Reactions to statements by Rachel A. Dolezal, the former president of the Spokane, Wash., N.A.A.C.P. chapter and a university instructor in African-American studies, who has claimed for years that her heritage is partly black  a claim her parents say is a lie.

title: A Six-Bedroom Country House in Catalonia
description: About a half-hours drive from Barcelona or from the coastal resort of Sitges, the home is on the market for $1,017,000.

title: Review: Vendela Vidas The Divers Clothes Lie Empty Offers Freedom to Escape
description: Vendela Vidas heroines have a particular talent for suffering. When their marriages cool or ancient family secrets worm into the light, these women take their troubles on holiday. They prefer to do their grieving somewhere picturesque: the Philippines (And Now You Can Go, 2003), Finland (Let the Northern Lights Erase Your Name, 2007), Turkey (The Lovers, 2010). Ms. Vida has become known for these travel/trauma narratives, wry, amiable novels prone to some clunkiness; the gears always grind a bit loudly. Nothing in them anticipates the smooth engineering of The Divers Clothes Lie Empty, her fourth and finest book, a taut, suspenseful story that ticks along with marvelous efficiency, like a little bomb.

title: St. Louis Cardinals Managers Reaction
description: Mike Matheny responded to an investigation by the F.B.I. and federal prosecutors into whether the St. Louis baseball team hacked into the computers of the Houston Astros.

title: Greenbergs Firm Vows to Appeal A.I.G. Ruling
description: A moral victory wasnt enough.

title: Stephen Currys Mouth Guard: An Investigation
description: Stephen Curry is a delirious and incorrigible show-off: He not only throws no-look passes, he also shoots no-look 3-pointers. Hes a boy wonder: See him for the first time on television and you might mistake him for a 12-year-old. (In reality he is 27, and 6 feet 3 inches tall.) Hes an egomaniac, sort of (but who isnt, in the N.B.A.?). In 2013, an interviewer asked him whom he would pick to shoot, given one chance to win a game and a lineup of Michael Jordan, Kobe Bryant, Ray Allen, Reggie Miller  and Stephen Curry. Curry said: Jordan. But after Jordan, he continued, Im No. 2. At the time, he was 25. He has since become the games greatest scorer.

title: As Fed Edges Toward Rate Increases, Investors Turn Cautious
description: WASHINGTON  This is not the moment the Federal Reserve will start to raise interest rates. But that day is coming, and investors are getting nervous.

title: Bird Flu Sends Egg Prices Up, but Slowing Demand Prevents Shortages
description: Are egg prices up significantly?

title: Brooklyn Academy of Music Seeks to Unify Its Campus With Art
description: Its a campus of sorts, but the Brooklyn Academy of Musics buildings can appear to be separate, individual structures. So BAM is looking to remedy that by starting a new public art program with $3.5 million from the Robert W. Wilson Charitable Trust, the academy is to announce on Tuesday.

title: Blackhawks Bask in the Moment, but Salary Cap Concerns Loom
description: CHICAGO  In the what-have-you-done-for-me-lately world of professional sports, it was inevitable that Joel Quenneville, the coach of the newly minted Stanley Cup champion Chicago Blackhawks, would be asked Monday night how he planned to continue the teams remarkable success, which has yielded three championships in six seasons.

title: Nintendo Makes Unusual Move at E3: Sharing Its Characters
description: LOS ANGELES  It was easy to miss, but Nintendo made something of an unusual move for the company at this E3 games conference.

title: Nintendo Makes Unusual Move at E3: Sharing Its Characters
description: LOS ANGELES  It was easy to miss, but Nintendo made something of an unusual move for the company at this E3 games conference.

title: A Pocket of Strength in Russia
description: The combination of a weak ruble and a strong dollar is bolstering industries like steel in Russia, where commodity companies are flourishing.

title: Upsides for Steel Industry in a Russian Downturn, Despite Sanctions
description: CHEREPOVETS, Russia  Burly steel workers in this gritty industrial town have their choice of free services at the company spa in a leafy park down the road from the factory.

title: A Candidate at Last, Jeb Bush Bounces Into New Hampshire
description: DERRY, N.H.  On his first day as a full-fledged, no-longer-just-thinking-about-it candidate for president, Jeb Bush called his adopted hometown Miami a crazy, wacky place. He spoke of the trauma of discovering that a hacker had published personal emails he had written about the health of his father. He gave a long, emotional hug to a woman who told of her decades-long struggle with mental disabilities.

title: College Student in Queens Is Charged With Conspiring to Support ISIS
description: A college student in Queens has been charged with conspiring to support a foreign terrorist organization after a monthslong investigation found that he was planning to attack various New York City landmarks on behalf of the Islamic State, according to the authorities.

title: Lodging Taxes and Airbnb Hosts: Who Pays, and How
description: Renting out a spare bedroom, or your entire house, to make some extra money is easier to do these days, thanks to online listing services and the mushrooming sharing economy. But inexperienced owners may be unaware that they usually must collect and pay hotel taxes due on short-term rentals.

title: Bravado and High Returns From Italian Fund Manager
description: LONDON  Never, ever marry an American woman. Thats the advice I give my friends.

title: Palestinian Government Is Expected to Resign
description: JERUSALEM  President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority told leaders of his political party on Tuesday that the government he formed a year ago after signing a reconciliation pact with the rival Hamas movement would resign within 24 hours, according to a senior Palestinian official and local news reports.

title: Senate Votes to Turn Presidential Ban on Torture Into Law
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate voted Tuesday to ban the use of torture, moving to ensure that the government does not return to interrogation techniques like waterboarding.

title: Chip Makers Renew Pleas to Congress for Trade Bill
description: In mid-April, 33 executives from rival Silicon Valley companies hurried from building to building on Capitol Hill to push lawmakers to grant President Obama the authority to finish a trade deal with Asian countries. Showing a rare cooperative front, they told the lawmakers that the deal would protect intellectual property and the companies ability to sell electronics across the Pacific Ocean.

title: New Yorks Lawmakers Agree on Campus Sexual Assault Laws
description: ALBANY  New Yorks political leaders have reached a deal on one of Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos legislative priorities for 2015, saying they will adopt new laws intended to change the way sexual assaults on all college campuses in the state are handled.

title: G.M. and Nissan Reusing Old Electric Car Batteries
description: For years, automakers have looked for ways to reuse the batteries from electric cars, which retain significant storage capacity even after they are no longer useful for transport.

title: U.S. Could Lift Sanctions Before Iran Accounting
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State John Kerry signaled for the first time on Tuesday that the United States was prepared to ease economic sanctions on Iran without fully resolving evidence suggesting that Irans scientists have been involved in secret work on nuclear weapons.

title: Recent Commercial Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: Jeb Bush Slow Jams in Two Tongues With Jimmy Fallon
description: Jeb Bush got the slow jam treatment from Jimmy Fallon on The Tonight Show on Tuesday night, and he reiterated in rhyme that he was finally ready to hit the campaign trail and have spirited debates with his fellow Republicans about how to solve Americas problems.

title: A Conversation With James H. Coleman
description: Mr. Coleman, 53, is the founder and managing partner of Hanley Advisors, a boutique real estate consulting and advisory firm based in New York. He recently served as an adviser and broker to the Swiss luxury goods company Richemont in its $700 million sale of a retail condominium at the St. Regis Hotel to Vornado Realty Trust.

title: In Turnabout, Disney Cancels Tech Worker Layoffs
description: In late May, about 35 technology employees at Disney/ABC Television in New York and Burbank, Calif., received jarring news. Managers told them that they would all be laid off, and that during their final weeks they would have to train immigrants brought in by an outsourcing company to do their jobs.

title: Stop and Quiz: Police Cast a Net for Runaways
description: Last week, on one of those June half-days, Luna Raposo-Dean, 13, left her middle school on West 48th Street in Manhattan just after noon and walked a few blocks en route to a drum lesson. At the corner of 40th Street and Eighth Avenue, a police officer approached her. It was outside the Port Authority Bus Terminal.

title: House Republicans Ease Opposition to Needle Exchanges
description: WASHINGTON  Faced with a health crisis resulting from a rise in heroin use in many of their home states, House Republicans are easing their longstanding opposition to federal funding in support of needle exchange programs.

title: If Cardinals Hacked, Their Gamesmanship Crossed the Line
description: The jokes came rolling in on Tuesday afternoon as the news spread that the F.B.I. and the Justice Department were investigating the St. Louis Cardinals, accusing them of breaking into the Houston Astros proprietary database network.

title: Panel Urges Changes in Using U.N. Soldiers
description: An independent panel reviewing United Nations peacekeeping operations recommended sweeping changes on Tuesday to make the blue-helmeted soldiers more accountable for sexual abuse and other crimes, and urged that they no longer be used in counterterrorism operations.

title: Popes Views on Climate Change Add Pressure to Catholic Candidates
description: WASHINGTON  As the steamy hurricane season descends on Miami, the citys Roman Catholic archbishop, Thomas G. Wenski, is planning a summer of sermons, homilies and press events designed to highlight the threat that a warming planet, rising sea levels and more extreme storms pose to his communitys poorest and most vulnerable.

title: Tiger Woods and Phil Mickelson Hope for Revival at Open
description: UNIVERSITY PLACE, Wash.  At 8 oclock on an overcast Tuesday morning, several fans bearing steaming cups of coffee stood in the cold around the Chambers Bay practice green and watched Phil Mickelson chip. As Mickelson hit ball after ball close to the pins, one fan said, If he can chip like that, hell give himself a chance.

title: Orange Is the New Black Season 3, Episode 9 Recap: Rumspringa
description: Season 3, Episode 9: Where My Dreidel At

title: No. 1 Rory McIlroy in Shadow of No. 2 Jordan Spieth at Open
description: UNIVERSITY PLACE, Wash.  The No. 1 player in the world does not usually play second fiddle to anyone. And yet, that is where Rory McIlroy has found himself on the eve of the 115th United States Open.

title: Bahrain Opposition Leader Sentenced to 4 Years in Prison
description: BAGHDAD  A court in Bahrain sentenced the leader of the countrys largest opposition movement to four years in prison on Tuesday, reflecting an escalating push by the government to silence dissident voices in the island kingdom.

title: Suleyman Demirel, Seven Times Turkeys Prime Minister, Dies at 90
description: Suleyman Demirel, who served seven times as Turkeys prime minister, dominating the nations politics when the country struggled with violence, economic stagnation and military rule, died on Wednesday in Ankara, Turkey. He was 90.

title: De Blasio and Bloomberg Trade Rare Praise. No Hug, Though.
description: There were handshakes and some chitchat, a shared smile or two, and, later, rare praise lobbed from across a stage.

title: At 37, Tommy Haas Hopes to Make the Most of Latest Comeback
description: HALLE, Germany  Tommy Haas is largely unsure what the future holds for him, but he does have one set plan this week.

title: Home of the Elves
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  I have a philosophy. [Here we go. Everyone get comfortable. Ed.] This philosophy says that, if at first you dont succeed, try, try again but, in all subsequent attempts, be as snarky as possible about it. [Thats not your philosophy. Thats your twisted interpretation of it. Ed.]

title: Review: David Mamets Ghost Stories, Bedtime Tales With a Gunshot
description: The lullaby of the locomotive has soothed the child to sleep. Or is it the soft, steady voice of the stranger in the trains parlor car, telling a story to the boys father? Both noises are charged with a cadence that inspires even the wary to let go of worldly care and suspicions. Your eyelids grow heavy, heavier by the second.

title: Review: The Tempest Stars Sam Waterston and the Weather at Delacorte Theater
description: As befits a work called The Tempest, theres thunder and lightning aplenty in the production that opened on Tuesday night at the Delacorte Theater in Central Park. Yet rough magic  which is abjured at the plays end by its ruling wizard, Prospero (a sagely bearded Sam Waterston)  is scarce throughout this exquisite-looking interpretation of Shakespeares valedictory romance.

title: U.S. Women Advance to Round of 16 on Abby Wambachs Goal
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia  Abby Wambach has sued over artificial turf and complained about it regularly, becoming a spiritual descendant of that great philosopher and former slugger Dick Allen, who memorably said, If a horse cant eat it, I dont want to play on it.

title: How Fluid Is Race?
A Pocket of Strength in Russia
description: The combination of a weak ruble and a strong dollar is bolstering industries like steel in Russia, where commodity companies are flourishing.

title: Matt Harvey Breaks Out of Slump With Commanding Performance
description: Matt Harvey had performed like a mere mortal in recent starts, allowing three home runs his last time out while posting a 1-3 record with a 7.20 earned run average over his last four outings.

title: Miami Provides 2 Homecomings and a Hammering
description: MIAMI  For nine long innings, Alex Rodriguez watched helplessly from the dugout as his teammates came and went, looking glum. There would be no chance for late-game heroics in a pinch-hitting role, as he had had the night before, no chance for him to be showered in adulation. The Yankees were well on their way to a 12-2 loss.

title: Womens World Cup: Sweden at Risk of Elimination After Draw
description: TUESDAYS RESULTS

title: A Summary of Cases Relating to Rachel Dolezal
description: A report from the Spokane Police Department details four cases relating to Ms. Dolezal, including one in which she reported finding a threatening letter.

title: Hockey Delivers Viewers for NBC
description: The Chicago Blackhawks 2-0 victory over the Tampa Bay Lightning to win the Stanley Cup on Monday was seen on NBC by an average of eight million viewers, making it the third-most-watched Game 6 of the Cup finals on record.

title: Neil Young Wants Donald Trump to Pick Another Song
description: Donald Trump wants to rock in the free world, but Neil Young is not having it.

title: On Stand, World Trade Center Parachutist Stresses His Skill
description: The night he leapt from 1 World Trade Center, Marko Markovich was enveloped in darkness, discernible only by the sound of his voice and the blinking red lights of the two GoPro cameras strapped to his helmet, seen in a series of popular YouTube videos.

title: Taxicab Confessions
An Olfactory Ode to Narcissus
description: For a pair known for their noses, Ezra Woods and Alia Raza, the perfumers and co-creators of Rgime des Fleurs, are surprisingly visual. They begin creating their scents by filling inspiration boards with what seem like random collages of contemporary art, ancient landscapes, baroque interiors and iconic clothing. Mirror, their newest bottle, is a nod to Narcissus, who infamously gazed down at his own reflection in the water, Raza says. We also used a rare absolute of narcissus jonquil, which adds an earthy floral note without sweetness. Made in collaboration with the fashion and design website the Line, the scent itself is about a reflection of an image as opposed to the image itself, so the fragrance is a blurred, impressionistic take on a few different themes, says Woods. In this case, notes of green galbanum, smoky gaiac wood, dry violet and clean charcoal come together, Raza says, like a sketch of a forest reflected in a pond.

title: The Beachy Pad of Brooklyns Lone Pro Surfer
description: Mikey DeTemple is a five-year ASP World Longboard tour vet, a four-time East Coast Surfing Champion and an accomplished filmmaker whose feature Sight/Sound was the best-selling surf film of 2011. For the past three years, the beach-blond, Brooklyn-bearded 30-year-old and his fiance, Lisa Myers, have shared a second-floor Williamsburg walk-up. I needed to be somewhere I could park my truck so I could take off to go surf, explains DeTemple, who says hell drive anywhere within a six-hour radius for waves. (If you want to do it in New York, he says, youve really got to work for it.) A space that felt like Montauk  where DeTemple lived before meeting Myers, and where the couple continues to keep a home  was also essential. We needed it to be bright, DeTemple says. At heart, we are beach people, no matter where we live, Myers adds. I would pour sand in here if I could.

title: Pariss Newest Purveyor of Frances Finest Foods Was Inspired by New York Specialty Shops
description: In Paris, La Maison Plisson, a stylish new cafe-restaurant-grocery store in the Marais, hasnt even been open for two months, but it has already become something of a gastronomic institution. The large, airy shop showcases Frances finest foodstuffs, which is why the original inspiration for this project may come as a big surprise: the specialty food shops of New York City.

title: Golden State Warriors End N.B.A. Title Drought With Victory Over Cavaliers
description: CLEVELAND  The Golden State Warriors launched some 8,900 shots this season. They attempted layups and 3-pointers, runners and elbow jumpers. They dazzled fans and overwhelmed opponents. But every time the ball left their fingertips, the Warriors seemed to be building toward something bigger and better, toward the brightest stage and the grandest prize.

title: Seats That Move With the Onscreen Action Lift Revenue for Los Angeles Theater
description: LOS ANGELES  As American movie theater chains look for ways to increase profits, a Regal Cinemas location here has hit by removing standard seats and replacing them with ones that move with the film, using a technology called 4DX.

title: Hundreds of Journalists Exiled Globally, Report Says
description: At least 452 journalists around the world have been forced into exile since 2010, almost a quarter of them from Syria, a leading press advocacy group said in a report released Wednesday. The report by the group, the Committee to Protect Journalists, attributed the disproportionately large number of exiled Syrian journalists to their harassment and fear of imprisonment by the Syrian government, as well as to threats and attacks from the Islamic State and other militant groups embroiled in the countrys civil war. According to the committees research, the top countries from which journalists have fled over the past five years are Syria with 101, Ethiopia with 57 and Iran with 52.

title: At Basilica Soundscape Festival, Electronics, Post-Punk and Noise
description: The Basilica SoundScape festival in Hudson, N.Y., has announced the lineup for its fourth edition on Wednesday, to run Sept.11-13. The festival, which takes place at Basilica Hudson, a reconditioned 1880s factory building near the Hudson River, is a three-day multidisciplinary festival of music, readings, film and visual art

title: Word of the Day | bowdlerize
description: bowdlerize  \bod-l-riz, baud-\  verb

title: House Benghazi CommitteeExamines the Origins of Emails to Clinton
description: WASHINGTON  Hillary Rodham Clintons longtime adviser Sidney Blumenthal testified before a congressional committee on Tuesday that dozens of memos he sent her when she was secretary of state were written by a longtime high-ranking C.I.A. official.

title: Whats On TV Wednesday
description: 11 P.M. (Sundance) DEUTSCHLAND 83 Martin (Jonas Nay), a 24-year-old East German, is extracted from his military existence and forced by the secret police to assume the identity of an aide to a West German general at the center of NATOs nuclear-deterrence strategy in Anna and Jrg Wingers new Cold War espionage series. Maria Schrader (above, with Mr. Nay) plays Martins manipulative aunt, who pushes him into the assignment by using his mother, who needs a kidney transplant, as a weapon. The series doesnt have the depth of that other 80s spy show, The Americans on Fox, but intentionally so, Neil Genzlinger wrote in The New York Times. Its decidedly a drama  lots of close calls and complications for Martin to deal with  but theres a slight wink throughout as well, as if it were saying, Dont take this too seriously.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I had no idea that years later, she would match the body with the soul.

title: Corrections: June 17, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: A Chinese Nurse Resigns, Bidding Farewell to Her Florence Nightingale Dream
description: Each May 12, on International Nurses Day, nurses in Chinese hospitals recite the Florence Nightingale Pledge, written in honor of the English social reformer and founder of modern nursing.

title: Lost, at Home in Colombia
description: Jorge Panchoaga was raised hearing stories about how his grandfather got lost as a child in the Colombian forest, wandering for two days until he was taken  and raised  by a baker and his family. Those tales took on special meaning in 2010, when Mr. Panchoaga was teaching photography to indigenous youngsters in the Cauca Department, the region his grandfather was from.

Those tales took on special meaning in 2010, when Mr. Panchoaga was teaching photography to indigenous youngsters in the Cauca Department, the region his grandfather was from.
