title: The G.O.P.s Blinkered Contenders
description: SAN DIEGO  The Republican Party keeps announcing its new modernity, declaring its new inclusiveness, swearing that it has changed and then showing that it hasnt.

title: My Choice for President? None of the Above
description: I dont recall a time when more people were running for president and fewer of them offered anything more than poll-tested generalities designed to rally their own bases. No one surprises you with any daring. If we could tax their clichs, wed balance the budget.

title: Massachusetts Takes On a Failing School District
description: The Massachusetts public schools consistently rank at or near the top in the nation for performance on the rigorous, federally backed math and reading exams known as the National Assessment of Educational Progress. The state has nonetheless struggled with how to improve chronically low-performing districts like the one in the impoverished former mill town of Lawrence.

title: Congressional Research Belongs to the Public
description: In Washington, the reports have become commodities traded and sold by policy wonks.

title: From Hillary Clintons Promises to Policies
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton made many promises in her campaign speech last weekend, including a vow to make the economy work for everyday Americans, not just those at the top. Unlike many politicians who cast the income-and-wealth gap as a result of impersonal forces, Mrs. Clinton rightly noted that growing inequality also comes from choices weve made as a nation, leaders and citizens.

title: How to Treat Wolves
description: To the Editor:

title: Put Lawyers Where Theyre Needed
description: OAK PARK, Ill.  MILLIONS of Americans lack crucial legal services. Yet enormous numbers of lawyers are unemployed. Why cant the supply of lawyers match the demand?

title: Test Yourself | Serena and LeBron
description: Below, several paragraphs from a June 11 column, Serena Williams Is a Star Who Matches LeBron James, From a Different Court.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Rachel Dolezal, Ex-N.A.A.C.P. Official, Breaks Her Silence on Today Show and MSNBC
description: In Rachel Dolezal, Ex-N.A.A.C.P. Official, Breaks Her Silence on Today Show and MSNBC, Richard Prez-Pea reports on a woman who has stirred up a furor about racial identity.

title: Officials React to Hong Kong Discontent
description: On Tuesday, Hong Kongs chief executive, Leung Chun-ying, and a Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman, Lu Kang, expressed concerns over potential political upheaval in the former British colony.

title: Crown Heights, Brooklyn, Where Stoop Life Still Thrives
description: Crown Heights was one of the wealthiest neighborhoods in Brooklyn at the turn of the last century, and the alluring architecture of that era, along with new residential development, is attracting newcomers and spurring rapid change.

title: Golfs Golden Dropout
description: UNIVERSITY PLACE, Wash.  Well before Jordan Spieth was fitted for a Masters green jacket in April, he acquired a nickname from a few PGA Tour players, who took one look at his pinchable face, impeccable manners and bulletproof game and anointed him the Golden Child.

title: G.O.P. Is Wary About Winning on Health Law
description: WASHINGTON  Republicans who have been hoping that the Supreme Court will upend President Obamas health care law are now confronting an urgent and uncomfortable question: What if they win?

title: Industrys Growth Leads to Leftover Embryos, and Painful Choices
description: After years of infertility, Angel and Jeff Watts found a young egg donor to help them have a baby. They fertilized her eggs with Mr. Wattss sperm and got 10 good embryos. Four of those embryos were transferred to Ms. Wattss womb, resulting in two sets of twins  Alexander and Shelby, now 4 years old, and Angelina and Charles, not yet 2.

title: Turkey at a Democratic Crossroad
description: ISTANBUL  After last weeks elections brought an end to majority rule by one party, Turkey faces the prospect of a coalition government. What was once considered undesirable, even unthinkable, now offers an opportunity to overhaul Turkeys political culture and inch the country toward becoming a genuinely liberal democracy. That would be a historic shift.

title: The Waterloo They Remembered
description: Two hundred years ago, in a shallow valley south of Brussels, three armies fought the Battle of Waterloo. Napoleon had returned from exile on Elba to face a coalition of European enemies, who were now determined to oust him a second time. The closest opponents were the Prussian and British-Dutch armies to his north, so he launched a campaign to destroy them both. At Waterloo, on June 18, 1815, he failed.

title: Science Weighs In on High Heels
description: Many commentators have pointed out that the new movie Jurassic World is scientifically suspect, if not fantastical. But they have overlooked one of the more prominent ways in which the blockbuster diverges from established research. The movies heroine runs from rampaging beasts in high heels, without turning a hair or an ankle. But research on the biomechanics of wearing heels, including a new study of the effects on ankle strength and balance, says of her equipoise: Ha.

title: Wednesdays Travel News and Tips
description: Our weekday morning digest that includes consumer news, deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.

title: Jack Dorsey (and Beard) Retake Twitter
description: The tech and business worlds may have raised an eyebrow at the news last Thursday that Jack Dorsey, co-founder and chairman of Twitter, would assume the chief executive role he relinquished in 2008, at least on an interim basis, replacing the chief executive Dick Costolo. But the jaw dropping came later.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Estonian News Site Can Be Held Liable for Defamatory Comments, Court Rules
description: LONDON  One of Europes top courts has ruled that an Estonian news organization can be held liable for defamatory comments posted on its website.

title: New York Today: Unfinished Business
description: Good morning on this crystalline Wednesday.

title: New York Today: Unfinished Business
description: Good morning on this crystalline Wednesday.

title: Traces of Earliest Stars That Enriched Cosmos Are Spied
description: Astronomers said Wednesday that they had discovered a lost generation of monster stars that ushered light into the universe after the Big Bang and jump-started the creation of the elements needed for planets and life before disappearing forever.

title: Standard Chartered Names New Senior Independent Director
description: LONDON  The British bank Standard Chartered said on Wednesday that it had named a new senior independent director on its board as the company continued to reshape its leadership.

title: Ireland Mourns 6 Victims of Berkeley Balcony Collapse
description: DUBLIN  The flag flew at half-staff across Ireland on Wednesday, as the country struggled to come to terms with the tragedy that took the lives of six young people when a balcony collapsed during a party in Northern California.

title: Experts on Aging, Dying as They Lived
description: At 10 years old I knew my parents did not wish to be resuscitated nor plugged into machines in the event of serious illness. They told me they were not afraid of death but rather of being kept alive at any cost. I knew they would refuse medical interventions, if they felt there was no purpose except to separate the dying from their deaths. They were wary of doctors who my parents said were trained by a medical culture that had lost touch with what should be its major focus: ending suffering.

title: R.B.S. Is Again Hit by a Technology Failure
description: LONDON  The Royal Bank of Scotland said on Wednesday that about 600,000 customer transactions had not been processed as a result of a technology failure overnight. The issue affected transactions at the companys R.B.S., National Westminster Bank, Coutts and Ulster Bank brands.

title: Dorothy Cann Hamilton Talks About the World Expo
description: Dorothy Cann Hamilton is no stranger to the world of food. In 1984 she started the French Culinary Institute, now the International Culinary Center, in New York and recruited renowned chefs like Jos Andrs and Jacques Ppin as teachers. Ms. Hamilton, 65, is the president of the USA Pavilion at the 2015 World Expo, in Milan through Oct. 31. The theme is Feeding the Planet, Energy for Life, and she is running a 35,000-square-foot pavilion that puts American food culture in the spotlight. Following are excerpts from a conversation with Ms. Hamilton.

title: Taxicab Confessions
description: Last night I witnessed an assault on a taxi driver. After the passenger jumped out of the cab and kicked it repeatedly, the driver got out and confronted the man. The man suddenly began throwing punches, and a legitimate brawl ensued during which the man yelled things like go back where you came from and I was born in this country, you werent. A small crowd gathered to break up the fight. When the police arrived, I stuck around to defend the cabdriver. The police listened but told me they did not need me as an official witness. I wished the cabdriver luck and went across the street to watch the aftermath play out. The passenger, a black man, was claiming that the cabdriver would not take him to Harlem but that he probably would have if he were white. The police did not arrest the man, nor did they appear to do much of anything in the way of even taking information. During the brawl I heard a ring bounce toward me across the street. I picked it up, and after the cabdriver called the police, I asked him if the ring was his. He said it belonged to the other man. I asked somewhat conspiratorially if he wanted the ring anyway, but he said no. When I got home, I found it was a Cartier wedding band that sold new from $1,100 to $1,600. Today I found a posting on Craigslist, seemingly from the passenger, seeking his ring, lost during an assault, in exchange for a reward. So what do I do? J.P., NEW YORK

title: Better Judgment
description: Nearly 100 years ago, Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr. stood at an upright desk in his study, dipped a pen into an inkwell inherited from his father and wrote a Supreme Court opinion allowing the government to imprison people for speaking out against World War I. Holmes was 77 on that day in February 1919. He came to Washington 16 years earlier from Massachusetts after stints as a law professor at Harvard and a judge on the state Supreme Court, and he looked the part of a patrician New Englander, with his handlebar mustache and a bristling shock of white hair.

title: Our Bodies, Our Feeds
description: Last month, my friend Tracy posted a series of messages on Twitter, including one that read, I look like a marshmallow tied up in rubber bands. Another said, Scientific fact: Salt and vinegar chips taste 46% better when youre on your period. Once I stopped laughing, I noticed she was using a hashtag I had never seen before: #LiveTweetYourPeriod. A quick tour of the tag revealed hundreds of other posts, ranging from the oblique (images of junk food) to the grotesquely exaggerated  one tweet included an image of the pivotal pigs blood moment in Carrie; another, the part in Alien when a creature bursts from John Hurts chest.

title: Responding to Readers Questions on Weight Loss
description: In an article on Monday, I discussed the evidence showing that diet is much more important than exercise when it comes to losing weight. You had many thoughtful comments and questions  so many that we thought it might be useful to respond to some of them here.

title: Can Hillary Clinton Be a Woman of the People?
description: Hillary Rodham Clintons presidential campaign is based on the assumption that voters are angrier at the rich than they are at the poor.

title: Today in Politics: Latino Conference Brings Immigration Overhaul Back to the Trail
description: Good Wednesday morning from Washington, where there is some potential movement on trade and even on the issue of needle exchange. But as a conference of Latino elected officials invites candidates to speak, immigration is sure to be back in the national conversation.

title: Bipartisan Group Urges Overhaul of General Election Debates
description: A presidential debate season that begins in mid-September. A television studio backdrop without a live studio audience. And a chess clock model, where each candidate is allotted 45 minutes of speaking time, which begins ticking down when they start talking.

title: Suspicious Swiss Bank Deals to Be Part of FIFA Investigation
description: An investigation by the authorities in Switzerland into the activities of FIFA, world soccers governing body, will include the examination of more than 50 suspicious financial relationships, the countrys chief federal prosecutor said on Wednesday.

title: The King of Tapas
description: Its the house that jamn built, the castle of chorizo, the mansion of manchego. The Spanish food mecca Despaa, in SoHo, is a landmark shop for food lovers, its dark wood finishes and white subway-tile walls bringing together the sights of Spain and New York. When I arrived to meet its owners, Marcos and Anglica Intriago, they welcomed me with tortilla espaola: potatoes and onions fat with olive oil and bound with egg into a neat little cake  the king of tapas. But the problem with tortilla, Anglica said to me, is that Americans dont want to pay for it because its just potatoes and eggs, and Spaniards dont want to pay for it because it doesnt taste like their mothers.

title: Who Owns Soccer?
description: Early this month, after Sepp Blatter trudged off the stage following his announcement that he would be retiring from the presidency of FIFA, he was followed at the podium by a man named Domenico Scala, the FIFA official who is charged with overseeing the election to replace him. Implicitly acknowledging the furor that prompted Blatters departure  the arrests of seven soccer officials in Zurich on corruption charges the week before  Scala said Blatters decision created an opportunity for us to go further than FIFA has before  to fundamentally change the way in which FIFA is structured. Scala also called Blatters announcement courageous, saying: I know that he has truly acted with the best interests of FIFA and football in his heart. I have a great amount of respect for the president and the role that he has played in championing reform within FIFA.

title: Morning Agenda: Jobss Legacy Shadows Ousted Chiefs Return
description: JOBSS LEGACY SHADOWS OUSTED CHIEFS RETURN | Jack Dorseys return to Twitter invites comparisons to another high-profile comeback of a chief executive who had been ousted from the company he founded  that is, Steve Jobs,  Steven Davidoff Solomon writes in the Deal Professor column. The legend of Steve Jobs lingers over Silicon Valley, he writes. One of its many forms encourages founders to return triumphantly to save their brands. Like Jobs, Mr. Dorsey will be rejoining his company as interim chief executive. And Mr. Dorsey, who is also the chief executive of the payments company Square, will now be running two companies at the same time, much like Jobs ran Apple and Pixar for nine years.

title: Police at Chinese Train Station Kill Attacker Armed With Brick
description: BEIJING  A man attacking people with a brick on Wednesday at a train station in the northern Chinese city of Xian was shot and killed by the police, according to a post on the microblog of the Xian Railway Police.

title: Michelle Obama Stages Her Own London Fashion Week
description: For the past two days, Michelle Obama, her mother and her two daughters have been in London promoting the Let Girls Learn initiative and doing some outreach via Britains fashion industry on the side. Its been a pretty effective demonstration of diplomatic multitasking.

title: Rare Bernini Sculpture Surfaces at the Getty
description: The J. Paul Getty Museum has just acquired an important early sculpture by the Baroque master Bernini: a marble bust of Pope Paul V that many art historians did not believe still existed.

title: North Korea Says Its Facing Its Worst Drought in a Century
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea is in the midst of a severe drought, its state news agency reported, raising fears of worsening food shortages in the impoverished country, where child malnutrition is a persistent problem.

title: Classical Music This Week: Philharmonic in the Parks, Free Music and Nina Stemme
description: Good morning, classical music fans. As we continue to experiment with this new weekly feature, please let us know what youd like to see in this space and tell us what youre reading and hearing. Use the comments section, email zach.woolfe@nytimes.com or tweet at @zwoolfe.

title: Newsroom Diversity: Why We Should Care
description: Does it matter who reports the news and comments on it? Does it make a difference if top editors of news organizations include plenty of women as well as plenty of men, and black and Hispanic journalists as well as white ones?

title: A Survey Finds Montana a Hotbed of Entrepreneurship
description: Silicon Valley gets all the glory, but the real hotbed of American entrepreneurship appears to be a few hundred miles to the northeast: Montana.

description: Dear Diary:

title: Tiger That Fled Flooded Georgia Zoo Is Killed After Mauling a Man
description: MOSCOW  A white tiger that had survived this weekends torrential flooding killed a man on Wednesday and was shot and killed itself, putting a horrifying end to a thoroughly depressing and occasionally bizarre few days for residents in Tbilisi, Georgia.

description: TUCSON

title: Allergan to Buy Kythera Biopharmaceuticals for $2.1 Billion
description: Allergan, the maker of Botox, said on Wednesday that it would pay about $2.1 billion in cash and shares for Kythera Biopharmaceuticals, which makes a treatment for double chins.

title: Export-Import Bank Divides Once-Supportive Republicans
description: GREENVILLE, S.C.  South Carolinians know something about civil wars, but the latest one within the Republican Party over the federal Export-Import Bank has a couple of the states Republican brothers in Congress battling each other, reflecting the national partys deepening divide over the role of government in the economy.

title: Hong Kong Lawmakers Begin Debate Over Election Plan
description: HONG KONG  Protesters, police officers and lawmakers converged on Hong Kongs Legislative Council on Wednesday as debate began on a plan to change the way the semiautonomous Chinese territory will choose its leader beginning in 2017.

title: U.S. Lags in Efforts to Rein In Omar al-Bashir of Sudan, Critics Say
description: When they heard the sound of galloping horses, or the roar of planes overhead, the women ran with children on their backs and hid in the hills.

description: Marie Tae McDermott is a news assistant and comment moderator.

title: South Korea Fights MERS Outbreak
description: Gimpo International Airport in Seoul is being disinfected while heat-detecting cameras monitor passengers. The number of Middle East Respiratory Syndrome cases in the country continues to rise.

title: Swiss Prosecutor on FIFA Bank Inquiry
description: Switzerlands attorney general, Michael Lauber, said on Wednesday that his office had seized about nine terabytes of data in the investigation into allegations of bribery and corruption at FIFA.

title: No Comment Necessary: Donald Trump Thinks Hed Win With Oprah As Running Mate
description: Donald Trump mentioned Oprah Winfrey as a possible running mate in 1999. In an interview with ABC News, he revealed he hasnt changed his mind.

title: Economists on Bushs Promise: Close to 0 Percent Chance of 4 Percent Growth
description: Jeb Bush set out an aggressive economic growth target in his campaign announcement speech Monday: four percent real G.D.P. growth, for a decade.

title: Summer Camps Mostly Undisturbed by Nearby Manhunt for Prison Escapees
description: DANNEMORA, N.Y.  The search for two escaped maximum-security prisoners across a swath of far northern New York State has covered modest, rural terrain. Plodding through marshy meadows and tramping through abandoned houses, the roughly 800 searchers are making their way through an area where small villages interrupt a vast forest and the economy depends on prisons like the Clinton Correctional Facility.

title: Lively Morgue Tumblr 527  531

title: 1890: Paris Eclipse
description: PARIS  Much interest was taken in yesterdays eclipse by Parisians. Thousands of persons arose far ahead of their accustomed hour, and, armed with pieces of smoked glass, sought the various points from which it was believed good views of the phenomenon could be had. The place de lHtel de Ville was occupied by a crowd of 500 persons, who were anxious to avail themselves of a large equatorial telescope and four smaller ones that had been placed there by M. Joseph Vinot, of the Journal du Ciel.  The New York Herald, European Edition, June 18, 1890

title: With Warriors Long Title Drought Over, Whos Next?
description: After 39 seasons of failure, the Golden State Warriors are finally N.B.A. champions again. Considering how often the team has struggled over the years, the wait, though not nearly a record, sometimes felt as if it would be endless.

title: Trade Deal Comments Put Hillary Clinton at Odds With Her Former Boss
description: WASHINGTON  If there was one moment recently in which President Obama could have used Hillary Rodham Clintons help, it was on Sunday as the president scrambled to salvage his trade deal, which had been halted by congressional Democrats.

title: Big Game Makers Cautious About Virtual Reality at E3
description: LOS ANGELES  Game developers have seen fads like 3-D games come and go in recent years. Theyve also seen technologies like mobile come, stay and upend the entire industry.

title: Big Game Makers Cautious About Virtual Reality at E3
description: LOS ANGELES  Game developers have seen fads like 3-D games come and go in recent years. Theyve also seen technologies like mobile come, stay and upend the entire industry.

title: Jeb Bushs 4 Percent Growth Target Called Unrealistic by Economists
description: Over on The Upshot, Josh Barro looks into Jeb Bushs pledge to increase G.D.P. growth to 4 percent annually, and how economists think its unrealistic.

title: Where ISIS Has Directed and Inspired Attacks Around the World
description: More than a dozen countries have had attacks since the Islamic State, or ISIS, began to pursue a global strategy in the summer of 2014.

title: Qihoo 360 of China Announces C.E.O.-Led Takeover Bid
description: The Qihoo 360 Technology Company, a maker of mobile security software in China, said on Wednesday that a consortium led by its chief executive had offered to acquire the company for about $10 billion in cash.

title: Penn and Teller, Reconjured on Broadway
description: The man known simply as Teller, or often, the silent one, paused during a walk through Times Square, thinking about change, about the old and the new, and said, Were going to pull a rabbit out of a hat.

title: Teaching the Holocaust to Muslim Germans, or Not
description: BERLIN  In Germanys ever-swirling debate about its past, it is a relatively recent, always delicate question: How do you teach Muslim Germans about the Nazis and the Holocaust?

title: South Korean Hospital Scrutinized in MERS Outbreak
description: SEOUL, South Korea  It is the jewel of South Koreas medical service: a 1,900-bed hospital of steel and glass owned by the Samsung conglomerate. It is also where a 35-year-old man whose symptoms were misdiagnosed as pneumonia languished for three days in an overcrowded emergency room and hallway, where he coughed up sputum teeming with the  Middle East respiratory syndrome virus and exposed dozens.

title: Hacking Inquiry Finds a Trail Despite Efforts to Cover It Up
description: The F.B.I.s route to the St. Louis Cardinals front office in pursuit of an apparent hacker, or hackers, involved a trip through a shrouded corner of the Internet.

title: Privately Owned Armored Trucks Raise Eyebrows After Attack on Dallas Police
description: HOUSTON  Jeff Funicello is selling his black 1975 GMC truck on Craigslist. It would be perfect for a thrifty bank. Or a low-budget SWAT team.

title: Regulator Restricts Mortgage Operations of Six Big Banks
description: JPMorgan Chase, Wells Fargo and four other big banks are facing new restrictions on their mortgage operations after a federal regulator determined the banks did not do enough to fix problems in their foreclosure practices in the aftermath of the financial crisis.

title: 4 Microsoft Executives to Leave in Top-Level Shake-Up
description: SEATTLE  Four senior Microsoft executives, including Stephen Elop and Mark Penn, will leave the technology company in the biggest organizational shake-up yet under Satya Nadella, its chief executive.

title: Jeb Bush and Religion: Hes No John Kennedy
description: Jeb Bush, whose presidential campaign was in beta for so many months and has now moved into the minimal viable product phase, offered some strong words about religion and politics yesterday. It turns out that he thinks religion should not bleed into the political arena  except of course when he thinks it should.

title: In Detroit, Branson Celebrates a New Virgin Atlantic Route
description: To promote Virgin Atlantics newest route, a nonstop daily round-trip flight between Detroit and London that began on June 1, the airlines founder, Sir Richard Branson, recently took a whirlwind tour of Michigans largest city, admitting by visits end that he was pleasantly surprised by what he discovered.

title: Podcasting Blossoms, but in Slow Motion
description: Is podcasting in the middle of a long boom or a short bubble? The future of radio, a medium already being buffeted by streaming music, may be riding on the answer.

title: E.U. Agrees to Extend Economic Sanctions Against Russia
description: BRUSSELS  The European Union is set to extend by six months economic sanctions against Russia, calming fears that Greeces acrimonious negotiations over its debt crisis might allow Russia to break the unity of the 28-nation bloc in its response to the conflict in Ukraine.

title: The End of the Sex Abuse Crisis
description: The conversation about Catholicism and Pope Francis is about to be dominated bythe topics of the environment and climate change, thanks to tomorrows (official; there have been leaks) release of the pontiffs ecological encyclical, Laudato Si. But let mesneak in a belated comment on last weeks news that the Vatican is setting up a tribunal to handle accusations of negligence by bishops in sex abuse cases, with coincided, probably not coincidentally, with the resignations of the archbishop of Minneapolis-St. Paul and his auxiliary over their handling of a now-defrocked predator priest.

title: To Cut Teen Smoking, Raise Tobacco Sales Age
description: A new study has found a simple way to significantly reduce teenage smoking: raise the tobacco sales age to 21. In 2005, Needham, Mass., did just that, while surrounding communities kept their age limit at 18.

title: Florence and the Machine to Replace Foo Fighters at Glastonbury
description: The Glastonbury Festival in England is swapping one musicians broken bone for anothers recently healed one.

title: California Says Uber Driver Is Employee, Not a Contractor
description: In a ruling that fuels a long-simmering debate over some of Silicon Valleys fastest-growing technology companies and the work they are creating, the California Labor Commissioners Office said that a driver for the ride-hailing service Uber should be classified as an employee, not an independent contractor.

title: Travel Diary
description: Highlights from the artist Mickalene Thomass four-city tour of Italy.

title: Alex Morgan and Abby Wambach Renew Partnership and Revive U.S. Hopes
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia  Chosen to start in a Womens World Cup game for the first time on Tuesday, Alex Morgan said she jokingly sought pointers from left back Meghan Klingenberg, who has made all of three starts.

title: After an Era of Ups and Downs, Home Prices Return to Sanity
description: WESLEY CHAPEL, Fla.  Donte and Anjoli Hill postponed their honeymoon indefinitely and squirreled away cash wedding gifts in order to afford the down payment on the four-bedroom house they bought a few months ago in this Tampa suburb.

title: Straw Hats at Pitti
description: The straw hat is a fashion perennial at the mens fashion fair in Florence, Italy.

title: The Biggest Cheats in Team Sports
description: A list of some of the most famous and unusual cheating scandals in team sports from around the world.

title: Review: Leon Golubs Riot Revisits Political Art With a Sense of the Absurd
description: Intrinsically theatrical, oil painting is an ideal medium for political art. Leon Golub knew this and made the most of it in mural-size pictures of terrorists, torturers and hit-squad goons that more or less fought their way into existence, being repeatedly painted and scraped down and sometimes cut up and reconfigured. These are the kinds of paintings we see on the first floor of a career sampler of Mr. Golubs work at Hauser & Wirth, a spinoff of a recent retrospective at the Serpentine Gallery in London.

title: Pope Requests More Help for Migrants
description: During a general audience at the Vatican, Pope Francis calls for coordinated international action and asks forgiveness for those who close their doors to refugees.

title: Greek Central Bank Warns of Financial Collapse if Debt Talks Fail
description: BRUSSELS  The central bank of Greece warned on Wednesday that failure to reach a deal in the countrys long-running debt crisis would result in a default on its bailout loans and economic turmoil.

title: Surely Not the Last Straw at Pitti Uomo
description: A short brim and a high crown was two years ago, Giacomo Tesi, a fifth-generation hatter, said on June 17 at the main pavilion of Pitti Uomo, the big mens wear trade show held twice annually in Florence, the Italian city that not only gave birth to the Renaissance but also, in 1951, to the modern fashion show.

title: Tiger Kills Man in Tbilisi, Georgia
description: A witness and the interior minister of Georgia described a deadly tiger attack on Wednesday in Tbilisi that killed one man after floods damaged the citys zoo, causing some animals to escape.

title: The Biggest Losers From A.I.G.: Taxpayers
description: Maurice Greenberg, the former chief executive of A.I.G., won support this week for his claim that the government acted illegally in 2008, when it bailed out A.I.G. But in his lawsuit against the United States, he wasnt seeking support, he was seeking money  $40 billion, to be exact. He got nothing, which on Wall Street makes him a big loser.

title: Valid Complaints on Story about Berkeley Balcony Collapse
description: My office fielded hundreds of complaints Wednesday from readers who are  quite understandably  upset about an article that went online Tuesday night.

title: 1965: U.S. Rejects Viet Cong Talks
description: WASHINGTON  President Johnson today [June 16] rejected any idea of direct negotiations over Vietnam with the Viet Cong or their political arm, the National Liberation Front. What would you think about the state of Mississippi negotiating for the United States? the president asked at a surprise press conference. I have no doubt that if the Viet Cong wished to negotiate, they would have no trouble in finding a government to negotiate for them, he said. His statement was a reference to his administrations firmly held belief that the South Vietnamese Communists are controlled, directed, supplied and now reinforced by North Vietnam.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, June 18, 1965

title: Chiles Copa Amrica Star in Court After Crashing Ferrari
description: SANTIAGO, Chile  Fans of the host nation at the Copa Amrica were set on edge when Arturo Vidal, the tournaments leading scorer and the star midfielder for Chile, was arrested and charged with driving under the influence after he smashed his red Ferrari on Tuesday night.

title: Netflixs Sense8: Watched It All? Lets Talk.
description: The supernatural usually isnt my calling when Im looking for TV shows or movies to watch. But there was something about Netflixs Sense8  a collaboration between the Wachowskis (The Matrix, Cloud Atlas) and J. Michael Straczynski (Babylon 5), with an alluring international cast and exotic locales  that called to me. (Read Alessandra Stanleys review here.) And while some of you may have binged the entire series that first weekend of June, Ive finally gotten around to doing so.

title: 36 Hours in Lima
description: Limas winning formula: A rich pre-Columbian heritage, emerging art and fashion scenes, and remarkably great food.

title: Tough Tests for Teachers, With Question of Bias
description: Students are not the only ones struggling to pass new standardized tests being rolled out around the country. So are those who want to be teachers.

title: 36 Hours in Lima, Peru
description: Perus capital may not have world-class architecture, but its old moniker Lima the ugly doesnt hold true these days. Right away, a visitor notices its tidy streets, handsomely landscaped parks and sweeping ocean views. And then there are the less obvious but ultimately more compelling attractions: a rich pre-Columbian heritage, ethnic diversity, and emerging art and fashion scenes, as well as remarkably great food. Limas transformation into a culinary powerhouse, which started more than a decade ago, was propelled forward in recent years by a group of talented and enterprising chefs. Their creativity, inspired by the seemingly endless variety of native ingredients, has brought fame not only to their individual restaurants, but also to the entire city.

title: New York Summer Love Stories
description: For a series on Summer Love, The Times asked readers to share their New York City summer love stories, both good and bad.

title: How The Times Covers ISIS
description: The hardest part of writing about the Islamic State is that there is no way for us to go and check out anything ourselves. The group has killed many journalists it has gotten its hands on and is more interested in putting out its own message through videos and social media, which allows it to idealize itself and entice recruits.

title: For Art Metropole, a Sara Cwynar Tote Bag
description: Among the stacks of miscellany packed into the multidisciplinary photographer Sara Cwynars studio is a selection of old trade manuals  including a 1960s or 70s catalog for customizable shopping bags. You would pick the kind of bag and the type to put on it, she explains, and theres a simplicity to the imagery that doesnt exist anymore, she says of the books pages. Cwynar repurposed the images for a series of limited-edition canvas totes  the aptly named Bags on Bags  available in Art Metropoles booth at Art Basel. True to form for an artist known for her vibrant works, she sold the Canadian institution on using four colors instead of two.

title: F.C.C. to Fine AT&T for Slowing Data Speeds of Some Customers
description: The Federal Communications Commission on Wednesday said it planned to fine AT&T Mobility $100 million, accusing the company of misleading millions of wireless customers with unlimited data plans by slowing down their service without adequately informing them.

title: TPP Versus NAFTA
description: Many people  myself included  thought that TPP would, in the end, follow the model of NAFTA: a Democratic president would push the agreement through Congress, but the bulk of the votes would be Republican. But it doesnt seem to be going that way. Why?

description: Q. An icon appeared on my computer offering me a free upgrade to Windows 10. Is this real? And if so, should I sign up?

title: Tracking Entrepreneurship, and the State of the Sharing Economy
description: The Kauffman Foundations annual analysis of start-up activity nationwide is a treasure trove of regional and demographic data. After five years of trending downward, new business starts reversed course last year and noticeably increased, but business creation remains below the historical average in most parts of the country.

title: Pope on Encyclical Before Its Release
description: Pope Francis discussed on Wednesday an eagerly awaited papal encyclical in which he is expected to address climate change.

title: New Group Enjoys Thaw in U.S.-Cuba Relations With a Party
description: The American travel and trade bans against Cuba are older than the 52-year-old senator Jeff Flake  so yesterday, he likes to chide his younger Senate colleague Marco Rubio, who opposes ending the bans yet campaigns for president as a new-generation candidate declaring, Yesterday is over!

title: Ron Clarke, Australian Runner Known for World Records, Dies at 78
description: Ron Clarke, an Australian middle- and long-distance runner who broke 17 world records, some by huge margins, in the mid-1960s but never won an Olympic or British Commonwealth gold medal, died on Wednesday in Gold Coast, Australia, where he had recently been mayor. He was 78.

title: Kenneth Feinberg to Oversee Cuts in Multiemployer Pension Plans
description: The Treasury Department said on Wednesday that it had named Kenneth R. Feinberg to oversee a new program to allow certain pension plans to cut retirees benefits if that is the only way to keep them from running out of money.

title: To Celebrate 50 Years, the Israel Museum Looks Back Much Further
description: JERUSALEM  A softly lit case displays a small, gnarled implement that is said to be the worlds oldest known complete sickle, dating back 9,000 years. On a wall nearby, a video installation called Shopping Day, made by the Israeli artist Doron Solomons and set in an immaculate supermarket, offers a wry reflection on the branding and packaging of modern consumer products.

title: Warriors Fans Rejoice at N.B.A. Title
description: Warriors fans celebrate after their team beat the Cleveland Cavaliers to become N.B.A. champions.

title: N.B.A. Plays Its Final Note, but What a Symphony It Was
description: CLEVELAND  So the certifiably best basketball player on the planet, having just put in one of the great performances in N.B.A. playoff history, slips into his postgame seat, his red eyes shadowed by the rim of a handsome homburg.

title: Postdigital Artisans
description: Jonathan Openshaw shares with T 10 of the most compelling projects featured in his new book.

title: Fed, in Shift, Expects Slower Increase in Interest Rates
description: WASHINGTON  The era of easy money is not ending yet.

title: 3 Postal Workers Accused of Posing as Children to Steal From Operation Santa
description: In the grand James A. Farley Post Office in Manhattan, a century-old Christmas tradition unfolded, as workers playing the role of benevolent elves sorted gift lists from needy children and addressed boxes from Secret Santas.

title: Philip Larkin to Get a Memorial Stone in Poets Corner at Westminster Abbey
description: LONDON  The British poet Philip Larkin (1922-1985)  a malcontent with a reclusive streak and an acid take on his own success  will receive a jolt of posthumous recognition when Westminster Abbey adds a memorial stone in his honor to its Poets Corner, a site featuring tributes to 67 (soon to be 68) of the leading writers in the English language.

title: Grace Wales Bonner Mens Spring 2016
description: Looks from the collection.

title: A Spring/Summer 2016 Trend Worth Adopting Now
description: White trucker jackets, fitted and cut short, are quickly emerging as a spring/summer 2016 trend worth adopting early. On Saturday, the handsome, stylish Harvey Nichols buyer Darren Skey made his London Collections Men rounds in a white denim version by Common Sweden. The up-and-coming Swedish brand Lhomme Rouge presented a lightweight Tencel zip-front jacket for next season; and earlier this week, Tom Ford showed the styles most luxurious interpretation, in white leather. You can get one now at ourlegacy.se.

title: Why Jeb Bush and Other Republicans Are Wrong to Chide Pope Francis for Taking a Climate Stand
description: Its been remarkable to see the lengthening line of Republican politicians, particularly presidential hopefuls, chiding Pope Francis for pressing the case for action to stem global warming given how much conservatives have stressed values-based arguments on important issues in the past.

title: Turkish Premier on Demirels Death
description: Prime Minister Ahmet Davutoglu said Wednesday that Suleyman Demirel, the former president and prime minister, who died in the early morning, always stood by legitimacy and democracy in Turkey.

title: Palestinian Is Detained in 82 Attack on Paris Jewish Restaurant
description: PARIS  A Palestinian man who is believed to have taken part in a  deadly 1982 attack on a Jewish restaurant in Paris has been arrested in Jordan, officials in Amman and Paris said on Wednesday.

title: Womens World Cup: How U.S. Fans Should Root Today
description: The United States has advanced to the Round of 16 at the Womens World Cup, but the next opponent remains a mystery. The four matches being played Wednesday will determine which of seven possible teams the United States will play Monday in Edmonton, at 8 p.m. Eastern.

title: Jeb Bush Avoids Criticizing Pope While Acknowledging Threat of Global Warming
description: WASHINGTON, Iowa  Jeb Bush backed away from criticizing Pope Francis on climate change on Wednesday, but he did offer a stronger assertion than many of his Republican presidential rivals that global warming is a threat and that the federal government should address it.

title: Prison Worker Charged in 2 Convicts Escape Is Linked to a Murder Plot
description: PLATTSBURGH, N.Y.  The civilian prison employee charged with aiding the escape of two murderers from a maximum-security prison here in Clinton County backed out of a plan that involved killing her husband and serving as a getaway driver because she possibly feared for her life, the local district attorney said on Wednesday.

title: A Robotic Dogs Mortality
description: This is the final episode in a Bits video series, called Robotica, examining how robots are poised to change the way we do business and conduct our daily lives.

title: The Family Dog
description: When Sony stopped manufacturing replacement parts for its Aibo pet robot, owners scrambled to save the robot-dogs that had become part of their families.

title: Jimmy Lee, Investment Banking Force, Dies at 62
description: James B. Lee Jr., a pioneering deal maker and among the most influential Wall Street investment bankers of his era, died on Wednesday. He was 62.

title: Both Sides Weigh In on Greek Debt Talks
description: Alexis Tsipras, the Greek prime minister, and Jeroen Dijsselbloem, who leads the finance ministers in the eurozone, discussed the ongoing Greek debt talks on Wednesday.

title: An Optimists View of Russia
description: With his invasion of Crimea, deployment of troops and weapons toeastern Ukraine and ruthless oppression at home, President Vladimir Putin of Russia has steered his country far off the democratic track. The promise of the early 1990s, when the collapse of the Soviet Union seemed to usher in a new era of rights and freedoms, is over.

title: Review: Jessica Hopper Looks Beyond the Boys and Their Bands in a New Book
description: The title of Jessica Hoppers new book, The First Collection of Criticism by a Living Female Rock Critic, isnt perfectly accurate, she admits in a note at the front.

title: A Stadium With a Bloody Past
description: The stadium, used as a prison camp after the 1973 military coup that overthrew Chiles Marxist president, is the site of six games in the Copa Amrica, including the final on July 4.

title: Rand Paul to Detail Flat Tax Plan
description: Senator Rand Paul will reveal his plan to overhaul the tax code on Thursday. Expect Steve Forbes to be pleased.

title: Rand Paul to Detail Flat Tax Plan
description: Senator Rand Paul will reveal his plan to overhaul the tax code on Thursday. Expect Steve Forbes to be pleased.

title: Review: Polish National Ballet Shows Its European Side at the Joyce Theater
description: The company now known as the Polish National Ballet has an august history, tracing its origins to 1785. Its fortunes, like those of Poland, darkened greatly during and after World War II, but in recent years, as the country has become a member of the European Union, the ballet troupe has worked to rejoin, and catch up with, the rest of Europe.

title: In Chiles National Stadium, Dark Past Shadows Copa Amrica Matches
description: SANTIAGO, Chile  A haunting yellowish glow radiates from the tiny section of empty wooden benches and crumbling concrete behind the north goal at Estadio Nacional. All around this space there is noise: 47,000 soccer fans screaming and jumping in delight as Chiles national team plays Ecuador in the opening game of the Copa Amrica.

title: Review: Catastrophe, on Amazon Prime, Shares a Special Comedy Relationship
description: Catastrophe, a bittersweet British television comedy making its American debut on Amazon Prime, is the product of an unlikely artistic union. One of its creators, Sharon Horgan, is a veteran sitcom writer and star who could be fairly called the Tina Fey of British TV, in stature if not style. The other, Rob Delaney, is an American comedian best known for having more than a million Twitter followers; hes headlining a TV show for the first time.

title: Top Plaintiffin Health Subsidies Case Awaits Edict Unperturbed
description: FREDERICKSBURG, Va.  Millions of people are waiting anxiously for the Supreme Court to decide the fate of President Obamas health care law with a ruling this month on health insurance subsidies. But David M. King, a plaintiff in the case, is not among them.

title: Where Christianity Ends
description: Last week I wrote a post on Bruce/Caitlyn Jenner and American religion in which I channeled Harold Bloom (via Will Wilkinson)and talked a bit about the Americanization of Christianity: What it means, whether its irresistible, and at what point in the process we should stop talking about American faith in terms of Christian heresy (my preferred terminology) and start talking about a new religion altogether.

title: Power Struggle in Malaysia Pits Former Premier Against a Protg
description: PUTRAJAYA, Malaysia  Malaysias governing party is at war with itself, embroiled in a power struggle that is destabilizing the country and threatening the partys nearly six-decade stretch of uninterrupted governance.

title: Malaysian Ex-Prime Minister Unleashes Criticism
description: Mahathir Mohamad, who served as prime minister of Malaysia from 1981 to 2003, turns 90 next month. He is forcing his way back into the center of Malaysian politics with a fire hose of criticism for the man he helped install in office, Najib Razak, the current prime minister.

title: Rachel Dolezals Unintended Gift to America
description: In James Baldwins 1968 novel Tell Me How Long the Trains Been Gone, a child points to his light-skinned mothers relationships to offer a compelling case that she is indisputably black:

title: Is Hillary Clinton Running a Narrow Campaign? Not Really
description: Is Hillary Rodham Clinton running a campaign focused on secondary, base-ginning issues?

title: This Solstice, Skylight at Fulton Center Hub Will Get Its Day in the Sun
description: Druids, take note.

title: Minnesotas Holding of Sex Offenders After Prison Is Ruled Unconstitutional
description: CHICAGO  In a decision watched by officials in 20 states that hold some sex offenders after they complete prison sentences, a federal judge ruled this week that Minnesotas program for such offenders was unconstitutional.

title: Officials on Manhunt as It Nears 2 Weeks
description: The New York State Police and Clinton County officials said they had no hard evidence that two murderers who escaped from a maximum-security prison had left the area.

title: How to Take (the Right) Accessory Risks This Summer
description: These accessories pack a punch that can take a basic look to another level.

title: California Chromes Overseas Trip Hits a Detour
description: ASCOT, England  Although a minor injury forced the reigning American horse of the year, California Chrome, to miss his chance to race in the Group I Prince of Waless Stakes on Wednesday at Royal Ascot, his trainer, Art Sherman, and co-owner Steve Coburn arrived at the racecourse with required top hats in tow.

title: Utah University Adds Texting and Walking Lane to Its Stairs
description: Phone carriers and local emergency rooms rejoice. Students at Utah Valley University have a new perk: a texting and walking lane.

title: Utah University Adds Texting and Walking Lane to Its Stairs
description: Phone carriers and local emergency rooms rejoice. Students at Utah Valley University have a new perk: a texting and walking lane.

title: Pixars Inside Out Takes a Journey to the Center of the Mind
description: Pete Docter and Ralph Eggleston discuss scenes from the new Pixar film and the way they visualized the act of imagination.

title: Compelling Works From Some of Todays Most Innovative Artists and Designers
description: In creative industries where ancient techniques originally set the standards for greatness, more and more contemporary talents are embracing, instead, digital technology. And its the job of people like Jonathan Openshaw, the editor of LS:N Global, developed by the Future Laboratory to help explain market and consumer trends, to keep a finger on the pulse of innovation. In a new book, Postdigital Artisans ($39, Frame Publishers), Openshaw explores the otherworldly processes and sensational creations of artists like Daniel Arsham, fashion designers like Iris van Herpen and a host of other up-and-coming talents. In the above slideshow, he shares with T 10 of the tomes most compelling projects.

title: Compelling Works From Some of Todays Most Innovative Artists and Designers
description: In creative industries where ancient techniques originally set the standards for greatness, more and more contemporary talents are embracing, instead, digital technology. And its the job of people like Jonathan Openshaw, the editor of LS:N Global, developed by the Future Laboratory to help explain market and consumer trends, to keep a finger on the pulse of innovation. In a new book, Postdigital Artisans ($39, Frame Publishers), Openshaw explores the otherworldly processes and sensational creations of artists like Daniel Arsham, fashion designers like Iris van Herpen and a host of other up-and-coming talents. In the above slideshow, he shares with T 10 of the tomes most compelling projects.

title: Mickalene Thomass Adventures in Italy
description: Earlier this month, the artist Mickalene Thomas returned home to Brooklyn after a trip to Italy spanning 10 days and four cities, organized around her participation in a conference, Black Portraiture{s} II, put on by NYU in Florence. Since it was going to be my first time in Italy, and since the conference coincided with the Venice Biennale, it seemed like a great time for me to travel all over Italy and see what was happening in the art world in what, to a New Yorker, can feel like a different part of the universe, she says. There was all sorts of buzz around the Biennale, and I wanted to experience firsthand all of the things Id been hearing about Italy for years: the architecture, the food, the people, the energy, the language. I got a taste of all of that.

title: Mickalene Thomass Adventures in Italy
description: Earlier this month, the artist Mickalene Thomas returned home to Brooklyn after a trip to Italy spanning 10 days and four cities, organized around her participation in a conference, Black Portraiture{s} II, put on by NYU in Florence. Since it was going to be my first time in Italy, and since the conference coincided with the Venice Biennale, it seemed like a great time for me to travel all over Italy and see what was happening in the art world in what, to a New Yorker, can feel like a different part of the universe, she says. There was all sorts of buzz around the Biennale, and I wanted to experience firsthand all of the things Id been hearing about Italy for years: the architecture, the food, the people, the energy, the language. I got a taste of all of that.

title: Economy Not Ready for Rate Hike
description: Janet L. Yellen, Federal Reserve chairwoman, said the United States economy is on track to grow between 1.8 percent and 2.0 percent this year.

title: Britannia Rules the Chart Again as Muse Takes No. 1 Spot
description: Muse, the arena-filling British band, has topped the Billboard album chart for the first time with its seventh studio release, Drones (Helium-3/Warner Bros.), which sold 79,000 copies and 84,000 total album equivalent units, counting downloads and streams, according to Nielsen Music. The group had previously peaked at No. 2 with The 2nd Law in 2012.

title: Unused Embryos, to Donate, Destroy or Debate
description: Hundreds of thousands of frozen embryos  perhaps a million  sit in storage facilities nationwide, preserved in silver tanks of liquid nitrogen. Some belong to individuals and couples who are still trying to conceive, or are preserving the option. But most are leftovers from the successes of the booming assisted-reproduction industry. Families, clinics and the courts face difficult choices about what to do with those embryos  possible lives, without guarantee, unsustainable without aid, and ethically challenging, raising questions about the beginning of life and the definition of family.

title: Will A.I.G. Decision Affect the Next Bailout? Dont Bet on It
description: A judges tone and harsh words in his ruling this week related to the taxpayer bailout of the American International Group seems to have put the government on notice that its tactics in rescuing the insurer during the 2008 financial crisis were improper and illegal.

title: Review: Romeo and Juliet Brings a Precise Pairing to the Met
description: In Kenneth MacMillans enduring 1965 production of Romeo and Juliet, theres a spine-tingling moment in which the heroine sits on the edge of her bed stunned by her fate. She has married Romeo, who has killed her cousin Tybalt, and is engaged  against her will  to Paris, who repulses her a little more every time she sets eyes on him. With her feet propped on point and her shoulders limp, Hee Seo, portraying Juliet at American Ballet Theater on Monday, looked like an animal, both haunted and hunted.

title: Review: Tristan und Isolde Brings Thunder to the Longborough Festival
description: LONGBOROUGH, England  A king, Marke, damns the treachery of his adopted son. A knight, Tristan, fights his betrayer, impaling himself on his assailants sword. His young lover, Isolde, rushes toward him, hoping he has not yet died the death she knows will come. An orchestra seethes. The stage goes black.

title: Review: Theo Bleckmann Upends a Schumann Song Cycle
description: Its usually not a good sign if a singer starts sounding like Elvis during a performance of Schumanns Dichterliebe (A Poets Love). But then there was nothing predictable about Theo Bleckmanns whimsical interpretation of the song cycle on Tuesday at the Stone, where he is in residence this week.

title: Review: Washington Square Music Festival Features Joseph Anderer
description: Some foods  like smores  are meant to be consumed out of doors. Certain musical instruments, too, fare best in the open: bagpipes, for instance, and alphorns. This idea was brought home on Tuesday by the Washington Square Music Festivals endearingly awkward opening concert, which featured a rare performance of Leopold Mozarts Sinfonia Pastorella for alphorn and strings.

title: Things to Know About Embryo Donation
description: While reporting on the article about embryo donation, Tamar Lewin discovered widespread confusion about how the process works. Submit a question about embryo donation to lewin@nytimes.com. Some of the questions will be selected and answered here. Your name and comments may be published, but not your contact information.

title: Miley Cyrus Honored at amfAR Gala
description: The pop star is joined by Andy Cohen, Anderson Cooper, Mary J. Blige and others at annual Inspiration Gala in New York.

title: AmfAR Gala Honors Andy Cohen and Miley Cyrus
description: At amfARs Inspiration Gala on Tuesday night, the famous and not quite famous primped and posed in borrowed dresses as they arrived at Spring Studios in TriBeCa.

title: Claims of Syrian Chlorine Bombs Counter News of Progress on Chemical Arms
description: The monitoring group overseeing the destruction of Syrias chemical arms stockpile said Wednesday that almost all effluent from the neutralized weapons had been eliminated, portraying the progress as a great success in the nearly two years since Syria agreed to give up its arsenal.

title: Hillary Clinton Strikes Bipartisan Theme in South Carolina
description: NORTH CHARLESTON, S.C.  Days after seeking to energize her liberal base with a major rally on New Yorks Roosevelt Island, Hillary Rodham Clinton on Wednesday emphasized her role as a bipartisan problem solver.

title: Hillary Clinton Strikes Bipartisan Theme in South Carolina
description: NORTH CHARLESTON, S.C.  Days after seeking to energize her liberal base with a major rally on New Yorks Roosevelt Island, Hillary Rodham Clinton on Wednesday emphasized her role as a bipartisan problem solver.

title: Grace Wales Bonner, a New Designer Who Looks to African and Indian History
description: One test of the quality of a fashion show is what sticks. Theres a sensory-overload component in spending several weeks on the road, seeing clothes upon clothes every hour on the hour. And even for the most dedicated scrutinizers, much of it comes and then goes, struts and frets its hour upon the stage and then  well, out of the memory it flies. Most of it is there on Style.com if you need it after that.

title: U.S. Gets More Time to Consider Insider-Trading Appeal
description: Federal prosecutors have another month to decide whether to ask the United States Supreme Court to review a critical ruling in an insider trading case involving two former hedge fund traders.

title: Spotify Taps Barry McCarthy, Former Netflix Executive, as New C.F.O.
description: The music streaming service Spotify announced on Wednesday that it had named Barry McCarthy, a former Netflix executive and a member of Spotifys board, its new chief financial officer.

title: The Girls of Summer
description: Young women are dressing for themselves.

title: Women Who Cover Up (Even as the Temperatures Climb)
description: On a recent Sunday afternoon, Kelsey Lenoch, 21, a student and fashion intern, was walking along Metropolitan Avenue in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, in a black velvet scoop-neck crop top from American Apparel beneath fitted woven-cotton, light-blue overalls. On her feet were black ruffled socks and platform wedge sandals by Free People. It was about 81 degrees.

title: Hockey Player Turned Williamsburg Innkeeper
description: AGE 34

title: Apple Music Streaming Service Terms Dismay Indie Record Companies
description: Apples new streaming music service will not arrive until June 30, but the company has already upset independent record companies because of its proposed licensing terms.

title: First Draft Focus: And Now, a Message From the Justice Department
First Draft Focus: And Now, a Message From the Justice Department
Silent Discos Let You Dance to Your Own Beat
description: Just after sunset on a recent Friday night, what looked like a silent flash mob or a mass game of charades was taking place in a cordoned-off cobblestone square in the South Street Seaport: some 300 people dancing wildly, sans music. Or so it seemed.

title: Review: Devices Adapted to the Outdoor Life
description: Whether you are hiking a mountain trail, camping in a dense forest or just hanging out in your backyard, your devices need to be rugged enough to withstand the elements, as well as accidental drops. Here are a few noteworthy items to keep in mind for your next outdoor adventure.

title: Acadmie Franaise Honor Highlights Fluid National Allegiances Among Writers
description: PARIS  When the Acadmie Franaise, the most august literary institution in France, inducted Dany Laferrire last month, it insisted that that Haitian-Qubcois novelist was the first non-French citizen to enter its ranks. It turns out that is not quite the case. The Acadmie later acknowledged that a handful of others  including the Belgian-born Marguerite Yourcenar, the French-born American writer Julien Green and the Algerian-born novelist Assia Djebar  had never taken French nationality, although they had been entitled to it.

title: Pictures of the Day: Syria and Elsewhere
description: Syria and More  Pictures of the Day

title: June 17, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Syria, Indonesia, China and the United States.

title: June 17, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Syria, Indonesia, China and the United States.

title: Star Search
description: Over the past 25 years, a parade of household names and stand-up sensations have had early breakthroughs on Comedy Central.

title: App Smart | Put the Apple Watch to Work
description: Many of the 3,500 available apps showcase the capabilities of the Apple Watch. Here are just a few that show off what our wearable tech can do.

title: Video Feature: Apple Watch Apps That Are Available Now
description: AT its recent annual developer conference, Apple made a move to jump-start the production of apps for the Apple Watch by announcing a software tool kit that will enable developers to create more advanced programs for the new device.

title: Does It Really Matter Exactly When the Fed Raises Rates?
description: If theres one message that Janet Yellen, Federal Reserve chairwoman, tried to hammer home in her news conference on Wednesday, it is this: Dont make so much effort to discern the precise timing of the Feds decision to raise interest rates, which 15 of 17 Fed officials think is likely to be warranted by the end of this year.

title: Shopping Events and Sales This Week in New York
description: On Thursday, the Seaport District is opening Seaport Studios, a two-level retail destination that will showcase a rotating cast of top emerging designers. The first wave will include Baja East, which has a cashmere ikat graffiti throw ($1,595), and Jennifer Fisher, with a large double-knot cuff ($435). Timo Weiland, Mykita and Solid & Striped are on deck for later in the summer. At 19 Fulton Street.

title: Films of Jon Moritsugu, Upending Stereotypes With a Wig and a Sneer
description: When the ABC sitcom Fresh Off the Boat was being hailed this winter as a breakthrough in the presentation of Asian-Americans on screen, one constant reference point was All-American Girl, the 1994 series starring Margaret Cho.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Immigrants Lawsuit Over Post-9/11 Detention Is Revived
description: WASHINGTON  Saying that high-ranking Bush administration officials may have taken part in grave constitutional violations after the Sept. 11 attacks, a federal appeals court in New York on Wednesday revived a long-running lawsuit brought by immigrants, most of them Muslim, who said they were subjected to beatings, humiliating searches and other abuses in a Brooklyn detention center.

title: Explaining China in Its Own (Varied) Terms
description: Over dinner at the Fuxuan Hotel in Shanghai, Zhang Weiwei explains why China under the Communist Party is certain to succeed, confounding the pessimistic predictions of Western naysayers.

title: Review: Killjoys on Syfy Has Bounty Hunters on Spaces Frontier
description: The Syfy channel might not be in many Emmy conversations, but in recent years it has served up satisfying show after satisfying show. On Friday it adds another, a cheeky series called Killjoys.

title: The Delusions of Rachel Dolezal
description: Rachel Dolezal, a woman with no known black heritage, has apparently, through an elaborate scheme of deception and denial, claimed for years to be a product of black heritage.

title: Praying on the Eve of Ramadan
description: Ahead of the start of the holy month of Ramadan, Muslim worshipers in Indonesia attended prayers.

title: Review: Tentacle 8 Ensnares a Security Analyst in a Maze of Secrets
description: Sprawling and intricate, John Chis labyrinthine conspiracy thriller Tentacle 8 is nothing if not ambitious (and in the wake of the Edward J. Snowden affair, somewhat timely). When Ray (Brett Rickaby), a National Security Agency analyst, is suspected of having a hand in a huge loss of data at the organization, he is thrown into a secret detention center and viciously beaten. A Pentagon consultant (Joshua Morrow) is determined to interrogate him, but before he can, Ray has escaped, aided by a nameless man in a town car. Ray learns of a covert group known as Tentacle 8, and soon he is on the run, determined to unearth information about it. His girlfriend, Tabitha (Amy Motta), a C.I.A. employee, may or may not be on his side.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: Good evening! Heres the latest.

title: Review: My Perfect Mind Softens Fear of the Fallible With the Stuff of Slapstick
description: Having a stroke is like going to a carnival in My Perfect Mind, a deceptively jolly account of a traumatic chapter in the life of the actor Edward Petherbridge that opened this week at 59E59 Theaters. Finger painting, cannonball tossing, wacky costumes, silly vaudeville sketches and a perilously sloped funhouse-style stage (with a trap door) are among the diversions on offer in this production, part of the Brits Off Broadway festival.

title: Review: Masaaki Suzuki Conducts Young Musicians in Bach
description: With four vocal soloists, two violin soloists, a guest conductor, a guest concertmaster and a full chorus deployed for just six numbers, it was an odd program, the kind that only a school or a festival could typically afford. Or in this case, two schools and two festivals.

title: Review: Confessions Abound in Ensemble Studio Theaters One-Act Marathon
description: Playwrights, appreciate your actors. Sometimes theyll save you from yourself. Thats especially true at Series C of Ensemble Studio Theaters Marathon of One-Act Plays, in which an exceptional team of performers shores up some of the weakest writing and makes the good plays even better.

title: Jeb Bushs Team Aims to Weaponize Its Fund-Raising Total
description: The super PAC supporting Jeb Bush, now walled off from the candidate because of campaign finance rules, hopes to weaponize its fund-raising total for the first six months of the year, the groups top strategist told donors on a conference call on Wednesday afternoon.

title: Jeb Bushs Team Aims to Weaponize Its Fund-Raising Total
description: The super PAC supporting Jeb Bush, now walled off from the candidate because of campaign finance rules, hopes to weaponize its fund-raising total for the first six months of the year, the groups top strategist told donors on a conference call on Wednesday afternoon.

title: Review: Mahler Chamber Orchestra Careens Across the Centuries at Aldeburgh
description: SNAPE, England  Most of Europes summer music festivals take place in settings fundamental to their character. Think of Verbier, perched high on a terrace in the Swiss Alps, exclusive and haughty. Or Salzburg, as over-righteous and over-visited by tourists as the Vienna Philharmonic that retreats there.

title: Review: A Midsummer Nights Dream Embraces Fun and Folly of a Classic
description: Poor Shakespeare, so often smothered by reverence when all his work wants to do is breathe. And breathe it does, deeply, in the breezy, joyously oxygenated A Midsummer Nights Dream, directed by Tamilla Woodard for Masterworks Theater Company.

title: Indias Earliest Photographers
description: Indias early embrace of photography is the theme of an exhibit that examines the countrys traditions of modern art.

title: Fitbit Prices I.P.O. at $20 a Share, Above Top of Its Range
description: When Fitbit begins trading on the New York Stock Exchange on Thursday, it will do so at a healthy valuation.

title: A French D.J. Went Down to Georgia
description: The biggest celebrities have seen Sebastien Perrin work, but they may not be able to tell you his name.

title: Senator Urges Inquiry Into Airline Behavior
description: Senator Richard Blumenthal asked the Justice Department on Wednesday to investigate whether airlines were engaging in anticompetitive behavior and colluding to limit capacity and drive up fares. In a letter to William J. Baer, the head of the departments antitrust division, the senator highlighted several comments that airline chief executives made at a recent industry gathering that suggested the carriers might be pursuing anticompetitive behavior. In his letter, Mr. Blumenthal quoted the presidents of Delta Air Lines, Air Canada and American Airlines, who all spoke of capacity discipline. The letter also noted that the airlines had become more concentrated after several mergers in recent years that were all approved by the Justice Department. Consumers are paying sky-high fares and are trapped inside an uncompetitive market with a history of collusive behavior, the senator said in his letter.

title: ISIS Claims Responsibility for Deadly Bombings in Yemen
description: SANA, Yemen  A branch of the Islamic State in Yemen claimed responsibility for a series of car bombings here in the capital that killed at least 30 people on Wednesday, adding a new layer of peril to a city terrorized for months by airstrikes as well as by antiaircraft fire that has fallen on civilian homes.

title: Airbnb Is Said to Seek $1 Billion More in Financing
description: Silicon Valleys elite start-ups have been on a fund-raising tear, and Airbnb has become the latest to try to add to its cash pile.

title: New York Lawmakers Reach Deal to Impose Stricter Rules on Nail Salons
description: Leaders in the New York Legislature reached an agreement on Wednesday on a law that would more strictly regulate the states thousands of nail shops, an expanding industry in which paying far less than minimum wage and operating without licenses is commonplace, the governors office said.

title: Orange Is the New Black Season 3, Episode 10 Recap: Unlucky Pennsatucky
description: Season 3, Episode 10

title: Orange Is the New Black Season 3, Episode 10 Recap: Unlucky Pennsatucky
description: Season 3, Episode 10

title: ABC Announcers Prematurely Crown the Golden State Warriors
description: With less than two minutes in Game 6 of the N.B.A. finals Tuesday night, ABCs announcers handed the title to the Golden State Warriors. While it was reasonable to assume that they would not fritter away a 13-point lead, it was premature to unreservedly say so. A lot can happen in a short time. And it did.

title: Amid Grief for Students, a Search for Answers After Balcony Collapse
description: LOS ANGELES  Across Ireland, flags flew at half-staff. At San Francisco International Airport, the families began arriving to retrieve the remains of their children, or visit the injured in the hospital. And in Berkeley  the city where the collapse of a balcony early Tuesday morning killed six students and injured seven more  building inspectors working into the night declared another balcony in the complex a hazard and ordered it removed.

title: Foreign Groups Fear China Oversight Plan
description: BEIJING  A remarkable assortment of foreign organizations set up shop in China in the decades after its emergence from isolation under Mao Zedong, offering good will, money and expertise that helped link the nation more closely to the rest of the world and turn it into the global powerhouse it is today.

title: No Charges Against Kansas Governor After Ethics Inquiry
description: A federal investigation into loans made to the re-election campaign of Gov. Sam Brownback by his lieutenant governor will not result in charges, the United States attorneys office in Kansas said on Wednesday.

title: Banks That Failed to Fix Mortgage Services Face Restrictions
description: JPMorgan Chase, Wells Fargo and four other large banks have failed to make long-promised improvements to their mortgage operations, a federal regulator said on Wednesday.

title: Rachel Moore to Leave Ballet Theater for Music Center in Los Angeles
description: Help Wanted: a new boss for a leading American ballet company.

title: When Will It End? Much Work Is Left as Albany Session Winds Down
description: ALBANY  It was to be the last day of the legislative session, so tensions on Wednesday were understandably high on the Senate floor. With so much to be done, things had come to a standstill over an unexpectedly provocative bill: naming the wood frog as the official state amphibian.

title: Dominican Republic Set to Deport Haitian Migrants
description: MEXICO CITY  On Monday, Yayine Mesilus was snatched off the streets of her small village in the Dominican Republic and taken back to Haiti, from where she had migrated eight years ago with her little brother to look for work.

title: Trade Bills Fate Rests on Whats Been Missing in Congress: Trust
description: WASHINGTON  The fate of President Obamas trade bill hinges on a complex brew of congressional relationships, procedural rigmarole and several leaps of faith across party lines.

title: Nelson Doubleday Jr., Publisher Who Owned the Mets, Dies at 81
description: Nelson Doubleday Jr., who shortly after taking over his familys publishing business used it in 1980 to buy the lowly New York Mets and put the team on course to win the World Series in 1986, died on Wednesday at his home in Locust Valley, N.Y. He was 81.

title: Drug Accelerated Growth in Children With Dwarfism, Pharmaceutical Firm Says
description: An experimental drug, vying to become the first approved treatment for dwarfism, improved growth in children by a significant amount in a preliminary study, the drugs developer, BioMarin Pharmaceutical, said on Wednesday.

title: Wednesday at the Womens World Cup
description: RESULTS

title: Brian Williams to Stay at NBC, but Not as News Anchor
description: NBC is planning to announce on Thursday that Brian Williams will not return to his position as the anchor of its Nightly News show, four months after the network suspended him for exaggerating his experiences during a helicopter attack in Iraq, according to two people briefed on the decision.

title: Rachel DolezalTold to Quit 2nd Post
description: SPOKANE, Wash.  Rachel A. Dolezal, the former N.A.A.C.P. president here who has been under fire for falsely identifying herself as a black woman, emerged at the center of a separate controversy Wednesday when the mayor of Spokane, David A. Condon, called for her and two others to resign from the citys Office of the Police Ombudsman commission.

title: Womans Portrait Will Appear on the $10 Bill
description: WASHINGTON  Growing numbers of Americans are going cashless, but demands to finally put a woman on paper currency persist. And now the Treasury has announced that a portrait of a woman, to be determined soon, will grace the $10 bill.

title: Plan to Train Iraqi Soldiers Is Hampered by Lack of Recruits, Defense Chief Says
description: The United States has fallen behind its goal of training 24,000 members of Iraqi security forces by this fall because the Iraqi government has not provided enough troops to train, Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter said Wednesday. Mr. Carter told the House Armed Services Committee that the United States military had trained only 9,000 Iraqis so far. Our training efforts in Iraq have thus far been slowed by a lack of trainees, Mr. Carter said. We simply havent received enough recruits. Last week the White House said the United States was adding another training site in Iraq, near Ramadi, where some 450 American troops would train Iraqi fighters, particularly Sunni tribesmen, in the war against the Islamic State group. Defense officials said the effort to train Syrian fighters to take on the militant group on the Syrian side of the border was also going slowly.

title: Case of World Trade Center Parachutists Goes to Jury
description: As sky divers and parachute jumpers, James Brady, Marko Markovich and Andrew Rossig have exposed themselves for years to potential peril.

title: Kosovo: Slovenia Detains Ex-Premier
description: Former Prime Minister Ramush Haradinaj of Kosovo was detained in a surprise move on Wednesday at an airport in Slovenia, where the police said they had acted on a warrant from Serbia. War crimes investigators in Serbia want to hold him accountable for the killings of Serbs while he was a commander of Western-backed insurgents in the late 1990s. In 2004 he was indicted on war crimes charges by the United Nations tribunal for Yugoslavia. But he was acquitted after two trials that were hampered by witness intimidation. Mr. Haradinaj now leads a political party in Kosovo, where many see him as a war hero. He said his arrest was evidently a mess-up, because for several years he had traveled widely without problem.

title: First Horizontal Piece Is Placed Along the New Tappan Zee Bridge
description: By definition, a bridge does not become a bridge until it has a horizontal span that leaps over water or land. On Wednesday, after months in which dozens of verticals  piles, piers and columns  have gradually been poking out of the Hudson River, the replacement for the aging Tappan Zee received its first horizontal structure and finally became a bridge.

title: Michigan: Largest County Seeks Emergency Status
description: The Wayne County executive, Warren C. Evans, is asking the state to declare a financial emergency to help shore up the struggling fiscal picture for the county, the states most populous. Mr. Evans described deficits over a matter of years in the countys general fund and an underfunded pension system as among the chief problems. If state officials agree to designate the county in an emergency, several outcomes are possible, including the installation of an emergency manager. Detroit, which is in Wayne County, was determined to be in a financial emergency before it sought federal bankruptcy protection, which it emerged from last year.

title: Roosters or Not Roosters
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Its Thursday, so be on the lookout for trickery.

title: Review: Gloria, at the Vineyard Theater, Looks at a Toxic Workplace
description: Anyone whos ever worked for a big Manhattan magazine will find much to savor and shudder over in Gloria, Branden Jacobs-Jenkinss whip-smart satire of fear and loathing in a beleaguered industry under siege, which opened on Wednesday night at the Vineyard Theater.

description: Detectives were searching on Wednesday for a 25-year-old man in connection with a series of attacks on Asian women in Manhattan over the last week.

description: A New York City schools administrator has been charged with endangering and sexually touching a 14-year-old boy at his home in Manhattan, the police said.
