description: TEL AVIV  A Palestinian man shot two Israeli men in a vehicle as they were leaving a spring near a Jewish settlement in the occupied West Bank on Friday, killing one and wounding another, Israels military said in a statement.

title: Jason Schwartzman Shares a Few of His Many  and We Mean Many  Inspirations
description: When Jason Schwartzman begins the conversation by announcing, Im a big fan of recommendations and lists, it turns out that the 25 things he has chosen to discuss are only a tiny fraction of the potential recommendations hes generated. (We whittled it down to 15.) Perhaps that shouldnt be a surprise, coming from a musician and actor who has formed a longstanding cinematic collaboration with noted obsessive Wes Anderson. Schwartzmans recommendations, in turn, serve as jumping-off points for more general discussions about social networks (the real-life ones, not websites and apps), aesthetic influences and finding lifelong friends through shared cultural interests. My idea of fun is browsing, he admits. To that end, he has cultivated an extensive network of recommenders; it is pretty rare to hear an actor mention that hes become friends with a film critic.

title: $15.5 Million, aRecord for Brooklyn Real Estate
description: An enormous brick townhouse in Cobble Hill, Brooklyn, suitable as both home and studio with its voluminous rooms, soaring ceilings and built-in four-car garage, sold to the photographer Jay Maisel for $15.5 million, according to city records, breaking the record for the highest price ever paid for a single residence in the borough.

title: James Gaffigan Signs Up for More as Conductor of Lucerne Symphony
description: The rising young American maestro James Gaffigan has extended his contract as chief conductor of the Lucerne Symphony Orchestra until 2022, the orchestra announced Friday.

title: James Gaffigan Signs Up for More as Conductor of Lucerne Symphony
description: The rising young American maestro James Gaffigan has extended his contract as chief conductor of the Lucerne Symphony Orchestra until 2022, the orchestra announced Friday.

title: Bookshelf: Sweet Tooth
description: New picture books include Jampires by Sarah McIntyre and David O'Connell, and Rude Cakes by Rowboat Watkins.

title: Bloombergs Gun-Control Group Funds News Site After Shooting
description: Michael R. Bloombergs gun-control group has started financing its own news website, only days after a shooting at a historic back church in South Carolina left nine people dead.

title: Bloombergs Gun-Control Group Funds News Site After Shooting
description: Michael R. Bloombergs gun-control group has started financing its own news website, only days after a shooting at a historic back church in South Carolina left nine people dead.

title: For a Teacher, Back-to-Back Marathons, Then Fourth-Graders
description: The seventh time she ran the Boston Marathon, Keila Merino woke up early before the race and joined a few other runners at 5 a.m. at the finish line on Boylston Street. The group hooked a right on Hereford, a left on Commonwealth, and continued for the next 25-plus miles, finishing at the starting line.

title: In Bed-Stuy Housing Market, Profit and Preservation Battle
description: On many days when the weather is accommodating, William Scarbrough stands outside the dry cleaner where he works, on the corner of Stuyvesant Avenue and Halsey Street in Brooklyn, observing the pedestrian traffic that distinguishes Bedford-Stuyvesant as perhaps the citys most frenetic real-estate frontier. A tall and slender man of 60, he has lived several blocks from the cleaners for close to a year now, during which he has watched investors and developers canvass the streets looking for properties from which they might extract significant profits.

title: Barbecue Without the Frills, by the Banks of the Gowanus
description: Its a little bit Venice, a little bit Superfund cleanup site. The partners behind Pig Beach NYC earlier this month expanded the options for canalside dining in Brooklyn  in this case, to the banks of the (vastly improved) Gowanus Canal. Started by four veterans of national barbecue competitions and high-end Manhattan restaurants (Del Posto, Balthazar, Eds Lobster Bar), Pig Beach is a no-frills pop-up outdoor barbecue restaurant that runs from now until Halloween.

title: Rand Paul Names Hedge Fund Chief Mark Spitznagel as Economic Adviser
description: Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky has appointed Mark Spitznagel, the hedge fund manager, as a senior economic adviser as he seeks the Republican presidential nomination.

title: Door Opens Slightly to Cuba, but Businesses Face Difficulty Getting In
description: MIAMI  Six months after President Obama cracked open a more than five-decade Cold War stalemate with Cuba, American money, travelers and business executives are streaming onto the island and a United States flag is poised to fly over the de facto embassy in Havana any week now.

title: Hillary Clintons Hamptons Quandary
description: For the past several summers, Bill and Hillary Clinton have done what New York Citys moneyed residents have done for decades: They spent their vacation amid the prime beachside real estate of Long Island.

title: A Shared Life, in Space and on Earth
description: The bride and groom, both astronomers, first connected as graduate students spending an evening in an observatory.

title: Brazil Arrests Head ofOdebrecht in Petrobras Scandal
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  Brazilian police on Friday arrested one of the countrys richest men, Marcelo Odebrecht, as the fallout broadens in an investigation into corruption at the state-run oil giant Petrobras.

title: Beyond Mourning for Charleston
description: The horrific church shooting in Charleston, S.C., leaves the nation at an all too familiar juncture  uncertain whether to do something positive to repair societys vulnerabilities or to once again absorb an intolerable wound by going through what has become a woeful ritual of deep grief followed by shallow resolve to move on toward  what? Toward the inevitable carnage next time.

title: Hillary Clinton Says No to Granting Fast Track Authority on Trade Deal
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton said she would probably not vote for fast-track authority for the trade deal that President Obama is seeking, but she acknowledged that she once said positive things about the potential for the Trans-Pacific Partnership agreement.

title: Hillary Clinton Says No to Granting Fast Track Authority on Trade Deal
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton said she would probably not vote for fast-track authority for the trade deal that President Obama is seeking, but she acknowledged that she once said positive things about the potential for the Trans-Pacific Partnership agreement.

title: Yemen Mediator Optimistic as Humanitarian Crisis Worsens
description: UNITED NATIONS  In Yemen, hospitals are reeling from a stream of war-wounded. A million people have fled their homes. Hunger is rising so steeply that hospital admissions for malnutrition have more than doubled, while aid agencies say a de facto blockade has made it difficult to get food and fuel into the country, the poorest in the Arab world.

title: A Marriage Made in the Heavens
description: You could have excused Kate Grier and Thomas Beatty for having their heads in the stars the first evening they spent together back in March 2010.

title: A Show Finds Humor in Gazas Headlines. Will Hamas Get It?
description: GAZA CITY  Men and women stood with suitcases at the port, waiting for a boat. Suspicious, Tarek, a 13-year-old tea seller, wandered over and asked, Are they really leaving? He had never seen anyone leave Gaza before, he explained.

title: A Street Nun Who Specializes in Redemption
description: They call me the street nun, said Ana Martinez de Luco, 60, a Catholic nun who does not wear a habit or robes, but rather a green apron and sandals and can be found in the thick of the action in the shantytown that is Sure We Can, a bustling can and bottle redemption center in a lot on McKibbin Street in East Williamsburg, Brooklyn.

title: Norwegian Women Confess (Facetiously): Were Terrible.
description: Norway was one of the surprises of the group stage of the Womens World Cup, with two wins and a 1-1 tie with the tournament favorite, Germany. But doubts about the team  and womens soccer in general  remain, so the players have taken them on with an unexpected weapon: sarcasm.

title: DAngelo and Bobby Seale on the Past and Future of Political Protest
description: OAKLAND, CALIF.  In early June, before the shootings in Charleston, S.C., the R&B singer DAngelo stood beneath the blood-red awning of the Its All Good Bakery here, peering into the window of the building that served as the first office for the Black Panther Party. At another stop, beneath a street lamp on Seventh Avenue, he stood where the group carried out its first observation of law enforcement.

title: Professor Panther
description: Bobby Seale co-founded the Black Panther Party. The R&B star DAngelo speaks out on racial injustice in his new album. The two met in Oakland, Calif.

title: On the Market in New York City
description: This weeks properties include condos in East Harlem and Bedford-Stuyvesant, and a co-op on the Upper East Side.

title: Homes for Sale in Brooklyn and Manhattan
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in New York City:

title: Victims Families Address Dylann Roof
description: Family members of those killed Wednesday at Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in Charleston, S.C., addressed the shooting suspect, Dylann Roof, in court.

title: Starvation Timetable in a Pandemic
description: Starvation is a real threat during an extended pandemic, but it is very hard to predict when and where it will start, researchers report in an unusual new study.

title: Orange is the New Black Season 3 Finale Recap: Wash Away the Sins
description: Season 3, Episode 13

title: Orange is the New Black Season 3 Finale Recap: Wash Away the Sins
description: Season 3, Episode 13

title: Love and Roller Coasters
description: Lisa Guerrera and Rich OFlanagan both speak the language of roller coasters, an inside joke that brings sweet memories of their romances earliest beginnings.

title: Does Greece Need More Austerity?
description: As many of us have noted, its hugely unfair when people claim that Greece has done nothing to adjust. On the contrary, it has imposed incredibly harsh austerity and substantial reforms on other fronts. Yet you might be tempted to argue that the results show that Greece hasnt done enough  after all, last year it was running only a tiny primary budget surplus (that is, not counting interest), and this year it has slipped back into primary deficit. So more adjustment is needed, right?

title: Does Greece Need More Austerity?
description: As many of us have noted, its hugely unfair when people claim that Greece has done nothing to adjust. On the contrary, it has imposed incredibly harsh austerity and substantial reforms on other fronts. title: Heartfelt Donations Replace Wedding Party Favors
description: If charity starts at home, and forming a home often starts with a wedding, why not turn the wedding into an event to raise money for charity?

title: Spiritual Healing and Arts Festival in the Berkshires
description: The inaugural MassBliss Arts and Awareness Experience, running July 10 to 12 in the Berkshires in Massachusetts, bills itself as a spiritual healing and arts festival. Peace Poets, a spoken-word hip-hop group, and the Bread and Puppet Theater will be on stage, and there will be a class on Ethiopian music, and one for those interested in extending their voice range.

title: On the Market in the New York Region
description: This weeks properties are five-bedroom homes in White Plains, N.Y., and New Milford, N.J.

title: China by Bike and Kayak
description: A new tour from Adventure Life allows travelers to explore China on foot, by bicycle and via kayak. On the Great Wall, Dynasties and Rivers trip, guests will hike the Jinshanling section of the Great Wall and through villages in the rice terraces of Longsheng; bike through Beijing hutongs, along Xians ancient city wall and by the Li River; and kayak on the Yulong River. The itinerary includes the Forbidden City and Summer Palace in Beijing, the Terracotta Warriors in Xian and Pingan Village, inhabited by the Zhuang ethnic group.

title: Homes for Sale in New York and New Jersey
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in the New York City Region:

title: Steeped in Racial History, Charleston Ponders Its Future
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  The force of racial conflict shaped this citys commerce, inspired a slave revolt and sparked the gunshots that started the Civil War. And this week, on a balmy Wednesday evening, it claimed the lives of nine black churchgoers who had gathered to study the Bible.

title: The Politicization of CBO Begins
description: Update: Richard Kogan has contacted me to say that while the claim of a worsening budget situation is made at the beginning of the report, the analysis that follows is in fact clean and careful. So were talking about a misleading statement rather than a misleading analysis. And sources close to CBO insist that the misleading statement was careless drafting rather than deliberate politicization. OK, I guess.

title: A Clubhouse for Cricket
description: Singhs Sporting Goods caters to New Yorks cricket community, offering an extensive collection of equipment and trophies.

title: Singhs Sporting Goods, for Crickets Serious Bowlers and Wicketkeepers
description: The pace at Singhs Sporting Goods is as languid as a cricket match  some of which can last for five days. A customer might try 30 bats before deciding to think it over and return the following day. Another might wander in, take a seat and watch a game from New Zealand on the shops TV.

title: Summer Culture Guide
description: Recommendations from The Times arts team.

title: Clint Dempsey Suspended Three Games for Conduct Toward Referee
description: Seattle Sounders forward Clint Dempsey was suspended for three games and fined by Major League Soccer on Friday for what league disciplinary officials determined was his abuse of a referee in a United States Open Cup match this week.

title: Opposing Viewpoints on Charleston and Guns
description: Gun-control supporters and critics are actively debating gun laws in the wake of the Charleston church shooting.

title: Grant Park Prepares for Taste of Chicago 2015
description: Chicago has been a culinary mecca for quite some time, so its only natural that the Taste of Chicago (referred to locally as the Taste) plays a major role in the citys summer psyche. Now in its 35th year, the festival will be held from July 8 to 12 in Grant Park, centrally located between the downtown Loop and Lake Michigan. (Theres a preview day on June 24 in Daley Plaza across from Chicago City Hall.)

title: An Angry Martin OMalley Calls for an Assault Weapons Ban
description: Using an off-color word to describe his anger, Martin OMalley, a Democratic candidate for president, called for a new national assault weapons ban and other gun control measures in an email sent to supporters after the shooting deaths at a South Carolina church this week.

title: An Angry Martin OMalley Calls for an Assault Weapons Ban
description: Using an off-color word to describe his anger, Martin OMalley, a Democratic candidate for president, called for a new national assault weapons ban and other gun control measures in an email sent to supporters after the shooting deaths at a South Carolina church this week.

title: Two Centuries of Taylor Swift
description: I did an interview with Billboard on the economics of music; Im not a real expert here, I just played one at SXSW, but I had some fun (and it is something I care about!)

description: How many galaxies are there in the observable universe? How many cells are there in the human body?

title: Marc Maron Discusses His Podcast Interview With President Obama
description: In the nearly six years that Marc Maron has hosted his popular podcast, WTF With Marc Maron, this idiosyncratic, inquisitive and self-deprecating comedian has interviewed hundreds of celebrated stand-ups and entertainers, including Louis C.K., Bob Newhart, Lena Dunham and Amy Poehler.

title: The Roller Coaster Couple
description: They trotted up the ramp to the Cyclone, that grumpy old rattler of a roller coaster in Coney Island, Brooklyn, a young man and a young woman who would spend the day never more than a few inches apart.

title: Watch: Victims Families Address Dylann Roof, Charleston Shooting Suspect
description: Relatives of churchgoers killed in a shooting in Charleston, S.C., appeared in court on Friday to confront Dylann Storm Roof, the suspect, with emotional tributes to their loved ones.

title: June 19, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Indonesia, Britain, India and the United States.

title: June 19, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Indonesia, Britain, India and the United States.

title: Financial Control Board Should Take Over Debt-Laden Puerto Rico, Lawmaker Says
description: In one of the strongest bids yet for federal intervention into Puerto Ricos fiscal woes, a member of Congress is calling for a control board to take over the islands beleaguered government.

title: Review: Ballers, on HBO, Follows a Financial Guru to the Sports Stars
description: Given the place sports occupy in our culture, youd think they would be right up there with doctoring and policing as fodder for television dramas and comedies. But Arli$$ and Friday Night Lights notwithstanding, the number of scripted shows about athletics has always been relatively small. Ballers, a plodding football series that begins Sunday on HBO, suggests why.

title: Review: Poldark on PBSs Masterpiece
description: Sweeping, stirring, rousing, lush. These are the sorts of adjectives suggested by Poldark, the 18th-century potboiler that begins Sunday on PBSs Masterpiece. Its the kind of show in which every plot twist appears to require a shot of someone pounding on horseback along the Cornish coast, close to the cliffs and outlined against the sun.

title: A Train Links Fashion Capitals, but Divides Passengers
description: FLORENCE, ITALY  The red carpet was rolled out. This is not a metaphor.

title: Google to Remove Revenge Porn Images From Search Results
description: There are few types of information that Google isnt busy organizing for its users. But on Friday, it said it would add another: so-called revenge porn.

title: Google to Remove Revenge Porn Images From Search Results
description: There are few types of information that Google isnt busy organizing for its users. But on Friday, it said it would add another: so-called revenge porn.

title: Charleston Mayor Announces Vigil
description: Mayor Joseph P. Riley Jr. of Charleston, S.C., announced a prayer vigil on Friday to honor the victims of Wednesdays church shooting.

title: Raw Video of Victims Families in Court
description: In this raw and unedited video, relatives of those killed in the church shooting Wednesday in Charleston, S.C., spoke at the bond hearing for the suspect, Dylann Roof.

title: Review: Ann Hampton Callaway Hits Redial in On My Way to You
description: A self-proclaimed hopeless romantic surrounded by material girls: Thats how the singer Ann Hampton Callaway described her younger self on Thursday evening at 54 Below, where she opened her new show, On My Way to You. That younger self was a demure piano bar entertainer whose rich, extravagantly gorgeous voice hovered on the brink of tears as she poured her heart out in classic ballads and lachrymose original songs.

title: Afghan Parliaments Term Is Extended After Squabbles Delay Elections
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  With Afghanistans fractious coalition government already struggling, a new deadline looms that could further hurt its credibility: The Afghan Parliaments term is set to expire on Sunday, with no elections scheduled and no agreement on how to hold them.

title: Nina Simones Time Is Now, Again
description: The feminist writer Germaine Greer once declared: Every generation has to discover Nina Simone. She is evidence that female genius is real. This year, that just might happen for good.

title: A Thirty-Year American Road Trip
description: David Graham has made his life work taking witty, empathetic images of America that are layered with meaning.

title: Rise of Far-Right Party in Denmark Reflects Europes Unease
description: LONDON  The surprisingly strong showing in elections on Thursday of Denmarks anti-immigration, anti-Brussels Danish Peoples Party has underlined a growing crisis of confidence in traditional political institutions and in the European Union itself.

title: European Regulators Lay Out Demands and Fines in Google Antitrust Case
description: LONDON  Europes antitrust authorities have threatened to impose significant fines on Googles operations on the Continent if the company does not give rivals greater prominence in some search results across the 28-member bloc.

title: The Week in Political Pictures
description: A White House picnic, two more names enter the 2016 race, and tragedy in Charleston, S.C.

title: First Draft Focus: The Week in Political Pictures
A Trendy Hybrid
description: A store in Los Angeles blurs fashion boutique, bookstore and gallery.

title: Book Review Podcast: When I Grow Up
description: This week, The New York Times Book Review features reviews of new books about childhood, parenting and the shifting definition of adulthood. A. O. Scott reviews Susan Neimans Why Grow Up?; Heather Havrilesky writes about How to Raise an Adult, by Julie Lythcott-Haims; and Meghan Daum assesses The Prime of Life, by Steven Mintz. Ms. Daum writes:

title: Finding It Hip to Be Square
description: From a forthcoming collection of iPhone images by Robert Herman, The Phone Book.

title: Robert Herman Squares New Photos With Past Work, Using an iPhone App
description: For decades, Robert Herman shot street photography mainly in New York and primarily on Kodachrome film. Mr. Herman was born in Brooklyn and raised on Long Island and began shooting on the city streets in the late 1970s while working as a set photographer. Theres a lot of time between takes, so I started taking photos in the neighborhoods where we were shooting, he said.

title: N.R.A. Board Member Deletes Criticism of Victim in Church Massacre
description: Faced with an online backlash, a member of the National Rifle Associations board deleted comments Friday criticizing the Rev. Clementa C. Pinckney, a South Carolina lawmaker who was one of the nine people shot and killed  in the attack on his church in Charleston on Wednesday night.

title: India and the Politics of Yoga
description: BALTIMORE  ATTENTION, downward-facing-dog enthusiasts. The International Day of Yoga is coming on Sunday. A brainchild of Narendra Modi, the Indian prime minister, it is being backed by more than 175 countries and heavily promoted worldwide. Last week, the Indian Embassy in Washington emailed me an invitation to celebrate on the National Mall, complete with a downloadable yoga protocol of exercises. Even Ban Ki-moon, the United Nations secretary general, has been seen, shoeless, practicing his tree pose in Delhi.

title: A Stylishly Secretive Store for Design-Obsessed Men in Los Angeles
description: Los Angeles  For much of the last year, the design-obsessed made their way to downtown, where they entered a 1920s-era Beaux-Arts building and rode the elevator to the 12th floor. There, a door sign read, confoundingly, Please Do Not Enter, but that is, in fact, the name of the store.

title: Chambers Bay Has Even Leaders Scratching Their Heads
description: UNIVERSITY PLACE, Wash.  Standing in the fairway, Jordan Spieth was on his way to a double bogey on the 18thhole, and he knew it. He had little interest in taking all the blame for that failing.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Ridin With Biden in 2016, but So Far the Vice Presidents Not Aboard
description: CHICAGO  On the whiteboard at campaign headquarters in a spartan downtown office are listed the days tasks. No. 1: Send out bumper stickers.

title: An App Offers Up-to-Date Schedules for Bus and Train Lines
description: If youre lucky, youre reading this somewhere other than Manhattan. For all that its been celebrated in song, summer in the city is often a miserable affair. (The lyrics of that Lovin Spoonful hit are worth a second listen.) Best to get away, and any app that can help you do that as quickly as Wanderu is worth the space it takes up on your home screen.

title: Finding Lessons in a Past Escape as Another Manhunt Presses On
description: The inmate escaped, and he ran hard.

title: White Terrorism Is as Old as America
description: My grandmother used to speak of Klansmen riding through Louisiana at night, how she could see their white robes shimmering in the dark, how black people hid in bayous to escape them. Before her time, during Reconstruction, Ku Klux Klan members believed they could scare superstitious black people out of their newly won freedom. They wore terrifying costumes but were not exactly hiding  many former slaves recognized bosses and neighbors under their white sheets. They were haunting in masks, a seen yet unseen terror. In addition to killing and beating black people, they often claimed to be the ghosts of dead Confederate soldiers.

title: Crushing Ivory to Save Elephants
description: The global ivory trade is responsible for the slaughter of as many as 35,000 African elephants annually.

title: Summer Lovin Takes New York
description: Whats this? Summer Love? In Metro space, where readers are more accustomed to reading about murder, prisons, misdeeds and the power struggle between the governor and the mayor?

title: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres the latest.

title: Bill Cunningham | Bountiful Bow Ties
description: Men have a new knot: the bow tie, which has been spotted at polo matches, at the Belmont Stakes, at picnics and at dance events.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Review: New York Theater Ballet Is at Home in St. Marks Church, Part of Danspace Project
description: Its been almost a year since New York Theater Ballet moved downtown to St. Marks Church, from its former headquarters in Murray Hill. Its current season, Legends & Visionaries 2015, part of Danspace Projects Dance: Access series, is its first in the church sanctuary. On Thursday, the troupe seemed right at home amid the pillars and stained glass windows, looking radiant and grounded despite the past years upheaval. The move felt complete.

title: In the Wake: Japanese Photographers Respond to 3/11
description: Art photographs at the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, focus on the aftermath of a disaster in Japan.

title: Evening Hours | Summertime Sweetness
description: Threats of rain did not slow the partying.

title: Bill Cunningham |Bountiful Bow Ties
description: For generations, men have tried to get rid of the necktie noose around their necks. They havent succeeded. Now they have a new knot: the bow tie, which has been spotted at polo matches, at the Belmont Stakes, at picnics and at dance events. Along with the bow tie have come straw hats and suspenders. The trousers worn with these can be long or Bermuda length. Its whats on top that defines a new generations dress code for todays casual weekend events. It stands in stark contrast to a few years ago, when men were flinging themselves into wrinkled shirts and cut-off jeans.

title: Turning to a Ghostwriter for a Personal Toast
description: When Tom Ruggiero was asked to offer a toast at the wedding of his friends Jessie and Ben last year, he panicked. A 32-year-old real estate lawyer in New York, Mr. Ruggiero was not accustomed to public speaking.

title: Review: Japanese Photographers Reflect on the Fukushima Catastrophe
description: BOSTON  Whats the purpose, whats the effect of creating art photographs about natural disasters after they happen? News photographs will have already stirred up horror; will this be more of the same? The curators of In the Wake: Japanese Photographers Respond to 3/11 at the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, pose those questions and more in this provocative exhibition by 17 photographers who reacted to the earthquake, tsunami and breach of the Fukushima nuclear plant in northeastern Japan on March 11, 2011, after the news-media coverage.

title: Max Robinson, a Largely Forgotten Trailblazer for Black Anchors
description: When NBC announced on Thursday that Lester Holt would replace the beleaguered Brian Williams as anchor of NBC Nightly News, it was widely applauded.

title: Review: Bill T. Jones/Arnie Zane Summons a Life During Wartime
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J.  At the start of World War II, Dora Amelan, a Jewish girl of 19, was living in Belgium. At the end of the war, she was still alive, though much of her family was not. The story of her survival is, in her telling, a story of luck but also of choices. That she spent much of the war in France helping others in internment camps and saving children did not save her from the kind of moral dilemmas that remain insoluble through a lifetime of remembering.

title: He Hosts Miley and Rihanna, and Now Hes Getting a Taste of Their Fame
description: Miley Cyrus posed with Sean Combs. Kendall Jenner hung out with Justin Bieber. Vanessa Hudgens chatted with Selena Gomez. John Legend and Chrissy Teigen held court in one corner, while Madonna danced in another.

title: Review: New York Philharmonic Goes Timeless in Central Park
description: Two factors conspired against pleasantness at Wednesday evenings New York Philharmonic concert, the start of the orchestras 50th season of programs in city parks: the weather and the music.

title: Ceramic Skyline, on the Move
description: For the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, last years 110th anniversary of brave New Yorkers first commute underground was cause for celebration, but for the New York Transit Museum, it also began a time of transition. The institution, just off Borough Hall, is moving its archives out of a Lower Manhattan storage space into a larger, 14,380-foot behemoth of a bunker in the Sunset Park neighborhood of Brooklyn. And the museum recently announced that its longtime director, Gabrielle Shubert, is retiring.

title: Review: Most Dangerous Man in America (W. E. B. Du Bois) Focuses on Government Investigation
description: A history play, a biographical play, a documentary play and a courtroom satire, Amiri Barakas final work, Most Dangerous Man in America (W. E. B. Du Bois), by the New Federal Theater, is an unmusical grace note to Barakas vibrant, varied career.

title: Review: The Brink Stars Tim Robbins as a Sex-Crazed Secretary of State
description: Making jokes about the Middle East is not a safe bet.

title: James Salter in The Times and Elsewhere
description: James Salter, the novelist whose careful prose style made him a favorite among fellow authors,  died on Friday in Sag Harbor, N.Y., at 90.

title: Alex Rodriguez at No. 3,000, With Bullet and Asterisk
description: Alex Rodriguez joined the 3,000-hit club in style on Friday at Yankee Stadium, in a familiar scene with a much different character in the starring role.

title: How Ali Wentworth, Comedian and Author, Spends Her Sundays
description: Even though the comedian Ali Wentworth is creating television pilots and writing books (her most recent, Happily Ali After, was published on June 9), she still has creative energy to burn. Ill wake up in the middle of the night and paint a bathroom or bake 300 homemade chocolate chip cookies, she said. Having worked in television (In Living Color, Seinfeld ) and film (Its Complicated, Office Space), Ms. Wentworth, 50, has become accustomed to the ebbs and flows of show business. On Sundays, she and her husband, George Stephanopoulos, 54, chief anchor for ABC News, shed their professional personas. They have two daughters, Elliott, 12, and Harper, 9, and a couple of dogs. They live on the Upper East Side.

title: Alex Rodriguez, the Most Powerful in the 3,000-Hit Club
description: Alex Rodriguez became the latest player to reach 3,000 hits. His home runs make up 22 percent of those hits, a higher percentage than any other player on the list.

title: English Class in Common Core Era: Tom Sawyer and Court Opinions
description: In Harrison, N.Y., 10th graders read articles about bipolar disorder and the adolescent brain to help them analyze Holden Caulfield. In Springdale, Ark., ninth graders studying excerpts from The Odyssey also read sections of the G.I. Bill of Rights, and a congressional resolution on its 60th anniversary, to connect the story of Odysseus to the challenges of modern-day veterans. After eighth graders in Naples, Fla., read how Tom Sawyer duped other boys into whitewashing a fence for him, they follow it with an op-ed article on teenage unemployment.

title: Federal Auditor Finds Broad Failures at N.H.T.S.A.
description: Even as evidence poured into the nations top auto safety agency pointing to dangerous defects in millions of vehicles, regulators repeatedly failed for years to root out problems and hold carmakers accountable, according to a long-awaited internal audit by the Transportation Department.

title: Friday Night Music: Pavo Pavo
description: I went to see Lucius at Celebrating Brooklyn on Saturday; for those who asked for a link, someone took quite good videos here and here. But let me feature the first opening act, a new band named Pavo Pavo. It was great to be part of the audience, most of whom, like me, didnt know the band at all; little by little everyone began to realize that we were experiencing something special, that these very young musicians definitely have the magic:

title: Airbag Death in Honda Rental Car Reveals a Gap
description: Honda Motor confirmed on Friday that an airbag rupture killed the driver of a rented 2001 Civic in September 2014, making it the eighth death linked to faulty airbags made by the Japanese supplier Takata.

title: With an Activist Investor, ConAgra Is Primed to Be Carved Up
description: ConAgra Foods smorgasbord is ready to carve. The conglomerates $6.8 billion acquisition of Ralcorp in 2013 left a bad taste with shareholders. The activist investor Jana Partners is ready to shake up the board. ConAgras myriad brands probably fit better elsewhere. The question is how to slice it.

title: Testimony in James Holmes Trial of Gunfire and Loss
description: DENVER  As the movie theater lights dimmed and the previews rolled, Ashley Moser shifted her 6-year-old daughter, Veronica, off her lap and into the seat next to her. Ms. Moser had just learned she was pregnant, and Veronicas bony frame hurt her stomach, she testifiedon Friday. They were sitting side-by-side in the dark when the gunman walked in, lobbed a gas canister and opened fire.

title: Please, Corporations, Experiment on Us
description: CAN it ever be ethical for companies or governments to experiment on their employees, customers or citizens without their consent?

title: Iowa Court Ruling Says Doctors Can Prescribe Abortion Drugs by Video
description: WASHINGTON  The Iowa Supreme Court struck down a rule on Friday that would have prohibited doctors from using telemedicine to dispense abortion-inducing pills to patients in remote clinics around the state, saying the ban placed an undue burden on a womans constitutional right to an abortion.

title: Mixed Effects Are Seen on an Affordable Care Act Repeal
description: WASHINGTON  The nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office said Friday that repealing the Affordable Care Act would significantly increase federal budget deficits and the number of people who are uninsured.

title: Red Tape Untangled, Young Nepalese Monks Find Ride to Safety
description: LHO, Nepal  A dozen children, wearing the maroon robes of Buddhist monks, sat together on the packed earth of the village courtyard, solemn-faced and whispering. Behind them, vertical cliffs rose to snow-covered peaks. In front, a narrow valley opened up, sunlight glimmering off the gold paint of a Buddhist shrine where other monks were stacking a stone wall.

title: Unicef Fears Surge in Child Trafficking After Nepal Quakes
description: Unicef expressed concern on Friday over a possible surge in the trafficking of Nepalese children who might have been orphaned, abandoned or sold in the nearly two months since two severe earthquakes struck Nepal.

title: De Blasio Prods Graduates to Challenge Injustice (and Son to Take a Joke)
description: The parents, anxious and proud, filed into their seats clutching flowers and cards, to be presented to students in private embraces after the ceremony.

title: In First Batch of Released Cheney Papers, a Peek at a Polarizing Figure
description: WASHINGTON  In February 2008, an aide sent a news article to Vice President Dick Cheney reporting that former Secretary of State Colin L. Powell might vote for a Democrat for president. Sections were highlighted in yellow, and someone had circled a quotation from Mr. Powell in which he said America had lost a lot of prestige around the world.

title: France: Mideast Peace on Agenda
description: The French foreign minister, Laurent Fabius, will travel this weekend to Egypt, Jordan, Israel and the West Bank for meetings that the government asserts will be an effort to restart peace negotiations between Israel and the Palestinians. Although the French are not talking publicly about it, the other pressing issue for Mr. Fabius is the proposed nuclear deal with Iran. Talks between Iran and its negotiating partners over Irans nuclear program are set to finish by the end of June. In Jordan, Mr. Fabius will meet with his Jordanian counterpart as well as with King Abdullah II.

title: Mexico: Ex-Governor Charged
description: The former governor of the northeast Mexican border state of Tamaulipas, Eugenio Hernndez Flores, has been indicted on money-laundering charges in South Texas, prosecutors said Friday. The charges stem from allegations by United States law enforcementagencies that Mr. Hernndez had received bribes from the Zetas drug gang to allow it to operate freely in Tamaulipas while he was governor from 2005 to 2010. Mr. Hernndez, 57, is a fugitive but he called in to a Mexican radio show on Friday to declare his innocence. The governor preceding him, Toms Yarrington, also faces money-laundering and drug-trafficking charges. He, too, remains a fugitive.

title: Hot Peppers Becoming a Cash Crop for Bronx Community Gardens
description: The bright-green stalks and leaves are tended by a dozen teenage boys who water, lay mulch, pull weeds and wait.

title: Genome Studies Show How Ebola Spread Initially
description: After tracking tiny mutations in the genome of Ebola, scientists from around the world are developing a fuller picture of how the virus spread and evolved genetically during the worlds worst outbreak of the disease.

title: Dominican Deadline Passes Without Mass Expulsion of Haitian Migrants
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic  A cloud of fear and uncertainty has settled over the Dominican Republic in the two days since the government officially closed the doors to migrant workers trying to normalize their status.

title: Marijuana Is in the Air and on It, Too
description: DENVER  Some people who prosper in life choose to spend their hard-earned millions on private planes. Some buy a vineyard in Napa to indulge a love of wine. Some collect showpiece cars, or fulfill a dream of hiking Mount Everest.

title: A Son, Known for His Kindness, Is Mourned After He Is Bludgeoned to Death
description: On an unassuming block of Amsterdam Avenue on the Upper West Side, Bubacarr Camara was murdered on Thursday, bludgeoned to death in broad daylight, the police believe, as he worked at his familys clothing and odds-and-ends shop. His body was discovered behind the register.

title: Returning Home to Console, Lindsey Graham Joins the Mourning
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  Senator Lindsey Graham was in the passenger seat on Friday, preparing to make what would be the first of many difficult phone calls in the coming days.

title: Pope Francis Climate Error
description: TORONTO  AMONG environmental activists, the international market for carbon credits is often compared to the medieval sale of indulgences. Pope Francis presides over the Roman Catholic church, the institution that created the market for indulgences, so you might expect him to be more sympathetic on this issue.

title: 8 Indicted in Identity Thefts of Patients at MontefioreMedical Center
description: A Montefiore Medical Center employee and seven others were indicted on Friday on charges of stealing the personal information of as many as 12,000 hospital patients and using it to make purchases at luxury stores, the Manhattan district attorney said.

title: Astros G.M. Jeff Luhnow Delegates With a Drive for Data
description: The first time Jeff Luhnow returned to St. Louis as general manager of the Houston Astros, he had Chinese food for his pregame meal at Busch Stadium. He opened a fortune cookie and was struck by the wisdom of the words inside: You will obtain your goal if you maintain your course.

title: How to Really Fix Rikers
description: ON Monday, New York City is expected to settle a three-year-old class-action lawsuit by the Legal Aid Society over excessive use of force at Rikers Island. As a former chief of internal investigations at the Department of Correction, I am a defendant.

title: Outrage vs. Tradition, Wrapped in a High-Flying Flag of Dixie
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  Stunned by the massacre at Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church, South Carolina has been abruptly forced to confront an issue that has bedeviled it for decades: the Confederate battle flag that flies above the grounds of the State House.

title: A Flavorful Crust
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  When I dont have a theme to become obsessed with in a puzzle, I play a little game that I like to call Guess the Seed Entry. It keeps things interesting for me, and Im not always right.

title: Black Church Is Target Again for Deadly Strike at the Heart
description: In Atlanta, the former slaves sang their hallelujahs in an abandoned railroad boxcar. In Lincoln County, N.C., they called out to Jesus in a building made of old pine poles. Near Cartersville, Ga., they raised their voices to the heavens from a roofless barrel shop.

title: Justice Kennedy on Solitary Confinement
description: The Supreme Courts decision in the case of Hector Ayala, who has been on Californias death row for 25 years, turned on the question of whether a judge could hear a prosecutors reasons for dismissing people from the jury pool without the defendants lawyer being present. On Thursday, the court ruled 5-4 that excluding the lawyer was a harmless error.

title: Redevelopment of Manhattans Far West Side Gains Momentum
description: Construction cranes are swinging across the skyline on the once industrial Far West Side of Manhattan where hundreds of workers are erecting four office towers, a hotel, a large mall and at least a half-dozen residential buildings.

title: First Presidential Trip to Ethiopia Planned
description: President Obama will travel next month to Ethiopia to meet with African Union leaders and discuss ways to lift economic growth, strengthen democratic institutions and improve security, the White House announced on Friday. The visit, the first to Ethiopia by an American president, will follow a stop in Kenya, the home country of his fathers family. Human rights groups questioned the trip, saying that Ethiopia has silenced dissent with arbitrary arrests, mistreatment of detainees and repressive legislation.

title: U.S. Open 2015: Mood Turns Serious After Jason Days Health Scare
description: UNIVERSITY PLACE, Wash.  The 115th United States Open had the wind briefly knocked out of it Friday afternoon when one of the leaders, Jason Day, fell in a heap on the ninth green. Day, sitting two strokes behind the pacesetters after a birdie at the eighth, was walking toward his ball, which had landed in a back bunker.

title: Jamie Lovemark, an Unheralded Pupil, Shines While a Star Stumbles
description: UNIVERSITY PLACE, Wash.  The player who was wild off the tee is finding fairways since he began working last year with Chris Como. But enough about Jamie Lovemark, the former Southern California star who has played his way into contention in his United States Open debut with rounds of 70 and 68 for a two-under-par 138.

title: Radio D.J.s Offer Comfort and Community After Charleston Church Killings
description: It was not a typical Friday morning at New Yorks premier hip-hop radio station, Hot 97  and not because of anything happening in the world of music.

title: Shock, Grief and Questions After Killings in Charleston Church
description: To the Editor:

title: The Popes Landmark Call on Climate Change
description: To the Editor:

title: James Salter, a Writers Writer Short on Sales but Long on Acclaim, Dies at 90
description: James Salter, whose intimately detailed novels and short stories kept a small but devoted audience in his thrall for more than half a century, died on Friday in Sag Harbor, N.Y. He was 90.

title: Working With Fraternities to Prevent Rape
description: To the Editor:

title: El Salvadors View: More Prosperity, Less Migration
description: To the Editor:

title: The Endgame in Greece
description: A meeting of eurozone finance ministers on Thursday, which was billed as the last chance to stave off a Greek default and a Greek exit from the euro, collapsed in rancor and recriminations less than an hour after it started. Eurozone leaders then promptly scheduled a summit meeting for Monday to deal with the crisis. After five years of this, the world can be forgiven for not heeding the serial cries of wolf. Only this time, there really is a wolf at the door.

title: Companies and Campaign Disclosure
description: To the Editor:

title: Uncertainty Mounting as Little Progress Is Seen in Albany on Rent Regulations
description: Tenants have held protests and an all-night vigil in front of the governors office in New York City. Politicians are complaining about other politicians. A city board that decides on rent increases is wondering if it will have to postpone its annual vote.

title: President Obama and Nancy Pelosi Share Stage After Setback
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Days after Representative Nancy Pelosi helped derail one of President Obamas most important legislative priorities, the two shared a stage, a solarium and some tight smiles on Friday as they spoke to the nations mayors and then at an exclusive fund-raiser.

title: Holding On to a Special Ball, With No Apology
description: Two security officials led the way through the Yankee Stadium crowd on Friday, and a group of reporters followed, as Zack Hample clutched the ball that was Alex Rodriguezs 3,000th hit so tightly that his knuckles were white.

title: Alex Rodriguez Is Climbing Statistical Ladders
description: At this point in Alex Rodriguezs career, which has been marked by longevity and relatively steady production, he seems to reach a major milestone or catch a memorable player in a major category almost daily.

title: Jacob deGrom Takes Shutout of Braves Into Eighth Before the Mets Fold
description: On the same night on which Alex Rodriguez nicely rounded off his career hit total at a revered 3,000, the Mets Jacob deGrom came up with some impressive zeros of his own on Friday  at least for a while. The best starting pitcher for the Mets this season, deGrom took a two-hit shutout into the bottom of the eighth inning, when he was undermined by some resistance by the host Atlanta Braves and some shaky defense from his own work-in-progress infield in a 2-1 loss.

title: Whats on TV Saturday
description: 8 P.M. (HBO) GONE GIRL (2014) After losing their writing jobs in New York, Nick Dunne (Ben Affleck) and his wife, Amy (Rosamund Pike, in an Oscar-nominated portrayal), move to his small Missouri hometown to attend to his mother after her cancer diagnosis. Then she dies, and so does their marriage. So when Amy goes missing on their fifth wedding anniversary after what looks like a struggle, with broken glass and mopped-up blood, Nick is the prime suspect. And suddenly he and the town are trapped in a nationwide media circus. At its strongest, Gone Girl plays like a queasily, at times gleefully, funny horror movie about a modern marriage, one that has disintegrated partly because of spiraling downward mobility and lost privilege, Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times about David Finchers thriller, adapted from the novel by Gillian Flynn. Yet, as sometimes happens in Mr. Finchers work, dread descends like winter shadows, darkening the movies tone and visuals until its snuffed out all the light, air and nuance. By the movies second half, she added, you may wish that Amy would stay gone.

title: Corrections: June 20, 2015
description: THE ARTS

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Ive had so manyAfrican-American friends come to Charleston and say, What a wonderful place. Its gorgeous. I love it. But where are the black people?

title: The People v. the Coal Baron
description: Don Blankenship always knew exactly what he wanted during the years he ran Massey Energy, once the sixth-largest coal company in the United States. He had specific and emphatic ideas about how to operate mines, how to treat employees and how to deal with regulators. When he issued instructions, he wanted them followed to the letter, and this wasnt just true about his business.

title: The Week on Instagram
description: Photos posted this week on @nytimes took viewers from Trump Tower in Manhattan to a decaying repository of the auto industry in Georgia.

title: Ermenegildo Zegna: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Emporio Armani: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Obamacare and Labor Supply
description: I was critical of CBO yesterday  probably excessively  for giving what seemed like undue cover for deficit scolds in its long-run budget projection. So credit where credit is due: the new report on the consequences of repealing the ACA is definitely not what the Congressional majority wants to hear. Despite including dynamic scoring, the report finds, unambiguously, that Obamacare reduces the deficit and repealing it would enlarge the deficit.

title: Is Dot Earth Past its Prime?
description: [ It seems to be the summer of discontent. Greg Laden, who writes a spirited global warming blog, has published a rather biting critique of my approach to blogging and climate science. Ive added a link, an excerpt and my responses at the end of this piece.]

title: Boom in Treetop Parks Lets Visitors Learn the Ropes
description: Fun in the trees was once reserved for the likes of Tarzan, but aerial rope courses now offer the thrill for everyone. These treetop attractions, originally developed in Europe in the late 1990s, involve trails of increasing difficulty and height, some as high as 50 feet.

title: Never-Ending Construction Clamor
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: Toxic Liquor in India Kills at Least 84
description: NEW DELHI  At least 84 people have died after drinking toxic liquor in a Mumbai-area slum, the police said Saturday, as the toll continued to rise in the worst episode of its kind in more than a decade.

title: Gaps Fashion-Backward Moment
description: At 8:50 on a Wednesday morning, nearly two dozen shoppers hovered in front of H&Ms new global flagship store on the corner of West 34th Street and Avenue of the Americas in Manhattan, eager to get inside as soon as the doors were unlocked at 9.

title: The Scene
description: Ermenegildo Zegna at Milan Fashion Week.

title: Jim Dolce of Lookout, on Achieving Breakthroughs in Small Bites
description: This interview with Jim Dolce, chief executive of the mobile security firm Lookout, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: Photo Diary: Ermenegildo Zegna Spring/Summer 2016 Mens
description: Scenes from Milan Fashion Week, captured by Filippo Mutani.

title: Dylann Roof Photos and a Manifesto Are Posted on Website
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  Dylann Roof spat on and burned the American flag, but waved the Confederate.

title: The Replacement Cellphone With a Past Life
description: Dont you love those T-Mobile TV commercials? The graphics are kind of punk, with lots of bold flashes of black, magenta and white. Everyone is cool and young and running around, flexing their muscles, chest-thumping, shouting. Theyre rebelling! Against the Man!

title: For the New Superrich, Life Is Much More Than a Beach
description: Jean Pigozzi, the venture capitalist and art collector, was lounging by the pool at his villa in Cap dAntibes early this month, enjoying a rare break from what he calls the circuit.

title: Variety: Split Decisions
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Do the Split Decisions seem to be getting more difficult to you?

title: Jil Sander Homme: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Teresa White of Aflac: Perseverance and Pachyderms, in the Tallest Building in Town
description: Teresa White is the president for United States operations of the insurance company Aflac.

title: A Hectic Day at Charleston Church, and Then a Hellish Visitor
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  Wednesday was a busy day at the Emanuel A.M.E. Church.

title: Time Is Muscle: Understanding Heart Attacks
description: In treating heart attacks, doctors often say that "Time is muscle." Quick diagnosis and treatment can save lives and reduce or prevent damage to the heart.

title: Mitt Romney, Jeb Bush and Ted Cruz Weigh In on Confederate Flag at South Carolina Capitol
description: The future of the Confederate flag that flies on the grounds of South Carolina state capitol consumed the Republican Partys presidential field on Saturday after Mitt Romney, its nominee for president in 2012, demanded its removal, calling it a symbol of racial hatred.

title: For U.S. Opens Leaders, Tuning Out Distractions Is a Challenge
description: UNIVERSITY PLACE, Wash.  For reasons having nothing to do with the summer solstice, Sunday will feel like the longest day of the year for the last group to tee off at Chambers Bay Golf Course. From first light to first drive, the hours stretch before the 54-hole leaders like a gangplank leading from familiar shores to the great unknown.

title: Building a Better Valve
description: With his smooth, fleshy face and twinkly eyes, Herbert Auspitz, 93, had an air of vigor, but he was fading fast. He had a fatal disease with a prognosis worse than that of most cancers: severe aortic valve stenosis. It is a narrowing of the valve that controls blood flow from the heart. There is no way to prevent it, and there are no drugs to treat it.

title: Can Wikipedia Survive?
description: WASHINGTON  WIKIPEDIA has come a long way since it started in 2001. With around 70,000 volunteers editing in over 100 languages, it is by far the worlds most popular reference site. Its future is also uncertain.

title: For Faithful, Social Justice Goals Demand Action on Environment
description: For an earnest young Christian named Ben Lowe, revelation came on the shores of Lake Tanganyika, in Africa. A relentless warming of the lake was reducing the catch of fish, the people were going hungry  and he had learned of scientific evidence that climate change was to blame.

title: Ermenegildo Zegnas Perfect Proportions for Spring 2016
description: This morning, Stefano Pilati kicked off the spring/summer 2016 mens shows in Milan with a standout collection for Ermenegildo Zegna. In an age where designers are shifting away from tighter, form-fitting, cropped tailoring, Pilati mastered the new, more voluminous and relaxed silhouette with consistently perfectly proportioned looks.

title: To Soften Image, Brazilian Police Ride In Atop Horned Beasts
description: MARAJ ISLAND, Brazil  Legends flourish about how the first Asian water buffaloes made it to this colossal island in the Amazon River Delta.

title: Eye on Gawker
description: To the Editor:

title: Gaza Welcomes Break From Strife and Reopening of Border With Egypt
description: GAZA CITY  For much of the past year, Gaza has sat in frustrated isolation as it struggled to recover from a devastating war with Israel. But for the people of the battered coastal enclave, the past week brought some welcome signs of relief.

title: Studying the Students
description: In The Dangers of a Student Data Clampdown (The Upshot, Economic View, June 14), Prof. Susan Dynarski of the University of Michigan said that pending laws to tighten the security and privacy of student data could block use of such data to assess and improve education. She cited one congressional proposal, by Senator David Vitter, that she said would effectively end the analysis of student data by outside social scientists.

title: A Quick Fix in Baseball? Not So Fast
description: Reminder to anyone who tries to predict the baseball standings before the season: Do not fall for the team that made the splashiest moves. This year, perhaps more than ever, proves the difficulty of a quick off-season makeover.

title: A Month of Ties
description: My fathers ties deserved a second chance. So I wore them and kept a diary.

title: Venezuelas Rising Team Unites a Country That Sorely Needs Better Times
description: VALPARAISO, Chile  When Gabriel Cichero played soccer for the Red Bulls in 2008, he sometimes socialized with his fellow Venezuelans Johan Santana, who was playing for the Mets at the time, and Bobby Abreu, who was a Yankee.

title: Rachel Dolezal and Racial Identity
description: Readers discuss issues raised by a white womans efforts to pass as black.

title: The Chinese Want Their Art Back
description: OVER the course of five days in March, Christies auctioned off the holdings of the dealer Robert H. Ellsworth, who, before his death last year at age 85, filled his 22-room apartment on Fifth Avenue in Manhattan with what was said to be one of the worlds most comprehensive private collections of Asian art, earning him the nickname King of Ming. The sale fetched $134 million, nearly four times the presale estimate of $35 million.

title: Trade Winds Blow Ill for Hillary
description: WASHINGTON  ITS hard being Elizabeth Warren.

title: Leave Hamilton Alone
description: IM all in for the plan announced last week by the Treasury to put a woman on a piece of American folding money. But in bumping Alexander Hamilton from the center of the $10 bill, we would be exiling the man most responsible for our nations having a sound currency in the first place.

title: Whats the Matter With Polling?
description: OVER the past two years, election polling has had some spectacular disasters. Several organizations tracking the 2014 midterm elections did not catch the Republican wave that led to strong majorities in both houses; polls in Israel badly underestimated Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahus strength, and pollsters in Britain predicted a close election only to see the Conservatives win easily. Whats going on here? How much can we trust the polls as we head toward the 2016 elections?

title: A Rain of Bombs in the Nuba Mountains
description: IN THE NUBA MOUNTAINS, Sudan  THE eight children in the Shanta family lived in a village of grass huts and had never turned on an electric light or worn a watch, never ridden a car or even a bicycle, never spoken on the telephone.

title: Lift the Cuba Travel Ban
description: Granted, Khartoum, Tehran, Damascus and Pyongyang are not terribly popular tourist destinations. But they are places Americans can visit without running afoul of federal law. Yet, traveling to Cuba for tourism continues to be banned. Getting there for approved purposes remains needlessly difficult and expensive.

title: Love and Terror in the Black Church
description: AT the sprawling Friendship-West Baptist Church in Dallas one day last spring, I was met by five men with earpieces who escorted me to the pastors office. As I prepared to preach that morning, a rolling phalanx of bodyguards shadowed my every move  when I greeted parishioners in the churchs spacious narthex and even as I made a stop at the mens room. We walked from the church study into the 4,200-seat sanctuary, the security team whispering into their wrists.

title: Pope Francis Call to Action Goes Beyond the Environment
description: IN Pope Francis sprawling new encyclical, Laudato Si, there are many mansions: A meditation on biblical ecology, a discussion of environmental policy, a critique of consumerism, even a reflection on the perils of social media.

title: Coping With Outbreaks of MERS
description: A highly lethal contagious disease that has been detected in camels and humans in the Middle East is slowly spreading around the world and is causing havoc in South Korea. Known as the Middle East respiratory syndrome, or MERS, it has killed 35 percent of those it has infected. There have been 1,333 laboratory-confirmed cases of MERS in more than two dozen countries; at least 471 people have died.

title: Gay Marriages Moment
description: REMEMBER the AIDS crisis? If you lived in a big American city during its spread, you were witness to constant sorrow and countless examples of gay people treated as second-class citizens.

title: Dagur Eggertsson
description: Dagur Eggertsson is the mayor of Reykjavik, Iceland.

title: Flying Lessons From My Father
description: LAS VEGAS  BEFORE my first flight lesson, my father sat beside me in the small cockpit and told me the story of a flight instructor whose student stalled on descent, panicked and didnt release the controls. They both died in the crash.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Patriots Scandal? Computer Hacking Is More Serious

title: Anthem Makes $47 Billion Offer for Rival Cigna
description: One of the biggest health insurers in the country, Anthem, on Saturday announced an offer to acquire a rival, Cigna, for more than $47 billion in cash and stock.

title: Neil Barrett: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Voters Always Want A Strong Currency
description: Even as the prospect of Grexit moves from inconceivable to plausible, polls consistently show that Greek voters want to stay on the euro. But what does this tell us?

title: Lady Gaga Brings Thrill to Tony Bennetts Immutable Style
description: An irresistible force and an immovable object: that would be Lady Gaga and Tony Bennett on Friday evening at Radio City Music Hall where they sang more than 30 standards, separately and together, before a respectful multigenerational audience that tilted older.

title: Industry Money Shifts to Republicans
description: Over the last three election cycles, several major industries have shifted their political donations to Republicans from Democrats.

title: What Is Whiteness?
description: THE terrorist attack in Charleston, S.C., an atrocity like so many other shameful episodes in American history, has overshadowed the drama of Rachel A. Dolezals yearslong passing for black. And for good reason: Hateful mass murder is, of course, more consequential than one womans fiction. But the two are connected in a way that is relevant to many Americans.

title: Harvard Admissions Needs Moneyball for Life
description: To: Harvard Management Company

title: The Cost of Letting Young People Drift
description: President Obama spotlighted a national crisis last year when he launched My Brothers Keeper, an initiative that encourages communities, nonprofits and the private sector to focus on ways to improve the lives of some of the nations most vulnerable young people. According to the White House, the private sector has since directed nearly $500 million to various projects aimed at expanding opportunity for this group.

title: Hillary Clinton Calls Americas Struggle With Racism Far From Over
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton delivered on Saturday her boldest remarks yet on race and gun violence, topics that have quickly become some of the most prominent and divisive in the presidential campaign, particularly after Wednesdays mass shooting in Charleston, S.C.

title: Fates Diverge for Homes That Touched Black History
description: By the time Booker T. Washington made his way to Montclair in the 1910s, to speak to women at a budding YWCA for African-Americans, he was already familiar with a different part of New Jersey. His ghostwriter, the pioneering black journalist Timothy Thomas Fortune, lived in Red Bank from 1901 to 1908; local records document at least one trip Washington made to meet Mr. Fortune there.

description: Marni Mens at Milan Fashion Week.

description: The Rev. John Paul Brown says faith has allowed him and others to turn the tragedy of the shooting in Charleston, S.C., into an opportunity for growth and unity.

description: Scenes from Milan Fashion Week, captured by Molly S.J. Lowe.

title: The Issue That Wont Go Away
description: So another atrocity has us talking about race again. And rightly so. Nothing about America makes sense without understanding the long shadow cast by the original sin of slavery.

title: New Vigor at a Designers Wooded Hideaway
description: The artist Stephen Talasnik has given some thought to why house museums may be preferable to museums built expressly to show art.

title: From Ferguson to Charleston and Beyond, Anguish About Race Keeps Building
description: Ferguson. Baltimore. Staten Island. North Charleston. Cleveland.

title: A Review of All My Sons in East Hampton
description: A searching wind, driven by a nighttime thunderstorm and heightened by the scream of an airplanes engines, sets in motion a worthy revival of Arthur Millers All My Sons at the John Drew Theater in East Hampton. Nightgown whipping in the blast, a woman stumbles out of her home to witness with horror the toppling of an apple tree in the backyard.

title: The Scene
description: Versace Mens at Milan Fashion Week.

title: Review: Chef Wang New Sichuan Cuisine in New Hyde Park
description: The arrival of Chef Wang New Sichuan Cuisine in New Hyde Park on Feb. 14 was truly a valentine to Long Islanders who love Chinese food. And there is a veritable Chef Wang behind the venture: Ding Gen Wang, who is the owner and executive chef. He also presides over three Manhattan restaurants: Legend 88, Legend 72 and Legend Upper West.

title: Photo Diary: Versace Spring/Summer 2016 Mens
description: Scenes from Milan Fashion Week, captured by Joshua Woods.

title: A Review of And a Nightingale Sang at the Westport Country Playhouse
description: One hand touching another: This simple yet complicated act between two people can open a world as much as a war can end it.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: Rough-Hewn Temple to Nuevo Latino
description: It began with the building, and that is a big part of the appeal of Iron Vine, a nuevo Latino take on tapas that opened in Peekskill in December.

title: Significant Sighting of 2 Killers Who Escaped From Prison, Police Say
description: New York State Police troopers converged on Saturday on a spot near Friendship, N.Y., in the southwestern part of the state, where they believed a resident caught sight of the two convicted murderers who staged an elaborate escape from the states largest prison.

title: Review: Happiness Bar & Grill in Asbury Park
description: Hard to resist a place called the Happiness Bar & Grill, and why bother when it serves terrific cocktails and the kind of excellent bar food that goes with them?

title: Restaurant Review: Yokohama in New Milford
description: The hundreds of photos of patrons celebrating birthdays and anniversaries tacked to the walls of Yokohamas rice paper-paneled entrance corridor suggest that this New Milford restaurant is much loved. That impression is amply reinforced most nights by the long wait for a table should you arrive without a reservation.

title: Oh, to Be Young, Millennial, and So Wanted by Marketers
description: The makers of Tic Tacs had a problem on their hands.

title: Things to Do on Long Island, June 21 to 27, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: Climbing the Corporate Ladder
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  This puzzle by Timothy Polin has some interesting layers, including some terrific fill, tricky cluing and the kind of theme that just stops me in my tracks. I hung in there, though, and I eventually got it. Its quite clever.

title: Things to Do in Westchester, June 21 to 27, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com.

title: Suit Has South Korea Looking Anew at Its Hard Line on Prostitution
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Kim Jeong-mi, a 43-year-old prostitute in Seoul, says she knows about humiliation. She usually charges customers 20,000 to 30,000 won, or about $18 to $27  roughly a third of what her younger competition gets. When desperate, she has gone as low as 10,000 won. She has felt people sneering.

title: Things to Do in New Jersey, June 21 to 27, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: Things to Do in Connecticut, June 21 to 27, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com.

title: Corrections Officer Placed on Leave in Escape Inquiry Worked as Inmate Escort
description: PLATTSBURGH, N.Y.  A corrections officer placed on administrative leave over his possible role in the escape of two convicted killers had a job that gave him routine access to the prison tailor shop, where authorities believe the two murderers obtained the tools they used to break out, an official with knowledge of the case said.

title: Carl Nesjar, Sculptor Who Added Dimension to Picasso, Dies at 94
description: Carl Nesjar was often called Picassos right arm, but in truth he was also his left arm and, Picasso being Picasso, very likely a third arm as well.

title: Allen Weinstein, Historian of Alger Hiss Case, Dies at 77
description: Allen Weinstein, a historian of Cold War espionage whose 1978 book, Perjury: The Hiss-Chambers Case, marshaled a mountain of new evidence to argue that Alger Hiss was guilty as charged in one of the most famous spy trials of the postwar era, and who served as the ninth national archivist of the United States, died on Thursday at a nursing home in Gaithersburg, Md. He was 77.

title: How Did They Get Out? Testing the Tools the Escapees Could Have Used
description: About two weeks after a pair of murderers cut their way out of a N.Y. prison, their methods remain a substantial mystery.

title: The Flight of Refugees Around the Globe
description: Mapping the migration of millions of people displaced around the world because of violence. Last year alone, about 14 million fled, according to the United Nations.

title: For a Blues Birthplace in Memphis, Challenging Next Steps
description: MEMPHIS  It was for years an open secret that behind the blues music, barbecue trophies and neon signs of Beale Street, the small strip of clubs, restaurants and history that helped put Memphis on the map, a legal and political mess existed that tourists never saw.

title: Attack Gave Chinese Hackers Privileged Access to U.S. Systems
description: WASHINGTON  For more than five years, American intelligence agencies followed several groups of Chinese hackers who were systematically draining information from defense contractors, energy firms and electronics makers, their targets shifting to fit Beijings latest economic priorities.

title: Lumberjacks Compete in Central Park
description: Photographs from Central Park where a daylong contest took place to determine the best lumberjack in the United States.

title: Symphony of Chain Saws Cuts Clean Through Central Parks Calm
description: Typically, an orchestra comprising cellists and violinists might play Mozart at the Naumburg Bandshell, a neoclassical concert stage near 72nd Street in Central Park built in 1923 to stimulate the publics interest in classical music. Instead, on Saturday, tall, bearded, thick-necked men hacked at pine logs with axes and chain saws.

title: Wait Lists Grow as Many More Veterans Seek Care and Funding Falls Far Short
description: One year after outrage about long waiting lists for health care shook the Department of Veterans Affairs, the agency is facing a new crisis: The number of veterans on waiting lists of one month or more is now 50 percent higher than it was during the height of last years problems, department officials say. The department is also facing a nearly $3 billion budget shortfall, which could affect care for many veterans.

title: Saturday at the Womens World Cup
description: SATURDAYS RESULTS

title: Cables Released by WikiLeaks Reveal Saudis Checkbook Diplomacy
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  It seems that everyone wants something from Saudi Arabia.

title: After Killings, a Southern Tourist Destination Remains Calm, and Open
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  In the heart of this southern citys historic downtown, there has been in the last few days an almost surreal paradox playing out on the street.

title: Memories Made, and Found, on a Moped
description: On a return trip to Bermuda, a son, now also a father, hopes to solve a longtime family mystery.

title: Yankees Legends, in Various Shades of Gray
description: Even the Yankees couldnt contest or withhold the intangible bonuses Alex Rodriguez stumbled into on the weekend he joined baseballs 3,000-hit club with a home run flourish.

title: Like Putting on Broccoli, or Cauliflower, and Results Are Bumpy
description: After Fridays second round, Henrik Stenson said that Chambers Bay Golf Courses dry, bumpy greens were pretty much like putting on broccoli.

title: Sweet Briar Reaches Deal to Stay Open
description: WASHINGTON  Sweet Briar College, the womens liberal arts college in rural Virginia that announced it would close in August  setting off a storm of protest and lawsuits from students, faculty and alumnae  will remain open for at least another academic year under an agreement announced Saturday by the attorney general of Virginia.

title: Lead Group Has Star Potential
description: UNIVERSITY PLACE, Wash.  It is initially overwhelming, but the more you play it, the less intimidating and more accessible it seems, the former United States Open champion Jim Furyk said. He was talking about Chambers Bay, which measured 7,637 yards on Saturday, but he could have been speaking of the PGA Tour.

title: Day Honoring Yankees Stars of Past Ends With an Old-Fashioned Rout
description: The Detroit Tigers gave up early on Saturday, pulling some of their best players in the fifth inning of an eventual 14-3 loss to the Yankees in the Bronx. Many fans left early, too, but it was hard to blame them. The days most gripping moments took place before the first pitch.

title: Unsteady Hands, but Steely Play by Jason Day
description: UNIVERSITY PLACE, Wash.  Jason Day made the birdie putt on the 18thgreen that gave him a tie for the lead at the 115thUnited States Open, but Day knew that rolling the ball into the hole was not going to be the hardest part.

title: Design Secrets of eBays Tastemaker in Chief
description: Though eBay has transformed the way people shop for design, the site interface itself has until recently been known for an absence of aesthetics. That is changing, however, with the companys appointment of Michael Phillips Moskowitz. The erstwhile Stanford research associate signed on as chief curator and editorial director a year ago when the company bought his e-commerce startup, Bureau of Trade, a mens wear-focused site offering carefully chosen vintage objects alongside, in the name of what he calls conscientious consumption, the origin stories behind them. Since then, he has spearheaded a series of initiatives to impart good taste into a platform that for years made users dig for it.
