title: New Flying Record
description: One plane through a building, sure. Two?

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Hope you are having a great Sunday. Here are the weeks top stories.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Science is like a compass. It can tell us where north is, but it cant tell us if we want to go north. Thats where our morality comes in.

title: Corrections: June 21, 2015
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: The Real Dad Bod
description: What makes a dad bod? College students describe it as an imperfect, but still attractive, male physique. But we asked Well readers to tell us about the original model  a body owned and operated by an actual dad. Many of you sent us stories about dad bods that reflect a life of experience, adventure and physical challenges.

title: Bottega Veneta: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: Milan

title: How Does an Uber Driver Take Family Leave?
description: My wife and I recently welcomed our first child, and throughout the pregnancy, I anxiously tried to settle on my plan for paternity leave. It seemed that every day, a new study or article came out that focused on the importance of fathers bonding with their newborn children and the ways corporate America was (or wasnt) stepping up to the plate to help. I understood all of this, but my new company, Fatherly, was barreling toward launch, and I wasnt sure how to fulfill my obligations to my work and my new family at the same time.

title: Salvatore Ferragamo: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Lapses at Prison May Have Aided Killers Escape
description: DANNEMORA, N.Y.  By the time David Sweat and Richard W. Matt engineered their extraordinary escape from the maximum-security prison here, corrections officers were rarely shining lights over the faces of inmates during hourly bed checks, making it hard to know whether a living, breathing person was inside a cell.

title: 1940: American Refugees Arrive Home
description: The United States liner Washington, last chance ship for Americans fleeing the war zone, arrived at 10:30 a.m. yesterday with 1,793 men, women and children, most of whom had passed fifteen long and harrowing minutes in lifeboats dangling over the liners side when the ship was threatened by a submarine June 11 off the northern coast of Portugal. To many, the submarine episode was less frightful than the ordeals they suffered while fleeing across Belgium and France, hardly a jump ahead of the German Army.

title: Tell Us How Your Church Addressed the Popes Encyclical
description: The encyclical by Pope Francis released on Thursday did not merely present a papal view on the environment and climate change. It was also an urgent call to action. The document appeared intended to persuade followers around the world to change their behavior, in hopes of protecting a fragile planet.

title: 1965: Army Occupies Algiers
description: ALGIERS  Riot police and troops occupied the center of Algiers tonight after angry youths took to the streets here for the second time in 24 hours to protest the ouster of President Ahmed Ben Bella. The demonstration which broke out this afternoon  despite a government edict banning all mass gatherings  was dispersed after the police and army troops fired shots into the air.

title: Calvin Klein Collection: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Possible Sighting of Escaped Killers Jolts Town
description: FRIENDSHIP, N.Y.  Brandy Thompson was occupied by chores, spending a gray Saturday afternoon working in her barn. But the barking of her dog, a hulking Italian mastiff named Charlie, drew her attention toward the railroad tracks beside her property.

description: Bottega Veneta Mens at Milan Fashion Week.

description: Mourners gathered at Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in Charleston, S.C., on Sunday.

title: Defiant Show of Unity in Charleston Church That Lost 9 to Racist Violence
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  The Emanuel A.M.E. Church has survived antebellum laws barring black worship, an angry white mob that burned down its original edifice, and the execution of its founder and dozens of others planning a slave revolt.

title: Republicans Tread Carefully in Criticism of Confederate Flag
description: WASHINGTON  The massacre of nine African-Americans in a storied Charleston church last week, which thrust the issues of race relations and gun rights into the center of the 2016 presidential campaign, has now added another familiar, divisive question to the emerging contest for the Republican nomination: what to do with the Confederate battle flag that flies on the grounds of the South Carolina Capitol.

description: Salvatore Ferragamo Mens at Milan Fashion Week.

description: SEATTLE  Three Microsoft executives saw their responsibilities multiply last week when the company announced that it was consolidating its engineering efforts, leading to the departure of several senior executives.

title: Advocates Make Another List of Plays by Women Deserving of Productions
description: Every year, as theaters around the country announce their new seasons, advocates for gender equality are disappointed anew: female playwrights are underrepresented, they say.

description: Milan

title: Photo Diary: Salvatore Ferragamo Spring/Summer 2016 Mens
description: Scenes from Milan Fashion Week, captured by Joshua Woods.

title: Julie Kent Dances Her Farewell Performance to Ovations and Tears
description: Her entrance applause was so loud, and lasted so long, that it must have been difficult to hear the orchestra during her first few steps. After the curtain went down on the last act, she received a 23-minute ovation and enough bouquets to stock a small flower shop. They were tributes to Julie Kent, who danced her farewell performance with American Ballet Theater on Saturday night after 29 years with the company  a final Romeo and Juliet  and stirred strong emotions among fans and fellow dancers. Through social media, the moment reverberated far beyond the Metropolitan Opera House. Heres a sampling of how her fans and colleagues shared the experience on Twitter.

title: Taylor Swift Criticism Spurs Apple to Change Royalties Policy
description: When Taylor Swift speaks, even the most powerful company in the world listens.

title: As Greece Deadline Looms, European Central Bank Plays Key Role
description: ATHENS  As Greeces standoff with its creditors enters the final stretch, the European Central Bank finds itself in the awkward position of being both the countrys savior and its scold.

title: Al Jazeera Journalist Held in Germany Awaits Verdict on Egyptian Arrest Warrant
description: BERLIN  An Egyptian-British journalist working for the television news network Al Jazeera remained in German custody on Sunday pending a court ruling on the validity of an Egyptian arrest warrant that served as grounds for his detention at a Berlin airport over the weekend. His lawyers said the charges were politically motivated.

title: Whats On TV Sunday
description: 9 P.M. (HBO) TRUE DETECTIVE Three law enforcement officers (Colin Farrell, above; Rachel McAdams; and Taylor Kitsch) in a fictional Los Angeles suburb and a career criminal (Vince Vaughn) trying to go legit collide when a city manager is murdered  and a lucrative land scheme disrupted  in Season 2 of this anthology series, created and written by Nic Pizzolatto. This time, Mr. Pizzolatto doubles down on much of what made the first season so distinctive, Alessandra Stanley wrote in The New York Times. That doesnt make it twice as good, though. Not nearly. In the premiere of Ballers, at 10, Dwayne Johnson plays a former football pro trying to build a career out of giving financial advice to current players in Miami. The characters shenanigans make for unrewarding, predictable drama, though the writers occasionally try for better, Neil Genzlinger wrote. And in The Brink, a dark comedy at 10:30, the fate of the world rests in the hands of the secretary of state (Tim Robbins), a lowly foreign service officer (Jack Black) and a Navy fighter pilot (Pablo Schreiber) after a rogue general (Iqbal Theba) seizes control of Pakistan and its nuclear arsenal. The writers dont go very near Islamic extremism or terrorism, Ms. Stanley wrote. Instead, she said, the creators of Brink take aim at American wrongdoing. So nobody is going to get in trouble because of this show. But people arent going to die laughing, either.

title: Altice Offers to Buy Bouygues Telecom for $11.3 Billion
description: LONDON  Altice, the cable and mobile services provider led by the French entrepreneur Patrick Drahi, has offered to pay 10 billion euros, or about $11.3 billion, in cash for its rival Bouygues Telecom, according to a person familiar with the discussions.

title: Parishioners Mourn Shooting Victims
description: Parishioners gathered at the Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in Charleston for a memorial service for the nine people killed.

title: In China, Illegal Drugs Are Sold Online in an Unbridled Market
description: SHANGHAI  Ordering illegal drugs from China is as easy as typing on a keyboard.

title: Les Arts Florissants Coming to BAM Next April
description: William Christie and Les Arts Florissants plan to bring the new Robert Carsen production of Les Ftes vnitiennes, a courtly 1710 opera-ballet bonbon by Andr Campra, to the Brooklyn Academy of Music next April, the ensemble announced on Sunday.

title: Netanyahu Rebuffs France on Restarting Mideast Talks
description: JERUSALEM  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel on Sunday rebuffed the French idea of restarting the Israeli-Palestinian peace process with international support and the backing of a United Nations Security Council resolution.

title: A Big Debut for Inside Out, but Jurassic Wins the Weekend
description: LOS ANGELES  Roaring back after a two-year absence from theaters, Pixar over the weekend released Inside Out to exultant reviews  the best of the year so far for any film, according to Metacritic.com  and an enormous $91.1 million in ticket sales.

title: Presidential Candidates Tell the Story of Their Fathers From the Stump
description: Heres a look at how some of the 2016 presidential candidates and hopefuls have been telling the tales of their fathers on the campaign trail.

title: How SurveyMonkey Is Coping After the Death of Dave Goldberg
description: PALO ALTO, Calif.  On the first day back to work after the death of Dave Goldberg, the chief executive of SurveyMonkey, employees at the Silicon Valley company gathered to mourn.

title: Invoking the Radical Spirit of Dorothy Day to Fight a Church Closing
description: The Church of the Nativity on Second Avenue has always reminded Mercedes Sanchez of the East Villages rough-and-tumble days, whether it was the homeless men who flocked there for meals, or the stories about Dorothy Day, the co-founder of the Catholic Worker movement who worshiped there until her death in 1980.

title: Avoiding Apocalypse
description: Larry Summers has written a scary column warning that Greece may be on the verge of becoming a failed state. Its a useful corrective to the extraordinary complacency Im hearing from too many European officials. But I do think its worth pointing out that this need not happen, even if there is no deal.

description: Milan

title: Pradas Club-Ready Patent Leather for Spring 2016
description: In a complete detour from last seasons sterile black nylon tailoring, Prada showed an energetic mens collection in Milan today, full of club-ready looks. This artfully disheveled combination of patent leather jacket and shorts, worn with double-layered fine-gauge socks and short boots, looks like something youd see on a night out in Berlin.

title: An Unexpected Par 5 at U.S.Open, Possibly Thanks to Spieth
description: UNIVERSITY PLACE, Wash.  The United States Open champion, Jordan Spieth, is only 21 years old, but it appears he may already wield considerable influence in the golf community.

title: No Shaving Grace
description: Serious matters are afoot, but I dont know if theres anything more I can say about them right now. So, on to a subject where I think I can make a useful intervention: Peter Dormans query about why so many economists wear beards.

title: Nico Rosberg Zips Past Lewis Hamilton to Capture Austrian Prix
description: SPIELBERG, Austria  The cynical jab on the cover of The Red Bulletin magazine had its prediction slightly wrong: Hamilton Wins in Spielberg. ...

title: The Scene
description: Prada Mens at Milan Fashion Week.

title: Photo Diary: Prada Spring/Summer 2016 Mens
description: Scenes from Milan Fashion Week, captured by Filippo Mutani.

title: Moncler Gamme Bleu: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Australias Policy on Migrants Questioned After Smuggler Says He Was Bribed to Turn Back
description: SYDNEY, Australia  If money talks, it was the stacks of crisp $100 bills that spoke loudest. An Indonesian smuggler said the Australian authorities had stopped his boat at sea and given him and his crew the cash, more than $30,000, to take his cargo of 65 migrants to Indonesia.

title: Taliban and Afghan Government Dispute Status of Kunduz
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  After Taliban insurgents said Sunday that they were on the verge of taking their first city, Kunduz in the far north of Afghanistan, officials there expressed alarm as residents began to flee the area. But the central government in Kabul said there was no cause for concern.

title: Taliban Are Talking Peace, Though Not With Afghan Government
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Taliban envoys have been busy over the past month, shuttling from conferences in one world capital to the next, in the biggest rush of activity on the Afghan peace front in years.

title: Masahiro TanakaHas No Complaints About His Arm, and Neither Do the Tigers
description: The first home run Masahiro Tanaka allowed Sunday drew an audible gasp from the crowd. It was stunning both because it came off Tanaka, the Yankees ace, and because the homer was a sight to behold, a high-arcing drive off the bat of Victor Martinez that finally landed about five rows into the second deck at Yankee Stadium.

title: Cigna Rejects an Overture From Anthem
description: The world of American health insurance may soon become even smaller, with the biggest companies seeking to become even bigger.

title: Review: Van Morrison Finds New Meaning in Extensive and Nostalgic Catalog
description: Road, the road, the road, the road, the road it never seems to end, the newly knighted Sir Van Morrison sang on Friday night at Forest Hills Stadium in Queens, in the only United States show on his current tour. At 69, Mr. Morrison has accumulated considerable mileage. But he was feisty and focused in this show.

title: Review: Twyla Tharps The One Hundreds: Math Thats Easy on the Eyes
description: It was misty early in the evening on Saturday, and the lawn of Nelson A. Rockefeller Park in Battery Park City was damp as 100 volunteers danced en masse for 11 seconds. This extremely brief burst of activity was the finale of Twyla Tharps 1970 work The One Hundreds. The duration of the preceding part of the piece could be measured in minutes: about 20. That was less time than I spent waiting for a subway train on my way home afterward. But The One Hundreds was well worth the trip.

title: Review: Requiem for the Dead on HBO Explores Gun Violence in America
description: A documentary about gun violence that has its premiere on HBO on Monday has been given extra topicality by the massacre in Charleston, S.C. That, though, isnt necessarily to the films benefit. It might draw additional viewers, sure, but it also underscores the projects voyeuristic shallowness.

title: Gay-Themed Play About Oscar Wilde Hits a Kremlin Roadblock
description: A plan to stage an American theater companys gay-themed play in Moscow, with support from the United States government, has stalled amid tensions between the two nations and at a time of Kremlin hostility toward homosexuality.

title: Review: Dance My Life, Souleymane Badolos River to River Work, Feeds Off the Public
description: Dancers are only some of the performers in the River to River Festival, which inhabits public spaces in Lower Manhattan for 11 days each summer. A dance in a plaza or park is also the dance of pedestrians walking by, of joggers, sightseers and other unwitting extras.

title: Macedonia Government Is Blamed for Wiretapping Scandal
description: WARSAW  The national security service, acting on orders from Macedonias conservative and increasingly authoritarian government, was behind the wiretapping scandal that has the small nation on the edge of cracking, a new report says.

title: Review: Great Men Die Twice, a Collection of Sports Reporting by Mark Kram
description: The list of sportswriters whose career highlights are worth anthologizing is probably finite: Ring Lardner, Red Smith, Roger Angell, add a few others of your own. But one who shouldnt be forgotten is Mark Kram, and not simply because he may be the greatest writer ever  of sports or anything else  whose name is a palindrome.

title: Most Dangerous Man in America (W. E. B. Du Bois) Focuses on Government Investigation
description: A history play, a biographical play, a documentary play and a courtroom satire, Amiri Barakas final work, Most Dangerous Man in America (W. E. B. Du Bois), by the New Federal Theater, is an unmusical grace note to Barakas vibrant, varied career.

title: Review: In Debutaunt, Mary John Frank Combines Theater and Dance
description: Pretty is as pretty does, scolds a matron with a honeyed voice and a stranglehold smile at the beginning of Mary John Franks very pretty, somewhat slight Debutaunt, an interactive satire of Southern cotillion culture.

title: Review: Three Romeo and Juliet Performances, Including Julie Kents Farewell
description: Hail, hail, hail and farewell. Last weeks run of Kenneth MacMillans Romeo and Juliet by American Ballet Theater included three important performances as Juliet and a distinguished new Romeo. On Thursday evening the Russian ballerina Evgenia Obraztsova made her debut with this company; on Saturday afternoon the company soloists Misty Copeland and Joseph Gorak gave the performance originally planned for their joint debuts as the star-crossed duo (Ms. Copeland had also, on short notice, danced it earlier in the week); and on Saturday evening Julie Kent, Ballet Theaters longest-serving principal dancer, took her departure from this company.

title: Study Maps Concentrations of Antibiotics in Chinese Waterways
description: Rivers near Beijing and Tianjin in the north and in the Pearl River Delta in the south contain some of the highest concentrations of antibiotics in Chinas waterways, according to a study that cites the overuse of the drugs in humans and farm animals.

title: Hawaiis State Bird
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  If you do not have a Twitter account, this puzzle might be a bit, well, puzzling for you. Even if you got the joke, it might be more than you were expecting on a Monday, but as the constructor, Joel Fagliano, remarks in his notes, theres nothing wrong with a curve ball once in a while.

title: A Voodoo Resurrection
description: A look at rehearsals for the opera by the Harlem Renaissance composer H. Lawrence Freeman.

title: Voodoo, Opera by the African-American Composer H. Lawrence Freeman, Is Revived
description: He was described as a black Wagner in the late 19th century, went on to write more than 20 operas and formed the Negro Grand Opera Company, which he once conducted at Carnegie Hall. But after the pioneering African-American composer H. Lawrence Freeman died in 1954, he fell into obscurity, with his works unpublished, unrecorded and, for decades, unperformed.

title: An Athlete Felled by Concussions, Despite Playing a Safer Sport
description: CLARKSVILLE, Tenn.  Months later, the father mustered the strength to sort through what was left in his dead sons bedroom. A Little League photo collage. Mardi Gras beads from that soccer tournament in New Orleans. And a typewritten personal essay tucked into a yellow folder, with a single word pen-carved into its plastic cover:

title: International Yoga Day Finally Arrives in India, Amid Cheers and Skepticism
description: NEW DELHI  It was a rare sight  after a brief speech to inaugurate International Yoga Day on Sunday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi descended from a huge stage in front of the presidential palace and took off his glasses and his shoes. He quietly took his place before a sea of schoolchildren and others, mats neatly arranged in a checkerboard as far as the eye could see, to begin what was billed as the largest yoga demonstration in a single venue in history.

title: Review: A Deadly Adoption Stars Kristen Wiig and Will Ferrell
description: It was either a brilliant example of deadpan humor or a mediocre Lifetime movie. You sorely want to give the stars the benefit of the doubt and credit them with a comedic masterpiece, given their rsums. But, gosh, it sure looked like a mediocre Lifetime movie.

title: Whats That Science Thing: Pluto Flyby Edition
description: What is the SWAP instrument aboard the New Horizons spacecraft and how much energy does it use? Try our quiz if you think you know the answer.

title: Crossing the Line Festival Announces 2015 Lineup
description: The interdisciplinary Crossing the Line festival, organized by the French Institute Alliance Franaise, has announced its 2015 lineup, which includes several premieres. The festival will run from Sept. 10 through Oct. 4 and begin with the United States premiere of Suite n2, a concert by the French artist Joris Lacoste. The British artist Shezad Dawood will delve into the aftereffects of Hurricane Sandy in It was a time that was a time, a post-apocalyptic film shot in Far Rockaway, Queens; on Coney Island; and on Staten Island. The films world premiere will be on Sept. 11. Other artists from around the world also have premieres planned: The Brazilian artist Gustavo Ciriaco and the Austrian artist Andrea Sonnberger will bind themselves together and walk through Red Hook (Sept. 19-20); the New York choreographer Miguel Gutierrez will dance his way through the past, present and future in Age & Beauty (Sept. 16-26); and the French photographers Mazaccio & Drowilal, who repurpose images from popular culture, will have their first New York exhibition, at the French Institutes gallery. More information is at fiaf.org/ctl.

title: Justice Anthony Kennedys Tolerance Is Seen in His Sacramento Roots
description: SACRAMENTO  In the fall of 1987, a package arrived on the desk of Laurence H. Tribe, a Harvard law professor who had just lost a Supreme Court case on gay rights. It contained the legal opinions of Anthony M. Kennedy, a strait-laced, conservative Republican jurist from Sacramento who hardly seemed sympathetic to that cause.

title: Hitler Paintings Are Sold at Auction for $440,000
description: Fourteen watercolor paintings and drawings presumed to be the work of a young Adolf Hitler were sold at auction in Germany for $440,000 (about 391,000 euros), the German news service Deutsche-Presse Agentur reported. The most expensive artwork, a watercolor signed by A. Hitler, of the Neuschwanstein Castle in Bavaria was sold to an unnamed buyer from China at the Weidler auction house in Nuremberg for over $113,000 (100,000 euros); a still life of carnations fetched over $82,000 (73,000 euros), according to Deutsche-Presse Agentur. The art dates from 1904 to 1922 and includes a female nude, scenes of Vienna and Prague, and a portrait of a girl. The collection sold for substantially more than the $143,00 paid at a British auction in 2009 for a group of 13 paintings attributed to Hitler. Last year, the Weidler auction house sold a watercolor said to have been painted by Hitler to an unnamed buyer from the Middle East for around $161,000.

title: California Golf Trip Lands Obama in a Water-Use Debate
description: RANCHO MIRAGE, Calif.  With four fund-raisers and an awkward reconciliation with the House minority leader, Nancy Pelosi, behind him, President Obama returned to a beloved golf oasis here for a weekend getaway with friends.

title: Archive of Captured Enemy Documents Closes
description: WASHINGTON  It was a bold vision: The American military had captured a massive cache of enemy documents, including detailed records of Saddam Husseins high command in Iraq and Qaeda records from Afghanistan. With the strong support of Robert M. Gates, then the defense secretary, the plan was to set up a center where the documents and even captured audio recordings would be available to scholars outside government.

title: A Show of Solidarity in Harlem Churches After Charleston Killings
description: The hurt could be felt in the solemnity of Sunday sermons and read on the faces of those seated in the pews for the first services in New York City since a white gunman killed nine black churchgoers last week during a Bible study in Charleston, S.C.

title: Frederick P. Li, Who Proved a Genetic Cancer Link, Dies at 75
description: Dr. Frederick P. Li, who helped prove to a doubting medical establishment that heredity and genetics play a major role in some forms of cancer, died on June 12 at his home in Brookline, Mass. He was 75.

title: States Take Few Steps to Fill Gap if Supreme Court Blocks Health Subsidies
description: WASHINGTON  As the Supreme Court prepares to rule on whether to block health insurance subsidies in 34 states that use the federal insurance exchange, Pennsylvania and Delaware are the best prepared. They have submitted detailed plans for creating their own exchanges by next year, a move intended to keep subsidies flowing to their residents, though possibly with an interruption.

title: The City From the Air
description: Dear Diary:

title: Fissures in E.U. Deepen From Strain of Migrant Influx and Greek Debt
description: BRATISLAVA, Slovakia  As Europe struggles to keep Greece from default and to hold its common currency together, violent protests against immigration in Slovakia and election results in Denmark over the weekend have strengthened the forces of disunion unleashed by an impassioned debate over how to deal with a flood of migrants from conflict zones.

title: Charles Correa, 84, Is Dead; Architect Fused Indias History With Modernism
description: NEW DELHI  Charles Correa, an American-trained architect who returned to his native India to pioneer a new, indigenous architectural style, melding 20th-century modernism with Indian traditions, died on Tuesday in Mumbai. He was 84.

title: Pressure on Greece and a Senate Hearing on the Takata Recall
description: National leaders from eurozone nations are expected to come together in a summit meeting Monday evening to tell Greece to come to terms or face the prospect of becoming the first country forced out of the single-currency union. Donald Tusk, the president of the European Council, who organized the emergency meeting in Brussels, warned Athens that it faced a critical choice on terms that had already been clearly outlined. Finance ministers from the 18 other countries in the eurozone are expected to hold another round of talks with Greece on Monday, before the meeting.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of June 22
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: In Charleston, a Millennial Race Terrorist
description: You dont have to do this, said Tywanza Sanders to the young man who suddenly rose and drew a gun, and according to witnesses, said he was there to shoot black people.

title: Cannes Lions Festival Shifts Focus Toward Ad Technology
description: CANNES, France  Fetes on yachts. Magnums of ros. Kim Kardashian.

title: Engaging in a Softer Conversation About the Roar From New Yorks Airports
description: Susan Carroll has developed a tender relationship with the noise monitor on the roof of her apartment building in Queens. She refers to it as my monitor (even though she does not own it) and checks on it daily to make sure it is still working (even though she does not operate it).

title: Sheldon Silver, Unbowed by Charges, Adjusts to Life After the Speakership
description: ALBANY  The last five months have not been kind to Sheldon Silver. Arrested in January, indicted in February and forced out as Assembly speaker in between, Mr. Silver has seen his influence in the Capitol wane.

title: Health Insurers Brace for Supreme Court Ruling
description: Their industry already upended with the passage of the federal health care law, insurance companies are facing another upheaval if the Supreme Court rules that millions of Americans are not eligible for subsidies to help defray the cost of their coverage.

title: Few Echo Popes Environment Plea in Sunday Sermons
description: On the first Sunday after Pope Francis issued a landmark document on the environment, Roman Catholics attending Mass in Kenya, France, Mexico, Peru and the United States said they were thankful that he was using his pulpit to address climate change, pollution and global inequality.

title: Womens World Cup 2015: Cultural Victories to Go With On-the-Field Ones
description: EDMONTON, Alberta  Colombia has already scored one of the greatest upsets in the history of the Womens World Cup, defeating third-ranked France, 2-0, in group play. On Monday comes the hunt for a bigger trophy: the United States.

title: Comcast and NBCUniversal Open Cross-Promotional Ad Strategy
description: When Microsoft wanted to promote its Surface Pro 3 tablet during the last holiday season, it turned to NBCUniversal for help. Together, the companies came up with a sweeping marketing campaign, with pieces showing up across NBCUniversals broadcast and cable channels, social media platforms, websites and within the companys shows.

title: They Dont Forgo the Fungo in College Baseball
description: OMAHA  One of the lasting daily traditions at the College World Series began about 40 minutes before Louisiana State faced Cal State Fullerton on Tuesday afternoon. And hundreds of fans crowded around the railing at TD Ameritrade Park under sunny skies to see it.

title: Gunther Schuller Dies at 89; Composer Synthesized Classical and Jazz
description: Gunther Schuller, a composer, conductor, author and teacher who coined the term Third Stream to describe music that drew on the forms and resources of both classical and jazz, and who was its most important composer, died on Sunday in Boston. He was 89.

title: Brian Williams Scandal Shows Power of Social Media
description: The soldiers who prompted Brian Williamss fall from one of the most powerful jobs in the media had first tried to blow the whistle on him in 2003.

title: N.Y.C.F.C. Said to Be Adding Andrea Pirlo of Italy
description: New York City F.C. has all but finalized negotiations with Andrea Pirlo, a 36-year-old Italian midfielder who is set to join the club at the end of the week as a third designated player, according to a soccer official who was briefed on the negotiations.

title: N.H.L. Seems Likely to Boldly Expand to Las Vegas Strip
description: LAS VEGAS  In a city built on chance, it feels like a safe bet that the N.H.L. will become the first major professional sports league to plant a franchise in this gambling and entertainment oasis in the desert.

title: Nun in Central India Is Sexually Assaulted
description: NEW DELHI  A 45-year-old nun was sexually assaulted in a medical center where she worked near the capital of the central Indian state of Chhattisgarh, a police official in the area said Sunday. The nun was found gagged and tied to a bed, he said.

title: Review: Ada/Ava, a Conjuring of Loneliness and Comfort in Plain Sight
description: The common wisdom is that once magicians reveal the secrets of their trade, the magic disappears. But thats hardly the case with the uncanny coven of young sorcerers who operate under the name Manual Cinema.

title: Poldark Season Premiere Recap: Woe v. Luck
description: Season 1, Episode 1

title: True Detective Season 2 Premiere Recap: All the Gold in California
description: Season 2, Episode 1, The Western Book of the Dead

title: New Summer, and New Face at Top, for the Fresh Air Fund
description: The Fresh Air Fund is preparing for a changing of its top leadership as it sends thousands of children from urban neighborhoods in New York City on vacations in the country this summer.

title: Hundreds Mourn Debbie Frank, Westchester Fitness Heroine
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y.  Debbie Frank was not as celebrated among exercise gurus as, say, Jane Fonda or Richard Simmons, but in the tidy suburban towns of southern Westchester County and among hundreds of women and a few men whose bodies  and self-confidence  she helped transform, she was a local hero.

title: U.S. Open 2015: Jordan Spieth, Not Yet 22, Is 2 for 2 in This Years Majors
description: UNIVERSITY PLACE, Wash.  Chambers Bay Golf Course had already served as the backdrop for one big event in the life of the 21-year-old Jordan Spieth. A month after Spieth won his first pro event as a PGA Tour rookie, he was a witness at a wedding on the grounds between his caddie, Michael Greller, and the former Ellie Morris.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: What lit the fire under this was the tragic death of my friend and his eight parishioners. It took my buddys death to get me to do this. I should feel ashamed of myself.

title: De Blasio Adds His Voice to Debate Over Dominican Deportation Law
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio went to Washington Heights in Upper Manhattan on Sunday to talk about international relations. The topic could hardly have been closer to home for the neighborhood, the center of the Dominican community in New York City.

title: Jason Day Finishes Out of the Race, but Finishes Nonetheless
description: UNIVERSITY PLACE, Wash.  Jason Day looked steady on the practice tee before Sundaysfourth round of the United States Open. Gone were the wobbly strides from Saturday. He stood straight and moved with a purpose. With powerful swings, he smashed soaring drives, and with precision, he fired crisp iron shots.

title: Colette Marchand, Glamorous International Ballet Star, Dies at 90
description: Colette Marchand, a French ballerina whose long-legged glamour made her an international star in Roland Petits ballets in the 1940s and 1950s, and who was nominated for an Oscar for her role in John Hustons Moulin Rouge, died on June 5 at her home in Bois-le-Roi, France. She was 90.

title: Word of the Day | guise
description: guise  \giz\  noun

title: Whats On TV Monday
description: 10 P.M. (Starz Cinema) THE FRENCH LIEUTENANTS WOMAN (1981) Meryl Streep earned her third Oscar nomination portraying Anna, an actress whose love affair with a co-star, Mike (Jeremy Irons), mirrors the doomed relationship in 1867 England between Sarah, a lowborn governess, and Charles, a French naval officer, in the film they are making. Harold Pinter also received an Oscar nomination for his screenplay adaptation of John Fowless novel, to which he added the parallel story of Anna and Mike. Writing in The New York Times, Vincent Canby called this drama from Karel Reisz an astonishingly beautiful film.

title: White Supremacist Who Influenced Charleston Suspect Donated to 2016 G.O.P. Campaigns
description: The leader of a white supremacist group that apparently influenced Dylann Roof, the suspect in the killing of nine African-Americans in a Charleston, S.C., church last week, has donated tens of thousands of dollars to Republican campaigns, including those of 2016 presidential contenders such as Ted Cruz, Rick Santorum and Rand Paul, records show.

title: Dustin Johnsons Dream Turns Real on No. 18, Then Nightmare Sets In
description: UNIVERSITY PLACE, Wash.  Dustin Johnson walked arm in arm with his fiance Sunday night toward the players locker room, and a swift exit from Chambers Bay Golf Course. Up the hill, the award celebration for the 115th United States Open was taking place without Johnson, who had tied for second with Louis Oosthuizen, one stroke behind the champion, Jordan Spieth.

title: Sunday at the Womens World Cup
description: SUNDAYS RESULTS

title: Corrections: June 22, 2015
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: A 30-Year American Road Trip
description: Its summertime, so millions of Americans are gassing up the car, loading up the kids and hitting the highway for that most American of rituals: the road trip. Big skies, roadside attractions and unending byways feature deeply in the national mythology, and in the history of photography, too. For David Graham, exploring the nooks and crannies of this large country has been his lifes work.

title: Our Seafood Choices: Health and Sustainability
description: To the Editor:

title: An Israeli-Palestinian Peace Dividend, in Dollars
description: To the Editor:

title: Justice for Juveniles
description: To the Editor:

title: Slaverys Long Shadow
description: America is a much less racist nation than it used to be, and Im not just talking about the still remarkable fact that an African-American occupies the White House. The raw institutional racism that prevailed before the civil rights movement ended Jim Crow is gone, although subtler discrimination persists. Individual attitudes have changed, too, dramatically in some cases. For example, as recently as the 1980s half of Americans opposed interracial marriage, a position now held by only a tiny minority.

title: White Supremacists Without Borders
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala.  A VARIETY of clues to the motives of Dylann Storm Roof, the suspect in last weeks mass shooting at Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in Charleston, S.C., have emerged. First, we saw the patches he wore on his jacket in a Facebook photo: the flags of regimes in South Africa and Rhodesia that brutally enforced white minority rule.

title: Obstacles to Economic Growth
description: In its latest forecast, which was issued last week, the Federal Reserve said it expected average economic growth this year of 1.9 percent, a marked drop from previous forecasts. As recently as March, it was projecting 2.5 percent, and a year ago, it projected 3.1 percent.

title: Republicans Take Aim at Poor Women
description: One would imagine that congressional Republicans, almost all of whom are on record as adamantly opposing abortion, would be eager to fund programs that help reduce the number of unwanted pregnancies.

title: Who Owns Your Overtime?
description: A LITTLE-NOTICED but important change in the American workplace is about to occur. Sometime in the next month, the Department of Labor is expected to announce an adjustment to the Fair Labor Standards Act. The change will raise the salary threshold for overtime. Currently, if you are a salaried employee and make less than $23,660 per year, you are eligible for time and a half pay for any hours over 40 per week. The update, which is likely to at least double that threshold, will affect millions of salaried employees.

title: The Detention of Immigrant Families From Central America
description: To the Editor:

title: The Fantasy Mr. Putin Is Selling
description: President Vladimir Putin of Russia is not veering from the mythology he created to explain away the crisis over Ukraine. It is one that wholly blames the West for provoking a new Cold War and insists that international sanctions have not grievously wounded his countrys flagging economy.

title: Test Your Punctuation | Robotic Dogs
description: Were trying an experiment with this edition of Test Yourself and focusing on punctuation rather than vocabulary.

title: Williams Companies Rejects $48 Billion Takeover Offer
description: LONDON  Nearly four years ago, the Williams Companies and Energy Transfer Equity battled to take over a rival oil and gas pipeline operator.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Keila Merino: Ultramarathoner and Fourth Grade Teacher
description: In For a Teacher, Back-to-Back Marathons, Then Fourth-Graders, Jonathan Schienberg writes about one of the top ultramarathoners in the country who also teaches fourth grade in New York City.

title: Indonesia Rejects Appeal by French Drug Convict on Death Row
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  An Indonesian court rejected on Monday an appeal of a French drug convict, potentially reigniting international tensions over the countrys use of the death penalty for serious narcotics offenses.

title: Obama Lowers His Guard in Unusual Displays of Emotion
description: WASHINGTON  His eyes well up without warning in private, thinking about his teenage daughters growing up. He choked back tears in public recently while delivering a eulogy for Beau Biden, the son of Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr., who died at 46.

title: Buildings Amenities Include Downtown Brooklyn Culture
description: The ecstatic moans echoed across the outdoor terrace at 66 Rockwell Place, audible even over the rush of traffic below on Flatbush Avenue. Some of those seated on the rattan patio furniture and folding chairs chuckled and gasped. Others rustled through their small bags of popcorn or sipped on plastic goblets of ros.

title: Greece and Its Creditors Show Signs of Headway in Debt Talks
description: BRUSSELS  Greece and its international creditors seemed on Monday to be edging nearer an agreement in their debt negotiations, after Athens submitted new proposals that would raise money through new taxes and cut costs by fine-tuning the nations pension system.

title: Taliban Attack Afghan Parliament
description: Video shows the moment a suicide bomb went off during a session in the Parliament building in Kabul, Afghanistan, on Monday.

title: Taliban Strike Afghan Parliament as Lawmakers Meet
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The Taliban attacked the Afghan Parliament on Monday just as lawmakers were convening for their third attempt to confirm a defense minister, while in northern Afghanistan a second district fell to Taliban insurgents.

description: Pardon the clich, but it happens to be particularly apt in this case: In trying to tame the nations obesity epidemic, an ounce of prevention is decidedly worth a pound of cure  considerably more than a pound, in fact, according to the findings of a five-year collaborative research project.

description: HAVERFORD, Pa.  Guatemala is in political turmoil. In April a United Nations commission exposed a multimillion-dollar network of customs fraud, operating within the countrys tax authority and involving a web of customs agents and high-ranking government officials, including the vice presidents personal secretary.

description: The eerie glow of millipedes in the dark is the kind of natural phenomenon that captivates Paul Marek, an entomologist at Virginia Tech.

description: When I rented my first city apartment, I discovered it came with a roommate. We did better than make do: We bonded.

title: Medical Insurance Is Good for Financial Health, Too
description: People who have health insurance have less health-related financial stress. Thats a not-so surprising finding from a recent survey from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

title: Today in Politics: Republicans Face Unsteady Path After Charleston Shooting
description: Good Monday morning from Washington. Though trade is still a source of gamesmanship and huge Supreme Court decisions could come down at any moment, all eyes are on Charleston, S.C., where crowds on Sunday spilled out of the church in which nine black churchgoers were killed on Wednesday by a white gunman.

Time for a New Black Radicalism

title: Morning Agenda: E.C.B.s Awkward Spot in Greek Crisis
description: E.C.B.S AWKWARD SPOT IN GREEK CRISIS  | As billions of euros are being withdrawn from Greek banks, the European Central Bank has stepped in with emergency funding to keep the countrys banking system from collapsing. Yet as it acts as the savior of Greeces financial system, the E.C.B. is also playing the role of the countrys scold, refusing to budge on debt relief,  Landon Thomas Jr. and Peter Eavis write in DealBook. This tension in many ways mirrors Europes broader dilemma of how to handle Greece, they write. Should lending lines to the country be renewed, in the interest of keeping the eurozone intact? Or should Greece, having demanded too much from Europe, not be bailed out again?

title: U.N. Report on Gaza Finds Evidence of War Crimes by Israel and by Palestinian Militants
description: JERUSALEM  A United Nations Commission of Inquiry on last summers war in the Gaza Strip  taking pains to be evenhanded  found that both Israel and Palestinian militants were responsible for violations of international law that could amount to war crimes. But each side interpreted the commissions long-awaited report according to its own version of the Middle East conflict.

title: CVC Capital and Investment Partners Acquire Stake in Alvogen

description: On the first day back to work after the death of Dave Goldberg, the chief executive of SurveyMonkey, employees at the Silicon Valley company gathered to mourn, Quentin Hardy writes.

title: Leaders of South Korea and Japan Speak of Improving Ties
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The leaders of South Korea and Japan called on Monday for their countries to leave behind historical disputes and improve ties, a rare exchange of conciliatory remarks that came as the leaders observed the 50th anniversary of diplomatic relations at embassy events in their capitals.

description: WASHINGTON  The Army has reprimanded a once highly regarded general involved in the war against the Islamic State because he guided a defense contract to a company run by his former classmates at West Point, a move that effectively ends his military career, military officials said Monday.

title: 1965: Algerians Protest in Moscow
description: MOSCOW  A group of Algerian students in Moscow called today [June 23] for the overthrow of the military regime headed by Col. Houari Boumedienne and the restoration of President Ahmed Ben Bella. A spokesman for the students met reporters outside the locked gate of the Algerian embassy in downtown Moscow. The spokesman declined to allow photos to be taken of the group of about 30 students who argued strongly against the statement condemning Col. Boumediennes takeover. It said, We call on all Algerian people to rise against the military dictatorship which is being forced on them.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, June 23, 1965

title: U.N. on Gaza Conflict Report Findings
description: Mary McGowan Davis, the chairwoman of the Human Rights Councils inquiry into the 2014 battle in Gaza, said on Monday that both Israel and the Palestinians may be guilty of war crimes.

title: Pringle of Scotland, Moncler, Ferragamo and Marni Offer Different Versions of theFashion Show
description: MILAN  In the same way that when you stare at a picture too long its contours seem to blur, or if you repeat a word over and over to yourself its meaning gets lost, there is often a moment during the unbroken string of fashion weeks that stretch from London to New York when you say to yourself, Wait a minute. What is a fashion show? Though, given the shows currently on view in Milan, the better question might be, what isnt?

title: The Inevitability of Yellow Teeth
description: Q. Why do teeth turn yellow with age? Is there any way to prevent it?

title: Prada and Gucci Advance the Gender Blur, Plus Reviews of Calvin Klein and Missoni
description: MILAN  Hanging floor to ceiling and wall to wall around a gallery in month-old Fondazione Prada on the outskirts of this city, there are dozens of paintings belonging to Miuccia Prada and Patrizio Bertelli. The salon-style installation plays off the time-honored convention of collectors exhibiting their holdings as a way of displaying their superior tastes.

title: Making a Point, Obama Invokes a Painful Slur
description: WASHINGTON  It was a single word, just six letters long, but one that has not been spoken by an American president in public for generations.

title: Grand Slam, Rarest of Feats, Is Within Reach
description: At 21, Jordan Spieth has won his second major and become the most celebrated player in golf. He is also halfway to one of the most difficult feats in sports, the Grand Slam. Indeed, difficult may be selling the challenge short. In its modern incarnation, no one has ever completed a Grand Slam in golf, and no one has come especially close.

title: Fashions Latest Accessory: The Law
description: With intellectual property issues (like who owns the rights to red soles on shoes?), 3-D printing and its implications for counterfeiting, domain-name squatting, and violations of corporate social responsibility in the supply chain (the Rana Plaza collapse in Bangladesh), it seems that one fashion brand or another is always in court lately, or trying to settle out of court.

title: Reader Spotlight: Plaudits (Mostly) for Charleston Coverage
description: Updated, June 23, 2015.

description: A super PAC that focuses on opposition research is planning to invest heavily in efforts to tie Republican candidates to the Koch brothers, oil tycoons whom Democrats have maligned in the last three national elections.

description: As a schoolgirl in Oakville, on the Canadian side of Lake Ontario, Emily Braun was often dismayed to find a pheasant sandwich in her lunchbox.

title: Disagreement Over Common Core Reading Lists: Reporters Notebook
description: I looked into how the Common Core had changed school reading lists  the subject of a story I wrote for Saturdays paper  after a parent mentioned to me that she had noticed a big shift toward nonfiction in her daughters elementary school.

title: DNA Matching 2 Escapees Is Found in Cabin 15 Miles From Prison
description: OWLS HEAD, N.Y.  DNA matching that of the two killers who escaped from a northern New York prison more than two weeks ago was found in a remote hunting cabin 15 heavily wooded miles west of the prison in Dannemora, an official briefed on the investigation said on Monday.

title: Al Jazeera Journalist Is Released by Germany
description: BERLIN  The German authorities on Monday released an Egyptian-British journalist from the television news network Al Jazeera, after widespread outrage over his detention by police officers acting on an Egyptian request.

title: Russia Assails Extension of E.U. Sanctions in Ukraine Crisis
description: MOSCOW  Kremlin officials reacted furiously Monday to the European Unions extension of sanctions on Russia through January, calling the measure self-defeating and accusing the West of crass anti-Russian bias by timing the decision to the nations commemoration of the Soviet victims of World War II.

title: Candidates Join Confederate Flag Debate in South Carolina
description: For presidential candidates, the killing of nine churchgoers in Charleston, S.C., turned into a litmus test on the Confederate flag over the weekend. As the campaigns gather pace, debate over whether the Civil War-era symbol should still fly is expected to linger.

title: Mens Designers Embrace Velvet for Spring 2016
description: Velvet continues to pop up throughout the weeks presentations, as in this standout ivory crushed-velvet jacket at Marc Jacobs.

title: Congolese Children, Adopted Years Ago, May Soon Be Permitted to Travel to New Homes
description: Nicole Craigs nearly 3-year-old daughter, Elisabeth Grace, carries a ring of laminated family photos everywhere she goes. She sleeps with them and kisses them and she will tell everyone, This is my daddy, or This is my brother Alex, this is my brother Kaden. She knows she has a family, Ms. Craig said over the phone from Green Bay, Wis.

title: Steve Humbles Neighbor Problem

title: Pollution May Age the Brain
description: Exposure to air pollution may hasten brain aging, a new study has found.

title: Putting Stents to the Test
description: Millions of Americans have had stents  small wire cages  inserted in their coronary arteries to prop them open. And many are convinced the devices are protecting them from heart attacks. After all, a partly blocked artery is now cleared, and the pain in a heart muscle starved of blood often vanishes once the artery is open again.

title: Surgery for Knee Pain May Not Provide Benefits
description: People in their 50s and older often get arthroscopic surgery for knee pain, but a new review of studies suggests that it has serious risks and no lasting benefits.

title: Martha Stewarts Media Empire Sold for Fraction of Its Former Value
description: At its peak, Martha Stewarts media empire, built around her carefully curated and fussily decorated lifestyle brand, was worth well over $1 billion.

title: Virginia Judge Approves Deal to Keep Sweet Briar College Open
description: WASHINGTON  A circuit court judge in Virginia on Monday approved a settlement that will allow Sweet Briar College to remain open for at least another academic year, as an alumnae group called on students and faculty to return to the financially troubled womens college in rural Virginia.

title: The New Serpentine Gallery Pavilion Surprises With a Cafe at Its Center
description: In the same month that Carsten Hller has transformed Londons South Bank into the cultural equivalent of a theme park (giant slides are the centerpiece of his Hayward Gallery show, Decision) comes one of the most playful and unpretentious Serpentine Gallery Pavilions in its 15-year history. A series of supersynthetic tunnels comprised of fluorine-based plastic, this latest commission looks like a psychedelic space camp parked on the immaculate lawns of Kensington Gardens. Its the colorful creation of the Spanish architects Selgas Cano, a little-known husband-and-wife team whose studio sits in a woodland outside Madrid. (Previous architects have included Oscar Niemeyer and Zaha Hadid.) The hope is that visitors to the pavilion, which opens to the public this week, will be propelled on a voyage of discovery (or at the very least, to the cafethat sits at its heart).

title: Focus on the Opportunities, Not the Shoals
description: More than a decade ago, I learned how to kayak. I practiced in the pool a few times before deciding to test my skills on the river. For one of my first trips, my wife and I traveled to the Snake River just below Jackson Hole, Wyo. We planned to paddle a stretch of the river known as Alpine Canyon. A friend who happened to be a very experienced paddler joined us.

title: When Retirement Savings Are Unsafe
description: The Department of Labor is about midway through a public comment period on its fiduciary rule proposal to require financial advisers to act solely in their clients best interests when giving advice and selling investments for retirement accounts.

title: Indonesia Court Rejects Convicts Appeal
description: An Indonesian court on Monday denied clemency to a French man on death row for drug offenses, though his lawyer pledged to look for other legal options to overturn the decision.

title: 1940: Churchill Urges French to Fight
description: LONDON  In a desperate attempt to keep the French resistance wherever the will to resist still remains outside the areas held by the Germans, Prime Minister Winston Churchill early today appealed to all Frenchmen to carry on the fight. The British Prime Minister spoke over the head of the French Government and in effect urged Frenchmen to ignore its action in signing the armistice. This is the meaning of the calamity which the French governments decision to accept the Germans terms is considered here to be. In his appeal, Churchill made it clear that British resistance would continue.  New York Herald Tribune, June 23, 1940

title: Almaty, Kazakhstan, Battles Perceptions and Beijing in 2022 Olympic Bid
description: ALMATY, Kazakhstan  The last time this happened  that is, the last time a former Soviet republic from Central Asia bid to host an Olympics  the entire thing was a joke. A lark. A laugh.

title: Uber Data Collection Changes Should Be Barred, Privacy Group Urges

title: TV Analyst and Former Met Darryl Hamilton Is Fatally Shot
description: Darryl Hamilton, an outfielder for the Mets on their last pennant-winning team, was shot to death on Sunday at a home in suburban Houston.

title: Picture This? Some Just Cant
description: Certain people, researchers have discovered, cant summon up mental images  its as if their minds eye is blind. This month in the journal Cortex, the condition received a name: aphantasia, based on the Greek word phantasia, which Aristotle used to describe the power that presents visual imagery to our minds.

title: Fendi: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: Milan

title: John Neumeier, Choreographer, Wins $400,000 Kyoto Prize
description: The American-born choreographer John Neumeier, who has been the artistic director of the Hamburg Ballet since 1973, is one of the recipients of the 2015 Kyoto Prize, established in 1985 by the Inamori Foundation in Japan to honor those who have contributed significantly to the scientific, cultural and spiritual betterment of mankind.

title: At Art Basel, a More Refined Kind of Pop-Up Club
description: It was quite late on Tuesday night in Switzerland  just hours before the next mornings First Choice VIP opening of Art Basel  but the bar at the Grand Hotel Trois Rois was packed. Leonardo DiCaprio sauntered through, sucking on an e-cigarette. Steven A. Cohen, the billionaire who has dropped $240 million on Giacomettis in the past year, chatted casually with a few dealers. The artist Rirkrit Tiravanija never removed his red sunglasses amid the smoke-filled room; the fashion world darling Peter Brant II sat with a chair-hopping contingent of the cosmopolitan and well-groomed; and Larry Gagosian  the king of the worlds most powerful gallery empire  sat casually in a plush velvet booth, greeting well-wishers.

title: Nikki Haley, South Carolina Governor, Calls for Removal of Confederate Battle Flag
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  Gov. Nikki R. Haley called on Monday for South Carolina to do what just a week ago seemed politically impossible  remove the Confederate battle flag from its perch in front of the State House building here. She argued that a symbol long revered by many Southerners was for some, after the church massacre in Charleston, a deeply offensive symbol of a brutally offensive past.

title: The Look of an Olympic City
description: Images from Almaty, Kazakhstan, which, along with Beijing, is try to be the host city of the 2022 Winter Olympics.

title: Egyptian Women Defy Protest Ban to Call for Release of Political Prisoners

title: Fox Makes Its Debut at the Open, and at Times It Seems Like an Amateur
description: For Greg Norman, it was a moment to define himself in his first United States Open as the lead analyst. Dustin Johnson was on the 18th green on Sunday with a chance to win if he sank an eagle putt. What was Normans assessment of the putt? Would it go left or right? What sort of speed should he put on it? Norman said nothing. Johnson missed.

title: E.P.A. Warns of High Cost of Climate Change
description: WASHINGTON  In the absence of global action to curb greenhouse gas emissions, the United States by the end of the century may face up to $180 billion in economic losses because of drought and water shortages, according to a report released Monday by the White House and Environmental Protection Agency.

title: Leopold Brothers Offers a Homegrown Version of Campari
description: Leopold Brothers, a small-batch distiller in Denver, has done an admirable job of making homegrown versions of classic European spirits like triple sec and maraschino. Now it has taken on Campari. This version, called Aperitivo, opens sweetly (less sweet than the Italian original), then comes across delightfully dry, bitter and citric. Its vibrant color is not artificial, but is from cochineal (insects): Leopold Brothers Aperitivo, $34.99 for 750 milliliters from klwines.com.

title: Supreme Court Sides With Raisin Farmers in Property Rights Case
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court  ruled on Monday that a government program dating to the Great Depression meant to increase raisin prices by keeping some of them off the market amounted to an unconstitutional taking of private property by the government.

title: Jimmy Lee of JPMorgan Chase Remembered for Shaping an Industry
description: James B. Lee Jr., a towering figure on Wall Street, was remembered at his funeral Mass on Monday as a father, a friend and an investment banker possessed of boundless energy, sprawling interests and a crackling wit, qualities that made him one of the most successful and beloved figures in his industry.

title: Hundreds Die in Heat Wave in Southern Pakistan
description: KARACHI, Pakistan   An intense heat wave has left at least 260 people dead over three days in southern Pakistan, mostly here in the port city of Karachi, officials said Monday, prompting the government to declare an emergency at hospitals and to ask the military to help respond to the crisis.

title: Cancer Doctors Offer Way to Compare Medicines, Including by Cost
description: Alarmed by the rapid escalation in the price of cancer drugs, the nations leading oncology society unveiled on Monday a new way for doctors and patients to evaluate different treatments  one that pointedly includes a medicines cost as well as its effectiveness and side effects.

description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday struck down a Los Angeles ordinance that allowed the police to inspect hotel and motel guest registries without permission from a judge. In a second decision, the court clarified the standards for excessive force claims against corrections officers from people awaiting trial.

description: WASHINGTON  A major human rights organization on Monday accused the World Bank of doing little or nothing when critics of its projects are harassed and intimidated by governments that benefit from its loans.

With the Higgs now in the bag, researchers are setting their sights on more exotic fare: signs of a new physics that not only describes the universe but explains why it is the way it is.

title: 2013 And All That
description: Those who can, cite evidence to support their position; those who cannot play gotcha. Events have overwhelmingly supported a Keynesian view of the effects of fiscal policy, but the anti-Keynesians have responded, not by reconsidering their views, but by seeking to discredit the messengers. In particular, theres a lot of Krugman said X would happen, and it didnt, so Keynesian economics is wrong. And in particular particular, the experience of 2013  when British growth accelerated, and US growth continued despite the budget sequester, is claimed as some sort of decisive experiment.

title: In Milan, the Mens Fashion Crowd Practices Magazine Diplomacy
description: MILAN  In fashion, as Heidi Klum has made a television career of opining, one day youre in, and the next day youre out.

title: E.U. Begins Naval Operation in Mediterranean to Stop Trafficking of Migrants
description: ROME  The European Union on Monday began the first phase of a naval operation in the Mediterranean that aims to stop the trafficking of tens of thousands of migrants seeking better lives in Europe. The initial phase will involve surveillance, intelligence gathering and patrolling to identify and monitor human smuggling and trafficking networks in the south central Mediterranean. The operation, Eunavfor Med, based in Rome, also calls for the capture and destruction of the ships used by traffickers. Those phases, however, will require a United Nations Security Council resolution and the consent of the Libyan authorities.

title: Cami Anderson, Picked by Christie, Is Out as Newark Schools Superintendent
description: Cami Anderson, the superintendent of the Newark public school system who became a lightning rod in the debate over education reform in New Jersey and nationally, resigned on Monday, eight months before her contract was to expire.

title: Gov. Larry Hogan of Maryland to Stay in Office While Advanced Cancer Is Treated
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md.  Gov. Larry Hogan of Maryland, a little-known former real estate executive whose upset victory in November thrust this overwhelmingly Democratic state into Republican hands for the first time in nearly a decade, announced Monday that he had a very advanced cancer of the lymphatic system but would continue to serve while undergoing treatment.

description: Milan

title: Review: Meg Baird, Always Generous, Gives Even More in New Album
description: MEG BAIRD

title: In Spider-Man Toy Patent Case, Supreme Court Stands by Past Decision
description: WASHINGTON  Writing for the majority in a patent case about a Spider-Man toy, Justice Elena Kagan concluded her decision with a quotation from a 1962 Spider-Man comic book: In this world, with great power there must also come  great responsibility.

title: Skylight Closes Out Run With Healthy Box Office
description: The Broadway revival of Skylight closed out its Tony-winning run with one more bragging right: the most revenue ever grossed in a single week at the John Golden Theater.

title: Review: Graham Swifts England and Other Stories, a Darkness Across Time and Fates
description: An undertow of melancholy tugs at Graham Swifts characters, threatening to pull them under  or at least backward. Time is a Mbius strip in his stories  time present contiguous with a Faulknerian time past and shadowed by secrets the reader only slowly pieces together. This is true of Mr. Swifts early work, like Waterland, and his Booker Prize-winning novel, Last Orders, and its truer still of his new collection, England and Other Stories.

title: Stream the New EP From Class Actress (With an Assist From the Disco Legend Giorgio Moroder)
description: When the singer Elizabeth Harper, who records as Class Actress, signed to Casablanca Records  the storied disco label that relaunched as an electronic dance label as part of Republic in 2000  she knew right away that she wanted to make her new EP (her third album as Class Actress) with a legend. I started doing research on the history of Casablanca, and found that it was such an epitome of drugs and Hollywood glamour  it had a whole Studio 54 vibe. And Giorgio Moroder had written every hit on the label.

title: Pete Rose Placed Bets on Games as a Player, a Report Says
description: Even as he fills his present as a baseball analyst at Fox Sports 1 and prepares to be part of the official activities at the All-Star Game in Cincinnati on July 14, Pete Rose cannot escape his past.

title: June 22, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Pakistan, Russia, Kenya and Burundi.

title: Oklahoma! Reimagined: Less Cornpone, but Fresh Cornbread
description: While the team behind the current Broadway revival of The King and I was pondering potential Tony Award acceptance speeches the day before the ceremony, the team responsible for a rather different Rodgers and Hammerstein production was in a rehearsal room in Brooklyn working on an opening scene.

title: Gov. Haley on Removing Confederate Flag
description: Gov. Nikki R. Haley, Republican of South Carolina, on Monday called for removal of a Confederate battle flag from the State Capitol grounds.

title: Grading the Common Core: No Teaching Experience Required
description: SAN ANTONIO  The new academic standards known as the Common Core emphasize critical thinking, complex problem-solving and writing skills, and put less stock in rote learning and memorization. So the standardized tests given in most states this year required fewer multiple choice questions and far more writing on topics like this one posed to elementary school students: Read a passage from a novel written in the first person, and a poem written in the third person, and describe how the poem might change if it were written in the first person.

title: Review: Hand Foot Fizzle Face Explores Futility and Disconnection
description: If you have $30,000 to spare, then you, too, can own a first edition of Foirades/Fizzles, an unlikely 1976 artists book by Jasper Johns and Samuel Beckett. Etchings and aquatints  some playful, some troubling  accompany five gnomic prose works, or Fizzles, that Beckett translated from the French.

title: Iraqi Families Return to Fragile Stability in Tikrit After Liberation From ISIS
description: BAGHDAD  When Umm Ahmed returned to her Iraqi hometown, Tikrit, in recent days she found a city devastated by fighting with militants from the Islamic State: buildings burned, shops looted, schools shuttered and hospitals inoperable.

title: New York City Settles Suit Over Abuses at Rikers Island
description: New York City has agreed to a settlement in the long-running legal battle over abuses at Rikers Island, the countrys second-largest jail system, federal and city officials said on Monday.

title: The Timess Policy on Racial Slurs: Editors Notebook
description: When editors at The Timess morning news meeting on Monday talked about President Obamas podcast remarks to Marc Maron on racism, there was a brief discussion of how we would handle one part of the story:  the presidents use of a common racial slur in saying that racism wasnt eradicated simply because such slurs were no longer used in polite conversation.

title: Senior Republicans Follow Nikki Haleys Lead on Confederate Battle Flag
description: Tongue-tied over the issue for nearly a week, senior Republicans jumped on the bandwagon Monday and called for folding up the Confederate battle flag after Gov. Nikki Haley of South Carolina said the Civil War symbol should be removed from the state Capitol.

title: Review: Bang on a Can Marathon Stays as Eclectic and Playful as Ever
description: A musician dropping an instrument during a performance would usually be cause for alarm. And at first, so it was, as the ensemble So Percussion played on Sunday during the Bang on a Can Marathon in the Winter Garden at Brookfield Place in Lower Manhattan.

title: Review: In At the Table, a Menu of Identity-Based Arguments
description: Chris (Claire Karpen) has only just met this group of friends, so she probably shouldnt make a scene. But dinner is over, the alcohol is flowing and Stuart (Craig Wesley Divino)  the smug one up there at the head of the table  is being obnoxious. When he tries to bait her into debating abortion rights, she tells him the issue is none of his business, because he is a man.

title: Obama and Biden to Attend Funeral for Clementa Pinckney

title: Review: Aston Magna and Boston Early Music Festivals Offer Diverse Monteverdi Experiences
description: GREAT BARRINGTON, Mass.  The mighty wind of Monteverdi that blew through Boston a couple of weeks ago found its way here, to western Massachusetts, over the weekend. Perhaps because it was countering eastward meteorological tendencies across the state, it arrived much depleted.
