Mayor Jaime Daz said five people rescued from the home near the California border had been hospitalized. A local charity runs the home, Beautiful Twilight, which houses indigent elderly people. There was no immediate evidence of an electrical fault or gas leak, Mr. Daz said, and investigators were theorizing that the fire had been intentionally set.

title: A Timeline of Jews in Egypt
description: Here is a timeline of the history of Jews in Egypt, based in part on information provided by Professor Joel Beinin of Stanford University, author of The Dispersion of Egyptian Jewry.

title: Visible in Melbourne and Sydney
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  If the FIVE STARS  or asterisks  had been kept as the theme clues, as Ian Livengood says below in his notes, this would have been a much different puzzle. This would have been a tough Thursday or a themed Friday, in my estimation.

title: Poland: British Teenagers Are Charged With Stealing From Auschwitz Site
description: Two British teenagers have been charged with stealing items from the formerAuschwitz-Birkenaudeath camps, the spokeswoman for prosecutors in Krakow, Poland, said Tuesday. The unidentified Britons, ages 17 and 18, were arrested Monday during a field trip to the Auschwitz-Birkenau State Museum and accused of stealing artifacts, including a razor, buttons and pieces of glass and cutlery, which once belonged to prisoners at the camps. The maximum sentence for thetheft of items of special cultural importance is 10 years in prison, said Boguslawa Marcinkowska, the spokeswoman. Still, she suggested that more likely penalties for the teenagers, who were released Monday, would include fines, conditionally suspended prison sentences and probation.

title: New York City Wants to Study the Effects of For-Hire Car Industrys Expansion
description: New York City officials introduced a proposal on Tuesday to limit the number of new for-hire vehicles for services like Uber while they study how an influx of such cars has affected traffic.

title: Boeing Names Next C.E.O., Affirming Its Heir Apparent
description: Boeing said on Tuesday that its chief executive, W. James McNerney Jr., would step aside on July 1 and be succeeded by its second-ranking executive, Dennis A. Muilenburg, an aeronautical engineer who had widely been seen as the heir apparent.

title: A Layover Ends in Penny-Stock Scheme Arrest
description: A man suspected of being the mastermind of a $300 million penny-stock trading scheme is in federal custody because the international flight he was traveling on from Canada to Mexico made a brief stop in Phoenix.

title: Colombia: 17 Are Indicted in U.S. on Cocaine Trafficking Charges
description: Seventeen members and associates of one of Colombias largest and most influential narcotics cartels, including its founder and current leader, have been indicted on drug trafficking charges in New York and Florida, law enforcement authorities said on Tuesday. Officials in Miami unsealed indictments against the suspects, who are accused of being involved with the cartel, Clan suga, and affiliate cartels and paramilitary groups. Officials say they shipped tons of cocaine to the United States as far back as 2003. The indictments were a result of a multiyear investigation carried out by law enforcement authorities in Colombia and the United States, and brought to 25 the number of people charged so far, officials said.

title: Even the Opening Date Is Moving at the Nets Training Center
description: Construction is underway at the Nets training center in Brooklyn, officially announced last June. The team, which had planned to move in by training camp, now expects to take up residence in February. Since moving to Brooklyn in 2012, the Nets have continued to practice in New Jersey.

title: Sean Parker Seeks a New Approach to Charity
description: Sean Parker has been known for many things over many years, like being a co-founder of Napster, an early Facebook executive and a fun-loving, jet-setting billionaire.

title: Judge Halts Syscos Proposed Merger With US Foods
description: A federal judge on Tuesday ordered a preliminary injunction to halt Syscos proposed merger with US Foods, dealing a potentially fatal blow to what would be a union of the countrys two biggest food distribution companies.

title: Frances Kroll Ring, Secretary to F. Scott Fitzgerald, Dies at 99
description: Frances Kroll Ring, the personal secretary to F. Scott Fitzgerald for the last 20 months of his life and a longtime source of information for biographers, documentary filmmakers, students and fans, died on Thursday at her home in Los Angeles. She was 99.

title: Lower Rates on Student Loans for This Academic Year
description: Students who must borrow to help pay college tuition will get a little bit of a break in the coming school year.

title: NATO Refocuses on Russia
description: Military training exercises this month in Latvia, a former Soviet republic, underline the seismic shift for an alliance that had been focused on threats far beyond its borders.

title: Suit Accuses Landlord of Discriminating Against Tenant With AIDS
description: David Goode, 27, poor and living with AIDS, thought he had found the answer to his homelessness when he saw an Internet listing in February for an apartment in New York for around $1,100 per month.

title: Prosecutors Say Officer Didnt Help Man He Shot in Brooklyn Stairwell
description: A prosecution document unsealed on Tuesday provides the governments most detailed public account of a shooting last year of an unarmed black man by the police in a Brooklyn stairwell.

title: The Case Against Officer Peter Liang
description: Prosecutors argue against dismissing the indictment of a New York police officer, Peter Liang, in the fatal shooting of Akai Gurley in a stairwell of a Brooklyn housing project.

title: Notes From One Artists Interior Monologue
description: The multidisciplinary artist Gordon Harrison Hull describes his latest works as emotional landscapes that map a journey through his psyche; they are collected for an exhibition at the Bryce Wolkowitz Gallery, fittingly dubbed Department of the Interior. The show has smaller, medium-sized and bigger pieces and they all come from a similar place, he explains, but the smaller ones are more intimate  they express one particular thought. Then, the medium pieces are an extrapolation of those and the bigger ones really go to town and express a lot of different emotions.

title: Colombia Military Accused of Deception on Civilian Deaths
description: Many generals and other high-ranking officers in Colombias armed forces may have known about a pattern of soldiers killing civilians and passing off the deaths as guerrilla casualties in the campaign against rebel insurgencies, according to a report to be released on Wednesday.

title: Schools Chief in Newark Says Debate Lost Its Focus
description: Cami Anderson knew the challenges when she arrived in Newark as its schools superintendent four years ago. In the citys South Ward, for example, there were 12 elementary schools and not at a single one were more than 30 percent of students reading at or above grade level. Students were fleeing to charter schools, taking money from the traditional public schools with them. She had been warned that the citys politics could be contentious, with a tradition of long and rancorous public meetings.

title: More Americans Are Renting, and Paying More, as Homeownership Falls
description: WESTFIELD, N.J.  To Johnnie McDowell, the house on Livingston Street seems to taunt him every time he walks by. Its nothing special: The two-story home is a bit shabby, and its been on and off the market in recent months without finding a buyer. Still, he cannot stop dreaming of a better life for his family as he imagines the extra space inside and his children and dog playing outdoors once he weeds the yard.

title: Word of the Day | natty
description: natty  \na-te\  adjective

title: Mets Survive Some Bumps and Bangs, but Cant Avoid Loss to Brewers
description: MILWAUKEE  Ray Ramirez, the Mets head trainer, hopped up and sprinted out of the dugout as if this were the Summer Olympics while Manager Terry Collins hurried close behind. Dilson Herrera had just violently collided with a Brewers base runner and was down on his knees, grimacing.

title: New York City Allocates $5 Million to Move Tenants Out of Three-Quarter Homes
description: New York City will dedicate $5 million of its budget for next year to inspect and fix illegal boarding homes, known as three-quarter houses, and to relocate tenants living in them, city officials said.

title: De Blasios Reversal on Adding Officers Stuns Allies and Skeptics
description: Meeting privately with city lawmakers last month, Mayor Bill de Blasio was blunt: He had no plans to expand the New York Police Department.

title: Neighborhood Policing to Expand Across New York, Bratton Says
description: A day after a budget agreement was reached that will enlarge New York Citys police force, Commissioner William J. Bratton on Tuesday spoke in sweeping terms of how hundreds of new officers would help transform the day-to-day operation of the Police Department.

title: Yanks Fall as Phillies Rookie Maikel Franco Continues Onslaught
description: Maikel Franco rounded first base, sprinted to second and threw his hands together powerfully. He had just roped a two-run double down the third-base line, and he was revved up.

title: The Fates of Some Legislative Initiatives in Albany
description: A look at how various bills fared in Albany this year.

title: Meeting of Eurozone Finance Ministers on Greece Ends Abruptly
description: BRUSSELS  A meeting of eurozone finance ministers, hoping to end the impasse in Greeces bailout negotiations, unexpectedly broke up Wednesday after only about an hour.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday
description: 9 P.M. (USA) SUITS As Season 5 begins, Harvey (Gabriel Macht) has trouble accepting the changes at Pearson Specter Litt. Donna (Sarah Rafferty) tries to get used to working for Louis (Rick Hoffman). Mike (Patrick J. Adams) and Rachel (Meghan Markle) find their big news overshadowed by an even bigger case. And an up-and-comer has concerns about how Jessica (Gina Torres) is running the firm.

title: Sibling Rivalry
description: The Ethicists consider how to reconcile two wildly conflicting stories of a deceased parent.

title: Corrections: June 24, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day for Monday, June 24, 2015
description: Our ancestors were literally fighting to keep human beings as slaves, and to continue the unimaginable acts that occur when someone is held against their will. I am not proud of this heritage.

title: Suspect in Attempted Murder Case Escapes Police Custody in Harlem
description: A man who had been arrested on suspicion of attempted murder escaped police custody on Tuesday as he was being transported from a Harlem precinct to central booking in Lower Manhattan, the police said.

title: Devin Allens Inside Story in Baltimore
description: The sketch of a camera Devin Allen had tattooed on his right hand on his recent birthday commemorates for him the life-changing events of recent months.

title: Hospital Billing
description: To the Editor:

title: Double Standard on Israeli and Palestinian Civilian Casualties
description: To the Editor:

title: Is Special Education Racist?
description: MORE than six million children in the United States receive special-education services for their disabilities. Of those age 6 and older, nearly 20 percent are black.

title: Trust Me. Butter Is Better.
description: Why would you buy a processed food that tastes worse than what it was designed to replace, doesnt exist in nature, and helps kill you?

title: Traffic Ban in Parks
description: To the Editor:

title: The Eric Garner Case: Was Justice Done?
description: To the Editor:

title: Beyond the Flag: Calling for Governor Haley to Do More
description: To the Editor:

title: Cold War Without the Fun
description: Lets see, America is prepositioning battle tanks with our East European NATO allies to counterbalance Russia; U.S. and Russian military planes recently flew within 10 feet of each other; Russia is building a new generation of long-range ballistic missiles; and the U.S. and China are jostling in the South China Sea. Did someone restart the Cold War while I was looking the other way?

title: Ending the Rikers Nightmare
description: Brutality is a decades-old problem in Rikers Island jail complex in New York City. Preet Bharara, the United States attorney in Manhattan, was on the mark last year when he said that ending it would require new policies that would be monitored and enforced by a federal court instead of being allowed to fade when public attention inevitably waned after the latest lawsuit or headline. Mr. Bharara delivered on that promise on Monday, when the city agreed to sweeping policy changes to settle a long-running legal battle over abuses at the jail.

title: When Teachers Are the Ones Tested
description: To the Editor:

title: President Obama Must Use Trade Authority to Reach Better Agreements
description: Congress is about to give President Obama the authority to sign trade agreements that lawmakers will be able to vote up or down but not amend. Now, it is up to the administration to reach deals with other nations that live up to the high standards on labor rights, environmental protection, access to medicines and other issues that Mr. Obama has said he supports.

title: Test Your Vocabulary | Silent Discos
description: Below, several paragraphs from a June 17 article, Silent Discos Let You Dance to Your Own Beat.

title: Deadly Clash Between Police and Ethnic Uighurs Reported in Xinjiang Region of China
description: HONG KONG  More than a dozen people were killed in the Xinjiang region of far western China this week in a clash between ethnic Uighurs and the police, according to a report by Radio Free Asia that was largely corroborated by local residents, including a police officer.

title: Merrick, N.Y., a Hamlet With a Nautical Flavor
description: Vanessa and Aaron Kopelowitz were living in a 600-square-foot, one-bedroom apartment in Manhattan and expecting their first child when they started doing some serious house hunting on Long Island about three years ago. They hoped to buy on the North Shore, but were turned off by the drive from Manhattan to Port Washington and the train ride to Syosset. They headed south.

title: Indigenous Group Plants Its Flag in Copa Amrica
description: TEMUCO, Chile  On a cold, rainy afternoon just a few hours before Brazil played Peru in the Copa Amrica last week, four policemen stood guard by a set of flagpoles in the town square here. Days earlier someone had managed to take down one of the red, white and blue Chilean flags and replaced it with the traditional Mapuche flag in a peaceful but poignant protest.

title: Troubled Delta System Is Californias Water Battleground
description: BYRON, Calif.  Fighting over water is a tradition in California, but nowhere are the lines of dispute more sharply drawn than here in the Sacramento-San Joaquin Delta, a 720,000-acre network of islands and canals that is the hub of the states water system.

title: South Street Seaport Tops Preservation Trusts List of Endangered Historic Sites
description: South Street Seaport, the low-scale, brick waterfront district that was once home to New York Citys booming maritime industry, made it to the top of a national list.

title: A Crossroads Decades Gone Will Reopen at the World Trade Center
description: When the chain-link fences are pushed aside this week, pedestrians will be able to cross the crossroads of Greenwich and Fulton Streets in Lower Manhattan. This is big news.

title: Homegrown Extremists Tied to Deadlier Toll Than Jihadists in U.S. Since 9/11
description: WASHINGTON  In the 14 years since Al Qaeda carried out attacks on New York and the Pentagon, extremists have regularly executed smaller lethal assaults in the United States, explaining their motives in online manifestoes or social media rants.

title: Giving Artists the Space to Grow
description: The Artha Project seeks out unrepresented artists and aims to steer them to success, giving them free studio space and helping them network with potential dealers and collectors.

title: The Artha Project Supports Emerging Artists on a Small and Personal Scale
description: Nine months ago, Lala Abaddon, a Brooklyn artist, was working mostly out of the bedroom of her cramped Bedford-Stuyvesant apartment, deconstructing large-format photos and painstakingly weaving them into bright, fabriclike canvases. She scarcely had enough space to create her work, just as it was beginning to get noticed.

title: Ahold-Delhaize Deal Would Create One of Largest Grocery Chains in U.S.
description: The merger agreement between the Dutch supermarket operator Ahold and the Delhaize Group of Belgium on Wednesday reflected yet another sign of the malaise hanging over the grocery business in the United States.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Risk of Extreme Weather From Climate Change to Rise Over Next Century, Report Says
description: Note: In summer we often tinker with our long-running features, and todays post is just such an experiment. 6 Qs About the News has been running more or less the same way since 1998, before The Learning Network even existed in blog form. We thought wed try something slightly new.

title: Wednesdays Travel News and Tips
description: Our weekday morning digest that includes consumer news, deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.

title: Tips for Keeping That Post-Vacation Feeling
description: A colleague recently returned from a trip to Europe with that unmistakable just-back-from-vacation glow. Striving to hold on to it for as long as possible, she deployed various strategies including placing her used boarding passes front and center on her desk, and leaving receipts from the TV Tower in Berlin and the Eiffel Tower in Paris on a bedroom chest of drawers that she passes each morning.

title: Fidgeting May Benefit Children With A.D.H.D.
description: Instead of telling children with hyperactivity and attention problems to sit still, perhaps we should encourage them to wriggle at will, according to a new study of children with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, or A.D.H.D. The study, in Child Neuropsychology, found that children with A.D.H.D. concentrate much better when they fidget than when they dont.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: New York Today: Swinging for the Beaches
description: Good morning on this less hot Wednesday.

title: Walking Home
description: Ive moved back into the house I grew up in, the house in which my mother died. Every sweep of the broom picks up stray hairs and dust: the small pieces of Mom that were left behind. Each time I empty the vacuum I throw a little more of her away. I have to pick and choose what to keep, and no one keeps the dust. I keep memories of her thumbs and how it felt to run my fingers over her knuckles. I keep a memory of the slight overlap of her front teeth. I keep other things, lists about her and how she was; cataloging is a vice of both lovers and the grieving.

title: IBM and Box Team Up to Target Global Data-Storage Market
description: Corporate partnerships, like human ones, depend on what each side brings to the relationship and what each side needs.

title: Today in Politics: Bobby Jindal Expected to Enter Fray Near the Bottom of the Pile
description: Good Wednesday morning from Washington, where even agreements dont guarantee the end of the long battle over the trade bill. Though the nations attention still falls on the shooting in Charleston, S.C., the campaign focus pulls to Louisiana, where Gov. Bobby Jindal is going to make an announcement that many before him have already made.

title: Confessions of a Seduction Addict
description: It started with a boy I met at summer camp and ended with the man for whom I left my first husband. In between, I careened from one intimate entanglement to the next  dozens of them  without so much as a day off between romances. You might have called me a serial monogamist, except that I was never exactly monogamous. Relationships overlapped, and those overlaps were always marked by exhausting theatricality: sobbing arguments, shaming confrontations, broken hearts. Still, I kept doing it. I couldnt not do it.

title: Documents on 2012 Drone Strike Detail How Terrorists Are Targeted
description: WASHINGTON  Early in 2012, worried that suicide bombers might pass through airline security undetected, American counterterrorism officials ordered a drone strike in Yemen to kill a doctor they believed was working with Al Qaeda to surgically implant explosives in operatives, according to British intelligence documents.

title: Tell It About Your Mother
description: In 1900, Sigmund Freud, a Viennese specialist in nervous disorders, began treating the 18-year-old daughter of a rich acquaintance. Freud, who was 44, was just beginning to practice psychoanalysis, a form of therapy that would become known as the talking cure. The girl, whom Freud would later refer to as Dora, had a cluster of inexplicable symptoms: Her mood was low, she was prone to losing consciousness and, for weeks at a time, she could not speak above a whisper. Freud diagnosed hysteria, a term commonly used in fin de sicle Europe to refer to a disorder in which psychological stress was expressed through physical symptoms. Freud traced Doras condition in part to her fathers sexual infidelities that she had felt obliged, from early adolescence, to help orchestrate. When Dora told Freud, in the course of the analysis, that her fathers friend  Herr K., a married man decades her senior  had accosted her in his empty office building, trying to kiss her on her lips, Freud, trained in biology and swept up in his own scientific detachment, couldnt empathize with her distress. One day, after only 11 weeks of treatment and still far from cured, she stood up at the end of a session, wished Freud a happy new year and never returned.

title: Chop Sueys Comeback
description: If you walk in the east side of the recently renovated Grand Central Market in downtown Los Angeles, you are confronted by the snaking lines at the trendy Eggslut, which sells, as far as I can tell, glorified Egg McMuffins. If you enter on the west side of the blockwide building, however, you come across a time capsule: China Caf, a lunch counter that serves Chinese-American food  egg fu yeung (a.k.a. egg foo yong), chow mein, chop suey and other old-fashioned former standards  to a clientele of mostly Latinos and hipsters.

title: Portrait of a Lady
description: A photographer working in a commercial studio in West Africa in the 20th century had a straightforward task: to please his clients. In that sense, the Malian photographer Seydou Keta was  like his father, who worked as a blacksmith, carpenter, mechanic and electrician, among other jobs  a craftsman. He was paid by the public to make pictures. But like his esteemed Malian compatriot Malick Sidib, Mama Casset of Senegal and Joseph Moise Agbodjelou of Benin, he produced such fine work that we now consider him a great African artist. These master photographers gave us panoramas of life in Bamako, Dakar and Porto-Novo, a vivid record of individual people, largely shorn of their names and stories but irrepressibly alive. Here are good clothes gracefully cut, glowing skin, beautifully coifed hair, polished shoes: all the familiar markers of a person taking pride in his or her appearance. Heres someone who looks witty, heres another who looks querulous, another whos modest, or vain, or sweet. There we see a renegade bra strap slipping off a shoulder, there a large laughing man with a baby, a woman in a bathing suit, youths partying at night with their Afros, bell-bottoms, precious LPs and endless reserves of cool.

title: How Do I Counter My Sisters Abuse Claims Against Our Father?
description: My sister has become a personality in the media primarily due to her colorful past. She gives lectures and has a self-help book coming out soon. One of her minor themes concerns our deceased father and is particularly nasty. Although there is no way to positively refute statements she has made, neither I nor my two brothers and my mother believe my father capable of the events my sister describes. My father was a kind and giving person. He has living brothers, sisters, nieces and nephews who loved him dearly and would be very upset by my sisters claims. My husband suggests I confront my sister, but that will most likely not yield a fruitful outcome or change anything. My concern is to protect positive memories. I propose to write about him myself, posting my memories on the Internet. I would not attempt to refute my sister, merely focus on my father and memories of him. This seems the least aggressive path and least likely to create any stir around my sister or her supporters. Since the Internet seems destined to live forever, at least an alternative memorial for my father would exist. Your thoughts are appreciated. NAME WITHHELD

title: Why Dont the Poor Rise Up?
description: Why are todays working poor so quiescent? Im not the only one posing this question.

title: Bernie Sanders a Virtual Unknown Among Black Voters
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont is climbing in the polls in Iowa and New Hampshire, and he has drawn thousands of people to rallies for his presidential campaign recently in Denver and Minneapolis. But the shooting last week in Charleston, S.C., has highlighted a daunting obstacle he faces in the Democratic primary contest: Black voters have shown little interest in him.

title: Hollande Condemns Spying by U.S., but Not Too Harshly
description: PARIS  The French government on Wednesday reacted with carefully calibrated anger to revelations about extensive eavesdropping by the United States government on the private conversations of senior French officials  including three presidents.

title: Homegrown Hate
Morning Agenda: Judge Halts Syscos Takeover of US Foods
description: JUDGE HALTS SYSCOS TAKEOVER OF US FOODS | Syscos $3.5 billion bid to buy US Foods was dealt a potentially fatal blow after a federal judge issued a preliminary injunction against the deal,  Michael J. de la Merced writes in DealBook. The merger of the countrys two biggest food distribution companies, which was first proposed in December 2013, has been opposed by the Federal Trade Commission. The commission sued in February to block the deal on the grounds that it would reduce competition in 32 markets and lead to higher prices and worse service for customers like restaurants and schools. In his ruling on Tuesday, Judge Amit P. Mehta of the Federal District Court for the District of Columbia sided with the F.T.C.

title: Classical Music This Week: KirillPetrenko in Berlin, Gunther Schuller and Roomful of Teeth
description: Good morning, classical music fans. Its a lovely day for an outdoor concert. How about Roomful of Teeth, the adventurous vocal ensemble, with music from their lovely new album, Render, in the Financial District tonight? (Bonus: its free.)

title: Classical Playlist: Rihm, Brahms, Glass and Messiaen
description: RIHM: Et Lux Paul Van Nevel, conductor; Huelgas Ensemble; Minguet Quartet(ECM)This eerie and uncomfortably hypnotic hourlong work for vocal ensemble and string quartet is a setting of the words of the Latin Requiem Mass, but not in any functional liturgical order. Instead, the text fragments, veiled by a gauzy haze of strings, appear like brittle remnants of a ritual half-forgotten. The Minguet Quartet plays the queasy dissonances and occasional snatches of almost-familiar tonal material with wonderful transparency; the voices of the Huelgas Ensemble are pure and airy conduits of the eternal light evoked in the title. (Corinna da Fonseca-Wollheim)

title: Why Affluent Parents Clam Up About Their Incomes
description: We want our kids to come to us with anything and everything. We try to be as honest as we can about sex and drugs. We encourage them to talk about their feelings.

title: Is Greece Lehman Brothers, or Is It RadioShack?
description: There is one big question that hangs over the last-ditch negotiations this week between the Greek government and its lenders, even if no one involved would frame it quite this way: Is Greece more like RadioShack, or more like Lehman Brothers?

title: To Bowling Green, an Inch at a Time
description: Dear Diary:

title: U.S. Economic Output Is Revised to Show Smaller Contraction
description: While nothing to brag about, the economys performance in early 2015 was not quite as bad as the number crunchers in Washington had thought.

title: Apple Signs Thousands of Independent Labels in Royalty Deal
description: The turning point in Apples talks with the music industry came late Sunday night, when  after a rebuke from Taylor Swift  the company reversed course on a proposal to not pay royalties during test drives of a new streaming music service.

title: Death Toll From Karachi, Pakistan, Heat Wave Tops 800
description: KARACHI, Pakistan  The temperature was still searingly high on Wednesday  98 degrees Fahrenheit, or 37 degrees Celsius  but at least it was dropping. It had been as high as 113 degrees Fahrenheit, or 45 degrees Celsius.

title: $2,650,000 Homes in California, Maine and Atlanta
description: SAN CLEMENTE, CALIF.

title: Italys Annual Spoleto Festival Gets a Boost From Botero
description: The dancing couple in the above poster is quintessential Botero  large, exaggerated, full-figured beings dressed in their Sunday best. The man wears a dark hat, narrow tie and powder blue jacket that pulls at the waist. The woman has poured herself into a tight-fitting red dress; her light chestnut-brown hair flows down her back.

title: Inside the Plan for Proenza Schouler
description: On Tuesday, part of the Twitter fashion conversation was Whats next for Proenza Schouler? now that the headline New York Fashion Week brand has sold a minority stake to the private equity firm Castanea Partners and gotten its first establishment chief executive. On Tuesday night, that chief executive, Ronald L. Frasch, decided he would spill a bit on what he had planned.

title: Daily Report: At Start-Ups, Some Shift From Using Free Agents to Employing Staff
description: When Ron Johnson was pitching his idea for an e-commerce delivery company to venture capitalists last year, one of the sticking points was his vision for how to treat employees, Farhad Manjoo reports.

title: The Worlds Deadliest Place for Kids
description: Nicholas Kristof reports on the rampant corruption in oil-rich Angola, which is depriving children of education and contributing to the highest rate of child mortality in the world.

title: Corruption Is Killing Children in Angola
description: This is a video report that Ill never be able to do again. Its about Angola, an oil-rich and fabulously corrupt country that also happens to be the deadliest place in the world to be a child.

title: Romneys and Obamas Confederate Flag Tweets Made Millions of Impressions
description: A successful tweet is often measured by how often its retweeted, but Twitters data experts are focusing on a new statistic  impressions  that they argue better quantify impact. And they have found some exceptional numbers behind Mitt Romney and President Obamas exchange over the Confederate battle flag.

title: House Hunting in Portugal
description: AN UPDATED FARMHOUSE WITH GUESTHOUSES AND A POOL IN THEALGARVE

title: Israel Cancels Some Gazans Access to Al Aqsa Mosque During Ramadan
description: RAMALLAH, West Bank  Israel canceled permission for hundreds of residents of Gaza to enter Jerusalem to pray during Ramadan in Al Aqsa Mosque, the third-holiest site in Islam, after rocket fire from the coastal enclave, Israeli officials said on Wednesday.

title: Why You Shouldnt Throw Out Your Skinny Jeans
description: Womens fashion lately has supplied researchers with cautionary tales of sartorial worst-case scenarios.

title: FarmLogs App Helps Farmers Collect and Retrieve Data
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich.  One day in 2011, Jesse Vollmars uncle was complaining about how difficult the family farms new data management software was to use. Despite taking a course taught by a software provider, he still couldnt figure out how to get it to keep track of seeding dates, rainfall, field yield or any of the other functions that mattered most.

title: New York Citys Flag, Centuries in the Making, Turns 100
description: City fathers were flummoxed. Wherever they looked, on documents, statues, building facades and other public works, the Seal of the City of New York rarely looked the same. Moreover, nearly three centuries of bloviating at City Hall had apparently generated a lot of wind, but had yet to produce an official municipal flag.

title: Cubs Fan Catches Foul Ball in One Hand With Baby in Other
description: For a couple of minutes there, the man every baseball broadcaster and reporter wanted to talk to was a 29-year-old employee of a financial firm.

title: French Government Reacts to U.S. Spying
description: Stphane Le Foll, the French government spokesman, spoke on Wednesday about documents released by WikiLeaks that alleged that the National Security Agency spied on French presidents and officials.

title: Debt Talks May Be Defining Moment for Greece, and for Angela Merkel
description: BERLIN  With Greece embroiled in civil war and the shadow of Soviet domination looming over Europe in 1947, President Harry S. Truman called for immediate and resolute action, putting up hundreds of millions of dollars to keep Greece in the Western camp.

title: Shabab Claim Responsibility for Deadly Car Bomb in Mogadishu
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia  At least two people were killed in the Somali capital, Mogadishu, on Wednesday when militants detonated a car loaded with explosives and then engaged in a firefight during an attack on foreign military trainers, witnesses and officials said.

title: Donkey Kong Economics
description: Bloomberg blazes new frontiers in article illustration; you can see why my beard is irreversible at the point. And I guess being portrayed as a master of Mixed Macroeconomic Arts isnt the worst thing in the world.

title: Schools Fear Gay Marriage Ruling Could End Tax Exemptions
description: Conservative religious schools all over the country forbid same-sex relationships, from dating to couples living in married-student housing, and they fear they will soon be forced to make a wrenching choice. If the Supreme Court this month finds a constitutional right to same-sex marriage, the schools say they will have to abandon their policies that prohibit gay relationships or eventually risk losing their tax-exempt status.

title: Start-Ups Finding the Best Employees Are Actually Employed
description: When Ron Johnson was pitching his idea for an e-commerce delivery company to venture capitalists last year, one of the sticking points was his vision for how to treat employees.

title: Most of the Way With Obamacare
description: As we wait for King v Burwell  just how far are Republicans on the court willing to destroy the institutions reputation on behalf of their party?  one question I found myself wondering about was how much of its original goal Obamacare has achieved. We know that the number of uninsured has dropped sharply; we also know that there are still a lot of uninsured. So how are we doing?

title: 1965: Saigon Breaks With France
description: SAIGON  South Vietnams ruling military junta today [June 24] severed diplomatic relations with France and for the first time officially declared war against the Communist Viet Cong. The government also announced it was introducing harsh measures including: 1. Closing down all newspapers published in the country. Saigon alone has had 36 newspapers, but now the nation as a whole will only have two, one for civilians and one for soldiers. 2. Clamping an anti-luxury 10 p.m. to 2 a.m. curfew on the capital. Premier Nguyen Cao Ky warned that his government would deal severely with anyone who raised his voice in protest.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, June 25, 1965

title: Businesses Doors Creak Open in a West Bank Ghost Town, Decades After Massacre
description: HEBRON, West Bank  It took Mohammad Abu Halaweh a good 10 minutes to pry open the rusted metal doors of his butcher shop for the first time in two decades. He had the key, an old-fashioned iron number as big as his hand. But he had to press a sandaled foot against the door and leverage his body weight to yank off a second lock. A handful of curious children had gathered by the time he finally finished the job with the help of a hammer.

title: Rick Ross Arrested and Charged With Kidnapping
description: The rapper Rick Ross was arrested on Wednesday in Fayetteville, Ga., and charged with kidnapping, aggravated battery and aggravated assault, the police said.

title: A Cure for Hovering
description: Neglectful parents, too-busy parents, dead parents, parents who are just not in the picture, who knows why.  What would childrens literature be without them? Or rather: with them. Its always a better story when children figure things out for themselves and adults are somewhere just offstage. But times have changed since the days when a 12-year-old and her 9-year-old brother could spend a couple of nights hiding out at the Metropolitan Museum, then head by train to the Connecticut home of one Mrs. Basil E. Frankweiler, pretty much eluding the entire adult world. Were deep into the hovering era now. As evidence I offer this: Overinvolved parents like the ones you see at the playground giving their offspring detailed instructions on how to play  have even begun storming the plots of childrens books.

title: Googles Street View Takes Armchair Climbers Up El Capitan
description: For decades, El Capitan has been the most iconic rock climbing wall in the United States, if not the world. From the first ascent by Warren Harding and others in 1958 to the Dawn Wall climb by Tommy Caldwell and Kevin Jorgeson in January, 3,000-foot El Capitan has been the vertical domain of climbing pioneers.

title: Tweets From the Courtroom: Boston Marathon Bombing Victims and Families Address Tsarnaev
description: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev appeared in court on Wednesday to be formally sentenced to death for his role in the Boston Marathon bombing, and victims and families of the victims were there to speak to him.

title: How to Eat on a Budget While Traveling
description: Food and travel are inseparable these days, but how do you approach choosing a restaurant (or shack or stand or ambulant vendor) in a strange city?

title: Harvey Pollack, Inventive Statistician in N.B.A. From Day 1, Dies at 93
description: Harvey Pollack, who tallied everything from triple-doubles to player tattoos as the mastermind of N.B.A. statistics going back to the leagues creation in 1946, died on Tuesday in Philadelphia. Mr. Pollack, the last still-active N.B.A. team employee from that inaugural season, was 93.

title: Hillary Clintons All Lives Matter Remark Stirs Backlash
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton is facing backlash for saying that all lives matter in an African-American church in Missouri on Tuesday, offending some who feel that she is missing the point of the black lives matter mantra.

title: New York City Escalates the War on Rats Once Again
description: For centuries, New York Citys white whale has been the common rat.

title: Charleston Shooting Adds to Security Fears in Places of Worship
description: As Bishop Ernest C. Morris Sr. greeted worshipers arriving for services on Sunday at Mount Airy Church of God in Christ, a woman hurried over and asked a question on the minds of many parishioners at the large black church in Philadelphia: Bishop, Bishop, are we safe this morning?

title: For the South, Against the Confederacy
description: The American South has always been the most barbaric, backward region in any developed democracy, Voxs Dave Roberts tweeted in the midst of a long day of Confederate flag talk on Twitter yesterday. Can we admit that now?

title: Celebrating Schubert and Coltranes A Love Supreme at the White Light Festival
description: Schubert, Beckett, Coltrane and new works will be featured this fall at Lincoln Centers sixth White Light Festival, which will run from Oct. 14 through Nov. 22.

title: A Constellation of Light Above the Ruins of Bannerman Castle
description: POLLEPEL ISLAND, N.Y.  As the small aluminum workboat made a wide turn in the Hudson River, the decaying ruins of Bannerman Castle came into view, a dark tangle of tumbledown brick, concrete, scrap metal and weeds that was only partly illuminated on a sunny day last month.

title: Kids in the Kitchen: Ketchup Chicken
description: We may set academic teachings aside for the hotter months, but that doesnt mean learning stops. Summer is a great time to convey some life skills  the kind of thing that, during the school year, gets caught up in the rush of activities, sports and homework. Turning your children into your personal chefs takes time  but it isnt just good for you, its good for them.

title: Can the Knicks Find Their Dolph Schayes in the N.B.A. Draft?
description: Knicks fans were understandably upset when a season of what sometimes seemed like intentional losing did not earn anything more than the No. 4 pick in the N.B.A. draft. But a deep dive into the teams past draft performance holds a glimmer of hope: The Knicks once made the best No. 4 pick in N.B.A. history. The only problem is, they failed to sign him.

title: Allies in Asia Welcome U.S. Progress on Trade Deal
description: HONG KONG  American allies in Asia on Wednesday welcomed a United States Senate vote that appeared to clear the way for a final round of negotiations over a sweeping trans-Pacific trade pact and may have made it easier for governments to make politically risky concessions.

title: Mens Cross-Body Bags Are Back
description: After seasons of the backpack reigning supreme, the idea of wearing a cross-body bag, as seen this morning at Lemaire (above), feels fresh again. The shoulder-straining messenger bags of yesterday these are not  compact and worn close to the body (almost like a harness), they complete a look instead of feeling like a clunky accessory.

title: 1915: Rush of Recruits on Lord Kitcheners Birthday
description: LONDON  Lord Kitcheners sixty-fifth birthday was celebrated today throughout the United Kingdom and the British Empire by a rush of recruits to K. of Ks Army. The Minister of War, who received hundreds of cables and telegrams, not only from his own countrymen but from kin beyond the sea, in the United States, expressed himself as deeply touched, but the reports from the recruiting stations, which told of thousands joining the colors to make the day memorable, were, he said, the finest tribute he had ever received.  The New York Herald, European Edition, June 25, 1915

title: Arthur Millers Screenplay The Hook Finds a Home Onstage in England
description: NORTHAMPTON, ENGLAND  The setting is Red Hook, Brooklyn, in the 1950s. The protagonist is an Italian immigrant who works as a longshoreman, a tragic hero who is also a working-class Everyman. The writer is Arthur Miller.

title: Reading About the Confederacy
description: Faced with the horrific murders in South Carolina and the ensuing debate over the appropriateness of the Confederate flag, its even clearer than usual that history is not a dusty book on a shelf. There has been more written about the Civil War than you could read in a lifetime, or a hundred lifetimes. But for those interested in learning more about the Confederacy  its people, its soldiers, its descendants  these five books offer a start:

title: O Pas Onde Mais Crianas Morrem
description: Nicholas Kristof viaja por Angola a reunir provas esmagadoras de como a corrupo ao extremo est a matar crianas. E, diz ele, os Estados Unidos devem pedir responsabilidades ao governo angolano.

title: Bobby Jindal Enters Presidential Race, Saying It Is Time for a Doer
description: KENNER, La.  Gov. Bobby Jindal, who is Louisianas first nonwhite governor since Reconstruction but whose popularity plummeted as the state struggled with a $1.6 billion shortfall, announced Wednesday that he is running for president in 2016.

title: Trade Authority Bill Wins Final Approval in Senate
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate on Wednesday gave final approval to legislation granting President Obama enhanced power to negotiate major trade agreements with Asia and Europe, sending the presidents biggest end-of-term legislative priority to the White House for his signature.

title: Bobby Jindal on the Issues
description: Gov. Bobby Jindal of Louisiana has announced his candidacy for the Republican presidential nomination. The first Indian-American governor in the United States, he came to the job in 2008 after three years in Congress. He had previously been president of the nine-member University of Louisiana System and has run the states Department of Health and Hospitals. Here are his positions on important issues.

title: What Bobby Jindal Would Need to Do to Win
description: Here is a look at what Gov. Bobby Jindal of Louisiana will need to do if he hopes to win.

title: James Taylor Opens at No. 1
description: James Taylor finally has a No. 1 album, 45 years after his debut.

title: Four World Premieres Set for New York City Ballet Gala
description: Who are you wearing? At New York City Ballets annual fall fashion galas, the question is asked as much of the dancers onstage as it is of the swells in the audience.

title: Migrants Target Trucks in France
description: Migrants attempting to enter Britain have been boarding trucks stuck in traffic at the port of Calais in northern France.

title: Halt on US Foods Deal Sours Outlook for Mergers
description: An antitrust food fight threatens to hamper Americas merger boom.

title: The Work of a Sculptor Beloved by Margaret Howell and J.W. Anderson
description: She is almost always photographed wearing overalls and an anorak, explains assistant curator Inga Fraser of the subject of a new exhibition, Barbara Hepworth: Sculpture for the Modern World, which opens at the Tate Britain in London this week. Though handy for stashing the pebbles she liked to gather on walks she took at dawn along her favorite Cornish beaches, Hepworths self-imposed workwear uniform was more than a function of practical necessity: As a woman sculptor in the early 20th century trying to be seen on equal terms with her male counterparts, Hepworth had to put her work before everything else. She saw style as secondary.

title: 36 Hours in Split, Croatia
description: Split, in central Dalmatia, has it all: Roman ruins and grand museums alongside fashionable cafes and trendy shops. But what makes this city most alluring is not just its proximity to the sandy beaches and rocky coves of nearby islands, but its location overlooked by mountains and edged by the deep blue Adriatic Sea.

title: 'Fresh Dressed' and 4 Elements of Hip-Hop Style
description: Sacha Jenkins, the director of the documentary Fresh Dressed, discusses four style trends have helped define hip-hop fashion.

title: Conflict in Californias Delta System
description: A network of islands and canals, the Sacramento-San Joaquin Delta is the hub of the states water system, and the center of an increasingly fractious battle between farmers and environmentalists.

title: 36 Hours in Split
description: Surrounded by mountains and sea, Split has it all: Roman ruins, trendy shops and fashionable restaurants.

title: Obama on U.S. Hostage Policy
description: President Obama announced changes on Wednesday to the nations hostage policy, allowing the government to communicate and negotiate with captors holding Americans.

title: Federal Hate Crime Charges Likely in South Carolina Church Shooting
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department will probably file federal hate crime charges against the white man accused of carrying out a massacre at a storied black church in South Carolina, federal law enforcement officials said Wednesday.

title: 1958: Snoopy and Company
description: This feature looks at some of the earliest mentions of famous names or terms in The Times. Have an idea for someone or something you would like to read about? Leave a suggestion in the comments section.

title: A Planet with a Tail Nine Million Miles Long
description: A planet outside of our solar system is losing its atmosphere, which is dissipating into a giant cloud, according to a new study.

title: Politicians Weigh In on Flag Debate
description: A look at comments made by politicians in the debate over whether South Carolina should be able to fly the Confederate battle flag.

title: ISIS Appears to Destroy 2 Palmyra Tombs, Flaunting Wreckage in Photos
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The Islamic State group has blown up two historic tombs near Palmyra, in central Syria, according to photographs released online and a Syrian government official, the first major sites in the city that the jihadists claimed to have destroyed.

title: Official on the New York Manhunt
description: Maj. Charles E. Guess of the New York State Police discussed reports of a missing shotgun on Wednesday, saying there is no confirmatory evidence, as the manhunt expands for the two missing convicts.

title: Ugly Fruits (and Vegetables) Get a Makeover
description: Not all carrots look alike, but you wouldnt know it from scanning the shelves of your local supermarket.

title: Google to Open New Data Center in Alabama
description: Google is on a building binge.

title: Patti LuPone as a Diva in Shows for Days
description: Hold on to your souvenir programs, theater groupies. Rumor has it that Patti LuPone has turned into a theater diva. O.K., so maybe that doesnt sound like such a stretch for this two-time Tony winner, who never met a production she couldnt dominate.

title: Home and Work
description: A tour of Tom Adlers house on Padaro Lane.

title: Palestinians to Seek War Crimes Charges Against Israel at Hague Court
description: RAMALLAH, West Bank  Palestinians on Wednesday prepared to submit to the International Criminal Court what they called evidence of Israeli war crimes, a move that will saddle the beleaguered, overstretched court with a new and potentially long-running headache.

title: Breaking Silence, Dzhokhar Tsarnaev Apologizes for Boston Marathon Bombing
description: BOSTON  It was an unexpected moment. After two years of silence, and sitting through his trial looking bored and impassive, Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, who has been sentenced to death for the 2013 Boston Marathon bombings, rose in court Wednesday to apologize for his deeds.

title: The New Industry Standard
description: This season in Milan, a new generation of Asian models took the mens runways by storm. Arianna Pradarelli, a casting director and T contributor, calls out some of the breakthrough faces to watch.

title: Bad Neighborhoods May Be Bad for Your DNA
description: It has long been known that people who live in unsafe neighborhoods suffer poorer health and increased risk for death. Now researchers have found that living in these areas is associated with shorter telomere length, a marker of aging cells.

title: Valentino: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: Paris

title: Bernie Sanders on Racist History of the U.S.
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont said on the Senate floor on Tuesday that the country has a long way to go in terms of civil rights, and he mentioned his own experiences protesting segregation.

title: Palestinians and the International Criminal Court: What You Need to Know
description: Q. What is the International Criminal Court?

title: The Scene
description: Walter Van Beirendonck at Paris Fashion Week.

title: Photo Diary: Walter Van Beirendonck Spring/Summer 2016 Mens
description: Scenes from Paris Fashion Week, captured by Sarah Aubel.

title: Scandinavian Design Sets Up Shop in a Historic Hamptons Hotel  and Its All Up for Grabs
description: My daughter calls that my daddys swing,' says Fredrik Carlstrom, pointing to Alexander Lerviks Sense Light swing, affixed to the porch of the Maidstone hotel in East Hampton. In fact, the plexi-and-LED-lit version of the playground staple neither belongs to nor was crafted by Carlstrom, even if his daughter is, as he says, very protective of it. Rather, its an extension of the retail collaboration Austere c/o the Maidstone, currently overtaking the historic Hamptons inn. Last year, Carlstrom, who is by trade a marketing executive, launched Austere, a multichannel retail venture focusing mostly on Scandinavian heritage brands, which has been dubbed a magazine you can walk into. Austere exists as both a 5,000-square-foot store in Los Angeles and an active online portal, which on top of shilling wares satisfies customers curiosity with an editorial component that tells the tales of these Nordic brands and the regions cultural values. We noticed there are people who make things, people who sell things and people who talk about cool things, explains Carlstrom, No one was doing all of it. And so were trying to do that.

title: New Music From Braids, Joanna Gruesome and the Snyder Family Band
description: Braids

title: In Hostage-Terrorist Policy Shift, Obama Admits Failures
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama said Wednesday that his administration had too often failed the families of American hostages held overseas by groups like the Islamic State, announcing a policy overhaul that will publicly state for the first time that the United States government can communicate and negotiate with hostage takers.

title: Hes Back: Arnold Schwarzenegger on Terminator Genisys
description: Over the years, Arnold Schwarzenegger has proved to be a skilled reinventor. An Austrian-born competitive bodybuilder, he transformed himself into an internationally loved action star (breaking through as the title character in the 1982 film Conan the Barbarian) and later morphed into a politician as governor of California. Since leaving office in 2010, hes weathered a sex scandal that ended his marriage to Maria Shriver and sought a toehold back in the film industry  winking at his older tough-guy status in The Expendables movies, playing an embattled sheriff in The Last Stand and going the low-budget indie route as a grizzled dad in the recent zombie movie Maggie.

title: Academy Will Not Cut Number of Best Picture Nominees
description: LOS ANGELES  After much speculation about a possible return to a system that limited Oscar best picture nominees to five, from the current flexible field of as many as 10, the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences decided, more or less, to stand pat.

title: Joy Williams Liberates Herself From the Civil Wars With Venus
description: Last month, Joy Williams took the stage in London to perform material from her new album, Venus, for the first time. The location was no accident; the city was where Ms. Williamss previous band, the Grammy-winning Civil Wars, played its last show in 2012. Since that appearance, she and her partner in the country-folk duo, John Paul White, have not spoken.

title: Glen Campbells Sunset Tour
description: Who is that? a befuddled Glen Campbell asks his wife, Kim, as he watches home movies of himself as a younger man. Its you, honey, she says. Its a movie about you. To which he replies: No kidding? Ill be me.

title: At Bryant Park, a Free Modern Dance Festival
description: The annoying thing about being a dance fan in the summer is that when the rest of the city occupies sidewalk cafes, conquers rooftop bars and snuggles up to sunset on a park bench, youre slinking into a dark theater and suddenly its night. Happily, New York has a growing list of free outdoor options to address that problem, at the same time making dance part of a broader public conversation and providing an ideal picnic backdrop to boot. Theres the River to River festival in Lower Manhattan, which just ended; the Battery Dance Festival, returning in August; and the Hudson River Dance Festival, new this year.

title: Stray Dog, Debra Graniks Portrait of a Biker With a Past
description: Winters Bone, the 2010film by Debra Granik, is best known as providing the breakout role for Jennifer Lawrence, whose performance in it earned her an Oscar nomination. Less attention-getting in that movie was the work of Ron Hall, a biker with no acting experience but a cool nickname: Stray Dog.

title: Weighing the Pros and Cons for 2 Escaped Convicts to Remain Partners in Crime
description: They cut holes in the backs of their cells together. They crept through prison crawl spaces together, burrowed through a pipe and climbed out of a manhole together. Disappeared together.

title: Shania Twain Plays New York Arenas
description: The last time Shania Twain embarked on an arena tour, she had a blockbuster album and momentum  as a country star with world-beating pop ambitions and production values to match. That was in 2003, when such a thing felt less familiar. (Taylor Swift was still a couple of years shy of 15.)

title: Five Boroughs Music Festival Features Ekmeles Ensemble
description: Voices and brasses: Its not a musical combination that springs immediately to mind. But its the subject of an intriguing program on Monday night from the vocal ensemble Ekmeles, which specializes in modern and contemporary repertory thats heard too little.

title: Alabamas Confederate Flags Needed to Come Down
description: Alabama, home of legendary segregationists like George Wallace and Bull Connor, broke with a highly visible part of its past this morning when workers emerged from the Alabama state Capitol building in Montgomery and banished four versions of the Confederate flag from the Capitol grounds.

title: The Friends John Singer Sargent Painted
description: John Singer Sargent may be known for squandering his considerable gifts on paintings of socialites that he dashed off with nearly effortless panache, but Sargent: Portraits of Artists and Friends, opening Tuesday at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, sets him in a different milieu than that of the merely moneyed and pedigreed. Organized by the National Portrait Gallery, London, in collaboration with the Met, the exhibition of more than 90 paintings, watercolors and drawings places Sargent in the trans-Atlantic vanguard of art and culture of the late 19th and early 20th centuries. Subjects include other artists like Claude Monet and Auguste Rodin and writers like Robert Louis Stevenson and Henry James. The collector Isabella Stewart Gardner appears in a portrait that rarely leaves the Gardner Museum in Boston. The Shakespearean actress Ellen Terry is pictured performing and in a formal portrait. These and other works, which reveal Sargent in unguarded moments responding to people he loved and admired, should be a crowd-pleaser. (Through Oct. 4; 212-535-7710, metmuseum.org.)

title: A Beloved Amusement Park Gets a New Life in Albany
description: ALBANY  James Wilkinson walked through the gates of this citys new amusement park for the first time and had the place scoped out in about a minute.

title: Bobby Jindal Draws Out His Announcement, Family in Tow
description: Gov. Bobby Jindal of Louisiana is giving his presidential announcement the slow-walk treatment.

title: Campaign Swag
description: The online stores of 2016 presidential hopefuls elevate their brands and gather data about supporters.

title: For Lovebirds, a Look That Is Really Quick
description: Lovebirds can rotate their heads up to 2,700 degrees per second, researchers report.

title: 2nd Prison Worker Is Charged as Search for Escaped Killers in New York Continues
description: CADYVILLE, N.Y.  A corrections officer recently placed on administrative leave after the escape of two convicted killers from a maximum-security prison in northern New York has been arrested, the State Police said Wednesday night.

title: Haider Ackermann: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: Paris

title: Guys, Just Let Your Curls Down
description: Curly locks  la Bjorn Andresen in the 1971 movie Death in Venice have emerged as the mop of choice this season, dominating spring/summer 2016 mens shows like Prada in Milan and, today, Valentino in Paris. The popularity of naturally curly models like Jack Mather and Serge Rigvava has certainly reinforced the trend.

title: Rare Klimt Portrait Brings $39 Million at Auction
description: LONDON  A rare full-length portrait by Gustav Klimt sold for 24.8 million pounds with fees, or about $39 million, at a Sothebys auction in London on Wednesday.

title: Reviews: New Books From Sarah Hall, Mia Alvar,Katherine Taylor and Others
description: THE WOLF BORDERBy Sarah Hall432 pages. Harper. $25.99.

title: New York City Schools to Expand Breakfast Program
description: Students in New York Citys public elementary schools will be served breakfast in their classrooms starting in the fall, as part of the $78.5 billion budget deal announced this week by Mayor Bill de Blasio and the City Council speaker, Melissa Mark-Viverito.

title: Saudi Bombing Only Fans Yemens Flames
description: SANA, Yemen  For nearly three months, Saudi Arabia, along with its allies, has been bombing Yemen, its southern neighbor, hoping to force the retreat of Shiite rebels who have seized major cities and to return the countrys president from the Saudi guest mansion where he lives to the presidential palace.

title: The Many Miseries of Yemeni Families
description: As the civil war in Yemen continues, many families say they are living in constant fear. Parents say that their older children have been wetting their beds at night, and that younger ones are so traumatized that they are sent running for cover by the sound of a door slamming.

title: Jim Webb Criticized for Comments on Confederate Flag
description: Former Senator Jim Webb, the Democrat from Virginia, has struggled to generate much excitement over his potential presidential campaign, but on Wednesday he managed to attract some attention with some curious comments about the Confederate battle flag.

title: Review: Man in Profile Studies Joseph Mitchell of The New Yorker
description: Growing up in North Carolina, Joseph Mitchell was not easily bored. He spent long days in deep concentration, exploring a swamp next to his familys farm. Mitchell was so absorbed by the natural species in his backyard that we can imagine the charge to his curiosity when, at 21, he moved to the human carnival that was Depression-era New York City to pursue a newspaper career. The move was made to the consternation of his father  he wanted his oldest boy to remain in the generations-old business of tobacco and cotton farming  but to the great betterment of American letters.

title: A Strong Swim Team
description: Plus: Hand-woven totes and saddle bags make for chic summer carryalls, rainbow prints are the breakout stars of the recent resort shows and more.

title: App Smart | Make the Most of Summer
description: Summer is short, and cramming in the most fun requires a level of organization. New apps can do some of that for you.

title: Video Feature: Apps for Summer Travel, Concerts and Grilling
description: Summer has arrived, with long days and warm sun tempting us to experience the outdoors and traveling. Getting the right apps for your phone and tablet can help you have a great time.

title: Four Wounded in Upper Manhattan Shooting
description: Three men and a woman were shot in and around an Upper Manhattan deli on Wednesday afternoon, the police said.

title: Racisms Psychological Toll
description: Our screens and feeds are filled with news and images of black Americans dying or being brutalized. A brief and yet still-too-long list: Trayvon Martin, Tamir Rice, Walter Scott, Eric Garner, Renisha McBride. The image of a white police officer straddling a black teenager on a lawn in McKinney, Tex., had barely faded before we were forced to grapple with the racially motivated shooting in Charleston, S.C.

title: Canvas and Verse
description: When the writer Claudia La Rocco asked several visual artists if they also wrote poetry, Don Voisine told her: I dont poem. That cheeky response ultimately became the title of a book La Rocco edited featuring painters work alongside their verse. Its contributors include Voisine, who, it turns out, does, at least on occasion, poem.

title: Letters: The Stranger
description: To the Editor:

title: Office Interior Design on a Dorm Budget
description: Step off the office elevator and youre immediately hit with the smell: a cooking aroma, something warm and inviting (corn chowder? bread?) wafting from a spacious, open kitchen with a wall of Waterworks cabinets.

title: Ivan Nova Returns as Yankees Avoid a Phillies Sweep
description: Thirty minutes before the first pitch was thrown at Yankee Stadium on Wednesday, the center-field scoreboard showed a preview of the matchup between the Philadelphia Phillies ace, Cole Hamels, and Ivan Nova, who was making his first start since April 19, 2014.

title: Being Nixon and One Man Against the World
description: In May, to start the final broadcast of David Lettermans late-night show, a dimly familiar yellow-tinged 1970s video began to play. My fellow Americans, Gerald Ford intoned, our long national nightmare is over. In specially recorded messages, Presidents Bush, Clinton, Bush and Obama then recited the famous line, which Ford had first spoken just after the disgraced Richard Nixon left the White House, the only president ever to resign. No one in the Letterman bit mentioned Nixons name, but his specter  as it so often does in our political culture  hovered over the whole thing.

title: Tearing Down the Confederate Flag Is Just a Start
description: Suppose African-Americans marked their heritage with flags depicting Nat Turners rebellion of 1831, in which slaves massacred about 60 whites before the uprising was crushed? The flag wouldnt be celebrating the murder of whites, of course, but would simply commemorate a factual milestone in black history!

title: Les Bains, a Legendary Parisian Nightclub, Brought Back to Life
description: PARIS  Perhaps only in Paris would a past-its-prime nightclub be brought back from dereliction. But to Parisians of a certain age, Les Bains Douches was not just any old bote de nuit.

title: Video Review: The McLaren 650S Spider Is a $280,000 Thrill Ride
description: THE McLaren 650S Spider is less of an automobile than it is equal parts Gerry Judah sculpture, Space Mountain thrill ride and carbon-fiber engineering shrine. There is no need for a vehicle like this, but thank the car gods it exists, for it brings great joy to those who glimpse and drive it.

title: Review: A Mix of Sounds at the New York City Electroacoustic Music Festival
description: For those who like their music extra durational, its a rich week in New York. The Bang on a Can Marathon provided nearly 11 eclectic hours this past Sunday, and this coming Sunday the Whitney Museum of American Art is presenting  over eight hours  Conlon Nancarrows complete studies for player piano.

title: Review: Dragons: Race to the Edge, a Dark Animated Series on Netflix
description: Why leave a five-year gap between the events depicted in Part 1 of your animated theatrical trilogy and the events depicted in Part 2? So you can squeeze a few television series into the empty space.

title: Amazon Echo, a.k.a. Alexa, Is a Personal Aide in Need of Schooling
description: THIS week, I asked a friend for help: Alexa, can you write this review for me?

title: The Persistence of ACA Denialism
description: I guess people with strong political preferences have always had a hard time accepting facts that are at odds with those prejudices; but I do also think that it has gotten worse in modern America thanks to the closed information loop of movement conservatism and the incestuous amplification it brings. You see it in things like the rise of inflation trutherism; you also see it in the inability of many on the right to accept the reality that Obamacare really has covered a lot of previously uninsured Americans.

title: Pictures of the Day: Libya, Spain and Elsewhere
description: France, Indonesia and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Ex-Advisers Warn Obama That Iran Nuclear Deal May Fall Short of Standards
description: Five former members of President Obamas inner circle of Iran advisers have written an open letter expressing concern that a pending accord to stem Irans nuclear program may fall short of meeting the administrations own standard of a good agreement and laying out a series of minimum requirements that Iran must agree to in coming days for them to support a final deal.

title: June 24, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Libya, France, Indonesia and Spain.

title: Jacob Lawrence: The Migration Series, by Leah Dickerman and Elsa Smithgall
description: One by one, the people left. Cotton sacks shed in place, a silent seepage from the fields, a human rivulet, and then a flood of six million black refugees fleeing the terrors of the Jim Crow South from World War I to 1970, an Overground Railroad that churned for nearly three generations and transformed the culture and social geography of 20th-century America. This leaderless revolution would come to be known as the Great Migration, and it would reshape every Northern and Western city it touched. By the time it was over, a rural people had become urban, and a Southern people had spread themselves over the country. Yet it was largely unrecognized, invisible to a majority of Americans while it was underway and almost too big to grasp even for those who were part of it.

title: Viewing Held for Pinckney
description: Mourners viewed the body of the Rev. Clementa C. Pinckney, the pastor and state senator slain at the Emanuel A.M.E. Church in Charleston, S.C., on Wednesday.

title: A Water-Friendly Design From the Young Architect Newly Anointed by MoMA PS1
description: The United Nations has predicted that by 2025, two-thirds of the world will lack sufficient water supply. It was this statistic that inspired the architect Andrs Jaque to develop Cosmo, his design for an outdoor installation which this past February earned first place in MoMAs 16th annual Young Architect Program. The competitions rules stipulate that submissions must integrate a sustainability element, and as the founder of the boutique design agency Office for Political Innovation, Jaque is no stranger to using his work to catalyze discussion. Architecture has been very iconic over the last decade, so people can recognize it easily, Jaque says. But I wanted to make the way we deal with water recognizable. I took this opportunity to show that making our lives compatible with other things is not necessarily a punishment, but can be something enjoyable.

title: Extinction Up Close:  A Rare Turtle Under Assault from Poachers
description: By now, youve likely heard about Accelerated modern humaninduced species losses: Entering the sixth mass extinction.

title: Summer Resident
description: Where does a great white shark go this time of year? Anywhere it wants to.

title: Raf Simons: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: Paris

title: Health Panel Recommends Cautious Approach to Meningitis B Vaccine
description: A panel of health experts stopped short of recommending that all American adolescents and young adults be vaccinated against a dangerous strain of meningitis that has caused outbreaks at Princeton University and the University of California campus in Santa Barbara, opting instead to let doctors decide whether to give the vaccine.

title: First the Flag, Now What About the Gun?
description: The sudden abandonment of the Confederate flag by Southern politicians has raised the question of whether the Charleston gun massacre of nine churchgoers might also prompt action on gun safety. The early answer is dont count on it.

title: The Oscars of Fragrance: The Perfumed Envelope, Please
description: This carpet is garbage, muttered one of 20-odd photographers last week at the ceremonial entrance to the Fragrance Foundation Awards (long known as the FiFis, like a disobedient poodle, though that nickname is now discouraged by its public-relations team, in the interest of gravitas). Many famous people have represented scents in one capacity or another. But only a smattering can be persuaded to attend the perfume industrys most important annual event, its ultimate prize, its Oscars.

title: John Kasich Appeals to Iowa as He Ponders White House Bid
description: DES MOINES  Does anybody remember me? John Kasich asked Iowans on his first visit to the state since an inglorious presidential bid in 1999, when he barely made an impression before dropping out.

title: Kenji Kawano: 40 Years with the Navajo
description: A Japanese photographer who only knew about Native Americans from Hollywood westerns became a dedicated chronicler of the Navajo people.

title: Review: The Royal Ballet Returns to New York With The Dream
description: The Royal Ballet remains one of the worlds finest ballet companies. The season its presenting at the David H. Koch Theater  the first time in that theater, and its first visit to New York in 11 years, the city that was its second home from 1949 to 1976  is in some ways problematic. But at the opener on Tuesday, with a performance of Frederick Ashtons Shakespeare-fairyland The Dream (1964), many aspects of style brightly flooded the theater.

title: Review: DanceBrazil Offers a Middle Passage Lesson at the Joyce Theater
description: Malungos, a new work by Jelon Vieira, the founder and artistic director of DanceBrazil, represents the Middle Passage, the awful transit of enslaved Africans from their homelands to settlements in the New World. In the piece, performers bid sad farewells to ancestral grounds, but then, trapped in the hull of a slavers ship, they rediscover the bonding force of dance. Malungo was a word that slaves employed to address one another, a recognition of solidarity.

title: Pursuit of Cash Taints Promise of Gene Tests
description: Dr. Scott Wilson often participated in medical studies, so the one being proposed by the New Orleans laboratory Renaissance RX seemed reasonable.

title: Tour of a Greek Factory
description: With Greece virtually broke, the government is looking to raise taxes on businesses to fill its financial gap.

title: Review: Colleen Focuses on Precision With Fingers and Feet
description: At SubCulture in Manhattan on Tuesday night, Cecile Schott, the French musician who performs as Colleen, was preoccupied with precision. In her hands was a treble viola da gamba, an instrument largely associated with Baroque music. At her feet, a set of loop and delay pedals. She played a bit on her instrument, captured the sound with the pedals, then used that loop as a base from which to add layers and depth.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: The Internet of Things Has Vast Economic Potential, McKinsey Report Says
description: The economic opportunity created by the so-called Internet of things has barely been scratched, according to a report released Wednesday.

title: Updating an Internet Radio
description: Q. My tabletop Internet radio occasionally drops a station Ive been listening to for many months because the station changes its address  but the URL the radio uses never gets updated. Is there an Internet radio that lets me input the new stream address instead of searching its preprogrammed database?

title: Review: Eiko Otake Holds a Mourning Service at Rush Hour
description: A strong wind was picking up on Tuesday afternoon as the choreographer Eiko Otake drifted along one side of the new Fulton Center in Lower Manhattan. In a pale yellow robe, with paler powdered skin and a bouquet of weeds in hand, she cut a striking image at rush hour, slower and ghostlier than anything around her. Onlookers trailed her with smartphones and cameras as she approached a propped-open door. She paused to shed her sandals, as if entering someones home.

title: The Knights in Central Park
description: Scenes from a concert by the orchestral collective.

title: Review: The Knights Are Spirited in Central Park, Despite Soggy Weather
description: Write-ups of summer concerts in New York parks are often as much weather reports as reviews. So be it.

title: Shopping Events and Sales This Week in New York
description: On Thursday, H. Stern reopens its Fifth Avenue store after a major renovation by the So Paulo and New York architecture firm Studio Arthur Casas to coincide with the Brazilian jewelers 70th anniversary. Designed to evoke the inside of a jewelry box, the space features showcases and desks in curved shapes with bijoux like an Oscar Niemeyer cuff in 18-karat gold with diamonds ($19,700) that appear to float above cantilevered structures. At 645 Fifth Avenue.

title: Businesses Worry About Shouldering Burden of Greek Debt
description: THESSALONIKI, Greece  Thanos Tziritis, the chief executive of Greeces largest building materials company, is proud of how his business survived the worst depression in the nations modern history.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres the latest.

title: Growing Older With Madonna
description: In the video for Bitch Im Madonna, a party anthem released last Wednesday, the pop star of the title, in a clingy Moschino leopard-print dress, hot-pink coif and gold teeth grills, romps through the corridors of the Standard hotel along Manhattans High Line. The bass is pumping, she sings, adding a suggestive phrase before gleefully making out with some guy in the hallway.

title: Ramadan Fashion
description: High-priced looks from Tommy Hilfiger, Monique Lhuillier and more.

title: Greek Lawmaker Compares Debt Crisis to Holocaust
description: A nationalist politician who serves in the Greek Parliament apologized Wednesday for a Facebook post in which he compared his nations suffering under austerity measures imposed by its European creditors, including Germany, to the plight of Jews slaughtered in the Nazi death camp at Auschwitz.

title: For Ramadan, Courting the Muslim Shopper
description: On his Armani/Dolci website and in his sweets emporiums across the Middle East, Giorgio Armani is offering a box of chocolates, date-and-honey-filled pralines sans alcohol.

title: Middle-Class Black Families, in Low-Income Neighborhoods
description: Many of the nations racial disparities stem from the simple economic fact that white families make more money than black families on average, a gap that has remained stubbornly large in recent decades.

title: Dmitri Hvorostovsky Cancels Appearances for Brain Tumor Treatment
description: The celebrated Russian baritone Dmitri Hvorostovsky has a brain tumor and has canceled all engagements through the end of August, according to an announcement posted Wednesday on his website.

title: Excerpts From Official Sentencing of Dzhokhar Tsarnaev
description: Excerpts taken from transcripts from Mr. Tsarnaevs official sentencing show that he expressed remorse for his role in the Boston Marathon bombing and admitted to causing irreparable damage.

title: Comments by Judge George A. OToole Jr. Before Sentencing Dzhokhar Tsarnaev
