description: Jimbo Fisher, the football coach at Florida State, announced Thursday night that the freshman quarterback DeAndre Johnson had been suspended indefinitely for a violation of athletic department policy.

title: Photo Diary: Comme des Garons Homme Plus Spring/Summer 2016 Mens
description: Scenes from Paris Fashion Week, captured by Molly S.J. Lowe.

title: Recalling Sarah Charlesworths Photographs
description: Sarah Charlesworth did not like being called a photographer. She preferred to speak of herself as someone who makes art with photographs, alluding to her practice of sitting at a table and sifting through images from her extensive source files. She would mix and match pictures and rephotograph them in new configurations. Unlike earlier photographers, who spoke of the pursuit and capture of trophy images as if they were hunting big game, Ms. Charlesworth favored the grand indoors.

title: Can 20 Million YouTube Fans Make Smosh: The Movie a Hit?
description: LOS ANGELES  For the last decade, the comedy duo Smosh  Ian Hecox and Anthony Padilla  have captivated a horde of teenagers with a steady stream of short and silly videos posted to YouTube.

title: Gemma Chan Explains the Art of Being a Robot on Humans
description: She bumped into sets and crew members. She even tumbled down the stairs. Playing a robot in the new AMC drama Humans was awkward at first for the British actress Gemma Chan. I honestly thought my head would explode, she said with a laugh by phone from London.

title: Popcast: Apple Music and Beats 1
description: Apple sees the future, and it is  radio. In part, anyway.

title: Escaped Convicts Appear to Be Heading to Canada, New York Police Say
description: MALONE, N.Y.  The two escaped murderers who have eluded capture for nearly three weeks appear to be headed toward Canada, the New York State Police announced on Friday.

title: Acting Coaches and Rehearsals: YouTube Stars Are Getting Movie-World Lessons
description: The entertainment entrepreneurs of YouTube and Vine are used to minimalist working conditions. In making the short videos that have catapulted them to social media stardom, they pretty much handle everything themselves: the writing, the lighting, the filming, the editing, the uploading  even the snacks.

title: Emma Stone and Kevin Hart Invited to Join Academy as Ava DuVernay Runs for Board of Governors
description: LOS ANGELES  The actress Emma Stone (Birdman), the actor Kevin Hart (The Wedding Ringer), the director Franois Ozon (Young & Beautiful), the producer Wyck Godfrey (The Fault in Our Stars) and Ted Sarandos, the Netflix chief content officer, were among 322 film professionals invited to join the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, the Academy said on Friday.

title: Shabab Militants Attack African Union Base in Somalia
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia  Rebels with the Shabab militant group attacked an African Union Mission base in southern Somalia on Friday, and the group claimed to have killed as many as 50 soldiers from Burundi and Somalia.

title: Aftermath of Suicide Bomb in Kuwait City
description: The Islamic State claimed responsibility for a deadly blast in one of the largest Shiite mosques in Kuwait City during Friday prayers.

title: A Persistent, but Quiet, Campaign Made Lunar New Year a School Holiday
description: On Wednesday night at the Yung Wing School, a public elementary school in Chinatown, students performed songs from the Disney musical Mulan, dancing crisply in traditional silk costumes ironed that morning by their parents. These were the voices of the next Asian-American generation in New York City  and they were loud.

title: Crying Foul on Plans to Expand the S.E.C.s In-House Court System
description: As the top cop on Wall Street, the Securities and Exchange Commission usually enjoys broad support for its work fighting fraud in the nations financial markets. But a recent agency stance has generated such criticism that even some of the S.E.C.s high-powered alumni are calling for a do-over.

title: Andy Roddick Talks About His Life After Tennis
description: Since he retired from professional tennis in 2012, Andy Roddick has talked about all things sports in television studios and podcasts as a broadcaster for Fox Sports 1. He has not, however, done match commentary on the sport he knows best. That will change when he joins the BBC broadcast team for the second week of Wimbledon, where Roddick won plenty of fans but never a title despite three appearances in the singles final.

title: WeWork Stretches Sharing-Economy Valuations
description: WeWork is stretching valuations for the sharing economy. The company, an American provider of office space to millennial workers, is valued by investors at $10 billion after its latest private funding round, doubling in just six months.

title: A Times Podcast With Win-a-Trip Winner Austin Meyer
description: Austin Meyer reports on a former drug dealer who is trying to earn his high school diploma.

title: Hard Politicking Behind Democrats Yea Votes on Trade Bill
description: WASHINGTON  On the evening of June 15, President Obama joined a conference call with the two men who had done more than anyone in six years to disrupt, derail or defeat his agenda in Congress. Now they were asking for something that was in short supply: trust.

title: Obama Delivers Eulogy for Slain Pastor
description: President Obama delivered the eulogy at the funeral of the Rev. Clementa C. Pinckney, who was one of nine people killed last week during an attack inside the Emanuel A.M.E. Church in Charleston, S.C.

title: Cheering Marriage Decision, Hillary Clinton Heads to Provincetown
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton transformed her H-and-an-arrow campaign logo into a gay-rights rainbow on Friday to mark the Supreme Courts same-sex marriage ruling. She issued a statement calling the courts decision an affirmation of the commitment of couples across the country who love one another. Her campaign sells a variety of branded Hillary items timed to Junes Gay Pride Month.

title: A Legoland Builder Turns Her Childhood Hobby Into an Adult Art Form
description: Pablo Picassos birthday was coming up and Veronica Watson wanted to celebrate. She was standing in her workshop at the Legoland Discovery Center in Yonkers last October, where she serves as the master model builder, and was scanning online through the artists paintings.

title: Dylann Roof Had AR-15 Parts During Police Stop in March, Record Shows
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  Dylann Roof, the man accused of killing nine people this month in a shooting rampage at a storied church in Charleston, S.C., was questioned by an officer earlier this year while hanging around a park, according to a police record released Friday. The officer found parts for a semiautomatic rifle in the trunk of Mr. Roofs car.

title: Berluti: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: Paris

title: Their Quest Ends With a Ruling
description: In 2011, Pat Dwyer and Stephen Mosher raced out of their rented blue van for a marriage ceremony on the sidewalk in front of the United States Supreme Court building.

title: Podcast: Empathy and Opportunity in Baltimore
description: Dontay Burrell, 21, is a former drug dealer from the same West Baltimore neighborhood that was home to Freddie Gray. With help from Thread, which helps high school students facing tough challenges in and out of school, Burrell is trying to earn his high school diploma.

title: Obama Sings Amazing Grace
description: The president broke into the spiritual after delivering the eulogy for the Rev. Clementa C. Pinckney, the slain South Carolina state senator and former pastor of Emanuel A.M.E. Church.

title: Drunk Wedding Faced Too High a Bar to the Big Screen
description: LOS ANGELES  In the spring of 2013, Paramount Pictures held a research screening at a multiplex here for a new comedy called Drunk Wedding. The studios vice chairman was so eager to learn the results that he attended in person.

title: Richard Matt, Escaped Prisoner in New York Manhunt, Is Fatally Shot
description: Richard W. Matt, one of the two convicted murderers who engineered an elaborate escape from New Yorks largest prison, was shot and killed on Friday by a federal agent, the authorities said, ending one prong of a three-week manhunt that spread over large stretches of the states northern terrain.

title: Roger Federer Still in the Mix at Wimbledon, His Lawn of Dreams

description: A plaque on the exterior of the Hotel Monaco in Alexandria, Va., honors the first martyr to the cause of Southern independence.

title: Fashion World Reacts to Same-Sex Marriage Ruling
description: The Supreme Court ruled this morning that same-sex marriage is a Constitutional right. Members of the fashion world took to social media to show their support. Here are some of their responses.

title: The Instant Republican Backlash on Gay Marriage
description: Just as you could hear the cheering start in front of the Supreme Court building as the TV news reporters were still leafing through the decision upholding marriage equality today, it took mere moments for the right wing to provide the predictable backlash.

title: On Instagram: Marriage Equality
description: Americans across the country took to social media to celebrate the Supreme Courts decision making same-sex marriage a right.

title: Bernie Sanderss Early Online Haul: $8.3 Million

title: The Bronx Zoos Loneliest Elephant
description: On a gray day in mid-June, at the edge of a leafy enclosure in the Bronx Zoos Wild Asia habitat, an elephant named Happy stood very still, gazing over the fence. There were a few logs scattered around, some grass and shrubs, and a concrete-lined pool. A green ball was marooned at the waters edge.

title: From the Upshot: Bernie Sanderss Early Online Haul Is $8.3 Million
description: Bernie Sanderss Early Online Haul: $8.3 Million

title: Review: Boney James Performs with Panache in Smooth Cruise Kickoff
description: Forty minutes into his sold-out first set on the Smooth Cruise on Wednesday, Boney James dialed up his crowd work with the efficient panache of a retail politician. First came the selection of a woman from the audience, who needed no cajoling to strut onstage and start dancing in a comically suggestive face-off with Mr. James and his tenor saxophone.

title: Review: A Mix of Sounds at the New York City Electroacoustic Music Festival
description: For those who like their music extra durational, its a rich week in New York. The Bang on a Can Marathon provided nearly 11 eclectic hours this past Sunday, and this coming Sunday the Whitney Museum of American Art is presenting  over eight hours  Conlon Nancarrows complete studies for player piano.

title: Glastonbury Festival Celebrates Its 45th Anniversary
description: PILTON, England  Michael Eavis pulled his beat-up Land Rover off the muddy track and onto the grass. Look at this land weve got, he said.

title: As a Landmark, Stonewall Gets C for Looks but A for Meaning
description: On Tuesday morning after nearly two hours of testimony from bureaucrats, academics and activists of the old guard  speeches variously formulaic and spirited  the citys Landmarks Preservation Commission unanimously voted to grant landmark status to the Stonewall Inn, the Greenwich Village bar that is recognized as the home of a turning point in the gay-rights movement. In their comments, many referred to President Obamas 2013 inaugural address, which cited Stonewall, along with Selma and Seneca Falls, as monumental signposts of the countrys continuing struggle for broader equality. Even the Real Estate Board of New York, the powerful lobbying group that can look upon preservation the way vegans regard a rib-eye, sent a representative to stand in support of the distinction.

title: Grenades, Fear and Uncertainty Become Routine as an Election Nears in Burundi
description: BUJUMBURA, Burundi  When the order came to leave their protest camp, the students voiced the same refrain.

title: The Story of New Yorks First Black Police Officer, Told With the Help of Langston Hughes
description: It is odd that Samuel J. Battle, the first black officer in the New York Police Department, is not a larger part of our citys lore. He was a giant man  6-foot-3 and nearly 300 pounds  who more than 100 years ago led the integration of the department, then essentially an Irish-American enclave.

title: Friday Night Music: Got To Admit Its Getting Better
description: Well, it has been a pretty good few days: health reform, marriage rights, fair housing, and a long-overdue recognition that fighting for slavery was wrong. And for some reason, I find myself reaching back to the past. Maybe its because Justice Scalia told us to go ask the nearest hippie. Maybe because todays Times real-estate-section report on what its like to live in  features the town where I grew up. (I remember the split-level ranches  those were the fancy houses. We had an ordinary, small ranch on a slab foundation  no basement. I believe my parents bought it for $15,000.)

title: Skyscraper
description: How high can a Lego tower go?

title: Grandmas Hand
description: On Avenue C in the East Village, Adela Fergusons authentic Puerto Rican food has warmed the hearts of many who long for the dishes of the island.

title: Casa Adela in East Village Is the Home of the Magical Rotisserie Chicken
description: It was a sunny weekday lunchtime on Avenue C, and as always, there was a lot of activity on the sidewalk outside Casa Adela. Three smiling men in faded T-shirts and loose jeans sat on plastic chairs next door, chatting in front of neatly graffitied shutters. Maritza Lopez, 54, stood in the shade with three of her grandchildren in navy blue school T-shirts, each clutching a white plastic bag with Thank You printed in red. Inside were foam containers full of rice and black beans, half a rotisserie chicken and avocado salad.

title: Review: String Orchestra of Brooklyn Plays a Program of Spare Works at Roulette
description: Concert programs often feature works with starkly contrasting styles, but an imaginative lineup at Roulette on Thursday by the String Orchestra of Brooklyn included three pieces that created a consistent mood.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Review: Jeremy Jordan, Take-No-Prisoners Heartthrob, Has a New Cabaret Act
description: Not since the young Harry Connick Jr. blazed across New York nightclub and concert stages in the late 1980s have I seen a male entertainer as ferociously determined as Jeremy Jordan to conquer the world. On Wednesday evening, this grinning heartthrob of Broadway (Newsies) and television (Smash) stampeded through 54 Below with a show business cavalry led by his musical director and pianist, Benjamin Rauhala.

title: Earth as Art  From Near (Inside a Stone) and Far (the Space Station)
description: NASA astronaut Scott Kelly, who is 91 days into a yearlong mission as commander of the International Space Station, has been posting strings of photographs of our remarkable planet on Twitter using the hashtags #EarthArt and #YearInSpace. Here are a few examples from earlier in June:

title: How Simon Doonan Spends His Sundays
description: As the creative ambassador of Barneys New York, Simon Doonan  who is also a humor writer and an author  spends much of his week attending store events and hobnobbing with notables. On weekends, the British expat removes his ambassadorial sash and relaxes on Shelter Island, where he shares a beachfront home with his husband, the designer Jonathan Adler, and their rescue dog, Foxylady. Mr. Doonan, 62, and Mr. Adler, 48, were instrumental in designing their rustic modern, Big Sur-style home. They chose the area for its small-town, hokey vibe.

title: Review: John Kelly Revives Love of a Poet
description: Manicured uniformity is bred into the bones of Governors Island, with its red brick buildings and military past. Waves lap at its edges, the Lower Manhattan skyline rises close across the bay, and yet romance is scarce. But this weekend, the River to River festival has imported a supply.

title: The Legacy of Coal in England
description: A photographer captures the cultural and social life of his home, the countrys once thriving coalfields.

title: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres the latest.

title: Two Reasons to Visit Inwood: Dyckman Farmhouse Museum and Darling Coffee
description: The confluence of the Harlem and Hudson Rivers shapes a pocket of land at the northernmost tip of Manhattan, a portal to the islands oldest forest once roamed by Native Americans. In the 1600s, warring Lenapes and Mohawks and a smallpox epidemic cleared the way for a Dutch settler, Jan Dyckman. He exercised his ax skills to sever virgin trees and built a homestead that still beats in the heart of Inwood.

title: Sci-Fi Writers Find Warmer Climate Amid Cuban Thaw
description: Jos Miguel Snchez discovered Conan the Barbarian as a 10-year-old boy in Havana. Before long, he was wearing giant boots and sporting a mane of long hair, inventing a personal style that he calls medieval-rocker  risky behavior in a society that shuns individualism.

title: The Scene
description: Givenchy Mens at Paris Fashion Week.

title: An Old-Fashioned Bartender Known for His Pour and His Personality
description: Ive never worked a day in my life, said Patty Ford, 61, leaning over the bar at Wollenskys Grill so that his raspy voice could be heard over the low roar of the after-work crowd on a recent weeknight.

title: Review: Bette Midler Is Still Naughty and Bawdy, but Reflective, Too
description: Bette Midlers smile is a sight to behold. Even glimpsed from afar on the stage of Madison Square Garden, that radiant grin  shockingly intimate, concupiscent, goofy and forgiving  suggests: You cant fool me. Were all human beings playing dress-up and putting on a show. So why not have fun, let our hair down and be a little naughty so long as no one gets hurt?

title: Love Has Won: Reaction to the Supreme Court Ruling on Gay Marriage
description: To the Editor:

title: Photo Diary: Givenchy Spring/Summer 2016 Mens

title: A Starting Wage of $15 an Hour: The New Normal?
description: The Fight for $15 notched a big victory on Friday, when 35,000 home care workers in Massachusetts became the first in the nation to achieve a statewide starting wage of $15 an hour.

title: Review: Mark Morris Conducts at Tanglewood, and Offers a Debut
description: LENOX, Mass.  The Tanglewood Music Center is celebrating its 75th anniversary this year, and the opening-night concert in Seiji Ozawa Hall on Thursday was a curious mix of familiar elements and unusual arrangements. The program began and concluded with one of Bachs Brandenburg Concertos  the same one, with different instrumentation.

title: Exes Explain Ghosting, the Ultimate Silent Treatment
description: It was not long ago that Sean Penn and Charlize Theron were a happy couple: appearing together at fashion shows and film festivals, hugging on the beach. Recently, though, it was reported that Ms. Theron had stopped responding to Mr. Penns calls and text messages. She was ghosting him.

title: Sam Roberts on Books on New York Topics From the 1870s to the 1930s
What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week.

title: Auto Regulator Opens Inquiries Into 5 Vehicles
description: Since General Motors began recalling 2.6 million older small cars with defective ignition switches last year, federal regulators have been criticized for their failure to thoroughly investigate the problem despite receiving clear warnings from vehicle owners.

title: The Real Rough-Talking Priest Behind On the Waterfront
description: Q. Was the role of the priest who was played by Karl Malden in the movie On the Waterfront based on a real priest?

title: Saving the Cows, Starving the Children
description: London  GANDHI famously denied himself food. And by starving himself to protest British rule, he ultimately made India stronger. But Indias leaders today are using food as a weapon, and they are sacrificing not themselves, but others. Their decisions threaten to make Indias children  already among the most undernourished in the world  weaker still.

title: A Word With: Andrew Sullivan
description: In the cavalcade of online commentary after the Supreme Court ruled on Friday morning that the Constitution guarantees a right to same-sex marriage, one of the most prominent voices on the issue was missing  for a couple of hours, at least.

title: Just Recognized
description: The Supreme Court legalizes same-sex marriage.

title: Bill Cunningham | Floppy Disks
description: The wide-brimmed straw shade hat, stripped of decoration, has been rediscovered by a new generation. The fancy hats popularized by the British royal family have been rejected in favor of functionality. Worn by people headed for weekend boat rides, these hats recall a more romantic moment in fashion. Some prefer parasols but those tie up the hands. Straw fedoras,are popular, too.

title: June 26, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from the United States, Tunisia, Beijing and elsewhere.

title: June 26, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from the United States, Tunisia, Kuwait, and Jerusalem.

title: Get-Rich Scheme Goes Comically Awry in The Producers
description: A Max Bialystock who looks like Mel Brooks. A Leo Bloom who sings mellifluously and mewls comically. A curvy Ulla with a sweet smile and a mischievous twinkle. Confetti. Whats not to like about the bubbly, bodacious production of The Producers now at the John W. Engeman Theater at Northport?

title: Contemporary Art From a Generous Couple
description: Herbert and Lenore Schorr recognize that there is a downside as well as an upside to giving a museum valuable works of art.

title: Was This the Right Way to Legalize Gay Marriage?
description: Justice Anthony Kennedys majority opinion in todays momentous 5-to-4 Supreme Court decision bringing marriage equality to every state in the country shows that he likes to let his pen soar: Changed understandings of marriage are characteristic of a Nation where new dimensions of freedom become apparent to new generations, he writes, adding that it demeans gays and lesbians for the State to lock them out of a central institution of the Nations society.

title: The Week in Political Pictures
description: Historic decisions from the Supreme Court, battle flag debates and funerals in Charleston, S.C.

title: Norman Lear and Seth MacFarlane and Their TV Families
description: At 92 years old, and right on time, Norman Lear, the legendary television writer and producer, jogged up the steps of Baltaire, a restaurant in the Brentwood neighborhood of Los Angeles. Seth MacFarlane, a fellow sitcom creator and filmmaker, followed soon after  in more ways than one.

title: The Nations First Planned Burial Ground
description: Every Fourth of July, a column of the Governors Foot Guard in Connecticut, one of the countrys oldest military units, marches in procession through the gates of the New Haven Burial Ground, one of the countrys oldest operating cemeteries. In their red jackets and thick gold epaulets, the men proceed to the grave of David Humphreys, an aide-de-camp to George Washington during the Revolutionary War. Speeches are given, chests are puffed and afterward onlookers snap selfies with the guards.

title: First Draft Focus: The Week in Political Pictures
Welcome, Everyone, to the Right to Marry
description: FOR an institution that has, especially in recent weeks and years, been subject to such extensive and vigorous public debate, marriage is strangely unknowable  that is, any particular marriage is mysterious, to anyone outside it.

title: Evening Hours | Damp Nights, Fiery Events
description: Swing dancing, yoga and musical performances.

title: The Allure of the Prison Break
description: IN my time as a rookie prison officer at Sing Sing, in Ossining, N.Y., I had to pass through 10 locked gates to reach the housing block where I worked. I would think about how I might escape if I were a prisoner there.

title: A Dissenter on Same-Sex Marriage
description: Michael N. Jones spoke out against Fridays Supreme Court decision that same-sex marriage is a constitutional right.

title: Conservative Lawmakers and Faith Groups Seek Exemptions After Same-Sex Ruling
description: Within hours of the Supreme Court decision legalizing same-sex marriage, an array of conservatives including the governors of Texas and Louisiana and religious groups called for stronger legal protections for those who want to avoid any involvement in same-sex marriage, like catering a gay wedding or providing school housing to gay couples, based on religious beliefs.

title: 2 Cabdrivers Are Disciplined for Refusing to Take Puerto Rican Mayor to the Bronx
description: One New York City taxicab driver has lost his license and another was fined for refusing to drive the mayor of San Juan, P.R., from Manhattan to a hotel in the Bronx last month, officials said.

title: Mass Killings by ISIS Fighters in Syrian Kurdish Town
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Islamic State fighters who sneaked into the Syrian Kurdish town of Kobani on the Turkish border killed more than 150 people there and in nearby villages, Kurdish activists and a monitoring group said Friday.

title: No Shock: Connor McDavid and Jack Eichel Lead N.H.L. Draft
description: SUNRISE, Fla.  The two most dynamic young prospects  Connor McDavid and Jack Eichel  were taken first and second Friday at the N.H.L. draft.

title: G.O.P. Hopefuls Denounce Marriage Equality Ruling
description: WASHINGTON  Across the country, among people of all ages and religions, the acceptance of same-sex marriage has grown with stunning speed. But not in the leadership of the Republican Party.

title: Working Within the System to Disrupt Brazilian Politics
description: BELM, Brazil  SOME Brazilian politicians duck questions about the scope of their aspirations, insisting they have absolutely no plans, say, of running for mayor of So Paulo, seeking a cabinet post or wielding power from some other coveted perch in Brazils huge bureaucracy.

title: Gay Conservatism and Straight Liberation
description: BEFORE there was a national debate about same-sex marriage, there was a debate within the gay community about whether it was a worthwhile goal to chase at all.

title: Cuomo and de Blasio Find Common Ground in Celebration of Gay Marriage Decision
description: Mayor Bill de Blasios team had the celebration on standby: five gay pride flags, to be unfurled if the moment came, and two lesbian couples amenable to a very public wedding ceremony.

title: Legal Challenges Remain for Health Law
description: WASHINGTON  The Affordable Care Act survived another major test at the Supreme Court this week, all but assuring its place in the social safety net, but the legal challenges to the law are far from over.

description: FRIDAYS RESULTS

title: Long Island High School Alumni Recall Connection to the Confederate Flag
description: The high school team was called the Rebels. Their logo, a Confederate battle flag and a rifle-toting soldier.

title: Fireworks Prohibitions Ease in Many States
description: NEWBURGH, N.Y.  After stocking up on sparklers and flaming fountains, Don Eason couldnt resist adding one more impulse buy to his incendiary items: a Fiery Frog, which promises to erupt in a column of crackling, multicolor sparks.

title: Investigator Gets 3 Months in Prison in Hacking Case
description: A private investigator in New York who illegally rummaged through the emails of dozens of people was sentenced to three months in prison on Friday as questions arose about how his case was investigated.

title: Celebrations Follow Supreme Court Ruling on Same-Sex Marriage
description: The 5-to-4 decision came against a backdrop of fast-moving changes in public opinion.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: Road to N.B.A. Is Taking Detour Around College
description: Three of the top seven picks taken in the N.B.A. draft on Thursday did not play college basketball, only the second time that had happened since the 2006 draft, when the N.B.A. began to require draftees to be at least one year removed from high school.

title: Nepal: Rough Terrain and Bad Weather Led to Helicopter Crash, Report Says
description: The crash of a United States Marines helicopter in Nepal that killed 13 people in May was caused by bad weather and the geography of the region, the Nepalese Army said in a statement Friday. The UH-1 Huey helicopter had been on a relief mission to aid people affected by a major earthquake in April when it lost radio contact after a second earthquake hit the region. In the statement, the army said that a joint investigation by Nepalese and American military officials found that hilly terrain and bad weather caused the helicopters pilot to strike hard rock at 11,200 feet in the Kalinchowk area, east of the capital, Kathmandu. The Marines and Nepals army had originally said that six Marines and two Nepalese Army officials had been killed, but earlier this month Nepals army announced that five civilians had also been on the flight.

title: Lively Morgue Tumblr 532 & 533
description: Lively Morgue Tumblr 532 & 533

title: Jubilation and Weddings, but Also Confusion, Delay and Denunciation
description: WASHINGTON  In Detroit, Atlanta and Austin, Tex., same-sex couples rushed to courthouses to marry. Here in the nations capital, people wiped away tears as a gay mens chorus sang The Star-Spangled Banner on the marble steps of the Supreme Court. In Cincinnati, Mayor John Cranley presided over a public same-sex wedding ceremony as a guitarist played acoustic melodies near a fountain in a downtown square.

title: State Senate Confirms Former Cuomo Aide to Serve on M.T.A. Board
description: The State Senate this week did not confirm three people recommended by Mayor Bill de Blasio to serve on the Metropolitan Transportation Authoritys board.

title: Womens World Cup: United States Defeats ChinaWith a Flick of the Head and a Flip of the Mood
description: OTTAWA  Carli Lloyd sprinted toward the right sideline, her face contorted in joy, before she aimed a flying kick at the corner flag. Her teammates, giving chase close behind, mobbed her in celebration, forming a jubilant tornado of white jerseys and neon green socks.

description: Wow, Supreme Court  what a week.

title: Angering Conservatives and Liberals, Chief Justice John Roberts Defends Steady Restraint
description: WASHINGTON  On Thursday, when Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. helped save the Affordable Care Act for a second time, conservatives accused him of everything short of treason.

title: Yevgeny Primakov, Former Russian Premier and Spymaster, Dies at 85
description: MOSCOW  Yevgeny M. Primakov, a former prime minister of Russia, the countrys first post-Soviet spymaster and for decades the Kremlins top expert on Middle Eastern affairs, has died, state news agencies said on Friday. He was 85.

title: Kristaps Porzingis Raises Eyebrows, Including Carmelo Anthonys
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  When the Knicks used the fourth pick to select Kristaps Porzingis on Thursday night in the N.B.A. draft, robust jeers accompanied his journey to the stage at Barclays Center. His arrival was not greeted with a great deal of enthusiasm  not by fans at the arena, and not by one interested spectator who was watching from afar.

title: Excellent Mornings Guaranteed

title: Judge Limits Restrictions on Flights to East Hampton
description: Wearing earplugs during tennis matches. Counting helicopters as they thunder over the pricey homes on Georgica Pond on Friday afternoons. Watching renters abandon the Hamptons for Marthas Vineyard or even  unlock those jaws  upstate New York.

title: Help Is on the Way for the Mets, but Its Another Top Pitching Prospect, Not a Hitter
description: Moments after Mets General Manager Sandy Alderson announced that the heralded prospect Steven Matz would make his major league debut on Sunday, Aldersons cellphone began to ring. Looking down to see who was interrupting, he quipped, An unknown fan calling about the six-man rotation.

title: After Arrests, Quandary for Police on Posting Booking Photos
description: SOUTH BURLINGTON, Vt.  Sheena Foley was stunned and chagrined last month when a traffic violation  she had rolled through a stop sign while driving without a current license, she said  led not just to an arrest but to public embarrassment: The Police Department here posted her booking photograph on its Facebook page.

title: Couples Personalizing Role of Religion in Wedding Ceremonies
description: When Evan Wolfson was a high school student in the 1970s, a teenager with a quirky wit and perhaps too much free time, he discovered a mail-order religious organization called the Universal Life Church. He sent an application to an address somewhere out West and duly received a card identifying him as an ordained minister. I carried it in my wallet and swelled with adolescent pride, Mr. Wolfson, 58, said recently. And that was that.

title: Smithsonian Will Tighten Its Guidelines on Disclosure
description: The Smithsonian Institution said Friday it would adopt tighter procedures to govern conflicts of interest involving its researchers, the latest development in a widening national discussion of scientific integrity.

title: Praising Supreme Court, Hillary Clinton Assails G.O.P. Field
description: FAIRFAX, Va.  Hillary Rodham Clinton on Friday night berated her Republican presidential rivals for protesting the Supreme Courts decision legalizing same-sex marriage and for resisting stricter gun laws after the shooting that killed nine churchgoers in Charleston, S.C..

title: Historic Day for Gays, but Twinge of Loss for an Outsider Culture
description: From Capitol Hill in Seattle to Dupont Circle in Washington, gay bars and nightclubs have turned into vitamin stores, frozen yogurt shops and memories. Some of those that remain are filled increasingly with straight patrons, while many former customers say their social lives now revolve around preschools and playgrounds.

title: Red Mascara, 92, Dies; His Im From New Jersey Almost Became State Song
description: Red Mascara, who became New Jerseys most persistent lobbyist with his 55-year bid to make a ditty he had written the official song of the state of Sinatra and Springsteen, died on June 20 at his home in Phillipsburg, N.J. He was 92.

title: Many See a Victory for Children, Too
description: Thousands, including parents, babies and dogs, flocked to the Supreme Court after its ruling on same-sex marriage. Supporters spoke about how they thought the ruling helped maintain and support families.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: For too long weve been blind to the way past injustices continue to shape the present. Perhaps we see that now.

title: Same-Sex Marriage: Landmark Decisions and Precedents
description: The Times is looking back on key legal decisions leading up to the Supreme Court decision on Obergefell v. Hodges on June 26, 2015.

title: Two Yanks Bask in Comforts of Home, Sinking Astros
description: HOUSTON  For rookies or veterans, there is always something special about returning home to play baseball.

title: Whats On TV Saturday
description: 8 P.M. (HBO) JOHN WICK (2014) A fabled hit man (Keanu Reeves) unleashes mayhem on a Russian mobster (Alfie Allen) who has killed the puppy that was the last gift from his recently deceased wife (Bridget Moynahan) in this savage adventure directed by Chad Stahelski (Mr. Reevess stunt double in Constantine and two Matrix films). Willem Dafoe, John Leguizamo, Ian McShane and Michael Nyqvist provide backup. Brilliant in its simplicity, the setup of John Wick, like the rest of the movie, passes swiftly and efficiently, Jeannette Catsoulis wrote in The New York Times, making the film a critics pick. Harboring few ambitions beyond knock-your-socks-off action sequences, this crafty revenge thriller delivers with so much style  and even some wit  that the lack of substance takes longer than it should to become problematic. Until then, were content to tag along as John, revealed as the ne plus ultra of former assassins, comes out of retirement and into the cross hairs. His quest, she added, may be one-note, but that note could not be more perfectly pitched.

title: Face It, Your Brain Is a Computer
description: SCIENCE has a poor track record when it comes to comparing our brains to the technology of the day. Descartes thought that the brain was a kind of hydraulic pump, propelling the spirits of the nervous system through the body. Freud compared the brain to a steam engine. The neuroscientist Karl Pribram likened it to a holographic storage device.

title: In an Uber World, Fortune Favors the Freelancer
description: With the rise of companies like Uber, entrepreneurs in a variety of fields are extending the concept of connecting customers and workers in what is sometimes called the new sharing economy. There are now online services for private tutors, dog walkers and delivery of packages and groceries, among numerous other options, and it is likely that these ventures will expand.

title: About the Maiden-Name Analysis

You can read the article on the trends  which also uses data from the Social Security Administration, the Census Bureau and The New York Times weddings pages  here.

Matt, the convicted murderer who was killed by the police on Friday after a weekslong manhunt, spent most of his time behind bars painting technically skilled portraits of Julia Roberts, President Obama and fellow inmates relatives, and bartering them for preferential treatment, has come as a surprise to many.

title: Variety: A Violent Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Todays quote, taken from Karen ARMSTRONGs book, FIELDS OF BLOOD: Religion and the History of Violence, does not have much to do with the bloody religious insurrections that the book is about, but leans more toward the connection between politics and religion that existed in ancient times.

title: HopSkipDrive, a Ride Start-Up for the After-School Set

But for parents who navigate the citys traffic snarls multiple times a day, commuting to and from work and ferrying their children to school and various activities, the talk can take on a desperate tone.

title: Remember, Knicks Fans, Basketball Is a Global Sport
description: No! Oh, my God! Boooooooo! Children wept, women howled, and hefty men in Knicks jerseys thrust thumbs down as if auditioning as extras for Gladiator II.

title: The Mouth Is Mightier Than the Pen
description: Few methods beat email for sending communication blasts, getting a note in front of a far-flung sales prospect or employer, or attaching pictures and documents.

title: Once a Beloved French Symbol,Cousteaus Ship Now Rusts Into Oblivion
description: CONCARNEAU, France  In its day, the Calypso was more than an oceanographic research vessel. It was the constant companion of the famed French explorer Jacques Cousteau, as the ship and its captain logged over a million nautical miles together from the Red Sea and the Amazon to Antarctica and the Indian Ocean.

title: The Scene
description: Dior Homme at Paris Fashion Week.

title: Photo Diary: Dior Homme Spring/Summer 2016 Mens
description: Scenes from Paris Fashion Week, captured by Alfredo Piola.

title: Serena Williams and Le Coach Seek a New Wimbledon Triumph
description: Wimbledon, true to Rudyard Kiplings famous words inscribed at the All England Club, has indeed been the scene of triumph and disaster for Serena Williams and her coach, Patrick Mouratoglou.

title: Louisville Slugger Craftsman Retires After 46 Years of Turning Out Hits
description: Danny Luckett did some woodworking in high school. Other than that, his main qualification for a job that would help many major league hitters was simply saying yes to the man at the employment office.

title: Does a Pistol Belong in Your Stock Portfolio?
description: A white man sat in a historic black church in Charleston, S.C., on June 17 and then proceeded to gun down nine people in a Bible study group. That mass murder has prompted national soul-searching on racism and renewed calls for stricter national gun control regulations.

title: Kerry, in Vienna, Begins Effort to Complete Nuclear Accord With Iran
description: VIENNA  Secretary of State John Kerry began on Saturday what the Obama administration hopes will be the final push for a nuclear accord with Iran, just three days before a deadline for concluding an agreement.

title: Red Bulls and New York City F.C. Will Meet but Their Approaches Dont
description: The players and coaches from the Red Bulls and New York City F.C. crossed paths for only a few minutes on Thursday. Sharing a podium as they changed places at a news conference promoting their game Sunday at nearly sold-out Yankee Stadium, the two players and their coaches awkwardly held team scarves for the kind of posed photos that most news organizations do not publish.

title: Hes Jesus Christ
description: IN THE NUBA MOUNTAINS, Sudan  IF you subscribe to the caricature of devout religious believers as mostly sanctimonious hypocrites, the kind who rake in cash and care about human life only when it is unborn, come visit the doctor here.

title: How to Help Dr. Tom Catena
description: My June 27 column was about an amazing American physician trying to save lives in the Nuba Mountains of Sudan, even as hes being bombed by the government. Im sure some readers will want to support his work, so let me explain how you can go about doing that.

title: When Reporters Write Books, Does The Times Win, Too?
description: WRITING books must be in the DNA of Times journalists. Even the papers founding editor, Henry J. Raymond, cranked them out, including his History of the Administration of President Lincoln in 1864. The next year, he returned with another, which boasted an equally catchy title: The Life and Public Services of Abraham Lincoln.

title: An Audio Tour of Your Apartment
description: HELLO! And welcome to your apartment. The goal of this audio guide is to foster a deeper appreciation of the place that, given your liberal arts degree and tenuous employment prospects, you certainly wont be moving out of anytime soon. The guide will provide a historical overview of the events, traditions and sheer human drama that have made this place a must-see destination for journalists, scholars and that guy who delivers your Seamless orders. We hope it will give you a fresh and exciting perspective on Apartment 2B. Headset on? Ready? Good. Press 1, then the green arrow, to get started.

title: Art in Public Spaces
description: To the Editor:

title: Magical Thinking in the Sahel
description: ONE morning last fall in Philadelphia, I wired a payment to a marabout, a West African holy man, in Mali. Payment for what exactly? That depends.

title: The Fight for Health Care Isnt Over
description: The Supreme Courts decision upholding health insurance subsidies for low-income Americans in every state will almost certainly not stop attempts by Republicans to destroy or impede the Affordable Care Act piece by piece.

title: Belated Protection for Some Close Relatives
description: Fascination with chimpanzees, humans close relatives in evolution, has long been the cause of enormous injury and destruction. So it is heartening to learn that the United States Fish and Wildlife Service is at last strengthening regulations to protect captive chimps and curb their use in medical research, the entertainment industry and the pet trade.

title: South Sudans Agony
description: South Sudan must rank among the most astounding failures in Africa, if only because the country is not even four years old. Already a political and ethnic struggle between the president, Salva Kiir, and his former vice president, Riek Machar, has escalated into one of the cruelest, most intractable and most senseless wars on the African continent, one that has grown relentlessly worse.

title: Pete Docter
description: Pete Docter is a director, writer, animator and voice actor for Pixar Animation Studios, part of the Walt Disney Company. His latest credit is Inside Out, about the inner workings of a young girls brain, which he directed and co-wrote.

title: Regulating Sex
description: THIS is a strange moment for sex in America. Weve detached it from pregnancy, matrimony and, in some circles, romance. At least, we no longer assume that intercourse signals the start of a relationship. But the more casual sex becomes, the more we demand that our institutions and government police the line between whats consensual and what isnt. And we wonder how to define rape. Is it a violent assault or a violation of personal autonomy? Is a person guilty of sexual misconduct if he fails to get a clear yes through every step of seduction and consummation?

title: John Roberts, the Umpire in Chief
description: LIBERALS and conservatives were exercised and confused by the combination of Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr.s vote to uphold the Affordable Care Acts tax subsidies on Thursday and his dissent from the Supreme Courts decision recognizing a constitutional right of same-sex marriage on Friday. Both sides accused him of voting politically: On Thursday he was taken to task by the right, and on Friday by the left.

title: A Heated Debate Over De-escalation
description: Seattle police officers attended a mandated training session in de-escalation techniques in May. In the classroom, many officers appeared skeptical of the techniques they were being taught.

title: Long Taught to Use Force, Police Warily Learn to De-escalate
description: SEATTLE  Officer Corey Papinsky was recently showing a group of Seattle police officers how to reduce the chance of using force against a citizen during a suddenly antagonistic encounter.

title: The Nets Focus on Themselves, Not the Knicks
description: Two days before the recent N.B.A. draft, the Nets hosted a tour of their new training ground  the Hospital for Special Surgery Training Center in the Sunset Park neighborhood of Brooklyn.

title: Wally Backman Serves Up Good News With an Appetizer of Humor
description: About a week and a half ago, Logan Verrett was sitting in the Las Vegas 51s bullpen, palling around with some teammates during a game, when his manager, Wally Backman, motioned for him. Backman had a stern look on his face, and Verrett had a feeling he was in trouble.

title: Marc Maron, at BAM, Finds That Happy Also Gets Laughs
description: On Friday night, the comedian Marc Maron walked onstage at the Brooklyn Academy of Musics opera house, groused about the imposing size of the theater (he said he expected to disappoint the structure) and then leveled with his audience.

title: Next Fight for Gay Rights: Bias in Jobs and Housing
description: Exhilarated by the Supreme Courts endorsement of same-sex marriage, gay rights leaders have turned their sights to what they see as the next big battle: obtaining federal, state and local legal protections in employment, housing, commerce and other arenas, just like those barring discrimination based on race, religion, sex and national origin.

title: Rangers Swap Forwards and Trade Away Cam Talbot
description: The Rangers were especially active on the trade front on Saturday, sending the backup goaltender Cam Talbot to the Edmonton Oilers for three draft picks, dealing the speedy forward Carl Hagelin to Anaheim for forward Emerson Etem and acquiring goaltender Antti Raanta from Chicago.

title: Europes Moment of Truth
description: Until now, every warning about an imminent breakup of the euro has proved wrong. Governments, whatever they said during the election, give in to the demands of the troika; meanwhile, the ECB steps in to calm the markets. This process has held the currency together, but it has also perpetuated deeply destructive austerity  dont let a few quarters of modest growth in some debtors obscure the immense cost of five years of mass unemployment.

title: Cherries Add a Dash of Sweetness
description: Cherry season is hitting its stride, and fresh cherries will be available for only a few short months. Martha Rose Shulman uses cherries to add a dash of sweetness to tabbouleh, along with farro pilaf, smoothies and bread pudding.

title: Size of Manhunt Area for Second Prison Escapee Is Significantly Expanded
description: Law enforcement officers on Saturday significantly expanded the area where they were searching for the remaining inmate who broke out of a maximum-security prison in northern New York this month, suggesting that officials had developed doubts that he recently had been with his partner, who was killed on Friday.

title: At the Womens World Cup, a New Leader Inspires a New Attitude for the U.S.
description: OTTAWA  From the outside, Abby Wambach looked like a motivational genius.

title: Suspect in Attack in France Had Ties to Radical Islamist
description: VNISSIEUX, France  The man who the authorities say decapitated his boss before setting off an explosion at an American-owned chemical plant near Lyon first came to the attention of the French intelligence services at least nine years ago, after he became part of the circle of a radical Islamist.

title: Mass Funeral Held in Kuwait for 27 Killed in Bombing
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Thousands of Kuwaitis, both Sunnis and Shiites, marched Saturday in a funeral procession for the 27 victims of a suicide bombing at a Shiite mosque during communal prayers the day before, an attack claimed by the jihadists of the Islamic State group.

title: 2 Charged in Confederate Flag Removal at South Carolina Capitol
description: A protester climbed a 30-foot flagpole and removed the Confederate battle flag from its perch outside the South Carolina State House early Saturday, before she was arrested and the flag replaced, the police said.

title: A Search for Survival and Family Amid the Violence in South Sudan
description: WAU SHILLUK, South Sudan  It had been more than a month since Theresa James had seen her two small children.

title: Straddling Old and New, a South Where a Flag Is Not Worth a Job
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  In a rambling home at the edge of a salt marsh, a proud graduate of the Citadel, the storied Southern military college whose cadets fired the opening salvo of the Civil War, was deep in prayer with a Bible study group.

title: Youth Chorus Unites Israelis and Palestinians, at Least for a Few Hours
description: JERUSALEM  Avital Maeir-Epstein and Muhammad Murtada Shweiki live about 150 yards apart in Abu Tor, a Jerusalem neighborhood that straddles the pre-1967 armistice line, a mostly invisible but politically charged marker of this citys Israeli-Palestinian divide.

title: As Left Wins Culture Battles, G.O.P. Gains Opportunity to Pivot for 2016
description: WASHINGTON  A cascade of events suggests that 2015 could be remembered as a Liberal Spring: the moment when deeply divisive and consuming questions of race, sexuality and broadened access to health care were settled in quick succession, and social tolerance was cemented as a cornerstone of American public life.

description: TEHRAN  Persian carpets were rolled out in the Beit-e Rahbar, the downtown Tehran offices of Irans supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, on Tuesday, a sign that important guests were on their way.

title: Remembering What Made Ornette Coleman a Jazz Visionary
description: Friends, family and admirers gathered at Riverside Church in Manhattan on Saturday to celebrate the life of Ornette Coleman, the visionary jazz musician who died on June 11 at the age of 85. The service was largely a joyful and music-filled affair with performances and speeches by many well-known artists, including Yoko Ono, Pharoah Sanders, Cecil Taylor and Savion Glover.

description: HONG KONG  Hundreds of people were injured at a water park in Taiwan on Saturday when a cloud of colored powder ignited in the air over a crowd during an event, erupting into a huge fireball.

title: Ascent and Descent
description: See who salutes.

title: Whats On TV Sunday
description: 9 P.M. (AMC) HUMANS Gemma Chan, above, stars as Anita, an exquisite specimen of artificial intelligence, or synth  one of the must-own gadgets populating a present-day London in a parallel universe  who has been purchased by an exasperated husband (Tom Goodman-Hill) after his wifes work schedule proves more than he and their three messy offspring can handle. But with her silky ebony hair, lithe limbs and ability to charm man and child alike, Anita isnt exactly the kind of help a frazzled middle-aged woman (Katherine Parkinson) wants to encounter at the breakfast table before shes had her morning shower. Meanwhile, across town, the government has issued a new elder-care bot (Rebecca Front) to George Millican (William Hurt), an aging scientist involved in the creation of the synths who wants to hold on to his outdated model, Odi (Will Tudor), with his memories of Georges dead wife. Theres a lot going on in this show, Neil Genzlinger wrote in The New York Times. Some of it is familiar from previous takes on artificial life, some of it is innovative, but all of it is involving, well written and well played.

title: 1940: Hong Kong Civilians Prepare To Leave

The Hong Kong government broadcast the message indicating that the British Foreign Office was adopting a firm attitude with regard to Japanese demands that the Burma-Yunnan highway be closed to transport of military supplies to the provisional Chinese government capital at Chungking.

In a television announcement to the nation, the queen said she had real confidence in the marriage of her 27-year-old daughter and Mr. Amsberg, a former member of the Hitler Youth movement, who served briefly in a German tank regiment at the end of World War II.

title: Dutch Say Separatists in Ukraine Block Inquiry Into Malaysia Jet Crash
description: MOSCOW  Pro-Russian separatist leaders in the eastern Ukrainian region of Luhansk have blocked access to Dutch law enforcement officials pursuing an investigation into the downing of a Malaysian jetliner nearly a year ago, the Netherlands Public Prosecution Office said on Saturday.

title: Climate Marchers Gather to Show Rousing Support for Pope
description: VATICAN CITY  When Pope Francis appeared on the balcony of the Apostolic Palace, where he delivers an address each Sunday, he was met by the usual cheers and by an unusual forest of bright green oversized paper leaves.

title: Cash Withdrawals and Hoarding as Default Looms Over Greece
description: ATHENS  The sun shone, as usual, with clouds floating in a brilliant blue sky above the Acropolis. Hotels were mostly full, shops sold T-shirts and the cafes along the narrow alleyways in the Plaka tourist district were bustling.

description: Paris

title: David Sweat, Escaped New York Convict, Is Shot and Captured as Hunt Ends
description: CONSTABLE, N.Y.  David Sweat, the remaining prison escapee on the run in northern New York, was shot by a state trooper and taken into custody on Sunday after a 23-day manhunt that began with an improbable escape from two maximum-security cells and ended in the rain-drenched woods just south of the Canadian border.

title: Bernie Sanders Defends Gun Record
description: With his stance on gun control under attack from a Democratic rival, Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont on Sunday defended what he called his strong record and called for a national dialogue to produce common-sense legislation balancing public safety against gun rights.

title: Review: David Byrne and Color Guard Blend Dance, Music and Athleticism
description: The glory of color guard is awesome: Teenagers of all shapes and sizes swirl flags and toss sabers and rifles into the air with nimble grace and wide-open hearts. Color guard performers cross the line between dancer and athlete, sustaining an American folk art that persists through passion. Now, in David Byrne, they have a cheerleader.

title: A Celebration of Gay Pride and a Supreme Court Ruling

title: Mets Defeat Reds in Suspended Game, but Take Their Time Doing So

description: As it turns out, the Greek crisis ends not with a bang, but with a referendum.

title: New Travel Options to Chad
description: Mountain Travel Sobek is offering an 18-day trip in the Republic of Chad, becoming the first North American outfitter to lead guests through the little-visited African country. Chad encompasses two zones, the fertile savanna of the south and the great sand dunes of the Sahara to the north.

title: Review: Voodoo, by Harry Lawrence Freeman, Has First Staging Since 1928
description: There is a fit of jealousy in Harry Lawrence Freemans opera Voodoo, revived on Friday and Saturday for its first performances since 1928, that seems ridiculous when its described. Lolo, a Louisiana plantation worker and Voodoo priestess, snatches a protective amulet out of the hands of her rival for the love of the man she adores, destroying it.

title: If Greece Is Shut Out of the Eurozone, It Will Sail Into Uncharted Waters
description: Greece could soon find itself in the middle of a daunting economic experiment.

title: Review: SeaWife Is a Doleful Fairy Tale About Whaling
description: In the past several years, whales have returned to New York Harbor, breaching and blowing in sight of the city skyline. And these leviathans now drive much of the action of SeaWife, a folk musical produced by Naked Angels and performed at the Melville Gallery of the South Street Seaport Museum.

title: Columbia University Press to Publish New Translations of Russian Literature
description: MOSCOW  Russian and American academics, publishers and Russian government officials announced on Saturday that they would collaborate on an ambitious new series of Russian literature in translation to be published by Columbia University Press.

title: Grisis
description: OK, this is real: Greek banks closed, capital controls imposed. Grexit isnt a hard stretch from here  the much feared mother of all bank runs has already happened, which means that the cost-benefit analysis starting from here is much more favorable to euro exit than it ever was before.

title: Sarah Streeter and Henry Hutcheson: The Father of the Bride, There in Spirit
description: Sarah Elizabeth Streeter, a daughter of Jennifer Lautenbach Streeter of Atlanta and the late E. Daniel Streeter, was married Saturday afternoon in Nantucket, Mass., to Henry David Hutcheson, a son of Susanne Lilly Hutcheson and Zenas W. Hutcheson III of Minneapolis. The Rev. Dr. Gary W. Klingsporn performed the ceremony at the First Congregational Church, of which he is the senior minister.

title: Chris Squire, Founding Bassist With the Rock Band Yes, Dies at 67
description: Chris Squire, the influential rock bassist who was a founding member of the celebrated British band Yes, died on Saturday in Phoenix. He was 67.

title: Seeking Genuine Discovery on Music Streaming Services
description: One day last week I woke up and decided I wanted to have the best morning ever.

title: Yankees Pay the Price for Miscommunicating on Another Routine Fly
description: HOUSTON  One of the most rudimentary drills at the most elementary levels of baseball involves learning how to handle a fly ball hit between fielders. There are rules that dictate which fielders have priority. Sometimes coded words are used  not simply Ive got it  to erase any confusion.

title: Royal Ballets Focus on British Choreography Exposes Its Limits
description: In recent years a remarkably high number of British choreographers have been working internationally: Richard Alston, David Bintley, Christopher Bruce, Michael Clark, David Dawson, Wayne McGregor, Ashley Page, Liam Scarlett, Christopher Wheeldon, Matthew Bourne. Ive even heard New Yorkers suggest that there should be a British choreography festival here. Instead, the Royal Ballet has brought us a season comprised almost entirely of British choreography. Even its sole non-British work, the Beau Gosse solo from Bronislava Nijinskas 1924 ballet Le Train Bleu, has a strongly British connection: It was created for the Anglo-Irish dancer Anton Dolin (born Patrick Kay), who in the 1980s reconstructed it and another Nijinska solo for the Royal British soloist Stephen Beagley.

title: Review: Larry Kramer in Love & Anger, Portrait of the Rebel as Gay Activist
description: On its surface, Monday nights HBO documentary, Larry Kramer in Love & Anger, seems like a perfect postscript to a historic week for gay rights, marked by the Supreme Courts affirmation of same-sex marriage. The film even culminates in a wedding, with Mr. Kramer, the AIDS activist and playwright, marrying his longtime partner, David Webster.

title: Urgent Recall for Some Jeep Grand Cherokees and Dodge Durangos
description: Fiat Chrysler is telling the owners of about five dozen Jeep Grand Cherokees and Dodge Durango sport utility vehicles to immediately stop driving them.

title: Review: Kevin Kwans China Rich Girlfriend Skewers Vulgar Wealth in Asia
description: Kevin Kwans brand of giddy wealth porn arrived in 2013 with Crazy Rich Asians, not a moment too soon to rescue a worn-out and useless genre. The vulgar rich had taken over reality TV, fictionalized TV (which seemed tepid by comparison), the occasional freakish documentary (like The Queen of Versailles) and the kind of fiction that heard its sell-by knell when Bergdorf Blondes and all its copycats came along. There was nothing new to be said about crass New Yorkers, Texans, Hollywood types or even tech billionaires, whose excesses werent usually that showy. A whole money-wasting continent had been milked dry.

title: Joni Mitchell Suffered Aneurysm, but Can Speak, Conservator Says
description: For the past few weeks, various reports have been swirling about Joni Mitchells medical condition, with the singer David Crosby saying on Friday that she was unable to speak after suffering an aneurysm. In her first statement since April, Ms. Mitchells conservator, Leslie Morris, responded in a statement on Sunday, saying that Ms. Mitchell had an aneurysm but that she was speaking and recovering well.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of June 29
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Bookstores Plan Rollout for Next Harper Lee Novel
description: Mary Badham, the actress who played the young Scout in the 1962 movie adaptation of Harper Lees To Kill a Mockingbird, will give voice to that character again to celebrate the publication of Ms. Lees second novel, Go Set a Watchman.

title: In a Triumphant Shout
description: All the worlds a stage,And all the men and women merely players:They have their exits and their entrances;And one man in his time plays many parts,His acts being seven ages.  Jacques, As You Like It

title: Youre Better Than This, Europe
description: STRASBOURG, France  DURING the last seven decades, European countries have painstakingly tried to rebuild a continent once shattered by war and atrocities according to the values of solidarity and human rights. We built institutions to prevent the crimes of the past and we made a commitment to help those in need of protection.

title: Marva Collins, Educator Who Aimed High for Poor, Black Students, Dies at 78
description: Marva Collins, a former substitute teacher whose success at educating poor black students in a private school she founded made her a candidate for secretary of education and the subject of a television movie, died on Wednesday in a hospice near her home in South Carolina. She was 78.

But even as voters weigh their options for a new leader, and look ahead to a change of direction for the country, their departing president has other plans.

title: As Charleston Church Mourns, Biden Adds His Prayers
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  On Sunday afternoon, hours after the weekly worship service, the pews of Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church filled again, and this city turned anew to the rite, now sadly familiar, of mourning another victim of a massacre.

title: Tunisian Gunman Showed Subtle Signs of Radicalization
description: GAAFOUR, Tunisia  The Tunisian student who shot 39 tourists at a seaside hotel on Friday was a silent loner who showed signs of radicalism in the past year but hid his real intentions, according to relatives, neighbors and the students Facebook page.

title: China and India Are Sitting Out Refugee Crisis
description: HONG KONG  When a deadly earthquake rocked Nepal in April, China and India rushed to send relief supplies and search-and-rescue teams. But when another humanitarian crisis  boats bearing thousands of migrants  appeared off Southeast Asian shores a month later, Asias two most populous countries said and did little. Instead, offers to resettle the migrants came from Gambia and the United States.

title: 5 Days That Left a Confederate Flag Wavering, and Likely to Fall
description: Inside the old granite State House in South Carolina, one day after the massacre in a Charleston church, an African-American receptionist politely gave everyone who called to complain about the Confederate battle flag the same response: Sorry, theres nothing to be done.

title: Eisner Brings His Media Expertise to Local TV Markets
description: LOS ANGELES  Michael D. Eisner is best known for developing the Walt Disney Company into a diversified entertainment conglomerate, but one specific slice of the media business has always been his sweet spot: television.

title: From Chris Christie, Candidate to Be, a Video Thats All About Him
description: When Jeb Bush and Hillary Rodham Clinton announced their presidential candidacies this year, they released gauzy videos showing voters who either agreed with their policy platforms, or whose lives had been affected by them.

description: PARIS  The man accused of beheading his employer and setting off an explosion at an American chemical factory in southeastern France used a smartphone application to send a gruesome photograph of himself with the victims head, a French official said on Sunday.

description: The last message to family and friends from Tyrelle D. Shaw, an artist and bow-tie designer who called himself Mr. Talented, arrived at 1:38 p.m. on June 16.

description: AUGUSTA, Me.  When Paul R. LePage, Maines combative governor, was seeking re-election last year, he told voters that his days of intemperate remarks were over. At a debate, Mr. LePage, who is of French descent, memorably said: Even a Frenchman can be taught to cool down.

title: Puerto Ricos Governor Says Islands Debts Are Not Payable
description: Puerto Ricos governor, saying he needs to pull the island out of a death spiral, has concluded that the commonwealth cannot pay its roughly $72 billion in debts, an admission that will probably have wide-reaching financial repercussions.

title: Greece Will Shut Banks in Fallout From Debt Crisis

This month, the Houston Astros announced that the hill would be removed, the fences would be moved in, and a restaurant and bars would be constructed in its place, a $15 million investment in the name of improving the fan experience.

description: Greece begins the new business week in the midst of a financial crisis. Its banks and its stock market will be closed on Monday. title: Polo Fades in India on the Backs of Endangered Ponies

Here, the game of kings is the province of the common man: Masons, laborers, government employees and police officers populate the roughly 20 active polo clubs in Imphal, the capital.

title: Asia Markets Slide on Fears About Greece; China Extends Tumble
description: HONG KONG  Asian stock markets slumped on Monday as Greeces financial difficulties triggered worry about possible broader harm to the global financial system. An interest rate cut by Beijing on Saturday failed to stem the fall in Chinese stock markets beyond the first hour of trading.

description: Just days after state legislators agreed to extend rent regulations for another four years, New York Citys Rent Guidelines Board is scheduled to vote on Monday evening on whether to increase rents for more than one million rent-stabilized apartments.

title: A Paris Designer Sets up a Creative Commune in the Hollywood Hills
description: I have an enormous need for freedom, says Bernhard Willhelm. I realized that I like being not too comfortable, but rather the opposite. Earlier this year, the Bavarian-born fashion designer and provocateur  known for his outlandish prints and silhouettes and an ongoing shoe collaboration with Camper  uprooted his studio from Paris to a rustic 1957 house built into a steep hill in Hollywoods Beachwood Canyon. Now, rather than the click-clack of heels along the boulevards, he hears hummingbirds as he works alongside his familial team, including his business partner, Jutta Kraus, who lives with him, and other designers and assistants who came along from Paris. I think this choice turned out to be very spontaneous and a bit nave, too, but its always been that way in my life, says Wilhelm, who had visited California only once before making the move. Germans make rational decisions and sometimes I decide to do emotional ones.

title: Pariss New Korean Joint, From Some of the Citys Coolest Expats
description: Emerge from the metro at the Strasbourg Saint-Denis station and you cant help but instantly catch sight of the neon pink sign beaming the word Hero. The neighborhoods colorful, late-night reputation might lead some to assume the sign marks yet another sex shop or dive bar. Instead, this spot beckons a hungry crowd.

title: Agency Taps Mapping Technology to Curb Rail Crossing Accidents

title: Whats On TV Monday
description: 5 P.M. (Lifetime) WHILE YOU WERE SLEEPING (1995) Lucy (Sandra Bullock), a lonely Chicago train station clerk, leaps to the rescue when Peter (Peter Gallagher), the object of her unspoken desire, is pushed onto the train tracks and falls into a coma. But after a nurse mistakenly identifies her as Peters fiance, she suddenly finds herself surrounded by the family she never had  including his charmingly suspicious brother, Jack (Bill Pullman). When a romantic comedy is as breezy and adorable as this one from Jon Turteltaub, its time to fall in love, Janet Maslin wrote in The New York Times. This is a formula film, but it has the kind of good cheer and fine tuning that occasionally give slickness a good name. Ms. Bullock, above with Micole Mercurio, left, Monica Keena and Jack Warden, brings a warm smile and a winning array of mannerisms to her role, she added. And as Jack does a perpetual slow burn in Lucys presence, Mr. Pullman smolders with consummate ease, engaging in the graceful teamwork that really makes this story click.

title: Dalai Lama Reflects on Aging at Glastonbury
description: A week ahead of his 80th birthday, the Dalai Lama thanked thousands of well-wishers at one of Europes largest music festivals on Sunday as they sang Happy Birthday tothe exiled Tibetan spiritual leader.

Europe never had the preconditions for a successful single currency  above all, the kind of fiscal and banking union that, for example, ensures that when a housing bubble in Florida bursts, Washington automatically protects seniors against any threat to their medical care or their bank deposits.

title: Dark Moneys Deepening Power
description: President Obama is reported to be considering an important brake on the torrent of dark money already flooding the 2016 presidential campaign  an executive order requiring federal contractors to disclose their donations to political candidates. Mr. Obama should immediately sign such an order. In doing so he would expose some of the bigger players in todays big money politics, while offering a healthy counterpoint to Republican efforts to squelch disclosure.

title: The Full Catastrophe, by James Angelos
description: On a December night in 2009, two larcenous officials in Pangaio, in the mountains of northern Greece, lured the towns mayor to a rendezvous on a quiet coastal road. Fearful that state auditors were about to expose the three mens systematic looting of the municipal treasury, they shot their co-conspirator to death with an Uzi submachine gun to silence him, then jammed his corpse into the trunk of his car, where it was found three days later. The killers were sentenced to lengthy jail terms, but  this being Greece, a country notorious for its bloated work force and a safety net that even protects the jobs of convicted criminals  they continued drawing a portion of their salaries while sitting in prison. They Murdered the Mayor but Still Get Paid! ran the headline in one Greek newspaper.

title: By the People and Wages of Rebellion
description: A few years ago, it wasnt hard to find Americans who thought a revolution was coming. At the depths of the recession, in hard-hit places like the North Carolina tobacco country or the exurbs of Tampa Bay, I met plenty of people who believed we were one power blackout or gas shortage away from civil unrest, political violence, even martial law. The feeling didnt conform to strictly partisan lines, and the objects of wrath included btes noires of both the left and the right: banks, oil companies, federal and state governments, news media. At Zuccotti Park in Lower Manhattan, a Tea Party couple visiting from rural Virginia was surprised to find a patch of common ground with Occupiers  at least until the discussion turned to actual policies. The anger was populist, which is ideologically capacious. The enemy was bigness, feathering its own nest and conspiring against the little guy.
