description: BEIJING  At a ceremony imbued with quiet triumph at the Great Hall of the People, Chinas president, Xi Jinping, hosted 56 member countries on Monday for the founding of a Chinese-led infrastructure bank for Asia, including major American allies from Asia and Europe that Washington had counseled not to join the bank.

title: Israeli Navy Intercepts Ship in Flotilla Sailing Toward Gaza Strip
description: TEL AVIV  Israeli Navy forces intercepted a ship that was sailing toward the Gaza Strip early Monday to protest a maritime blockade of the coastal enclave, military officials and activists said.

title: Deal Is Near, Pierre Moscovici Says
description: The European commissioner for economic and financial affairs said on Monday that Greece must stay in the eurozone.

title: Red, White and Bluer
Chinese Stocks Fall Into a Bear Market
description: HONG KONG  Like a growing number of other investors, Wang Jiacang, a 48-year-old driver in Beijing, is caught in the falling Chinese stock market with no easy exit.

title: Today in Politics: Supreme Court Still Has Work to Do After Major Rulings
description: Good Monday morning from Washington, where this week Congress is in recess, Jeb Bush makes a big trip to South Carolina, and another Republican contender is set to join the fold. But just because the Supreme Court ruled in two big cases last week doesnt mean its work is done.

title: A Promising Medicare Plan, if Only Health Organizations Would Stick Around
description: Two recent studies of Medicares new way to pay for health care show that its reducing spending and improving quality. The problem is, health care organizations dont always stick with the program.

title: Biking a New Route Through Ontarios Scenic Greenbelt
description: Greenbelt Biking A new Canadian bicycle route will take riders through 295 miles of Ontarios Greenbelt (above), an area encompassing about two million acres of protected farmland, green space and natural heritage sites. The Greenbelt Route uses existing roads and trails, starting in Queenston near Niagara Falls, following the curve of Lake Ontario and ending in Alderville First Nation.

title: Major Law Firms Give Little to Legal Aid, Study Finds
description: While major law firms are enjoying record revenues  more than $100 billion last year  they are donating only a tenth of 1 percent of their proceeds for legal aid to low-income people, according to a new analysis released by The American Lawyer.

title: State Marijuana Laws Complicate Federal Job Recruitment
description: WASHINGTON  For all the aspiring and current spies, diplomats and F.B.I. agents living in states that have liberalized marijuana laws, the federal government has a stern warning: Put down the bong, throw out the vaporizer and lose the rolling papers.

title: The Awesome Gratuitousness of the Greek Crisis
description: Barry Eichengreen asks himself why his influential analysis, suggesting that the euro was irreversible now appears wrong. Surely in a direct, mechanical sense what were seeing is the process I warned about five years ago:

title: 4 Militants Dead After Raid on Home in Eastern Pakistan, Officials Say
description: LAHORE, Pakistan  At least three militants were killed in a gun battle with the police and intelligence officers early Monday during a nighttime raid on their hide-out in eastern Pakistan, officials said. Another militant blew himself up after setting off his explosive-filled jacket, while two more people were arrested by the security forces after the shootout, the officials said.

title: Morning Agenda: Greek Banks Closed in Debt Crisis Fallout
description: GREEK BANKS CLOSED IN DEBT CRISIS FALLOUT  | The fallout from the failed negotiations between Greece and its creditors over the weekend spread to the countrys banks and stock market, which did not open for business on Monday,  Jim Yardley writes in The New York Times. In response, stock markets in Asia and Europe  dropped sharply  as investors feared that Greece was likely to miss a debt payment of 1.6 billion euros, or $1.8 billion, to the International Monetary Fund that is due on Tuesday, risking a default and possible exit from the eurozone.

title: Hong Kong Democracy Activist Reports Being Assaulted on Street
description: Joshua Wong, the 18-year-old student who led months of protests last year for a free election of Hong Kongs leader, said he was assaulted by an unidentified man early Monday while walking down a street.

title: Burundi Holds Elections After Night of Gunfire and Grenade Attacks
description: BUJUMBURA, Burundi  After a night filled with gunfire and grenade explosions, polling stations in the capital of this central African nation opened Monday morning to thin crowds, as many people gripped by fear and uncertainty chose to stay home.

title: China Fears Loss of Great Wall, Brick by Brick
description: The Great Wall in northern China cannot be seen with the naked eye from high orbit above the Earth or from the moon, as some people believe. For centuries, those who have wanted to see the wall have had to make a trip to Asia to lay eyes on one of the greatest surviving artificial structures in the world.

title: Stay Close, Sleep Close, or Stay Close, Sleep Apart?
description: Stay Close. Sleep Apart.

title: Private Equity Firms Circle Australian Car Finance Company
description: Sydney, AUSTRALIA  The American private equity firms Carlyle Group and TPG are in discussions to buy Esanda, Australias second-largest auto financing business, according to people briefed on the matter.

title: Greek Deal Still Possible, Hollande Says
description: The French president, Franois Hollande, said there was always the possibility of a deal between Greece and its international creditors, and that France was ready to help ensure dialogue resumed.

title: Lancashire Council in Britain Deals Blow to Shale Industry
description: LONDON  Britains ambitions to produce natural gas from shale rock were set back on Monday when a local government rejected a companys drilling plan.

title: Deutsche Banks Head of Mergers and Acquisitions Said to Be Leaving
description: LONDON  Henrik Aslaksen, the global head of mergers and acquisitions at Deutsche Bank, is preparing to leave the company, according to a person briefed on his departure.

title: Sysco Terminates Deal With US Foods
description: Sysco said on Monday that it was calling off its proposed merger with US Foods, days after a federal judge halted the union of the companies, the countrys two biggest food distribution companies.

title: Egypts Top Prosecutor Is Most Senior Official to Die in Insurgency
description: CAIRO  A powerful bomb killed Egypts top prosecutor as he drove to work Monday morning, broadening the violent insurgency against the government that militants have been waging for two years.

title: Woman in Taiwan Dies Days After Being Burned in Water Park Blast
description: HONG KONG  A 20-year-old woman who suffered severe burns in an explosion at a water park in Taiwan died on Monday, a hospital official said.

title: Why Birds Sound Like Morning People
description: Q. Why are birds so noisy at first light and then suddenly quiet?

title: Givenchy Is Coming to New York Fashion Week  on Sept. 11
description: The movable feast of fashion weeks continues. After Valentino decided to hold its couture show in Rome instead of Paris next week to celebrate the opening of a mega-store in the Italian capital, Givenchy announced that its spring 2016 ready-to-wear show would be held in New York rather than Paris, to celebrate the opening of its Manhattan flagship.

title: Democrats Seek to Tar Chris Christie Ahead of His Big Day
description: The Democratic National Committee, which has spent years feasting on Gov. Chris Christie as a target for derision, is welcoming the New Jersey governor to the presidential race with a post on Medium that laces into his record.

title: Times Critics Guide: What to Do This Week
description: Need to break out of a cultural rut?

title: What Ballers Gets About Football and Money
description: HBOs Ballers has been compared repeatedly to Entourage,but amid its (many) scenes of dudes partying, the show focuses on something a bit more nerdy: money management.

title: Tunisia Attack Will Get Full Spectrum Response, British Leader Vows
description: LONDON  Shocked by the deadliest terrorist attack on Britons in a decade, Prime Minister David Cameron promised a full spectrum response on Monday to the assault, which killed 39 tourists at a resort in Sousse, Tunisia, on Friday. At least 18 of the victims, and possibly as many as 30, were British.

title: Daily Report: Apple Can Afford Some Mistakes, Just Not on Products
description: As Apple prepares to start its long-anticipated subscription streaming music service on Tuesday, few marketing experts expect its scuffle with Taylor Swift over royalties to leave any scars. Instead, they think it turned out to be remarkably good publicity, writes Brian X. Chen.

title: 1940: Nazi Saloons Put Under Ban
description: BALBOA, C.Z.  Tightening the dragnet that is being woven around members of a suspected fifth column who live within a stones throw of the Panama Canal in the terminal cities of the Republic of Panama, United States Army authorities ruled today [June 29] that several saloons owned by known Nazis and Fascists in the cities of Panama and Colon were off limits. This action was taken as the arrival of the United States fleet from the Pacific for passage into the Atlantic appeared a matter of days.  New York Herald Tribune, June 30, 1940

title: Supreme Court Allows Use of Execution Drug
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court  ruled on Monday against three death row inmates who had sought to bar the use of an execution drug they said risked causing excruciating pain.

title: Juncker Says He Feels Betrayed by Greece
description: The president of the European Commission, Jean-Claude Juncker, said the momentum in negotiations between Greece and its international creditors had been shattered by the announcement of a referendum.

title: The Endings
description: A photo essay on break-ups.

title: Supreme Court Rebuffs Lawmakers Over Independent Redistricting Panel
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court ruled on Monday that Arizonas voters were entitled to try to make the process of drawing congressional district lines less partisan by creating an independent redistricting commission.

title: Supreme Court to Weigh Race in College Admissions
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court agreed on Monday to take a second look at the use of race in admissions decisions by the University of Texas at Austin, reviving a potent challenge to affirmative action in higher education.

title: Supreme Court Blocks Obamas Limits on Power Plants
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday blocked one of the Obama administrations most ambitious environmental initiatives, an Environmental Protection Agency regulation meant to limit emissions of mercury and other toxic pollutants from coal-fired power plants.

title: Karl Rove Disputes an Excerpt From Ted Cruzs Book
description: Senator Ted Cruz of Texas is going on tour to promote his new book this week and one prominent reader is not so happy: Karl Rove.

title: Beyond the Mets Steven Matz: Other Pitchers With Big R.B.I. Games
description: The Mets have had some pretty impressive pitching debuts in recent years. Matt Harvey struck out 11 Diamondbacks in winning his first major league start in 2012. Zack Wheeler struck out seven Braves and pitched six shutout innings in 2013.

title: Pine Bush School District Settles Anti-Semitism Suit for $4.48 Million
description: An upstate New York school district has agreed to pay $4.48 million and enact broad reforms in curriculum and training to settle a lawsuit by five current and former Jewish students who claimed that they had been victims of pervasive anti-Semitism in the schools, a court filing on Monday showed.

title: Afghans Protest After U.S. Forces Carry Out Raid on Strongman
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Protesters in the northern Afghan province of Parwan blocked the main highway there on Monday after American forces raided the village of a local strongman and blew up a weapons depot belonging to him, officials and residents said.

title: John Boehner Reassures Lithuania of Support Against Russia
description: Speaker John A. Boehner and a House delegation have wrapped up a three-day trip to Lithuania, where aides said he reaffirmed the United States commitment to resisting Russian aggression in the region.

title: Poland Wants Bison to Multiply, but Others Prefer Subtraction
description: BIALOWIEZA NATIONAL PARK, Poland  The two great, glowering creatures paused from their noisy feeding, silhouetted against the pencil-thin pines on the far side of a meadow, and emitted a couple of steam-train snorts.

title: Guinea Pigs Are Autistic Childs Best Friend
description: Guinea pigs do not judge.

title: The Short Stories We Tell Ourselves About Everyday Spending
description: I love a good story. In fact, I used to tell myself at least one new story every time I opened my credit card statement. Oh, Id say to myself, I was so busy last month, it makes perfect sense that I ate out a dozen times. Ill just eat out less next month.

title: The Best-Selling Sports Books
description: Trying to decide what to read on the beach this holiday weekend? Here are the best-selling sports books in May 2015, according to the New York Times best-seller list.

title: Amy Winehouse Documentary Lets Nobody Off the Hook
description: Barely a year after the death of Amy Winehouse, the hard-living retro soul star turned tabloid obsession who died in 2011 after a public fight with addiction, the singers family and record label decided it was time to make a documentary about her legacy.

title: Highball Season
description: Highballs are gaining real estate on craft cocktail bar menus around the world thanks to their quick-prep appeal: By definition, a highball should be relatively fast and easy to make, as well as lower in proof. Stylistically, the drinks range from old-school, Phillip Marlowesque whiskey and sodas, to more deconstructed iterations, often featuring just one unexpected ingredient. And an approach centering on fresh juice citrus, seasonal syrups, infusions  is big this summer.

title: Puerto Rico Debt Crisis Splits Congress on Party Lines and Draws Muted Response From White House
description: The declaration by Puerto Ricos governor that the islands $72 billion in debt is not payable was not only a warning to its creditors. It was also aimed at leaders in Washington, who perhaps more than anyone could determine whether Puerto Ricos finances can be stabilized or will slide into chaos.

title: Raymond Smullyans Alice in Puzzle-Land
description: This week we mark the 150th anniversary of the publication of Lewis CarrollsAlices Adventures in Wonderland with a special feature by Raymond Smullyan, the famed musician, magician, mathematician, logician andprofessor emeritus of philosophy at Indiana University.

title: Aftermath of Egypt Prosecutor Bombing
description: Police in Cairo on Monday inspected the wreckage of a convoy carrying Egypts top prosecutor, Hisham Barakat, who was killed by the attack.

title: A Mellow Summer in Asheville (With Moog Music)
description: While the beach may be a preferred destination for Independence Day travelers, Asheville, N.C., a city that rests seamlessly among the Blue Ridge Mountains, puts a unique spin on summer relaxation. With the Pisgah National Forest nearby, as well as the scenic grounds of the Biltmore Estate, a French Renaissance chateau built by George Washington Vanderbilt, the North Carolina Arboretum and the Carl Sandburg Home in Flat Rock, among many other sites, the region embraces tranquillity. The city (with roughly 87,000 residents) is also known for its quirky characteristics, with its liberal political leanings in a traditionally conservative region, along with its numerous streetside music performances.

title: 1965: Life Insurance on Hostage
description: WASHINGTON  The government is investigating a bizarre case in which an AID employee in Vietnam allegedly applied for life insurance on a colleague and friend captured by the Viet Cong, it was disclosed today [June 29]. Gustav C. Hertz, who was taken prisoner by Viet Cong guerrillas Feb. 2, is under a threat of retaliatory execution if the Saigon government puts to death a terrorist arrested for the March 30 bombing of the U.S. embassy. The terrorist, Nguyen Van Thai, is still under death sentence.

title: Serena Williams Turns Early Scare Into Decisive Statement of Purpose
description: WIMBLEDON, England  On a warm opening day at Wimbledon that went pretty much according to expectations, the fist pumps and shouts somehow seemed out of place.

title: Michael Cerveris, My Tony-Winning Landlord
description: Earlier this month, my former landlord won a Tony Award. Michael Cerveris, named best lead actor in a musical for Fun Home, this years best musical, once sublet his apartment to me while he was working in London and my place was being renovated in Manhattan.

description: The illustrator Damien Florbert Cuypers shares his impressions of the fashion set around Paris for the mens wear shows this past week.

title: Escaped Convicts Had Planned to Go to Mexico, Cuomo Says
description: The escaped killers David Sweat and Richard W. Matt had intended to go to Mexico before their plan unraveled when a prison worker accused of helping them did not show up with her car, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said on Monday.

title: Benghazi Emails Put Focus on Hillary Clintons Encouragement of Adviser
description: WASHINGTON  Hillary Rodham Clinton told reporters last month that the memos about Libya she received while secretary of state from Sidney Blumenthal, a longtime adviser whom the Obama administration had barred her from hiring, had been unsolicited.

title: Jeb Bush Enlists Family in Cash Appeal (but Not His Brother)
description: Fund-raising is a family affair for former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida. But not the whole family.

description: These three things are true:

title: Greeces Troubles Attract Little Sympathy From Poorer Neighbors
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria  Throughout months of acrimonious haggling with creditors, Greeces left-wing government has cast itself as the victim of an elitist financial and political order beholden to Europes stingy rich, notably Germans.

title: An Old-World Goat Roast
description: A kosher roast and Barolo tasting in Chappaqua, N.Y.

title: An Old-World Dinner Pairs Barolo and Roasted Goat
description: The logs in the outdoor fire pit had been lighted, and would slowly burn down into hot coals. The rotating spit beckoned. All that remained was to prepare the forequarters of two young goats  kids, if you want to get biblical about it.

title: A Ring That Builds on One Italian Brands Heritage
description: To be completely honest, explains Amedeo Scognamiglio of the Italian fine jewelry brand Faraone Mennellas inner workings, Roberto, my business partner, is also an architect  he designed all of our shops and our showroom. And I always say that we keep opening stores to make Roberto happy, so he can build them. That know-how led to the creation of a standout ring from the duos Capri Girl collection, a curved, diamond-encrusted screw in gold or silver. Weve always been nongraphic, very feminine and romantic, Scognamiglio says, so this marks an evolution  a little bit Dolce Vita, a little bit rock n roll.

title: K.K.R. Settles Over Broken Deal Expenses
description: For years, private equity firms operated behind a curtain of mystery when it came to how they passed along expenses to investors. The Securities and Exchange Commission is now beginning to pull back the curtain and shine a light on those practices.

title: Worried That Fasting Palestinian Prisoner Could Die, Israel Releases Him
description: TEL AVIV  A Palestinian prisoner who has emerged as a potent symbol of resistance to Israels occupation ended a 55-day fast on Monday after Israeli officials, concerned he could die, agreed to release him.

title: French Minister Suggests Group to Push Middle East Talks
description: UNITED NATIONS  France floated the idea on Monday of a new international group to spur negotiations between the Israelis and Palestinians. In so doing, the French seemed to dial back from an earlier proposal to get the United Nations Security Council involved in the gnarled and stuck Middle East peace talks.

title: Bree Newsome Removes a Symbol of Hate
description: The filmmaker and musician Bree Newsome shattered a Southern taboo on Saturday, when she climbed a flagpole outside the South Carolina State House and removed the Confederate flag. Social media erupted in applause at the sight of an African-American woman wresting the emblem of hate from its place of pride so soon after an avowed white supremacist had been charged with murdering nine black parishioners at a church in Charleston.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Cardiac Care

title: Capital Controls Hit Greek Economy at Worst Time
description: Capital controls have hit the Greek economy at just the wrong time.

title: How to Fire-Roast a Fowl
description: Wild ducks are ideal for campfire cooking; otherwise, try a half-chicken.

title: Campfire Cooking: Roasts on a Stick
description: When I was a 10-year-old kid in western Michigan, I discovered Sydney Pollacks melancholic Jeremiah Johnson. The film chronicles the misadventures of a disillusioned mountain man (Robert Redford) who wanders the Rockies in the mid-1800s.

title: Liberals Shouldnt Assume Redistricting Verdict Will Help Them
description: When the Supreme Court ruled Monday to allow independent redistricting commissions in Arizona, the decision was greeted with enthusiasm from liberals who support redistricting reform.

title: With Loan Deadline Looming, Europe Offers Greece a Last-Minute Deal
description: BRUSSELS  Seeking to calm a whirlwind of uncertainty that has battered global markets, opened deep fissures in European unity and threatened to push Greece out of the eurozone, European leaders insisted on Monday that a deal was still possible to settle Greeces spiraling debt crisis. But they gave no indication that this could happen before Athens runs out of cash to pay loans due on Tuesday.

title: De Blasio Appoints New Head of Economic Development Corporation
description: New York Citys main agency for economic development will be run by Maria Torres-Springer, Mayor Bill de Blasio announced on Monday.

description: The tiny fish known as the bristlemouth is part of a detective story that bears on everything from feeding the planet and monitoring ocean health to learning how to better predict climate change.

title: Greeks Line Up for Money and Stock Up on Goods as Cash Rationing Starts
description: ATHENS  Uncertain what might happen next, with banks and financial markets closed, across Athens people wasted little time Monday, rushing to the nearest A.T.M. to withdraw their new daily maximum of 60 euros, determined to raise every last cent while they could.

title: An Ocean Mystery in the Trillions
description: Habitats on land  rain forests, steppes, woodlands, deserts, alpine meadows, all well explored over the centuries  make up less than 1 percent of the planets biosphere. Why so little? The band of life is narrow. Fertile soil goes down only a few feet, and even the tallest trees stretch up only a few hundred feet. Birds can fly higher, but must return to the surface for nourishment.

title: Christian Thielemann Named Music Director at Bayreuth
description: He was passed over for the post of chief conductor of the Berlin Philharmonic, but Christian Thielemann was given another important post in the German music world on Monday: music director of the Bayreuth Festival, the temple to the music of Richard Wagner.

description: David W. Dunlap is a Metro reporter and writes the Building Blocks column. He has worked at The Times for 40 years.

description: Unique vistas, flavors and fashions make up a couples trip to the San Francisco Bay Area. A Visa Signature room upgrade at Cavallo Point begins an adventure that takes them sailing into the sunset.

description: It is a trick lifted straight from the movies.

title: Verbatim: Jeb Bush Doesnt Think Donald Trump Will Cry Poverty
description: Jeb Bush, upon being told that NBC had ended its relationship with Donald Trump because of derogatory remarks Mr. Trump made about immigrants when he announced his presidential run.

title: Before Bara, Minnows Will Have Their Moment
description: Just 24 days after Barcelona lifted the trophy in Berlin, the Champions League started up again on Tuesday. But Bara, Bayern, Chelsea, Juventus and the other teams that may contend for next years final will not be on the field for a while yet.

title: Outdoor Bars and Restaurants to Visit for a Summer Bite
description: In the summer, for a dinner of rib-eye and cabernet, I want air-conditioning. Otherwise, I prefer to sip my ros with some cool vitello tonnato at a table on a patch of pavement  or better, in a quiet verdant garden or on some breezy rooftop. Here are some possibilities.

title: Arianna Meets the A-List

title: Monetary Controls in Greece Squeeze Consumers and Businesses
description: FRANKFURT  The bank closings and restrictions on money transfers that the Greek government imposed on Sunday are the financial equivalent of a tourniquet. The measures may stop the bleeding, but they are hardly a cure and could do more harm than good.

title: Hiatus, With Links
description: I wont be blogging or columnizing for the next three weeks, barring a sudden nuclear war with Russia (and if the missiles fly quickly enough, maybe not even then); instead, Ill be taking a little time to work on a book in which (I hope) neither papal encyclicals nor the Confederate flag nor Obamacare nor same-sex marriage will figure all that prominently. That means youll be spared endless follow-ups on any of themes Ive written about recently. But I dont want to leave you empty-handed, so here area few links related to recent subjects, and a few others as well.

title: Supreme Court Allows Texas Abortion Clinics to Remain Open
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday allowed 10 Texas abortion clinics to remain open while the justices consider whether to hear an appeal from a decision effectively ordering them to close.

title: For Couples, Time Can Upend the Laws of Attraction
description: After decades of studying the concept of mate value, social scientists finally have the data necessary to explain the romantic choices in Knocked Up and Pride and Prejudice.

title: Key Moments in Search for Escapees
description: A look at key moments in the 22-day search for David Sweat and Richard W. Matt after their escape from the maximum security prison in Dannemora, N.Y.

description: PARIS  Two senior executives at the ride-hailing company Uber were detained and questioned by the police in Paris on Monday, the Paris prosecutors office said.

title: Arizona Settles Cases With Relatives of 19 Who Died Fighting Wildfire
description: PHOENIX  Relatives of some of the 19 firefighters killed in one of the nations deadliest wildfires joined state officials here Monday to announce settlements in two legal cases against the Arizona State Forestry Division, the agency responsible for the firefighters on the day they died.

title: Rodgers and Hammerstein Biography on the Way
description: The publisher Henry Holt announced that it has acquired the rights to Rodgers and Hammerstein, a biography of the musical theater writing team Richard Rodgers and Oscar Hammerstein II. The book, by the journalist Todd S. Purdum, is scheduled to be published in 2018, the 75th anniversary of the duos musical Oklahoma!

title: Review: The Quartet, by Joseph Ellis, Details the Constitutions Gang of Four
description: More than two centuries after the ratification of the Constitution, the historian Joseph J. Ellis writes in his absorbing new book, The Quartet, a mystic haze has formed around that document. Much as he captured the human beings behind the marble masks of the founders in earlier books, so he examines here the contingent roles that fortune, visionary ideals and pragmatic politics all played in forging a framework for the fledgling nation, a set of ideas and institutions that would become a model of representative government.

title: Greek Referendum Plan by Alexis Tsipras Tests His Power and Conviction
description: ATHENS  As Friday night became Saturday morning, with sidewalk cafes still bustling in central Athens, Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras abruptly appeared on national television.

description: Now is a good time to check the settings on your sports-as-war metaphor filters, before the United States, England, Germany and Japan collide in the Womens World Cup semifinals, and before Lionel Messi and Argentina try  again  to win a major title.

description: MIGUEL

title: Review: A TV Scream, With Fresh Carnage and Winking Nods to the Genre
description: The people old enough to be making television shows and movies today apparently spent their childhoods scared out of their wits. Whether that means they know how to scare todays younger generations remains unclear, and MTVs attempt to make a television series out of Scream doesnt clarify the picture.

description: Helen Mirren knows how to make an exit.

description: Uber will acquire a portion of Microsofts maps technology and extend employment offers to around 100 engineers on Microsofts mapping team, the ride-hailing company said on Monday.

description: Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. said during his confirmation hearing that judges are like umpires, and as every baseball fan knows, each umpire has a different strike zone.

title: The Models, Editors and Street-Style Stars of Mens Fashion Week in Paris, Illustrated
description: The illustrator Damien Florbert Cuypers shares his impressions of the fashion set around Paris for the mens wear shows this past week.

title: Readers Respond to Ghosting
description: Readers had a lot to say about Exes Explain Ghosting, the Ultimate Silent Treatment, an article about breaking up by disappearing, a tactic most recently said to be used by Charlize Theron. The story drew 340 comments on nytimes.com/styles and more than 970 comments on Facebook.

title: Jeb Bush Calls Confederate Flag a Racist Symbol
description: WEST COLUMBIA, S.C.  Nearly two weeks after canceling a campaign event scheduled the morning after the deadly attack on a South Carolina church, Jeb Bush on Monday called the Confederate battle flag a racist symbol, reflecting the new Republican normal in a Southern primary state vastly altered by the racially motivated killings.

title: Renovation of Brutalist Building in Goshen Can Proceed, Judge Rules
description: Despite the efforts of preservationists, a State Supreme Court judge has cleared the way for a renovation of the Orange County Government Center in Goshen, N.Y., a Brutalist building designed by Paul Rudolph.

title: Wandering the Wonders of Oregon
description: When Travel Oregon, the states tourism commission, introduced its Seven Wonders of Oregon campaign last March, it was supposed to be a five-month-long initiative focused on a few key regional markets.

title: Review: SILENT dialogue, From Dai Jian, Dances From Room to Room at the Met
description: If you were browsing the Melanesian artifacts in Gallery 354 of the Metropolitan Museum of Art on Friday night, you might have been alarmed by a sudden onrush of people in white jumpsuits. They swarmed the long, cavernous room like flocking birds, darting among glass-encased statues and masks. Dropping to the floor, they slithered toward an outcropping of New Guinea totem poles and draped their limbs over the displays protective railing, flirting with its tacit mandate: Dont touch the art.

title: Greeces Future, and the Euros
description: The referendum called by Greeces prime minister is a bad idea, but at this stage its about the best available. Greek banks have been shut down to avoid a meltdown; bailout talks with European creditors are frozen; Athens does not have the money to pay 1.6 billion euros due to the International Monetary Fund on Tuesday, threatening default and withdrawal from the euro.

title: Discovery Gains European Rights to 4 Olympics
description: Discovery Communications won the exclusive rights to broadcast the Olympics from 2018 to 2024 for most of Europe, the media company announced on Monday.

title: After Same-Sex Marriage Ruling, Southern States Fall in Line
description: GRETNA, La.  The countrys last major pockets of resistance to same-sex marriage were rapidly shrinking on Monday as officials in states across the South, citing the rule of law, softened their defiance and began offering marriage licenses to gay and lesbian couples.

title: Amish Country Embraces Farm-to-Table
description: Downtown Lancaster, Pa., long considered the nontouristy side of Amish Country, is embracing the farm-to-reclaimed-wood-table trend full tilt.

title: Think Like a Doctor
description: Documents that will be part of this weeks Think Like a Doctor column were accidentally published ahead of schedule. Please check back Wednesday, July 1, 2015 for the full column.

title: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Disney Merges Consumer Product and Interactive Units
description: LOS ANGELES  Children do not separate their toys into two piles  traditional and digital  and now the Walt Disney Company wont either.

title: Greeks Rally Against Austerity Rules
description: Thousands of anti-austerity demonstrators gathered outside the Parliament building in Athens to show their support to the Greek government in its negotiations with international creditors.

title: Review: The Bad Doctor and Graphic Medicine Manifesto
description: A small hourglass stands next to the computer on Dr. Iwan Jamess office desk. No symbolism is intended  the device is actually a cheap 10-minute egg timer, exactly the length of a routine appointment in Dr. Jamess general practice in a small Welsh town. It was donated by an annoyed patient specifically to embarrass the doctor.

title: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres the latest.

title: Celgene to Pay $1 Billion for Biotech Collaboration With Juno
description: Celgene, a leading biotech company, said on Monday that it would pay about $1 billion to start a collaboration with Juno Therapeutics, a leader in the hot new area of cancer drugs that harness patients immune systems to attack tumors.

title: A Scientific Ethical Divide Between China and West
description: BEIJING  China is spending hundreds of billions of dollars annually in an effort to become a leader in biomedical research, building scores of laboratories and training thousands of scientists.

title: Review: The Whitneys Conlon Nancarrow Festival is an Enchanting Tribute
description: Has there ever been an engine of delight more focused and industrious than Conlon Nancarrow? This sui generis composer restricted himself almost entirely to a single medium, and an eccentric one: the player piano, that mechanical parlor ghost into which rolls of paper dotted with holes are fed.

title: Jazz at Lincoln Center and Sony Music Team Up for Blue Engine Records
description: Jazz at Lincoln Center has shelves upon shelves of recordings from concerts it has presented since its founding in 1987, including a studio recording featuring the pianist Chick Corea, a musical Mass with a gospel choir written for the 200th anniversary of the Abyssinian Baptist Church in New York and concerts with the saxophonists Sherman Irby and Ted Nash.

title: Study Suggests That Google Has Its Thumb on Scale in Search
description: Google entices people to search by promising links to the best that the web has to offer. But research released Monday, led by top academics but paid for by one of Googles rivals, suggests that Google sometimes alters results to play up its own content despite peoples preferences.

title: Review: Syd tha Kyd, Betwixt and Between on Ego Death
description: THE INTERNET

title: Pictures of the Day: Burundi and Elsewhere
description: Burundi and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Review: Spirits of the Air & Heroes Takes on Legend and Fairy Tale
description: Does the choreographerChristopher Williams, with his fascination for ancient myths and legends, breathe a different air than the rest of us? His world is one of fairies and gods, where dancers curve their arms and backs in juicy opposition to their lower bodies, and the stage sometimes looks like a sculpture garden coming to life.

title: June 29, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Burundi, Egypt, Spain and Greece.

title: Solid Sound Festival
description: Images of performers at the festival.

title: Wilco Tinkers and Experiments at a Festival Its Happy to Share
description: NORTH ADAMS, Mass.  This is my son Spencer, Jeff Tweedy said onstage at the Solid Sound Festival on Sunday night, presenting his new band, Tweedy, by introducing its 19-year-old drummer. A moment later he caught himself, observing that this crowd probably didnt need to be briefed. But he went on, just in case somebody wandered in, he said, and didnt realize it was a cult gathering.

title: Review: Pianist Ursula Oppens Seamlessly Connects the Classics With New Music
description: Ursula Oppens is an eloquent pianist who has long been a persuasive advocate of new music, which she presents not as a discipline separate from the interpretation of the classics but as an extension of that work. The connection felt especially organic in the solo recital she presented at Bargemusic on Friday evening.

title: Seattles Little Up House Faces Razing After Buyers Back Out
description: SEATTLE  Edith Macefields tiny house in the old waterfront neighborhood of Ballard  likened by many people to the house in the Disney movie Up, in spirit and architecture  will have to be torn down or hauled away, its owner said on Monday.

title: AC/DC Songs Will Be Added to Streaming Services Like Apple Music
description: One sign that streaming music has now fully entered the mainstream: AC/DC is on board.

title: Turkey Uneasy as U.S. Support of Syrian Kurds Grows
description: ISTANBUL  The United States has stepped up its military support for Syrian Kurdish militias fighting the Islamic State, efforts that have angered Turkey, a longtime ally and NATO member, which is now weighing new measures to contain the ambitions of the Kurds, including a buffer zone within Syria.

title: New York City Board Votes to Freeze Regulated Rents on One-Year Leases
description: The board that regulates rents for more than one million rent-stabilized apartments in New York City voted on Monday night for a freeze on one-year leases, an unprecedented move in its 46-year history.

title: Supreme Court Declines to Hear Appeal in Google-Oracle Copyright Fight
description: Many in the tech community expressed dismay at a Supreme Court decision on Monday not to hear the appeal of a copyright decision against Google.

title: Brash Personality Seen as Chris Christies Main Asset
description: If Donald Trump makes the rest of the Republican presidential primary field look responsible, Chris Christie threatens to make the others look boring.

title: At the Supreme Court, aWin for Direct Democracy
description: IN 2000, voters in Arizona adopted a state constitutional amendment that created an independent commission to draw congressional districts. But the commission immediately faced a legal challenge: the United States Constitution gives the power to state legislatures (and to Congress) to regulate national elections  not to the voters. Can the word legislature in the Constitution mean voters themselves?

title: Making a Confederate Flag Invisible
description: Removing the Confederate flag from the public square is but a first step toward deeper reflection on race.

title: Germanys Prolific Offense vs. United States Stingy Defense
description: The matchup between Germany and the U.S. features the tournaments best offense and defense. Which side will come out on top?

title: U.S. Tells Iran That Preliminary Nuclear Deal Must Stand
description: VIENNA  The United States warned Iran on Monday, in both English and Persian, that a preliminary agreement reached two months ago in Switzerland must remain the basis for a final nuclear deal.

title: Peace Eludes South Sudan as Rivals Hold Talks
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Even as South Sudans president, Salva Kiir, and his longtime rival, the rebel leader Riek Machar, met here at the behest of Kenyas president to end South Sudans civil war, Mr. Machars forces captured the strategic city of Malakal.

title: Fast-Food Restaurants Should Raise Minimum Wage, New York Panel Says
description: The minimum wage for fast-food workers in New York should be raised substantially, maybe even to $15 an hour, a state panel appointed to study the issue said on Monday.

title: Ahead of the World Cup Semifinals, Close Quarters for the Players
description: AHEAD OF SEMIS, CLOSE QUARTERS

title: Russia: Officials Meet on Syrian Crisis
description: Foreign Minister Sergey V. Lavrov of Russia said Monday that he would meet Tuesday with Secretary of State John Kerry in Viennato discuss the crisis in Syria and rising attacks by extremists. The announcement coincided with a visit to Moscow by Foreign Minister Walid al-Moallem of Syria for talks with Mr. Lavrov and President Vladimir V. Putin. Mr. Putin pledged continued support for Syria, and said all the countries in the region should pool their efforts in fighting the evil that is the Islamic State. Mr. Moallem questioned the likelihood of a joint regional effort. I know that Putin is a man who works miracles, he said, but an alliance with Saudi Arabia, Turkey, Qatar and the United States would require a very big miracle.

title: Low-Ranked Briton Wins, Surprising Even Himself
description: WIMBLEDON, England  During his postmatch interview on Monday, Liam Broady noted that being a 21-year-old from Manchester, England, playing in his first Grand Slam event could explain some of the saucy language he used that led to a warning from the chair umpire.

title: Colorado Court Rules Use of Public Funds for Private Schools Is Unconstitutional
description: DENVER  Colorados highest court on Monday struck down a voucher program that allowed parents in a conservative suburban school district to use taxpayer dollars to send their children to private schools.

title: U.N. Council Extends Troops Presence in Darfur
description: UNITED NATIONS  United Nations peacekeepers will remain in the Darfur region of Sudan for at least another year, the Security Council decided in a unanimous vote on Monday.

title: AOL in Deal With Microsoft to Take Over Display Ad Business
description: When the deal for Verizon to buy AOL was announced last month, executives from both companies said AOL was an appealing acquisition because of its advertising technology. On Monday, AOL showed some of the value in announcing a deal with Microsoft.

title: Israel to Build Fence Along at Least Part of Jordan Frontier
description: TEL AVIV  Israel has built fences on its frontiers with Lebanon, Syria and Egypt. It has constructed barriers through parts of the occupied West Bank and along the border with Gaza.

title: F.B.I. Opens Investigation Into New York Prison Where 2 Escaped
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation in Albany has opened a corruption inquiry focusing on employees and inmates at the maximum-security prison in northern New York State where two convicted killers escaped this month, one official with knowledge of the matter said on Monday.

title: Fitting Effort by Lleyton Hewitt in Wimbledon Farewell
description: WIMBLEDON, England  On one side of the net Monday was Lleyton Hewitt, playing in his final Wimbledon. On the other side of the net was Jarkko Nieminen, playing in his final Wimbledon.

title: Ben Wattenberg, Neoconservative Author and PBS Host, Is Dead at 81
description: Ben Wattenberg, an author, a PBS television commentator and a professed neoconservative who vainly urged his fellow Democrats to court the nations centrist voters at a time when the party was moving to the left, died Sunday in Washington. He was 81.

title: Obama Making Millions More Americans Eligible for Overtime
description: President Obama announced Monday night a rule change that would make millions more Americans eligible for overtime pay.

title: Squabbling, Hesitation and Luck Had Roles in Manhunt for New York Prison Escapees
description: After tunneling out of maximum-security cells, Richard W. Matt and David Sweat waited for the Jeep, driven by a cooperating prison employee, that would take them to Mexico.

title: 3 U.S. Churches Weighing Divestment Resolutions in Support of Palestinians
description: Delegates to annual gatherings this week of threeUnited States churches with millions of members were considering resolutions to divest from companies deemed supportive of Israeli occupation in the Palestinian territories, or to boycott products made in Israeli settlements. Votes on resolutions at the Cleveland synod of the United Church of Christ and the Episcopal Churchs general convention in Salt Lake City were expected to come up for votes on Tuesday, representatives of those churches said Monday. A resolution at the Mennonites meeting in Kansas City, Mo., was scheduled for Wednesday. Advocates of the Boycott, Divest and Sanction movement seek to pressure Israel economically over the Palestinian issue. Many advocates for Israel consider the movement a guise for anti-Semitism and for delegitimizing Israel.

title: Loads of Debt: A Global Ailment With Few Cures
description: There are some problems that not even $10 trillion can solve.

title: Womens World Cup: When These Two Stars Clash, the Gloves Are On
description: MONTREAL  When Germany, the worlds top team, meets the United States, the worlds second-ranked squad, in a Womens World Cup semifinal game Tuesday, there will be a matchup of goalkeepers befitting the stakes.

title: Court Lets Some Charities Avoid Rules on Birth Control Coverage
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court issued an order on Monday that allows certain nonprofit religious groups to avoid compliance with federal rules concerning insurance coverage of contraceptives for women.

title: Bostons Revised 2024 Olympics Bid Criticized as Incomplete
description: BOSTON  Suppose your teacher told you that an assignment was due by a certain day. You stayed up half the night, produced a nice-looking package a day before the deadline and patted yourself on the back for handing it in early.

title: Police Department to Redefine Chokehold to Match City Council Bill
description: The New York Police Department is poised to narrow its definition of a chokehold, adopting language from a City Council bill aimed at criminalizing police use of the maneuver.

title: Jack Carter, Comedian Who Brought His Rapid-Fire Delivery to TV, Dies at 93
description: Jack Carter, a motor-mouthed comedian who became one of televisions first stars in the late 1940s and continued working, as both a comic and an actor, well into the 21st century, died on Sunday at his home in Beverly Hills, Calif. He was 93.

title: Review: In Becketts Happy Days, a Woman Buried Deep by Inertia
description: The wattage of Winnies smile is what makes it so disconcerting  that and the way it lights up her eyes as she chatters on, her willful cheer sparkling in the sun like the diamonds that glint from her earlobes.

title: Review: Shows for Days, With Patti LuPone as a Diva With Depth
description: Though she has been known to chew scenery into sawdust, Patti LuPone shrewdly resists making a feast of her high-calorie role in Shows for Days, the unresolved new comedy by Douglas Carter Beane that opened on Monday night at the Mitzi E. Newhouse Theater.

title: Impressive Show of Courage
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  You will barely need me for this, thats how easy and smooth this one by Susan Gelfand went down. Like crossword pudding. The good kind, not the bland, hospital kind.

title: The Hard Line on Greece
description: In July 2012, Timothy F. Geithner, the United States Treasury secretary at the time, traveled to Sylt, an island off Germany in the North Sea.

title: A Divided Court on Three Big Rulings
description: An interesting thing happened on the way to Monday mornings predictable Supreme Court ruling upholding Oklahomas use of a controversial lethal-injection drug.

title: Yankees Set for Rare Shutout From All-Star Starting Lineup
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  Back-to-back seasons without the playoffs, declining television ratings and plummeting road attendance are signs that the Yankees have lost some luster.

title: No Evidence of Hate Crimes in Fires at Black Churches
description: After a deadly racist attack in South Carolina and heated debates about Confederate symbols, a string of fires at black churches in the South has put congregations on edge. But officials say they have found no evidence that the blazes were hate crimes.

title: U.S. Lifts Ban on Bahrain Aid
description: The Obama administration on Monday lifted its ban on security assistance to Bahrain that was imposed after the nations crackdown on demonstrators in 2011.

title: Womens Teams Still Struggle for Fans
description: The Liberty will be in Chicago on Tuesday night to take on the Sky in an important W.N.B.A. game. The United States womens soccer team will be in Montreal for a critical World Cup match against Germany.

title: Harold Feinstein Dies at 84; Froze New York Moments in Black and White
description: Harold Feinstein, whose celebrated series of black-and-white photographs of Coney Island in the 1950s established him as one of the most accomplished recorders of the American experience, and who went on to experiment with color and new digital techniques, died on June 20 at his home in Merrimac, Mass. He was 84.

title: 13 Metro-North Workers Accused of Cheating on Conductor Exams
description: A dozen current and former employees of the Metro-North Railroad were brought into state court in Manhattan in handcuffs on Monday on charges that they cheated on the exams required to become a train conductor or locomotive engineer.

title: Charleston Church Mourns One More Beloved Victim
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  It was just after 10:30 on Monday morning, as yet another hearse stopped in front of Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church, when the crowd on Calhoun Street grew quiet.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: While most humans wish to die a painless death, many do not have that good fortune.

title: Tom Adlers Home Sweet Surf Abode
description: Like any good hideout, the publisher Tom Adlers redwood-frame house on Padaro Lane near Carpinteria, Calif., keeps a view of its own freedom. Though the longtime surfer doesnt quite chase it like he used to, the window due south from his writing desk, past a large painted portrait of the poet Sadakichi Hartmann, opens onto a stretch of the Pacific Ocean, where Adler surfs when theres surf. To live for decades at famed breaks like Rincon Point and this one has been a charmed life, and on top of that Ive had friendships, says the former creative director, of finding long-riding waves as a teenager and never leaving.

title: Senior Tech: A Tablet for Aging Hands Falls Short
description: A tablet can be the perfect gateway gadget when it comes to connecting an aging mom, dad or tech-reluctant grandparent with the rest of the wired world. Small, light and simple, a tablet requires less technical skill and manual dexterity than, say, a laptop or a smartphone.

title: Word of the Day | coddle
description: coddle  \k-dl\  verb

title: Whats on TV Tuesday
description: 8:05 P.M. (Starz Cinema) TALK TO HER (2002) In Pedro Almodvars tragic comedy, two men  Benigno (Javier Cmara), a nurse, and Marco (Daro Grandinetti), a journalist  share an unusual friendship while they care for their girlfriends: Alicia (Leonor Watling), a dancer, and Lydia (Rosario Flores), a matador, who are both comatose. But their devotion isnt what it seems: Benigno is obsessive, with no real ties to Alicia. And suddenly romance is tinged with horror. Like all great doomed affairs, Talk to Her, Elvis Mitchell wrote in The New York Times, is full of lovely, sweet suffering. And when its over, the realization of how much the movie means to you really sinks in; you cant get it out of your heart.

title: Farm Waste and Animal Fats Will Help Power a United Jet
description: Sometime this summer, a United Airlines flight will take off from Los Angeles International Airport bound for San Francisco using fuel generated from farm waste and oils derived from animal fats.

title: Yankees Rallies Hit Snags, Courtesy of Mike Trouts Glove
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  The Yankees most severe problem Monday night was not the way they swung the bat, pitched, fielded or ran the bases. Their 4-1 loss to the Los Angeles Angels could be traced to a single shortcoming: They hit the ball in the vicinity of Mike Trout.

title: 2 Dead After Self-Immolation on Japanese Bullet Train
description: TOKYO  A 71-year-old man burned himself to death aboard a Japanese high-speed train on Tuesday in what appeared to be a deliberate act of self-immolation, the authorities and witnesses said. A second passenger on the train, a woman, also died.

title: Chinese Lawyers Worry New Rules Will Limit Clients Defenses
description: Chinese lawyers fear that proposed changes to laws governing courtroom behavior will restrict their ability to do their jobs. Lawyers in human rights cases, who already face the threat of assault if they challenge the court authorities, say the additional threat of jail will limit their ability to offer robust defenses for their clients.

title: Corrections: June 30, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Making a Confederate Flag Invisible
description: The image was at once mundane and historic. In Alabama last Wednesday, on the order of Gov. Robert Bentley, workers took down the Confederate battle flag on the grounds of the state Capitol and were photographed as they did.

title: Trade and Workers
description: To the Editor:

title: Dont Diminish Hamilton
description: To the Editor:

title: The Next Culture War
description: Christianity is in decline in the United States. The share of Americans who describe themselves as Christians and attend church is dropping. Evangelical voters make up a smaller share of the electorate. Members of the millennial generation are detaching themselves from religious institutions in droves.

title: Under Common Core, a New Emphasis on Nonfiction Texts
description: To the Editor:

title: Lets Fix Our National Parks, Not Add More
description: BOZEMAN, Mont.  IN Yosemite National Park, officials need roughly $19 million to upgrade an aging sewer system to prevent spills like the one that leaked thousands of gallons of raw sewage into the Merced River 15 years ago. In Grand Canyon National Park, more than $100 million is needed to repair the water system and $44 million to fix the trail network for the parks four million visitors a year.

title: The Long Road to Making Marriage Equality a Reality
description: To the Editor:

title: Why Gun Control and Abortion Are Different From Gay Marriage
description: The legalization of same-sex marriage is a potent example of a dominant theme in American history: Over time, civil rights expand, and discrimination ebbs.

title: Euskaltel, Spanish Telecom Firm, Is Valued at $1.3 Billion in I.P.O.
description: LONDON  Euskaltel, the provider of telephone and broadband services in the Basque region of Spain, has said that its initial public offering valued the company at 1.2 billion euros, or about $1.3 billion.

title: Death Toll Rises to 142 After Indonesian Military Plane Crashes Into City
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  A military aircraft carrying 122 people crashed into a neighborhood in the Indonesian city of Medan on Tuesday, killing all those aboard, according to the chief spokesman of the countrys armed forces. At least 20 people on the ground were also killed, and search and rescue efforts were continuing Wednesday.

title: Test Your Vocabulary | Making Art With Lego Bricks
description: Below, several paragraphs from a June 26 article, A Legoland Builder Turns Her Childhood Hobby Into an Adult Art Form.

title: On the Greek Referendum
description: Greeces citizens must decide.

title: With All Eyes on Greece, Markets Hold Steady
description: PARIS  Global stock markets stabilized on Tuesday as hope arose that Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras of Greece might still reach a last-minute deal with his countrys international creditors, but Athens missed a deadline for a critical loan repayment to the International Monetary Fund.

title: Something Must Be Done About Prince Edward County, by Kristen Green
description: On Sept. 10, 1959, black students in Prince Edward County, Va., watched as school buses full of white children rolled through the streets, delivering their charges to the newly opened Prince Edward Academy. To resist court-mandated desegregation, the local school board shuttered the public schools, but not before white volunteers stripped classrooms of desks, books, and supplies for the new academy. Local Jaycees ripped out the high school stadiums goal posts and transplanted them to the white-only academys football field.

title: What Chris Christie Would Need to Do to Win
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey has entered the race for the Republican presidential nomination. Here is a look at what he would need to do if he hopes to win.

title: New Jersey Could Be a Tough State for Chris Christie to Win
description: LIVINGSTON, N.J.  The breakup has been a long time coming. For two years, he has spent more and more time away, openly flirting with others in what looked a lot like a trial separation. At home, he got an increasingly chilly reception.

title: Arianna Huffingtons Improbable, Insatiable Content Machine
description: One morning in March, a dozen Huffington Post staff members gathered around a glass table in Arianna Huffingtons office. They had been summoned to deliver a progress report to Huffington, the sites president, editor in chief and co-founder, on a new initiative, Whats Working. It was created to help the site cover solutions, rather than focusing only on the worlds problems  or as Huffington explained in an internal memo in January, to start a positive contagion by relentlessly telling the stories of people and communities doing amazing things, overcoming great odds and facing real challenges with perseverance, creativity and grace.

title: Chris Christie on the Issues
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey enters the 2016 presidential race on Tuesday. Known for his blunt, blustery demeanor, he has said his ability to win twice in a heavily Democratic state makes him an attractive candidate for the party in the 2016 general election. Here are his stands on a variety of important issues.

title: Things You May Not Know About Chris Christie
description: There is little that New Jerseyans do not know about their governor, thanks to Chris Christies penchant for oversharing. But some of the more infrequently recounted parts of his life story might still come as a surprise to many people in his own state, not to mention voters in the Republican primaries.

title: Chris Christie Announces Run, Pledging Truth About Nations Woes
description: LIVINGSTON, N.J.  Gov. Chris Christie declared an uphill candidacy for president on Tuesday with New Jersey-style swagger, unconcealed disgust for Washington and a high regard for his own candor, vowing that there is one thing you will know for sure: I say what I mean and I mean what I say.

title: Concerns Over Personal Safety Haunt Women on Tennis Tour
description: Jesper Andreassen held up a plate of 10 jalapeos for the camera, then stuffed them into his mouth, one by one, proudly tossing each stem over his shoulder as he finished.

title: U.S. Chamber of Commerce Works Globally to Fight Antismoking Measures
description: KIEV, Ukraine  A parliamentary hearing was convened here in March to consider an odd remnant of Ukraines corrupt, pre-revolutionary government.

title: Willis Group and Towers Watson to Merge
description: LONDON  The insurance broker and risk management advisory firm Willis Group Holdings said on Tuesday that it had agreed to an all-share merger with the professional services firm Towers Watson that would create a company with an $18 billion market value.

title: 6 Qs About the News | A Famous French Ship Rusts on Land
description: Note: Were experimenting with a new format for this feature. Tell us what you think!

title: A Close Encounter With Boko Haram
description: ABUJA, Nigeria  ON my second visit to Chibok, I slept with a machete tucked between the headboard of the bed and the dresser, wondering if the reddish stains on the blade were rust or blood.

title: E.U. to End Cellphone Roaming Charges in 2017
description: LONDON  European officials approved on Tuesday a series of sweeping changes to how mobile and wired Internet service works in the region, pushing through rules that outlaw mobile roaming charges and forbid providers from giving preferences to some types of online traffic.

title: Tuesdays Travel News and Tips
A Rookies Road Trip Through Montana, Wyoming and Idaho
description: If you long to answer the call of the open road but lack experience behind the wheel, look no further than the rental lot at Billings Logan International Airport in Montana.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Wendel Agrees to Acquire AlliedBarton Security for $1.67 Billion
description: LONDON  The French investment firm Wendel said on Tuesday that it had agreed to acquire AlliedBarton Security Services, one of the largest providers of security guards in the United States, from the Blackstone Group for about $1.67 billion, including debt.

title: New York Today: Freedom From Foam
description: Good morning on this muggy Tuesday.

title: Amid Final Talks on Iran Nuclear Deal, Obama Calls Strict Verification Crucial
description: VIENNA  As a high-level team of Iranian officials flew here on Tuesday for what appears to be an intensive final week of negotiations for a comprehensive nuclear accord, President Obama issued a warning that he was prepared to walk away from any agreement with a verification regime that consisted of a few inspectors wandering around every once in a while.

title: Flow Traders I.P.O. Could Value Dutch Firm at Up to $1.9 Billion
description: LONDON  Flow Traders, a Dutch proprietary trading firm, said on Tuesday that its initial public offering could value the company at up to 1.72 billion euros, or about $1.9 billion.

title: Change Comes From the Margins
description: In 1916, Hugo Ball, the German writer who would soon become a founding member of the Dadaist movement, wrote the following account of his first meeting with the men who would be his artistic and philosophical compatriots: An Oriental-looking deputation of four little men arrived, with portfolios and pictures under their arms: repeatedly they bowed politely. They introduced themselves: Marcel Janco the painter, Tristan Tzara, Georges Janco, and a fourth gentleman whose name I did not quite catch.

title: Japan Clears Train After Self-Immolation
description: Emergency crews rescued passengers from a bullet train after a 71-year-old man set himself on fire on Tuesday. He and a female passenger died, and dozens were hurt.

title: Joy of a Black Planet
description: In 2011, Zim Ugochukwu was traveling on the Jagriti Yatra, a 15-day train trip through India for aspiring entrepreneurs. Her time in India wound up sparking an idea for a start-up, though perhaps not in the way the trips organizers intended. Ugochukwu was struck by the fact that, out of a group of about 500, she was one of just three African-Americans. She thought about how mainstream travel publications, even those online, werent speaking to them or their experiences. When I searched black travel on Google, I saw a black suitcase, she said. Thats not what I meant.

title: Americas Postracial Fantasy
description: On Fathers Day, my dad and I had brunch with some close friends of mine. The conversation soon turned to their two sons: their likes, their dislikes, their habit of disrupting classmates during nap time at nursery school. At one point, as I ran my hand through one of the boys silky brown hair, I asked whether they consider their kids biracial. (The father is white; the mother is South Asian.) Before they could respond, the childrens paternal grandmother, in town for a visit, replied as if the answer were the most obvious thing in the world: Theyre white.

title: Why Television Is Still King for Campaign Spending
description: Presidential campaign staffers like to talk about a digital strategy, and with good reason. But television continues to occupy the vast majority of most campaigns budgets.

title: Dale DeGroff on the Origin of Cocktails, Katrina and the Rainbow Room
description: Dale DeGroff is one of the worlds foremost cocktail experts. His book The Craft of the Cocktail, published by Clarkson Potter in 2002, is regarded as an essential bartending guide. He is the founding president of the Museum of the American Cocktail in New Orleans, which reopened earlier this year. Mr. DeGroff is also a consultant working with bars and restaurants through the Beverage Alcohol Resource group, including the new Oleanders in Brooklyn.

title: Today in Politics: Christie Prepares Insurgent White House Bid
description: Good Tuesday morning from Washington, where President Obama is hosting Brazils leader at the White House. Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky heads to Denver to mingle with the marijuana entrepreneurs, and Senator Ted Cruz of Texas is set to release his new book. But the political spotlight will be on New Jersey, where the governor is due to announce his next move.

title: The Importance of Hide-and-Seek
description: Ive found myself wondering lately which of my patients were lucky enough as children to play hide-and-seek with their parents. When its played as its meant to be, its such a delightful game. Kids ask to play it, though, only when theyre confident that theyll be found. In that way, its a bit like psychotherapy: Only when patients feel hopeful that their experiences and feelings will be understood does the work begin in earnest.

title: Morning Agenda: A Hard-Line Stance on Greece
description: A HARD-LINE STANCE ON GREECE | Greece has until 6 p.m. E.D.T. on Tuesday to make a 1.6 billion euro, or $1.8 billion, payment to the International Monetary Fund, but in an interview on state television on Monday night, the Greek prime minister, Alexis Tsipras, strongly suggested that Greece would not make that payment,  Andrew Higgins and Alison Smale write in The New York Times. Late Monday, Jean-Claude Juncker, the head of the European Unions executive branch, offered Mr. Tsipras a last-minute proposal that presented the possibility of a concession on demands for cuts in bonus payments for the poorest pensioners, European officials said. In return, Mr. Tsipras would have to accept all of the other creditors demands, which he had already turned down, and request an emergency meeting of eurozone finance ministers on Tuesday. So far, Mr. Tsipras has not responded publicly.

title: Sean Scully Fills aSpanish Monastery With Bursts of Color
description: MONTSERRAT, Spain  On a hot day in June, the craggy slopes of Montserrat towering above him, the Irish-American painter Sean Scully walked toward the entrance of a small monastery about an hours drive from Barcelona. Inside, 22 of his artworks, including six abstract canvases with his signature bands and blocks of color, energize a space that is more than 1,000 years old.

title: Making Tobaccos Case
description: See the letters the U.S. Chamber of Commerce sent to governments all over the world in an effort to dismantle antismoking laws.

title: Aftermath of Plane Crash in Indonesia
description: Rescue officials combed through the debris after a military aircraft crashed into the city of Medan, on the island of Sumatra, on Tuesday, killing dozens.

title: Do Genre Labels Matter Anymore?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Dana Stevens and Leslie Jamison discuss whether categorical descriptions are as stable or as useful as they used to be.

title: When Spell-Check Cant Help
description: More from the file of sound-alike mix-ups  all of them making repeat appearances:

title: Menil Collection Director Leaving for Kunstmuseum Basel
description: After 12 years as director of the Menil Collection in Houston, Josef Helfenstein will step down at the end of this year to become director of the Kunstmuseum Basel in Switzerland.

title: G.E. Agrees to Sell European Buyout Financing Business to Sumitomo
description: LONDON  General Electric said on Tuesday that it had agreed to sell a division that finances leveraged buyouts in Europe to a unit of the Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation for about $2.2 billion.

title: Weekly News Quiz | June 23-29, 2015
description: A very newsy week inspired the 10 questions below, our last quiz before we take a monthlong summer break.

title: Rand Paul Mixes With the Marijuana Crowd to Raise Funds
description: Rand Paul has been wooing young Republican voters with his clever campaign swag and his vows to make privacy a priority.

title: Language Lessons and Mom
description: Dear Diary:

title: Farm to Fashion, as Youve Never Seen It Before
description: Youve heard of farm to table, the food movement that champions knowing where your food came from  literally, which field  as a way toward sustainable agriculture, health and natural balance? And youve heard of the crazy success of cat videos?

title: Fierce Rivalry Between Chinas Top Two Universities Plays Out Online
description: A war of words has raged on the Chinese Internet this week. It doesnt involve celebrities or politicians. Its a battle between Chinas top two universities, Tsinghua and Peking, over recruiting new undergraduates.

title: ConAgra to Sell Its Private-Label Business
description: Under pressure from a prominent activist shareholder, ConAgra announced plans on Tuesday to shed its private-label brands operation  less than three years after buying the business.

title: Cenovus Energy Agrees to Sell Oil-and-Gas Royalty Business
description: Cenovus Energy, a Canadian oil company, said on Tuesday that it had agreed to sell its oil-and-gas royalty business to the Ontario Teachers Pension Plan for 3.3 billion Canadian dollars, or about $2.7 billion.

title: A Southern Chefs Recipe for Pickled Magnolia Petals
description: In this series, the photographer Rinne Allen documents harvests across the South, exploring the many uses of natures seasonal yield.

title: 1915: Germans Using Wireless Code
description: LONDON  The New York edition of the Herald charges that the Germans are making use of the wireless station at Sayville, Long Island, to inform their submarines off the English coast of the departure of vessels from the American side. The station is under government censorship, and the transmission of military information is forbidden. It said that the messages, although purporting to be ordinary commercial telegrams, conceal a military code. The Washington correspondent of the Herald takes the government to task in connection with Germanys forthcoming answer to the Lusitania Note, which is expected to be favorable.  The New York Herald, European Edition, July 1, 1915

title: New Cases of Ebola Put an End to Liberias Status as Virus-Free
description: MONROVIA, Liberia  More than a month after Liberia was declared free ofEbola,at least two new cases have emerged, the first discovered when the body of a 17-year-old boy tested positive for the virus, officials saidTuesday.

title: Leap Second Will Extend the Day, and Might Roil the Internet
description: To balance out a very gradual slowing of the Earths rotation, scientists are adding an extra second to the day on Tuesday.

title: Pope to Address the Humble and the Powerful Alike in a Three-City U.S. Visit
description: A center for the homeless. A school in East Harlem. A prison.

title: Readers Turn: The Nuisances of a Marriage Name Decision
Daily Report: AOL to Take Over Display Advertising for Microsoft
description: When the deal for Verizon to buy AOL was announced last month, executives from both companies said AOL was an appealing acquisition because of its advertising technology. On Monday, AOL showed some of the value in announcing a deal with Microsoft, Dino Grandoni reports.

title: Supreme Court to Weigh Dispute Over Union Fees
description: The Supreme Court on Tuesday agreed to hear a challenge to the way public-sector unions finance their operations. Union officials said a ruling against them would deal a blow to organized labor.

title: Stephen King Releases Exclusive Audiobook Drunken Fireworks
description: In Stephen Kings memoir, On Writing, he gives aspiring authors this advice: If you want to be a writer, you must do two things above all others: read a lot and write a lot.

title: Argentine City Aims to Stand Out With Rebellious Spirit (and Coke) in a Cup
description: CRDOBA, Argentina  Backstage at a dance hall, a percussionist, Hugo Nez, unzipped his rucksack and pulled out two bottles: one of fernet, a bitter Italian liqueur, the other of Coca-Cola. After mixing them in a plastic pint glass, Mr. Nez sank his lips into the sepia-colored froth and guzzled. That Friday night, the sequence would be repeated by young revelers in bars and dance halls across this city.

title: In Afghanistan, Suicide Blast and Angry Crowd Target American Soldiers
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A convoy of American troops survived a huge suicide bomb attack in Kabul on Tuesday afternoon, only to find themselves struggling against a gathering crowd of Afghans who were trying to tend to civilians wounded in the bombing.

title: Review: Sarah Hepolas Blackout, on the Darkness That Took Over Her Life
description: Addiction memoirs, for the most part, have flat third acts. Their writers get sober. Thats cheerful news for them, but less so for us. They were so interesting to read about when they were knocking over chairs.

title: The Best Free Agents Realistically Available
description: LeBron James is about as much of a free agent as Tim Duncan. Both N.B.A. players have the right to sign with any team that can fit them under its salary cap, but neither is expected to go anywhere.

title: Convict Conducted Dry Run of Breakout the Night Before Escaping
description: One of the two convicted killers who escaped in early June from a maximum-security prison in northern New York, setting off a three-week manhunt, conducted a dry run of the breakout the night before they fled, two officials with knowledge of the matter said.

title: French Prosecutor Seeks Terrorism Charges Against Suspect in Decapitation Attack
description: PARIS  The chief prosecutor here said Tuesday that he had requested that multiple charges of terrorism be brought against Yassine Salhi, who is accused of decapitating his boss and trying to set off a major explosion last week at a branch of an American chemical and gas company.

title: In St. Louis, an Urban Farmer Uses a Rooftop and Food to Spur Renewal
description: ST. LOUIS  A two-story concrete building on the edge of downtown St. Louis is bearing its heaviest load 88 years after construction.

title: Egg-in-a-Hole for Camping or the Comfort of Home
description: I learned to make egg-in-a-hole at my beloved sleep-away camp, which was hardly rustic. (There were showers in all the cabins.)

description: Rosy clothes for men.

title: Lester Holt Draws More Viewers to NBCs Nightly News
description: So far, so good for Lester Holt and NBC.

title: 1965: Pakistan and India Pull Troops
description: NEW DELHI  Pakistan and India today [June 30] began withdrawing troops all along the border on which the two armies have faced each other since the partition of India in 1947. The withdrawal of the 30 divisions was made under an informal gentlemans agreement between the two governments after the formal settlement of their dispute in the Rann of Kutch, the desert wasteland between India and West Pakistan which has been the scene of fighting since January.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, July 1, 1965

title: Gov. Christie Announces Presidential Bid
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey announced on Tuesday at his former high school in Livingston, N.J., that he is seeking the 2016 Republican presidential nomination.

title: Misty Copeland Is Promoted to Principal Dancer at American Ballet Theater
description: Misty Copeland was fast becoming the most famous ballerina in the United States  making the cover of Time magazine, being profiled by 60 Minutes, growing into a social media sensation and dancing ballets biggest roles on some of its grandest stages. But another role eluded her: She was still not a principal dancer.

description: Ashtons Cinderella

title: Hillary Clintons Softer Side Shows Up on Pinterest
description: Cookies have played a part in previous Clinton campaigns: Like the time, in 1992, when Hillary Rodham Clinton faced a criticism when she said, in response to a question about her legal career: I suppose I could have stayed home and baked cookies and had teas.

title: Your Best or Worst Summer Dates in New York City
description: This summer, were exploring love in the hot season, and love often starts with a date. We want to know about yours.

title: Should Greece Abandon the Euro?
Greece, Missing I.M.F. Payment, Is Called Effectively in Default
description: ATHENS  Greece missed a crucial debt payment to the International Monetary Fund, the fund said early Wednesday, deepening a crisis that has haunted world leaders and financial markets over the past week.

description: Tamil Nadus indestructible politician.
