description: The Greek finance minister, Yanis Varoufakis, told reporters on Tuesday that Greece will not pay the International Monetary Fund on time.

title: A Traffic Accident. A Fire. And Then Their Romance Was Really Tested.
description: Blood was spilling from cuts on his back and arms, his Vespa was a twist of metal and plastic, his mind was woozy and emergency personnel were swarming the scene.

title: Dirty Water and Open Defecation Threaten Gains in Child Health
description: Dirty drinking water and open defecation, particularly in rural areas of many developing countries, are threatening to subvert gains in child survival rates and other health measurements, two major United Nations agencies said Tuesday in a joint report on global progress in sanitation.

title: Summer Reading Contest Winner, Week 1 | Gender, Race and Shifting Perceptions of Identity
description: Each Friday through Aug. 14 we are posing a simple question to teenagers: What interested you most in The Times this week?

title: Missing I.M.F. Payment Puts Greece in Uncharted Territory
description: FRANKFURT  Greece on Tuesday added its name to a roster that includes some of the worlds poorest and worst governed nations, including Iraq, Sudan, Somalia and Zimbabwe.

title: The Chat: Chris Christies Announcement Speech, Instantly Analyzed
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey announced his campaign for the 2016 Republican presidential nominationon Tuesday with a speech at his old high school in Livingston, N.J. Over instant messages, two New York Times political correspondents analyzed Mr. Christies remarks in real time, as they did with the campaign announcements ofseveralother2016candidates. Here is an edited version of their chat.

title: Surveillance Court Rules That N.S.A. Can Resume Bulk Data Collection
description: WASHINGTON  The Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court ruled late Monday that the National Security Agency may temporarily resume its once-secret program that systematically collects records of Americans domestic phone calls in bulk.

title: A Chef and Her Bluefish
description: I love fishing, though I have to admit Im not very technical. I pick up tips where I can and somehow still manage to catch fish.

title: Cuba Wins W.H.O. Certification It Ended Mother-to-Child H.I.V. Transmission
description: Cuba became the worlds first country on Tuesday to win World Health Organization certification that it had eliminated mother-to-child transmission of both H.I.V. and syphilis. Despite its poverty, Cuba provides basic health care to all citizens. Since the 1980s it has successfully suppressed its H.I.V. epidemic, initially through forced quarantine and, since 1993, by widespread testing and treatment.

title: Ruling That Apple Led E-Book Pricing Conspiracy IsUpheld
description: SAN FRANCISCO  A federal appeals court on Tuesday upheld a ruling that determined Apple to be the leader of an industrywide conspiracy among book publishers to raise prices of digital books.

title: Chris Christies Town Hall Bluntness to Be Tested
description: In announcing his presidential bid Tuesday, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey laid out the type of campaign that should sound familiar to anyone who has attended of his trademark town halls: blunt, direct and saying exactly whats on his mind, those offended be damned. The question is whether it will prove effective outside of New Jersey.

title: A Death the Supreme Court Should Remember
description: Early on Monday morning in New Orleans, Louisiana, Glenn Ford died of lung cancer. He was 65.

title: Leonard Nimoy Is Remembered at Symphony Space
description: We have been, and always shall be, your friend, the actor Zachary Quinto said on Monday at Symphony Space, during a tribute to Leonard Nimoy.

title: Betting Markets Suggest Greeks Will Reject Government Stance in Referendum
description: Political betting markets suggest that Greece's prime minister, Alexis Tsipras, may have misread the mood of his own electorate in calling for a financial referendum this Sunday.

title: What You Get for  $2,900,000
description: This weeks properties include a clapboard house in Key West, a loft in Dallas and a converted church in South Carolina.

title: Veteran Luke Ridnour Rapidly Adds Four Teams to His Rsum
description: Everything about Luke Ridnours N.B.A. career was fairly nondescript until a week ago. Over 12 seasons, he was gainfully employed by five organizations, averaging 9.3 points and 4.5 assists as he played for the likes of the Milwaukee Bucks and the Minnesota Timberwolves. A steady-handed point guard, he was also capable of shooting well from beyond the 3-point line.

title: Timing of Christies Announcement Has Fund-Raising Advantages
description: In fund-raising, as in politics, timing is everything.

title: Met Extends Show on Chinas Fashion Influence
description: The Metropolitan Museum of Arts China: Through the Looking Glass, an exploration of Chinas influence on Western fashion and the largest show ever organized by the museums Costume Institute, has proven so popular that it will be extended three weeks, through Labor Day, Sept. 7, museum officials said Tuesday.

title: Right Divided, a Disciplined Left Steered the Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON  The stunning series of liberal decisions delivered by the Supreme Court this term was the product of discipline on the left side of the court and disarray on the right.

title: On the Road in Big Sky Country
description: A car-averse traveler finds freedom in the drivers seat, covering 700 miles and three states over three days.

title: Gov. Chris Christies Phony Truth-Telling
description: On his new website, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey portrays himself as a guy who gets attacked for telling it like it is, but thats what his mom told him to do from her deathbed.

title: China Pledges to Halt Growth of Carbon Emissions in Climate Plan
description: HONG KONG  China, the worlds biggest greenhouse gas polluter, pledged on Tuesday to wean its economy away from reliance on fossil fuels as it grows, and to try to bring the rise in its carbon emissions to an earlier end.

title: Two First-Round Upsets Shake Up Womens Draw
description: WIMBLEDON, England  At least this time, Eugenie Bouchard had a reason. After months in an inexplicable downward spiral, Bouchard tumbled out of Wimbledon in the first round Tuesday afternoon with another demoralizing loss.

title: Delaware Art Museum Completes Sale of Artworks to Repay Debt
description: The Delaware Art Museum, which has come under withering criticism for deciding to sell up to four works from its collection to pay down construction debts, announced Monday that it had privately sold one of its most important paintings, Winslow Homers Milking Time, as well as Andrew Wyeths Arthur Cleveland, for amounts that it did not disclose.

title: Willis-Towers Watson Merger to Insure Against Market Turmoil
description: Willis Group Holdings and Towers Watson have taken out some insurance against future troubles in the sectors they serve.

title: Chris Christies Path to Relevance
description: Chris Christie is highly unlikely to win the nomination. The reasons, like his moderate-conservative views and the ethics scandal over bridge traffic in New Jersey, have been summarized elsewhere.But many candidates with little or no chance to win the nomination nonetheless play a big role in presidential primaries, and Mr. Christie could be one of them. He could drain votes from Jeb Bush, widening the opening for Marco Rubio or even improving Scott Walkers odds to win both Iowa and New Hampshire.

title: Witness Describes Attack on NATO Convoy
description: A suicide bomber attacked a convoy of foreign troops serving with NATO in the Afghan capital, Kabul.

title: Zadie Smith to Collaborate on a Screenplay
description: LOS ANGELES  Amid the superheroes, dinosaurs, cyborg assassins and male strippers of the summer movie season comes a drop of sustenance for the cinematic intelligentsia: the French director Claire Denis will make her first English-language film, and she is collaborating on its screenplay with the British novelist Zadie Smith.

title: Global Climate Pact Gains Momentum as China, U.S. and Brazil Detail Plans
description: WASHINGTON  Five months before a United Nations summit meeting aimed at forging a historic global accord to cut climate-warming emissions, significant signs of progress toward an agreement are emerging.

title: Report Shows Widespread Mistreatment by Health Workers During Childbirth
description: They are slapped and pinched during labor, yelled at, denied pain medicine, neglected and forced to share beds with other women who just gave birth. And that is just a partial list of the abuses and humiliations inflicted on women around the world as their babies are born.

title: A Hat Maker Beloved by Madonna, Sia and Gigi Hadid  and Bob Dylan, Too
description: Los Angeles-based Nick Fouquet is in many ways the ultimate California dude  tall and lanky, with a shaggy blond mane that simply begs to have a hat put on it  but dont call him a milliner. His approach to hat making is anything but traditional. Ive always wanted to do my own thing, he says, and its such a niche market and undervalued accessory. To me, hats are the pinnacle of elegance. Im not here to reinvent them  but to do it with my twist; not over-the-top or dramatic, like a milliner might.

title: Historic Football, Florences Brutal Sport
description: Images of calcio storico in Florence, Italy, a centuries-old competition with few rules and the sort of human wreckage generally associated with the gladiators.

title: French Telecom Company Orange in Deal That Lets It Part With Israeli Provider
description: JERUSALEM  The French telecommunications company Orange has reached a deal allowing for a parting of ways with an Israeli mobile service provider, weeks after a squabble over a possible withdrawal of the brand from Israels cellular market caused a diplomatic storm.

title: A Most Dangerous Game
description: FLORENCE, Italy  Last Tuesday, about 24 hours before he jammed his fingers into another mans nose, dropped his elbow across another mans neck and put another mans feet where ones ears are supposed to be, Rodrigue Nana considered, just for a moment, the basic notion of fear.

title: Friends With ISIS: How To Tell One Young Womans Story
description: Like most developing stories, nothing was for certain. Earlier this year I went to rural Washington State to meet a young woman who had befriended Islamic State sympathizers over the Internet.

title: Goldman Sachs to Pay $7 Million Penalty Over Options Glitch
description: For a Wall Street bank that prides itself on not making mistakes, an incident when Goldman Sachs erroneously sent thousands of stock options trades into the market two summers ago was embarrassing and costly.

title: California Mandates Vaccines for Schoolchildren
description: LOS ANGELES  California on Tuesday became the largest state in the country to require schoolchildren to receive vaccinations unless there are medical reasons not to do so, as Gov. Jerry Brown signed legislation that ended exemptions for personal or religious reasons.

title: Candidates Try Hard Sell to Lift Fund-Raising Totals
description: Crowds and polling numbers go up and down in the initial days of presidential campaigns, so when it comes to measuring early enthusiasm for a candidate, fund-raising is often the bottom line.

title: Social Media Reaction to Misty Copelands Historic Promotion
description: On Tuesday, Misty Copeland became the first African-American woman to be promoted to the role of principal dancer at American Ballet Theater. On her Instagram account, Ms. Copeland, who has over 500,000 followers, posted a photo and a short video of the moment she received the news.

title: Supreme Court to Hear Challenge to Union Fees
description: The Supreme Court on Tuesday agreed to decide whether public-sector unions may require workers who are not members to help pay for collective bargaining. A ruling against them could deal a severe blow to organized labor.

title: France Orders 2 Uber Executives to Stand Trial
description: PARIS  The Paris prosecutors office said Tuesday that two senior Uber executives in France had been ordered to stand trial on behalf of the company on charges including deceptive commercial practices and illegally organizing taxi services through its low-cost UberPop ride-hailing option.

title: A Lowcountry Boil
description: A traditional Frogmore feast in South Carolina.

title: Summer Seafood Boils Take On Local Flavor
description: A seafood boil is one of the great communal eating experiences of an American summer.

title: A More Splintered Conservative Wing
description: In the term that ended Monday, the Supreme Courts more right-leaning wing exhibited more fractured voting than it had in recent terms.

title: United Church of Christ Approves Divestment to Aid Palestinians
description: The United Church of Christ, one of the largest Protestant denominations in the United States, overwhelmingly approved a resolution Tuesday calling for divestment from companies that profit from Israels occupation or control of Palestinian territories, and a boycott of products from Israeli settlements.

title: A Crowdfunding Campaign Tries to Save Greece
description: Greece was on the edge of a deadline to pay 1.5 billion euros (about $1.75 billion) back to the International Monetary Fund, and a crowdfunding campaign called Greek Bailout Fund wanted to help.

title: Market Report
description: Pillows so pretty youll want to take them outdoors.

title: Liberia Confirms New Ebola Case
description: Dr. Bernice Dahn, Liberias new minister of health, said on Tuesday that the country had confirmed its first case of Ebola since it was declared free of the virus more than a month ago.

title: Donald Trump: An American Tale
description: I dont have a lot to add to the story of Donald Trump, his slander against Mexican immigrants and the ensuing self-induced immolation of his media empire, except to note that what we have here is a classic American immigrant story.

title: Israeli Man Dies in Attack Near West Bank Settlement
description: JERUSALEM  An Israeli man died Tuesday after being shot in the West Bank the night before. Palestinian gunmen are suspected in the attack on the victim, Malakhi Rosenfeld, 26, a student at the Hebrew University of Jerusalem, and three other Israelis as they rode in a car near an Israeli settlement. Also Tuesday, Israeli security guards shot and wounded a Palestinian man at the Kalandia crossing between Jerusalem and the West Bank city of Ramallah. The Israeli police said the man had run at the guards and ignored warnings to stop. Israels defense minister, Moshe Yaalon, blamed a recent wave of attacks on programs on Palestinian television that he said incited violence.

title: Jake Wobbrock of AnswerDash: Lead With Strengths, and Weaknesses
description: This interview with Jake Wobbrock, founding chief executive and chief scientist of AnswerDash, a provider of automated customer service for websites, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: Court Allows N.Y.U.s Contested Expansion Plan to Go Forward
description: The states highest court on Tuesday upheld a lower court ruling allowing New York University to move forward with its expansion plan, most likely ending a long battle with neighbors, elected officials, preservationists and faculty members.

title: Gunman at Tunisian Beach Hotel Trained With Museum Attackers
description: TUNIS  The gunman who massacred 38 foreign tourists at a beachside hotel on Friday trained with a militant group in Libya this year alongside two Tunisians who later killed 22 people at the national museum, security officials confirmed on Tuesday.

title: President Forced to Watch Marriage-Ruling Celebrations on TV
description: Even President Obama is sometimes forced to watch events around the White House  ones he helped create  only on TV.

title: The Magic of Hobo Packs
description: Boy Scout camp introduced both of us to hobo packs, bundles of cut-up ingredients wrapped in foil packets and cooked in the coals of a campfire. Ours combined ground beef, potatoes, carrots and a ton of ketchup.

title: Chris Squire Made Prog Rock Rock
description: At 14, it was easy to like Led Zeppelin and the Rolling Stones. And I did. These bands were like audio-visual packages tailored explicitly for my hormone and confusion levels, spackle kits for my hole-ridden sense of self. Because straight-up, blues based rock and roll is the prima materia of teen rebellion. So it was then, and so shall it be until the end of Spotify.

title: Sepp Blatter Wont Attend Womens World Cup Final
description: Blatter Will Skip Final

title: Patience Spent, de Blasio Accuses Cuomo of Hurting New York City Out of Revenge
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio, in candid and searing words rarely employed by elected officials of his stature, accused Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo on Tuesday of stymieing New York Citys legislative goals out of personal pettiness, game-playing and a desire for revenge.

title: For Black Principal Dancers, Rarefied Air
description: With her promotion at American Ballet Theater, Misty Copeland joins only a handful of African-Americans at major companies who became principals. Heres a look at a few of them.

title: Obama Downplays Dangers of Greek Crisis
description: President Obama said on Tuesday that Greece defaulting on its debts is concerning, but is primarily a problem for Europe.

title: Disney Names Its First Female Chief Financial Officer
description: LOS ANGELES  Adding another female executive to its predominantly male senior ranks, the Walt Disney Company on Tuesday named Christine M. McCarthy as its next chief financial officer, succeeding James A. Rasulo.

title: In England, Glenn Ligon Brings Together the (American) Works that Have Influenced Him
description: What holds all this work together  I realized every single one of these artists is American, Glenn Ligon reflects. And theyre all loans from the Tates collection. Obamas favorite artist has landed in England with an exhibition hes curated  a personal constellation, really  all culled from British holdings. Its an attempt to show the community around an artist, says the abstract painter, who has more recently branched out as a multihyphenate practitioner. Glenn Ligon: Encounters and Collisions clusters 45 artists whom Ligon explains were very influential in the beginning of my career, as well as now. Traveling from Nottingham Contemporary  which has really built a strong reputation in the last four or five years, explains Thomas Dane, Ligons longtime English gallerist  the intimate retrospective docks in Liverpool today at the Tates waterfront warehouse complex. It goes up alongside Blind Spot, an exhibition of a series of black pourings by Jackson Pollock  the man of the hour, Ligon jokes, moments before his own opening.

title: First Draft Focus: Ready? Say Cheese
Justice Dept. Report Says Police Escalated Tensions in Ferguson
description: WASHINGTON  When heavily armed police officers swarmed the streets of Ferguson, Mo., after the fatal shooting last year of a young, unarmed black man, they only worsened tensions and made it harder to regain public confidence and control, a draft report from the Justice Department has concluded.

title: Knicks Think Big as Free Agency Is Set to Begin
description: Phil Jackson, the president of the Knicks, has been clear about his priorities in free agency: size, size and size.

title: The Supreme Courts Lonely Hearts Club
description: Now all of us single people are pathetic, not just the straight ones. Marriage responds to the universal fear that a lonely person might call out only to find no one there, writes Justice Anthony M. Kennedy in the majority opinion of the Supreme Court in Obergefell v. Hodges. As I read that bit alone in my apartment, I choked on my coffee.

title: A Look at the Snowden Teaser Trailer
description: It has no movie scenes or dialogue, but the trailer for Snowden is aiming to speak volumes.

title: Israels Cartoon Diplomacy Equates Iran and Islamic State
description: Apparently undeterred by the backlash over its last venture into cartoon diplomacy, Israels government released an animated video on Tuesday that equates the threat from Islamic State militants to that of a nuclear-armed Iran.

title: Tourism in Greece Remains Steady During Debt Crisis
description: With Greece reeling over fears of default and the weeklong closure of its major banks and stock market, travelers are likely wondering how these major financial disruptions will affect their ability to use currency throughout the country. While native Greeks are currently limited to daily A.T.M. withdrawals of 60 euros per account, tourists do not face similar restrictions. (However, many A.T.M.s have been running out of money, forcing people to try other machines, which have been plagued by long lines.)

description: The filmmaker behind a controversial documentary about President Obama is producing a documentary about the Clintons and their relationship.

title: MAC Cosmetics to Open Its First Makeup Studio
description: With blow-dry bars studding nearly every neighborhood, never mind the proliferating nails salons, MAC Cosmetics is thinking: Why not makeup?

title: June 30, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Afghanistan, Syria, Indonesia and the United States.

title: Jeb Bushs Wealth Soared When He Left Governors Office, Tax Returns Show
description: After he left office as governor of Florida, Jeb Bushs net worth grew to at least $19 million from $1.3 million, a significant leap in wealth that reflects the power of his connections and the breadth of his entrepreneurial pursuits.

title: Just-for-Summer Perfumes
description: Sometime in late May, around the time I replace boots with sandals in my closet, I put away all of my perfumes with notes of incense and amber, tobacco and musk; in their place appear fragrances with coconut and night-blooming flowers.

title: Verbatim: Jeb Bush on Chelsea Clintons Speaking Fees
description: Jeb Bush, in response to questions about his paid speaking fees, according to Bloomberg Politics

title: Bigger, Cheaper, Faster Data in the Cloud
description: The kind of data science that worked for President Obama is coming to cloud computing, and working at a speed faster than the president ever saw.

title: U.S. Leaves the Markets Out in the Fight Against Carbon Emissions
description: In 1990, by an overwhelming majority, Congress amended the Clean Air Act to establish a market for electric utilities to trade the right to emit sulfur dioxide, one of the main contributors to acid rain.

title: Lufthansa Offers Compensation to Families of Germanwings Crash Victims
description: PARIS  More than three months after a Germanwings airliner crashed into a French mountainside, killing everyone aboard, the airlines parent company, Lufthansa, made its first proposal to pay for emotional damages on Tuesday, offering the German victims families $28,000 each. Lawyers for the relatives immediately dismissed the figure as inadequate.

title: Fire in the Sky
description: What goes on up there?

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Deep Below Croatia Lurks a New Species of Centipede
description: The worlds deepest-dwelling centipede  found as much as 3,600 feet below the surface  is in Croatia, a new study in ZooKeys reports. The centipede was found in three caves in the Velebit mountain range, along the Adriatic Coast. It has powerful jaws with poison glands and long, curved claws that allow it to clutch its prey. And like other cave-dwelling arthropods, it has elongated antennas, trunk segments and leg claws. Researchers named the centipede Geophilus hadesi, after Hades, the Greek god of the underworld.

title: Starry Night
description: Cosmic diamond brooches inspired by the clean lines and optimistic design of Art Deco.

title: Florida State Freshman Quarterback Is Charged With Battery
description: A freshman quarterback at Florida State has been charged with battery after an altercation at a Tallahassee, Fla., bar in which he punched a woman in the face, the police said.

title: Review: In Terminator Genisys, Ageless Cyborgs and a Deathless Franchise
description: In a scene in Terminator Genisys thats on heavy rotation in the movies ads, the old Arnold Schwarzenegger goes up against the new. The older version has the smoothly pampered skin of the best beauty treatments that Hollywood money can buy, with scarcely a visible line etching his sharply angled and ironed facial planes. Now, though, the new movies cyborg has abruptly come deadpan to deadpan with an unlined, recently minted identical twin that, like the original Terminator in 1984, has entered without any clothes. Its strange to see Old and Young Arnold go at it, their refrigerator-size bodies slamming against each other in what plays like an intimate existential clash.

title: Apple Music Makes Debut With D.J. Carrying the Flag
description: Into the unknown we go, the D. J. Zane Lowe said just after noon on Tuesday, as he began his first show on Beats 1, the Internet radio station that is a big feature of Apples new music service.

title: Summer of Science
description: The very efficient hummingbird.

title: U.S. and Cuba Agree to Reopen Embassies, Officials Say
description: WASHINGTON  The United States and Cuba will announce an agreement on Wednesday to reopen embassies in each others capitals, formally restoring diplomatic relations more than a half-century after they were ruptured, according to administration officials.

title: Zuckerberg Takes Questions in Facebook Session Marred by Tech Troubles
description: Mark Zuckerberg may run Facebook, but that does not mean he actually controls the social network.

title: Review: Cinderella Returns to the American Ballet Theater Stable
description: The 20th century saw four choreographic masters of the male-female duet: Fred Astaire, George Balanchine, Frederick Ashton and Merce Cunningham. Ashtons are almost all to do with love of one kind or another. On Monday, as his 1948 treatment of Prokofievs three-act Cinderella returned to American Ballet Theaters repertory, I marveled again at many of its choreographic features but especially at its two pas de deux for the heroine and her Prince. Hee Seo was Cinderella, Cory Stearns her Prince.

title: Seattle Police Investigating 2 Officers Shown in Report
description: The Seattle Police Department said Tuesday that it was investigating two officers featured in a video and an article in The New York Times about the departments efforts to retrain officers to eliminate unnecessary force during confrontations with civilians.

title: Spains New Public Safety Law Has Its Challengers
description: MADRID  Spain has been the epicenter of some of the largest protests in Europe against government austerity cuts, including a youth-led mobilization that called itself the indignants, which took over Madrids main square in May 2011 as a precursor to the Occupy Wall Street movement.

title: Review: Magic Mike XXL, Fleshing Out a Sequel With Heart as Well as Pecs and Abs
description: Alone in his workshop one night, Mike Lane receives a visit from the muse. Though hes still played by Channing Tatum, Mike is no longer the Magic Mike we met in the movie of that name a few years back. Hes an entrepreneur with a fledgling custom-furniture business. The dream that beguiled him in Magic Mike  to quit the stripping game and work with his hands instead of his abs and his glutes  has come true.

title: Donna Karan Steps Down, in Major Shift for Fashion
description: In a major shift for American fashion, Donna Karan, the 66-year-old founder and chief designer of Donna Karan International, a brand that defined the way American working women dressed for decades, announced on Tuesday that she was leaving the helm of the house that bears her name.

title: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres the latest.

title: Review: A Poem Is a Naked Person Is a Jam Session of a Documentary
description: As he appears in A Poem Is a Naked Person  a documentary made in the early 70s and now receiving a belated and welcome United States theatrical release  Leon Russell is an enigma wrapped in a mystery and wearing his signature top hat. With silver hair and an air of sagacity belying his youth at the time (he was born in 1942), Mr. Russell seems to have sprung from the commingled imaginations of J. R. R. Tolkien and Mark Twain. Hes a wizard and a mountebank, an old-timey song-and-dance man dabbling in ancient magic.

title: Review: Mala Mala Shares Experiences of Being Transgender in Puerto Rico
description: Mala Mala, a survey of transgender individuals in Puerto Rico, is nothing if not timely. With Laverne Cox, the Amazon series Transparent and Caitlyn Jenner, the topic of gender identity has gone mainstream.

title: Review: Ekmeles Performs Chamber Works Written for Voices and Brass Instruments
description: In the necrology for the year 1616, the names of Shakespeare and Cervantes stand out. The death of a young German girl that same year might have barely passed notice.

title: The Wedding Is Off: It Shoulda Been You Will Close in August
description: The party is almost over for It Shoulda Been You.

title: A Five-Bedroom Stone House in Southern Umbria
description: The house, near the picturesque town of Todi and with a pool, a vineyard and olive trees, is on the market for $2.83 million.

title: Living In Morningside Heights
description: The neighborhood on Manhattans Upper West Side is dominated by Columbia University and other schools and sandwiched by parks.

title: Bush PAC Said to Use Womens Opinions of Clinton for Potential Lines of Attack
description: The super PAC supporting Jeb Bush presented data culled from womens opinions of Hillary Rodham Clinton to independent groups last week, two people told of the briefing said.

title: Facebook Sweetens Terms for Buyers of Video Ads
description: Facebook is giving advertisers the option to pay for video ads only if users view them for at least 10 seconds, as the social media company faces pressure over how it charges for ads. Facebook on Tuesday began offering the new ad-buying feature to bigger advertisers.

title: Escapees Fraternizing With Prison Workers Doesnt Surprise Experts
description: Shortly after Richard W. Matt and David Sweat were discovered missing from their cells in the honor block of Clinton Correctional Facility in northern New York, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo sought to tamp down any suggestions of complicity by prison staff members.

title: Returning Stars and Stripes to Havana
description: Wayne S. Smith honeymooned in Cuba before taking a post at the United States Embassy in Havana. He is one of the last living American diplomats who witnessed the day the embassy closed in 1961.

title: An Anything-Goes Aesthetic
description: Looks from Givenchy, Berluti, Dior Homme, Herms and more.
